Review_Date: Shabnam D wrote a review Mar 21
Review_Text: The Riad was delightful! A mixture of the old and new. The restaurant was beautiful with preparation to keep us warm during our meals! Food was great! Service and people were amazing. but at 2am someone was knocking on the door continuously. Seems there was no coverage overnight. Also the guests in the room next to us were unwell and coughed all night. Overall the experience was pretty good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Danielle M wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Only had one night here but wish we had more. Check in was relaxing with tea a stunning beautiful Riad … small entrance to the room but very comfortable bed. Breakfast on the terrace was good and the staff were all incredibly helpful and kind. Reception recommend dinner at Le Tanjia in the square and it was absolutely perfect! Great ambiance great food… easy to walk to the main square.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: I love cake wrote a review Mar 10
Review_Title: The best service in such a great setting
Review_Text: We could not review this place any higher!! Fantastic superb!! We have never experienced such a team that are all involved in a common goal of great service throughout from the wonderful breakfast team the Reception Staff and the Cleaning Team.    Massive thank you for making my wife’s 40th birthday so special…    Breakfast was lovely such an array of lovely breads pancakes cakes yoghurt jams omelette fruits and Moroccan beans/veg.    The service of the reception staff was superb booking taxis welcoming sorting champagne for the room and providing the sandwich pack for the journey home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jonathan H wrote a review Mar 7
Review_Text: Amazing Riad with very very very friendly and helpful staff. We needed a Dr on our second day and the staff were able to call one for us who came to the Riad with 45 minutes and prescribed medication. Save the hassle of going to a hospital. Breakfast was lovely every morning fresh food and plenty of it. The Riad is so peaceful after a busy day in the Medina it feels so relaxing just being there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sydney R wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: This Riad is in a perfect location. Just a short walk to the main marketplace area and right next to the street so it’s easy to get taxis if you need to. It’s also very easy to find. The hotel staff was probably the nicest I’ve ever had so incredibly friendly and made sure our stay was perfect. It has a beautiful rooftop area to lounge at and a jacuzzi if you need to cool off. The only negative thing I would say about this Riad is that the food was ok. The appetizers were excellent but the actual meal was just alright. Other than that 10/10!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Emily T wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: This riad was absolutely fantastic! A little oasis right in the middle of the busy/loud streets. From the moment we entered the facility we were treated with kindness and hospitality. The rooms themselves are nice but are not the selling feature of this hotel- it is the staff. They are excellent. Very attentive thoughtful polite and caring. 10/10 would stay here again and would recommend to friends traveling to Marrakech.

Review_Date: claudia h wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Celebrating 70th birthday and 50 years as a couple
Review_Text: The whole "family" of staff could not have been kinder or more helpful and attentive. Wonderful food and a great location. A guided hike around Imlil in the Atlas mountains with a birthday lunch served on a rooftop pudding accompanied by snowfall. The next day skiing at Oukaimeden ascending the slopes at 10000ft+ mounted on Bubble the Mule. Finished the day on quads in the desert.  Thank you for helping to make some wonderful memories for us which will ease us through the coming lambing season and beyond. xx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ashley S wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: What an incredible place! The location is perfect - just outside the gate to the medina so the cars can pull directly up to the front door but 10 minute walk to Jemaa El Fnaa market. I visited in February so it was quite chilly but they kept heaters throughout the riad and I had a space heater (and nightly hot water bottles) for my room. Everyone was kind and helpful - In 30 years of travel I've never experienced such attentive and impeccable service! While I didn't try it out they have a heated pool and outside on the terrace is a hot tub. They are open for dinner and each meal I had was excellent. Breakfast was a variety of breads a type of porridge and your choice of omelet with fresh squeezed orange juice and choice of coffee/tea/mint tea. One thing to keep in mind is the walls are thin so if you have loud guests/young children staying you will be able to hear them. The other guests I encountered were all friendly and respectful. As a solo traveler I felt very safe. Highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Jennifer Q wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: The people who work here are lovely hard working and will assist you in anything you need. They speak many languages. They made all the difference in how much we enjoyed our visit.  The Riad is beautiful with many authentic local touches. The location is ideal for getting easily to many sites. There is a beautiful sitting room with a fireplace where the fire is maintained all day. The roof deck is fun with a view of the entire city.

Review_Date: Hannah K wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Lovely Riad on the outskirts of the medina close to all of the attractions of Marrakesh. The staff were amazingly welcoming friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and the communal areas in the hotel were very nice. Breakfast and dinner were both delicious. Highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stew C wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: From the moment you arrive at the Riad you are made to feel very welcome. The staff are friendly efficient and welcoming.    It is a short distance to all the main attractions with the souks being close by.    The breakfast is delicious and nothing is too much trouble. If they don't do something you would like they will buy it for you to have.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: bettina d wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: My stay at Dar Anika was memorable. The riad is beautiful and located very close to Bahia Palace Jemaa el-Fnaa etc. I booked a suite which was clean and comfortable. They had a rooftop restaurant that served a great breakfast! I suggest spending some time up there to view both the sunrise and sunset!    What made my stay most memorable was the staff. Hind and her team went above and beyond. The welcome guide to what is nearby and the traditional Moroccan mint tea milk and treats really set the tone to my stay. The team really took the time to help me with what I needed - suggestions to where to visit help with transportation etc. Even as I departed I was given fruit and sandwiches!    I would 1000% suggest Dar Anika to any traveler. I can't wait to visit Marrakech once again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Madeline S wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: We had a lovely time and were treated like royalty! Upon arrival we were offered tea and cookies and fruit. Then we were given a tour of the beautiful building. They are so welcoming and helpful! Highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Anne Quin wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Our stay could not be faulted. The riad is beautiful comfortable and welcoming. The staff who speak English are extremely helpful and friendly. Although situated on a busy street it is a haven of peace and tranquility. I would highly recommend it.

Best riad in Marrakech. A great location charming facility and truly extraordinary staff make for a pleasant stay. The employees were exceptionally kind and helpful and went out of their way to assist us in every possible way. The food was good and the staff was very welcoming

Review_Date: Sandee T wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Dar Anika is a beautiful tranquil Riad that we will absolutely come back to. The riad is well appointed and walking distance to most places. The real star of this Riad is the team behind it: Leann the manager; Bader (usually the first person we saw at breakfast) who was always on point professional and warm-he even taught us to make one of the delicious (and healthy!) soups that’s served at breakfast; and last but not least the lovely ladies at the front desk who were so helpful to us and went above and beyond! How many places pack you a lunch to take on your flight?! This is how the Dar Anika crew rolls.    A true diamond in Marrakech.    Shukran Bezzaf Dar Anika!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Magical stay in a vibrant city of Marrakech.
Review_Text: At the Dar Anika we were collected from the airport and dropped at the doorway of our accommodation. With vehicles wizzing around us in Marrakech and the view of a doorway set back from the madness we were eager to get inside . The door opened smiles welcomed us. Through the doorway was an unexpected sanctuary. The staff went up and beyond serving us. They were caring helpful efficient conscientious and just happy to help anyone of us. The rooms were spacious are home from home. Petals on the bed and in the bathroom when we arrived. I’d stay here again definitely.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Excellent spot to stay in the Medina!
Review_Text: We enjoyed our stay here in Marrakech. It is in a great location close to a taxi car stand and the Medina. It is very walkable from here. We loved the tea served at check in and the rooftop restaurant which was great for breakfast and for wine at sunset. Thank you for being excellent hosts!

Review_Date: Simon W wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: An oasis of calm in the centre of vibrant marrakesh
Review_Text: Just a fantastic Riad  great location  wonderful staff who could not do enough for their guests. Excellent breakfast and the sun loungers were an excellent escape from the madness of marrakesh . A quiet oasis yet still close to the mercurial Medina
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Nice escape in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: Truly fantastic! Convenient location great hospitality comfortable room and a charming place Once you learn which direction to walk to the Medina it’s like coming home. They recommend the absolute best dining experience and only steps away. We felt safe at all times and the transportation that they arranged was first class
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Kellie D wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: A fantastic and welcoming riad. The staff were attentive and couldn’t do enough for you.  Room are clean.  I recommend being on the first floor as slightly brighter rooms.  The ground floor has good rooms but are quite dark  The main area is relaxing and cozy.  We had food one the first night which was lovely and they had entertainment.  We relaxed on the roof terrace and the staff were so friendly bringing drinks if we wanted them  I highly recommend staying here for a couple of days.  Location is fab as right at the end of the souks into the main square.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Fantastic location lovely staff and a beautiful facility -- a truly enjoyable place to stay! Exactly what we had envisioned for a riad in Marrakech. The staff went above and beyond; even holding our luggage for a few days while we went on our four-day excursion into the desert. Location was ideal -- close to everything in the medina yet right by a main road that made getting cabs/airport transit easy. Would absolutely stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Catherine D wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Lovely Riad just inside old city walls.  Staff are lovely rooms are excellent and beds very comfy.  We ate dinner once in the Riad and the food was ok but not great - though looking at reviews from others we probably just chose the wrong dishes!  Shower in our room was a bit volatile - hot and cold randomly. Overall we would definitely recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kerry R wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Riad Ksar Anika on a quiet road on the edge of the Medina was a jewel of a place.  We spent 9 days and wish it was more.  Amongst fountains and olive gardens with birds singing around a central pool where a substantial breakfast of fresh local produce is served every morning is an absolute treat.  The en suite room with the most comfortable bed was huge.  We had a couples Hamam and massage which is highly recommended after a day haggling in the medina.  The staff are all lovely and bend over backwards to accommodate your every need.  I can’t wait to return.  Thank you 🙏
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patrick L wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: The hotel is an oasis of beauty comfort and tranquility amidst the chaos of the old town! The hotel staff are very warm and exceedingly helpful. As a change of pace we decided to take a day trip to the Atlas Mountains that we arranged through the hotel. Our driver was very courteous and his SUV was roomy modern and clean. He drove us up into the mountains where we met up with our Berber guide for a hike to the falls and a walk through the village carved from the mountainside culminating in a wonderful traditional Berber lunch. On the way back we drove through the Agafay desert which at one stop offered a view of snow capped mountains to one side a lake in the distance on the other and rock desert formations all around us. The natural beauty of the mountain and desert was a welcome diversion from the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfectly situated, comfortable and tranquil riad with absolutely fantastic staff
Review_Text: The hotel was perfectly situated by the medina. It was a haven away from the hustle and bustle. It was spotlessly clean very comfortable and the staff truly were second to none. They were so kind and nothing was too much trouble. They even gave us a packed lunch to take to the airport without us asking!  Emmen (not sure if spelled correctly) was so kind and helpful.  The staff were able to recommend/arrange bookings at restaurants a tour of the medina and a hammam. The pool inside is very small but beautiful and the roof terrace is a lovely spot to watch the sunset with a drink. Breakfast was delicious simple and fresh. We loved the pancakes; msemen. We would recommend this riad to anyone going to Marrakesh and hope to be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Absolutely charming Riad- the decor, staff and location
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is a totally charming riad. The decor is stunning. The manager (Leanne) is knowledgeable and warm. The staff on reception are absolutely incredible! They helped us out with the little things and can not do enough to assist. Our flight was delayed but they did all they could to ensure we were comfortable at the riad whilst waiting for our flight like sending up freshly squeezed juice and printing our boarding passes last minute. The rooms are ornate and large. Our room had a gorgeous bed and luxurious marble bathroom. They are slightly darker due to barriers blocking insects on windows but very comfy. Breakfast is simple but incredibly well-executed- fresh fruit soup morrocan pancake and bread cakes and the option to have omelette as well. The pool is so beautiful especially at night. It's not the cheapest Riad but the customer service and location is amazing. We didn't use it but there's even a jacuzzi and sunbathing area on the roof. It's a wonderful place to stay and I'm sure will continue to flourish with every new guest that visits.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: jo c wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Lovely staff and welcome in a great location
Review_Text: Great central location. Clean rooms and throughout hotel. The best thing was the friendliness of the staff and the little extras or extra mile they went to ensure our stay was enjoyable and comfortable. Would highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah D wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad with Excellent Customer service
Review_Text: The Riad is beautiful and the customer service is excellent . Soon as we arrived they gave us milk and dates whilst they sorted out the paperwork and passports and then traditional mint tea and biscuits. The next morning Leanne the manager gave us a map of the medina and Marakech and gave us hints and tips which was very useful .  The facilities are great with the dipping pool  and the roof top terrace . Our room was very cosy and the bed very comfy .  We ate in the restaurant one evening and the food was delicious .  Every day after returning from sightseeing they would offer us a cold slush or mint tea. Excellent service and definitely recommend to stay here !  Keep up the good work 😊
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Wedad S wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Fantastic and courtious staff.  Very private and cozy.  Excellent location. Great food and service. Nice rooms  Felt very safe and pampered.  The rooftop evenings were lively and colorful you can see the action below and take memorable pictures.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Colleen W wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: First of all every person on staff at Dar Anika is exceptional. From the front desk to Lyanne the manager. Everyone is genuinely invested in your experience and stay. Not just at Dark Anika but in Marrakech. Each staff person took the time to ensure we had everything needed for a successful vacation/experience.  Yassine in the dining room/lounge along with Saleem and Morad were very attentive. Their customer service is remarkable  The location is great. Extremely close to taxis souks and El Jamma Fnaa. Very easy to walk or grab a taxi!  Would highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Nikki A wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: My mom and I came to explore Marrakech and this was our first Riad experience. It was wonderful! Such a lovely retreat from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. The service is what topped it all though. We stayed in other Riads after Dar Anika and none had the level of warmth and hospitality that we experienced during our first stay. If looking for comfort and and authentic experience in Marrakech this is the place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kevin W wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Beautiful riad in excellent location in Marrakech!
Review_Text: From the minute we arrived we awere greeted by the warmth and hospitality of the staff. The location is ideal on the edge of the old Medina an easy walk in and out of the bustling shops! The rooftop deck was a nice place to relax with a drink and take in the sights and sounds of Marrakech. Would highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Timi S wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Very lovely and open-minded, the most excellent service
Review_Text: So friendly all the staff from the front desk and the manager Leane were so lovely and excellent hosts to my family and my friend. A very accommodating and friendly Riad perfectly placed at the gate to the old town. Always juice and snacks on hand and the most heavenly breakfast. Would recommend the place heartily to anyone think of visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Dar Anika is wonderful, relaxing, recharging
Review_Text: The staff at the Riad couldn’t have been more helpful and welcoming. The manager Leanne was so helpful and gave us advice and recommendations. She made us feel so much at home. The riad was absolutely stunning and felt like an oasis and refuge from the bustling streets. We stayed in a superb ground floor room with bathroom en-suite . Our room was by the pool and we swam every morning. There was also a great chill out area with books where we were served tea and refreshments whenever we needed them. There were also cakes/ sweets available in the afternoon. Alcohol was available.  The breakfast was superb and typically Moroccan - fruit salad with yoghurt omelette. We also had s couple of great meals in the stunning restaurant- cool relaxing and plant filled.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Greta K wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Lovely hotel near the spice market and Bahia Palace
Review_Text: Beautiful guesthouse right on the edge of the medina. They offer a wonderful map (complimentary) of the different areas and souks and will come get you if you get lost. Service was very enthusiastic although somewhat inexperienced; rooms are spacious and comfortable. Order the Chicken Seffa if you eat in!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Incredible staff in the heart of the medinq
Review_Text: We loved our time at this property. It is a beautiful riad in the heart of the Medina. The staff warmly greeted us upon arrival and took care of our every need throughout our stay. The daily breakfast was delicious especially the freshly made bread and coffee. We adored the rooftop where we could see across the city and enjoy mint tea and cookies. Because it is a small riad we got to know the staff who were absolutely lovely. They sent us to our next destination with snacks. No detail was overlooked!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Donna K wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Enjoyed every minute of our stay and sad to leave.
Review_Text: First time in Marrakech and had no idea what to expect. This small hotel/Riad is an absolute gem. The staff and the service they provide are exceptional at all levels. The hotel is charming and comfortable and perfectly located for accessing the souks within the Medina and transportation if you want to go elsewhere however there is plenty to see and do within walking distance. The hotel manager greeted us personally on our arrival and checked in on us regularly offering us invaluable guidancein navigating Marrakech. The service at this Riad really sets it apart even compared to larger more modern hotels.  You will feel like family here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: sharon f wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Intimate, Boutique Riad In the Heart of the Historic Medina
Review_Text: This very special Riad was our last stay in Morocco and it did not disappoint!  Yousef and his small staff took excellent care of everything. The Riad has 5 rooms and 3 have a small balcony overlooking the lovely open air courtyard. The rooms are immaculate and well appointed with a fireplace and bathrooms with a tub and heated floors. Dinner was extremely intimate in a lovely setting and breakfasts were delicious both of our mornings.  Definitely a must for your visit to Essaouira for ocean views and a great location.

Review_Date: David M wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We have had the most amazing time at Dar Anika hosted by the wonderful Leanne and her staff who guided us through with great recommendations and tips on how to navigate Marrakesh in all its wonder. The Riad has it all from rose petals and our daily swims in the pool. A special thank you as well to our main man Yassine who was a delightful host in the restaurant and to the rest of the staff who attended to our every need with a smile. Without doubt one of the best trips of our lives x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Exceptional service and stay, fantastic location
Review_Text: We had a fantastic stay at this beautiful riad. The location is fantastic just a short walk to many major sites close to parking if you have a car and easy access to taxis if needed right in the nearby square. The riad itself was so quiet and peaceful inside and beautifully decorated. Our room was very spacious beautiful clean and quiet- and we enjoyed a greater sense of privacy here than in some other riads we stayed in during our trip to Morocco. We loved the rose petals at check-in. There is a lovely shaded rooftop terrace where we enjoyed a delicious breakfast.    The best part of our stay however was the exceptional service. The manager and all of the staff were so fantastic going above and beyond to make sure we had a great stay. We had a evening flight on the day we checked out but there was no problem safely storing our luggage and when we returned from a little site seeing out in the Medina we were invited to relax in the comfortable room off the lobby and were even served tea and cakes while we waited. They even packed up some fruit and sandwiches for us to bring with us for our journey!    We highly recommend this riad and would absolutely stay here again if we have the pleasure of returning to Marrakech in the future!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a great place to stay. Location is only 5-10min stroll to the main Jemaa el-Fna square via one straight thoroughfare lined with all sorts of goodies. Bahia Palace is two minutes away.  On your arrival you will be greeted with traditional milk dates biscuits and the famous mint tea and encouraged to relax in the gorgeously decorated surroundings and calm peaceful setting. The staff here are very friendly indeed and will tend enthusiastically to your every need.  There are two or three little terraces on the roof  perfect for enjoying a cold Casablanca beer after a day of souk shopping. The breakfasts are great and there is no set time to have it by.  The manager Leanne is wonderfully friendly. She will give you local tips and tell you hilarious stories if given the chance. She also personally escorted us to the nearby taxi spot on departure. Do take the time to take her aside for a chat if she doesn’t beat you to it.  Cannot rate dar Anika highly enough. It’s an oasis of calmness and tranquility the moment you step off the bustling streets outside  F & D (UK and Mauritius)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bob L wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Start with a great location right on the edge of the Medina. Then add a luxurious Riad right at that spot. Then top if off with a staff that worked as if we were the only guests there. (We're sure every quest felt the same way). The result of this was a truly great and authentic stay in Marrakesh! We had such a wonderful time immersing ourselves into both the old and new that Marrakesh has to offer. The house manager greeted us personally upon arrival and gave us many great tips to maximize our enjoyment during our stay. The staff was friendly and eager to help at every turn. The hotel lived up to the pictures that you see here and our room was very comfortable and clean. The food was very good and the atmosphere in the balcony dining area allowed the sounds and atmosphere of the city to surround you.    We are so grateful to the house manager as she truly has a sense of client service that flows down to all members of the staff. We confidently ventured further afield from the Riad using their external services and they were all top rate.    We highly recommend Riad dar Anika for a truly authentic Moroccan experince.

Review_Date: Nizam Patel wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We stayed at this Riad for nine nights and found the service of ALL staff to be absolutely amazing. They made us feel at home and the atmosphere was one of love and friendship. It was the managers approach towards her staff and guests which made all the difference. Like a mother to all! We decided to tip the cleaners on our last day only to find out that the tips were not kept by them personally but were forwarded onto the manager who makes sure all tips given to individuals were equally distributed amongst all the working staff on a weekly basis. This shows the level of integrity and honesty amongst all the staff at this riad! From the kitchen staff to the front desk. I would stay at this riad again and would certainly recommend them to friends and family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter B wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: High standards in traditional style Dar Hotel
Review_Text: Dar Anika is a great hotel for visiting Marrakesh. Its location just a short walk down a friendly traditional shop lined street from the main square is perfect. Managed by an international manager means standards match expectations. Very friendly and we really did feel at home and able to use the common facilities just as our home. Not the cheapest place to stay but you get what you pay for and Dar Anika gives you an authentic experience with the quality you expect. We loved this hotel and our stay in Marrakesh was so much the better because of the personalised one to one recommendations of places to eat and visit from Liane the manager.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Fantastic Riad run by a delightful team - we loved it!!
Review_Text: From our arrival at the airport where we were greeted by the hotel's driver through five nights accomodation to the time we left armed with a gift of lovely toiletries and a picnic for the plane we couldn't have asked for a more perfect stay! The team at this hotel are genuinely lovely! Nothing was too much trouble and everyone was friendly and helpful. The restaurant is really nice the ambience superb location perfect cleanliness first class - it really was a wonderful holiday! The ladies in the hotel's hammam are lovely too! With many thanks to Lyanne and her team for their warm welcome and caring attitude throughout our stay - I can't recommend this Riad highly enough!!

Perfect !! Everything the best ! !!!!!!! Foood the service the people the host the cleaning the beauty of the place was perfect ! We will come back there I challahhh ! Also the location is perfect near the mellah and old medina
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika for 4 nights at the end of August. From the moment we arrived we couldn’t have asked for a better service/experience. We were given drinks and biscuits on arrival whilst our luggage was taken care of and then met by the managerLyanne. She greeted us so warmly as well as taking us through the local map giving us tips and recommendations of things to do and attractions to visit. Our whole experience at the Riad was superb. The staff couldn’t have been more polite and helpful  going above and beyond at every opportunity - from serving us drinks to organising excursions; from changing money for us to being at our beck and call when needed. We had a truly wonderful time here and would like to extend our thanks to everyone working here Lyanne and her team were truly amazing and we wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this Riad to anyone wanted an A* traditional Moroccan experience! We thank you again and hope to see you in the future :) xx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard W wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: Fantastic stay at the Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: Would highly recommend Riad Dar Anika. Friendly and very accommodating staff. All the activities arranged for us by the staff were excellent. The Riad itself is beautiful and an oasis of calm from the bustling streets of Marrakech. Enjoy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent very kind staff and well placed (right next to the souk and about 5-10min by feet to place jamaa el fna.  We spent three very peacefull days here. There si Aldo a jacuzzi on the roof and a calm and refreshing pool on ground zéro.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad was the most beautiful accommodation that we ever spend a nice time every thing was excellent. The service was great very nice swimming pool breakfast was delicious very friendly and helpful staff members rooms are very spacious and clean. I highly recommend this Riad
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Aman G wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Lovely place to stay the service is amazing. Very bespoke. Location is very central so you can walk to the main square and see all the main sights around there. The staff from the manager reception and waiters are all more than happy to talk and help with anything you need.  The breakfast is vast and freshly prepared daily authentic Moroccan style so if your keen on coco pops - wrong place. My kids would have struggled here but I think for adults keen on learning and experiencing the culture it was a great choice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great hotel just outside the medina
Review_Text: Excellent hotel. The location is great it’s literally 30 feet from the entrance to the Medina so you can easily walk through the market or access all the restaurants while still having some peace and quiet when at the hotel. Review_Date: Dr. Barry Travels wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: We were a group of 18 traveling to Marrakech for the first time. From the time we entered the Riad until the time we left we were treated as royalty. We occupied 9 of the 12 rooms and all of us had a memorable experience. The riad itself is beautiful. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else. The manager Leanne was so nice and we were served food and mint tea upon our arrival. She explained some of the local customs to make us feel more comfortable on our first visit here. Tea and snacks were provided each afternoon as well as fresh milk and dates to our rooms. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The showers were a bit tricky as they went from freezing to burning hot so just be aware or that. Breakfast is included but give yourself plenty of time to eat as it is served in courses. The first day we were there we were expecting a buffet that we could eat in 15 minutes. Don’t expect that. It is unconventional for us to have soup as one of the foods for breakfast but there is also some fruit bread and crepe-like dishes. It is a full-breakfast but not a European one we had expected. The roof hang-out is relaxing. Each afternoon they serve non-alcoholic slushies which were so refreshing in the Moroccan sun. There is a small pool there as well as in the lobby. The lobby pool is chilly so go for the rooftop water. They do have a bar on the third floor (where breakfast is served) the wine is complementary but other drinks are not free. We really enjoyed sitting and drinking tea or coffee on the ground floor (the lobby and first floor rooms). It is a cozy quiet space away from the noise outside the door. The location is perfect a quick 10 minute walk to the main square and just meters away from restaurants. We had happy hour at the Cozy (not far from the riad) and sat at the rooftop bar for great views of Marrakech while sipping great beer and drinks.

Review_Date: Michael P wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: If you’re looking for a beautiful refuge where you will be taken care of by the friendliest people you’ve ever meet look no further! I was greeted by a friendly staff who helped me with my bags sat me down in a beautiful air-conditioned room fed me dates mint tea and milk and cookies. Best check-in process ever! The manager came out to greet me and show me Marrakech’s attractions on a map. She taught me how to bargain where to walk and how to stay safe. These warm gestures and the magnitude of service did not relent over my stay.    This place is as beautiful as the pictures. It was a quiet refuge from the intense chaos you can find in the old Medina. And I found that coal dipping pool essential in the Moroccan heat.    Throughout my stay service was timely friendly and very detail-oriented. The breakfast was simple and tasty. In the few days I stayed here I began to experience this place and the staff as home. They were never far away and could answer all of my questions. They never stopped smiling or caring which was what I needed after traveling alone for a week.    When I left in an anxious hurry to not miss my flight the manager even walked me out to a cab negotiated price for me and she sent me off with a homemade sandwich and hug. These are the kind of people I want to come visit again.    Thank you so much Riad Dar Anika    A solo traveler

Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika in 2nd week in June 2022    We had a brilliant time staying here right from the outset. As usual when travelling to a country for the first time you are always a bit apprehensive. We found the Dar Anika on Trip Advisor and read the reviews and decided to stay here and we weren’t disappointed. Everything from the email communications around the flexibility around the bookings to answering queries via the phone prior to arrival was excellent. We booked a private transfer from the airport to the hotel which was managed without any problems and we are so glad we did. Our flight was 3 hours late but the hotel managed this on their end and we were collected from the airport by a professional chauffeur which is absolutely worth it.    Throughout the 7 night stay the service from ALL the staff was impeccable and they definitely go above and beyond and made our stay super comfortable. On the first morning we were met by Leanne who is the manageress of the hotel who took time to sit down with us and explain the basics of local culture souks taxi’s places to go and potentially to avoid. This was very personalised and helped us as first time visitors.    The super helpful staff in reception always greet you with a smile and went out of their way to help with any queries and will help book any half day/full day excursions hammams or even the professional tour guide. We booked our camel ride professional guide and hammam session through the hotel and everything went very smoothly. Your prices are communicated to you clearly and there is no confusion. The room we stayed in was very comfortable and spacious but we paid extra for a more spacious room and we recommend you check this with the hotel.    We would recommend the tour guide for everyone who is new to the city as it will at minimal give you an idea of where to go etc. Following the guidance provided we went on our ways finding our way around the old city and it was brilliant. Do go and explore for yourselves allow yourself to get lost around the souks as you will very quickly find your way around again. The evenings were absolutely buzzing in Jemaa el-Fnaa Square so do go and experience that also.    On our last day when we checked we was offered the option to go and put our feet-up and relax before our flight in the evening at their partner Riad hotel which is a 5 minute walk from Dar Anika as a complimentary gesture. Once again an amazing level of service and something we didn’t expect but were grateful for as it allowed us to relax and freshen up for our flight later that evening. We finally walked back to Dar Anika for our evening private transfer which was on-time and as professional as what we had become accustomed to.    If you are thinking of staying somewhere in Marrakech Morocco I would recommend you stay at Riad Dar Anika Marrakech. Its location is great easy access to local shops cafes restaurants and other amenities and all their staff are simply amazing.    I think the level of service and wonderful experience we received here will be very difficult to be matched elsewhere now 😊.    To the staff at this hotel you made our stay wonderful comfortable and one to remember. We can’t wait to visit again.    Thank you for everything.      Regards    Room Number 1 (Jun 10 - Jun 17)

Review_Title: Highly recommended for 1st time visitors to Marrakech.
Review_Text: If you’re like us wanting to experience Marrakech for the very first time the choice & locations can be some what overwhelming. Let me make things super easy… the Riad Dar Anika is a wonderful option for 1st time visitors.    Stepping foot into the Riad you’ll be immediately whisked away from the nearby hustle & bustle of the local square into an incredible air of peace & tranquility. The welcome is particularly nice allowing you to rest your feet with the aromas of a mint tea before they highlight surrounding local things worth visiting.    Speaking of location you’re no more than 10 minutes walk to nearly all of the key attractions including the Souks. The small lane from the Riad to Souks is full of adventure & mystery although be mindful that motorbikes go anywhere in Marrakech so best to stay to one side at all times.    The Riad has a small swimming pool downstairs to cool off along with a roof terrace that includes a jacuzzi & sunbeds if you want to rest up. Breakfast mint tea & cake is all included best enjoyed on the terrace. The mountains provide a lovely backdrop of the nesting Storks if you’re lucky enough.    Couple of other notes.  - We paid 200 DHR for a taxi to Riad. With a bit more bartering I think you can get a fair bit cheaper. About 20 minute ride.    - Water & fruit are provided in the room.    - Walking around Marrakech is a rewarding experience so pack good shoes.    - Riad Monceau was a particularly fun dinner stop while you enjoy a bit of local jazz.    - The shop keepers & market traders are super friendly. Of course they encourage browsing their products but they are respectful if you’re not interested.    - The market square can be a little intense & busy so just be mindful of younger peeps & belongings. But it’s a great place to soak in local culture whilst grabbing a tea or coffee.    - 3-4 days is definitely about right to enjoy Marrakech at a steady pace.    Happy travelling and enjoy the delightful sights sounds & flavours of Marrakech.  recommended for 1st time visitors to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Affordable luxury. Quiet, refined, charming, service.
Review_Text: Dar Anika is a haven adjacent to the Marrakesh Medina markets and the old Jewish Quarter/Mellah.  It is a boutique premium but affordable Riad with pool bar restaurant and spa pool. The ambiance is relaxing and the staff are caring and attentive providing excellent service lead by expat manager Lyanne who was so welcoming and charming. We extended our stay from 2 to 5 nights and had a wonderful relaxing stay before braving the souks and the frenetic energy in the medina market alleyways and huge famous Jamaa El Fna Square with snake charmers spice merchants and hundreds of sellers offering everything and anything. Thoroughly recommended if you visit Marrakesh.

Review_Text: I just love this place it’s like you have been transferred into a different era in a Time Machine. The food is Devine they treat you like your the queen of the Medina.perfect location the cleanliness is unreal.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Superb riad. Well located on the edge of the souk and close to the more interesting markets and palace. Lovely tranquil ambience with dark woods quality period furnishings and carpeting natural lighting and luxurious fittings. Peaceful roof terrace with thatched dining area and another open with sunbeds and views across the rooftops to the snowy Atlas mountains. We were so impressed with the welcome which included a well-informed briefing on local attractions and eating-places. Staff diligent friendly and helpful with fluent English. Definitely would return.

Review_Date: omar a wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: Location- extremely convenient  Cleanliness- exceptional  Food- delicious  Hospitality- we were constantly looked after in a warm and friendly manner  Can’t wait to be back with our friends at Dar Anika  Thank you
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Laurie B wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: I never write reviews her or elsewhere but this experience we had at Riad Dar Anika was the most outstanding experience we have ever had from our world travels that I wanted to let them know. From the minute we arrived we felt like royalty. A special thanks and praise to the manager Lyanne who was so helpful from the minute we arrived till we left. Her hospitality was incredible. When I informed Lyanne that I needed an extra suitcase and few extra trinkets to bring home she right away took me on a shopping adventure that only a local would know how to do. She bargained with the shopkeepers as they knew who she was and truly saved the day. She and her staff went above and beyond the call of duty. They were so attentive to our every needs. Always with a smile and graciousness that is how they treat everyone who comes to the Riad. Our family is looking forward to a return trip to Morocco and of course to Riad Dar Anika!

Dar Anika was amazing. Lovely personal touches. Leanne the manager was so helpful with wonderful tips about the city. Breakfast was special every morning. Staff so friendly. Highly recommended. Definitely will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: · Omg..I’ve just returned from a 5 night stay at dar Anika and if I could give it a million out of 10 I would. Not only was the riad itself spectacularstunningly authentic clean and luxurious but what made our experience remarkably memorable was the superb staff. From the second we arrived at the riad we felt like we were meeting our best friends..the welcome we received from Leeann the manager was magnificent..mint tea..fruit cakesetc…not just that but she spent an hour with us giving us tips on how best to experience Marrakesh and surrounding areas. Priceless as it actually made our trip so much better than we ever imagined. Thank you Leeann. We will be back for sure. We took trips which the riad kindly arranged to the Atlas Mountains..where we met the amazing guide..Hussein..this was the most definitely the highlight of our holiday. We hiked through the mountains with his gentlemanly help and brought us to his own home for what was the most magnificent meal I have ever had. His very kind wife cooked authentically Moroccan food and omg…wow!!! Don’t miss this experience. Dar Anika is certainly the most magnificent place in Marrakesh to stay!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sophia B wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: The raid was so spectacular.  What made my experience was the wonderful people and staff that worked there. They went above and beyond to make my experience as enjoyable and accommodating as possible.  They gave recommendations for their favorite spots in Morroco and we exchanged stories about our backgrounds.  The location was also very perfect in the center of the market place and square you can quickly go to abs from locations. When you walked into the road there was a sense of calm and peacefulness.  I would highly recommend visiting this riad to not just enjoy the beautiful accommodations but to experience the kindness and generousity of the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Camila He. wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: Dar Anika's team makes the difference! We stayed at the Riad for 2 nights and the experience was great. Comfortable room service more than special. Location is good both for those exploring the Medina and for those exploring the new city. Breakfast was very good and delicious. Drink lots of mint tea and orange juice!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: saad k wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Title: THE BEST SERVICE I HAVE HAD EVER!
Review_Text: We couldn't have written this review soon enough currently on the plane going home  missing our room at the riad dar anika. Outstanding service  room was so authentic and the staff are so attentive that we felt like royalty. They went beyond anything I have ever experienced. Definitely recommend. Location is perfect. No need to bring a hairdryer as they have salon professional ones in the rooms.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Again at Riad Dar Anika, our home in Marrakech
Review_Text: We recently spent a week at the Dar Anika after a ten day tour of Morocco and before moving on to Tunisia. Dar Anika has superb rooms and common areas and the manager Lyanne was especially helpful....from providing hand-cream when I needed it to directing us to nearby pharmacies and special restaurants to getting our laundry done in record time. Luanne's staff is super competent and helpful. This was our home-away-from-home. We will always stay here when in Marrakech.

This place is a true gem. I will definitely come back. From the decor cleanliness to the hospitality I don’t know where to begin. Lyanne has taken care of me like family nurtured me had me served cared for and then some. If you want quality beauty and home do not look any further. I would not stay anywhere else
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stephenie L wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: When it comes to service what separates great from good is the attention to details. What Riad Dar Anika delivered was not just great—it was exceptional. From the decor to the food to the people zero complaints. But what really set them apart was the people. From the beginning when Leanne (I hope I’m spelling her name correctly) sat us down during check-in to go through the entire neighborhood recommending things to do and places to go to telling us anecdotes of her own experiences I immediately felt so welcomed that I already knew I was going to miss this place (and the people) when I check out. And her staff? Truly one of the best I’ve encountered in the service industry; courteous and professional yet also genuine and approachable. Additionally they remained communicative (basically around the clock) and were readily available for questions and recommendations reservations and last minute accommodations. They weren’t just willing to go the extra mile they went far and beyond.    In summary:    Location? ✅ Cleanliness? ✅ Comfort? ✅ Hospitality? ✅ Value? ✅    I would readily stay at Riad Dar Anika again if I return to Marrakech on a future visit and would not hesitate to recommend this establishment to anyone looking for a 5-star experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Dar Anika for our 3 day visit to Marrakech and it surpassed our expectations. They are immediately so welcoming and accommodating. Leanne (the owner) is very personable professional and made sure we had an amazing trip. Her staff is also incredible and provided the best service for travelers. For example the receptionist would make dinner reservations and daily activities for us on last minute notice and arrange car rides. We looked forward to breakfast here every morning so definitely stay for that. The location is very close to restaurants and the markets. The rooms are very clean and spacious. I highly recommend everyone staying here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Rachel B wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: Our experience at both Riad Dar Anika and Riad Kaiss was amazing! I can’t recommend highly enough! When my family and I return to Morroco we will definitely stay there. The staff and especially the hotel manager Leann were so accommodating to our every need and very friendly. The Riad was so charming unique very clean and in an amazing location. We felt right at home. Honestly probably the best hotels I’ve ever been to (definitely beats La Mammounia in Marrakech)!

We arrived a day late due to some drama at the airport and ended up only getting to spend one night. Right when we arrived LeAnn took us to the sitting area started a fire and served us tea and cookies as she gave us her welcome which included a detailed overview of where we were what to see what activities were there and how to best going about having the best time ever. She answered all of our questions helped us find dinner recommended a route for our one afternoon to see the most we could. She was incredibly honest and warm and her concern for our welfare was authentic. The rest of the staff were so friendly and helpful. The location the breakfast the rooms and everything were so perfect. We had the best sleep in our beautiful room and took so many pretty pictures on the property and roof deck. It was such a great first place to stay on our two week trip to Morocco. It was so nice to have such a positive experience after having trouble at the airport. I would love to come back and stay longer next time. Thanks so much LeAnn (and Fadou and others!).

We arranged to be picked from the airport by the Dar Anika taxi who was waiting at arrivals for us. We arrived at Dar Anika showed to our fabulous room with rose petals on the bed . The staff were wonderful arranged a gorgeous birthday cake for my husband and I as we were celebrating our birthdays. The Riad was in a perfect location a shop right outside the door in an alley that brought you straight in to the Medina. We really enjoyed the market although be careful at night guys going around with a snake and a monkey in a nappy if u take a photo they will demand money from you can be a bit overwhelming at first when they are all rushing to you to buy something you get use to it. I really enjoyed the souks and the Jewish quarter. We done two day trips an early start on one morning for sunrise in a hot air balloon the high light of my trip truly amazing they organised breakfast when we got down in a tent well worth the 6.30 start. We got a guide on second day Abdul from Marrakech Outdoors a family run business he spoke great English €120 for full day 10 to 7 in eve went to Atlas mountains and waterfall he organised a guide walker to bring us up the mountain (wear comfy runners a tough enough hike but we'll worth it) Abdul organised for us to dine up in mountain with a local family who welcomed us in to their home gave us a tour and cooked the most fabulous meal Marrakech style you really get a true feel for how simple they live on so little makes you appreciate what we have in life. If you are thinking of booking Marrakech go right ahead you will really enjoy the expierence well worth the trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Niall H wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Title: Exceptional location great facilities and very professional management team and staff.
Review_Text: We stayed last weekend for four days and were so happy we picked this Riad. Everything from booking the room to organizing our airport pick up through to having a meal ready for us when we arrived late was just perfect and completely hassle free. The Riad along with others in the group is managed by Lyanne who clearly understands the correct concept of customer satisfaction as she organised everything for us and guided us really well in terms of what to see and where to eat. All her recommendations were spot on and her team were able to organise the guides and drivers for all our trips. They also made sure that we got very good value for money and this in itself was a great bonus for first time travelers to Marrakesh. We stayed in room number 2 which was a great size very comfortable really clean and fresh. We had a look whilst walking by at some of the other rooms which are similar in size and design so you wont be disappointed with any of them. We found all members of the team to be extremely helpful very warm and welcoming which added to the experience. If you want to see Marrakesh and immerse yourself to understand the culture pick this Riad as it was a truly wonderful experience and a great credit to Lyanne and her team. The location is one of the best within walking distance of everything so it makes things very easy to see. We will most certainly return.

Unlike some of the other riads where I stayed you can see this one from where the cab drops you! But it’s not just the location that I loved about this place. They were so organized helping me get trips and excursions planned. I also used their hammam and massage services ( WOW! Such a great experience) They were also always ready with a cup of tea or fresh squeezed pomegranate juice!  This riad will definitely be a place where I will return.

Review_Title: Good location and good staff at this well run riad
Review_Text: Dar Anika has an excellent location just at the edge of the Medina. The manager an ex-pat from New Zealand is very friendly and helpful. There is a nice deck to relax in the sun in the afternoon. The front desk staff was very efficient.The breakfast was good. The dinner was average at best and the food was not properly heated throughout. Perhaps because we were a bit spoiled by our Riad stay in Fes the rooms in Dar Anika seemed a bit small a bit dark and over priced. Nonetheless you could not go wrong staying here as the good far outweighs the minor negatives.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: From the moment we arrived to the moment we departed the staff at the Riad dar Anika was incredible! Extremely helpful and attentive without being invasive. The property is absolutely stunning and the location is perfect! It is located just beside one of the gates to the old city which makes it easy to get transport to/from the airport/train station and means you aren't lugging your luggage through crowded cobble stone streets for long.    The food was superb and the view from the roof top terraces was beautiful and quite romantic. We also appreciated the quiet areas like the library and the lobby for relaxing reading and discussing our excursions of the day.    I can't say enough positive things about the riad and the staff! Stay here! You won't regret it!

Review_Title: Excellent quiet small hotel in the old town.
Review_Text: I was in the hotel with my daughter for 4 days  The hotel is a beautiful hotel really peaceful and calming. The staff are amazing really care about your stay They are very helpful in recommending restaurants and things to do I was very pleased with their services.    The hotel is small the rooms are nice and clean. All staff are friendly and helpful. They pay maximum attention to each guest.  The location is great all the interesting things are close by and you can see them on foot. I recommend a hammam with a very good product and a massage in the hotel ..

Feel pampered from the minute you arrive. From the tasty welcome to the comfortable room to the upstairs outdoor sitting area and most important the warm and friendly staff who work to ensure your stay is perfect

Review_Title: I was spoiled to bits and I loved it!
Review_Text: I can’t put in words the level of TLC I was given. From the very grand welcome to the final hug before taxi took me to the airport. Lyanne and her staff went beyond and above to make my stay a very memorable one.

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad with pool, rooftop terrace and cool tub
Review_Text: What a stunning Riad. We went for a swim in the pool and roof top terrace.    They went above and beyond for our honeymoon with rose petals everywhere!    Everyone was so welcoming and hospitable.    It’s a peaceful hidden gem in Marrakech. We learned so much from chatting with the manager and other employees.    Couldn’t recommend this Riad enough! Can’t wait to come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff make this delightful small Dar.  It has a beautiful lounge with swimming pool and rooftop terrace where we laid out by the cool tub. Staff couldnt do enough and were great- booking dining tables going out to get additional supplies and even haggling with taxi drivers for us!

Review_Date: Shazia M wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: Dar Anika was phenomenal! It wasn’t just a place to stay it was an experience. Everyone there was so sweet and caring. They took such great care of us. My daughter and I decided to go to Morocco this past September for my birthday. After doing a lot of research we came upon Dar Anika. LyAnne and Hind were very helpful and accommodating. This was our first trip to Morocco and we didn’t what to expect. As soon as we arrived we knew we were safe and in good hands. The Riad is GORGEOUS! Very clean and well maintained. LyAnne and her staff are extremely friendly and treated us like family. We were taken to the lounge area and they washed our hands with rose water and a warm towel. Served us Moroccan mint tea cookies dates and milk. Took us upstairs to our room. The room was very clean and beautiful. Remember to take the drain plug out in the shower (lesson learned lol). We were served a delicious Moroccan breakfast every morning. Rasheed put together a beautiful spread. They also offer many different tours and spa services. The Hamman was such an amazing experience very relaxing. The Souks (my favorite part of the trip) were just around the corner. The Riad was close to EVERYTHING. Great restaurants shops banks you name it.    I can’t put into words the great experience we had in Marrakech. Ms. LyAnne was like a mother to us. I still remember how she watched us drive off every time we left the Riad. She truly cares. I definitely recommend staying here.    Thank you Ms. LyAnne! I love you and hope to see you again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Highly recommend this beautiful hotel amidst a bustling part of the Médina and city. We were warmly welcomed by the lovely hosts Lyanne and Hind who were extremely helpful and available at all times.  Gorgeous pool and bedroom were the perfect places to cool down from the heat.  I would strongly recommend a hamman and massage in the hotel which were expertly done with care and attention and made me feel utterly cleansed and relaxed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Barney O wrote a review Sep 2021
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad in Medina - such wonderful hospitality
Review_Text: Short 4 night break to Marrakesh. Such an enjoyable stay. Riad beautiful very comfortable excellent location and nothing a trouble to the staff who worked tirelessly to make a perfect stay. Lyanne set up a motorbike tour for me through Ourika and Valleys - a really enjoyable day out. On return to the Riad - so perfectly relaxing - an Oasis in the Medina away from the bustle. Excellent restaurant suggestions given. Very impressed and most appreciate all the kindness and hospitality! Look forward to returning in the future
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: comfort luxury and friendly staff all combine to make your marrakech stay unforgettable. breakfast was a homemade wonderful affair and the riad is authentic and close to the market  the decor is amazing

Review_Date: Amy T wrote a review Aug 2021
Review_Text: I recently returned from a fabulous stay at Riad dar Anika. Lyanne Kerr and her excellent staff could not have been more accommodating and helpful. Whether it was providing a refreshing drink scheduling excursions or selecting the best restaurants; these folks are spot on. The Riad itself enjoys a great location as taxi's are able to drop you at the door since it's just outside { 50 feet } the medina gate. Stay here and experience all the comforts you desire while enjoying the magic of Marrakech.

Review_Date: Zuleyka M wrote a review Aug 2021
Review_Title: Look no further, this is your riad.
Review_Text: This place is phenomenal. Service is spectacular. Leann the manager made sure to make our momcation/ girls trip an unforgettable one. The riad is super clean. They set up covid testing right at the hotel.  The daily FREE breakfast was delicious such a spread. We enjoyed it.  Location location location. Riad is walking distance to the medina restaurants shops and ATM. Its extremely safe.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Shirley M wrote a review Jul 2021
Review_Text: Traveling to Morocco was a true awesome experience but staying here in Marrakech was even more than I could of asked for. It really made this mom-vacation trip even more relaxing. I felt so safe and comfortable here. The Riad Dar Anika is definitely the place to stay if you are visiting you will not regret it 🥰

A beautiful Riad nestled in the heart of Marrakech.  The attention to detail was impressive -From the cleanliness of my room to the food served at meal times I was blown away with the whole experience at Riad Dar Anika.    Lyanne and the staff there went out of their way to ensure my trip was memorable -By organising exclusions to local landmarks to serving the most authentic delicious Moroccan dishes to name a few of the things the team were able to assist me with-Usually at the drop of a hat!    Highly recommend Dar Anika and will return on my next visit to Africa’s breathtaking north!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: A dream weekend we were upgraded to a beautiful suite on arrival the staff were lovely the restaurant was excellent. Was faultless despite the economic situation with health standads taking precedent. This Riad well be our destination whenever we visit Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Zina D wrote a review Jun 2021
Review_Text: This is not the first time i come and always give a positive note to Riad Dar Anika. For the welcome availability and kindness of the staff they helped us with anything and anytime. Our room was a large room the bed was decorated with roses and it smelled great very meticulouslt cleaned and everything in place.  Lyanne is very helpful person she helped us organize our stay and discover new places and find restaurants we ara very grateful to her.  The breakfast on the rooftop is so wonderful and delicious. We missed everything.    We will be back soon....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: An initial post COVID trip to Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika the last weekend in May. The Riad is beautiful and each room shows attention to the details that travelers need to make their stay gracious. The staff was caring and attentive. The food breakfasts and dinners  was excellent. this was our second stay at Dar Anika and surely will not be our last.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tasnim B wrote a review Jun 2021
Review_Text: Like many people i spent a lot of time trying to choose a Riad the choice becomes impressive. Finally i booked at Riad Dar Anika but I did not regret my choice    This Riad is in a good location right next to the Bahia and Badi palaces and very close to the main square Jamàa El Fna.    Lyanne and her staff are lovely and always available to give advice on places to see and restaurants to choose from.    Our room on the top great bathroom extraordinary bedding air conditioning fresh fruits moroccan pastries dattes milk and water..    The breakfast is delicious moroccan pencakes with fresh orange juice fruit salad honey butter orange and strawberry jam the best coffee and the green mint tea cake watermelon and melon....... It was served on the terrace.    We really liked Marrakech we felt safe at all times. Highly recommend this fabulous Riad. Thank you for all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ahmed B wrote a review Jun 2021
Review_Title: A Gem in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: Highly recommend this beautiful gem of a family-run hotel. So clean owner so helpful and friendly and the location could not be any better!  Breakfast was excellent with high quality food and coffee. Kind and professional service. Hope to come back very soon to Dar Anika! Thank you for everything!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Marouane L wrote a review Jun 2021
Review_Text: We stayed for 2 nights at the Dar Anika and it was perfect. The room is clean beautiful and comfortable. The breakfast is delicious. The jacuzzi is amazing with the best view on theroof. The service was superb. Definitely will be back! Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: David J wrote a review Jun 2021
Review_Text: The Riad is beautiful. Great to relax there and an easy 05-10 minute walk to the main square markets and other sites seeing. The staff was great and provided fine breakfasts - a good way to start of the day. Lyanne our host was outstanding very friendly helpful and knowledgeable. A true find and we'd certainly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Once Again, Dar Anika Was Marvelous
Review_Text: We just enjoyed 3 nights at the Dar Anika and it was again delightful. Everything was functioning well and beautifully kept up despite Covid. I used the pool off the interior garden space and found it totally refreshing. Drinks and breakfasts in the roof top dining area gave us a splendid view of the skyline. Our room was truly special a delightful cocoon amidst the city's noises even featuring a dome of soft glowing stars in the ceiling. The staff was super helpful. A bit of paradise in these times.

Review_Date: Fadoua A wrote a review May 2021
Review_Text: We spent a few days at Riad Dar Anika this place is unbelievable. Lyanne was amazing she organized many things for us including SPA 🥰.....    The riad is really one of the most beautiful Riads. I ever seen in Marrakech we were very happy among a cheerful staff.    I would like to thank them for the exceptional service and the wonderful hospitality. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mehran B wrote a review Apr 2021
Review_Text: This Riad is located right at the edge of the Medina which makes it easy to get in the Medina the square and the new city. The rooms are generous in size and the Riad is extremely charming. The fresh flowers placed in the room and rose peddles on the bed and bathroom are extra touches that made a big difference. The private hammam in the Riad is perfectly suited for couples who want to wind down and relax.    The best part of our experience was the hospitality we received from everyone including the Riad manager. Her charming personality and hospitality made our trip unforgettable. She helped us getting around and gave us wise advice where to shop once we told her what we were interested in.    We can't say enough about our wonderful experience and would not hesitate to go back. We highly recommend the Riad to anyone thinking about spending time in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Alexandra D wrote a review Mar 2021
Review_Title: A fabulous 40th at Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: My husband and I decided to spend a long weekend at Riad Dar Anika for my 40th birthday and it certainly did not disappoint. The room was beautiful the food magnificent and the people just delightful. I would highly recommend anybody looking for a relaxing but interesting break in Morocco to consider this hotel. We visited their sister hotel for lunch too which was equally as good such fine attention to detail.

Review_Date: Salma Ty wrote a review Mar 2021
Review_Title: Unforgettable and joyful breakwe had ever
Review_Text: My friend and I had an incredible stay at this Riad we were amazed by the beauty of the place the kindness of the staff the welcome that gives you a glimpse of the Moroccan traditions.    The room was lovely and comfortable. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace made in front of us fresh and delicious another terrace with a jacuzzi and lounges beds heaven of peace quiet and relaxation.    We really enjoyed our stay at Dar Anika. A special thank you to Lyanne the manager she provided us with a smartphone phone with internet to use Google map or to contact them in case we lost our way. She gave us a lot of useful informations advices and places/restaurants recommendations.    We will recommend this wonderful Riad to our family and friends.

This Riad has a great location it is accessible by cars. Beautiful Morocco traditional decoration the room is large and very comfortable with good amenities safe minibar water fruits and cookies. The breakfast is delicious and it's serverd on the roof. The staff is friendly and very helpful answered our questions and book taxis excursions... Anything we needed. After we came back from outside they served us an afternoon tea with a homemade cake what a treat! It was a great experience and we will be back for sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tangata haere wrote a review Mar 2021
Review_Text: During covid lockdowns with no overseas travel possible we were reminiscing about our holiday in Marrakech. Our stay at Dar Anika was great. We wish the wonderful Lyanne and her team safe times and have our fingers are crossed for better days ahead.

We were reluctant to visit Marrakesh during COVID but really needed a break and knew we would be guaranteed blue skies! From the moment we made the booking through Lyann nothing was too much trouble she was so friendly and answered all our questions ahead of our trip. When we arrived we were welcomed by such lovely staff and a delicious tagine (the best I’ve tasted) even though there is a curfew in place the hotel staff always made sure we had eaten. The hotel wasn’t at full capacity which was even better as it meant more space for us. The hotel furniture / rooms were kitted out to a v high standard. We didn’t want to leave. I don’t usually write trip advisor reviews but want people to know about this little gem.. we cannot wait to return. Thank you Lyann & staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was my first trip to Morocco and Marrakech was high on my list of city destinations. The middle of a pandemic was an interesting time to visit and I probably saw the city at its quietest but it meant that I had the beautiful boutique Dar Anika hotel pretty much to myself.    The hotel is perfectly situated right at the entrance to the Medina and an inauspicious entrance makes way to a hidden gem of a palace inside complete with heated pool atrium with plants galore and all the traditional furniture to give it an authentic feel. The hotel has been managed by the very friendly and capable Lyanne from New Zealand supported by a marvellous team of dedicated and responsive local staff who couldn't have been nicer. Nothing was too much trouble and from the perfectly made coffees from Hassan over breakfast on the sun terrace through to the hammam scrub at night the service was really first class.    For anyone looking for a city getaway I couldn't recommend Dar Anika more highly. It's your own little luxurious sanctuary tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the souks. Not to be missed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Tim Kerr wrote a review Apr 2020
Review_Text: Raid dar Anika was even more magical the second time.    I returned to Marrakech recently and stayed again at the  Enchanting Riad “Dar Anika”.  the staff where superb in assisting me with any  requests that I raised from organising transport to showing me the best cafes around the area for tagines coffee and  anything in between .The manager Lyanne (a fellow kiwi) mesmerised me with her local knowledge warm friendly demeanour and the  ability to source the purest argon oil in all of Marrakech .  The riad was spotless and clean and a pleasure to relax and recharge  after a exciting day spent in the city.    Highly recommend staying here

Absolutely the best in esthetics service sincerity and assistance for traveler. I recommend this jewel of a place for anyone who appreciates an intimate riad with 5-star amenities. The food was delicious the staff was excellent and Lyanne the manager was warm welcoming and extremely helpful. This is a place for friends hanging out couples seeking the romantic getaway or a solo traveller at the end of a tour or seeing the sights of Marrakech. It is extremely comfortable for all travellers. The beauty of Riad Dar Anika is located within walking distance to so many of the "must-see" sights in Marrakech.

Beautiful staying in particular staff has been super kind with us.  I Wish to come back in Marrakech soon and I’d love to stay here again.  I suggest to chose this riad for a couple trip or for a family one all your request will be accomplished.

We had a wonderful time during our second visit. This time we brought some friends too and standards of care cleanliness etc were all great. Hopefully we will be back in the next 12 months. Love to all the staff especially Lyanne in the mean time. Stay safe.

Book a 6 hour tuk tuk if you have any walking problems to see the souk as it makes it easier to get around. The hotel arranged one for us with a very knowledgeable driver.  Go to the Berber Touareg museum. A world class collection

Review_Date: Tangata haere wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: I stayed at Riad Dar Anika last year and in light of the world wide pandemic I was remembering my time there very fondly. They were a great bunch of people and I hope they are not suffering too much. Lyanne was a great woman – kind caring funny and worldwise. All the staff were thoughtful and helpful. There are possibly more beautiful riads but I doubt you could get more personal attention and good all round friendly advice and interesting conversation. When all this lockdown and health issues are over it will be good to visit again.

Review_Date: susan j wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Stay at Riad Dar Anika while visiting Marrakech. It is the perfect place close to attractions beautiful traditional decor and comfortable rooms. My stay was full of great experiences one was the hammam bath. Drinks and dinner on the roof top was a perfect way to end the day after sightseeing. Morning's started well with a great breakfast and coffee. The staff are all so attentive and helpful. A car and driver was organised for me where out of the city I was able to visit a traditional rug maker. The service at this hotel is exceptional and I had an amazing time visiting Marrakech.

Review_Title: A delightful oasis in the Marrakech Medina
Review_Text: This beautiful hotel is situated on the door step of Marrakech's main tourist attractions. The Jama El f'na market is 700 metre's away whilst the El Badii Palace with its roosting storks is a mere 300 metres.    Inside is a sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the local street traders as you walk through the door you're hit with the sweet perfume that instantly tells you you're in the heart of Morocco.    As you pass reception the beauty of the hotel is revealed a bright atrium with a small pool on the ground floor the light reflects from the pool. you can take moroccan tea by the poolside or in the sitting room with its large sofa's.
