The rooms are generous and the bed was very comfortable! The rooms have all the amenities required safe hairdryer and toiletries. The vanilla shampoo is a delight.    On the top floor is the restaurant and a sun deck. The food was delicious the menu is not extensive but is more than sufficient for a weeks stay. You must try the moroccan wine the ones I tried were delightful.    The best assets of the hotel are the staff it was the most excellent welcome and we were treated with the highest regard during our stay. We we there when the borders were closed and the expectation of having to stay in Morocco became very real. The staff gave us every assistance and advice we had our flight cancelled the day before we were due to fly and were assisted in rearranging transfers to the airport and printing new boarding cards.    As soon as we are able to travel we will be heading back to Marrakech and Dar Anika will be our chosen destination we made some fantastic friends the moroccan people stole our hearts.

This hotel is just about perfect. The service is exceptional from the time you enter until you leave any request is promptly attended to. The restaurant and roof terrace provide a welcome respite from the lively street life just out the door. The riad is beautiful and comfortable. When needing cash for small purchases and tips the office staff was able to change larger bills. We took advantage of the hamman for a relaxing hour after a day of site seeing. I will most certainly be back the next time I am in Marrakech.

An amazing place to stay where our expectations were regularly exceeded. For example we were given a mobile phone to keep for the duration of our stay meaning that at no cost to us we always had access to maps Google and the ability to call local numbers (such as the Dar Anika reception or taxis).    The staff were very happy to recommend whatever we required whether it was restaurant ideas or routes for walking or which tourist sites we the most important to visit. They happily made bookings for restaurants and taxis on our behalf.    The staff knew that we had a 3hr drive to Agadir when we left so they gave us a satchel with some sandwiches and fruit in it to keep us going - such a lovely gesture :)    A faultless stay in a beautiful Riad - I can't imagine there are any other hotels that could do better.

Review_Date: Robert B wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: We were at the Dar Anika when we got word that Moracco was closing it's borders. The staff went out of it's way to assist us in getting a flight back to the U.S.  If not for the extra help they gave us in getting home. I am not sure we would have got home. We were on the last flight out of Casablanca.    We have traveled the world and have stayed in many hotels. I would rate this hotel as one of best if not the best in caring for guests.    Well done!

In my opinion there is nothing that you need to pay attention .Food and drink were especially very good and the quality of the furnishing and decor first class.Our visit was well timed as it was not too hot and we had warm sunny days

Review_Date: Aman Virdi wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Dar Anika is a beautifully well maintained Riad centrally located in the old town & in walking distance to lots of tourist hotspots. Having never visited before a welcome briefing from Leanne the manager was extremely useful & set us up with a plan of good restaurants & places to visit.    The breakfast was hearty with fruit pancakes and the most delicious soup (yes soup for breakfast). They also made me gluten free bread which I really appreciated. There is an afternoon tea available each day which was a nice touch.    We had a full body massage at the Riad during our stay which we both enjoyed. We didn’t really use the pool but made use of the sun terrace to relax and enjoy the hot afternoon sun.    All the staff were great & were always happy to answer questions or organise things for us. We were even given gifts on our departure as well as some snacks for our journey home. All in all a fabulous stay and I would definitely recommend to anyone travelling to Marrakesh.

Riad Dar Anika is one of the most beautiful places I’ve stayed at around the world. But it’s not the beautiful decor that makes it one of the best though you will be thrilled with all the intricate details you will find at this Riad. The best part about Dar Anika is the service. It’s truly 100 percent amazing. They care so much about their guests and go above and beyond to make your stay smooth and delicious and peaceful and amazing. They think of and take care of every detail. Do not hesitate to stay here if you get a chance. You will love it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: S D wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Beautiful place beautiful room. The breakfasts were delicious. The rooftop is beautiful and has a full bar! Great location near the Medina but still peaceful. We had the third bed made up for our 18 year old son which he said was comfortable but definitely too small for a 6'1" person.

Review_Title: Dar Anika is THE riad to stay in!
Review_Text: Dar Anika was amazing! The owner - LeAnn - is so kind. She helped my friend and I book 2 different half day tours (souk tour and city tour) that were both wonderful. She also gave a such a warm welcome and great explanation of Marrakesh when we arrived. Every single member of the staff was so kind and so welcoming and accommodating. Breakfast was delicious and having drinks on the rooftop was great. The room was insanely clean - as with the entire riad - and was very aesthetically pleasing. Finally the location was great - easy to find when leaving the souks/Janaa el-Fna square and easy to access the new city/Gueliz/Hivernage. I absolutely recommend this riad. The

Review_Date: Benjamin G wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Such a great time at Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: We have spent a long week-end at Riad Dar Anika and it has been such a great time. The manager & staff are so welcoming and they will do everything they can to make you feel special. All you need for a nice vacation time.

Our stay pleasant and worry free. Beautiful Riad with top notch service with attention to details. Leanne the property manager was present at our arrival to personally greet us and was also there to see us off four days later. She and her staff helped plan out daily trips to destinations nearby without pressure rush or need for advance deposit. Riad is located at southern end of Medina so it was peaceful at night yet short easy walk to the souks and the square. Daily breakfast in the terrace was very enjoyable. The best dinner we had in Marrakesh during our 4 day stay was at this Riad. We will be going back to Riad Anika in the future.

We spent 2 nights here and hotel was absolutely amazing place to satay. The staff was unbelievably helpful and tended to our every need. The rooms were so clean that you could see yourself in the tile! We will highly recommend this Riad Dar Anika

Review_Date: jane felding wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Very very nice riad. The house the rooms and the roof top teresse are very nice. The staff are friendly and serviceminded. Specially the manager (Lyanne) makes this place worth comming to. We will highly recomend it.

Review_Date: Queenie C wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: The staff were welcoming and attentive to our needs. We felt part of the Riad family during our short stay there. The food and wine is fantastic at the restaurant and we spent a lovely lazy afternoon on the terrace.

Like I already said it was a very nice experience!with very good service good restaurantexcellent hammam! The manager was a very nice person! Told us a lot and advice us for the best things to see I the city!

Lovely stay Lyanne and all staff very helpful. Dining was great and riad was a very relaxed environment but very well located to the Medina. A nice touch with some gifts at the end of the stay! Would recommend.

An oasis of calm and luxury this is a wonderful place to feel well taken care of when kicking back to relax. It is in the middle of the old town so most things one might want to do are within walking distance.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jason K wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Fantastic stay in the Dar Anika
Review_Text: As so many others have noted the Dar Anika is a really magnificent riad. The staff goes far out of their way to ensure that your stay runs smoothly. The entire hotel is spectacular and the attention to detail again testament to the dedicated staff is just spectacular. Their hospitality and their dedication to making sure that your stay (including various efforts to tailor your trip ... like setting up tours dinners and other arrangements) is clearly what makes the Dar Anika special. Likewise the location can not be beat. You will not be disappointed. Can't wait to return someday!

From start to finish the stay of our family at Dar Anika was amazing. Lyanne welcomed us impeccably on our arrival and went the extra mile for whatever request we had. Her team was absolutely fantastic and we were really incredibly well taken care of. We felt so confortable I can’t find the words. If I ever come back to Marrakech as the song goes there is no place I would rather be. I would recommend this place unconditionally.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Philip A wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Great Dar, ebjoyed the inner pool
Review_Text: We stumbled across the website for Dar Anika whilst looking for a riad in which to stay and were drawn by the peace and quiet that this riad promised. We were slightly reticent about booking as the property was new and had no online reviews although it is obviously being marketed as an upmarket riad as it appears on several other websites. The British ownership however put our minds at ease.    It is situated in a prime position close to several attractions (including the open top Marrakech Tour bus stop – although this is an eyesore not an attraction!) and is accessible by road. It is also at the start (or end) of a busy footpath that takes you straight to the Jemma El Fna (approx 10 minutes); mind the mopeds! In contrast to the noise and commotion in the street it is a place of peace and calm once you step through the heavy front door.    The service is impeccable with discreet and attentive service. This is a result I’m sure of the high levels of professionalism with which the British manager runs the place.    The room price included a healthy breakfast of fruit yoghurt and a variety of local breads. We also opted for the evening meal which to my mind included some of the best Moroccan food I have ever tasted! I particularly liked the beef tajine with almonds and prunes (had it twice). This British run riad prides itself on meals that are prepared hygienically and to very high standards.    As is the nature of riads the bedrooms are quite dark and even with all the lights on we found it a struggle to read. We did have a small patio area however that was outside (not suitable to sun bathe due to high walls) and pleasant to sit in.    A note of caution. For most North Europeans July and August is far too hot. For several days during our stay the temperature was in the low to mid forties with occasional sand-filled thunderstorms (see picture - this is desert country). If you have been to Marrakech before and just want to relax by the pool it is fine but if it is your first time temperatures like this sap your energy and make casual sightseeing very uncomfortable

Review_Date: Brian M wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: A relaxing refuge in the chaos
Review_Text: The orientation on the first morning really helped us to get the best from our visit. Throughout our time there the staff could have been more helpful. The Riad was spotless and had all the amenities you could want. I would not consider anywhere else if I return.

We researched and researched where to stay at in Marrakech. Finally after reading reviews we decided to give Dar Anika a try. Wow. Wow. Wow. We were right. There aren’t enough words to use to express just how much we loved our stay at Dar Anika. If you are like me and can’t decide trust me book today. I can go on and on about all the amazing things we experienced but if I did then you won’t have any surprises and experience what we experienced. So... Stop looking and make that reservation!

We had the most wonderful stay here the staff went above and beyond and couldn’t have done more to help us and make us feel welcome. I can’t praise the staff and manager enough! The restaurant upstairs is lovely as is the breakfast which was included. The rooms are comfortable and clean and the riad itself is beautiful. The staff booked our excursions for us and gave us tips on the local area. I would highly recommend and would love to visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jacqui K wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: After staying at La Mamounia for a couple of nights (a very expensive bubble within Marrakech) we moved to Riad Dar Anika and what a welcome reprieve! We received a warm welcome from Leanne who in ten minutes gave us more helpful information about navigating Marrakech and the Medina than we had received in the prior two days. The location is perfect - easily accessible by car but in the Medina. The rooms are immaculate and the service staff is friendly polite and efficient. The real highlight is the rooftop restaurant/bar where you feel instantly transported within (but above!) the fray of the Medina. Breakfasts at the rooftop restaurant were excellent with a wide range of choices. Riad Dar Anika along with our two nights in the desert were the highlights of our trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Thomas H wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: We have not written many reviews here or elsewhere but our stay at Riad Dar Anika was so enjoyable we wanted to let them know. The staff and manager were so responsive! They helped us make a few plans before we arrived and they checked in with us every day to see what we needed. The location was ideal. Just outside the Medina it is both steps away from taxis and just a short straight walk to the main square inside the Medina. We enjoyed a nice dinner at the Riad the night we arrived hammam and massage the next day and they arranged a trip to the Atlas Mountains for us as well. That was another wonderful day as we were met by Hassan a guide they often use who led us on a leisurely and enjoyable 2 hour walk around the valley. He will adjust the level of challenge to meet your needs. All that and it's a great value as well!

Review_Title: A Pleasant stay at Riad Dar Anika (It was actually March of 2018, but the dates are restricted)
Review_Text: We arrived from Madrid at about midnight and after a brief search through the Medina of Marrakesh were greeted even at that hour very courteously and without delay were escorted to our room for a much needed rest. It was our first taste of Morocco and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The rood top terrace was very pleasant. The view of Marrakesh from there was picturesque.

Review_Date: Jenni H wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: We had the most amazing time at Riad Dar Anika and couldn't have asked for a better place to stay whilst in Marrakech. The hotel is so beautiful and Lyanne and her team are so friendly and accommodating! From helping us arrange transfers to giving local advice and taking a general interest in our day everyone who we encountered made us feel welcome and that nothing was too much. The location is perfect and we enjoyed every moment of our stay here. Highly recommended!

Review_Date: Samantha W wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: Wonderful, comfortable, cozy, and excellent service!
Review_Text: The service was phenomenal! The Riad was beautiful warm clean and cozy with a salon with a fireplace and many nooks to sit with a cup of tea. Had a wonderful massage. When we left we were presented with gifts and lunch for our plane trip. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family
Reviewer_Location: Rancho Santa Fe, California, United States

Review_Date: Thomas D wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: We couldnt have asked for a nicer place to stay on our first trip to Marrakech. The service was fantastic from all the staff and we were given great help and advice throughout. The hotel itself is beautiful and the food in the restaurant was great. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I really don’t think we could’ve stayed at a better Riad. Everyone was so attentive to every detail and went out of their way to ensure we had an amazing time in Marrakech. The location was right next to the Souks so we could walk out and start our day. Lyanne sat us down shortly after arriving and gave us a map that mapped out everything we needed to see and tips and tricks to getting there AND gave us a phone to make sure we wouldn’t get lost. I’m still dreaming of this place and my boyfriend and I did not want to leave. I would recommend this Riad to anyone interested in staying in Morocco!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My girlfriend and I spent our vacation in Marrakech at the Dar Anika and we could not be happier. From the moment we left the US to the moment we returned the Dar Anika was in constant contact with us to ensure the quality of our trip. The Riad is located in the old city right outside of the entrance to the markets. Market shopping and street food as well as beauty stores and upscale restraints were just minutes away by foot. Taxi’s are plentiful which kept them reasonably priced.    By far the best part of our stay was the staff & service. Breakfast and room service never disappointed. The front desk made reservations at restaurants (useful if you don’t speak French/Arabic). The cleaning staff tidied our room & bathroom 3 times a day. Finally the manager Lyanne gave invaluable advice & service. When I needed something from the store Lyanne walked me from the Riad all the way to the area of the store where my item was. That’s just the quality of service she offered.    The Riad Dar Anika is a world class establishment with unbeatable service. If you want an authentic location in a beautiful city this Riad is for you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ron T wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Everything from the location to the facility to the service at this Riad/hotel is top notch. Riad Dar Anika gives you the traditional experience without sacrificing on creature comforts. It is on the outskirts of the medina labyrinth which makes it easy to get a taxi to other parts of the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Rebecca Ahlrot wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at Dar Anika! Lyanne and her staff at the Hotel was marvelous and went way beyond our expectations! We highly recommend a stay at this beautiful Riad. The location as well as the interor design made it easy for us to want to come back! Rebecca & Jerker
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jerker Ahlrot wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Spent 5 days in Marrakesh and stayed at lovely Riad Dar Anika. This little boutique hotel is a mix of luxury and family feeling.  The manager Lyanne and her staff did everything and more to make us feel at home.  The location is perfect with everything you want to see within reach.  Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I was lucky to stay at Dar Anika. Their warm hospitality and help are really thankful even before my departure to Marrakech. Their hospitality and amazing interior design and furniture could make me feel as if I was a noble person. I really love all staff of Dar Anika and would like to come back again to meet them!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Very nice hotel in walking distance to the Souks
Review_Text: The staff was very friendly and the rooms were very clean. We enjoyed our stay. The restaurant was also very nice. Not only was the food delicious the service was also excellent. The hotel was located in a very central area so that we could walk to the famous Souks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A beautiful property with superb staff focused on the best customer service
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika Dec 28-Jan 1 one of the busiest times of the year for the property. The entire team went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. It has a very convenient location in the Medina yet offers the needed quiet at night Lyanne is one of the most welcoming hosts we have had in a hotel. She coordinated drop off and pick up for us on New Years Eve with such ease that it made it very convenient for us a family of 7. Her knowledge of the medina and the local culture was a great guide for us to map out our 4 days in the beautiful city. Kudos to the entire team it was an excellent stay one we will cherish as a highlight of our trip to Morocco.

Review_Title: A bit of home in the middle of town
Review_Text: What a find! Dar Anika was absolutely wonderful. Lyanne and her team were extremely accommodating warm and charming. The room was comfortable and cozy with plenty of treats throughout the day. One of the real hidden gems here was THE FOOD. The restaurant feels like a step into a home-cooked Moroccan kitchen with exceptional Lamb shoulder and breakfast bites.    The location was incredible- just a short walk from the main square but far enough to be quiet at night. Every return to the property felt like coming home. A wonderful stay we'll be sure to repeat!

Review_Date: pritish h wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: Best Service! Good location and Incredible Staff !!!
Review_Text: If you are looking for a riad near Marrakech old city Medina and came across to DAR Anika then your search ends here!!! We stayed there for 3 nights and 4days and also planned 4 day desert excursion with them!! They also helped us plan our day activities with a tour guide for the city tour and also where exactly to go eat tips for the tourists and watch outs etc..This was one of the most memorable trip of our life and it was all because of Lyann and her incredible staff!!! There were 3 incredible receptionist genies as I would call them as they were so sweet and friendly and they made all our wishes of having great time come true !!! We absolutely put all the faith on them to plan it for us and it was the best decision. The location of the riad was also perfect as it was just right at the entrance and you don’t have to walk a lot from the car stop unlike other riads that are inside and you have to walk all the way with the suitcases to get into.  The rooms are very clean and good. Honestly the rooms did not matter so much because we were just outside all day and only came back to sleep..    I will highly recommend this riad for anyone who is looking for having a good time in Marrakesh !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The hospitality that made the difference
Review_Text: After a week in Morocco it was so nice to come in and talk to the general manager Lyanne who was the most down to earth interesting and kind woman. Lyanne took a genuine interest in our family. Her tips were so helpful and she just made us feel so welcome and at home. We stayed here during New Years Eve and had a fantastic NYE dinner at their rooftop restaurant with wonderful food and the staff really went out of their way to make sure we had a fun time.    When we first arrived we were flustered because our driver had dropped us at the wrong place and a local had taken us to the wrong Riad and had argued with us very rudely for a bigger tip. The front desk ladies took it upon themselves to deal with the local and even went so far to call the tour company to remedy the situation. This exemplifies this Riad they go above and beyond to make this experience an overwhelmingly positive one. These women always had a smile on their face and made us always feel welcome and accommodated.    On top of that the Riad was absolutely beautiful and the rooftop views are breathtaking. The breakfast every morning was also delicious. Highly recommend staying here. They truly made our Moroccan experience special and one that we we will always remember.

Review_Date: Nick K wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: This Riad was amazing! As soon as we were welcomed in it really did feel like the oasis from the city that the staff wanted it to be. Our room was clean comfortable and cool. There were plenty of toiletries and towels provided and it was well cleaned every day. My wife was obsessed with the daily Moroccan breakfast it was a feast every morning to start the day! The staff were all lovely. They went above and beyond to help us have a pleasant visit to Marrakesh by helping ensure our planned excursions went smoothly and even packed us snacks to take with us to their airport since they know our flight was late at night. We will definitely come back here if we ever find our way back to Marrakesh!

Riad Dar Anika was perfect in every way. Great location great facilities and unbelievable service.    I have to praise the manager Lyane in particular. She was there right from the moment we stepped into the Riad to the time we left  . There was a great welcome and any time in the day when she saw us coming or going she will be out offering us teas and juices and cookies and cakes. Her hospitality was truly incredible. When we informed her that my daughter has nut allergy she called the cook to verify if there Calle selections that day had any nuts. She also told the cook not to make anything with nuts over the next 3 days so we can eat everything without worrying.    The staff is very efficient and friendly. The place is very organized. They gave us two local phones with addresses and phone preprogrammed. We could call them anytime day or night if we were lost in the Medina or just needed anything.    The location is right at the entrance of Medina. So it is easy to get to by taxi but great place to explore the markets and the city.    Truly recommend the place
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Great location, charming house and wonderful people
Review_Text: This is a very charming Riad at the edge of the pedestrian only part of the Medina. This excellent location gives you access to cars as well as the labyrinth of pedestrian only streets inside the walled Medina. The staff is excellent and go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. This is not your typical hotel it’s an old Moroccan house with 12 rooms.We booked two rooms for the four of us. The terrace has great views of the Medina with a hot tub. Breakfast and dinner was good and the Italian chef prepared some off the menu items for us to taste as he was trying out dishes for his next menu. The front desk got an entire load of laundry done for us. We booked our travel to Essaouira the desert and Fes through the hotel. They arranged for an excellent English speaking driver with a Toyota Land Cruiser 4X4 for our journey. Will highly recommend this Riad to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Hassan W wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: wonderful place  amazing staff  very helpful manager explaining a lot to us giving us a local phone to manage in our trip  very clean hotel restaurant and bar  very excellent location easy to reach by car near major attractions
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Amazing staff  Amazing help to have your stay enjoyable  Amazing manager Leeann help us in every aspect to enjoy our stay  Very clean and beautiful place  Breakfast bar and restaurant was so enjoyable  Leeann and her staff are the best
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Darina T wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Thank you for the lovely stay the care the flowers the great breakfast and the care for a gluten free breakfast. All the staff was very kind and we loved everything about our stay! We recommend the Riad dar Anika. Lovely location and great local experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I highly recommend staying at Riad Dar Anika. The staff is there to make sure your trip is an amazing experience. Our room was so romantic and very clean. Fruit mint tea and coffee was served all time. Delicious breakfast traditional live music at dinner.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: fantastic stay in a beautiful hidden oasis in the medina of Marrakech. Peace and quiet  delicious food helpful and friendly staff. We felt very nourished and well looked after during our stay. Loved it !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika was one of the best hotels we have stayed their service and customer attention was top notch. We enjoyed their food breakfast and their delicious tea. The whole staff were beyond amazing thank you all. We definitely recommend them 100%.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul M wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: An exceptional Riad in a perfect location.
Review_Text: The Riad was just perfect and all the staff were exceptional. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left they could not have been more helpful knowledgeable and friendly. The Riad is located perfectly for exploring the medina but not so you are disturbed at night. We would recommend it wholeheartedly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: great location and beautiful Riad to stay in friendly staff who were happy to help with anything great food in their rooftop restaurant  also the terrace and jacuzzi were a lovely place to relaxxxxx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had a marvelous 5 days stay at Dar Anika.  From the minute we have arrived to the minute we have left we felt pampered by the entire team of this beautiful Riad.  Our room was beautiful and spacious and our only dilemma for next time will be if to return to Dar Anika or to try its sister Riad Riad Kaiss that is close by and looks extremely nice as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Maria Tiago wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Nice stay at this riad. The staff were generally helpful although took their time! I found the terrace to be a nice place to relax and get some sun. Clean rooms and very beautiful riad and great value! End your search and stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I spent 3 nights here at the beginning of december and was mostly very satisfied ! It started already at the check-in I was allowed to take a seat on the sofa got tea and a dessert. Wow I was really positively surprised! Also a free telephone was made available I found a very nice gesture.    To the rooms which were very traditionally furnished.. actually very beautiful but some things were missing to me. A little more modern would have done well for example there was no TV in the room. Also the minibar was empty when opening. the bathroom did not correspond to a 5 star hotel for me shower was for example integrated in the bathtub and not individually... the shampoo was not very effective and the washbasin rather old.  Also a negative point for me was the size of the room namely it was quite small for this price which I paid.    But the breakfast and the roof terrace were beautiful. I also appreciated the friendliness of the staff...    I find the ratings a little too high here and for me rather a 4 star hotel. But all in all I was very satisfied it was a completely different experience for me. it is just different than staying in a five star hotel in Europe but I still felt very comfortable here around the clock.    What I also found beautiful... at the check out I got another present and eat for my flight. Very attentive and hospitable is this hotel ! Many other hotels could cut themselves a slice of this.    Thank you for the amenities !

Review_Date: Kev M wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I don't tend to review many places but 5his one needs to recognised as an amazing place. The locations is perfectly placed in the old town with easy access to the famous squares souks and Mosque's.  The room was a superior room and was lovely. Only one word of caution is if you suffer from claustrophobia then ask about what room has the most natural light. This is something that all Riad's would have as they have small windows. We loved the room though. The bed was big and comfy. The breakfast was varied and truly Morrocan which was great but if you wanted western style food there were breads and omlettes as well.  We ate in the restaurant twice and the food was stunning.  The main positive about is was the service from pick at the airport to check in briefing and maps offers to do reservations at restaurants use of their driver and buying entry tickets to lending you a local smartphone with preset numbers to call the hotel and use Google maps. Simply everything was a pleasure (especially the bar manager making us speciality cocktails to try). We felt truly welcome and would absolutely recommend friends to stay here when in Marrakesh
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very romantic stay and very hospitable place
Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights at this wonderful riad  very clean rooms and well refined  the staff are very nice and helpful  a detailed info about the city wr given upon arrival  this is a 12 rooms riad each one has a different decoration our room was suite nbr 1  spectacular romantic and very spacious the best thing was the breakfast waw it was very generous  soup  fruit salad and home made yogurt cake and coffee assortments of traditional bread with pancake and then a wide options of omelets we tried the camel bacon eggs as recommended by the manager  it was very tasty  the staff were very friendly and professional and they made us happy every morning this is really a high standard place to stay .would come back again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anne W wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: I was welcomed with fresh dates and mint tea in one of the lovely reception rooms. The local staff were attentive and efficient and manager Leeanne a font of practical advice and ready help in any contingency. Older less fit folks might not relish the stairs climb to where the food is but it's good for the appetite. Loved the view from the rooftop and the warm quiet ambience of the dining-room which included a man playing the oud a traditional lute. Much better than piped music. Despite my room being on the ground floor off the central courtyard it was sufficiently noiseproof that I was able to sleep undisturbed a pleasant outcome for this light sleeper. Note there is no kettle but tea or coffee or hot water will be brought to you virtually on demand. I had a very early flight on the day of my departure and relished the fresh hot pot of tea brought to me as I waited for my airport transfer at 3.30am.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: The reviews are true! Enjoy an incredible stay
Review_Text: I do all the holiday planning in my house so when my husband came home and suggested Dar Anika as his colleague had been there and said it was incredible I looked it up on here. Surely all those glowing reviews couldn’t be true...? Well we’ve just returned and I can say with confidence they are true. Lyanne and her team throughly spoil you from the breakfast feast each morning to making sure you know where to go and what to visit. The trip is a delight from beginning to end. We only stayed for 3 nights but loved every minute of staying here. Our suite had a stunning cupola in the roof- we slept so well. Riads don’t have big picture windows due to their design. It’s not an issue - we had the best nights sleep ever. The toiletries are stunning they have decent Parlux hairdryers in the rooms and comfy pillow top mattresses. We had dinner one night in the hotel and enjoyed that. Afternoon tea was delicious each day. There were so many little touches dates and almond milk in our room a lunch box and toiletries to take home etc. We loved it here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Everything is perfect about this Riad. The manager Leanne took an extensive amount of time familiarizing me with the city and arranging day trips to the Atlas Mountains and Essaouira. The highlight of my stay was my guide Hassan in the Atlas Mountains at Imlil—the best guide ever who took good care of me and fed me the most spectacular lunch ever in his home. Ask for Hassan and create an experience you will never forget.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Beautiful Riad excellent hostess where nothing was too much trouble. Excellent location to explore all Marrakesh had to offer with the Riad as a relaxing sanctuary to come back to for complete relaxation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nick P wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Attentive and relaxing a beautiful raid exuding an air of calm and tranquility; a great antidote to our daily lives and the hussle and bussle of Marrakesh. Great location and knowledgeable staff. Lyanne in particular is a font of knowledge and first-hand experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Great place to stay while you are in Marrakesh
Review_Text: Everything was just as expected. The room that we reserved was ready when we arrived. The room was just what the internet said it was. Breakfast was great. The restaurant which is part of the RIAD was outstanding. All service was just excellent. The place was quiet from 10PM to 5AM. Yes we heard the call for prayer at 6AM. But everyone does who stays in this part of town. My only comment was the insulation in the room was not perfect. But this is a very old building and this is to be expected. We stayed on the second floor in a suite. Which was very nice.

Very charming place with an breakfast freshly cooked for each guest. Anticipating your needs and going a bit beyond. Sparkling clean place. The professionalism and kindness of the staff was a such a delight.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Amie R wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Wonderful trip my partner and I stayed here with my Mum and Dad and we all had such a comfortable welcoming and wonderful stay. Lianne and the team are fantastic and can help arrange anything you would like once you are there and know all the spots to try. The restaurant team are lovely aswell and the food is fantastic - the lamb shoulder to share is a must. Cleanliness was great and we couldn't have been in a better location. Would recommend to everyone. Thank you Lianne & Team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Stephen Page wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Of all the Riads in all of Marrakech - Lyanne and her wonderful team make this the best. Came this time with friends and we got into a great routine: adventures in the morning sun terrace in the afternoon and a series of restaurants in the evening.    Lyanne makes it easy to enjoy the Médina. The briefing when you arrive the welcome at breakfast and when you come back from the mornings adventure and drinks on the terrace.    The restaurant is cracking too. Possibly the best food we had all weekend.    We’ll be back soon.    Kate and Stephen
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Amie R wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Lianne and the team were simply fantastic welcoming and wonderful to have as a point in contact throughout our stay.    The riad is beautiful clean and inviting - the restaurant on the top floor is good fantastic lamb and lovely staff - the view from the roof terrace is great too.    Would recommend to anyone - a hidden gem.    Thanks to Lianne and the team again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is an oustanding Riad with a very welcoming staff which made us a feel right at home upon our arrival and throughout our stay. We really appreciated all they did for us from the help they gave us navigating Marrakech to sorting out reservations at restaurants and all the other little things they did to ensure we had a nice stay. The location is central and made going out into the medina very easy. The rooms were spacious clean and serviced regularly whilst we were out.    The terrace of the hotel offers really fantastic views of the city and the mountains which is great for having a drink.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Elizabeth L wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: The Riad Dar Anika was the best of both worlds--authentic riad right at the entrance to the medina while also beautiful tranquil full of creature comforts and helpful staff and serving delicious food. As the other reviews said they go above and beyond to make you comfortable and schedule anything you so desire. Note that you can have them arrange a private tour guide hammam or spa services and they will charge you through the room. (We weren't sure if these things were included or not.) Prices are reasonable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This restaurant has excellent welocomig staff and great service. The food is exceptional though we didn't stay tere. The l;ocation i in old Marrakech close by the Palais Badi. The lamb shoulder Mechoui as fantastic best I've ever tasted.

Spent 3 nights. Fantastic place. Would recommend enthusiastically. Staff attentive and very capable. Excursions and guides arranged through Dar Anika top notch. Location ideal. Restaurant on site also very good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a lovely stay at Dar Anika the warm and personalized welcome the professionalism the kindness are there. The breakfast is delicious the view from the terrace is awesome.  We asked for additional services (personal guide driver for airport transfer massages) everything was done with smile and high quality. We recommend the hammam and massage done in their own hammam.  We highly recommend this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I were so impressed by Lyanne and her fabulous staff. We immediately felt so welcome. The Riad is the perfect location and the perfect size so it’s easy to meet other travellers. The rooms were great. The rooftop patio was spectacular- views of sunrise and sunset. Added bonus was the restaurant- wonderful breakfasts and dinners . Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend 👍
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Keven H wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Ideal location! Riad was very clean and the staff was extremely friendly and made us feel at home during our stay. The breakfast included was a perfect way to start the day and dinner at their restaurant was the best meal we had in Marrakesh! Only suggestion would be to request a room on the second level.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter S wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Beautiful setting under a bamboo roof with lots of plants and heat lamps. There was also a local guy playing a Moroccan style guitar which was nice.  Very welcoming.    Random service though.  We waited 20 minutes just to order a drink so at the same time we ordered our food just in case. Food arrived in less than 5 minutes which was surprisingly nice. Food was amazing !! Chicken Saffra which was chicken and couscous mixed with herbs and spices in a sauce. SO tasty.    Ordered pears in caramel sauce for desert and again was so delicious. Really really lovely food. Not cheap but worth it. Nice atmosphere just the speed of service at the start that could have been better. Compliments to the chef !  Strong 5/5
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My girlfriend and I stumbled across this little gem which was just on the outskirts of the main medina square.  The owner and staff were welcoming the service and meal excellent and whilst respectful of the Muslim culture it was also nice to be able to have a bottle of wine with our meal.  We ate in numerous restaurants whilst in Marrakech but this was the standout by a country mile. Can’t recommend it enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Nothing was too much for the charming and respectful team. Always a smile and a courteous manner. Leanne was a terrific host with encyclopedic knowledge of her surroundings. Warm and friendly quick-witted efficient and most amusing! She devoted time to her guests. What an asset to Dar Anika.  Arrangements were made seamlessly for our 4 day stay. We went to La Bahia Palace Le Jardin Secret Maison de la Photographie the Marjorelle Garden (and the Yves st Lauren Museum) and the Musee de le Femme. All worth a visit. We also jostled between fellow tourists traders and scooters in the endless souks. Beware of taking photos in the Jemaa-El-Fna Square.  Essaouira was a delight as was Hakim our driver. He was justifiably proud of his Berber heritage. A guide showed us the old town.  The food was excellent and a great lively evening out is at Comptoir Darna with belly-dancing.  A hammam (massage - deep clean!) is a must arranged at the Riad.  We thoroughly enjoyed our time but it is hectic outside and a bit exhaust-fumey. We went in October and the weather was lovely. High summer could be overwhelming for some brits!  We loved our time there and it has a special place in our hearts. A surprise anniversary cake a packed lunch for our journey home and of course Leanne's trademark rose petals in the rooms were all those little added touches which can make such a difference to your feeling of being looked after and treated as special.  Thank-you to all the lovely staff. Jane and Mark.x

Review_Title: Fabulous stay in a well appointed Riaad inan ideal location with exemplary service.
Review_Text: I booked the Riad Dar Anika for my wife and I after coming to Morocco in June on a boys trip when we stayed at a fairly bland but very adequate international chain.  If you want a real taste of Medina living then this is the place. Beautifully appointed at an entrance to the Souk two minutes from the Bahia Palace and 5 minutes from the Jamaa El Fna. The Riad is an oasis of calm from the hustle and bustle of the Souk which is well needed.  The hotel is furnished to a high standard with a nice bar and roof top restaurant and a typical small pool to one side of the quadrangle. Our superior room was authentic with a standard double and a bath and shower. Riad rooms arem't typically enormous given their heritage. If you want something large go to one of the chain hotels outside the Medina. By the way if you cant handle stairs (not a problem to my wife or I) then look somewhere else  The staff staff were extremely good. I received a personalised welcome email before I came and they arranged transfers (20mins from the airport) and a number of restaurant bookings etc before we came. Having arrived off the hideously early flight from London Gatwick we were fed and watered and made to feel at home. The Kiwi Manageress was extremely good We had a twenty five minute sit down with her during which she took us through Medina logistics and ideas of places to go and restaurants worth a visit. She does this with all of the guests.  We dined at the rooftop restaurant on the first evening given our early start. The shoulder of lamb for two was excellent and was the local Shiraz. You also have breakfast in the restaurant. Depending on your appetite talk to the waiter before you order as although excellent it is a multi course affair! Cake and drinks are also available in the Courtyard during the afternoon should it take your fancy.  On checking out we were given a transparent package containing a hand baggage sized shower gel shampoo and soap as a leaving gift together with a 'security friendly lunch bag with a sandwich and fruit; a really nice touch.  The true test of staying in a hotel is whether you would stay there again. In the case of Riad Dar Anika a resounding yes!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We felt like royalty while staying at Dar Anika. The service at the Riad was truly exceptional. The additional touches like tea cake and dates made it a 5 star experience. The spa services provided were top notch and I have to recommend a hammam as it was an experience unlike anything I've ever had.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Everything about our stay here was fabulous from the personal greeting on arrival with milk dates Moroccan mint tea and cookies and description of the area and things to do and see to the lovely riad itself with comfy individual rooms in traditional Moroccan style and great smelling toiletries to the amazing breakfast freshly prepared by table each morning. The restaurant has a good reputation and the menu looked really high quality although we unfortunately didn't get the chance to eat there ourselves. The riad is located close to the main square and all the market stalls but also near many popular tourist attractions. The roof terrace was a perfect way to end a day of sightseeing and then again at the end of the day before going to bed. It was our daughter's birthday during our stay and the hotel staff couldn't do enough - they organised a cake and flowers for her which really made her trip. On departure we were given gifts including toiletries and a print of our names in Arabic as a memento of our time there given a goodbye hug from the hotel manager and taken to a nearby taxi. Thanks to everyone involved for making it such a memorable stay. Fantastic personal service which will mean a stay here again for us for sure!

My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and it was spectacular! The staff was amazing from arrival to departure. We traveled to 4 different cities during our 2 week stay and this hotel was our favorite based upon hospitality. The staff was attentive whenever we were present the breakfast was fresh and delicious the staff was knowledgeable and provided exceptional service by flagging taxis providing packed luncheons for excursion days and the honeymoon surprise (flowers/decor) in our room. I highly recommend and couldn't be happier.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Superb hospitality at Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: Everything about Dar Anika is excellent: location atmosphere rooms staff food. From the moment of arrival to that of final departure we were treated as honoured welcome guests. The director and her staff were marvellously friendly and helpful giving us advice and recommendations whenever we sought them obtaining tickets and reservations for us booking a city tour and a wonderful guided tour and hike in the Atlas Mountains and there to chat with us about our experiences over cups of mint tea and luscious local home-made pastries when we returned from our outings. Our corner room 3 on the upper terrace level was spacious beautifully decorated quiet and calm and kept spotless. Our included breakfasts were so copious and delicious that we skipped lunch entirely on our days in the city. For me this small luxury riad is far superior to the big grand hotels in Marrakech. At Dar Anika one actually is visiting the culture and people of Marrakech as well as their city. I recommend Dar Anika highly!

Review_Date: Richard L wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Nice rooms (some a little more spacious than others) and decoration. Breakfast excellent. Dining experience was mixed because some staff were absent through sickness but the cuisine was good. Above all wonderful staff
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mrs R wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: I have just visited Riad dar Anika with friends for a girls weekend and we were all blown away with how beautiful this place is. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and we we greeted with fresh mint tea and home made biscuits whilst they checked us in upon our very late arrival.  Attention to detail is impressive such as a gift of their locally sourced shampoo and showergel on checkout. They even gave us a foodbag to take to the airport!  Leanne spent time at breakfast giving us some handy tips before we explored the Souks and we were given a local mobile phone to use for the duration of our stay so that we could call them directly if we got lost.  The roof top terrace with a cocktail is a must in the late afternoon as is the restaurant on an evening in a beautiful setting.  Perfect location on the edge of the souks yet once you are through the front door you are enveloped by peace and quiet. I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone visiting Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We just got back from our visit to Morocco and I couldn't wait to share our experience at the riad. Such an amazing hospitality starting from the moment we walked into the door. The restaurant is awesome as well both breakfast and dinner and I would highly recommend planning to have dinner at the riad at least one night. Last but not least the hammam is fantastic.

The place was perfect very well located and the staff is incredibly friendly and kind. They were expecting us with all kinds of amenities and the best was the manager little talk about the city with great tips and advices. The manager the restaurant manager all the staff in the reception Zouhair in the restaurant and Acmed in the everyday issues and all the people that work in the riad were constantly looking after our comfort and needs. We had an experience that we will never forget and we are anxious to come back. Thanks for everything!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just returned from an absolutely amazing stay at Dar Anika. From start to finish the staff have exceeded all expectations from our welcome at 11pm with mint tea to our check out yesterday with gifts and a packed lunch. The small touches that left such a big impact on our short break the use of a mobile phone with maps all ready to go the tips of where to go and what to see all invaluable! The most amazing breakfasts certainly set us up for the day. Can‘t rate this Riad enough it is a gem and would without hesitation recommend to anyone. Thank you to all staff and we will hopefully be returning again!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at Riad Dar Anika and could not have asked for a better hotel. Lyanne was absolutely amazing in giving us tips in navigating the city and even helped us into our first taxi (which can be a hectic experience!). The entire staff was welcoming and went over the top to ensure that every need was met. The Riad was immaculately clean and absolutely beautiful. It felt like an oasis from the bustling city outside. We couldn't have asked for a better location hospitality and experience. Thank you to the entire Riad staff for making this by far the best hotel experience we have ever had!

The rooms were great staff very hospitable and helpful. Restaurant superb and rooftop deck a bonus on a hot day with a jacuzzi overlooking the city. Last day we were there the manager packed us lunch for our ride back to Casablanca. Highly recommend this place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Barb K wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: Oasis. Our every need was anticipated and met
Review_Text: We received an incredibly warm welcome that included a cell phone should we get lost which was pre-programmed with Dar Anika's number! Our every need was anticipated. Staff was amazing; friendly helpful and gracious.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: Munster, Germany, Pamplona, Spain, Cannes, France, Genoa, Italy, Pisa, Italy, Pompei, Italy, Sicily, Weittenberg, Switzerland

Review_Date: Ted Berk wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Marrakesh is a rather hectic place to visit and this boutique hotel is a welcome retreat from the busy city. The service and hospitality were terrific. There is a rooftop restaurant that is a great place to relax and have a drink. The food was excellent. Rooms were nice and the hotel was very clean. The only limitation of the place is that the pool is too small to really swim laps but it was clean and will cool you off.

Review_Date: James and Debjani wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: Great service, great location, beautiful Riad
Review_Text: Stayed 3 nights at Riad Dar Anika. From the moment we walked in we were graciously and enthusiastically supported and helped and made to feel at home. The Riad was beautiful and comfortable. The small swimming/wading pool was incredibly refreshing after the hot sun of Marrakesh. The room was excellent (though the lights flickered on occasion)... we had a Superior Double Room so we had plenty of space. They helped arrange everything we needed - the service was exceptional at all times. In all ways a wonderful experience.

We chose the Riad Dar Anika due to the Tripadvisor recommendations and you guys so didn’t disappoint!    Greeted with dates pastries and mint tea on arrival and given an excellent briefing by lovely Lyanne what to do where to eat and how to avoid being ripped off by taxi drivers...    The staff are the best I have ever experienced and I stay in a lot of hotels they just can’t help you enough!    Given the noise and sensory overdose outside the door it is a wonderful oasis of calm. A few hours relaxing on the roof with a good book and a cocktail after a day of exploring was heaven.    The Hamman is so to be experienced - let’s just say we were unbelievably clean at the end (!) - and the masseurs are excellent.    The breakfasts are delicious yet to experience an evening meal but given the quality of everything else sure it will be fabulous.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Beth S wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Excellent Riad with outstanding service. Loved the rooftop deck and view of the stars! The staff really make your stay memorable and rooms are cozy and the breakfasts and dinners were excellent. Staying here made out trip to Marrakesh 5 stars. The location is also excellent and close to taxis!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Rob Malcolm wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: Great stay fell like family after just a few days.
Review_Text: We had great stay at Riad Anika thanks to the great staff and in particular our great host and manager Lyanne. The food and ambience was so enjoyable as was the dip in the luxury plunge pool. Great location central to all the sites and shopping we will definitely recommend to our friends in Australia.

Review_Date: René K wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: A very charming spot in the city
Review_Text: At the edge of the medina and not far away from the big plaza.  They help you with every question you have very very friendly a real oasis in middle of a magnifique fascinating city. It is really worth to stay there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Dar Anika went above and beyond our expectations. Starting with their amazing staff every employee gave 110% to make us feel at home and were always attentive to every single detail. Everyone was so helpful and willing to accommodate to our needs. Upon arrival the concierge gave us a tour of the property sat with us in the lounge to answer questions and helped us organize our agenda. We were provided with a local cellphone to use during our stay and our warm welcome was completed with peppermint tea and homemade cookies (that are always available in the courtyard for the guests). We booked all our tours and activities through the Riad and they didn’t disappoint. Riad location was exceptional very centric and close to almost everything in the Medina so it was easy to come and go. The room was very clean and comfortable. The rooftop restaurant was a must for breakfast every morning as well as for dinner. Nights were spent relaxing in the rooftop terrace under the stars. Definitely would recommend if staying in Marrakech. Thank you very much to Hint Lyanne and everyone that helped us have a honeymoon to remember. With love and good vibes Frances & Josele ♥️
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a lovely riad located in the old city of Marrakech. The location is easy to get to as it's a very short walk from the old Jewish quarter where taxis can drop you. Yet it's located within the souk close to the main square. The riad itself is beautiful and the rooms are comfortable. Leanne and her team welcomed us like family and made sure every need was met. We had dinner in the rooftop restaurant one night which was one of the best meals of our Morocco adventure - including being serenaded with lovely traditional music. We'll happily recommend Dar Anika!

Review_Date: Sarah R wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: My husband and I truly don’t have enough nice words to use about this wonderful place. The amenities location food ambiance rooms decor etc were all top notch but what made the stay really special was the staff. They are the warmest kindest most lovely people. Lyanne is fabulous and her love for the staff and guests shines through. All of her recommendations were spot on and really helped us to make the most of our stay. If traveling to Marrakech you must stay here. You are right at the action of the market and you are able to walk all over the Medina from the Riad. You are also right near a taxi stand so access to the other parts of town is also very easy. The Riad itself is peaceful and pleasant despite the busy streets below. We enjoyed spending our evenings on the terrace upstairs. Truly the best place we believe we’ve ever had the pleasure of staying.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I would love to be welcomed  in any hotel of the world by Lyanne and her staff. Friendly clean helpful and do not miss the kitchen upstairs... Booking this hotel you are around the souks and in spite of being in the middle of Marrakesh you won:i hear any noise. The Riad Arnika you can book and you have a wonderful stay in Marrakesh....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ted Berk wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Marrakesh is a rather hectic place to visit and this boutique hotel is a welcome retreat from the busy city. The service and hospitality were terrific. There is a rooftop restaurant that is a great place to relax and have a drink. The food was excellent. Rooms were nice and the hotel was very clean. The only limitation of the place is that the pool is too small to really swim laps but it was clean and will cool you off.

The staff are the best I have ever experienced and I stay in a lot of hotels they just can’t help you enough!    Given the noise and sensory overdose outside the door it is a wonderful oasis of calm. The Hamman is so to be experienced - let’s just say we were unbelievably clean at the end (!) - and the masseurs are excellent.    The breakfasts are delicious yet to experience an evening meal but given the quality of everything else sure it will be fabulous.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Beth S wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: We chose the Riad Dar Anika due to the Tripadvisor recommendations and you guys so didn’t disappoint!    Greeted with dates pastries and mint tea on arrival and given an excellent briefing by lovely Lyanne what to do where to eat and how to avoid being ripped off by taxi drivers...    The staff are the best I have ever experienced and I stay in a lot of hotels they just can’t help you enough!    Given the noise and sensory overdose outside the door it is a wonderful oasis of calm. Review_Text: Amazing stay felt like home. Staff was excellent and professional. Worth staying at Dar Anika Riad. Breakfast was amazing with fresh orange juice and home made food. Wonderful trip to Marrakech. Thank you so much for your efforts..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: susan j wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is a great place to stay while in Marrakech. Location is ideal close to souks and they go out of their way to help you to make the most of your stay with friendly and helpful staff. The recommendations of places to visit and assistance with ‘need to know’ info made my stay really worthwhile and enjoyable. A substantial breakfast included was also appreciated during my time a Riad Dar Anika. I would definitely visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We would like to thank Lyanne and her team for the most amazing stay. The customer service was excellent - we were looked after so well and everyone was friendly and nice. The location of this Riad is great too- about a ten minute walk down the road to the main square and souks. The Bahia Palace and El Badi Palace is just around the corner. This is a lovely traditional Riad and we have already recommended it to a family member.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Glenda A wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: The staff were very helpful and courteous Lyanne and her team went beyond their duties to fulfil our requests. Very friendly and warm atmosphere during our time there. Great location and convenient. Close to Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We’ve just returned from the most amazing 3 nights at Riad Dar Anika and we cannot emphasise how fantastic this Riad is. The manager Lyanne offers personal service that easily rivals if not surpasses that of some 5 star hotels we’ve stayed in. The location is fantastic and as soon as you step out on to the street you really feel you are in the centre of everything.    Within hours of booking the staff emailed to make contact and answered any questions within a very short time. Communication was excellent and it was refreshing not to have to chase a hotel for a reply.    From the moment we arrived we were delighted by the attention to detail and the efficiency of Lyanne’s team. After drinks and a guided tour of Riad Dar Anika by Lyanne we were shown to our rooms which are beautiful and have such an authentic feel to them a much better way to experience Marrakech than a boring big chain hotel.    We were given the use of a phone in case we needed google maps or to contact the hotel a map which marked out where everything was in relation to the Riad and a friendly reminder to call if we needed anything.    Dinner at the Riad was superb a great wine selection and we had arranged a cake for our friend’s birthday which was taken care of and delivered to the table just as we asked.    The rooms are serviced well fresh towels twice a day if you want gorgeous complimentary products plenty of complimentary bottled water and some seriously good cake in the afternoons served in the lounge. Breakfast is like a banquet there is absolutely no way you can leave hungry.    Even as we checked out the service was spot on with some amazing little touches that left us feeling that we really had struck gold. Riad Dar Anika really made our holiday in Marrakech for us and we would highly recommend you booking your stay here. It really is an exceptional place and once again thank you to Lyanne and her team for everything
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My family and I just left this hotel today and I had to write a review. Lyanne and her staff were amazing. They went out of there way for anything we needed. They would pack us a snack for our trips walk us a block or two to show us how to get somewhere and even filled out our custom forms just to name a few. The restaurant food and staff were great too. The hotel is right next to the Médina but you can always come back to the Oasis that is this hotel. Can’t say one bad thing except we had to leave!!! We will miss you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jessica C wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: You don't need to look further
Review_Text: The trip was absolutely amazing a great part thank to Riad Dar Anika. We had a wonderful time besides the horrible flight experience. Staff was so friendly everything so detailed we even received lovely sandwiches for our return airport ride from the Manager. Unfortunately we lost 2 days due to traveling issues and did not get our money back which simply sucks BUT the experience made it worth it.    The food is great! Very delicious not once did it make me sick and that is coming from a person that has plenty of stomach issues. The restaurant manager was delightful very attentive and kind.    Distance form the medina: its a 5-8 min straight walk. I repeat Straight walk!! With so many left rights and forks in the road you learn to appreciate a straight walk.    Room: Clean.. clean and clean. We did notice some little ants made their way inside the first night but as you can see there is an open space and many natural plants everywhere After the first night we never saw them again. The staff ALWAYS cleaned so detailed they even organized my whitening strips in the bathroom!    Tours: I had in mind what tours I wanted to do before I arrived. They offered to schedule everything for us and was later added to our tab. Honestly that was the best choice we made! We visited the Jardin and YSL museums and went for a camel ride suring sunset. It takes the pressure off looking for taxis tickets and etc. They also tell you the limit of how much taxis should cost so you do not get ripped off!    Lastly I would recommend to enjoy the pool. During our stay we seemed to be the only people making use of it. It is beautiful romantic and quit peaceful from the madness 50 feet away.    -Riad Kaiss ( sister riad) They have a sister Riad where you can have breakfast lunch and dinner. You can also use the pool at this location. It is a 3 minute walk away but do not worry they will escort you there so you will not get lost.    We loved this place so much! We plan to return and stay a little longer next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wonderful staff and a beautiful hotel. Everything from the lovely manager Lyanne greeting us with a glass of tea when we arrived to the delicious breakfast on the terrace in the mornings was just perfect. The staff was very helpful with everything including getting us train tickets to Casablanca. When we left they had even made a luch bag for us for our trip. Lyanna has also been very helpful as I left my bracelet at the hotel to get this back to me in Norway <3    Dar Anika was just a perfect place to stay in so many ways. We left for Casablanca to stay at the Four Seasons Hotel and let me just say that it was a HUGE disappointment to arrive there from Dar Anika. Both five-star hotels but Dar Anika was by far the most preferred one!    I will recommend this hotel to everyone who is travelling to Marrakesh!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great location and amazingly helpful staff. Mint tea smoothies and cakes offered at every turn! We also ate in the restaurant in the sky bar and had a lovely meal. Enjoyed our conversations with Leyanne who made us feel very welcome. Thoroughly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I chose Riad Dar Anika for our recent visit to Marrakech. It was an excellent choice. Very safe clean and a great location. I cannot say enough about the staff. Everyone went above and beyond to make us fell as if we were the only guest. I would highly recommend and the only thing I would change was for us to have stayed longer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: The Most Hospitable Ryad in Marrakech
Review_Text: This Ryad was so welcoming and full of sweet thoughtful touches! The staff was amazing the food was delicious the place was beautiful and the location can not get any better. Nothing here disappointed. Everyone was so kind and wanted to make sure our every desire was fulfilled. Our room was perfect... very clean and comfortable. Cookies and milk by our bedsides every evening what more could you ask for. The sweet manager has thought of everything... even packing us a to go snack for our flight! Ohhh and don’t forget to try the afternoon slushy... watermelon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Cammy J wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: At Dar Anika you will be blown away by all the thoughtful features and gestures of the staff. Please take time to enjoy the many terrace levels the well stocked bar and oh my lord the dinner menu. I will dream of Chicken Seffa for many weeks to come. We didn’t use the pool but it looked gorgeous! At the end of our visit they even had our immigration forms filled out for us made placards with our names in Arabic a meal to go and hair products from Morocco. But while these are all wonderful treats when it comes down to it the people of Marrakech treated my friend and me with utter kindness and a lovely spirit!

From the pickup at the airport till the drop-off we loved every single moment. The staff was very helpful attentive and knowledgeable and the riad's location absolutely perfect. Will certainly stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Samantha F wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: The food service rooms were well above expectations--if I visit Marrakech again I would def choose Dar Anika again. From the most amazing breakfast to the complimentary afternoon tea the level of hospitality was above and beyond.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ana Raimundo wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: The atmosphere throughout the hotel automatically relaxes you upon entry. Air is refreshing to walk into such a quiet pristine atmosphere after exploring the hustle and bustle of the Medina! Overall staying at this hotel really made our experience in Marrakech memorable and we would highly recommended staying here if you are visiting this city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This Riad was in a great location for the souk and getting out and about via taxi. The staff were very friendly and welcoming with little touches including helping with taxis booking restaurants afternoon tea fresh cake and a slushy available each day. Food in the restaurant was really good especially after a long day travelling there. Roof terrace and hot tub were great as well as use of sister Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Casey S wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: Magical stay at Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: I loved staying at Riad Dar Anika especially as a solo female traveller they made me feel at home. The staff were so helpful in making sure I had all the info I needed to get around safely and make the most of my time in Marrakech. The Riad itself is beautiful and comfortable with an amazing pool to cool off after a day of exploring. The breakfast is also delicious. Couldn't recommend this Riad highly enough as a very special place to stay in Marrakech. I hope to visit again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Chris N wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I would absolutely recommend staying here to anyone wishing to visit Marrakech. The staff is superb and extremely helpful. The location is perfect. The riad itself is beyond gorgeous. It's a perfect oasis of tranquility from the chaos of the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jennifer P wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: Gorgeous, clean and peaceful riad with excellent food and service
Review_Text: This is a gorgeous riad that is just a feast for your eyes everywhere you look. The restaurant's food is incredible (don't miss the lamb!) and the staff was so warm and attentive. We loved it and are eager to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A gem in the heart of Marrakesh
Review_Text: Really beautiful place with a fantastic team. Nothing is too much for them and their genuine care and attention to detail from the cookies and drinks every afternoon to the sandwiches made for us for our the trip back home. Lyanne and her team are absolutely lovely and we will definitely be back at Dar Anika when visiting Marrakesh next. Thank you for a great stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Leisha B wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: We stayed at the beautiful Riad Dar Anika just last week and we're still reflecting on how wonderful our stay was. Upon our arrival we were immediately calmed by Lyanne and her amazing advice on everything - where to eat how to get reservations how to exchange cash places to see. We were also given a phone to use which was instrumental!    The location is AMAZING right between the main taxi queue and the medina. Lyanna also helped us negotiate the right rate to get to la jardine majorelle.    The food is awesome - I can't believe breakfast was included - it is a beautiful mountainous spread of delicious breads spreads and delicacies.    The staff is incredible - so helpful kind thoughtful. We were always greeted with kindness and given everything we needed plus more.    The room was well air conditioned comfortable bed perfect blackout blinds and incredibly quiet. We were nervous we'd be awakened by the 6a call to prayer and never did it disturb our sleep.    Just when we thought we had it all we were sent off with beautiful gifts and a delicious lunch to go. Seriously amazing and so thoughtful.    We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay and highly recommend to our friends. Thank you Riad Dar Anika for a beautiful introduction to Marrakech we hope to come back and stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is absolutely the best place! I was in Marrakech about 10 years ago and I desperately tried to find the Riad I stayed at 10 years ago. Fortunately I couldn't find the prior Riad and we stayed at Riad Dar Anika.    The location is excellent the grounds are beautiful and the management and staff are the best. You are a short walk to the main square where you can find the chaos that is Marrakech. But then you can return to Riad Dar Anika and find peace and relaxation.    They gave us a cell phone in case we got lost and even walked us to a nearby restaurant as we couldn't figure it out on our own. They set up transportation from the airport and the price was in line with a normal taxi. The service was fantastic and I would highly encourage anyone to stay at Riad Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family
