Review_Text: Lovely little safe haven amongst chaotic Marrakech. Great staff who can't do more to help. Lovely setting and decor. Everything you need at your fingertips to make the most of your stay in Morocco. Thank you for having me
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: A million thanks to Lyanne and the team at Riad Dar Anika for making our stay unforgetable. It's truly a gem in the old town and we couldn't ask for more. Fantastic location great food brilliant team... We will definitely come back as we fell on love with the place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patrick D wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika was an incredible place to stay in Marrakech. The management and staff were exceptionally helpful warm and knowledgable. Hammam service was outstanding as well (off-site but short walk). The food was great for breakfast and the staff was so eager to make sure that we had a great experience. They provide a phone for use around the city (maps were huge!) and even packed us a lunch on our way out. They go above and beyond any hotel staff that I can ever remember. Thank you for an amazing stay!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Keith M wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Great in every way!!! Highly recommended!! Service was the best feature. Bed was great too. Super location near lots of places to shop and eat or wander. I would come back for sure and hopefully stay longer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: A wonderful experience! Lyanne and the rest of the staff were very friendly and couldn't be more helpful. They took care of everything including arranging a hiking trip to the Atlas mountains airport pickup and return restaurant recommendations and reservations drivers and taxis shopping advice etc. Lyanne guided me in getting a terrific deal on a quality carpet to bring home. Upon returning from an outing we were always greeted with a refreshing drink. The restaurant was outstanding (we ate dinner there twice) and the rooftop bar gave a spectacular view of the city as the sun went down. The entire facility was clean quiet and relaxing. It was clear that everyone from the owner on down took great pride in this Road. I give it my highest recommentation. You will not be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Outstanding resting place within minutes of the market.
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived to the moment we departed (with our lunch bags in hand!) we were treated like family - the staff could not have been more helpful pleasant and generous. Leanne in particular had excellent recommendations and insights about the city and country. Breakfast dinner and drinks on the roof top terrace were particularly pleasant especially after a busy day in the city. The hospitality was nothing short of outstanding - they made us feel as though we were at home! The location could not have been better -- this Riad is within 10 meters of a busy street where a taxi can be hailed - a short 5-10 minute walk in the opposite direction and we were in the heart of the Jemaa market. 6 stars if that was an option!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Was a little tricky tofind at first but easy after that . Well located and accommodating both room and staff. Close to main area of Marrakech restaurants and shopping and markets. Would definitely stay again.

This was the best place I’ve ever been to because right once you get to the place they treat you like you’re the only people staying they’re. They offer you cake everyday at least twicefor free then they give free slushees they change the flavor every day there is also so much to do in Marrakech but here’s some tips if young men in about there twenty’s come up to you and say hay it’s you from the Riad I can show you how to go on a beautiful hike say now cause if you say yes they will get you lost in the alleys and demand money for them to show the way out. And if they make you pay 500 to them don’t do it at most they need 100 there are lots of store just move on to the next and you’ll probably find it etc
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Stayed 4 nights so got to know the manager and staff. Leanne the Manager is excellent and caters to every need even sending out someone to get medication from the local pharmacy for us. Joe the restaurant manager is very attentive and runs a very classy but casual restaurant. Clean modern comfortable and centrally located this is a wonderful place to unwind and see the sights and sounds of Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael Makele wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Best customer service and Breakfast in Marrakech
Review_Text: The best customer service during our stay in Marrakech needs to go to Riad Dar Anika. From the moment you arrive they treat you like you are a VIP welcome drink and snacks detailed information about the souk and the surrounding areas ( Lyanne offers some very good advice )  booking restaurants walking you to the restaurant afternoon snacks in the bedroom you name it. Breakfast at Dar Anika cooked up by Saidat and Soufiane hit the spot every time. Their pancakes bread  cakes scrambled eggs and soup washed down with orange juice and Mint tea was outstanding. They really do know how to look after their guests.

Review_Title: Friendly, well located Riad, great find.
Review_Text: The hospitality at this Riad begins right after you book and extends past the time you leave. Simply put staying here enhances your visit to Marrakech rather than merely a great place to stay. The staff is unobtrusively warm. They provide advice assistance and guidance that are designed to help you enjoy your stay. There are many places where that type of service is designed to simply sell you something. Not so here. I received great advice about where to eat how to negotiate and practical advice on how to enjoy myself in an environment that is quite different than my own. The Riad itself is clean rooms well put together and facilities reflect their unique environment. The food is good and provides a great value for money. The staff at the Riad in both word and act let me know that they actually wanted me to have a good visit and to experience all that Marrakesh had to offer in a way that I would enjoy it.

Review_Date: Paul B wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Had a fantastic time in the Riad Dar Anika and would highly recommend it. The location is unbelievable and Lyanne was a superb host and gave us some great tips about where to go/ eat/ etc. The staff were excellent and breakfast was fantastic each morning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tangata haere wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: After a hectic time travelling around Morocco in a tour group our last stop was Marrakesh. It was a pleasure to stumble across this haven just by the square at Bab Mellah. Attracted by the Anika’s Kitchen sign we went in to be warmly greeted by none other than a fellow kiwi (New Zealander) Lyanne. It was such a breath of fresh air! All her staff were exceptional. They guided us to the rooftop where we has some snacks and cool drinks. We were so impressed that we booked dinner for that evening {and took along with us some other members of our tour}. The monk fish was “to die for” and the caramelised pears were worth a return visit. Lyanne was a kind and thoughtful host. They made us feel special at a time when we were tired and over travelling. Highly recommended and the best place we ate at in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We decided to treat ourselves towards the end of our trip and chose this restaurant for an evening meal based on trip advisor reviews we read - it did not disappoint!    Whilst the restaurant was quite empty when we arrived the atmosphere was lovely with live music and plants everywhere.    We ordered the chicken with vermicelli and beef fillet brochette. We were given warm bread and sauces (aubergine olive and cream cheese) as a complimentary appetiser which was really tasty. The main courses were faultless which we paired with the house white wine (reasonably priced) and followed with a mint tea (which came with small biscuits/pastries).    Overall the food was wonderful and some of the best we have eaten in Marrakech. Whilst not the cheapest (700 DH for the total bill) it was well worth it. If we were staying longer in the city we would definitely come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tim Kerr wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: I visited the Bar and Restaurant on the top floor of the Riad Dar Anika -to have a drink and relax after a day of exploring the Médinaand what a delightful retreat from the hustle of the streets below it turned out to be .I had a wonderful juice and some sweet biscuits on the rooftop Terrace overlooking the City and it’s charms below.  Great relaxing atmosphere to counteract the hectic character that is Marrakech.Thoroughly enjoyed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Maria L wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: So I don't have the time for reviews...two young children but I can't less this one slip away! This place blew me away and I will return to Morocco some day just to go back to this Riad. They welcome you here with all the tiny details which I happen to notice. They cleansed out hands with rose water upon entry checked us in with mint tea and cookies a bowl of fresh fruit in a comfortable air conditioned lounge. Then the gorgeous Riad itself welcomes you with flowers and decor the room was special because we were upgraded to a suite. The next morning I wasn't quite ready for breakfast and no joke was joyously greeting by the bartender with a coffee with fresh steamed milk and when I ordered two orange juices for my daughters to bring back to the room he hand squeezed fresh oranges and the server carried them back for me on a tray. 5 star service all around. Finally I'm not a big foodie but the breakfast later that morning blew us away just delicious. These Moroccon bread thingies with honey and fruit salad and homemade yogurt more fresh juice cakes coffees teas you name it if they could fit it on the table up on the veranda overlooking Marrakesh they did. Memorable stay. Can't wait to go back sans kids.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: From the moment I booked; to the weeks / days leading up to our arrival; the holiday itself; I could not complement enough the exceedingly high level of customer service. Pick up at the airport “tips and tricks” introductory meeting arranging trips providing mobile phone; exemplary customer service / focus. As for the accommodation it is truly beautiful. Staff go out of their way to make your holiday as relaxed and enjoyable as possible. I highly recommend this Riad. I will definitely come back here if I am in Morocco. Big thank you to Lyanne and the staff. You could not have been more welcoming.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Vicky B wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: This is my second visit to Dar Anika terrace restaurant. It didnt disappoint and we were welcomed with open arms from Joseph. We started the evening with cocktail and then had an assortment of savory pastries. All delicious flavours. I had a grilled seabass fillet (which was huge) and my friend the grilled chicken breast. There was nice acoustic music being played in the background while we were eating. I would definatly recommend this guest house to visit. I would go again with more friends next time i am in Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: There are truly no words to describe how amazing Riad Dar Anika is. My husband and I went here for our honeymoon and everyone went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed and ensure that our trip was perfect. The location is amazing and Dar Anika is a little oasis from the hustle and bustle of the streets. The breakfast everyday was delicious and we found ourselves with mint tea or watermelon juice in our hands at all times. What stands out the most though was the customer service and the little personal touches. Every single person was so kind helpful and an absolute delight. It was our pleasure to meet everyone and we will definitely be back one day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: wonderful riad with large and nicely decorated room. Beautiful inner courtyard to relax with a nice pool and sun terrace on top with jacuzzi. Super friendly and helpful staff. Perfect location right at the entrance of the souk but also just around the corner from the taxi stand which allows efficient sightseeing. Beautiful rooftop restaurant with excellent service try the lamb shoulder the best we’ve ever had! Also amazing birthday surprise with cake from patisserie des princes and beautiful flowers thank you again for wonderful days in your little gem!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We’ve just had an excellent and wonderful night at the restaurant of Dar Anika.  First we’ve got a very warm welcome from the staff in the reception and the restaurant.  The atmosphere in the restaurant at the rooftop is just amazing. During our diner a guy was playing traditional live music just great!  The waiters Mohammed and Karim were great. You could see that they followed some sort of an touristic school as they were high skilled in what they did. Serving wine and food.  The manager was very friendly and gave us advice choosing the correct diner.  Than the food itself. It was just amazing. Quality was as high as it can get in Marrakesh I would say the best in town.  We’ve had beef skewers and a tajine. Both were very delicious.  The wine was also very good.  I really like to recommend this restaurant it was a great great night! High class!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Shelsea Patton wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: This boutique hotel was simply amazing . I would definitely return . The staff make you feel so welcome and loved . They personalize your experience and tailor to your every need. The breakfast every morning is so delicious  from the coffee to the fresh omelette’s.    I felt so safe here and never even locked my door.    Rooms and common areas were decorated so beautifully . Our hotel was like a museum.    Every time we needed something the staff went above and beyond to make sure it was done ! Leann  the hotel manager made sure our trip would be a success upon arrival. She didn’t let us down !  Fadoua and Hind the receptionist Provided us with the most amazing restaurants to go for dinner and it was truly the best dining experience we ever had !    Ahmad and Hassan  the butlers wait on you hand and foot and will even walk with you to help find taxis and local shops! They were sooooo amazing .    If you are traveling to Marrakech don’t waste your time looking for anywhere else to stay. This is the best !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: LyAnne and her staff went over and above in the kindest ways to make certain we were completely taken care of during our stay! The Riad is beautiful the location perfect and the restaurant is wonderful. They did many little unexpected things for us each day which were gracious and helpful always with a smile and with friendly personal service.    LyAnne is amazing and makes herself available for any need like getting a taxi for you assisting with your restaurant reservations and she even packed us going-away gifts upon our departure. How very lovely our memories are! Definitely will return and recommend this Riad to all our friends! Hats off to LyAnne and her staff!! We appreciate all they did.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed here for three nights and couldn’t have been happier With this hotel. The staff always went above and beyond to make our stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. On arrival the manager Lyanne talked us through the local area and made some fantastic recommendations for lunches / dinners / days out. Our room was a lovely and clean. I noticed some reviews mentioned the rooms being on the small side but we didn’t find this to be a problem as we were rarely in the room. In fact our room was larger than I expected. Great location being on the edge of the medina. Would definitely recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent stay, perfect location, fantastic staff
Review_Text: We spent a wonderful week in Marrakech and one of the many reasons was our stay at the Riad Dar Anika. We felt like being at home surrounded by an extremely nice staff not to forget the director Lyanne Kerr who read all our wishes from our lips. Many thanks to all !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a beautiful Riad inside Medina. Hotel manager and staff super attentive and contented to every whim we had. Transport leaves you literally at their doorstep which is hard to find this makes it super easy and safe if you want to venture at night to restaurants or visit new town. Rooftop is an oasis and at night they have music and a chef who cooks very good. The rooms were very clean with local amenities that were great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A very delicious and refined dinner in a very pleasant setting.
Review_Text: Very pleasant reception and service. Food was absolutely delicious and so so refined.We had an amazing time and really enjoyed listening to very melodious Marrocan live music and chatting to restaurant staff who were beyond nice and made us feel so welcome. My partner loves eating meat and thought this was the best he's had in a long time and I don't eat meat and still I had a lot of choice. We will definitely go again!

Really a very nice experience in this wonderful Riad in Marrakech  Best food best service best humor in this restaurant 💯💯✅ I advice any guest want to visit Marrakech to go and test their food (italien chef in Moroccan restaurant)I guess you get it 🤪

The location of Dar Anika was perfect! It is located at the gate to the Medina and is within easy walking distance to may of the main sites. The staff were very helpful to recommend restaurants ... even providing us with cell phones in case we needed assistance (eg. got lost in the medina). A special thank you to the Manager Lyanne who couldnt have been more helpful or accommodating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Leaders in the hospitality business should really visit Riad Anika and Riad Kaiss for lessons in how to treat their clients. Everything from the greetings by staff the special attention provided by the General Manager Leann and Owner Abu and Narine (Riad Kaiss) was first class! Small touhces like packing light healthy snacks and large bottles of water for day tours or for transport back to Casablanca to having ones name written in Arabic as a departure gift to walking a client over to a local hamman to the well edited sleeping rooms and public gathering places to the food. I can't say enough about both locations. If you want a little less hustle and bustle stay at Riad Kaiss but expect high quality service and professionalism at both!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: A excellent peaceful hotel hidden away in the hussle and bustle of busy Marrakesh    Would recommend for a couples break..    Excellent restaurant..    Very helpful staff..    Would stay again if I was visiting Marrakesh
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have nothing but great things to say about this amazing Riad. From the moment we walked through the front door we were greeted with the most friendly and kind staff.  Upon arrival we were made aware of many things that we could/should see while visiting as well as many places to eat. The food/restaurant at Anika was wonderful. Each time we would come back from being out on a hot day wandering the Souks we would arrive to a staff member bringing us iced mint tea little cakes ect. This place goes all out for service for their guests. The manager of the riad is always making sure her guests are taken care of. We recommend this amazing experience to everyone. We are waiting to return. Thank you for this exceptional visit to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Dar Anika in May 2019 for 3 nights. So glad we did! The room was larger than I expected and the bed was very comfortable. The staff is so friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good (tea breads morracan pancakes omelette fruit and yogart). Every afternoon when we returned to the Riad they delivered fresh strawberry smoothies and a piece of cake. After a long day of exploring it was so appreciated. They also replenished 2 large bottles of water each day. LeAnn the manager went out of her way to meet us and chat. She even packed us a to go bag with sandwiches and fruit when we left for our 3 day journey into the desert. She is a lovely person and is doing a great job managing the hotel. The location was also very convenient. It was right at the end of a road that lead to the market. So it was easy to find our way home without getting lost a 10 minute walk. The best part of staying at Riad Dar Anika is the feel of being in Morocco. It's not your typical westernized luxury hotel. It was luxurious but in a Moroccan way. i would highly recommend staying here. You will not be disappointed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Riad Dar Anika - they went above and beyond their service to make our stay as warm & comfortable as possible. Lyanne was so personal & sincere with us that it truly made for the most impressionable Moroccan experience!  Couldn’t have been a better location!  Would highly recommend this gem of a Riad!  Kathy & Scott (from Canada)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The restaurant is situated on the top floor with a wonderful ambience and very good food. The restaurant has an Italian chief which we didn’t expect in Marrakesh. We had the chicken seefa and monkfish tagien which we recommend.- enjoy :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Mariela R wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Dar Anika is definitely a 10 stars Riad not just 5!  The place is absolutely beautiful clean and cozy. The location couldn’t be better. It is very well located close to everything which makes it very convenient to move around. The food was amazing and breakfast delicious. And last but not least the staff was incredible !! Lyanne The manager is unbelievably helpful she is in every single detail making sure you have a great time in Marrakech. All her recommendations were great and accurate making our stay and experience in Marrakech way more enjoyable and memorable. I highly recommend this Riad. My husband and I had a wonderful time at Riad Dar Anika thanks to Lyanne and her staff! We don’t have nothing but good things to say about this Riad.  THANK YOU ALL AGAIN!!  Mariela and Leo
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: i recently took a short trip to Marrakech and I had the pleasure to stay at Riad dar Anika .  The staff were wonderful  accommodating and a pleasure to speak to.  The owner treated us well and made sure we were happy and comfortable during our stay.  Food was consistently well prepared and truly delicious  I can wait to go back for more.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a great time at Dar Anika. The hotel is lovely but what really made our experience was the staff/ service. Lyanne was extremely helpful welcoming and made sure we were well looked after. We were shown all the main sites as soon as we checked in and we were given a mobile phone (local number) to use in case we needed it. We caught up with Lyanne every day and she made sure that we were safe and gave us great tips as to where to go prices to pay and what to expect!    Breakfast was fantastic and the staff were extremely attentive we really felt at home. We ate dinner at the restaurant one evening too and the atmosphere and food were perfect. I'd definitely recommend to other guests!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika was the highlight of our time in Marrakech. We stayed in 2 different rooms and both rooms were beautifully decorated and luxurious.     Breakfast every morning was incredible - plate after plate after plate of delicious wholesome food - we didn't need lunch most days! And we enjoyed the complimentary afternoon tea on many occasions too. We ate at the restaurant twice - also excellent - I'd recommend the restaurant on its own even if you're not staying at the hotel.     However the standout best thing about Dar Anika is the staff. We were really made to feel at home. Every single person we interacted with in the riad was genuine warm and thoughtful and it was clear to us that they truly care. It was like staying with family.     All in all a superb hotel that gets the small things right as well as the big ones. One of the best hotels we've stayed in anywhere in the world. Thank you all at Dar Anika for making our holiday so memorable!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Caroline G wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: During a recent trip to Marrakech me and my party visited this restaurant twice for dinner - both times without a reservation even though they were very busy we were made to feel very welcome. The menu was very good and the quality of the food excellent very large portions. We visit Marrakesh every year and will defiantly go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Hotel has an excellent management and great location in Medina - close to all of the markets/sukhs but is very quiet at the same time. We had a very warm welcome and during our stay we felt like at home staying 4 days with our daughter (10 years). We will definitely come back and can only highly recommend this hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Harry K wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: The hotel is located just out side of the souk. We were greeted warmly and offered a late morning breakfast. The concierge took care of all arrangements for us including restaurant reservations and a car to the airport. Americans would love this place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Adam Brunning wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Charming riad, with amazing staff and gorgeous food
Review_Text: A group of 8 of us ate here with the set menu. The food was incredible service fantastic and atmosphere stunning. The restaurant has a new chef whose food was superb. This is my second time to this restaurant and it didn’t disappoint.  It is well worth a visit booking is advisable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We just spend a couple of days in this lovely Riad. Lian and her team have been very welcoming and were helping us with everything we were looking for. The rooms are nicely decorated and clean. It's close to the central place (Djemaa el Fna) and the Bahia Palace. The rooftop bar is the place to relax after you spend a day in the Souk or you sign up for the Hammam at the Riad. We enjoyed dining at the Dar Anika Restaurant on the top floor. Nice variety of Moroccan and Italian dishes ( the chef is an Italian) that we enjoyed very much. Lian is clearly the soul of the place in her welcoming and warmhearted style. We liked every moment staying at Dar Anika!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Perfect hide-out in the Marrakesh madness
Review_Text: Great location in the Médina but easy to approach and to shift to Taxi/car. Lee Ann is the perfect host and fully support you in your personal escape if you need it! The patio and the rooftop are places to really rest an stay to recover.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Henry S wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: We LOVED our riad. The staff was exceptional - they catered to our every request including helping us with reservations restaurant recommendations tours and transport. Each person we met was so kind helpful and knowledgeable. We were also huge fans of the breakfast - so many delicious local treats. Would recommend to anyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Had a wonderful evening meal here at Dar Annika. Wonderful food served by friendly and attentive staff.The set meal was excellent with traditional Moroccan food and a very tasty selection of vegetarian dishes. Fantastic Mojitos made by JAMEL the best I've ever tasted! Highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Charming riad very committed and knowledge staff ised fruit juices (strowberry peaches) are superbed. Strategically placed within the medina we had there an unforgettable experience... there is the possibility to have a private hammam whcih we tried and enjoyed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kate K wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Our family (2 adults 2 teens) just had a lovely stay at Riad Dar Anika in Marrakesh. From the rose strewn beds to the afternoon tea we were truly pampered. The riad itself is a beautiful light filled place with marble floors and birds flitting in from the open ceiling. The restaurant on the third floor is exceptional (worth a visit even if you are not staying at the hotel) and the staff is extremely helpful including packing sandwiches for us for the plane ride. There is also a private terrace at the very top of the building where you can have a drink or catch a bit of sun. We highly highly recommend this riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Holly V wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Dar Anika is undoubtedly the best hotel that we’ve ever stayed in. Their service is out of this world. I was treated like a queen while staying here. The staff is so friendly hospitable and accommodating. Upon checking in you are welcomed with tea dates milk and cookies. Everyday when we got back to our room we were then greeted with frozen drinks and cake. When checking out they gave us gifts and packed a lunch for us to eat on the plane (which was exactly what we needed). I’ve never witnessed a hotel offer this kind of service before. I loved that they gave us a cell phone to use to call them if lost or to arrange a ride. Made me feel much safer and more comfortable while exploring a new city. We arranged several rides with them and it made our time there much easier. The rooftop is beautiful and the food was the best food we got in all of Marrakech. You have to try their brioutes - they’re amazing! The all-included breakfast was like a seven course meal with endless deliciousness. The pool was great and relaxing. We spent a bit more than we usually do to stay at Dar Anika and we are so glad that we did. It’s so worth the money and next time we go back to Marrakech we won’t even think about staying anywhere else. We miss Dar Anika already!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I can honestly say that of all the places we have travelled to around the world the hospitality and warmth of welcome we experienced at Riad Dar Anika was second to none. We stayed for 4 nights in March to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday and Lyanne and the team made it so special.    Even before our arrival communication was swift and very helpful arranging an airport transfer and for our room to be decorated for the birthday celebrations.    The briefing Lyanne gave us along with the local mobile phone with Google maps in case we got lost allowed us to have the confidence to explore this beautiful city whilst being aware of the areas to avoid and the scams to be on guard for.    The Riad itself is perfectly located just outsidethe medina - whether travelling on foot or via taxi with lots to explore within a short walk from the doorstep. As you can also see from the many photos on here it's beautifully decorated and with a rooftop terrace where you can find some peace and tranquility.    The food in the restaurant was excellent we enjoyed the traditional Moroccan breakfast but also had dinner a couple of times. The bar had not yet been finished during our stay but looked almost ready to open and am sure it would be lovely.    We also treated ourselves to a couples Hammam and massage both of which were excellent but the lady who gave us the Hammam was especially lovely.    Every single member of staff was excellent and really helped to make my wife's birthday celebrations special (including a gorgeous cake).    At checkout we were given a packed lunch for the journey home (which was delicious) and a small poster print with our names written in Arabic as a souvenir. Again lovely thoughtful touches that demonstrate the attention to detail Lyanne and the team offer.    Thanks for looking after us so well!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Neil A wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: A lovely old house located at the corner of the Jewish quarter next to the Jewish cemetery. Great location to start your walking tour of the markets an the Souk. The top floor is a well appointed roof deck. They offer an excellent selection of beer and wines. And the Gin and tonics are marvelous. The staff are very friendly and proved five star service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karl B wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: My wife and I spent 3 nights at the Riad. The staff was so friendly and made our honeymoon very special. The food at their restaurant was fantastic and breakfast was always a great treat. They even try to help you make sure you do not get too lost in the Medina by giving you a local cell phone. Location is perfect at the doorstep of the Medina. Can not overemphasize how nice the staff is would encourage anyone planning a trip to Marrakech to stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karishma A wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We absolutely loved our stay at Riad Dar Anika! Everyone was so welcoming and thoughtful especially Lyanne who made sure we felt like we were coming HOME rather than staying at a hotel. The restaurant manager as well as his staff were equally as hospitable and welcoming! I will recommend Riad Dar Anika to any of my friends who wish to travel to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Melissa H wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: I only want to stay here when I go to Marrakech!
Review_Text: I loved this place more than I can even say. From the moment we arrived they treated us like royalty with mint tea and hot towels. Every time we stopped in they would just bring us fresh juice and cake and olives. It was so lovely that we would end every day on the rooftop drinking wine and watching the people below. The entire place was beautiful s were all the people working there. It really felt like they were my friends by the time I left the riad. I would recommend this place to anyone going to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had a large room (room 6) with a king size bed which was v.comfortable. Large bathroom as well. Room 6 gives on the street so it can be a bit noisy in the evening (at night OK) and there is a mosque just in front of it so you can be woken up quite early (but that's part of the atmosphere too).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: 5 stars does not do this hotel justice. Our stay from start to finish was outstanding. The accommodation was beautiful with a gorgeous swimming pool and a terrace overlooking the Atlas Mountains. The staff were polite and went out of their way to accommodate us. Lyanne and Abu made our stay in Marrakesh wonderful they went above and beyond their duty to make us feel welcome as did the rest of the staff. Thank you so much!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Home from home filled with laughter
Review_Text: From the moment my daughter and I stepped through the door we were “home”. One of the many highlights was a chance to chat through what we wanted to do on our trip and for Bertille to then make the necessary reservations including a tuk tuk trip through the souks: crazy but wonderful. Our room was so comfortable the hammam pool and rooftop terrace were tranquility itself and nothing was too much trouble. The food was delicious and every single member of the staff family was fantastic. Little treats just kept appearing from afternoon cake to a farewell care package. Thank you so so much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Spent four nights at Riad Dar Anika. Great location super friendly staff and a just a really beautiful little place. Highly recommended.  Thank you Lyanne for all your love and care - all the best  Amund& Tanja + Geir&Silje
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: alison A wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Imagine arriving and having a hotel and its staff all to yourself. That's the welcome we received from the manager and staff at Dar Anika. No request was too small and the riad itself a beautiful oasis in an energetic city. Coming back in the afternoon to Morrocan tea after a hectic day was so relaxing. If you want an evening meal you won't find anywhere better in the city. The manager helped us with advice on local ways and went beyond what would be expected to make a great stay. Even providing us with a phone for reassurance for while we were out. Thankyou for making our holiday so enjoyable
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Service, Great Location, Great People
Review_Text: We highly recommend Dar Anika to anyone who desires a true riad experience when visiting Marrakech. The staff is highly competent attentive gracious and kind. Whether working with the staff to plan outings in Marrakech and its environs or simply relaxing on the terrace with a drink or enjoying a quiet tasty meal Riad Dar Anika proved a wonderful haven and well-situated home base in the Médina. We have traveled a good deal and cannot recall a single hotel with better people. The staff is an invaluable resource in terms of detailed advice and counsel on navigating Marrakech and the local culture and economy; providing a network of prompt polite and trustworthy local guides and drivers; and most of all a willingness to tailor our experience to our unique interests and desires. Highlights included savory Moroccan breakfasts afternoons out on the terrace with mint tea or a cold beer and always finding a bowl of fresh fruit and a plate of biscuits in the room. The rooms are small and windowless as is common inside the Médina. That said the garden atrium is open sunny and comfortable and you have other choices within the riad with a couple quiet indoor lounges tabes chairs couches on the first and second floor atriums and two small rooftop terraces from which to watch the bustle on the streets below. Finally Dar Anika is within a 10-minute walk from Katoubia Mosque Jemaa el Fna the souks the Kasbah and other key sites.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It was centrally located it was incredibly clean the staff was very welcoming accommodating generous and overall superseded all our expectations. The breakfast was beautiful and the staff accommodated our every whim. We were celebrating our anniversary for which the staff surprised us with a beautiful flower basket and a card with amazing wishes!!! We also celebrated our friends birthday and the staff surprised us with the birthday cake that was delicious!!! We occupied with our friends most of the Riad as there were 12 of us and all rooms were great they even surprised us with individually wrapped sandwiches on the day of our departure as they knew we will have a long day ahead of us traveling. We never requested it they just surprised us with amazing gestures which went above and beyond our expectations. It was an incredible stay!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My first impression when I got there was: Why did I pay almost 400 USD for a night here? I did not see the luxury that one usually expects when pays that much for a hotel room. However the real luxury of DAR ANIKA comes in the service in the people in the staff in the way they care about the guests. You really feel protected and embraced in that crazy Marrakech. There I felt like home. It is true that the rooms are not that large and does not have that luxury of Ritz Carlton but beds are super comfortable and there are so much other details that the Ritz does not has and that DAR ANIKA has. Everything is so cozy. Food is amazing. It is one of the few Riads that you can reach by taxi which is another luxury. I strong recommend this Riad. They will do anything to please you and that is priceless.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Denisa Z wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Absolutely unforgettable and spectacular stay and restaurant
Review_Text: Really amazing peaceful stay. Restaurant is absolutely spectacular and so is the food. TOP classdelicious and the head of the house Joseph was very welcomingknowledgeable made super comfortable. Great selection of delicious Italian cuisine and great Moroccan food.!!! Location is just perfect to relax and convenient to get to all important places. Rooms are very cleansuper comfortablespacious and lovely decorated. We will definitely return as soon as possible to enjoy this magnificent place!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pierce Howell Dargan wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Best part of our Marrakesh trip
Review_Text: We went to dinner at the restaurant while a very unseasonal thunder storm was hitting Marrakesh. They were amazingly prepared with external heating and covers for the windows. The food was really top class and the staff particularly the head of house Joseph were amazing. We will be coming back again when we revisit Marrakesh when there will hopefully be better weather.

Just went for lunch amazing setting to eat of the busy street made very welcome served alcohol👍the manager told us he’s new and they have a New Italian chef got a free sampler I ordered shrimp courgettes linguine it was great my wife had an beautiful steak with potatoes and veg👌They also have great Moroccan food. They gave us free mint tea and pastries. Would highly recommend👍
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Brilliant service at a peaceful gem in the madness of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed here for three nights from the moment we arrived we knew we had made the right choice. Lyanne (a very caring knowledgeable and clever lady)and her team couldn't do enough for us from arranging the transport from the airport sharing information on a map about where to go in Marrakech organising a guide for the first morning arranging a taxi to our next stop in the Atlas mountains the endless supply of mint tea to the completion of the forms for the airport and the food for our trip to our next destination. They really went over and above.    The rooms were clean and spacious the property is a cool and peaceful retreat from the madness of the streets of the Medina. It is conveniently located for the souks and main square and very easy to get to by taxi - some of the Riads are quite a walk from the nearest road and although some offer to cart your luggage to the Riad we had the luxury of being met from our taxi by Riad staff and being inside the Riad moments later.    As per a previous review we much preferred the Riad experience to the luxury large hotel. La Mamounia (which is just up the road) is lovely but quite sterile and clinical. At Riad Dar Anika you feel like you're in Morocco and because there are only 12 rooms the staff are attentive without being intrusive. It's unique and the personal touch makes this Riad stand out. We would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very special. A diamond in the rough
Review_Text: This was our favorite spot on our trip to Morocco. Best staff ever. It gave you a true flavor of Morocco.  Small and unique. Our friends stayed at the Mamounia a five stay elegant hotlel . We all agree we made the best choice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment we stepped in off the chaotic streets of the Médina we knew we had made the perfect choice of a hotel. The staff greeted us warmly and got us situated in our room very quickly. The room was lovely clean and well decorated! More important than anything was the fact that the manager sat down with us and instead of the normal let me tell you about the hotel she asked about us. Where we had been how are trip was going and what did we want to see while in Marrakech! She proceeded to help us plot out the next three days of Médina visits garden visits historic site visits restaurant choices and even shopping. She helped us map out the next three days so that we could both enjoy and maximize our stay. She is a gem!!!! While there the staff helped us get advance tickets so we didn’t have to wait in line at the gardens. The city is lovely the staff amazing but I’d go back just because someone expressed care and concern for us achieving what we wanted to achieve on our trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: this was a wonderful and gorgeous hotel with impecable service  the manager was the most caring woman they even packed up sandwhiches for us to take on the bus on the way to the airport  and also gave us shampoo as souvenirs
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Fantastic trip made even better by Dar Anika
Review_Text: We visited Marrakesh for 5 days and had a fabulous time. Dar Anika was really conveniently placed for the medieval town and also a welcome retreat from the hustle and bustle. Thank you to all the staff especially Lyanne for making it a wonderful break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Heading to Marrakech? Then Riad Dar Anika is our Number 1 recommendation.    Perfectly located within the medina it’s the ideal location to explore this fascinating city. Managed by the wonderful Lyanne the staff of the Riad take care of all your needs. From the welcome drink and tour around the facilities to the rose petals beautifully arranged in the bedroom and the loan of a mobile phone to call for a pick-up should your sense of direction go astray in the labyrinth of souks.    Lyanne’s tips for navigating the city and her concern for guests’ well-being are both outstanding. The rooms are beautiful the breakfast a true Moroccan feast and the rooftop terraces a delight to escape the hustle and bustle - the perfect place to enjoy a book or the views across the city to the distant Atlas Mountains. Or alternatively try the tranquil pool at the heart of the Raid for warming relaxation. And on departure completely unexpected gifts to add to our memories of a wonderful stay.    We’re delighted to give Riad Dar Anika an unqualified five star rating. Why haven’t you booked already!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Totally satisfying stay: beautiful, comfortable, with most thoughtful helpful service
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed three nights at Riad Dar Anika and found it an oasis of beauty and comfort in the bustling medina. The interior Moroccan courtyard is graced with beautiful tile floors trellised roses high quality Moroccan furnishings and a welcoming warmth. The manager is usually nearby graciously helping with advice even walking Susan to a cash machine when are usual one was not working. Staff were consistently gracious and helpful. A quality breakfast was included in the upper floor restaurant overlooking the courtyard with other views over the medina.    This oasis was especially valued as the narrow ways of the medina full of pedestrians are constantly disrupted by motor skooters some respectful of pedestrians some not. All the more reason to value this lovely tranquille hotel situated within walking distance of major monuments and the fine textile museum in the medina.    We especially liked our room number 8 which was separated from the lobby courtyard by a door and hallway leading to our room door.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dane H wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Your Must Book for a Riad
Review_Text: Unparalleled service with amazing location. Riad Dar Anika is hard to beat! Enjoy the complimentary snacks and mint tea and whatever surprises the staff has in store for you. Breakfast included is a huge plus as you need energy for all the sightseeing and adventures while in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sabir T wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Marrakesh and our stay at Dar Anika was our last stop on a 2 weeks journey across Morocco and wow what an end! This Riad just blew our expectations away. From the level of personal service to attention to details and thoughtfulness at every level. my wife and I were awed. We are discerning world travelers who pick particular boutique hotels to enhance our cultural experience so we were ecstatic to be here. Best in authentic as elegant decor! Best in service! Best in placement! Best in hamam! Best in massage! This winner takes it all! Thanks l you Leanne hind fadwa Hassan adil and all of you who left a lasting impact in our Marrakesh experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of serenity in the Medina
Review_Text: My daughter and I spent 8 nights at dar Anika and I can’t imagine a better place to stay in all of Marrakech. Not only is it well situated—just off a square and near a taxi stand—the riad is beautiful. In fact it is so beautiful and comfortable that we spent almost as much time relaxing in the riad as we spent sightseeing! The rooftop bar-restaurant offers an amazing breakfast (orange juice eggs Moroccan crepes and breads fruit yogurt coffee cake and tea or coffee) and when we returned to the riad late afternoons we were offered tea and cake in the courtyard. The staff is amazing! The manager Lyanne is so warm and personable that I felt I was saying goodbye to a dear friend by the time we left. The rest of the staff is equally friendly and caring anticipating our needs and doing everything possible to make our stay memorable. I miss them all and hope I’ll have the good fortune to return to Marrakech—and dar Anika—again someday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Stresa Apt wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: From the moment we walked in the door and were welcomed with rose water dates and tea to the sad farewells Dar Anika was truly perfect in every way. In the ideal location for both the Medina and the new City this Riad was our refuge from the overwhelming excitement of the streets of the Medina. We loved relaxing on the two roof terraces one with sun loungers and the other with tables for dining the restaurant with live music our room just wow! and especially how comfortable the staff led by the amazing Lyanne made us feel. Marrakech can be intimidating but staying at Dar Anika made it all an incredible experience. And visually it is just beautiful. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Dah Anika is a sparkling gem in a sea of stones. The traditional Morroccan beauty this Riad holds is a treat for the eyes - to say the least. Having stayed in many Riads in Marrakesh this was by far my all time favourite. I've never been treated so well by such friendly and accommodating staff. The rooftop was by far my favourite spot. A beautiful sun trap situated above the buildings with a view that will leave you mesmerised. Whether for business or leisure Riad Dah Anika is the Riad for you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: I have stayed at Dar Anika before and I have just returned from yet another fantastic stay here for 4 days which means it is only right to leave another review as my experience just gets better and better!! I cannot express enough how beautiful this Riad is and how warm and friendly all of the staff are here! Thank you again for making myself and my partner feel so at home for all of the recommendations to go and places to see etc.  Breakfast is fantastic Moroccan tea is a dream and the restaurant is the best atmosphere. Totally obsessed- must stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great location with gorgeous interior decor. The members of staff all of them are brilliant. They care that you are comfortable well fed and have everything you need. All the great things people have written about Dar Anika are completely true. If you are visiting Marrakech you must stay here or go to eat in the restaurant at the very least.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our 3 days stay here was fabulous we were well looked after from our arrival.A friendly porter was waiting to help us with our bags to the Dar. Lyanne and her staff welcomed us with genuine warmth. The rooms are clean and its evident that the hygiene standard is very high. All the staff in the Dar are warm and ever willing to help and assist us. We were given a mobile phone Incase we got lost a very thoughtful and smart guesture. We HIGHLY recommend this wonderful piece of heaven in Marrakech for those looking for a home away from home. we could not fault the hotel in any way as everything was perfect. Little gestures like in room fresh fruit n cookies serving coffee n cake after a tour ice crushed fruit whn it’s warm milk n dates at night. Infact we kept comparing all the other places we stayed at to Dar Anika’s high standard of hospitality and efficiency.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of tranquility in the melee of the Medina
Review_Text: This is an incredibly well run small hotel offering comfortable beautiful surroundings with excellent staff and service. Stepping off the street from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech into a tranquil quiet oasis if you’ve never been believe me is something that you need. The restaurant too is very good. Breakfast is excellent and served when you want it. The staff couldn’t have been more welcoming or helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It’s been said many times on here but the service is impeccable we were looked after in 5star style from beginning to end. The room was lovely the dining area and sitting areas a delight cake and tea in constant supply 😊  We ate here three nights which was wonderful but you must try the sister Hotel Riad Kaiss for dinner a wonderful experience.  We came here for my 50th and can not be more pleased with everything.  Thank you Leanne Hint and all the staff.  Also a special mention for Ismail at Kaiss for a wonderful evening.  👍
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nils K wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Lovely Riad in the heart of the city
Review_Text: We girlfriend and I had an awesome 4 nights stay at Dar Anika and would definitely recommend the hotel and stay here again.    The entire team around Lyanne was super accommodating from changing us to another more silent and bigger room to buying us suncream bringing us a small snack in the afternoon and handing us a small care package for our flight back home.    The hotel was in a great spot & busy but still silent inside. The restaurant was excellent so we enjoyed a great breakfast every morning on the rooftop and had a great dinner upon arrival.    The rooms are small but have everything they need. Also they are super clean. Windows to the courtyard are not the best noise cancelation but since there are only a few rooms it is almost never noisy.

Review_Date: Kait H wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Everything we wanted our stay to be!
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is everything we wanted our stay in the Medina to be…and more! The location is excellent so if you’re looking for a place that melds convenience and hospitality look no further. Situated right on the edge of the old souk it’s close enough to make the highlights of Marrakech all completely walkable but far enough “out” to be quieter at night and a serene refuge at night or during the day. Lyanne is the epitome of what a good manager should be and her attention to detail willingness to help and overall wonderful attitude are such a gift for travelers. Definitely take her up on looking at a map together because she gives great insight on what to see do and most importantly - what to skip or avoid. The staff goes above-and-beyond and if you’re worried about getting lost the riad provides a local cell phone that has Google maps. It worked great! We loved the breakfast (it’s majorly filling!) the afternoon mint slushy drinks relaxing in our room in between souk shopping and the afternoon chocolate and raspberry cake (YUM!). We would definitely come back to Riad Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: There is not much I can add to the many glowing reviews of this place other than an exclamation point (!). I’m generally skeptical of places that have so many positive reviews. I’ve been gamed by TripAdvisor. But in this case I would say they are deserved.    I travel frequently as I have done my entire adult life. Every passport I have ever owned required extra pages. I’ve had the pleasure of staying in many of the finest hotels in the world as well as everything else from rustic lodges B&Bs yachts tents to hostels. The essential quality I look for and that makes me want to come back is do I feel at home? I have an eclectic list of places that I return to for that reason - the Park Hyatt in Tokyo the Pulitzer in Amsterdam the Oriental in Bangkok Greywalls in Scotland. There are others but those come to mind.    I felt that sense immediately when I walked into Dar Anika and it was amplified as I interacted with the many kind people who work there.    If you want a comfortable relaxing spot in an ideal location where all your needs will be cheerfully met look no further. If you want a big fancy hotel with a big screen tv on the wall then keep looking. I for one will look forward to my return to this my new home in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: This was our second stay at Dar Anika.The email correspondence from the hotel was again prompt & efficient from reception.We received a warm traditional welcome upon arrival.The room we shared was immaculate and cleaned and refreshed daily. This time we decided to take in the souks and chat with the locals about their produce. We came home with spices and remedies and Lyanne was kind enough to source us some mint tea. A visit to Bahia palace provided good photographic opportunities.Our favourite place to escape to was ' le Jardin secret'. This is a gem of a place with a roof terrace serving lunch. We ate at Dar Anika for 3 evenings ( complete with delicious food and soft live background music) & also experienced the hammam with a lovely lady who works very hard in hot and humid conditions to make your skin feel wonderful! My son was keen to watch a football game one evening. We thought he had ventured out but found him in front of a cosy open fire watching the game; the evening staff found him the correct Tv channel so he would not need to go out and find a bar. We left early on our last day and were given a packed lunch for our flight home. One regret before leaving was that we didn't make enough use of the sun terrace.It is clear that Dar Anika staff are carefully chosen to provide guests with a service that cannot be faulted. With best wishes to Lyanne and staff we look forward to our next visit and cannot thank you all enough for a seamless trip from start to finish.

Review_Date: Konstantin B wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: A combination of a perfect location a beautiful building immaculately decorated and a considerate and attentive owner makes this a rather flawless experience. The owners have carefully anticipated any challenges you might face out in the city and carefully adapted to them - which ranges from offering an island of tranquillity away from the markets to detailed local advice how and when to best approach an activity to an almost telepathic ability to appear with free cake and drinks exactly when needed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Geir F wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Excellent service in nice hotel at a great location!
Review_Text: Lovely atmosphere. Situated close to the markets. Even though it’s located in a busy street the atmosphere inside is tranquil. Eating breakfast at the rooftop at sunrise is a must. The staff is friendly speaks in general English well and is extremely service minded. The concierge service at front desk is applicable. The manager takes care of you like you were a king -from you arrive till you leave. We will happily come back. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Absolutely loved every minute of it!
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika for four days and absolutely loved every minute of it!  Lyanne and her excellent team makes you feel at home the second you enter their beautiful courtyard - we immediately felt at home.  The place is like an oasis in the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh – and it’s only a short walk away from Djemaa El Fna where all the action is.  Coming back to Dar Anika after a day in the busy souks is just what you need – they rock up with homemade cake and smoothies to get the dust out of your system.  The rooftop restaurant makes for an excellent start to the day enjoying the view while indulging in Moroccan pancakes fresh fruit and coffee. And if you don’t want to stroll to far at night the same rooftop restaurant serves excellent local wines and dishes.  The attention to detail by Lyanne and her crew was just amazing – they even made us a delicious lunch bag for our trip home.  We’ve travelled a lot – and it’s not often that we’ve felt so much at home so far from home. Dar Anika gets nothing but our warmest recommendations. And next time we visit Marrakesh there is no doubt about where we’ll be staying.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent, Friendly Riad with good location and nice rooms
Review_Text: Location: Next to Bab Mellah which meant easy to get in and out of the city for tours and to find taxis  Staff: extremely helpful and kind both in reception in restaurant at Hamam etc. Their Manager Lyanne was a star both with guests and personnell
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: kristee n wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Amazing Property and would recommend over and over again!!
Review_Text: We absolutely adore and love Riad Dar Anika. Everyone made our stay feel so homey and special . The service was attentive personal and consistent. We love the house manager as she welcomed us so warmly and provided such amazing welcoming service. The overall staff were knowledgeable  professional and swift to attend to needs/requests. We were even provided with a local cell phone with the speed dial and direct texting to the riad front desk which was an incredible touch to facilitate getting around the city  making dining reservations or simply with any general questions. Riad Dar Anika made our stay in Marrakech even more special memorable and amazing. The Riad feels intimate and almost another worldly once you go past the friendly door man through the wooden doors. The ambiance is perfect with a homey feel where tea and snacks are available at your leisure. The rooms are cozy and comfortable with great cleaning and daily turn down service. I can't say enough great things about this place. Definitely a must if you find yourself in Marrakech-- and is there to rescue you should you find yourself feeling any discomfort in a foreign  chaotic but ever so vibrant and lovely city of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Incredibly good service, beautiful place, great location
Review_Text: Stayed a couple of nights in late Feb 2019. The service was incredibly good right from the start. We got a elaborate presentation of the hotel amenities the city and the main sights and places to visit. The personnell was all the time one step ahead and thinking our best. An excellent example was when we had done some sightseeing and returned exhausted to the hotel they prepaired and brought us cold drinks and some snacks already before we had even gathered enough strenght to go to the bar to order these.  We recommend the place highly and will definitely revisit the place when ever in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Spent an idyllic few days at this wonderful Riad. Situated close to the main square in the busy Medina but an oasis of calm. Leyanne the super efficient but charming and relaxed host makes sure your every wish is catered for. We would love to return .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We just LOVED our stay! The accommodations are beautiful and quaint. The service is exceptional--lead by a very caring and genuine host Lyanne. Where else in the world does the manager buy you drink on an exquisite terrace overlooking a breathtaking city and get to know your story? Where else in the world would the manager (Lyanne) walk you to dinner through the maize of streets through the medina so you don't get lost. Where else in the world do you get a personalized hand written note on your bed of roses before you go to bed? Then make sure that when you leave you are all set with details for your flight-- customs form filled out lunch packed etc. The setting on the rooftop is so inviting we met other travelers and enjoyed the evening getting to know their stories... and of course Lyanne added to that experience as well. Food was exceptional was well. This Rial is not only the ABSOLUTE BEST in Marrakesh-- but the BEST ON THE PLANET! It may even be a reason to travel back to Morocco!! THANK YOU Lyanne and team!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: George Stephens Jr. wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: My sister just left Marrakech. We stayed at Dar Anika hotel and absolutely loved it. It’s in a great location charming and the attention to details and client service is unmatched. I would strongly encourage you to book a room in this property. You’ll love Lyanne - the GM.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We spent four nights at Riad Dar Anika and recommend it very highly indeed! Lyanne and the team looked after us so well it really felt like a home from home. Here's a few reasons why we'll be going back..  - Location is right on the entrance to the Medina.... everything is on your doorstep no schlepping in from afar (like you will at Mamounia etc)  - Few rooms but very well staffed so they all know you by sight arrange your attraction tickets in advance (no queueing) book restos taxis walk with you to show you where to get money or even where your restaurant is book the best guides and there is always a complimentary mint tea and cake to hand.  - Roof terrace with sun loungers and wonderful panoramic views. Extra smaller roof terrace for romantic night cap views of the bustle below and skyline.  - Comfortable surroundings with heated pool sitting room and each bedroom is very individually and well appointed.  Really is the best option. Thank you to all!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: What a beautiful location for a tea break in the afternoon. Beautiful location nice views from the rooftop terrace of the markets and to people watch. Very friendly staff. Beautiful accommodations and well priced menu. We would definitely recommend stopping in.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Amy W wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika for three nights. Lyanne was the most amazing hostess from the moment we arrived. She really set us up for a great trip in what can be a very challenging city. All the staff was incredibly accommodating and the Riad is clean and classy. We enjoyed many meals from the roof decks looking out over the hustle and bustle. Highly recommend this perfectly located Riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I have just returned from a six day stay at this fabulous small riad in Marrakech and can highly recommend it. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were bathed in a warm welcoming ambiance that made our first trip to this fascinating spot a memorable and wonderful experience. The hotel is small intimate and very special. The food is delicious (we had to push ourselves to eat out elsewhere occasionally!) the staff are incredibly friendly helpful yet never intrusive. They genuinely want you to enjoy your stay and spoil you regularly with mint teas cookies... cakes. Breakfast is delicious and sets you up perfectly for a day of activity. If you're looking for a very special place to stay where you can relax and withdraw to when the frenetic pace of Marrakech's teeming city gets a bit too much this is it. Thank you so much dear Lyanne for taking such great care of us! Hope to make it back one day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed 4 lovely nights with our 3 month old baby and were well received by the staff who were kind and thoughtful. The Riad itself is perfectly formed and peaceful and it truly deserves the praise it has received in other reviews. Thank you Lyanne Fadoua and staff for such a nice stay. I did actually eat the sandwiches you made us for the airport! See you next time
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Philippa Smith wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: We just returned from a lovely 4 night stay. The team led by the wonderful Lyanne couldn't have been more helpful. They made us feel so welcome and at home and ensured we saw the best of Marrakech. The service is exceptional. The rooms restaurant and roof terrace are beautiful - a real haven within the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sherri L wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Wonderful service and facilities. Over the top concern that our entire trip to Morocco was perfect.Best Raid of the 5 that we used while in the country. They gave us a local cell phone to use in case we got lost or had trouble. Would highly recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fabulous riad to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: Dar Anika is still in my heart after stayed here for 2 nights last week. I got very warm welcome from friendly staffs and the riad is so beautiful. The room is spacious ans peaceful that make me feel very comfortable. The staffs were very nice whenever you met them. They have such a great service-minded attitude that they can give you a perfect recommendation when you need to go anywhere or do anything in Medina. It is in a great location that is close to many places we need to visit. The breakfast is excellent with a great service. I would recommend you to stay at this riad. Thanks Dar Anika for giving such a nice experience during my stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I have just returned from a 3 night stay in this beautiful riad. From the second we arrived the staff were welcoming and attentive to much more than our needs. Nothing was too much for them! The riad itself has a real Moroccan feel is spacious and homely. The food and amenities were perfect and the hammam/massage relaxing. I would definitely stay again. Great location!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Alexandra E wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: One of the most stunning hotel I have been too : the setting in the Medina  with it's peaceful environment  it's decor  the personnel  everything about this hotel screams traditional Moroccan heritage .  I cannot stop thanking the administration for their help their tips an their warmth.  One of the most beautiful hotels to go !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Emily Porter wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Dar Anika was perfect! The riad is absolutely beautiful the staff were so friendly and helpful and the breakfast was awesome! It is a haven of calm when you need a rest from exploring the souks. The roof terrace is a great place to have a drink and enjoy the evening sunshine. The location is great easily walkable to the centre of the Médina and to the new town. We did Hammam organised by Dar Anika which was wonderful can’t recommend it enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: High end boutique hotel in Marrakech
Review_Text: I stayed here for 2 nights last weeks. We got a very warm welcome from the first second until the last one from the hotel staffs.They tried to do everything to impressive customer which I never met before. I recommend Riad Dar Anika to everyone who would like to find the heart felt service.  Strong positive:  Service DecorationLocation and shower gel(wonderful)  Little negaive:  Room with no view Bathtub with too short glass barrier so quite wet after bathing
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Erin F wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Stunning - Will Make Your Marrakech Stay
Review_Text: We absolutely loved our stay here. The Riad is gorgeous with spacious rooms a pool and private Hammam. The staff is amazing you truly get treated like family and royalty. They go the extra mile to ensure you’re always comfortable as well as take the time to get you accustomed to the area so you know where to go and can always call should you get turned around with the cell phone they provide you. The food wonderful we had dinner in one of the room top areas to watch the sunset and see the bustle of the street breakfast is amazing too you will certainly be satiated to start your day. The location is perfect your 15 minutes from the souks 5 min from the palace and about a 20 min walk from the “new” city. We will absolutely come back to Marrakech but we will only stay at Riad Dar Anika for the exceptional experience we had with them
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John B wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: We decided to take our short break in a Riad in the heart of the Medina rather than one of the hotels in the newer part of Marrakech a decision completely vindicated by our excellent stay at Dar Anika. This Riad has all the facilities of one of the swankier hotels but what sets it apart is the service and attention to detail offered by Lyanne and her dedicated friendly team nothing was too much trouble. The staff anticipated our needs and provided some fabulous extra touches to make our stay very special. The food was excellent offering local dishes and so well prepared we ended up eating there every evening.  Sipping drinks on the roof terrace overlooking Marrakech as the sun sets with the muezzin calling was magical.    If you go to Marrakech and want to stay at a Riad this is definitely the one to choose you will not be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dave S wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Wonderfual Riad and staff in heart of Marraheck
Review_Text: Centrally located near entrance to the Souk and steps from a taxi stand. Beautifully appointed. Hind and staff were wonderful especially since we had to rebook after failure to make it March 2018 due to weather (at no extra cost). Abou the manager mapped out various areas of interest on arrival spending at least 30-40 mintues a warm wonderful man. Also packed us a lunch for our trip to Fez on departure! Highly recommended great service! We had a modern beautiful Riad in Fez and though 5 star it did not compare to the Dar Anika where we felt part of the family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A superb wellcome with tea rosewater a wet cloth and a guide. We Got our own fone so we could Always get in touch with the staff. The staff is Always helpfull and in front. You feel very safe and taken Care off.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I visited Riad Dar Anika for a short holiday and it was an amazing experience. The staff are all very friendly and the service is impeccable. The hotel is also close to shops and sights. Definitely recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Lisa Martin wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Great service from the team. From when you were first welcomed to the hotel and I realized we had lost our phone charger to when our airport transfer company (separate company) was late the team did whatever they could to help us. They also give us a great idea of what to see in the city in a short stay and the restaurant there was great as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Stop looking and book this place!
Review_Text: We travel a lot and stay in good hotels but rarely do we stay in a place where we’re treated like royalty and a treasured family member at the same time like we were at Dar Anika. The attention to detail and personal touches overwhelmed us. My husband’s 50th birthday was made all the more special because of the staff. We can’t recommend this place highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Dar Anika is not only in a great location in Marrakech it is also a perfect and quiet getaway from the hustle and bustle of the souks. The staff were incredibly helpful and thoughtful going out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. We would highly recommend Dar Anika for anyone looking to stay at a smaller place and to have a more intimate experience (getting to know the staff enjoying the shared spaces etc.) This is a Riad not to be missed if you're passing through Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great ambience smallish rooms compared with typical modern hotels. Clean and very quiet at night in what initially could be perceived as a noisy part of town. Staff is exemplary and attentive. Drinks and good food is served upstairs also. Well located for exploring the old part of town.
