They loan you a mobile phone in case you get lost which is easily done in the Souks. Don’t miss out on the large square for the nighttime activities a short walk from the Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Traveling extensively around Morocco in my acquisition of carpets this ryad is is by far my favorite. The rooms elegant the meals tremendous the staff more than accommodating. Lyanne and her wonderful coworkers Bertille Fadoua et al have always assisted my stay providing for my comfort and concerns. They have welcomed me as family into their “home”. If a knowledgeable English speaking driver was needed an early morning breakfast before an international flight or a sudden change of plans they have made it work; always with understanding and the willingness to make the customer happy.  You will not find better in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: The staff at Dar Anika is extremely friendly and helpful the rooms are nice and clean (although a bit loud on the first floor) the food was delicious and the location is great. I would highly recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a nice stay at Riad dar Anika. The service was very good and the staff very kind. We received usefull information about the city restaurants beautiful buildings etc... The hammam was also pleasant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely staff and common areas but costly for quality of rooms
Review_Text: We stayed for 5 nights during holidays. The location is very good at the entrance to the Medina and near a taxi stand. The staff is lovely and the food in restaurant is very good.    The rooms are decorated beautifully but our room was the size of a interior cabin on ship and the bathroom was even smaller. That would be OK if the price was commensurate but it is not. This room was 302 euros per night.    This was our fourth trip to Morocco and we have stayed in several riads so I know what other riads offer in terms of room sizes and costs.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Excellent service. Antonio and his staff is top notch. They were very helpful in getting reservations for dining transportation etc. Food was great. Riad location is very central. They truly think of every way to make your trip enjoyable. We had 3 rooms.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Richard K wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: The Riad That Grew On Us
Review_Text: This Riad is ideally located in the Medina but right on the edge so there is no chance of getting lost in the myriad laneways(unless of course you can't find the correct entrance).It was easy to walk to almost everything of tourist interest. On entering the Riad we were first welcomed into a lounge area where Sarah the delightful and very friendly French staff member greeted us and gave us a little talk on how things ran.  There is a lovely small pool in the covered courtyardpossible to swim or paddle in it but never saw anyone actually attempt it. We were then shown to our room and we were instantly shocked and disappointed at how small it was albeit nicely furnished with flower petals strewn over the bed as a welcome.There was not even a window in the room. We decided it was impossible to stay here for 3 days and asked if we could move to another room.Not easy as every room was booked.Nevertheless they magically found another room on the first floor which it turned out was reserved for other guests who had not arrived.We moved there and although not that much bigger it did have a window and we were happy to accept this.    The staff were constantly apologetic and on the second day the manager arrived and offered us a huge compensation which we did not think was right to accept.Everyone on the staff was so kind and by this stage we did not want to hurt their feelings and because of their attitude we were really enjoying the ambience.    On the rooftop there was a pleasant open air restaurant where we had a very good dinner and each morning had breakfast served there. Nothing was too much trouble for anyone and tea or coffee and cakes were available every afternoon-just ask and it was made for you.    By the time we left we were having such a good time we wouldn't have moved anyway    A special experience in a country where everyone showed such kindness ..    Thank you to Sarah and all the staff for making this such a memorable event. Sincerely Rick and Mario

We have stayed at quite a few really fine hotels in many different countries in the world Riad Dar Anika is hands down the best and most memorable we have stayed at. In fact we checked out this morning and already we find ourselves missing the hotel! We became quite attached to the lovely riad and mostly its amazing staff! The riad might not be the most luxurious but it offers many personal touches the best service and most genuine hospitality!    The riad is so wonderful thanks in a great part to its amazing manager Antonio. As other reviewers have pointed out Antonio would meet with his guests upon check in to provide a really helpful overview of the riad. He would also offer great tips on touring in Marrakech. He's genuinely kind helpful and never pushy. He even offered us recommendations on restaurants in Marrakech for dinner when Riad Dar Anika itself has one of the best restaurants in town. I was quite blown away when he gave us a local cell phone with his phone number programmed in the phone and easily accessible. Even though we never ended up using the phone it was such a nice gesture and offered us a great peace of mind.    We also enjoyed our room (room 1). It was lovely decorated and spacious (for three). There were always fresh fruits and water in the room. All the staff members were warm lovely and really kind. The warmth hospitality and care we received were truly genuine. The official breakfast (which was super nice) starts at 8 but on a couple days when we needed to leave early the restaurant staff would be there early to prepare breakfast just for us. At least one of the waiters I noticed was serving dinner the night before till late and had to get up so early to serve us. We had never experienced this kind of service and accommodation anywhere else before!    The hotel location is excellent right in the medina with a 5-minute walk to the Square a 10-minute walk to the Saadian Tombs and a 5-minute walk to the Jewish quarter.    The hotel is very green which is very important to me. They offer great quality argan oil soap body wash shampoo and conditioner all in re-fillable containers which is fantastic. I hate all the wastes we experienced at other hotels.    Finally this morning when we checked out really early Mr Antonio was there in person to see us off and to offer us a bag of sandwiches and fruits for the road because we had to leave so early. I was so moved that I was tearing up!! We loved our first visit to Marrakech but what truly sealed our experience of this great city is the care and hospitality we experienced at Riad Dar Anika!!!! We really hope to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Francesco G wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Excellent from all points of views
Review_Text: We chose this Riad for our holiday in Marrakech due to the great reviews here on TripAdvisor. As they are all pretty good our expectations were high. I admit that the Riad managed to exceed them.    Everything worked fine. Antonio the director meets personally each guest and provides good overview of the city a map and even a mobile-phone to avoid to be lost in Marrakech. He and the staff is really aiming to help the guests/customers but it's not the usual "help to sell". When we arrived we had already excursions booked on our own and the staff helped us calling the tour operators for confirmation.    We had a request for our room and it has been managed in the same day. When we left they made us few small gifts.    Concerning the Riad itself it's in a perfect location at the end of the city center 2 minutes walk from a roundabout and 5-10 minutes walk from the main square of Marrakech. The rooms are beautiful kept in care at every corner and with all the possible comforts.    For the breakfast the first day we have been a bit disoriented. We were expecting a buffet but when we entered there was no trace of it. Long story short the breakfast is the same for all the guests and it's delicious. It's a traditional Moroccan breakfast including among others an omelette bread orange juice yogurt cake etc. Honestly it's a lot and it's all good.    If you are reading this review to search the right place to stay in Marrakech look no further you found it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Magnus L wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Safe and calm right in the medina
Review_Text: In Dar Anika you are close to everything important to see or do in Marrakech. The staff and the management is extremely helpful whatever needs you have. For instance we were given a local smart phone with a "hot line" to both the hotel and the manager which was much appreciated.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A beautiful gem of a hotel in a great location. The staff was very helpful in every way. We felt very well cared for! Wonderful staff strong Wifi delicious cuisine and a really great breakfast. You will really enjoy this lovely spot.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: If I could give this review more than 5 stars I would.  The location was absolutely perfect close to a lot of the main sites and a short walk to the main square. It's right at the edge of the Medina which means taxi's and transfers for trips can pick you uo from the Riad instead of having to walk to a different location. It feels like a complete oasis of calm away from the crazy hustle and bustle of Marrakech outside.  Our room as clean nicely decorated and a great size for our 5 night stay. If we ever arrived back to the room during the afternoon we were welcomed with cake and a lovely iced strawberry drink delivered to our room.  On check in we were given a map lots of handy tips and recommendations as well as a phone with internet and marrakech sat nav! Amazing.  The breakfast was great although due to arranging early morning trips we only had breakfast twice during our 5 night stay. Restaurant staff were wonderful.  The service and staff was the best I have ever encountered. Always happy to help smiling nothing is too much trouble. I would happily recommend this riad to any family or friends looking to stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A wonderful small riad with superb friendly service
Review_Text: We stayed 3 nights and eat in 2 nights. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel at home with superb service and a very homely feel in luxurious but characterful surroundings. We eat twice in the restaurant which was excellent as was the breakfast. A real find. Even on leaving we were unexpectedly given a bag of food with packed lunch to see us on to our next stop.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in November. We would rate the décor and service very highly although we didn't get the 5 star treatment some of the other reviewers received i.e. no phone and not many instructions about getting around. However the staff were very attentive. The breakfast was a bit minimalistic compared to other establishments on our 14 day tour. An omelette or a boiled egg was an extra! which rather surprised us.    Having said that I would not hesitate to recommend this delightful spot to anyone visiting Marakesh
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hongkun Q wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: This place is amazing! The location service and food are perfect. Walk into a lot attractions in mins. For dinner I love Morocco style monkfish:)) something special about this Riad is their decorations. So many details make everywhere beautiful!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The place to be if you are going to Marrakesh
Review_Text: We absolutely loved it! Great location great staff always happy to chat great room and service and amazing food! The chef did everything to acommodate my gluten-free requirements. They recommended and organised amazing tours for us and made our Marrakesh experience incredible! 5 stars +
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I just returned from a 4 night stay at Dar Anika and I don’t have the words to say how incredible it was. There is nothing the staff would not do to please their guests. Truly above and beyond service. Clean great food they will set up any tours or restaurants you want to visit and make sure you know everything you need to know before going out into the city. Thank you to their entire staff. If you are traveling to Marrakech this is THE place to stay and I will be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ricardo M wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Best place to stay ! Not enough words for all the quality , location, friendly staff....
Review_Text: Felt like a little prince at his own private space! Strongly suggest this place of you wanna visit Marrakesh.  Well located to the Medina center superb accomodations very friendly and helpful staff.  Recommend the meals at the roof top just something
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: This is a beautiful small hotel tucked away in a corner just at the entrance to the souk. The rooms are lovely service outstanding and the restaurant upstairs serves great food. It is very easy to walk out the front door and be in the middle of things.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Cristina F wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: October 2018 stay at Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: I stayed at Riad Dar Anika with my boyfriend two nights in mid-October. I highly recommend it! We had excellent service the entire time with Sarah giving us a detailed welcome and great introduction to Marrakech (what to visit where to eat and how to haggle with locals). One very good detail was that the Riad gave us a mobile phone with GPS and the number of the hotel in case we got lost or had any questions (no other Riad/hotel in Morocco did this). The food was very good and was available at all times. It was also nice to come from a day of sight seeing and have a snack tea or a drink waiting for us as soon as we arrived. The hotel has a nice rooftop and I also enjoyed a hamman and massage. The rooms were well decorated and private and mine had a good hairdryer. Would love to go back again one day!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Staff were very helpful and friendly. Great location just next to the Medina. Lovely terrace to have breakfasts. The breakfasts were also very good. Room got cleaned often and the addition of rose petals was great!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah D wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed here for a couple of nights. The first night we had the most delightful table set up for us on the roof terrace. With heater and wonderful coats to wear so cute. Food and service was outstanding ...... there really was every attention to detail possible  Antonio the Manager went out of his way for us several times including lending us his mobile incase we needed him at ANY time whilst out touring around the local area ...  Breakfast was delicious and freshly made everything. Yum. Situated in the the mot beautiful restaurant again the staff were fabulous !  On leaving we were given a little drawing with our names on and some yummy toiletries.... on top of this we were handed a little picnic for our journey to our next Riad this really is way beyond anything and such a thoughtful and kind thought !  Thank you Antonio for everything and your staff are a credit to you. We will be back .... absolutely 5 star X pls book you will not be disappointed!!!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We booked Dar Anika for 4 nights this November.    Due to curcumstances out of our control we had to leave Dar Anika after 1 night stay.    So my review is based on the 1 night we had    First of all I would like to say that all of the staff were very very welcoming indeed as soon as we entered the Riad and greeted us with mint tea and biscuits.  After being shown to our room we didnt spend much time there as we were so close to the Madina we went out shopping but like other quest have said they are a bit in the smaller side  On return we had a table booked on the roof top terrace for dinner  the set menu was well priced and I must say the quality was very good indeed ( we had the roast lamb for 2 ) . At the end the staff presented me with a birthday cake and singing happy birthday which was a plesent surprise.    Unfortunately the following day we had to leave the Riad due to personal reasons.  This is where the personal touch came into play  the owner of the Riad understood our problem and he and his team were very sympathetic to say the least which was very touching    So if you are looking for an authentic stay in Marrakech which is not a corporate hotel then Dar Anika will fulfill this for you
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wow! Beautiful immaculate Riad with staff who are extremely knowledge andnothing is too much trouble. From arrival to departure our stay was perfect. We were even given a mobile phone with internet access a direct line to the hotel and Antonio the manager and google maps for when we inevitability got lost in the souks! ( if you don’t get lost you haven’t immersed yourself in the experience properly!). All our pre booked trips were organised for us with no hassle.I cannot recommend this Riad enough we will definitely return to Marrakesh one day and most certainly wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Amazing Riad close to the Medina
Review_Text: We absolutely loved this place. The first night we had a beautiful table on the roof the food was wonderful and the setting was gorgeous. The staff make this place so special too they were so accommodating to all our needs and made a lovely birthday cake for us. The manager Antonio was incredibly kind and helpful and even gave us a phone in case we got lost when touring around. The reception made sure everything was organised for our transfers and gave us some lovely gifts when we left. I cannot recommend this Riad enough it was fantastic as were all the staff we would be back in a flash:)

Made to feel very comfortable by Antonio and his friendly team. Great little Riad just outside the main souks within the medina. The real fires kept us warm when it was chilly and the service was impecable. Sister Riad Kiass also enchanting.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This place was excellent and made us feel at home. The host was happy to help us to plan out trip and arrange for activities. They were very attentive and breakfast/dinner was really good. We left Morocco on a high
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My daughter and I stayed 3 nights at this lovely Riad and didn't want to leave. The staff went out of their way to be helpful. They were always smiling always happy. The breakfast was a feast. Each course starting with soup delicious and sustained us most the day. The manager Antonio took the time to educate us on the Moroccan ways and how to enjoy ourselves while being safe. He even provided us with a complimentary cell phone. They far surpassed our expectations. A true treasure!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Awesome friendly staff. Every need met!
Review_Text: The staff at riad Anika went above the mark! We always felt safe and they arranged for our transportation to and from airport restaurants and excursions out side the old city . They were always providing us with tea and snacks when we came back for a break from sight seeing. Breakfasts were amazing and probably the best I’ve had in a hotel not to mention included with the stay. Can’t get over the staff  all of them exceptional!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: From my welcome to departure the entire staff was extremely helpful and kind. They provided me with a local phone to use for directions and to contact the hotel for any needs. The food was delightful. The hotel was full of culture and art.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: It was the little things that count
Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights in the Riad Dar Anika and enjoyed our experiences. Marrakech is an interesting with a mix of old and new and worth a visit. I did think the rooms were expensive but the service you get makes it feel worthwhile.    The good:  - Excellent service by all the staff this included the phone with google maps which was helpful  - Location the riad is right inside the Medina so never had a problem getting around our finding our way back.  - You are served a lovely breakfast no getting up 2 or 3 times to self service buffets which was nice for a change.  -We booked a walking tour to the Atlas mountains via the riad and this was one of the highlights of our trip.    There is an out door area at the top of the riad for sunbathing I would suggest adding a few umbrella's as it can get very hot but there is a sister hotel with a swimming pool that guest can use.    Overall we enjoyed our stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: amazing place to stay-beautiful people and place
Review_Text: these french people know how to treat their guests! Nothing is out of bounds-they go out of their way to help in any way. Food wonderful-fresh squeezed OJ at breakfast with wonderful homemade breads and yogurt jams and honey. Dinner was one of our best-Sarah is the manager and she's lovely. Huge recommendation here. Like a mini oasis inside-quiet and peaceful then step outside and it all changes! This Riad is on the fringe of the Medina if you want to experience the real Marrakech! AC
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: John B wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: We've stayed at many high quality hotels but nothing as good as Dar Anika. Wonderful atmosphere with the best service you can imagine. We were met immediately and had cookies as we discussed recommendations for our stay. There were rose petals on our beds. The service and support were exceptional. They even has a lunch to go for us when we left for the airport. Although it's hectic outside inside it could not be quieter. There's also a fabulous lounge/restaurant on the 3rd floor. Great location too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We booked at the Dar Anika primarily as it was my daughter's name so I thought it would be a nice surprise for her.  The foyer of the Riad is beautiful and quaint. The staff were fabulous. It is very conveniently located at the entrance of the souk. The breakfast was amazing the only thing I would say was we found it a little noisy at night. We stayed three nights here and then went to a large resort just close by which provided us with the best of both worlds.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Giles P wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Sometimes you read the reviews and wonder if it will be as good as people suggest. Well it is. The well appointed rooms beautiful courtyard good and plentiful food and ideal location on the edge of the medina should be enough to encourage visitors but it is the personal service that sets this Riad apart. Not only are Antonio and Sarah are always checking in with guests to make sure the stay is as perfect as it can be but every member of staff ( there are a lot of staff for the number of rooms )greets you with a smile and nothing is too much trouble. Without asking cool drinks and snacks appear when you return from the madness outside the Riad umbrellas appear over your head whilst you dodge the showers ( and when it rains in Marrakech it really rains) crossing the courtyard and your room is strewn with rose petals to add to that special experience. One evening we asked if they could suggest somewhere local for a light snack and after a chat amongst themselves they suggested somewhere which was a few minutes walk away rang arranged a table and then arranged for a member of staff to guide us there....always doing that little bit extra. We loved everything about this Riad and our stay 4 night stay in Marrakech. Both are highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Deb w wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Had a fantastic stay here. The staff are so welcoming and prepared to go the extra mile. The riad is stunning and the extra touches such as drinks served on your return from trips out to the rose petals on the bed just make this place a class above others. It really was a pleasure staying here. A very big thankyou to all the lovely staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bali S wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: This place is nice and and cosy. If you like boutique hotels (although this is more of a house) with fantastic service this is the place for you. We stayed 5 nights in October and we had a wonderful time overall. We stayed in the deluxe double room which is highly recommended and go for the rooms upstairs to enjoy the balcony view of the Riad!  We encountered slight issues with communication and some arrangements but this was quickly rectified and the staff were very helpful overall. I recommend if there are any issues you have do voice them before the end of your stay you will be delighted with how they turn things around!  Personally the food was not to our taste but that is not saying the food was bad so we mostly ate out.  We did 3 excursions which I highly recommend - The buggy (not quads) through the dessert half day is so much fun - should out to Bashir at the buggy tours who saw I was getting annoyed that the quads in front were going too slow he took me on a separate path during the whole tour where I could basically test the buggy to it's limits - a lot of fun!!  Next we did the hot air balloon - which was just the most amazing thing. It was a nice day and the ride was so steady! - great views and pictures to be taken.  lastly we did the Atlas Mountains - Imlil Villiage tour - a bit of trekking - no too much as you can tell the guide the routes you want to take - shorter routes are available if you don't want to walk so much.  This Riad has a sister property (Riad Kaiss) which is 5 minutes walk and it has a rooftop pool which we used twice.  Overall if you are looking for fantastic service and want to stay in the heart of the Medina - this is the place to be.  Thanks to Sarah and all of her staff at the Riad for a wonderful stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed 7 nights in Riad dar Anika in October 2018. I have to recognize I had not previously realized a riad is not a palace nor a mannor it is a house a nice big house but a house. Hence not all rooms are equaly big or equaly decorated (just like in any hotel). On arrival I was given a small and simple room. I asked for a better one. Unfortunately there was no one available for my whole journey so they gave me a nice big well decorated room for half of my stay and mooved me (I didn’t have to do it) after 3 nights to another intermediate room. So I had the chance to see three different rooom all comfortable some nicer none was a suite. The house itslef is nice with a cute yard/garden a small swimming pool (more for decoration than for use) lovely corridors with small tables and sofas a beautiful terrace with a good Morrocan restaurant and bar a nice house for a nice stay. Location is excellent you can walk to almost every touristic place in town. So far so good. What I believe is a reason to choose this riad is its excellent service. All staff including the manager are inmediately available friendly and highly commited to make your stay as good as it can be. It is people working at the riad who make you feel at home kindly treated even pumpered well advised and helped when needed. If you are going to Marrakech and you want to stay in a riad do choose this one you will surely enjoy it as I did and will not regret. If you do go please tell hello and thanks from me to every and each one of the persons who work there. To all of them thank you very much !! By the way I believe 4 days is OK for Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: sara n wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: The Staff at Dar Anika were absolutely amazing from start to finish we couldn't have asked for a more perfect stay and would never look elsewhere if we ever go back to Morocco. The attention and friendliness of the staff really made this one of the best trips we have ever had and nicest places we've stayed in mostly because of the friendliness and hospitality provided by the staff here. From the moment we checked in (tea service cookies maps directions cell phone/charger to use during our stay..the list goes on) until the moment we left (they packed us a lunch and gave us parting gifts and even filled out our customs forms!) we were treated like family and this was unlike anything we've ever experienced. We've stayed in 5 star hotels and have never received this kind of treatment we received from the staff at Dar Anika. The rooftop restaurant was so beautiful the food was delicious and the rooms were perfectly appointed and quiet from the bustling city. Our couples Hammam was excellent and relaxing. I could go on and on but if you are considering Dar Anika you shouldn't look any further because this is the place to stay. Thank you all for making our time in Marrakesh so special and for even mailing back my charger left in the room much appreciated! We will certainly be back in the future. It was such a pleasure. Mille Fois Merci:). Sara & Jeffrey
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Barry B wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: We began a recent trip to Morocco in Marrakech. We reserved accommodations at Dar Anika a Riad in that city. They also made bookings for us for a day trip to Essaouira and a 4 day 3 night visit to Merzouga which included a night in the desert. As well they made arrangements for train travel to Casablanca when we departed. All these arrangements were made with care and professional handling of all the details required according to our wishes.  Our accommodations at Dar Anika were most satisfactory. We were warmly greeted on our arrival and subsequently whenever we returned from excursions whether of a few hours or a few days in duration. This welcome and interest in our needs or wishes was displayed by the entire staff.  The meals - whether breakfasts or dinner - offered a great choice of selections were appealingly presented pleasantly and courteously served.  Our room was fresh clean nicely decorated pleasingly furnished and maintained with care and attention during our stay.  My wife and myself would have no hesitation in recommending Dar Anika for the discriminating Marrakech visiter who wishes top notch accommodation hospitality and assistance for a visit in this fascinating city in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Riad made my first visit to Marrakech wonderful. It was very easy to find on the edge of the Medina. The rooms were so special. And the restaurant and staff were wonderful. They made it a memorial stay!! I would definitely stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We spent part of our honeymoon at Riad Dar Anika and loved our experience; the Riad is very nice and comfortable; common area is great for lounging and drinking tea or enjoying the pool to cool off; the rooftop space is a great oasis for breakfast or dinner; our room was comfortable overall though the temperature is difficult to regulate (no windows to open for ventilation; A/C unit is small and under-powered); staff was attentive the entire time taking very good care of us and setting up transportation excursions massages Hammams etc.; highly recommend this Riad
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Barbara K wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: We had been touring Morocco for about 10 days and our last stop before returning back to the USA was for three nights at Dar Anika in Marrakesh. What a fabulous choice. This Riad was the perfect place to end our trip and to help us recover from a very hectic schedule. I'm not sure we have ever stayed at a place with a staff (thanks Antonio) that went so far out of their way to make our stay memorable and to cater to our every need announced and unannounced. A small example my husband's electric razor had just broken the day before and by the time we arrived at the Riad he was too tired to go out to buy a new one. My husband mentioned in passing about his broken razor to Antonio and within a few minutes someone came to our room with a large tube of shaving cream and a decent disposal razor at no charge and without us actually asking for such a thing. The staff tries to anticipate what they can do to help make your visit more comfortable and enjoyable A another example when we left the Raid for our long trip back to the airport in Casablanca to our surprise they had packed in a small gift bag sandwiches fruit and a small poster with our names written out in Arabic. The calligraphy was beautiful.    One night we had dinner at their roof top restaurant. Our 7 course meal (a fixed price dinner) was by far the best meal we had during our two weeks in Morocco and I might say we had already eaten at many high end Moroccan restaurants prior to this point. For the main course my husband had monkfish and I had filet mignon both cooked perfectly in a mild and tasty source. The dinner was well worth the additional expense.    Our room was always kept clean with new rose pedals put on top of our very comfortable bed each day. The Riad is in a great location close to many of the important sites in the old city. When we left the Riad each day they lent us special cell phones even though we had our own to help us if we got lost something easy to do in the Madina. When we returned back to the Riad each day there would always be additional snacks beyond the daily fruit basket and cookies you might expect to see in Morocco's better Riads.    All and all the 5 star rating of this Riad is well deserved.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I can’t say enough positive things about this place or staff it’s just fantastic. The responded quickly to my emails arranging my visit and various excursions. The hammam was exceptional. They brought drinks every time we came back from the hustle and bustle. Good recommendations about trips etc. Room was lovely and always fresh. Good lovely and served speedily and hot. Great visit and I can’t wait to visit Sarah and the team again xx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Hidden gem at the most convenient location in the medina
Review_Text: Read Anika was the best lodging experience during our multi city trip to Morocco. It was like home away from home. The staff is outstanding and most considerate. Management has an eye to ensure Excellent guest comfort.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We just returned back from Morocco and the one of the highlights of our trip was this beautiful place. The rooms the special touches and the staff were all incredible. Highly recommended. We loved it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: ALLEN K wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Four of us stayed in this Riad for five nights. It was a wonderful experience. Sara and her team did an excellent job in making us feel like queens and king.    A friend left her glasses in Casablanca Sara and her team helped to coordinate with different parties and eventually got it back for us. Another got sick Sara helped to get a doctor to come to the Riad to tend to our friend.    Among these incidents we had originally booked two twin rooms but only one available when we arrived. We end up getting two singles and one twin rooms. A pleasant surprise.    The hotel staffs were super nice and friendly. They entertained our every demand and gone beyond. Sara made excellent recommendation on dinner venues. She gave practical and very helpful tips on navigating in the Medina and shopping tips.    Every afternoon when we return from our adventure the road would provide cold drinks and cakes. At night they will provide a small glass of milk and cookies or preserved dates.    The Riad even provide a smartphone that has the hotel contacts in it in case we need emergency assistance.    I can’t express more on how wonderful it has been. I highly recommend this Riad to all and will definitely stay here when I come back to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is a beautiful place to stay with excellent food and top-notch service located in the heart of Marrakech. The hospitality of the staff at every level was the best we've experienced anywhere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It was an outstanding experience due to the willingness to help attention to detail and overall excelent service attitude of all the staff....everybody were very friendly.....the planned excursions program was a great help and certainly an asset they have.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: María A wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Amazing service and being on that old property was an inversion into Morocco. I is right in the Medina and you can access easily to the Market and a whole bunch of restaurants. It's amazing how things can change in the Medina between the day and the night full of mostly seafood restaurants.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: It's taken me a year to write this review
Review_Text: I've been in two minds for the past year on whether I should write a review of Dar Anika and I must say that when I think back to our stay it was one of the more disappointing breaks but this may have been down to my high expectations after reading the reviews on here prior.    We arrived tired and after a thorough check in were shown to our rooms which were really quite small and didn't reflect what I had thought we were staying in on booking.com. Although I travel regularly with work this was a special trip with my family and my Mum was a little disheartened by a dark room. The manager handled the situation well and we were offered another room which she was happy with so thank you for that.    The staff were wonderful and food tasty. I went to spend time relaxing on a lounger but this was a main thoroughfare for the staff and I didn't feel entirely comfortable. We therefore spent most of our time when not exploring Marrakech at their sister property.    My main concern over our stay is that I felt that it provided very poor value for money. When I was booking this holiday I compared many different hotels and riads. I must admit that I regretted booking Dar Anika.    Working in travel I appreciate that service and location etc comes at a premium but on this occasion I felt that it just didn't warrant the price tag compared to other offerings.    I also wanted to mention that when considering Dar Anika do only book the higher category of rooms and take all the reviews on here with a pinch of salt. On departure you are encouraged to raise concerns with management rather than post on TripAdvisor which I really appreciate but it doesn't always present both sides.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I can not thank you enough for such a beautiful stay at Riad Dar Anika. You all were absolutely amazing and we had the most amazing experience ever. I have traveled throughout the world for my job for pleasure and I have had the privilege to stay at some amazing hotels during my trips the best I thought. But staying with you I can now say it was absolutely the best experience I have ever had. The entire team there made our visit wonderful. Everyone at the Riad Dar Anika were all lovely people so helpful so professional and just beautiful people wonderful people. Since my return to the states I have bragged about my visit to your Riad to everyone who has asked me about my trip. I am already planning on coming back and enjoying more of your beautiful country. When I do return I will be staying with you again. I feel like we arrived not knowing anyone and by the time we left we had made so many friends. Everything you arranged for us the hike into the atlas mountains to visit the berber villages the camel back sunset trip the dinners the gardens it could not have been better. I fell in love with Morocco the culture the people and you will definitely see me again. I hope I didn't drive Sarah and Nadia crazy with all my questions ;))) but they were so amazing love them both. The food the rooms the atmosphere the best ever. I could keep going I am getting so excited as I write this because I loved my stay there so much. Thank you all so much for such a beautiful visit for your hospitality for your kindness for your friendship and making this an unbelievable and memorable trip.Tim Cronin
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Brian L wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: I highly recommend Dar Anika. If you want to explore old town this is the perfect location for you. It’s a quick and easy walk to the square. The rooms are clean and well kept. The staff is amaxing and attentive. Thank you Sarah and staff!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Spent 4 nights at Dar Anika. This was our first time in Marrakech. I do not know which was better the staff or the location but together we could not have chosen a better place. We were picked up from the airport which was a good start as finding our way alone would have been a disaster. It is true what you will read about the hospitality of the people in Marrakech. The staff at the hotel always were friendly and sincere in making your stay a great stay. The location of Dar Anika enables you to walk right out and head to the souks or some of the places to see. The staff will always get you a taxi (which are inexpensive) tell the driver where you are going and also the fare so that you do not get ripped off. The restaurant will serve you the local foods in the upstairs restaurant with great service. Many times at night we would go to the very top of the restaurant drink some wine and watch the street below. The architecture of the building is the real thing. One day we walked over to their sister riad and spent the hot afternoon in the rooftop pool. Never did a staff member not have a smile on his/her face and a genuine spirit of making your trip great. We had a good time trying to use English French and hand gestures in communicating. I have never met more delightful people. I had tears in my eyes when we said goodbye.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Birgitta H wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: A really lovely Place with excellent food
Review_Text: We had the full menu with six courses and it was sooo good and the waitress was so sweet and extremely serviceminded - Highly recommendable Place in the middle of the Medina in Marrakesh - and they serve good Wine (if you choose it) to the amazing dinner.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve P wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: From the moment I arrived the management and staff exceeded my every expectation- the property is perfectly located and impeccably clean  The staff will happily provide recommendations and directions  The best meals I had were at the property restaurant
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Wonderful riad. Beautifully appointed clean elegant comfortable. Air conditioned. Stayed 2 nights and are returning for a third. Helpful staff. Breakfast good. A bit of a walk to nearby sites of interest so wear comfortable shoes when going out. When you return from your sight-seeing enjoying a rest by the quiet pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We are newly engaged and came to Morocco for a week. We started our visit at dar anika and they didn’t disappoint. Sarah and Nadia were always at our service. The hammam at the hotel was amazing as was our massages. Meals were good and the Riad was located within walking distance of many top tourist spots. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mareike B wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: We choose to have dinner at our wedding anniversary in dar Anika - and it was amazing!!!  Perfect and really personal service an amazing table at the roof really delicious food and drinks...we won’t forget the amazing hours there and can recommend it to everyone who wants to have moments in a comfortable and cozy atmosphere while enjoying to look at the busy square...    Thanks for the unforgettable evening!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent stay at Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: The staff at this hotel made our experience in Marrakech very memorable; every single staff member we encountered were extremely professional friendly and helpful. They seemed to always be one step ahead.The rooms are spacious and clean and the breakfast is lovely. Great location close to all the action available in Marrakech. Thank you to the staff for the incredible hospitality you have shown us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mads P wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Me and my girlfriend and her mother was there last night eating the lamb shoulder. The main course was very very good i would say they should have extra sauce to the costumers except that it was amazing. Service were brilliant from the beginning to the end. I will reccomend this place to everyone who wants a special night in marrakech :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Rc M wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Riad just at the entrance towards Riad Zitoun l'kdim close to Jemaa el Fna.  The decor and level of finishings is of an exceptionally high standard. Attention to detail in all areas is shown by the owner. Highly recommended to the most discerning traveller.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Michelle W wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title: Best hotel i've ever stayed at
Review_Text: This riad/hotel had the best service I have had anywhere in the world. The hosts made us feel so welcome nothing was a bother. They have a fantastic rooftop bar where you can sit and drink a beer while watching all the action on the street below. The room was spacious and clean the breakfast was amazing and I just cannot rate this place highly enough. Can you believe that when we checked out they had even filled out our airport departure cards made us a food hamper to take to the airport and gave us a gift for staying with them. The location was perfect to all the attractions and they organised the best guide for a half day tour who was so knowledgeable and interesting. He took us to all the places we wanted plus extra ones that he thought we would like which we did. You can walk to the main square from the riad and access to the airport is only about 15 minutes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed at Riad Dar Anika for 3 days in June with my partner. We were blown away by how amazing this Riad was.  Service was fantastic with friendly staff.  Room was beautiful.  Perfect location.    Definitely recommend this hidden gem if you plan on taking a trip to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fairuz O wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Stayed here in June with my family. We lived it! The staff is so friendly and accomadatingthey helped me find a place to send my laundry and they picked it up and delivered the clean laundry. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious. Do not hesitate to stay at this hidden gem in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: As close to perfect as it gets
Review_Text: Stayed here for 2 nights with my 13 year old daughter. Perfect stay: beautiful and charming room very nice breakfast great location but mostly we felt totally welcome and were given all explanations necessary for a perfect stay in the medina. The friendliness of everyone in this riad was unseen!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had the pleasure of staying at Riad Dar Anika for 2 nights before we headed off on a Sahara desert tour. Walking through the lane way to the entrance we were a little unsure but once we stepped inside we wished we had arrived a couple of days earlier. The room and the staff went above our expectations. The staff even packed us a little lunch box for our long drive to the desert.    The hotel itself is in an excellent location which is walking distance to most attractions which benefited us having only 2 nights there.    Do yourself a favor and book a hammam through Dar Anika! Aside from it being such an amazing experience and the cleanest we have ever been their hammams are done in a room with just yourself or whoever you book with. Couldn't recommend it enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic Hotel & Benchmark for others in the area
Review_Text: Outstanding hotel rooms clean breakfast amazing and the hotel staff and management amazing. We also had a spa and hammam and again one of the best I have had. The restaurant in the hotel is known for its menu and we had dinner that was fantastic with too much food that we could not finish!! The hotel provides you with a mobile phone that is really handy. It made us feel more safe and we used Google Maps to find our way around. When we were leaving for the airport the hotel had prepared us a packed lunch and completed all our immigration forms!! The location is also perfect as you walking distance to main attractions. Definitely come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We researched many Riads for our stay in the Medina. After reading many reviews we chose Dar Anika and we are so glad we did. The staff could not have been more accommodating or more helpful. They were constantly finding ways to assist us and our children...and many times anticipated our needs before we even realized we needed it! We were treated like dear family. The food was delicious and served in a beautiful rooftop environment. Sarah and her staff are top notch...and this is coming from someone who had stayed in some of the top hotels in the world.  After our time at Dar Anika we moved out of the Medina to the Mandarian Oriental. Excited to return to Marrakech and enjoy time at both locations.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kenny F wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: This riad really did go above and beyond my stay with them was the first few nights of my honeymoon they put rose petals all over the room and had a bottle of champagne on ice when we arrived. Their driver who picked us up from the airport waited even though we got in very late and had to go through all the customs stuff at the airport. One morning we woke up early to watch the sunrise and even though breakfast didn't start for another hour some one heard us up on the roof and brought us coffee. When we checked out of the riad they had packed us a lunch and handed us a cold bottle of water. There are probably 20 other little things that I am forgetting to mention but this place and their staff are fantastic! I would definitely stay here again next time I'm in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary and choose the Riad Dar Anika after reading previous reviews and we were not disappointed! The staff were absolutely fantastic attentive and went out of their way to cater for all our needs. The rooms were spacious and immaculate and the food was amazing! We will definitely be back. Thanks for making our visit so memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We found this Riad after some research on Tripadvisor and were not disappointed. This was our first trip to Marrakech (and Morocco) and it was for a special occasion. Because of this Riad Anika management very generously offered us a bigger room FOC in their sister Riad 3 minutes down the street which was equally as beautiful as the room we had booked. Due to us preferring the location of Anika we decided to stay there for our five day trip. The staff were very welcoming friendly and attended to us without hesitation their attention to detail in service was incredible. The room itself was lovely and we arrived to find rose petals beautifully decorated in the room on our bed and bathroom this along with a cleaned room we found each time we came back after being out all day exploring. The Riad's location is great a couple of minutes to the local stalls and only about 6-8 minutes to the main square (Jemaa el-Fnaa). The food is very good particularly their monkfish dishes and freshly made breads ! We ate breakfast each morning and we couldn't have asked for a more substantial and tasty breakfast to start the day. We really enjoyed staying at Riad Anika and loved our trip to Marrakech - we would recommend this hotel and if you stay then you must try their mint tea absolutely refreshing and delicious. Thank you Riad Anika for such a fantastic stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stacey L. wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Will be coming back for sure!
Review_Text: I loved everything about this raid! I initially loved the flowers I saw online in the rooms and I didn’t have a reservation booked so I was praying there was space for us. I’m 6 months pregnant and on top of that I was extremely sick from a cold and exhausted from walking all day. I was having the worst day ever and when we got there the front desk lady was able to show us some rooms. I told her I wouldn’t mind a smaller room as long as it had a bathtub.  When we came back she managed to get us a bigger room with a bath tub so I was super happy!    The room was so beautiful and I really liked the cookies/water/and fridge.  We got to enjoy the pool the next day it was warm :) breakfast was amazing they serve so much and I can barely eat but I tried eating a bit of everything. I don’t usually like harsha bread but they made it super tasty and moist. I especially loved the broccoli soup and some other veggie soup they gave us for breakfast. They also have ice which I love. It’s so hard to find ice in morocco and they even had iced coffee.    I believe check out is at noon but we left early since we are still traveling to see the rest of morocco we have a four hour trip down south and it was super helpful that they gave us a goodie bag with soaps fruit and some sandwiches.    Everyone working at this place was super nice and the hotel was very clean. Since I was sick and didn’t get to see much of Marrakech I will definitely come back. I actually enjoyed staying in the room resting up.  Everything was 5+ stars. Also the map/ travel advisor and how the staff speaks multiple languages really helped a lot. The location of the raid was also perfect since I couldn’t walk much te day after I got there it was a pretty easy walk from the raid to the main square it’s also close to La Bahia palace.    Wish I would have had some change to leave our housekeeping and waiter but I only had my Amex on me. Also I saw that they only accept visa and mastercard I believe. My husband booked the hotel and not me so double check on payment methods.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I booked a 3 night stay here for the first part of our honeymoon and we couldn't have been made to feel more welcome! We arrived to a bottle of champagne and flowers in our room and were greeted on our return each night with delicious drinks and cake. The service was absolutely impeccable throughout the staff very friendly and the Riad itself is incredibly beautiful and in a fantastic location set on the fringes of the Medina where it is a bit more peaceful but still only a short walk to el-Fna. We spent every evening having a drink on the roof terrace and ate there one night one of our best meals in Morocco! The hotel also provided us a with mobile phone with data in case of emergencies and also arranged taxis for us when required. Upon leaving they also provided us with a packed lunch for our taxi to Essaouira :) Strongly strongly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Service is EVERYTHING at Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: I stayed at Riad Dar Anika for 2 nights. While my room was not as spectacular as some others where I have stayed in the same price range the service was absolutely impeccable and that made ALL the difference. When I arrived I was given a map and orientation to getting around in Marrakech. Most notably Riad Dar Anika provided me with a local phone to use in case I got lost or needed any kind of help which in the Marrakech median is no small thing. I have never had that happen before. My room was kept immaculate (seemed like every time I left they cleaned it and put more rose petals on the bed and in the bathroom).    But here's what really got me about the service. When it was time to leave I was presented with some small gifts. I know they do this for everyone but it still felt personal. But even that wasn't the height of the service. First they gave me my already completed customs declaration to help make my airport exit go smoothly the next day. But even that wasn't it. Next they also presented me with a lovely plain white cotton purse with a sandwich and some fruit for my train to Casablanca as they suspected I had not had time for lunch. They were right and I would have been stuck with junky train station food.    Superior service is taking care of my needs when I have them. But extraordinary service is anticipating my needs before I even know I have them and in that Riad Dar Anika was exceptional.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Our first visit to Marrakech and what a place to choose. Dar Anika is beautiful It is the whole package that takes some beating anywhere. All of the staff are amazing they cannot do enough for you I mean anything!! They are like a family. The dinning room is beautiful and cool and here you will eat the most beautiful tasty meals of anywhere in Marrakech everything is freshly made and is just delicious. It is the small touches that do it the rose petals that decorate your bed in the evening watermelon smoothies when you come in from the heat. Paradise! No need to look any further x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bruce G wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Two Wonderful Days in Marrakech at Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: We spent only two days at the wonderful Raid Dar Anika as we were beginning our North Africa and European vacation. Our flight was delayed and we lost a day in this beautiful city. From the the moment you are greeted at the airport; the definition of hospitality is provided by a wonderful staff. When we arrived; we were greeted by Sarah Antonio (owner) and Faduoa welcoming us to their Riad. Sarah provides a gracious welcome provided a mobile phone for our use and highlighted useful information for touring Marrakech.  Dining at the Riad is most certainly not to be missed and we had the pleasure of meeting Mustafa a nice young man that worked at the restaurant.  Take of advantage of the Hamam provided by the Riad; wonderful experience.  Room/bed are both very comfortable Wi-Fi works well and the Riad is within close distance to many of the sights within Marrakech. Easy walks.  Travelers this is a wonderful place with a wonderful staff; you won't be disappointed. We will return again to Riad Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jennifer O wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: One of the most incredible stays we've ever had...spectacular accommodations and service!
Review_Text: Truly this was the most exclusive intimate outstanding hotel experience I’ve ever had (and I’ve stayed in many dozens of hotels around the world). Antonio Sarah and their entire staff – I wish I could name them all! – provided the most luxurious service possible to their guests … we literally felt like royalty based on how we were treated. They provide their guests a local phone with Dar Anika’s number programmed so that you have a “hotline” to help should you ever need it which made us feel very secure in the foreign surroundings. The rooms were impeccable beautifully appointed roomy and covered in rose petals. The entire riad was gorgeous flush with local décor and what appeared to be hand-selected details in every direction. The rooftop bar and restaurant offered among the most attentive servers and delicious authentic cuisine we’ve ever enjoyed and no need was unattended … not to mention it offered a breathtaking view of the city. And the location at the very edgeof the medina and old city area was extremely convenient for anything we wanted to visit on foot. The staff helped us arrange for a couple of local activities which were similarly top-notch and provided gracious help when we needed it (continually checked with airport regarding the status of a lost bag confirmed existing activity reservations walked to find our arranged transportation so we didn’t have to search the street and many other services). Antonio I cannot give enough compliments to your staff for their INCREDIBLE hospitality and I cannot thank you enough for providing the experience of a lifetime for our family!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Impeccable service from trilingual staff every possible amenity Nat Geo-worthy pics of the Koutoubia Mosque minaret at sunset great people watching on a main thoroughfare to D’jema el Fnaa easy car drop-off point just steps away so no long luggage haul. Antonio gives helpful map overview and travel tips upon arrival and you’re greeted with refreshment and rose petals at every turn. Hard to go back to real life after this.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent Stay..... Good Location..... Relaxed atmosphere and quiet place.Very good restaurant and live music... the staff were incredibly friendly and polite...The rooms and common area places are beautiful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mose H wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Beautiful riad in a wonderful location
Review_Text: We loved this riad. The location is ideal. You feel both in bustle of Marrakesh but removed enough for calm and quiet at night. The rooms and common area places are beautiful. The only thing that could use some work is the service. We found it indifferent and lazy at times.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Stayed in the Riad which was a new experience for us. All rooms face the gardens. The atmosphere is relaxed and very friendly. You have a feel that you are transported into a different world long gone
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: carolyn w wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: We ate on the roof top at Dar Anika and had a really wonderful experience. There was live music which was a lovely background and the food was very good. Service was some of the best we have had in Morocco the staff were incredibly friendly and polite. We had several free starters at the beginning of the meal and also free wine and cold drinks at the end. A wonderful experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Exceptional stay at Dar Anika with perfect location and wonderful Staff!
Review_Text: Dar Anika is a star! Excellent customer service and outstanding location in the medina. From the start all the details that the Staff did from welcoming us with a rose water ceremony and fresh dates to the mint tea and refreshments were so lovely. We relaxed in the sitting area with cool towels while discussing the map of the city and getting local tips in order to make our stay most enjoyable. We were given a local iPhone that we could use at the Medina and throughout our stay which made Google maps very handy getting around. The Staff including Sarah Kamal Yassine Tarik and Madia were so wonderful and warm. Hind also helped us at Reception and was outstanding. Highly recommend Dar Anika and thank you to the Staff who treated us like family. We loved every moment and will return again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Best place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: If you are looking for comfort excellent service exceptional hospitality and a beautiful place to stay in Marrakech then Riad Dar Anika is your answer. We have been in 5 star resorts but the service that we got here is the best amongst all. They did not leave a stone unturned in making us feel at home. The staff is friendly and kind and extremely helpful in every way.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Amazing experience with Dar Anika in Marrakech! Whether the manager Antonia or all of the staffsboth are so kind and friendly.They made a meticulous and considerate serviceeven helped me to fill in the exit form and prepared the lunch of transport in advance it was a lovely surprise .I strongly recommend Dar Anika!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Trine F wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: What can I say; after the first meal they remembered what everyone of us preferred to eat if you preferred herbs and/or tomatoes in your omelette or if you wanted omelette at all...When we left they had made ready and filled out our documents for the airport they gave us fruit and food for the flights oil from Morocco... The beautiful New Zealand lady who was so relaxed and gave us the best tips - what a scoop to get her come to Marrakesh... All the others at the Riad just so nice and service minded.. the Riad is perfectly located and you can be driven to the door - what you can not take for granted if you want to stay in a Riad. The standard -- it’s a Riad....    This is to be recommended if you would stay in a Riad with ok standard and the most fantastic people.

Review_Date: Vicky B wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Oasis in the centre of marrakech
Review_Text: Stayed here for a few nights back in March when we were travelling around Morocco. Certainly the best hotel in Marrakech service was superb room was luxurious clean and tranquil . Would recommend to friends and family. On our second night we had dinner on the roof top terrace they had live music which gave great ambiance . Service was exceptional - we arrived after 10pm not expecting to be seated but we were welcomed with open arms  Set menu was good value for delicious good quality food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Daniel K wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika was exactly what we were looking for during our first trip to Marrakech. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful and the property is beautiful. There is no better way to end a long day around town than spending quality time on the amazing roof deck with a cool drink. The riad also has a perfect location- a quick five minute walk away from Jamaa el Fna.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sofia L wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: The best riad to stay in Marrakech. Arriving at the riad we were welcomed with a nice mint tea a superb staff and very pleasent chat with the Riad manager Antonio. Antonio and all the staff gave us the best tips of marrakech and helped us with everything we needed. Everybody is super nice friendly and helpful from arriving until leaving.  The riad is superb very clean and very well located (and this is super important easy acess by car and easy acess to all the visiting spots in the medina) The restaurant has a great view over the rooftops of marrakech and a great terrance for relaxing after the busy souks. Certainly a Riad to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Arriving at Dar Anika we were really well accomodated by all the staff and the Manager António.  António provided a really detailed description about Marroco its culture and Marrakeche in particular. Lifestyle where to go and precious tips were given not only at the begining but also during the all stay!  The staff are all 5*.  5* accomodation super clean and perfect location!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: For my birthday I decided to spend a little extra and go for Dar Anika. And I could not have been happier with my choice. A year on I still continue to think about my time here. It was pure bliss. The service was exceptional. The staff were extremely attentive. I received a dozen roses on my birthday and the kitchen staff presented me with a cake and sang happy birthday. I had breakfast on the gorgeous terrace and ate the most delicious food with the bird singing in the background. The Riad is a haven with the hustle and bustle of the city. There are beautiful oils in the bathroom and rose petals on the bed each day to greet you. You must if possible arrange a tour with the very helpful manager for the Atlas mountains. The driver was fantastic and it was an incredible experience. When we came back from our trek we were greeted with fresh watermelon juice and having our shoes cleaned! For our airport travel we were given a packed lunch to eat on the plane. Nothing was too much trouble. The owner spent half an hour helping me get Question Time on the tv so I could watch the election debate! It has been twelve months since I stayed there and I always reflect on what an incredible holiday I had. You must stay here if you can.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Not that it needs saying but i'll say it anyway Marrakech is a busy and sometimes overwhelming place. For a first timer it was verging on scary. However Riad Dar Anika offered a peaceful sanctuary from the hustle and bustle which surrounds around.    Leanne the assistant manager made us feel welcome from the start (as did every member of staff) giving us good advice about the surroundings and a phone in case of emergencies (The Google Maps on it helped us navigate our way out of the souks once we had gotten lost which everyone inevitably does).    The complementary tea and cookies the fresh varied and wholesome breakfasts and a wonderful dinner ensured we never went hungry.    On departure we received some lovely gifts as well as some sandwiches for the journey. The service is truly outstanding and is reason alone to stay at Dar Anika. Once you also consider the place itself there's no question as to where you would want to stay on your trip to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Highly recommended for stay in Marrakesh
Review_Text: We had the most lovely stay at Riad Dar Anika this past weekend. Prior to arriving we received an email with all of the information we could need about getting to the hotel and things to do while we were there. This was so helpful as we both had had busy weeks at work and hadn't had the time to sort out of plans beyond arriving! We were greeted at the airport by a driver and driven to the hotel. It takes about 15 minutes to drive. From the outside of the hotel it doesn't look like much but the inside is spectacular. It is a quiet clean sparkling oasis inside the busy city. We loved it. We were welcomed so warmly were given drinks and snacks as well as tips of what to do and what to be careful of. Our room was big and well furnished. We often came back to the room to find more sweet treats and refreshments. We had dinner at the hotel the first night which was lovely and took recommendations from the hotel staff for dinner the other nights. We also highly recommend hammam at the hotel and the day trip to Imili. Breakfasts at the hotel are a true feast and a great way to start the day. The location is great. Close to taxi stands but also easy to set off on foot from and easy to find. The service is unmatched!! You will love you time here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pedro R wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: The stay was fantastic due to the attention sympathy of the personnel quality of the place and the wonderful roses petals in the bedroom every night. The visit to Marrakech was very influenced by this wonderful place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: jancis m wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Very well located riad within minutes walk to local shops restaurants. This was our 3rd stay at Dar Anika we tried an alternative riad one year and it just didn't pass muster! All the staff at Dar Anika are polite friendly and helpful without being intrusive. The riad is clean with fresh towels in the room everyday turn down service with a nice touch of fresh dates and milk left in the room at night. The mint tea is a refreshing alternative to coffee or tea although they do offer a comprehensive list of cocktails wine etc. The food was well presented and represented Moroccan cuisine.  Appreciated all the lovely fresh roses around the riad.  All in all a very relaxing 4 day break. This review is probably not doing Dar Anika justice so you will just have to visit yourself and experience it first hand.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad with outstanding service, deceptively plain exterior!
Review_Text: We enjoyed a 3 night stay at this beautiful well furnished Riad to conclude our Morocco Expert Tour in Marrakesh. Interior and room (we had a suite) furnishings were excellent TV had 2 English/news channels (most were German -?owner) climate control was good rooms were very clean bed comfortable plenty of hot water for showers. Daily buffet breakfast was local excellent eggs extra. Service was OUTSTANDING always friendly - desk staff even physically walked with us to ensure we proceeded the right way (map confusing - streets not straight but zigzag!). Location very convenient in Mellah 10-15 min walk to Medina (shopping district) and Bahia Palace. No exercise facilities and local streets VERY tight for running (if interested on vacation!) Would love to stay here again if back in Marrakech!

Review_Date: Kate M wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: Best service in any hotel I have ever stayed in
Review_Text: We took our first holiday ever in Marrakech not really knowing what to expect. When we arrived at the hotel we were warmly welcomed given hospitality and then met by the manager Antonio who talked us through areas we should visit what places were closed or we couldn’t visit as non-Muslims where we couldn’t photograph. He also advised us on where would be good for us to eat - my son is an incredibly fussy eater. He also talked us through a map of the area making recommendations - and provided us with a mobile phone so we had all the contact numbers we needed and access to google maps. This insight was invaluable. Throughout the stay we were so well looked after - and all the staff were brilliant and incredibly thoughtful. I’ve never stayed anywhere where I have been made to feel so welcome. Also the food in the restaurant was excellent. I can’t recommend it highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Tris S wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: A Jewel in a mad city.
Review_Text: This is a 1st for me reviewing a place before I have departed but I fail to see that this hotel has anymore to offer us than it has?  As the title states its an absolute jewel an oasis of calmness in a city of total madness. It has style which is an absolute credit to the owner Mr Abul.  The staff here make this place tick though and also I cannot name any one person who stands out. Because they ALL do from the chefs the housekeeping reception and waiters. They are ALL fantastic and make you feel you so so welcome and valued.  Leanne you must be proud to oversee such a personable team as absolutely nothing was too much trouble for them?  The restaurant is also beautiful serving reasonably priced top notch food in a lovely atmosphere. I feel I should also mention the entertainment at this point in the restaurant. Superb!!  The rooms are beautifully furnished and big enough and immaculately maintained by housekeeping to a very high standard.  Nothing is too much trouble from booking excursions to chauffeurs & restaurants.  As with previous reviews from satisfied customers this hotel IS wonderful. Its was totally our privilege to stay with you!  I will be back.......
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Danielle G wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: The staff at this hotel go out of their way to make sure everything is perfect. We loved our stay and highly recommend this property. The breakfast was amazing the terrace was beautiful and the staff took care of our every whim. Get a hammam there if you can - an experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Adrienne F wrote a review May 2018
Review_Title: The Best Part of our Morocco Experience
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika towards the end of our honeymoon. Words cannot adequately describe how amazing this place was for us. When we arrived Lyanne sat us down and explained how Marrakesch worked and walked us through a map of the city. The room and facilities were excellent. The staff arranged excursions drivers and cooking lessons at our request. Hind and the rest of the staff were always kind helpful and went above and beyond. Things like the helpful staff the "no tipping" policy and the free snacks made us feel at home and made it easy to explore the city. Truly one of the best experiences of our travels. The breakfasts were amazing. They even packed a snack for us when we left. Also the location was wonderful! Thank you!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This place was an absolute gem! Not only does it sit in the perfect location (right in the Medina) but it is clean quaint and really special.
