The staff is beyond welcoming accommodating and friendly. The food at the restaurant was very good. They truly go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable and special.    On my last day I unfortunately came down with a bad stomach bug and the staff did everything they could to make me feel better. They had staff run out and buy me meds brought drink to my room and constantly checked in on my to ensure I was as comfortable as I could be. Upon my departure they even made me a sandwich with some fruit as they knew I had been bed ridden the entire day. Places like this special are hard to come by. Highly recommend!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Highlight of our trip to Marrakech!
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika for two days with our 3.5 year old daughter. It was such a wonderful and memorable experience. The riad is so authentic and well-run and the staff and management were incredibly friendly and hospitable. They made us feel very special - and were especially welcoming to my daughter and making sure she was happy. The manager Antonio spent time sitting with us and explaining all that they and the city had to offer. They helped us arrange travel to Essaouira and even packed a lunch to take with us! Even though the riad is located in the hustle and bustle of the Medina you felt like you were tucked away in a little gem of a place. The breakfast was lovely and a unique experience. Our room was breathtaking (room 2) with a skylight and rose petals spread everywhere everyday. And the best part was there was no TV! so you really felt like you were away on a retreat. I would highly recommend staying here! and memorable experience. The riad is so authentic and well-run and the staff and management were incredibly friendly and hospitable. They made us feel very special - and were especially welcoming to my daughter and making sure she was happy. The manager Antonio spent time sitting with us and explaining all that they and the city had to offer. They helped us arrange travel to Essaouira and even packed a lunch to take with us! Even though the riad is located in the hustle and bustle of the Medina you felt like you were tucked away in a little gem of a place. The breakfast was lovely and a unique experience. Our room was breathtaking (room 2) with a skylight and rose petals spread everywhere everyday. And the best part was there was no TV! so you really felt like you were away on a retreat. I would highly recommend staying here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: the staff at this Riad can not do enough for you. They are very knowledgeable and helpful. The manager and assistant manager ensured they spent time with us explaining maps and organising excursions.  There is a small outdoor seating area if you are looking to spend hours sitting by a pool then this is not the place for you. However if you want to feel very welcomed as if you are visiting hospitable family friends you will not be disappointed. The Riad is conveniently positioned close to the main square.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: They told us not to tip any of staff and leave tip in the end. We were not sure how much is enough.We searched internet and it said 10-20 dirham per day is recommended so we left the euro we had. 5 euro per day. But I do not know that was enough or small. I hope it was enough because I would love to come back here if I am coming back to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have stayed at the best hotels in the world like the Savoy stayed at the most memorable places like Ulusaba on Safari and Dar Anika is up there with these fantastic hotels that we will remember for the rest of our lives. Nothing is left to chance the food is delicious the place is authentic but luxurious it's a relaxing Oasis in a chaotic city. Go and experience the Ying and Yang of life and enjoy it! We will forever be comparing hotels to Riad Dar Anika! We can't wait to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Booked this on the reccomendation of family that stayed there and it was the highlight of our honeymoon. Friendliest attentive staff. Full rundown of the city and what to do when you stay - they will help you get from a to b make rezzies and mostly ensure you have a phenomenal time. Checking out Kaiss their sister riad nearby is a must too.    Perfect location - easy access to souk and out of Medina if that’s also desired.    Can’t advocate for them enough- already convinced friends to make this heir next vacation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jacqueline W wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Riad with outstanding service and comfort
Review_Text: A wonderful friendly and comfortable Riad in a great position. Feels like a quiet oasis amongst the bustle of outside. Lovely roof top terrace for dinner or cocktails. Every member of staff was outstanding. Have stayed in many hotels around the world and this rates amongst the best if not the best!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Like you would visit good friends
Review_Text: Perfectly located at the Qzadria Square in the Mellah Quartier of the Medina Dar Anika and his staff are the ideal place to stay for a couple of nights in Marrakech. If you step out of the hotel and go to the left you will automatically get to the Jemaa-El-Fna Square and into the souks. The atmosphere at the hotel is very familiar and the whole staff is very very kind and helpful. ...You will be treated like Kings and Queens. The breakfast is top notch. There was really nothing to complain about. If we ever get back to Marrakech no doubt this will be our first choice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Very good experience in Dar Anika
Review_Text: We really enjoyed our stay in Dar Anika. The staff was really friendlz and willing to help. The room was very big and nice. The breakfast was the best and very much. A lot of things can be seen near the hotel it is in a very good area. We would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to visit marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Robert M wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: I can’t say enough good things about this Riad and the people that work there. The Riad itself is beautiful with great rooms and rose petals when you arrive etc. The food and service Is also top notch. After a hectic day in Marrakech it was great to come back to this oasis and have a drink.    However the main differentiator was that the manager Antonio really bailed me out of a bad situation where a charge on my credit card by a rug merchant was 10x what I expected it to be. I went to him for help and he used a combination of local contacts and fluent French to help me get it corrected. He then shuttled me around the city by motorbike to make sure it was cleaned up. I feel very certain that at a minimum I otherwise would have spent months haggling with the credit card company to try and get it resolved (if at all).    I typically travel 2 days per week for my job both domestically and internationally. We like boutique hotels with great service. I have to say that Riad Dar Anika truly exceeded my highest expectations and it was the people that made the difference.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Charlotte T wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: If you go to Marrakech this is absolutely the best Riad. Excellence service breakfast was super and the manager Antonio is great! Also the location is very good. The rooms were clean and the beds good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I've never felt so welcome and well looked after the staff were brilliant and so were the rooms so clean and the rooms were made up daily.....great location too right outside our Riad was a market place with an amazing atmosphere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: We highly recommend Dar Anika and we would love to come back another time!
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika from 31st March to 4th of April 2018. The reception and the staff at the Riad were absolutely fantastic with a very good service attitude! We received good help from the host to organize our stay and Antonio and the others gave useful advice about what we should see and what we should experience during our stay. The hosts were professional and they did what they could to make our stay in Marrakech as good as possible. Our room was always decorated with rose leaves and although our room was a little small we had an amazingly nice stay at Dar Anika. The breakfast was very good and the two dinners we had in their restaurant were lovely. We therefore had a great stay in a lovely riad well located to the main sights of Marrakech. We highly recommend Dar Anika and we would love to come back another time!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jonathan E wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: My overall experience at Riad Dar Anika was extremely positive. The staff were welcoming and the room was ready as soon as we arrived which is always nice. They were very helpful in helping us plan our activities in Marrakech and the location of the riad is very convenient in terms of distance from key things to do in the city. The one small issue I had is the food selection at breakfast- I would recommend letting the hotel know beforehand if you have special dietary restrictions and if there are things in particular you like to eat at breakfast. All in all I highly recommend a stay at Riad Dar Anika if you are visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Wonderful service from the team at Dar Anika
Review_Text: We stayed here over Easter and from start to finish we had a really good experience with the team at Dar Anika. From Ms Hind answering emails at all time of day to help us organise our stay to the welcome given on our late arrival Antonio and Lyanne's helpful advice of what to do and see during our stay and the general kindness and professionalism shown by all of the team during our visit; they really go above and beyond to make your time there great.    On arrival we had milk dates tea fruits whilst all of the administrative tasks were completed. Our room was adorned with rose petals and the bathroom and bedroom were of a very good size. Breakfast is never ending from soups to local specialties fresh juice Moroccan tea and more; you won't go wanting!    The team organised a great guide for us and then helped with restaurant bookings. They even organised a bad of goodies on our departure (sandwiches fruit) for our travel to the Atlas mountains. Honestly such a great experience in a lovely riad well located to the main sights of Marrakech. You won't be disappointed should you choose to stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: 3 day break at Dar Anika in Marrakesh.
Review_Text: Hind and Maria dealt with our email booking very promptly and kindly organised a birthday cake a wonderful day trip to the Atlas mountains and a cream tea at the Royal Mansour each that made the trip for a 21st birthday very special. We were greeted at the airport and immediately transported to the tranquil haven that is Dar Anika. A warm Moroccan welcome ( and breakfast ) awaited us and Antonio the manager took time to help us plan our stay and we were given a detailed map and a mobile phone for use if we wished any assistance or information whilst we were out and about sightseeing.The rooms are immaculate and cleaned daily completed with a flourish of fresh rose petals! Staff are always on hand to escort you to/ from the hotel to a private taxi and we had the same driver for the duration of our stay. The first day we took in the colourful souks El badi palace ruins Jemaa el-Fnaa square and finished the evening with dinner at the hotel. This was so good that we ate there every evening and took time to relax listening to the live music in the background. Antonio must be proud of his staff; they take pride in their work and your comfort is their main concern. Our second day took us to the Atlas mountain trip. Hassan was our knowledgable guide who ensured we were walking at a comfortable pace for as long or as little as we wished. We stopped for toilet breaks and bought some books from a local shop for the delighted children in his village. Tip - take a few MAD's with you for this. Hassan's wife cooked us two meals that were served by Hassan on his roof terrace. I have never sat anywhere so beautiful and peaceful ever. It is a shame that we did not have enough time to fit in some of the other trips or hammam that the hotel offer. When you arrive back to the hotel from wherever you have been that day you will be greeted with a cold fruit smoothie or mint tea and biscuits to refresh you. Our final day started with the usual several courses for breakfast and culminated with delicious birthday cake fresh flowers and happy birthday sing song from all the staff :-) Airport transport is recommended and booked through the hotel - (we were also given a bag of sandwiches and fresh fruit for our plane journey home) Riad Dar Anika is a special and calming place to stay and we would return and recommend it without question !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed here at the end of March 2018 and it was a lovely Riad ... we were in Morocco for the week and stayed here on the first night and the last two night... location is really good as you are just a few minutes from the Bahia Palace and around 1 mile from the Jemma El Fna square.... the Riad is lovely ... the rooms are really nice and the staff are very friendly. There is a Internet Cafe/print shop nearby in case you need to print out boarding passes also for your Ryanair Flight . Would definitely stay here again if we were in the area
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Attention to details and personal touch at Max level
Review_Text: We stayed at countless hotels and never felt the need to write an review but Dar Anika truly deserves one. I am going to skip the part about how pretty the hotel and rooms are and how soft the duvet covers are and go straight to the details. In Morocco guests are required to fill in this check-in form to list passport number nationality address etc every time they arrive at a hotel which was very tedious. Dar Anika does this for you we arrived and were greeted with rose water and wet towels to wash and mint tea and cookies to reflex while they filled out the form for us all we needed to do was to sign at the end. Another thing is there is no end time for breakfast we woke up at 1:00 pm thought we missed it but was told we can have it any time we wanted. After that the hotel manager Antonio greeted us and told us not to go the Jardin Majorelle at that time because there is going to be a 2 hrs lineup for tickets then offered us the service to buy tickets for the next day to skip the lineup and also offered phones with data and maps which all comes with a small fee which we were happy to pay. Moreover we were greeted with fresh juice every time we returned and rooms made with different flower petals. What's even more impressive is that on the morning we checked out the manager prepared sandwiches cookies and fruits for us to take to the airport in 2 small bags a letter of thank you and a name tag of us hand written in Arabic. Dar Anika brings a real personal touch we haven't seen in any hotels before and it truly deserves more than a 5 stars rating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve T wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: The staff couldn't do enough .The attention to every detail was fantastic. Courtious patient and helpful. Food was great and there is no hard sell The décor was out of this world .The manager Antonio treats you like family 5 minutes from the Great Square yet so tranquil We plan to go again .We were so impressed 12 rooms and 37 staff to look after you You don't need a car . you are in the center. They will always arrange parking. 2 hours from the High Atlas mountains which you can see from the hotel roof bar
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful and quiet hotel with an excellent location. Step outside the front door and you’re inside the vibrant market. While inside the street noise is completely unnoticeable.    Saying the staff was wonderful is an understatement. Staff members including the owner were always visible and eager to help or answer any questions we had. Everyone was so approachable and genuinely friendly. We were supplied a cell phone upon arrival with preloaded maps for navigating the city. It also had the owner’s personal number if we needed anything got lost or had any questions while out during the day.    Thank you for a wonderful stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Suzanne B wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Brings new meaning to the word hospitality!!
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is perfection. From the wonderful staff to the beautiful decor and ambiance it truly made our stay in Marrakech simply marvelous. Upon arrival our host Antonio greeted us with a map and cellphone which he loaned us to make sure that we could always find our way and be in touch. The entire staff was terrific helpful and friendly. Every time we returned from a day of sight seeing we were met with either a cold beverage or mint tea. There was nothing they would not to do for us from making reservations finding us cars booking tours and giving suggestions and recommendations. There is nothing better then staying in a Riad to ensure that you get the true Morocco experience but I am sure that Riad Dar Anika is one of the best in town.

Having never been to Marrakech and hearing such varied stories from friends who had been before we had no idea what to expect but finding and choosing Dar anika genuinely was the best possible choice we could’ve made. All the reviews praising the staff in addition to the beautiful photos we found online confirmed this would be the place for us to stay. They were even offering a discount for booking directly with them! The price offered was far more palatable than what we were finding on Expedia which made it that much easier to relax and enjoy our time away :)    This level of value we received simply CAN NOT be found anywhere else everything from the smartphone we were given at the start (which had any important numbers already on there; the manager reception and driver to name a few) to the packed lunch we received on our way to the airport all our needs were taken care of before we even knew we had them! Not to mention the additional discount we received due to my partner insisting on paying in cash what a lovely surprise!    So a big thank you to all the staff and the manager Antoni for all the effort put into making our stay so perfect. We have already recommended you to all our friends on Facebook and will be making a return visit as soon as we can!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Very friendly welcome - the owner will give everyone a quick intro with tips where to go and also what not to do! On - Top all rooms are equipped with a Mobile Phone so should anything go wrong or you feel lost in the Medina you can always call the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Larissa V wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Most lovely place I've ever been!
Review_Text: I can only recommend this amazing hotel/ Riad. It's perfectly situated in the Medina/ old town very clean and nicely decorated. This hotel is a next to the visit of the city a stand-alone experience. Every employee is very kind attentive decent ... (from hammam woman receptionist waiters hotel manager to the car drivers). The best thing however was the breakfast. Bread and pancakes is freshly baken in front of you fresh fruits soup cake Joghurt eggs... best orange juice not to forget :-)  We arrived in the morning and were invited to have breakfast at once. We even got a mobile phone in case we got lost in town. I could write so much more but to summ up it was the gratest place I've ever been. My husband and me will hopefully come again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An Oasis in the midst of the fun of Marrakech.
Review_Text: We had originally booked at a hotel but decided to change to a Riad. Boy are we glad we did and particularly at Dar Anika. Manager Antonio and his staff are warm welcoming and go the extra distance to provide a wonderful experience in the heart of the city. Upon arrival your are warmly greeted and provided an orientation complete with a cell phone with map. We spent a 4 day weekend celebrating our niece's birthday and wonder of wonders following our breakfast on that day she was presented to our surprise with a wonderful chocolate cake and the entire staff singing Happy Birthday in French and Arabic! The rooms were wonderful and the souk main square and many of the major sights and sounds are within walking distance. The rooftop restaurant is also terrific with fresh baked breads and crepes for breakfast and a wonderful dinner which is highly recommended if you arrive late in the day and are not quite ready to hit the streets. After a day of sight seeing entering through the heavy door takes you into a veritable oasis to relax reminisce about your activities of the day and plan for tomorrow. Great fun and a truly excellent way to enjoy Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Scott M wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: I stayed with my wife and 2 daughters for 3 nights. Each day something reminded me that this is not a normal hotel. On the first day they provided us with a cell phone that we could use for our stay as our home cell phones could not get data. On the second day my 5 year old daughter had her pencil tip break at dinner - we asked if they by chance could sharpen her pencil - 15 minutes later a pencil sharpener appeared (they went out and bought one at 8PM) On the third day the British woman behind me at breakfast spent 15 minutes chatting with the assistant manager who she had befriended on her visit the prior year - and then proceeded to present him with her homemade marmalade she brought just for him. On the 4th day I left my i-phone in my room and we checked out They found it and ran after us on the street to return it. I wish I could say I was testing their honesty - but I was just being careless. I am sure the staff is well paid but I was impressed by their decency.    There are certainly larger and more opulent rooms to be had - but a nicer staff - that is going to be a tough one.    The location also depends what you want. I thought it was a plus that it was really in the city connected there is a pulse there is vibrancy. If you just want to veg out there are better places - but if you want to see and feel the city Road Dar Anika is an excellent choice. The small scale of the hotel allows for service that is almost impossible at the larger hotels. A great alternative to the chains that are around the world.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: From the moment of booking this had the feel of a great experience and we were not to be disappointed. Arriving was just the start of a wonderful holiday from meeting all of the staff and Antonio the manager. We were asked what we would like to do with our time and everything was arranged. Restaurants and drivers excursion to the Atlas Mountains with a great guide and then a fabulous lunch at his house in a Berber Village. The restaurant staff in the Riad were also so friendly and helpful. Nothing was to much trouble for any of them. Would highly recommend this Riad and Marrakech even for the most wary of travellers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Earl G wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: Well what can I say?    This was our first trip to Marrakech and as we traveled from the airport to Dar Anika late in the evening at the beginning of our five night stay; I was unsure what to make of this crazy - busy metropolis?  However my mild concerns were soon put well to bed as the doors to Dar Anika opened in front of us and we were greeted by the team that subsequently looked after us for the duration of our stay.    From start to finish this is 5* plus! levels of service; we’ve been lucky enough to have stayed in some nice places in the past and this beautiful riad is up there with the best.    After a restful first night’s sleep we were met by Abu who owns and manages the place and it’s equally (if not more🙂) impressive sister riad - Dar Kaiss with his brother which is situated a few streets away.  Abu took time out to personally draw up an itinerary for our five night stay that saw us do everything from trekking in the Atlas Mountains; to eating in the finest restaurants; to getting absolutely lost in the Souks! and soaking up some real Moroccan culture in many of the fine sights that surround this perfectly located property. I cannot recommend this place enough and if you’re reading this? then you’re halfway there!  Go for it. You won’t regret it and we’ll maybe see you back there!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: lisa c wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: This lovely riad overwhelmingly exceeded my expectations. Everything about our stay was perfect. The staff was phenomenal and went above and beyond to ensure my husband and I felt comfortable as first-time visitors to Morocco. Any request was promptly attended to. The hotel is absolutely beautiful with true-Moroccan decor.  The location is very convenient for excursion pick-up while situated at the entrance of the souks making everything easily walkable.    I would absolutely stay here again and would highly recommend it to anyone staying in Marrakech!

Review_Date: Lucy C wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: I visited Riad Dar Anika with my mum as a treat for her 60th birthday and we absolutely loved it!  The staff were so thoughtful and attentive and they always had a big smile on their face. We ate at the restaurant one night and had breakfast at the Riad every morning the focus on traditional morrocan food only added to the charm of the Riad and it was always delicious - I would highly recommend the Monk Fish dish. If you want to eat elsewhere they also make great recommendations for local restaurants.    We booked two extras during our stay the first was a hammam and massage in their sister hotel which was amazing one of the best massages I have ever had. The hammam was a completely new experience..... I’ve never felt so clean! The second excursion was quad biking in the Atlas Mountains which was great fun! The scenery is stunning particularly in March when there is snow on the mountains and the guide really cared for our safety. We would definitely do this again!    Another ‘must do’ activity is to go to the Marjorelle gardens which are stunning
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Vince McLean wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Well-Placed Haven Amid The Bustle of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Dar Anika with another couple on a short 4 night city break. From moment of arrival we were extremely well tended to by Antonio the owner and all of his wonderful team. The Riad is not large (which is mainly why we chose it) but is traditionally constructed around a central internal courtyard with balconies off this leading to the guest rooms and open to the sky at the top. On the rooftop is the lovely Riad restaurant serving all of the meals of the day from breakfast to dinner and beers / cocktails any time you fancy (unlike may restaurants in Marrakech private Riads can sell alcohol even if they are in sight of a mosque). Breakfast is filling and lovely. And we had dinner one night which was also of a very high standard. We were given a quick 20 minute "how to do Marrakech" by the owner Antonio who helpfully marked up a map of the city with places to see and good walking routes to take it all in - very helpful and not at all condescending or lengthy - he even pointed out and recommended other restaurants to try so he was keen for us to experience Marrakech as well not just sell his own restaurant to us! The Riad is right on the edge of the Medina by a square call Bab El Mellah - this means it's perfect to get a taxi there from the airport or if you venture out as there is a large taxi rank in Bab El Mellah Square AND it provides very easy walking access into the old Medina and Jemaa El Fna the main square of the Marrakech market traders. The Riad also has its own car and driver if you prefer to using the street taxis although for tourists either are perfectly safe (the street taxis being cheaper of course). We walked the city end to end over 4 days and loved the sights and sounds we experienced - please do not let anyone put you off Morocco by telling you that you will be hassled by street vendors - simply not true in 2018. If you walk through the souks and markets they will of course try to sell you stuff (that's why they are there) but if you don't want it you just have to politely decline and our experience was they leave it at that. The Riad Dar Anika rooms are well appointed - traditionally furnished many with four poster beds and as some have commented here not all of the rooms are large - but this is a traditional Riad not the Hilton so my advice is to choose what you want before you travel! If you are after a welcoming safe secure clean friendly environment to relax for a few days I do not think you can go wrong with Dar Anika. We plan to return to Marrakech and I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Katie F wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: Amazing Riad beautiful decor comfy cosy rooms wonderful staff! can't say enough about this wonderful place really was a treat to stay here. The staff were so friendly and attentive always with smiles too.

Review_Title: Just a wonderful stay - I will certainly come back!
Review_Text: The hotel is best located in Medina. The staff is more than friendly well educated and experienced. The service is extraordinary. The rooms are very good. The manager took his time to welcome us and give a lot of hints and recommendations. The food is excellent. You feel more like you would stay in a family than in a hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My friend and I were absolutely thrilled with the service we received at the Riad Anika. We felt like we were staying with family. All the little details were wonderful and the staff could not have done more for us. I highly recommend a stay here in this gorgeous Riad in a fantastic location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I totally recommend this Riad. All the experience was great and António the Manager is the best host I’ve ever met. He welcomed us and gave us a lot of recommendations based on our needs and expectations. He was genuinely available and wanted to provide us the best stay during the weekend. All his staff was really polite and the Riad is so cosy. Thank you very much and we will come back for sure!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic Riad just outside the Marrakech Médina
Review_Text: A gorgeous riad with helpful pleasant and courteous employees. It is located just outside the Médina........well within walking distance of approx.0.8 miles. The manager was very pleasant and helpful with information about getting to the Médina. The riad and rooms were beautifully decorated in Moroccan style..........very clean and tidied up on a regular basis. Our bed was so comfortable. In the evenings before supper we went up to the balcony which was set up for relaxation for some wine and beer and view of the sunset. We placed our order for drinks and staff delivered them with some snacks to the balcony...........we felt we were being waited on hand and foot......ha ha.....just loving it. Breakfast was Moroccan style........everything just made and delicious.........we really enjoy their fresh squeezed orange juice..........the service was top notched. I highly recommend this riad.........we really enjoyed our stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: THE place to stay in Marrekech
Review_Text: Everyone at Riad Anika we amazing! The staff really made the beautiful space even that much more special. We came with our daughter and they went out of their way to accommodate us. The food was delicious the hammam and massage excellent the location was perfect! Just steps away from all the major sites (Bahia Palace Tombs etc) and also the Souks but it felt like a quiet oasis. Amazing trip!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Overall: The riad was beautiful quiet welcoming and extremely comfortable. The riad provided a stress free environment to relax after a hard day of sightseeing.    Service: The service provided by the staff was the best I have ever experienced from my travels throughout the world. The level of detail the service provided was just amazing. Despite arriving late in the evening the staff had arranged private airport transfer and welcomed us with tea and pastries. The next morning we had the best breakfast I have ever had the pleasure of eating from a hotel (more about this later). After the breakfast the manager sat us down and gave us a complete overview of the area and offered his assistance in helping us schedule anything we wanted to do. Additionally we were provided with a smart phone to ensure we would never get lost and could get in contact with the staff if needed. Then to our delightful surprise after a day of walking the city the staff brought cold daiquiris to our room. I could easily go on for an hour about the high quality of service provided. Do not think twice about staying at this riad. Oh even on our way back to the airport the riad provided us with a small bag with sandwiches and fresh fruit for our travels. Then on the way to the airport my wife realized she had left her bag behind. The riad quickly sent her bag in another vehicle which delivered the bag to us at the airport. Truly amazing service and staff. All the employees were extremely polite and helpful the entire trip. I have never felt so welcomed on vacation.    Food: Amazing. The breakfast was beyond all expectations. There was soup yogurt fruit salad crepes eggs made to order fresh pastries fresh orange juice tea coffee etc. Everything was fresh and delightful. Again the staff’s service even at breakfast was simply perfect. Furthermore dinner did not disappoint. The dinner at the riad was the best we had in Marrakech. We ate at several restaurants with the highest of ratings throughout the town but none of the other restaurants compared to the Riad. The atmosphere was perfect. Every night there was live music. The music was at the perfect volume and did not distract from the overall atmosphere.    Again I can’t say enough good things about our stay. Do not hesitate to stay with Riad Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Very lovely hotel and extremely nice service. Especially the breakfast was very good and plenty. The hotel employees and the manager are very friendly and courteously. They gave us a lot of tips and information about Marrakesh as well. We loved staying at Riad Dar Anika and would recommend 100%.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Danielle L wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Just had the best experience with all the Dar anika staff they made me feel like a princess.. so nice so thoughtful.. like a big family.. definitely gonna go bak again because of them!! it was my first time in Marrakech and I'm gonna recommend it to everyone! 5 star service beautiful and comfortable environment just nothing more to ask because they have taken care of everything!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jeremiah Christopher wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Title: A lovely Riad, with terrific service!
Review_Text: A lovely hotel with amazing personal gracious service! The location was pretty great too! The rooms could use some love and care a little refresher in the decor. The suite we stayed in was a bit run down.  The manager Antonio and his staff are all incredible in doing their jobs. Oh and they took care of me after I feel ill even making special trips to the market for things that might make me feel better. After a day and a half I was feeling much better. Thank you to all the staff for their sincere care. The pool is heated and pretty the rooftop restaurant was a nice place to enjoy breakfast and/or lunch.. Thank you Dar Anika for such a pleasurable stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Marrakesh     There are 5 Star hotels and Boutique hotels rarely is there a Boutique hotel with 5 Star service.  Riad dar Anika is just such a hotel.  Ok so you have to fly to Marrakech to stay there it's well worth the trip.      We were greeted on arrival withMoroccan tea milk & pastries in the lovely court yard  just off the main entrance.  Our room was strewn with rose pedals gratis water and more pastries. Every day they were replaced. While the room was small it was just perfect for 2. The shower will accommodate 2 cozily with plenty of towels.    The hotel manager Antonio sat with us answering questions giving us a detailed overview of the city.  He offered to schedule trips book us transportation etc.  I'll revisit this later I want to tell you more about the hotel.    I wake before my Significant Other (SO) and rather than disturb her I stepped out of our room to one of many cubbyholes with couches footrest & chairs.  Rarely was I there for long when staff began arriving offering me tea or coffee. PS. The stairs are hand cleaned by a staff person with towels.      There is a restaurant upstairs where we had our best meal in Marrakech Vermicelli & Chicken.  The service was worthy of a Michelin star.  Yes we've been to many 3 star Michelin restaurants. While we dined there were 2 musicians playing what I assume was local music.  It certainly enhanced the dining experience.     We had the hotel book a car one night to avoid negotiating to/from trips to a restaurant a 15/20 minute ride.  This was a wise choice as this restaurant sits on the outskirts of town with no noticeable traffic.  We liked the car service so much we booked our airport return with them.     Suggestion book pickup at the airport unless you were raised in a family of Horse Traders and actually enjoy negotiating every cab ride.  I was raised in such a household and negotiated 150$Dirham to the hotel.  If you factor in the highway robbery of changing USD to Dihram at an airport kiosk there was no savings over the Hotels pickup charge.      The Riad manager Antonio is amazing.  Great service is because of great management.  Every person in the hotel offered any service we could ask.  All were done gleefully rapidly and with a thank you on their lips. Many times we were stopped and asked if they could do something for us answer questions recommend a restaurant hail a cab point us in the correct direction. Great staff backed by a Great boss.     I posted pix of the Riad on my FB page only to have a friend say he had stayed in the hotel in 2017.  He could not praise the hotel enough. We both agree it is our favorite hotel anywhere.    We left early in the morning and as we left The manager gave us a bag filled with fruit & breakfast sandwiches for our flight.  It's the little details that make an amazing experience.     Thank you for a wonderful stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: What a fabulous hotel to holiday

Review_Title: Best place to stay in the Medina

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Magical oasis within the Medina of Marrakech!
Review_Text: Stop searching for the perfect place to stay on your visit to Marrakech! Morocco can be a culture shock for foreigners but Riad Dar Anika will make all the difference between an absolute dream come true and a nightmare! Sure there are less expensive places to stay but this is so worth the splurge for the peace of mind that comes from being nestled within the safe oasis and absolute paradise of Road Dar Anika where they see to your every request with the response "As you wish". My husband and I visited Morocco with our 18 year old daughter so her safety as well as our own was of upmost importance to us. From the moment we made our reservation they reached out to us by email with important information about our upcoming stay. They offered transportation to/from the airport (which I highly recommend) meals to be ready upon our arrival (which I didn't book but we were able to order lunch upon our arrival anyway) and a fantastic selection of activities that we could prebook (we chose the desert camel ride excursion (loved it)! Their driver was waiting for us at the airport upon our arrival. He spoke perfect English and made us feel so welcome and so comfortable on the drive. The hotel is located on a pedestrian-only street so he dropped at the nearest point which is a lively intersection within the medina full of cars people mopeds animals and all kinds of incredible sights sounds & smells that will overwhelm your senses! But there was an employee from the hotel waiting when our van pulled up to carry our bags and guide us safely to the riad. As soon as you enter you are struck by the beauty within and they immediately made us comfortable on sofas within a glass room overlook the courtyard pool. It was now time for tea! Everywhere you go in Morocco they will offer you hot mint tea and cookies! And the tea service is a whole elaborate production! Them the manager came and sat with us to welcome us and find out what we wanted and didn't want during our stay. He then went through everything we needed to know to have a safe and enjoyable visit and offered to help us in any way we desired. This little chat squashed any concerns we had. My husband asked where the nearest ATM was so that we could get some local currency it was just around the corner but he assisted on sending an employee with us who led us there and then stood behind us to make sure nobody bothered us while we used the ATM. Now when I say bothered I don't mean in a physical way. We took a lot of comfort in being told that 90% of the locals earn their living from tourism so although they want your money they will never so much as harm a hair on your head to get it because the king has very strict punishments for anyone lays a finger on a tourist. After lunch we took a stroll to Marrakech's main square Jema El-Fna. We've traveled all over the world but this was like nothing we've ever seen! It was a great introduction to the city and not to be missed but it was summer and it was Africa hot so we were happy to return to Riad Dar Anika for a refreshing swim in the pool before the a delicious Moroccan dinner overlooking the courtyard pool while enjoying live Moroccan music. Day # 2 we enjoyed breakfast by the same pool before a van picked is up for a 30-minute drive outside of the Medina for our 90-minute camel ride in the desert. I'm so glad we booked this directly through our hotel as we knew we were in good hands and completely safe. There was a whole group of tourists from other hotels as well and the camel guide took a lot of care assigning us to the best camel for each of according to size and disposition while at the same time keeping families together. The camel guide was French and spoke enough of several languages to give us all detailed instructions on to how to mount the camels safely (while they were sitting in a line connected to each other by rope) and more importantly how to stay on when the camels all simultaneously stand up. They had given us all authentic Moroccos robes and turbans to wear and they were clean and pressed and perfect for souvenir photos! They are quite accommodating if you ask them to take photos with your own camera but don't worry if you forgot yours because they also take one of each person and at the end of your ride they hand you a complimentary print they made for you! And by the way you can keep your camera and your purse or backpack with you during the entire ride because they show you how to hang it from the camel's saddle handle. The ride is within a little desert oasis so no cars to worry about and it's so easy and so fun with lots of interaction between the guide and all the riders. 1/2 way through there is a break and everyone gets off camels and pose for more photos etc before riding back to the starting point where you enter.a little house for bathrooms before being served hot mint tea and the most delicious fried treats. Once we returned back to our hotel we desperately need another swim in our hotel pool before a relaxing dinner and night in our hotel. You could absolutely fit in another adventure in the evening but we were tired and the rooms are so fantastic we wanted some time to just enjoy them. Day #3 we wanted to sunbathe and although Riad Dar Anika has an indoor pool their sister property has a rooftop pool just a short stroll away and they offered us to let us use it. It was perfect! The manager escorted us down there and introduced us to the staff who he instructed to look after our every need. They generously provided an available room for us to change in and we spent a couple hours drinking fresh squeezed juice while alternating between lounging in the sun and cooling off in the pool. Afterward my husband and thoroughly enjoyed a couple's hamman which is a traditional Moroccan bath.You start nude (or in underwear if you prefer) and an attendant preforms a series of rituals from ladeling hot water all over you to rubbing black mud all over your body scrubbing your body from top to bottom exfoiliating your skin giviing you a massage and washing your hair. Afterward they wrap you in robes and guess what...they serve you hot Moroccan tea! The whole experience was absolutely heavenly and not to be missed! That night we had a special dinner planned outside of our hotel (I will review that seperatley). Day #4 we booked a guide through our riad to take us shopping in the famous souks of Marrakesh. It's a little walk beyond the main square we visited on our first day. We thought hiring a guide would help us navigating the endless stalls down a maze of winding paths and it did as well as help us haggle for a fair price (this didn't really seem to be the case). But the main problem was that I like to look at everything before I decide what I'm going to buy. We spent 3 hours walking around looking around at all the merchant stalls selling everything from kaftan robes slippers leather goods spices arcane oil and beauty products to lamps rugs. Since we had a flight to catch that night this didn't allow enough time to go back and make final purchase decision so I recommend not waiting until your last day to do this. Anyway this review is about Riad Dar Anika and I wholeheartedly recommend staying here when you visit Morocco. Everything from rooms to cleanliness to food to service and more was absolute perfection! Simply the best!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: It was a pleasant surprise our stay at Riad Dar Anika for the past New Year in Marrakesh. The staf was very attention all the time special Mr. Antonio the manager very kinde and gave us all the information about the city.

Review_Text: Dar Anika has an excellent location allowing you to walk to so many sights yet also have easy access to taxis to venture farther out. The lounges dining rooms and sitting areas are all strikingly beautiful tasteful and yet also exceptionally comfortable. The staff were unparalleled in their professionalism but it was the personal touch that really made the difference. Their warmth and helpfulness were truly remarkable. I would name a few but they were all so uniformly kind and went out of their way to make sure we had a good visit. We celebrated my husbands birthday during our stay and they arranged for flowers a cake and the whole staff singing Happy Birthday in 5 languages! It was truly memorable.  The restaurant was excellent and we wound up eating dinner there several times in addition to our leisurely and delightful breakfasts which were included.  The excursions they arranged for us were great. We especially enjoyed our day in the Atlas Mountains.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: First time writing a review because we loved Anika!
Review_Text: Service was exceptional and we felt like staff were caring us like for their family members. It was a first stay in Morocco for our 2 weeks honeymoon. While we were nervous about going around in the city it was amazing they let us use a phone for emergency and the city navigation. The room was very clean and the amenities are thoughtful. When we leave for a 4 days dessert tour they handed us a lunch bag with sandwiches and fruits which helped us a lot for a long survival road trip!! Thank you Anika for amazing hospitality! We will definitely come back for our anniversary!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Dar Anika is right at the entrance to the Medina and an oasis of calm. It’s close to everything and a lovely small hotel that feels like a home away from home. Could not be nicer! The owner Antonio and the staff were absolutely superb.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: barbara D wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: The Dar Anika is a lovely riad in the medina. It's quiet luxury was much appreciated after exploring the old city camel riding excursions and treks to the Atlas mountains which were expertly arranged by Antonio and his staff at the riad. I would certainly return to this lovely hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Frederico S wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: We stayed there for 5 days early January 2018. People are very nice excellent service and very good installations! Well located and easy access to many touristic areas. Amazing terrace with view to the medina the ambiance of the pool area is relaxing excellent breakfast and good price!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We booked into Dar Anika based on the reviews in Tripadvisor. What no one mentioned was that some of the rooms are very small and face onto the main small road down to the Square (Room 6). Window opening was thus not an option. Also breakfast is on the terrace directly above this room and all movement of chairs and tables is clearly audible below. Not good.    We made immediate complaints that the allotted room did not constitute a luxury room but the Riad was full that night. Fortunately the owner has another Riad only 5 minutes walk away and we were transferred to Riad Kaiss.    None of this was ideal but I must report that at all times the staff were more than courteous kind and helpful.    I have written a separate review of Riad Kaiss
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Robert T wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Title: An oasis of calm amidst the bustle of Marrakesh
Review_Text: Just returned from a Christmas break at this delightful and friendly riad; Antonio and his team go out of their way to make you feel welcome and comfortable and will do whatever they can to make your stay memorable. Superb location just minutes from the main square and souk but far enough away to escape the hustle and bustle when you want. We had a fantastic holiday
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I would highly recommend Dar Anika to anyone looking for an authentic boutique Marrakech experience. The staff are attentive kind and knowledgable. I thought it was an incredible value for the cost. Such a gem!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Unbelievable experience, couldn't recommend any more highly
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed here while in Marrakech and at first I was hesitant because of the price. However in retrospect I easily would have paid twice the amount to stay here and considered it a win. The staff was accommodating the manager took the time to help us plan our stay in the city the food was delightful and the hotel was beautiful. I left feeling like they genuinely cared about our experience not just in the hotel but in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Very nice, smal and central lying accomodation
Review_Text: it was a short trip. the hotel is easily accessible. friendly staff. very good quality of the breakfast and the lunch. sometimes music in the evening. only 12 rooms. a typical smal courtyard - house recently renovated. very forthcoming management. if you´l have any question they´ll help you. i can really recommend this location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Book Riad Dar Anika - you will not regret this!
Review_Text: My wife and I has the pleasure of staying in Riad Dar Anika last week. The Riad is beautiful the staff are friendly and incredibly helpful. The food is delicious. One night I was poorly; the staff went out of their way to provide emergency medication in the middle of the night. Even on leaving we were given a goody bag with food and fruit. Best decision to make to book this beautiful Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Linda K wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: You almost feel like you are staying with friends. When we arrived we sat down with tea and cookies and they went over the map of the Medina. Pointing out the best routes to take to see the Medina and good restaurants.    Food in the hotel was excellent as was the Hammam experience was something everyone should try. Their attention to small details really sets this hotel apart from others.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a beautiful and well located riad for visiting all the local stunning palaces gardens and square. I cannot recommend the Dar Anika more highly and hope to return sooner rather than later. There are so many wonderful things to mention so I hope I manage to remember everything:  Rooms - the bedrooms and bathrooms are beautiful the design is stylish the attention to detail is impeccable and the public areas (corridors pool rooftop garden and restaurant) are also attractive very clean and just wonderful to be in. There is a very calm atmosphere here and Dar Anika provides a tranquil oasis from the hustle and bustle of the manic streets outside.  Restaurant - the food is of a high standard very tasty and served by caring friendly staff. The breakfasts are so filling that you will need to walk a very very long way to work them off! On that subject however do not be surprised if you are served soup with breakfast. Some of you may be surprised by that tradition but I assure you it is worth trying.  Staff - everyone here has the knack of anticipating everything you might need without being overbearing. The manager was immensely helpful and the font of knowledge for advice on what to do both locally and further afield. He even supplied us with a mobile number to call if we ever encountered a problem when out and about. On leaving he provided us with a snack and fruit for our onward journey. I still have the beautiful canvas bag it was served in and use it with fond memories.  I would recommend using their airport pick up and drop off service along with considering one of their organised tours or treks.  Treatments/Spa/Pool - I would also highly recommend giving the hammam a try and if time and budget allow a massage. My skin has never looked so healthy for several years. If I could I would go all the way back just for a hammam...  The pool is chilly and refreshing. Both the pool at the Dar Anika and at their sister hotel are stunning and eminently instagrammable!  That covers about the gist of it. If you are a couple looking to celebrate a wedding or an anniversary then this is the place for you. If you are looking to celebrate a special birthday then this is the place for you. If you appreciate beauty in design and want to go somewhere that you will remember forever then this is the place for you.  There is a reason that this place scores highly on Trip advisor and the reason is  quite simply that the Dar Anika looks after its customers. Nothing is too much trouble.  Thank you all for a wonderful wedding anniversary that I celebrated with you Dar Anika. I will be back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very friendly and helpfull staff. We will come again
Review_Text: A above standard Riad with extremely friendly and helpfull staff. We can recommend to stay in this Riad. Management is really interested in our opinion and really want the guests to feel like being with friends. They did everything that we could relax and have a perefct holiday. Even special wishes were no problems for the staff. Thank you very much. Continue like you do your job now.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: First visit to Marrakesh - definitely not our last
Review_Text: Excellent position just at the entrance to the medina and close to the palacestombs and Jamaa el Fna square. Breakfasts were fantastic and really enjoyed our dinner in the restaurant. Extremely helpful with showing you where to visit and best way to get there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I cannot fault this hotel.  It is in the perfect location in Marrakesh. You are treated like royalty.  It is small and cozy an oasis of peacefulness just off the busy square.  It is one of the few decently priced hotels in the world I could not fault in any way.  Could not recommend highly enough!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: beautiful riad. had a great time staying there. after a day of walking in the old town it was great to go back and relax. staffs are very friendly. my family enjoyed the stay very much. will recommend to friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: From the moment I walked into to the hotel my experience was wonderful. The facilities are beautiful...you feel like you are walking into your own home. Registration was easy and thorough. The room was very comfortable. Dining was delicious and the roof top bar had an incredible view. I found this to be a very special experience and have already recommended it to several friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: My husband and I had the true pleasure of staying at this riad for 6 days. From the moment we arrived everything was wonderful.  The riad emailed us prior to our departure from the USA to confirm our visit and also gave us a few tips for navigating the airport. They also let us know that that had a driver to pick us up if we wanted that service. What a welcome relief. The thought of navigating a taxi after 15 hours of flying sounded too stressful. Our flight was 2 hours late arriving and the hotel driver was waiting on us. Bless him.  Upon arrival at the riad the staff set us in a wonderful lounge room and bought hot mint tea cookies and dates. Also they gave us warm cloths to clean our hands and sprinkled our hands with rose water. Wow!  Our first morning we met with the manager Abu. He gave us a map and made suggestions for us. This was so helpful. It saved us time money and energy.  Breakfast was an experience. The waiters would bring out several different courses and quickly clean away our used dishes. Such service!  We ate dinner at the roof top restaurant twice and the food was clearly prepared by an experienced chef. There was wonderful live music and beautiful burning candles everywhere. It was the cold season when we were there so small heaters were running and I was given a warm cape to put on. The cape was so nice that they helped me order some from their tailor; I took them home as gifts.  The room was very comfortable and modern. We were amazed how often the kind maids came to refresh the room. This included sprinkling fresh rose petals on the bed and in the bathroom. There was a variety of pillows and a great memory foam bed topper. The manager Abu was concerned that the Call to Prayer would wake us up in the morning as there is a mosque nearby our window. He had made window covers with padding to muffle the noise. Amazing attention to detail.  The common area and lounge were beautiful. At night the glow of the pool and all the candles were simply magical. The cleaning staff was constantly tidying up.  After coming in from a day of shopping we heard a knock on our door. Staff was delivering a frozen fruit drink to refresh us.  The location of the hotel is perfect. It was a 5 minute walk to the main square down the small street next to our hotel. Once you get to the main square you can orient yourself and get just about anywhere on foot.  We did take advantage of the hammam and the spa. We had never done a hamman before and did not know what to expect. The lady who took care of us was so gracious and made it easy to relax and enjoy a skin cleansing used for centuries by the local people. It was very private  professional and we could do it as a couple. We would not have done a public hammam. The young lady who did my massage and mani/pedi was wonderful.  In fact the entire staff was wonderful. They are genuine caring people and it shows in their work and their smiles. Many riads exist in Morocco but we believe you would be hard pressed to find one more attentive to service cleanliness and a desire to give you the best experience than this one.  If you have any reservations about coming to Morocco please lay those aside. its is a country of wonderful inviting people and a beautiful place to visit.  Betsy & Dan Mills
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights at Riad Dar Anika and really appreciated the warmth and hospitality of Antonio and his team. Everybody was so friendly and really went out of their way to make sure we had the best time in Marrakech.  Highlights: the wonderful welcome of dates and milk breakfast and dinner on the glorious roof terrace Antonio taking the time to really help us plan our visit and organize our trip to the Atlas Mountains the lovely staff and the location just on the edge of the souks. They even prepared us a packed lunch for our bus ride to Essaouria.    Would definitely come back and highly recommend. Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Lovely boutique hotel great service super location. The team managed to cater very well for dietary restrictions too. We had a very enjoyable four days in Marrakech and also loved the in-house hammam.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lia W wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: I cannot recommend this place enough! You must stay here. We stayed at two Riad's while we were in Morocco the first which was Dar Anika (and the second one was in Fez). It was almost hard to enjoy the second riad because Dar Anika goes ABOVE and BEYOND what is expected when you stay at a Riad.    From the moment we stepped in we felt welcome. We were offered tea and were able to relax while they checked us in. Antonio the manager at the riad came to meet us and then sat down with us to tell us about Marrakech. He provided us with a map explained how to get places that we were hoping to see and also gave us new ideas of where to visit. He also gave us tips and tricks for navigating the city and how to stay safe. The fact that he took time out of his day to do this was beyond my expectation!    Our rooms were spotless and comfortable. The beds were so comfortable! There were also snacks provided as well as beverages. We would also be provided with milk and dates at the end of the day which is a Berber tradition to welcome guests as well as fresh squeezed juices.    Our first night there we ate dinner at the restaurant and it was delicious! We split the lamb for two and it was perfect -- although quite a bit of food so GO HUNGRY! Everything was flavorful and incredible! If you aren't lucky enough to stay at Dar Anika you should at least go for dinner!    Breakfast was also delicious and fresh. Fresh pancakes omelettes and bread were made fresh every morning in a traditional fashion. On our last day our driver was coming at 8 am and so they arranged for us to have our breakfast early which was such a nice touch! In fact they also packed us a to go lunch just in case we got hungry in the car :)    I have to give a special shoutout to Antonio and his entire staff. I wish I remember ALL of their names (Ridwan - I remember yours since it sounds like red wine!) because they all were so kind and welcoming! We enjoyed chatting with them and getting to know them. Ridwan actually saw us out walking around in the Jemaa el Fna recognized us and talked to us on his day off. We loved all the staff and cannot say enough good words about them. They work so hard to make your stay memorable.    One more thing -- we did the Hamam at Dar Anika and loved it! It is small but perfect for a couple. The woman who does the Hamam was lovely kind and made us both feel so comfortable. The products they use are natural and good quality. Also importantly the hamam is SPOTLESS. If you are going to be getting (almost) naked in a hamam you don't want it to be dirty. Highly recommend -- and then follow it up with a massage.    All in all Dar Anika was amazing and we are already wanting to go back! Hopefully we are able to make it to Marrakech in near future and if we are -- we will definitely be staying at Dar Anika!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Wendy V wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: We had such a lovely time at Dar Anika. Antonio and his staff did absolutely everything to make the best of our three day stay. Arriving was such a pleasure as we were all treated like princesses ( 4 friends ) the house is perfectly maintained and staff is always ready to help out. Rooms are cleaned and taken care of regularly. Lunch and breakfast were perfect and so delicious. The bread and pancakes are freshly and traditionally cooked right besides us. This Riad is the place to be to have a great traditional experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Absolutely the best place to stay in the Medina!
Review_Text: It is one of those places that grow you on you the longer you stay. And by the time you leave you just want to stay longer. The entire staff is amazing and all they want is to make sure you have a great time. Antonio and his team really care about you having the best possible experience in Marrakesh. The roof top is the best place to have breakfast or a tea... and breakfast is great!    The location is perfect. You can walk everywhere cabs are always available a 2min walk by the roundabout and if you want to take a break mid day you are usually never more than a 20min walk away.    If we come back to Marrakesh this is for sure where we will stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The best experience you can have in Marrakech !  High quality and service  all the staff friendly! Delicious restaurant and breakfast with home made bread and "crepes" !  Very good location !!  Really very very good !!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ashlee D wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Amazing experience here at Dar Anika! The staff was  warm and welcoming they ALL go above and beyond to make sure you have a great stay. Abu and Antonio made the best accommodations to insure we were all comfortable and felt at home. This was by far the best experience I have had at any hotel. Dar Anika did  exceptionally well in service the facility is well maintained and the food was amazing! I can not wait to plan my next stay here! Thank you guys for all of the hard work you all put in it is greatly appreciated!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had a wonderful time at the Riad Dar Anika. They were thoughtful and greeted us with lovely homecoming when we arrived as well as sat with us to arrange any events we were interested in. Better still they thoughtfully answered my unending questions about the area. Our only suggestion is they add variety to the restaurant menu (both for breakfast and dinner). The staff were outstanding..very thoughtful and friendly. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: OLD WORLD GAMOUR IN AN EXOTIC LOCATION
Review_Text: I had the good fortune of experiencing what I consider a trip to the past by staying at this Riad. This is where to go if you fantasize about staying in a far off land in an old world style glamorous romantic and intimate hotel. It is located on the edge of the medina in the old Jewish quarter where you feel like you will run into Indiana Jones. A hotel that caters to your every whim. The food is exquisite 5 star quality The rooms make you feel like you are back in time with old world glamour. The staff is dedicated to ensuring that your stay is 100% memorable and will go all out to provide for your every need. If they don't have something you desire then rest assured that they will go out and find it for you. Don't waste your time going anywhere else. Trust me me you will leave there with a lifetime of fond memories.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kirsty L wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: Amazing service. Beautiful place. Central location
Review_Text: Our family went for a wonderful five day trip with our two teenage boys. We had a brilliant time. Are well. Enjoyed the fabulous weather. And the staff were fabulous. Full of trip ideas and booked everything we wanted from visiting masseuses to nail appointments and swimming pool access at nearby hotels.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Philip L wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: It had been a long drive from Fes to Marrakech and when we arrived at the Riad Dar Anika I was tired and grumpy. It was hot and the Riad itself did not compare to the grandeur of the Riad in Fes. It didn’t help when we walked the medina because when compared with the quiet calm of Fes the medina of Marrakech was dusty and dirty and one was assaulted by the diesel and gas fumes of the motorbikes that seemed more of a presence than the busy crowds. There was the constant worry that you would be run down by them on the narrow streets. Our room turned out to be small and cramped as all the rooms were full. That night I told my wife that I was prepared to give it a two out of five stars despite the thorough briefing about “the what to do and not do” in Marrakech when we first arrived. We were to stay four nights and I did not have high expectations.  But gradually almost imperceptibly we were thoroughly seduced by all that is the Riad Dar Anika. A Riad is a home. Its outer walls are unassuming but inside it is inviting and protective and a sanctuary. Riad Dar Anika represents the best of that tradition. In retrospect it began with that very first briefing when we were asked what was of interest to us and we were then presented with options. We were guided as to how to negotiate with the vendors how much to pay taxis what areas to avoid and where not to eat. We left that briefing wishing that we had been given that introduction when we first came to Morocco a week before. We were moved to the number 1 room when it became available. Recommendations were spot on.  Every member of the staff attended to our every need. We were asked not to tip them and that leaving a tip at the end was at our discretion and not expected. It allowed us to enjoy the interaction with them rather than struggle with the barrier of a monetary interaction. Complimentary pastries and fruits were always available. Staff would escort us down the street to hail a taxi. When I asked for a paper clip to pop out a SIM card for my phone the manager actually produced one on the spot that was already bent. He said that he carried them with him because the guests sometimes requested it. When one young staffer was asked about how he liked working there he said that he enjoyed it very much and that the manager was like a father to him. On the terrace one staff member brought extra peanuts rather than the usual mixed nuts because he noted that my wife preferred them. And at breakfast crêpes and eggs were brought without request after noting our preference. At the end when we left for the airport the owner and manager and staff said goodbye and we were given a carrying bag of fruit and sandwiches with a customs form that was already filled out for the both of us. The attention to detail the smiles the caring about our well-being were ever present. Abu is one of the owners and it is his warmth and caring that cascades down to the staff. And just as Dar Anika gave a sense of being a guest of a family I too felt that I had developed a sense of family in that I sincerely invited him to see us if he ever came to San Francisco so that we could host him as well. We felt that the Riad Dar Anika was a home away from home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Don't think, just enjoy ...a stay to remember <3
Review_Text: Where to start ? If you have already read many of the other reviews you get the idea. The entire staff is very friendly service oriented with the sole intent to make your stay as easy and enjoyable as possible. If you have thought about something out loud it likely has already been put into action for you to just enjoy. You will no doubt appreciate many of the special touches they have planned for your stay.    Do take advantage of everything Dar Anika has to offer including a visit to their Sister property Riad Kaiss just a short walk away. It is all exceptionally well done. Abu & Antonio have fine tuned the experience you will have staying with them in Marrakesh wether it be for a few days or a longer stay.    Our only regret was not having more time in this wonderful city. We will definitely return.    Many thanks <3  Jillian & Clay Vancouver BC

Dar Anika is at the entrance to the Medina proper but still just 20 m from a main street and can easily reached by car. The proprietor and staff are very friendly and helpful. The building is beautiful and quiet although near the busy city center. Room is comfortable and spacy enough although not huge. Construction is traditional with verandahs around a central courtyard and a very nice restaurant/bar on the roofterrace. Food is very good and the waiters are top.    Due to the traditional architecture the rooms are very dark since there are no real windows meant to give natural light.    Is it overpriced? Yes for sure but then again you do not have to worry about anything and you get great memories for your money spent.    Only point for the easily scared: the place looks a fire-trap: no windows to the outside and just one wooden staircase leading to the one small exit. If anything happens (which of course is not very probable) your chances of a safe exit are not great (as the house is built to keep chances for intruders to enter minimal).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hi! we were there for 3 days and I it was so beautiful . The Riad was next to jamaa lfna square also they offer a delicious food like tajines and tanjaia . It the famous food in the red town Marrakech. For all that I want to thankful the group of the Riad
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 days and it was great. To be in a oasis on the edge of the Médina was a fabulous treat. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful Antonio the manager explained how to experience the Médina and what to visit. The complimentary cocktails were appreciated and the dinner we had on the rooftop was high quality. We would strongly recommend this as a place to stay when in Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Feel at home at this beautiful Riad
Review_Text: The staff made you feel that you are staying at your own luxury villa. This small intimate Riad is an oasis in the city. Wake up in the morning to birds chirping as it has an open air courtyard where you can have breakfast in the mornings. Made to order breakfast was excellent. Try the Moroccan pancakes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amanda M wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Let me start by saying the staff could not have been more accommodating during our stay. Very friendly and helpful. Arranged transportation when necessary and offered to set up any tours we would like. My problem with the riad was with our room. It was very small and we had a hard time fitting both of our travel suitcases in the room. The shower did not have a door and the bathroom floor was soaked after every shower. the bed was also very firm and I found it to be uncomfortable. I also found the room to be very noisy the last night of our stay- I don't know if it was the room above us or noise from the courtyard but I was woken several times during the night. Given the amount we paid for our room I was very disappointed in the room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tony H wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika was perfect for us on our 4 day trip to Marrakech. The service was exceptional and Abu and Antonio made us feel like we were their special guests. The rooms were excellent and complimentary drinks were frequently provided when we came in hot from the medina. The roof terrace was a wonderful setting for the excellent breakfasts dinner and an afternoon drink. From arrival nothing was too much trouble and Abu gave us a really useful map tour of places to go - an enormous help on our first trip to Marrakech. The location is perfect as well with everything within walking distance. At the end of our stay we asked if there was somewhere to keep our bags because we were catching a late flight and we were told to just keep our room so we could freshen up later. Then on leaving they gave us some food for the journey and they'd even filled in our border papers to speed us through the airport. The attention to detail was impeccable and this hotel was a huge part of making our experience so amazing. I 100% recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Javier V wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Good location very close to the centre of the medina by a straight ahead street ideal for voyagers addicted to the medina.
