Fantastic awesome staff specially the two maitre d’hôtel (breakfast & dinner) and Antonio the MD always in charge and fully dedicated to his guests.    Very good restaurant at the top terrace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: vague travellers wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: The Friendliest Place which helped us have an amazing experience
Review_Text: We knew nothing of the city and picked Dar Anika based on Tripadvisor reviews and its website. All the favourable reviews reflected our experience too.    We loved the residence and the comfortable rooms around the courtyard. Abu's explanation and suggestions around dos and don'ts in the city were invaluable as were restaurant suggestions and a great tour to the Atlas Mountains with a friendly and knowledgeable local guide. There are plenty of those tours offered around the city of course so it was good to be able to rely on Abu's suggested guide. Also when we decided not long before we left that one of our group's swollen knee meant we couldn't do the walk we had booked the hotel immediately came up with a replacement idea arranged that with the guide and took it all in their stride.    The other point we wanted to mention was the friendly and helpful service we received from everyone there no matter what their role. Their attitude really adds to the stay and we hope that we let everyone know how much we enjoyed their interactions with us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Corinne R wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Everything about this place is perfect! Started with an amazing reception and a beautiful clean and comfortable room. It's location was perfect too right in the square. We wanted to have a great meal and see belly dancers and Antonio made a great recommendation (Azar) and arranged a reservation and transportation. Completed our stay with an amazing breakfast on the rooftop deck. Upon departure Antonio even sent us off with a packed lunch for later that day! This place is highly recommended!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika for three days and it was an amazing experience! Abu and his staff made us feel at home. The best briefing of do's and dont's in Marrakech was given to us upon arrival there. The hammam experience was very pampering and luxurious. Highly recommend starting your trip there at Dar Anika. Hoping to go there again soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: marie m wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: We totally enjoyed this very special Riad in Morroco. The rooms were impeccable the food delicious and the staff remarkable.The staff in particular went above and beyond the call of duty to meet all of our needs.We LOVED Riad dar Anika and highly recommend this jewel to anyone traveling to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mike & Aly C. wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika was a dream come true for my husband and I. While traveling to Morocco was way out of our comfort zone we felt nothing but comfortable in Marrakech after our warm greetings from Antonio and the fabulous staff at this Riad. From the sunlight filled courtyard in the morning to the glowing pool and patio at night dar anika highlighted for us the beauty that Morocco holds. Location is perfect! Staying there puts you within walking distance of all major sights (sites) in Marrakech. The service at Dar Anika is additionally exceptional; every detail thought about including the the rose petals on our bed still water in our room a customized map of the cityand sandwiches prepared for our departure flight. Make sure not to miss a meal (or two!) and drink at the restaurant on the rooftop! At Dar Anika kitchen the ambiance is superb and every option on the menu is exceptional! Trust us... we tried them all! Can’t wait to visit again soon - highly recommend to everyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: M S wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Beautiful riad on the edge of the Medina with an attentive staff that caters to your every need. Easy walk to the main square Djemma el-Finaa. Terrific restaurant for dinner and the best home-made yoghurt for breakfast. Definitely worth a stay when you are in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Debbie H wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: We had such an amazing stay here the service is really second to none and the building is so beautiful. The staff were so friendly and helpful and the manager Antonio took the time to sit down with us and let us know where to go recommended restaurants and also told us what to watch out for in the market square!    Every time we returned back we were presented with refreshing minty iced drinks and fresh fruit. The breakfast was delicious with so much food you don't need lunch and fresh bread is made in front of you by the ladies in the riad. The room itself was gorgeous and covered with rose petals and very romantic. As we left the staff even handed us filled in flight cards so we didn't have to worry at the airport and also gave us a bag of sandwiches and fruit for the plane. Such lovely touches that you just don't get at the big hotels. I would highly recommend staying here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fabulous manager and staff made for a very enjoyable break
Review_Text: As previous reviews have mentioned nothing was too much trouble for this riads' team. Antonio especially was wonderful and his staff followed his lead.  Lovely comfortable rooms and perfect location within the medina ( old town)  We were allowed to use the rooftop pool in their ( very close) sister hotel which was a treat every afternoon as we ordered a cool beer to relax with. Each drink was accompanied by a dish of olives and other tasty nibbles which was most welcome.  I cannot recommend this highly enough
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Don't hesitate to book. Lovely staff great rooftop restaurant beautifully clean and brilliant location short walk to main square. Have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world but have never been looked after as well as at Riad Dar Anika. Can't believe there's anywhere better to stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Originally I had 4 nights booked at Dar Anika. I had read so many great things about it. From the moment I arrived at the airport their excellent customer service commenced. A lovely driver was waiting. On arrival which was early in the morning after the traditional welcome I was offered breakfast. This was very unexpected given that my check- in time was not officially until the afternoon. Then came the welcome and briefing with one of the owners-Abu. This was very helpful for me as I was travelling by myself and whilst I was excited I was also a little anxious about being in the Medina alone. However I followed all of Abu's instructions and all went well. I also tried the hammam and massage. Both wonderful experiences. After my first wonderful night at Dar Anika Abu suggested a walk over to Riad Kaiss to see their second property! Within an hour I had moved to Riad Kaiss! (See my other review on Riad Kaiss) Dar Anika was fantastic and is very deserving of its TripAdvisor status and reviews! Flawless!

Stayed here for 3 nights and it was wonderful. It is ran and owned by a very friendly Spaniard called Antonio. Nothing is too much trouble gave us really helpful advise at our briefing and the place is beautifully decorated and comfortable. The biggest plus point of this place are the fabulous staff who really took care of us and made us feel at home. The breakfast are amazing on the rooftop terrace. The location is perfect to experience the hustle and bustle outside the Souk as the locals get about their business and return at the end of the day with the tranquility inside the riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lane J wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Great place to stay while visiting Marrakech! The location is very convenient within the old city and walking distance to a lot of the sites as well as the souks. We very much enjoyed our stay. The staff was lovely friendly and very accommodating. We stayed in one of the rooms on the main level and was very pleased. The rooms were kept nice and clean and decorated with rose petals upon arrival. We ate breakfast both days at the riad and was very pleased with the food and service. Would definitely recommend to anyone staying in the area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The Riad is within walking distance from Bahiha place and a great escape from the hustle and bustle of Marakech medina. All the staff were very nice and helpful. They always smile and are ready to help us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nigel T wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Superb hotel in the middle of the walled Medina.  A quiet oasis away from the outside hustle and bustle  Abu a great host and gave us all a very warm welcome and ensured that during our stay nothing was too much trouble  This is without doubt the best staffed hotel and most friendly we have been in over many years of travelling all over the world.  Thank you Abu and all your exceptional staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Our stay at the Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: We have just returned from a 5 night stay and can honestly say the service we received from Abu and all of the other staff at the Riad was exceptional.  We were treated so well from the moment we arrived in Marrekesh with the car journey to the Riad which the staff had organised for us beforehand the warm welcome with treats to eat and drink the time Abu spent with us explaining all that we needed to know about the city and providing a map so we wouldn't lose our way with highlights that we might like to see shown clearly on the map a beautiful room with fresh fruit and biscuits everyday and rose petals in the room making it both look and smell lovely the lovely argan oil based shampoo and body wash provided the refreshing iced lemon drinks provided whenever we returned from days out the amazing food in the roof terrace restaurant organising reliable taxi journeys for us around the city suggestions of great places to eat and drink staff that went out of their way to help us with anything we needed an early breakfast today on our day of departure and even a picnic lunch for on the plane to Abu getting up early to personally wish us well on our journey home.  We have stayed in many hotels around the world but in our opinion none have ever provided such warmth kindness and total dedication to their guests as the Riad Dar Anika.  For anyone looking for a beautiful stay in an amazing city we would highly recommend this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Fabulous hospitality location surroundings and food. Just fabulous all round! There really are no words to express how great everything is at the Dar Anika I've never felt so spoiled by such wonderful warm friendly people nothing is too much trouble and they attend to your every need. A huge thank you to Abu and his team for making my birthday break just perfect!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We spent three lovely days at this hotel. Abu and his team were excellent commencing with a warm welcome and an overview of points of interest in the medina. The room was very comfortable and the breakfast was a treat.    We had access to the sister hotel which was around the corner. They have a lovely pool which we used to cool down each day.    Overall we could not have asked for a more hospitable welcome to North Africa .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emma L wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: So glad we chose this hotel Abu and his team are as much about developing a great relationship with their customers as they are about providing excellent service great location and the help and advice given was invaluable in getting the most out of Marrakech food was fabulous staff were fun and couldn't do enough for you. We recommend the trip to the Atlas mountains they have gone out of their way to make this a great experience and Abu's personally chosen guides give you a great insight in to the local culture  The interior architecture of the Riad was amazing encapsulating the essence of Morocco must try the lamb banquet...highly recommended  would definitely return

We left Marrakech with sweet memories from Riad Dar Anika thanks to the warm welcome that the staff and the owner offered us (couple + baby). First of all the location is great: it's at the door of The Old Medina two steps far from Dar Bahia Al Bedii Palace and El fnaa big place. It is easily accessible with a baby stroller. The Riad is cosy and nice the restaurant is in the terrace on the rooftop I have enjoyed my first fish tajine there and every morning we go up to have our breakfast with fresh orange juice harira (morrocan soup) traditional bread eggs yogurt fresh fruit salad and of course a big cup of coffee to start the day. I have to mention that they served also my baby with a vegetable soup every morning.  The Riad has also its private hammam. Small yet convenient. Khmissa the lady who took care of me has magical hands. I have enjoyed a relaxing massage while Khawla the receptionnist was playing with my 7 months old baby boy.  We left the Riad this morning at 4 AM and we found the owner standing up at the door to greet us with a lunch box full of tasty fruits. Can't recommend it highly enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Patricio L wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: The best service I ever had in a hotel. The team is so kind and willing to make you happy!    Feels like home and you will never wanna leave.    And the Dar Anika has a great kitchen as well.    We will definitely come again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Heather M wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed for 6 nights at Riad Dar Anika. From the moment we walked in to when we walked out the service from the management and staff was UNBELIEVABLE! The location of the riad was perfect. The taxis were right there so when you needed one it was easy to get. A close walk to the medina but also a lot of great shops around. We were worried about being able to use our phone but the riads wifi was never an issue and we bought a SIM card (for gps when we weren’t at the riad) from a store right across the street (which the staff informed us about). The food was VERY good! They have live music a few nights a week also during dinner which was awesome. Although I would love to share the many details the staff did for us I think you should just see for yourself and enjoy the surprises. I know we DEFINITELY did!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John B wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: We chose Dar Anika on the basis of its reviews on TripAdvisor and were worried that it couldn't possibly live up to the hype. But it did and then some. Everything was seamless and flawless from arriving at the airport (the Dar Anika driver was right by the door!) to the food to the room to the location and the service. We wanted to benchmark it against some of the big flash hotels around Hivernage and these literally could have been anywhere in the world. And just huge impersonal establishments as opposed to the Dar Anika which felt like coming home very day. It's in the best location to tour from - right on the edge of the narrow streets - but not quite inside the maze meaning you can walk in or taxi out on a trip with ease.  I've stayed in a lot of decent hotels but this one is genuinely one where they actually really care that everything is as perfect as it possibly can be.  Many thanks to Abu and the whole team for an unforgettable experience - we'll be back. 11 out of 10.

Review_Title: The place to be in Marrakech
Review_Text: Riad dar Anika is superbly located for everything you may want to see and experience in this fabulous city. The staff are welcoming friendly advisory and attentive - nothing is too much. The rooms are beautifully decorated the breakfast is an experience in itself the roof terrace a perfect place to relax and the pool a great way to cool down. The hammam and massage organised by the hotel is a must!!! Will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: First time to Marrakech but from the moment we were met at the Airport to the moment we got back to the Airport we felt entirely encompassed by the hospitality and warmth of Dar Anika facilities and staff. Simply have no recommendation for improvement and highly recommend the Hamam. The location is excellent allowing for easy access into the main sites but also giving some quiet break the from the busy city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect hospitality and a tranquil haven
Review_Text: My best friend and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Dar Anika and couldn't have wished for a more perfect base. A huge thank you to Abu and the team for 5* hospitality.    What we loved:    The hospitality absolutely perfect in every way attentive but not over bearing.    The food in the 'Kitchen Dar Anika'. We had the 8 course set menu with the lamb for 2 (don't eat before dinner there's so much food!).    The Hamman and in room massage a lovely treat big thank you to the lovely ladies doing the massage.    The rooftop bar and sun loungers a great place for pre/post dinner drinks.    Abu's welcome briefing. Abu told us the best places to eat and made table reservations and shared handy tips with us.    Our room (superior twin). Spacious clean and well appointed.    The pool here and at the sister Riad the Riad Kaiss (5 mins walk away) which we used free of charge and was on a great spot up on the roof.    The feeling that you were part of the family 🙂Everyone looked out for us and gave us top tips to keep us safe and maximise our stay.    What we didn't like:    Absolutely nothing!    This was my 2nd time in Marrakech and I would have no hesitation in recommending the Dar Anika. Book with confidence!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Karen T wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: We had such a lovely stay all the staff were extremely welcoming and helpful. We felt like we were staying with family. Fantastic experience made all the better because of the hints and tips from Abu
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Dar Anika for 6 nights. The service was impeccable with all the staff going above and beyond to please you. This little gem in the middle of the city is surrounded by every tourists' dream. Close by they have a couple of well known palaces museums the tombs and all the souks (markets) you could ever imagine. The receptionists were polite and highly organised. The bellboys went the extra mile to make sure we were comfortable. The cleaners made sure the rooms were spotless each time we went in. The breakfast staff were attentive providing service out of the ordinary. A special thanks to Abu who made our holiday uniquely remarkable.  Thank you all for welcoming us like family in your wonderful home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We arrived to a warm welcome at the Riad including tea and a swift check in. Our room was lovely with roses to welcome us on our honeymoon. Breakfast is a treat and the advice we were given by the manager was very helpful before we headed to the souks- the guide they also organised was excellent. Dinner is good and there is a strong wine list.    Before we headed off after our two night stay we were furnished with two pre completed departure forms (in case of airport queues) and a delicious packed lunch for the road!    A really warm and relaxing first part of our honeymoon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Oldouz M wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: Lovely short stay at this Riad
Review_Text: Nice short stay at this Riad which is at the heart of the medina but very quiet inside. Very clean lovely decoration in the traditional Maroccan style. Staff was friendly and helpful at all times. The breakfast was served on the roof terrace tasted nice and was presented with care. It's a good place to stay as a couple or people who want it more quiet as there isn't much going on here. There is a small pool but not appropriate to swim in but you can use the sister hotel/riad which is close by where there is a bigger pool and lounge area on the roof.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The service is unlike anything I have ever known! Amazing food too. The Hammam made the holiday for us make sure to go for one while staying. The staff cannot do enough to make you feel comfortable with or being overbearing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I stayed at this Riad for 4 days. Breakfast and free wifi was included with my stay the Riad is beautiful and all the staff were friendly and very helpful especially Nabil and Mohamed. I had dinner at the hotel the food is great I would definitely recommend anyone to stay at this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Sadique J wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Dar Anika is an intimate cozy riad with an attentive staff. They try to accomodate every need of yours from the chef to the Manager Antonio. The breakfast is a generous high quality spread of morrocan and western delights. They pay attention to detail in serving breakfast and if you ask for something not available they rush to the market to get it fresh for you. The rooms and bathroom are standard size. The location is great near the main road and at the entrance to the souk. What made our stay special was the care we got from the general manager. He oriented us before our trip to the souk and warned us of pitfalls. On our exit our departure airport forms were filled and were provided snacks for our voyage home. Now that's called SERVICE!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Manzar S wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Outstanding hospitality and top notch customer care at this hotel that no other hotel has matched in my worldwide travel. Highly recommended hotel.  All staff were highly vigilant in looking after our needs. In particular the chef's hospitality and his attitude towards paying attention to details and catering for our individual preferences. Super guy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I normally do not write reviews on hotels but due to the outstanding experience I had during my stay at Dar Anika they definitely deserve the recognition. I only stood there for 3 days but after a long week of traveling between countries I am so thankful I ended my trip here. The hospitality and the care for their customers I honestly could not have asked for a better place to end my trip. The entire staff was warm and inviting. The food was amazing they served many different dishes but as a person who loves trying all types of food I was overjoyed when a new tray of food came to the table. And it was all delicious. I also received a massage during my stay which I accidentally woke up late for but the staff was more than willing to accommodate for my tardiness. I could not speak more highly of this place and express the amount of gratitude I have for them. A million times thank you to Dar Anika for an amazing stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Jennifer K wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: From the moment my friends and I stepped into this hotel we knew it was a dream come true. From its lush greenery to the beautiful decor and serene music it felt as if have walked into an oasis or spa. What made our stay incomparable to any other hotel was the excellent customer service and hospitality of the entire staff. The rooms decorated with origami towels and light rose petals. Rooms also equipped with the ACs that will keep you cool int he hottest of temperatures. The staff was all so pleasant and helpful from organizing a car tours or escorting us to a nearby place you will never ever experience service such as this. Antonio and Clarice were so helpful with organizing my rooms and greeting us with the utmost class and service. They catered to everything my friends and I requested even running out to get Benadryl for my friend who was not feeling well. Abu the owner was a gem. He sat down with us and mapped out areas to visit and to avoid. Where else can you get an owner of a hotel to sit down and converse with guests? On my birthday the staff surprised me with a cake and even sung a Moroccan rendition "Happy Birthday" to me. I was so blown away by how close we all had come in such a short period. I highly recommed this riad to anyone visitng Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Georgia H wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: No warning of moving our booking
Review_Text: We arrived and were told that we wouldn't be staying there and had to move to another riad operated by the same management. There was no warning of this happening at all. Furthermore we were given no information on price differences etc. Luckily for us the other riad was amazing and we had a great time.    We were very disappointed we didn't receive any emails regarding the issue.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Overall a very nice place very friendly and accommodating staff especially Lahasan at breakfast time. Antonio the manager went out of his way to assist us with our forward journey to Spain and tickets to the Alhambra in Granada. Location is ideal right at the entrance of Al Madina with a 10 minute straight shot to the square. Would stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The owner Antonio and his staff are hands down the most wonderful people in the business! Their attention to detail is evident in every part of the hotel which itself is immaculate. From the moment we arrived we felt welcomed and right at home. Larson in charge of guest services catered to our every request always with a smile and a funny story to tell about his family. It was impossible to not relax and laugh when he was around.  I honestly can't say enough about the hotel it's staff and it's wonderful dining. This is really the only place to stay while in Marrakech. You will not be disappointed.  Thank you Antonio Larson and Dar Anika staff for the most memorable vacation ever! You will all be greatly missed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Zelikha H wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: My husband and I went on this trip for our honeymoon. We stayed in the riad dar Anika bc it was highly rated on trip advisor and other travel sights. We were not disappointed. This place exceeded our expectations. We felt like we were at home away from home. Service was amazing very attentive and very friendly staff. Would recommend the hamam and massage experience it's worth it especially on the first day of traveling. I think it would be a mistake to stay anywhere else when in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tiffany W wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Excellent staff very helpful and courteous extremely attentive service. Our host Antonio greeted us warmly with drinks and Moroccan snacks and gave us a very thorough overview of the sites history restaurants and how to survive in the city. Great location right at the Medina but also accessible by car to the new town. All in all impeccable hospitality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Casey M wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: We just stayed at Riad Dar Anika for two days of our honeymoon and I cannot say enough about this hotel. They have amazing attention to detail and great customer service. Upon arrival Antonio the manager spoke to us in great detail about our stay and helped give us advice for the souks and restaurants to go to. Hotel staff members are all fantastic as well. They came with fresh drinks when we arrived back daily cookies flowers and even pastries on our last day. When we left for the airport they even packed us a bag of sandwiches and fruit to eat on the plane. We also had a fantastic dinner upstairs on the patio with beautiful views. Breakfast was also served on the patio!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent customer service and delicious food - worth a visit!
Review_Text: Hotel/restaurant was recommended to us by a friend and we thought we ought to try it. I reached out to the hotel/restaurant to book a table of two for dinner at very short notice via email and they were more than happy to confirm this in just a few hours.    On arrival staff were friendly and checked us in and showed us to our table. Food was delicious and arrived on time too and the staff were also very friendly throughout the service. All orders include complimentary gazpacho as an amuse-bouche and mint tea shot of liquor and luxury biscuits for desserts.    Restaurant is very highly recommended and the food and service are worth every penny!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Malin L wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: One night at Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: I was travelling to Marrakech for a businessmeeting but arrived one day prior to the meeting and decided to live one night at Riad Dar Anika. It was fantastic. The room the service and the food. They really did everything they could to get me as comfortable as possible. As I was travelling alone I really appriciated their kind advise and help.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We called in for a drink and it was such a lovely experience and quiet oasis we booked for dinner for the following night. We were not disappointed. Before ordering our table of four were given nibbles bread and delicious soup. We preordered the fish as they order it for the evening. We also had 7 hour slow cooked lamb and a salad. We put everything in the middle so we could all share the delicious tastes  The food was divine as is the service and setting. Can't recommend it highly enough

We had the pleasure of spending 3 nights at this amazing hotel. It's about 10 guest rooms so let's say 15-20 guests at any one time. I bet they have more employees on duty at most times. Truly amazing! Everywhere you turn there is an employee cleaning offering to help you or whatever. When we got home my wife's first words were "I am not ready to take care of myself." They truly did everything during our stay. The daily breakfast is amazing. Lawson and his team are first class and will give you all the food you can eat with lots of different options! We have two gluten free eaters and one dairy free eaters in our group and they made sure every meal had a variety of foods for them. The second day Lawson brought out a PLATE FULL of gluten free options for my daughter to enjoy. Just FIRST CLASS all the way! We also had dinner at the Riad a couple of nights and it is truly spectacular to eat wonderful food under the stars with amazing service and live music. Even if one is not staying at the Riad the restaurant is open to the public and I do recommend it highly. Let me get back to Lawson. In a hotel full of amazing employees I think he might have done the most to make our stay special. I got sick one day and he brought me special tea to drink to calm my stomach. He then came back later to check on me. He even gave me some of the tea to take with me when we headed to the airport. He is a gem but like i said all the employees are excellent. Antonio the manager greets you and shows you a map of the city. Very informative and we felt no rush. He took his time to explain everything. The location of the Riad is excellent if you want to be in the Medina (the old city). It's about a 10 minute walk to the main square. A short cab ride or long walk to the new city where more modern restaurants and nightclubs are. The hotel has a very small pool which are kids enjoyed to the fullest. It's not warm but it's refreshing after a hot day. Upon checking out they even gave us sack lunches and they completed forms for customs which was nice as we didn't know they were required and we chuckled to ourselves watching people filling them out next to the line at the airport. If we go back to Marrakech we will stay at Dar Anika again for sure!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Carol A wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: Amazing Riad not to be missed
Review_Text: From the moment we stepped inside this beautiful enchanting Riad- Full of ambiance and wonder we were overwhelmed at how wonderful every single detail was. Every member of the staff were exceptional with their service and hospitality. It was the best place we stayed in all of Morocco for a unique very special experience that we will never forget. From the initial greeting with Abu till the departure we were sad to leave. Amazing delicious food and catered to you. Excellent location as you step out the front door straight to the Medina. They can arrange your entire stay in Morocco and I highly recommend it. They know all the best places to go and see and to eat. We would definitely stay here anytime and hope we can get back soon. I cannot say enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing raid - food, service, facilities and hospitality
Review_Text: We only stayed for one night but the hospitality and service at this riad was outstanding. We were given complimentary mint tea pastries dates milk and cakes during our very short stay. The owner Antonio is very knowledgeable and incredibly helpful. He even provided bags and sellotape for us to wrap out newly purchased Moroccan lights in.  The rooms ( ours were the basic rooms) were fabulous and spotlessly clean.  We ate on the roof top terrace and the food and service were excellent.  If you are looking for a riad with five star service and facilities then here is a must. Another bonus is its location - it is a 10 minute walk - in a straight line to the main square. We have got lost many times around the souks in the medina trying to get back to our riad - but this time we were pleased to find it so easy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Travis P wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: Everything about Riad Dar Anika is great
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at Dar Anika for 4 nights. The owner and staff were friendly and tremendously helpful the food was excellent and the location couldn't be better. It is more expensive than many of the other riads in Marrakech but we felt that it was more than worth it. I would happily stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great place, great staff, great location
Review_Text: We stayed here for three days recently and I cannot praise it enough. it is well located for the Souks and other places in the Medina and has a wonderful roof top restaurant. The breakfasts are really good and we were supplied with lovely fresh drinks and fruit whenever we got back from an excursion. Very clean and comfortable room. Best of all are the staff who are very friendly and helpful and made everything easy particularly for travellers like us who were new to Morocco. It also makes arrangements for excursions; we went to the Ourika valley for the day with a very good guide. In all very highly recommended and would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My family of three (2 adults and teenager) had a marvelous three night stay here. The Riad is an elegant peaceful oasis in the perfect Medina location easy walking to several nearby historical sights the main square in the Medina and the Medina area itself. We stayed two nights in one room plenty of room with a single divan for our son and lots of wardrobe space then did a two day side trip to Ouarzazate with a driver/SUV arranged easily by reception staff (who sent us off with a lovely lunch). We returned to a different even larger room again with a nice divan for our son. The staff service and meals were excellent! Your arrival is welcomed by staff offering mint tea dates fruit and Moroccan sweets in the salon off the beautiful courtyard and upon return from ourcafternoon walks we were greeted with refreshing melon juice. The owner sat with us and a map the first day to orient us to the city the sights restaurants and areas of the Medina very helpful. We had delicious dinners on the rooftop accompanied by a classical Moroccan Oud player lovely. I am gluten free and the chef ensured I had a wonderful breakfast since I had to miss out on the crepes and hot pitas! Every need was anticipated here and we could not recommend it more!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Ben J wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: I don't have the vocabulary to give Dar Anika justice. This is quite simply the best hotel that I've ever had the pleasure of staying at.  The architecture decoration and cleanliness is second to none.  The staff are extremely attentive but in no way overbearing or obtrusive and always appear at just the right time with a cold drink or light snack without ever having to ask.  This hotel is worth the trip to Marrakesh on its own. I will definitely be returning just to stay at this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Ashvin Joymungol wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: I spent three wonderful days in this amazing hotel. At the time of booking I was considering other 5 star hotels but I was intrigued by the comments on Riad Dar Anika most of which were very complimentary (and long). These comments swayed my decisions and I opted for Riad Dar Anika.    Situated in the Medina this beautiful hotel is an oasis of calm in these hectic surroundings. I have spent time in many iconic hotels around the world but the service of the Riad Dar Anika rivals any of them. Abu the owner and all the staff go out of the way to make your stay memorable and make you feel special from the moment you check in till you check out.    I will very highly recommend this amazing hotel.

One of the best hotel I've been. Especially the greatest service. It makes us feel like home. Mr. Abu is a great owner and gave a lot of help. I really recommend this hotel.  這應該是我們住過服務最用心的的飯店！隨時隨地都提供意想不到的驚喜，讓人有賓至如歸的感覺，老闆Mr.Abu熱心又好客，提供許多協助，衷心推薦!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Simran Jeet S wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Title: Excellent place to stay in Marrakesh
Review_Text: My wife and I came to Marrakesh for our honeymoon and stayed at Riad Dar Anika. We were not entirely sure where to stay and a friend recommended Riad Dar Anika. In retrospect we are so grateful for this suggestion because we ended up staying there and absolutely loved it. It was so perfect that we actually feel like it took our honeymoon to the next level.    First of all its location is one of the prime spots in the entire city. We had easy access to the main square (jam al fana) which meant we were easily able to come and go as we liked. We really enjoyed hopping to and from the square at night which I'm not sure we would have done if we had stayed elsewhere. That itself made the trip because the spectacle of the square at night is a highlight of our time in Morocco. We were also closely located to many of the other main attractions of Marrakesh and the hotel staff helped us realize that many of the top-rated restaurants in the city were actually within walking distance.    Speaking of the hotel staff I have to say that we have never experienced such hospitality anywhere we have been. We were waited on hand and foot from the moment of our arrival to after our departure. The hotel staff greeted us with tea biscuits fruit and fresh milk by the pool as they checked us in the hotel. We asked there help in arranging a hot air balloon tour and they helped us find and book the top-rated tour in Marrakesh. They also helped us arrange hammam and massage treatments and they helped us find bike rentals as well.    Beyond hospitality the hotel manager and staff were so attentive to any problems that we might be encountering and helping to correct them. There were a couple of small glitches in our stay but the manager and staff went above and beyond to correct these. It was truly one of the best travel experiences that we've had staying at Riad Dar Anika!    We didn't realize it at the time but the restaurant at the riyadh itself is one of the most highly rated in all of Marrakesh. We enjoyed an elaborate breakfast every morning with careful service and attention from everyone in the kitchen. The food was some of the best we enjoyed in Morocco and the service was probably the best we have ever experienced. Honestly it's hard to put into words how incredible the hospitality and service was at Riyadh Dar Anika. We loved it so much that we are hoping to come back and visit. My wife and I highly recommend it and guarantee that you will have a wonderful experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Simon G wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at Dar Anika for two nights and cannot fault the place the service or the attention to detail. We arrived delayed with no luggage after the airline lost it and had to wait another hour at the airport - despite being two hours late our transfer was still waiting for us with a big smile. On arrival we were met by the manager Antonio who was incredible. He gave us all his knowledge of the area suggested somewhere to get clothes and even offered to book restaurants. The room was lovely not huge but this riad is not about that. It's intimate but you feel like you are on your own and with only 12 rooms you almost are. The only thing I can fault was the squeaky bed frame! We had a brilliant couples hammam and one of Antonio's recommendations (Azar) was one of the best dinners ever. The riad is located in an awesome location at the entrance to the markets but not in the middle so it's nice to walk in and out.    The last finishing touch was on check out Antonio provided us with pre completed departure card which just gave us one less thing to think about doing!    Overall a first class venue and one to definitely recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The Perfect Hotel Solution for Marrakech
Review_Text: The Riad Dar Anika is the perfect hotel solution for Marrakech. I generally stay in five star hotels and considered that for Marrakech. I believe that I was much better served staying in the Riad which is close to the medina and in the center of the "action". The hotel is clean safe and has a terrific roof garden where meals are served. We had drinks up there every evening even when we dined elsewhere.    The key to this hotel is staff. The courtesy missing from many hotel stays is clearly in evidence at this property. The manager Antonio sets the standard for courtesy caring and above and beyond customer care. I really cannot stress how Antonio made our visit to Marrakech: He spent over an hour on arrival marking walking tour routes for our two days of touring; he arranged (and it was terrific) our tour of the Atlas Mountains including the guide at whose home we had lunch; he was offended that we had a bad meal at a restaurant he endorsed and without being asked contacted them for a refund; he was present at breakfast each morning...just to make certain that the guests had no issues. Antonio and his staff define hospitality in an industry where it is frequently absent.    I highly recommend Riad Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: robert b wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: After being lucky enough to stay in many 5-Star hotels over the years Antonio and staff have raised the bar! Everything about our stay was excellent: staff services advice food hospitality location etc.... But it is the small things really make the difference at this level of service for customers and that is where Dar Anika excelled. From the owner to the manager to the staff it was the training and caring balance of details that sets such a great standard for every other property. Thank you. Robert and Pam from Laos.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Xavier D wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: I don't make a habit of making reviews on places I go to. There are too many. I travel as a pilot all over and to be perfectly honest I have grown sort of "blasé" over the years and pretty hard to impress. Doesn't mean I am a bad person you see only human nature after years of doing hundreds of hotels on all continents... well you get the point right ?  But this time around I had to pause for a minute and think to myself "Really ???"  What should have been just another layover of 48 hours somewhat felt in the end like I had been a Sultan spun out of a Aladdin fable roaming his personal palace as he pleases unobstructed free to be exploring this dreamlike palace from Hammam to rooftop swimming pool from luxurious suite with intricate details to sipping mint tea in the lush courtyard in front of the fountaincomplete with warm service staff that actually cared about you like family almost. In fact so much so that it doesn't even feel right to refer to them as "service staff". Doesn't do them justice at all!!! They were more like friends. Ismail Anes were stellar dedicated and so friendly. The place is STUNNING and authentic in decoration true to its spirit of former palace down to the most minute details. I kid you not when I say that the people made us all feel like we WERE royalty there. The manager Antonio was so accommodating to our needs and I was blown away by the kindness of Abu the owner whom I hereby genuinely congratulate on behalf of my whole crew for running his ship so superbly. I congratulate all the employees who go above and beyond what's required even for a seasoned traveler... the souks and famous landmarks are literally right outside the door too. This place is unlike anything I have ever seen before and will have you cry out loud to delay your return ticket!!!  Really only one bad thing to mention... our stay in Marrakech was too short!!!!!!!!    The Gulfstream crew
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Tobias H wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Perfect stay at an oasis of quietness in the middle of the bustling Medina.
Review_Text: We were staying for three nights in Riad Dar Anika and we enjoyed the very attentive service excellent food and helpful advise during our time at the Riad.  It all started at the airport with a perfectly organized limousine transfer and went on after a short ride with a warm welcome and helpful explanations by Antonio the manager upon our arrival. Make sure to grab one of Dar Anika's well made maps as even smartphones are of little help in the narrow streets of Marrakech.  We had dinner pre-arranged at the Riad well in advance of our trip and this was a great choice as we enjoyed the lovely atmosphere on the rooftop terrace succulent food and impeccable service. After a cosy night's sleep in the perfectly quiet room we enjoyed breakfast on the terrace with home made breads fresh fruits and eggs made to order.  The Riad is in walking distance of any main attractions including the Jemmah El Fna Square. On my wife's birthday she received a charming surprise after breakfast. Everything was just perfect.  Upon check-out we were given a lunch bag by the caring team of manager Antonio. We will definately come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This riad is an amazing oasis in the old city. I have stayed here numerous times and every time been impressed with their service and the lovely atmosphere. The location is perfect as the medina is right outside your doorstep!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Gaby K wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Dar Anika is a feast for the senses and one of the most amazing experiences I have ever had.    From the moment we arrived the service was second to none!    We were welcomed with rose water to wash our hands and delicious Moroccan tea and pasties in a beautiful room that took our breath away.    Our bed and bathroom were covered with rose petals.    Even though we arrived after midnight we were taken up to the roof top to enjoy the views and served with every request.    The next morning the breakfast was delightful and the manager took time with us to map out our day with a local map book all our desired excursions and advise us on how to avoid issues and gain the most from our stay.    The service here is truely something to experience as there is nothing too big to ask for and all your needs are met with great speed snd a smile.    We were sad to leave as this really was such an amazing place to stay.    We will be back and highly recommend this beautiful place to all.    If I could give it 10 stars for customer service I would.    Thank you to all at Dar Anika you made us fall in love with Marrakech :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I have visited Dar Anika and Riad Kaiss honestly it has been long since i had such a service and attention.excellent welcomingprofessional servicerooms are above standardhygienecleanliness and warmness the moment you step in.Food is excellent and what i appreciate most is the attention from all the staff. highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Susan W wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: A beautifuly restored traditional Dar in the heart of the Madina. Once we stepped through the doors the noise & bustle of of the busy streets was left behind. When we arrived we were told "this is your home" and we were certainly treated like family rather than just guests nothing seemed to be too much trouble.    Everywhere was spotless and the service was excellent there was bottled water & fresh fruit in bowls in the rooms as well as in the public areas and very return was greeted with the offer of either a delicous fresh fruit (non alcoholic) daiquiri or mint tea. We took dinner & breakfast on the roof terrace overlooking the city the food was excellent and the service very friendly.    The air conditioning in the room was both efficient and quiet (a huge plus). Be warned as this is a traditional Dar there are no windows opening onto the street and some of the rooms are quite small although perfectly adequate for sleeeping in and the communial areas are very relaxing and peaceful to sit in.    Antonio the manager took time to advise us on how best to explore the Madina safely and at our own pace. He advised us about various exceursions both the pros and cons and again modified them to suit our needs.    We stayed for 8 nights and were offered the opportunity of having a slightly diffrent experience of staying at the sister Riad - Riad Kaiss. This was a different but equally amazing experience which I would definitely reccomend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alan M wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Best hotel service I have ever experienced, no hyperbole
Review_Text: We stayed for two nights and were treated like we had just bought the hotel. The staff were universally terrific not just because they were amiable and helpful which they all were but also because they paid great attention to detail.    The room was on the smaller side but cozy and well decorated. The restaurant menu was similarly compact but the food is good enough to compensate for any perceived lack of variety. Fair warning about taking breakfast on the rooftop terrace: you will likely be swarmed by bees.    Seriously though if you find yourself in Marrakesh you have to stay at Dar Anika. It's one of those hotels that make you want to come back to a city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Lee L wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: From arrival pickup to sending us on our way with prefilled departure cards and sandwiches and fruits to go everything was thoughtfully arranged and prepared.  Our room no 10 was just off the reception on the ground floor. It can get a little noisy during the day but it was so convenient to be able to open your door and speak to the reception or order morning coffee and breakfast. Upstairs rooms might be quieter.  Front desk is there 24 hours a day. We usually get home late at night they will open the door for you.  Had in room massages one day it was really good!  Abu the concierge knows the best places to go. Antonio the GM always on hand to attend to all the guests. Front desk restaurant and everyone on staff couldn't be sweeter! They even arranged for our transportation after we were at another hotel!  Ask the front desk to arrange for car services. Clean and hassle free!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: HaiAnh T wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: It is one of my best hotel experiences. You will be impressed of how attentive the staff treat you here. We only stay for 1 night but we were treated like the most important friends of the hotel: we can check out at any time we were given free juices and treats all the time and by the time we left for the flight they also gave us a bag packed with sandwiches and fruits (to eat while waiting at the airport!)    I have never seen such an amazing hospitality especially we are just normal visitors we only paid for the cheapest room when booking online but yet they still gave us the supert services. I would go back to Marrakech again simply just because Antonio and his staff have given us such a pleasant impression of how Morrocans treat their guests.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Andrea M wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Magnificent service and it is also pretty!
Review_Text: We stayed 4 nights at this beautiful well located and intimate riad. We've read about Antonio and the rest of the staff from other travelers' comments here still we did not know what to expect.  Since the moment we arrived our experience was totally unique everyone went beyond to take care of us and recommended restaurants site seeing places and a day trip exactly to our taste and like. Not to mention the beautiful room which was cleaned and arranged practically every time we return to it the delicious meals at the cozy and well designed terrace the attention to details and good taste in the riad's decor the beautiful pool with candles the driver that took us around for dinner and day trip the openness and warmth of the staff since minute one after our arrival and the list goes on...  We also tried the couple's hammam and massage a total exotic experience. A most do in the riad for total "pacha" feeling...  We like to travel quite a bit and have stayed in boutique hotels around the globe; we have to say this trip was one of our best experiences mainly because of the service.  Don't hesitate to book with them you won't regret it by the contrary you will remember it as one of the best trips of your life.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We absolutely loved our dinner at Dar Abuja. First they brought olives and warm rolls then a complimentary soup. Next had a mixed starter of meat and chicken filled triangular pastries - delicious!! Then it was a plate of salad - and followed by our main course. We had the Chicken Saffa - a sweet chicken 'tagine'with vermicelli - so yummy. My husband had the beef kebabs - which were so tender. We were too stuffed for pudding so the manager brought us complimentary sweet biscuits and mint tea. The service was really good and the food delicious. Highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After the rush and buzz of Marrakesh this is an excellent retreat to relax and recharge the batteries. Our room was spacious and comfortable. Breakfasts were excellent and we enjoyed a good dinner on one evening. The service throughout our stay was superb. Every request for assistance or guidance was answered and given fully. All the staff treated us as honoured guests with courtesy and respect.  The walk from the centre is about 15/20 minutes withe last few hundred metres along narrow busy streets with speedy traffic so keep your wits about you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christina S wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: And it's pretty too!  This was our first time to Morocco so we didn't know what to expect. We didn't want to risk doing a "budget" place so we splurged a little and chose Dar Anika based on reviews here. But WOW you get a great value for the money.  The staff are incredibly professional attentive kind and go out of their way to assist you. Your room get's cleaned pretty much every time you leave it. There are only 10 guest rooms so they are really able to give you the kind of personalized attention that we've never encountered anywhere else we've stayed.  The location is great. The Medina is not that big so you can walk everywhere that you want to and this spot worked fine for getting around.  We loved the free breakfast every morning - homemade yogurt fresh fruit salad warm assortment of breads and the famous fresh-squeezed orange juice. The dinner menu is delicious as well. We ate on the roof deck 2 of the 4 nights there and loved everything we tried.  The rooms were very clean spacious and the bathrooms were large and very modern.  We'd recommend booking a spa/massage session at the hamman Kosi which the staff can reserve for you.  We are extremely happy with our experience at Dar Anika and if we ever go back to Marrakech we will definitely choose to stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rodrigo P wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Great staff - polite and friendly  Well decorated very very clean  Good places to have a drink inside with different styles  They give you gifts all the time (food tea juice etc)  Great breakfast  Nice rooftop view  Perfect location (at the medina but close to the walls which is good given that the center is too messy)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard A wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: First time in Morocco and we chose the riad based on reviews here. We weren't disappointed at all in fact this was one of the best trips we've had. The riad is perfectly situated in the Medina and easy to find. Our room (room 2) was very well furnished quiet and a good size. The rest of the riad was just as good but the roof terrace was exceptional; we ate there most mornings and evenings and spent time relaxing during the day.    The food was very good at every meal. We tried most of the menu and every dish was a delight.    The best part of the riad is the staff. We have never met such warm welcoming and helpful staff at a hotel before. Every day we were surprised with little gestures that made the holiday so special; our favourite drinks just arrived local food was explained to us and they even made us a packed lunch for the trip home.    If you're thinking of going to Marrakech this is the perfect place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A wonderful play for first-time stay in Marrakesh
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is an exceptional place - it is not a hotel it is a Riad which as told by the property manager is a "family home." That's the way my mum and I were treated - with incredible respect and poise. I as a traveller do not want to be pushed into anything and the hosts are brilliant at that. They let you be but they also want to provide for you.  For example they arranged for a driver for Jardin de Majorelle the last day of our stay and after that they also prepared a full basket of fruit and sandwiches for our trip back home. The restaurant is amazing even if it's small and the menu's don't change much because the food is prepared as they say with love. They also sit down with us and explained where to go in Marrakesh what to be careful about and what not to miss.  All in all a wonderful experience!  Everyone at the Riad speaks at least basic English while the manager is fluent in Spanish and French as well. Grateful to all staff have to mention mr. Kemel here too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I chose this hotel because of the excellent reviews I read..but honestly my experience exceeds all reviews  The minute you arrive they welcome you with cold milk dates and traditional cookies...and of course the famous Moroccan tea  The manager mr Antonio gives you some tips (and tricks) to "surviving" the Medina  The room is so clean & smells gorgeous (rose water)  Breakfast is so delicious & a nice lady bakes the bread right in front of you...mr Hassan is the nicest person you can meet & he asks if you need something special (or extra) & it will be ready for you the next morning...  Dinner time is so romantic on the terrace with live music & the tajines are out of this world  I was also so glad that they have argeela (shisha or hookah).. it's not available everywhere like in Lebanon or Egypt so it was a relief to know that they have that too..  When you come back to your room you find complementary bottle of water milk dates and traditional cookies..what more can you ask for!  They really treat you as family...& I chose this title for my review because I think it best explains how well you are treated from each and every member  There is really nothing bad that can be said about this hotel so if you want to stay in the Medina this is the place to choose  It's amazing how you literally enter another world the minute they open the door for you..  Thank you all for everything :-)  The only thing I recommend is putting a click on the wall in the room
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The Riad Dar Anika was a beautiful place to stay. The decor is gorgeous the rooms are spacious and the staff is beyond compare.  Everything we needed or wanted was taken care of. Day trips were arranged in our behalf by Antonio including all transportation. The sister Riad to this one has a very nice hammam and spa where we enjoyed a couples hammam followed by a swim on the rooftop pool for my boyfriend and a massage for me.  The staff at the Riad Dar Anika were attentive thoughtful knowledgeable and kind. Restaurants were recommended even reservations were taken care of!  We had the best time in Marrakech and I'd say it was made seamless by the staff at this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Adam C wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: There's not much to say except that you will have a stay to remember.    Hidden behind a wooden door at the entrance to the Medina prepare yourself for a luxurious few days. The building is glorious Antonio and his wonderful staff can't do enough for you and you will absolutely not go hungry!    Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Thomas P wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: We were a full family of 10 spanding from 1 to 70 years of age but were made to feel very welcom and were pampered at all times.    The location help with tours and knowledge of Marrakech was good.    Adding to that the roof top terrace for breakfast and drinks/dinner makes it fantastic
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Friendly, great location, charming rooms, just maybe too many rose petals... ;-)
Review_Text: I stayed here with 5 friends for a girls trip. The staff was very welcoming and breakfast on the terrace was a treat. The morning we checked out with a day of driving ahead of us they packed a lunch for each of us and filled out our travel cards for our return flight home. Such attention to detail! And the riad was located just at the edge of the medina so it was easy to explore in all directions. My roomie and I laughed each night when we returned to our room and had to pick up rose petals from just about every surface! A great sleep and beautiful rooms.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This place looks EXACTLY like the pictures even down to the flower petals on the bed. Staff was so thoughtful and looked out for me (as a solo traveler that meant a lot). They noticed when I came in and out knew me by name and always asked (unobtrusively) where I was going and when I expected to be back. I was there on my birthday -- they baked a cake for me and sang happy birthday at dinner. When I left for the airport at the end of the week they had packed a couple sandwiches and some fruit in case I got hungry on the flight home.    The entire experience was wonderful and I would recommend this place to anybody traveling to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We enjoyed a fabulous stay at this wonderful Riad recently. The staff are so polite and attentive the Manager Antonio goes out of his way to help. Everywhere is spotlessly clean the breakfast is so good and dinners on the roof terrace are an unforgettable experience. Our bedroom was spacious with little noise from the street below.    Going beyond that 'extra mile' ... picnic bag provided for the flight home & airport departure cards completed for us .  Loved the ice cold strawberry juice that appeared without asking when we return from a day out .    All in all an unforgettable experience. Can't wait to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tony W wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: My partner and I had never visited Marrakesh before and we didn't really know what to expect. The city is very different from Europe and so we made our hotel selection based on the reviews written on this page.    On first approaching the Riad nothing about it stands out. Just a door in a wall. However when the door was opened it was obvious that we had arrived at a very special place.    We were greeted by the friendly staff and given fresh tea juice and snacks as we sat in the small well decorated lounge. The atmosphere immediately indicated that nothing had been left to chance in relation to ambiance.    Our host manager Antonio explained all we needed to know about to the Riad and gave us very useful information regarding the local area.    Our room on the first floor was well appointed immaculately clean and very comfortable.    Breakfast served on the roof terrace overlooking the Medina was a delight. Freshly prepared local food efficiently served by attentive staff.    We availed ourselves of Hammam on two occasions one of which included a massage. This was an amazing experience and should not be missed.    Dinner was available on the roof terrace. A well thought out menu of locally sourced dishes and a good wine list made up of selected Moroccan wines. We ate dinner twice during our four night stay. Both meals were excellent as was the service.    Nothing was too much trouble for the staff who were very polite friendly and efficient. I mention in particular Aziz who cleverly anticipated our requirements for superbly prepared gin and tonics as the sun went down!    Antonio and his team worked tirelessly to make our stay very special.    Excellent. Thank you
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nikki A wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: My friend and I (both Americans in our mid-20s) stayed here for 4 nights and could not have had a better experience. As an avid traveler I have never and will probably never experience such high quality customer service. The staff was impeccably trained and attentive. There is nothing this Riad didn't think of when it came to the comfort and happiness of their guests.    As two young girls traveling alone safety was obviously a major concern for us however Dar Anika made sure we were either escorted everywhere or knew the best routes and times to travel and explore.    The manager met with us upon or arrival and helped us plan our trip and book excursions (I highly recommend the hike in the Atlas Mountains and camel excursions). Everything was so easy and the trips were fantastic! They even booked all of our restaurant reservations and gave the best recommendations for lunch and dinner!    Dar Anika had every amenity you could hope for in a Riad and they were all beautiful and functional. The Riad even has an on-site hammam which was such an interesting and authentic experience!    Quite possibly the hardest part of leaving Dar Anika was saying goodbye to the staff members who were such an integral part of our experience in Marrakech and made us feel like family!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Superb boutique hotel in the midst of Marrakech Medina
Review_Text: As an avid traveller this was the most lovely stay I have ever had in a hotel. I truly am certain I will not see another place up to this standard in my lifetime. Upon arrival we were greeted with fresh juice and a sit-down with the manager who gave us a run-down of the city the Riad and helped us plan our itinerary. Everyone who works at the Riad is amazing and friendly going above and beyond to make our stay incredible. Not only was it sad to leave Marrakech but it was sad to leave all of the people we had met and stayed with at the Riad. Customer service is absolutely excellent they are always thinking of the little things that make such an improvement to the day. Beautiful space and beautiful people - this is where you want to stay to get a true and real experience of the Medina!! Definitely go on the hike to the Atlas mountains and explore Berber culture. The hammam was also lovely. Not to mention breakfast and dinner are always impressive. Go here and I hope to be back sometime as well!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Debbie B wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: We travelled from Portugal to Marrakesh to celebrate our anniversary.  Riad Dar Anika was our 1st choice. This was absolutely the right place.    The service - top notch.  The Staff - simply fantastic.  The Rooms - very cozy and beautiful.  The Breakfast - the very best we have ever tasted.  The Food - excellent local / traditional cuisine.  The Manager - Mr. Antonio - very kind thoughtful professional.  Riad Hammam & Massage - a fabulous experience - so good that we had two in our four day visit.  Overall Experience - unbelievable- Everything was thought of for our every need. Our exit immigration forms were filled out for us a picnic was prepared for us for our flight.  We will definitely be back to stay at the Dar Anika.  A great BIG thank you to Antonio and his team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Thank you Antonio and the staff for my unforgettable trip in Morocco.    Words cannot express how lovely our stay was. Here were a few of my favorite things about Dar Anika:    1- The breakfast. On the BEAUTIFUL rooftop. It was a delicious feast every morning. The fresh squeezed orange juice!!! Being able to watch your bread get made. The wonderful attentive staff... I happen to go for my birthday and they all came out singing for me...with a cake! This was not even a request from my boyfriend they did it on their own. Seriously I can't describe the level of service here -- unbeatable    2- The welcome process - mint tea? check. delicious green basil smoothie?? i dont even know what it was but it was most refreshing drink i have ever tasted. Antonio also sat us down and walked us through the map. He was so thorough and helpful!    3- Hamman - I can't compare this to another hamman experience in Morocco but here you are scrubbed in a private room by a lady. If you want the authentic experience of being handled in public this is not it.    4 - Beautiful rooms w/ rose petals :) so romantic.    I have to go back to the service... when we left the hotel (rather unwillingly) they sent us off with packed sandwiches and drinks because they knew we were going into the desert. I MEAN!!!!! Words cannot even describe the gratitude.    Dar Anika hands down had the best service of any accommodation in all of my travels and I recommend anybody and everybody to stay here to experience it yourself!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tony P wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: We arrived dinner time and it was quite a spectacle as we entered the Riad. Quite a popular place for those in "the know". Staff was very attentive. We had a suite and it was gorgeous. Breakfast was great. Dinner was excellent and the hammam experience great. Very well located a five minute leisurely walk to the main square Jemaa al Fina square where entertainment abounds until midnight.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I loved everything about this place excellent restaurant recommendations and they even gave us a picnic lunch for our long roadtrip to the desert. Antonio helped us plan our remaining time in country and we even received help with our departure paperwork. I felt so comfortable and welcome at Riad Dar Anika. The rooftop terrace was so peaceful and beautiful!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: michael c wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: An oasis of beauty nd calm
Review_Text: excellent value for money. Absolutely no complaints. genuinely good advice from staff and manager on where to find whatever you are looking for.  The location is superb and we only once used a taxi which was to travel to the New town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mattias F wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Very helpful and welcoming staff. Nice room in a quiet environment well away from the busy street outside. Beautiful roof top terrace and nice food both breakfast and dinner choices. Nice to be able to order some beer or wine also!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff was wonderful and the Riad is truly an oasis within the busy Medina streets. The manager took time to orient us to the area and customs and made us feel very welcome. They were particularly accommodating to our 11 year old son.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Dar Anika is your home the moment you walk in; a home with a staff that is there for whatever you need (without being overly pushy or encroaching on your space and privacy). This is the perfect place to travel to - and relax within - the Medina of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The perfect place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed in four different riad's during our long stay in Marrakech and both of us agreed that Riad Dar Anika was the best all round place to stay. This was based on the unbeatable location the amazingly welcoming staff and the comfortable well equipped room and great nights sleeps that we had there. In addition I feel it is very important to say that if I were travelling to Marrakech as a woman on my own I would definitely choose to stay in Riad Dar Anika again because unlike many other riads there are several routes to choose to walk home at night which are safe and do not involve walking down the empty narrow passages in the dark which at night can be a little intimidating. The location really is the best you could wish for in this respect.  Returning to Riad Dar Anika after a busy day exploring Marrakech felt like coming home and instantly you felt relaxed and so well looked after. The hotel staff really are wonderful the service we received was above and beyond anything you could hope for. On arrival (following their excellently organised airport pick up) the manager sat with us and explained the map of the city what were the best things to see how much you could expect to pay for taxis and other useful tips. The reception staff also completed the departure form for us for our flight out of Marrakech and on check out provided us with the most delicious (complimentary) pack lunch for the journey.  The food at the riad was probably the best meal that we had during our entire stay in Marrakech and incredibly good value for money considering how tasty it was and how many courses it involved! The riad roof top area was a wonderful spot to relax and watch the world go by and the breakfasts that are served up there every morning were wonderful.  In summary Riad Dar Anika has everything you could want for an amazing stay in Marrakech. It is 10 - 15 minutes pleasant walk from all of the sights it is a beautiful place to sit and relax and you feel so welcome that you feel like part of the family. I could not recommend it more highly and would not hesitate to stay here again on my next visit to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Daniella P wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: The riad was beautifully designed. The staff was very atentative and friendly. The staff made our stay that much more amazing. The breakfast was delicious and the view from the terrace is great. Our bed bed was very comfortable and the room was great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Scott M wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Great hotel - full of old-world charm with modern amenities. Perfect location on the southern edge of the medina great atmosphere delightful staff under the management of Antonio. Use their airport pick up service too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is the second time I have stayed at Riad Dar Anika and can not recommend it enough. The staff are so thoughtful and helpful nothing was to much trouble during our stay and we received first class service all the way. We was made welcome the minute we set foot through the front door with refreshments and Antonio is wonderful at taking the time to explain local attractions we may want to visit during out holiday. The breakfast is without a doubt the best I just hope your hungry! Myself and my husband booked the couples hammam and massage and it was such a fantastic experience and a great way to unwind.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sarah S wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: I think this is the best hotel we've stayed at during our entire trip to Morocco. The service was great loved the rooftop breakfast (though a bit cold in march) unlike big hotels Anika really gives you a feeling of home staying there. Before we checked out we were given pre-written departure cards (which was super considerate and saved us a lot of trouble!) and a bag packed with sandwiches and fruits for our trip. Of all our times traveling in different places not any one of them had this type of service.
