As much as we loved this Riad I did want to point out if you're staying in morocco it's best to bring your own slippers and maybe a face towel. The slippers here were clearly one time slippers but re-used as they came in different stained colors :(
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: WOW! Starting with arriving at the hotel and being offered tea dates and cookies to the amazing manager and staff this is my favorite place as a world traveler that I've ever stayed. The room was amazing the dinner was magical. Be sure to do the hammond as it's a must do in a life time experience.    Shokram to the Riad Dar Anika team!    Can't wait to come back. :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: If you are looking for excellence come to Dar Anika and let Antonio and the staff deliver the most wonderful stay. It is everything you would ever want and more. From the moment you walk through the door and are greeted you will feel like an honored guest. After being served a refreshing snack and tea Antonio spent time explaining all the “need to know” items of his beautiful riad and city and made sure we felt comfortable and had all our questions answered. We enjoyed a fabulous dinner in the courtyard while listening to lovely live music and breakfast the next morning on the terrace was perfection. It doesn’t get any better and the service was exceptional. We could not have enjoyed our stay more.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My Wife and I and another couple had the pleasure of staying in the Dar Anika from the 22nd to 26th March 2017. I cannot reccomend this Hotel enough the setting and the Hotel are truly fantastic if you want a true Moroccan sensation.    We were greeted by Abu the owner on arrival and he gave us a breif resume of Marrakesh and some recommendation's of restaurants etc which all proved be be well above expectation. We dined in Dar Anika one night and again we cannot find fault. The staff the accommodation and the level of service were truly 5 Star.    The hotel organised all our taxi trips meals out and places to go I really cannot recommend this hotel enough the two Owners Abu & Abu were a delight as were all of the very efficient and friendly staff !!    Many thanks for a wonderful insight into Marrakesh your staff are a credit to you !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Riad is conveniently located just 10 minutes from the main square in the Medina. The walk to the Medina is a straight walk through the Souks. The Ambiance is tranquil and the rooms are comfortable. The roof top terrace is Perfect to watch the sun go down or to eat a hearty breakfast in the morning and hear the streets wake up for a day's work.  We were greeted by the staff who collected the bags from our Taxi and walked 50 yards to the front top the Raid's deceiving entrance way - opening to a breathtaking lobby/dining area with a pool.    Please do not except wide open spaces - the use of space is well thought out and quite adequate. We were a family of 4 with 2 teenagers and had 2 rooms - we had everything we needed.    I have to say that if you like being pampered there can't be a better place to stay in Marrakech from the owners to all the staff - they are there to welcome you and make your stay comfortable. I can only recall a few hotels in the world that are so fastidious about this.    When Abu- one of the 2 owners/Brothers sat down to welcome me to their Riad - I have to say he was modest and undersold the Dinner choice and so we ate out the first night - big mistake!. The second night we decided to stay in and enjoy the place as we were leaving to catch a flight in the morning and didn't want to get to get tired walking. I have to say the meal was amazing - we all thought so. If only I had known how good the food is here. You will find other people coming in for dinner to eat here - so that confirmed my suspicion. Try the Chicken Seffa Medfouna - divine!.    I have to give the owners and staff a big hand for making this place so memorable. They outdid themselves and my family and I will always remember their graciousness.    FYI - They also have a sister property only 5 minutes walk from here that they just opened called Raid Kaiss - beautiful and we checked it out and had a drink there. It is old world style in al its grandeur. If you intend on staying several days in Marrakech - do yourself a favor and split it between these 2 properties and get pampered to your delights.  I also forgot to tell you that my son wasn't feeling well one morning and the Owner - Abu walked with me to the Pharmacy to get medicine - amazing!! ( The owners brothers engineers non-hoteliers are there almost all the time and both are called Abu). My Son is only14 but they checked on him and catered to him when he felt better while we were out in the Souks shopping - that is how comfortable we were in leaving him there on his own. This says a lot about the level of service and comfort they provide in making you feel welcome.  Thank you guys for making this stay so lovely for our family I can't thank you enough.    I saw the reviews on Trip advisor and booked this place on a hunch and it paid out - big time. I will recommend this hotel to anyone that values service attention to detail great location attentive and caring staff. I can't praise this place enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Rowan M wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: If you measure the value of hotels by the centimetre then this is not the place for you. If you value care and attention to detail in service then look no further. Antonio and his whole team are committed to making every second of your time as comfortable as possible. When we arrived we were served mint tea dates and cakes. The rooms are small but adequately sized. However they are finished to a very high standard and decorated in scented rose petals daily. The staff were happy to bring a bottle of wine to the roof terrace for us to enjoy the sunset before dinner. As for food you will not go hungry. The quality and quantity coming from the kitchen is amazing. Look out for the breakfast flatbreads especially.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Diego H wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Title: Great Staff, but tiny rooms and rates too much pricey.
Review_Text: Location is good (south part of the medina just at the corner). Attention for the staff and the manager is the best asset of this small lovely and authentic riad. It also boosts a nice decor. Breakfast (especially at the roof top) is very nice. But the rooms are too tiny (there is no space for properly opening a medium/big luggage) bad acoustic (you can easily hear sounds from outside) and does not have tv or stereo. Amenities (shampoo etc.) are nothing special. And rates are too much pricey. Although I enjoy staying there for the average asked price at Riad Dar Anika I would rather stay in another place.

Review_Date: Denise A wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: We arrived in Marrakech and was greeted by our driver. He waited for us to negotiate our rental for the next day with such patience. When we arrived at Dar Anika someone met us to walk us into the medina to Dar Anika. What a beautiful house! Antonio met with us to greet us and instantly made us feel welcome with tea and homemade cookies and pastries. He surprised us by upgrading us to another co-owned Riad within walking distance. Riad Kaiss is unbelievably beautiful and so well managed. Valentino greeted us there with even more hospitality. Antonio also asked about our entire trip and called our desert tour company to ensure we understood our next few days and ensure our time would be the best. The food was served on our balcony and everyone made us feel safe and able to enjoy the beauty of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: April W wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: I was very impressed with this riad. The owner came out and greeted me going over all the things that I could do during my stay. I enjoyed the massage and the great bar outside. The food was excellent. While I waited for my transport to pick me up for the airport they fed me and gave me a nice sack lunch to take with me on the plane. Amazing stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Lisa D wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Title: Wonderful and extraordinary in every way!
Review_Text: We chose Riad Dar Anika because of its brilliant reviews and we're thrilled to report that yes this beautiful riad really is as special as guests claim it is. Having reviewed dozens of hotels spanning five continents I can say with conviction that I have never experienced such incredible guest services -- and it's totally sincere. Every member of the team cares deeply about the comfort of every guest. A few examples of many: Larsen arranged to have the figs we bought at the market cleaned prepared and wrapped for us. Antonio who brilliantly manages the team followed our car on his motorbike after we checked out to return two small items we'd left behind. It's gestures like these that allow us to call Riad Dar Anika one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at.  Our room was beautiful and we enjoyed the daily display of rose petals and delicious cookies and fruit in our room. The riad's hammam was a welcome treat - if not a necessity- after a long journey and the massage that followed was perfect.  We had dinner at the hotel every night and loved each selection. Breakfast on the rooftop dining area was a great way to begin the day.  There's no better place to stay in Marrakech - or beyond. I would give Dar Anika ten stars if I could.

Review_Date: Justina I wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Title: Highest level of service I ever came across
Review_Text: Went to Marrakech as my birthday trip. It was the first time there and found it difficult to choose whether to stay in the Medina (old town) or in the modern part. I choose the authentic old town experience and found this boutique Riad with 9.8 rating on booking.com not even knowing what a Riad actually is :) long story short the moment we got there we stepped into a 1001 nights type of experience! I can seriously not emphasize enough how romantic and beautiful this boutique hotel is. The care they gave us is unheard of. They were so considerate from: receiving a detailed explanation of all there is (worth!) to see in the city to unlimited delicious fruits and fully personalized breakfast menu (even for me as a vegetarian) to daily new rose petals all over the room free of charge ironing service amazing hammam treatment reservations at the best restaurants including private drivers taking us back and forth and receiving a generous lunch box take-away when we left to the airport. They made my birthday unforgettable by both surprising me at breakfast with flowers and cake as well as arranging the restaurant employees in the evening to sing for me (without me knowing) and then again a bottle of champaign with candles ones we returned during the night! I wish I could post the videos to really show the amazing atmosphere! We saw the owner there daily talking genuinely taking interest in every guest and Antonio the manager takes personally care of everyones need. I recommend Riad Dar Anika with all my heart and can't wait to return! Oh by the way although it is really a luxurious place and we felt like royals - the final bill for being taken daily by the driver hammam for two people and all the consumption in the hotel was less than 90E!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A beautiful Riad with service which could not have been better real first class service. The manager Anthonia greeted us when we first arrived and we were served with Moroccon tea and sweets. He helped us by providing his suggestions and recommendation on the things to do in Marrakech.The staff in the riad was absolutely helpful and friendly. The room was beautifully decorated Moroccan style. We also had a hammam at the riad and it was a lovely experience. I think it was also very sweet that Anthonia and his team made us sandwiches for our flight back to the UK. Thank you for your hospitality and generosity Anthonia and team. We hope to come back soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wonderful break from the hustle and bustle. We had a rooftop terrace (very) light lunch and Lahcen looked after us so well. Gentle music and tasty Moroccan food with a lovely half bottle of rose and unhurried service. €31 euro for two.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just returned from 4 night stay at riad anika. It was my wife's birthday so really wanted to have a special trip for her. The riad is everything and more than we expected after reading all the previous reviews. The staff are so attentive and there is always someone nearby to offer tea or a snack which we found at the end were complementary which was an added bonus. Antonio is great at explaining what to do and to make sure the stay went well. We had a lovely meal at the hotel on the first night and all the staff came out to sing happy birthday with a cake and flowers for my wife - it was fab. Can't fault the hotel in any way it really was 5 star. We also did the day trip to the mountains which was pricey but a lovely break from the madness of the city. Hassan is a great guide and we really enjoyed experiencing a window into Berber life in the mountains. It felt very genuine and not contrived for tourists.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Can't fault any aspect of this well run and beautifully furnished Riad. Staff were very Professional and did everything to make our stay special. We were upgraded to a beautiful airy room. Antonio met us the first morning with a map and suggestions of where we might go daytime and evening.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great location, friendly and extremely helpful staff, a calm oasis in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: Stayed 4 nights and had a wonderful time the friendly staff couldn't have been more attentive and helpful they arranged a fabulous day in the mountains for us with their driver and a local berber guide. The breakfasts were fabulous I would thoroughly recommend this Riad to friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of calm and luxury
Review_Text: I booked this gem of a riad a surprise for my fiancé. After reading the glowing reviews beforehand I must say this place lived up to my expectations. Hind was a star was always at the end of an email for any queries I had arranged the private transfers from the airport dinner reservations etc. All of the staff (special mention to Mohammed) here go out of their way to help and nothing is too much trouble. I booked the special weekend stay and or room dinner and Hamman were perfect.    Upon arrival Antonio sat down and with us to give us the low down on the local area. Thank you Antonio!    We we're treated to over 2 hours of the most amazing hammam and massage I have ever had at Dar Anika's sister hotel Riad Kai's - this Riad appear equally luxurious and again the service from the staff there was faultless.    This was our first trip Marrakesh it will not be our last and we most definitely recommend Dar Anika or Riad Kaiss.    Thank you for making our stay here in Marrakesh a totally fabulous one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rob J wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Title: Great location, friendly and extremely helpful staff, great value!
Review_Text: We stayed 4 nights...arriving on the Monday evening we were met by Hent and the other friendly staff who made us feel very welcome...room was excellent (a lot of rose petals all around...but it was valentines week ) ... very nice meal and a good night sleep. Antonio met us the following morning and provided a useful guide to what to see and arranged 2 other trips for us as well as a hammam and massage. We went quad biking and then hiking trip to Imlil. .. Both very good. Trip around city / medina in horse drawn carriage was very good...haggle for everything. Motorcyclists are nutters...citar player goes on a bit so expect to be up til 1100 and then quite noisy from 7 am but overall an excellent stay...All staff have been brilliant not only in helpfulness but just going that extra mile!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A real find for lunch or dinner!
Review_Text: This gorgeous little riad and restaurant is situated very close to the Bahia Palace. My colleagues and I had dinner here on our penultimate night in Marrakech and liked it so much we came back for lunch on their beautiful terrace the following day; a week later I brought two colleagues from Casablanca to enjoy the riad at lunch time!  At night they had a very welcoming fire to help stave off the January cold. We ate well and enjoyed a nice bottle of wine between us. We were offered lots of little complimentary extras such as olives mint tea soup and bread. There was some unobtrusive but lovely live music all adding to the ambiance.  I will definitely be coming back here on my next trip to Morocco. Also worth checking out is their sister riad Riad Kaiss recently renovated and situated in the middle of the Medina; we were lucky to get a guided tour and it too is gorgeous!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Julie M wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: We had 6 fantastics nights at Riad Dar Anika. Everyone was extremely welcoming towards us and did their utmost to make us feel comfortable. They were all very helpful but not in a distant way - we felt we met some really nice people!  The Riad is really like the pictures shows - we were in no way disappointed! Charming decoration and the roof-top terrace was perfect for breakfast and for relaxing after a long day in the buzzing city. Everytime we came home only a few minutes passed before someone knocked on the door with a fresh orange juice or mint tea with small local cakes.  The food was no less than amazing (I had a fantastic chicken dish that I can't remember the name of)! I would recommend to save the meal(s) at the Riad for the last days in the city as we really found it much better than most of the food in the city.  Lastly the Riad is located about 10 minutes walk away from the big square and the souks which I consider a BIG plus as people pretty much left us alone in that area of the city. It was very nice to have a few minutes to mentally prepare for the buzz inside the city :)  Big big thank you to Antionio for the fantastic welcome Larsen for taking so good care of us at breakfast (don't know how the name is spelled) and the rest of the team for being so nice! Big recommendation from us
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sam A wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed at Dar Anika for 3 nights in January 2017 from the moment we got there to the point of leaving we was treated really well on arrival we was seated with the hotel co-ordinator Abu who explained the “dos’s and don’ts” he made suggestions of what to do and how to manage the 3 days we was there for the reception staff where amazing breakfast was a delight.  The ambiance was great especially at night when the musicians played their traditional music and you could see over all the hotel residents. We didn’t get to eat at the hotel due to lack of time but the smell of the food was quite tempting.  We plan to go back in a few months and will booking directly with the hotel. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so memorable and look to see you again soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay with Antonio & the team. A very warm welcome from our favorite chap Lahcen who literally was the most helpful person 🤗- we were brought a number of local treats milk dates mint tea.  The central area to chill out in is stunning. Then we rested on the sunny roof terrace to relax on the sun beds.  The room was lovely ... and a beautiful touch with flower petals everywhere.  We additionally went to the sister riad just round the corner with a pool & bed to sun yourself on a bottle of champagne up there was a real treat.  The markets are on the door step and a short walk up to the main square (15 mins).  Antonio recommended we get a driver for the evening and we are glad we did (lift to bar Marmounia which again I recommend ( probably spelt wrong)).  Breakfast on the roof was ideal breakfast served from 8am until whenever you want it - great attitude!  Lastly we enjoyed a Hammam at the sister riad wasn't sure what to expect - enjoyed it - lady very professional & skin feels amazing.    All in all I throughly recommend this place and it definitively deserves 5 stars we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and I will recommend to all friends and family ✨ ⭐️
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Benjamin W wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay with outstanding service from splendid Personnel. The Restaurant and Roof Garden are great. The hotel is located right next to the old town. Antonio (the manager) received us with a warm welcome and made our stay as enjoyable as could be. We highly recommend to book this hotel when in Marrakech.    Christa and Peter W Düsseldorf Germany.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Matthew P wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: Visited Dar Anika for our fifth anniversary. The Riad is beautiful: the oud playing at night in the indoor courtyard breakfast on the rooftop terrace rooms decorated so you don't forget you're in Morocco.    However it's the service that makes this place outstanding:  - Served breakfast when we arrived despite not staying the night before  - Sit down with Antonio (the manager) to discuss what we wanted to do each day offer advice and even take care of the bookings  - Special gluten free baking to accommodate our dietary restrictions  - Milk and a moroccan treat served in the room each night  - A special anniversary cake and song  - Orange juice in the room while packing  - Pre-filled in departure cards and sandwiches for the plane    Every individual went above and beyond to make this stay as special as possible. We've stayed in places all over the world... this one sets the standard. Book it now!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika I really miss you! Stayed for 4 nights in this great Riad. From the moment we arrived we felt so relaxed after a long flight we were taken to the majlis (lounge) and welcomed by a traditional welcoming drinks dates and rose water perfume!    We all were busy taking pictures of the riad can't describe the inner joy we had! Staff were so professional and friendly we've immediately felt welcomed and our home!    Hotel manager Antonio a real gentleman welcomed us and gave us a detailed overview on the city. It was very informative being the first time in the city.    Then we were taken to our rooms rooms were cosy and very well maintained.    Toilet was good size and water pressure was perfect!    The breakfast was the best I ever had! Seriously the BEST! Bread freshly baked different selection of eggs jam yogurt and fruits!    We have also enjoyed dinner the food was tasty and I'd really hope more option will be added to the menu.    The gentlemen looking after the breakfast and dinner were so friendly and prompt.    House keeping was great I honestly felt to relaxed for the hygiene and Tidiness.    The last nigh there was a night show (shaikhat) and it was amazing.    Location was great right on bab el mella and it's 7/10 min walk to Jama l'efna.    This will be my base for future visits to come. Thanks to Antonio and the whole team.    Ahmed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I visited here before their sister hotel riad kaiss. This place is a little more boutiques homely and less classically flamboyant but is equally as amazing. It has its own unique charm. It is very homely and extremely comfortable. I had a wonderful meal on the roof which was incredible and they also have a pool inside for relaxation. The proprietors have got the combination of style elegance and service just right. Again I would highly recommend .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Exceptional service for a romantic birthday getaway
Review_Text: What a fabulous Riad! Close to all the main attractions in the Medina not far from the main square and hosted by some of the most courteous and helpful staff we have ever encountered.    The owner Abu got our 4-night visit off to a great start by telling us where to go and perhaps more importantly where not to go/what not to do - tip no. 1 don't buy anything on your first day in the souks!    The food was wonderful. Fresh fruit in the bedroom every day and many thanks to Lahcan and his team for the wonderful breakfasts in particular. What can we add about the cakes we were presented with on our birthdays? Fabulous! Never had "Happy Birthday" sung to us in three different languages before either so made for a couple of very special days in the middle of our trip.    We visited the nearby Riad Kaiss for a hammam on our last day. Another treat in the larger but equally stunning sister hotel to Dar Anika so if you are unable to get a room at Anika you can't go wrong with Kaiss either. The delightful Valentina will show you around.    Finally a big thank you to the staff for arranging a trek in the foothills of the Atlas mountains with our guide Hassan. Another great adventure topped off by a lovely lunch prepared by Hassan's wife and mother.    We would not hesitate to recommend either of Abu's Riads.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: ‘Riad Dar Anika’ – owned by Abu managed by Antonio and run by exceptionally gracious and polite staff. My wife and I (along with our unborn baby boy) had an amazing time in Marrakech and this was almost entirely as a result of the guidance and support of our hosts. The food was excellent the rooms were comfortable and homely and the attention to our needs were met on every opportunity and level. This simply is good business we are absolutely going to return the to Riad Dar Anika and we’ll bring friends and family with us.    The madness and chaos of the Souks is something to behold in Marrakech and I whole-heartedly enjoy immersing myself in the sordid undertaking that is haggling – “8000DHS for a lamp get out of here!!”……”but it is the finest quality sir look crafted by the hand of the pope”….”350DHS”……”You insult me Sir this that is not even 5% of the price”…….. “What price you mean the one you’ve made up to fleece me?”….loved it. Then remove and cleanse yourself in the form of a Hamann highly recommended if you stay at the Riad Dar Anika.    This Riad has a great roof-top area as well where you can either sun-bath eat & drink or just absorb the atmosphere there - the noises are great the occasional donkey beeping mopeds and prayer time add to the experience and all in a pleasant way.    Delighted with the hospitality and holiday in Marrakech thank you Abu and Co!!    thank you T & J and baby bump x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: john r wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: We spent one night at Riad Dar Anika before going up to the Atlas Mountain. The place is simply perfect from location to the service and staff. We felt totally relaxed the moment we entered the dark wooden doors. The staff treat you with so much care and attention. The manager Antonio made sure we were well informed about the city. Thank you Dar Anika for a lovely stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jill K wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: My husband I came to Marrakech for a quick 2 night stay and this Riad along with the sister property a few blocks away were outstanding. Beautiful decor details and the owner and staff could not be more kind and accommodating. We arrived early in the morning and they welcomed us with tea and dates and fruit and a full breakfast. The courtyard terrace upstairs everything is beautiful. And when my husband got very ill AFTER we had checked out they welcome us back got a doctor and arranged for us to stay another night. The Hamman was spectacular massages were first rate. All of this for a very reasonable price (offseason). I would come back here in a heartbeat. The people are so warm.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jayne E wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: We can strongly recommend Dar Anika having received outstanding service and courtesy. We were especially grateful for the helpful advice from Antonio the Manager that greatly enhanced our experience of Marrakech. We enjoyed our day trip to the High Atlas mountains with the superbly welcoming Berber guide Hassan and we loved the highly atmospheric restaurant Dar Yacourt that Antonio kindly suggested. All round an excellent experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: perfect spot to explore the medina. Perfect service - verry welcoming - they make sure you are taken care of from the moment you walk in the door breakfast on the roof terrace is perfect way to start the day. heated pool for the cool winter months.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kathryn P wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: From the moment we were greeted at the airport to the sack lunches that were packed for us for our bus ride this place made you feel like royalty. Even when we booked our stay at this riad they immediately followed up by sending over about 8-10 documents for you to read through. The riad staff is wonderful and happy to help you book any part of your trip!    Upon arriving at the riad they immediately escorted us into a salon and brought us milk and dates. Once they found out that we had not eaten yet that day they took us to the terrace and fed us the most amazing breakfast spread. After breakfast the manager Antonio briefed us about Marrakech with a map and then showed us to our room.    Our room was lovely and in good condition. It was perfectly large enough for two of us. They provided water and snacks/fruit. They would even bring by milk and dates in the evening.    The riad booked for us a tour guide Saad who was wonderful. He took us around Marrakech for a little over 7 hours. I would definitely recommend for your first trip to Marrakech to get to see all of the sites.    We also took advantage of the spa at the riad. We booked a couples hamman and followed up with a massage. The services were wonderful! We would highly recommend.    Larsen and his dining staff were fabulous and the food was delicious! We ate breakfast like kings daily. The only thing you order is how you would like your eggs prepared and what hot drink you want. And then mounds of food would appear before your eyes. It was all so good. And they cook the pancakes and breads right in front of you. We even had lunch at the riad one day and everything was delicious. All of the meals can be served on the terrace which luckily we had great weather every day.    This riad would do anything - make reservations schedule a car transfer for you and they even filled out the customs form for us to leave Morocco.    It was also located in a perfect place in the city. Very convenient to get in a cab and hop around the city. It was also a very easy walk to get to the souks.    This was our third hotel on our honeymoon and it was our favorite place that we stayed! We would recommend this place to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a pleasure staying here for two nights recently. The ambiance was authentic beautiful and intimate as the decor and layout was magical cozy and sun-filled. The service was very impressive from being greeted with mint tea and snacks upon arrival to having drivers arranged and getting set up with bookings at great restaurants and hammams. I would highly recommend Dar Anika!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Anwar M wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Visited dar Anika during my stay in Marrakech. We were welcomed with so much warmth no other place matched. The food we had there was the best while in Morocco. The place is much better than the photos. We loved it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Masood A wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Title: Repeat Visit: as good as ever!
Review_Text: We - my wife and I and our 23 year old daughter - went back to Dar Anika last December a year after our first visit. You always worry that the second visit won't be quite as good as the memories of the first. But we needn't have with Dar Anika.  We had a great wonderful time with exceptional hospitality food service and care. Everyone on the staff from Mr Antonio the manager to the receptionists waiters and cleaning staff go out of their way to make sure you are having a good time and to suggest things you might do to explore Marrakech or beyond.  The hotel itself is very comfortable. For us the best part is the terrace on the roof from which you can feel and see the hustle and bustle of the medina around you.  The kitchen is rightly acquiring quite a reputation and we enjoyed quite a few meals in-house during our stay. The pastilla is highly recommended!  All in all we really couldn't recommend the place more highly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Fantastic Riad in the Heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: My wife and I enjoyed 2 nights at Riad Anika at the start of January. From start to finish everything was fantastic - from the drinks at sunset on the terrace to the best yoghurt I have ever tasted for breakfast. Antonio and his team were absolutely wonderful. The location is great - a 5 minute walk to Jamaa el Fna square. There were also some very thoughtful finishing touches that were completely unexpected (a packed lunch on a day out and filling out boarding cards for the airport) that made the stay extra special. We hope to visit again when we return to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lorene T wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Our stay was truly amazing! The service was over and above anything we ever experienced. All the staff made sure we had everything we needed. The dinners were great and the breakfast was made especially for us and was different every day. It was very nice to have a meeting with the manager to give us tips on our stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Daniele C wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: I can easily say this was the best hotel experience I've ever had. Location food and the Riad itself are fantastic but what made the holiday sublime was the service we received. Abu Antonio and all the staff are amazing in giving you tips and taking care of you. Special mention to Lahcen that made every breakfast a food' feast. Hope to be back soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: L H wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Thank you to Antonio and his staff at the Riad Dar Anika for making our first stay in Marrakesh a memorable one. Nothing was to much trouble. All the recommendations were spot on especially the wonderfully atmospheric YACOUT. I must also mention the Berber guided trip into the Atlas Mountains that was arranged by Antonio and led by the very lovely Hassam including lunch cooked by his Mother and his wife. We were made so very welcome.  Thank you all we will be back Neil and Lesley H
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Everything is perfect. The staff really did their best to make you feel comfortable. The kitchen is awesome. The room is a little bit small. I very much enjoyed this trip in Marrakech and this hotel is really like my home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I had a wonderful stay at the Dar Anika for 10 days in November 2016. Booking was easy and they had a driver to waiting for me at the airport. Antonio and his team are to be commended for the incredible hospitality they showed me. No request was too small. The kitchen prepares superb food; I chose to eat at the Riad several nights instead of any of the other wonderful restaurants in the city. Breakfasts are substantial and delicious. The location can't be beat: it is at one of the main entrances to the medina; a taxi can leave you right in front or you can walk along a straight path to the main square. Would stay again at the Dar Anika in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Wonderful time staff were a Joy.
Review_Text: Booked the above Riad based on reviews. Certainly wonderful but wanted two things. Wifi and pool. Wifi fine pool is not what you see. It is in the middle of the courtyard surrounded by dining tables and chairs. Definitely artistic license with the photos and no way you would use it. Also no provisions were made for you to sit around it.  Wonderful staff great welcome and conveniently located near to the Square.  Food was great but ate out mostly.  Linen could do with an upgrade as had seen its best Day.  Massage was Out of This World. FANTASTIC. Had the local Hammam followed by one hour massage. All in house.  Would recommend totally but not if you want to relax by the pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff will do their uttermost to make you feel at home and give you a lovely stay.Complimentary dates and milk on your room for an arabic treat. Beautiful interior and an amazing roofterrace with lovely foods on the top. Higly recommended thanks to Antonio with his lovely staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: lili z wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: by the lower season to be there you will get great price and in the middle of Medina you can just walk around without worry for lost. when you need the tip about Marrakech you always can get advice from the owner or hotel manager. they are very warm welcome persons and experience the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Zara Mahmoud wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Visited Riad dar Anika on New Year's Eve  It was a night to remember with its amazing Moroccan food delicious lamb Tajine and fantastic music and cultural show /dance I had the best night ever.  Zara Mahmoud
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had an unforgettable stay at Dar Anika - the staff were lovely the food was delicious the service impeccable the location perfect and the Riad itself beautiful. I can't wait to come back here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This was our first visit to Morocco and it was a wonderful culture shock for us. When we arrived I wasn't sure we were at a hotel- it has an unassuming entrance in the middle of chaos. Once inside Abu and Antonio and their wonderful staff guided us and cared for us-handling every detail of our visit. We were welcomed with mint tea and traditional milk and local treats. Our room was huge and beautiful their food was delicious. We ate on the rooftop terrace for both dinner and breakfast where they had an artisan making homemade breads. My husband was in heaven. I am gluten intolerant and when they found out they brought me delicious bread also. It is close to the market with the snake charmers monkeys and the unique things you find in Morocco. The staff was friendly and well trained. We had a wonderful time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fiona J wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Title: A 5 star experience that makes you feel like a family friend relaxing in a luxurious home
Review_Text: This was our first trip to Morocco and we had no expectations. But Dar Anika has set the bar so high we will find it hard to match. Arriving tired and late at night after a 2 day commute from Australia we were warmly welcomed by Antonio and his staff. Nothing was too hard to arrange - airport pickup meant a smooth car ride straight to the hotel on entry we were welcomed by Antonio and given a comprehensive idea of the location suggestions and advice for places to visit over the next few days and commonsense tourist advice about moving around Marrakech. Phone cards organising access to an ATM to get local currency without the airport markup [1min walk from the hotel] and a late notice dinner on the rooftop terrace just seemed to happen.  The hotel grounds and rooms are even better than they appear in photos [both professional and trip advisor traveller] and it is the attention to detail in both use of materials and furnishings that really makes this special. While it is definitely a hotel it has the feel of a luxurious family house. The rooms all open onto a central courtyard but were very quiet and private. Yes you would wake to the 5.30am call to prayer but that was just an opportunity to get fabulous shots of the sunrise over the Atlas mountains from the rooftop terrace or to roll over and go back to sleep.  So no review of Dar Anika would be complete without mention of Larssen and his epic breakfasts and the wonderful experience of the in house Hamman spa. As seasoned travelers we know well the advantages of using the breakfast included in the room price to offset the need for lunch and snacks. however we were never going to be prepared for the wealth of choice we were served up every day. This included soup yogurt both traditional moroccan and french pancakes egg dishes fresh fruit and unlimited barista coffee.  The Hamman spa was also a special experience. We were able to do this as a couple in a heated room within the hotel. It was so easy to get into our swimming things and dressing gowns then walk downstairs straight to the spa. When finished you are dripping wet but glowing and the short walk straight back to the room is ideal.  Finally the location of Dar Anika is ideal. The walk to the main square and souks is an easy 15 minute walk. If you don't want to go far for a meal there is a modern square across from the hotel that has several restaurants within 1 minute walk. You can eat at the hotel and order wine from the house menu. To access most tourist attractions you will find they are within walking distance or a short taxi ride.  Would we stay here again.... in a heartbeat!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: andrea a wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: We could stay here forever! The staff went above and beyond to meet our every need and expectation! They made us feel right at home! They made shure every detail was perfect! Cant wait to come back! SOON!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: An Oasis in the medina of Marrakech...
Review_Text: Thank you to all the staff at Dar Anika for making our stay unforgettable. During all my travel globally I have not experienced a better more genuine and personalized service elsewhere. Excellent location close to many city landmarks. Although we left very early in the morning for the airport on our last day Abu made sure he was able to say his goodbye by arriving significantly before his regular arrival time. Thank you again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: What a great experience we had at Riad Dar Anika. The location is really great with everything in walking distance. The staff are really friendly knowledgeable and helpful. The Riad is beautiful decorated and offers an authentic experience. Great outside terrace. Great breakfast!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Melody C wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: This was by far my favorite Riad! We stayed 3 other places but this one is very special! It's close enough to the souk & square yet far enough that it's not too loud. It's located south where things had more of an expat feel. The service here was unrivaled. Antonio and his staff are the best. You'll be happy you stayed here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Andy M wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: Stayed for 4 nights in October 2016. We were totally blown away on arrival the welcome & the Riad itself were beyond our expectations. The photographs don't do it justice as they can't portray the warmth of the staff & the calmness of the Riad enough. The high standards & attention to detail made our stay in a city full of hustle & bustle so relaxing. Antonio & his staff were so helpful & attentive yet unobtrusive. Breakfast or evening meal on the terrace is a real treat. Location is perfect to explore the 'experience' of Marrakech being close enough to walk to all the main sites but far enough out of the mesmerising circus of experiences that is the old town.  Don't be daunted by walking the streets & souks although it may feel out of your comfort zone. We downloaded a map of Marrakech on the 'Ulmon' app which kept us on track.  We would recommend a trip to the Atlas Mountains with a Berber guide. Antonio arranged this for us & our guide Hussain was really friendly chatty & gave great insights into his way of life. Taking Mint Tea & Lunch in his home was a great privilege & experience.  Marrakech is a great experience for a totally different city break.  We wouldn't hesitate in staying in the Riad Dar Anika again & would recommend you put it on your bucket list.  Thankyou to Antonio & all staff for a wonderful experience on many levels.  Andrew Morgan & Sandra Levick
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: kristina j wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: If you are thinking of visiting Marrakech go to the Riad Dar Anika! The whole experience was wonderful. Just 10 minutes walk from the square the Riad is a peaceful oasis from the noise and chaos. The roof garden was a beautiful spot to watch the world go by. The staff were without doubt the best I have ever encountered in my many travels. The food was amazing.    Just go!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Was here I February 2016 but we just had to come back (December 2016)  The food is great and the service is top. We had dinner downstairs and decert on the rooftop. Khaliol (the waiter) was great  We must come again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika for 3 nights at the end of our vacation. It is NOT to be confused with Csar Anika which is nearby. Dar Anika is managed by Antonio who greeted us (with tea of course) and sat down with us and gave us an overview of the city of Marrakech. He recommended restaurants (which were all fabulous) and even sent us off to the airport with a care package. He arranged an evening car ride to a restaurant when he thought getting a taxi woud be difficult or unsafe. We loved breakfast up on the roof terrace and even did afternoon tea up there. The riad setting is so much more unique and authentic than a stay at a hotel in Morocco. The staff made us feel like we were VIPs from start to finish. I wish I knew more people planning trips to Marrakech because I would love to share Dar Anika with them.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Connie H wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: Beautiful Riad attends to your every need. Kind conscientious and attentive. Well-located this place is a gem. They even packed us a lunch to eat on the plane when we left. Would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Absolutely loved our stay at this lovely riad. The place is beautiful and the staff and owner couldn't have been more warm and welcoming. They really made our stay in this city the best that it could be. The owner had much great advice for us of the best things to do and places to visit. I only wish we had more time than 1 night. Thanks again Dar Anika and all the great people who work there for a wonderful stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I've never felt so looked-after on a holiday. All the staff are so focused on making sure you have a brilliant stay. Wish we could have stayed for longer than 4 nights!    Abu (the owner) gave us lots of useful information and recommendations at the beginning of our stay and made sure we knew where we were going each day. He gave us lots of restaurant recommendations too without hard-selling the riad's restaurant - which we discovered serves delicious food and is lit up beautifully in the evenings.    Breakfast was a great start to each day with friendly and attentive Lahcen looking after us exceptionally well. Freshly squeezed orange juice tasty Moroccan pancakes and eggs and coffee to order helped to ensure I've returned from holiday a kilogram heavier. Eating on the sun terrace was also a treat with views accross Marrakech and little sparrows hoping to share breakfast with us. We were also given dates and milk when returning to the riad in the evening more freshly squeezed orange juice in the day (thanks again Lahcen) and lots of complimentary fruit and Moroccan biscuits.    The riad itself is beautifully decorated and is impeccably clean. There is a very cosy lounge off the atrium too for relaxing with some mint tea after an evening out or an afternoon in the souks. The room was perfect: very spacious a large comfy bed and a powerful shower. All decorated lovingly with rose petals! Location is great: the riad is 5mins brisk walk from the main square so it is easy to get around.    We also had hammam and massage at the riad which was a great experience very relaxing.    On departing we got given a packed lunch for our journey home a lovely touch.    Thanks to all the staff for making our holiday so special. We know there is only one place to stay when we return to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A great venue to have a group holiday with friends a classic location and design of the hotel a unforgetable time. A wide range of catering available which covered our needs. For sure will be re-visiting.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: A great raid in a great location. Our first trip to Marrakesh was made all the better for staying at the Dar Anika. Clean rooms good food and staff who could not do enough to help. Excellent quality all round and would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alessandro D wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Title: LOOK NO FURTHER... THE BEST PLACE TO STAY (RIAD KAISS ALSO SISTER OPTION) IN MARRAKECH (BY FAR) !!
Review_Text: Fantastic trip... the hotel (Riad) not only provides a beautiful place to stay right in the heart of the city the facilities the restaurant (the food here was best i had over the week stay) the excursions / guides are all superb but what outshines here compared to many hotels I have been to worldwide is the service!!  This is a typical ‘stress-free’ holiday (as they should be) - all you have to do is get on a plane and arrive to the airport of Marrakech..... From there you are looked after every single way imaginable from ‘A - Z and al with outstanding service and friendliness. In all honesty I personally have never had a more relaxing holiday than this and it’s all thanks to the immaculate and client friendly team at the RIAD DAR ANIKA.... We are going back in March!! Cannot wait!!!

Review_Date: Luis C wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Title: Our Amazing experience at Riad Dar Anika!
Review_Text: This Riad is truly a gem in the middle of Marrakech. There are many compliments we could give to this riad and all the wonderful people who work there. First of all the level of service is like no other the staff and management treat you like family and they attend to your every need. We had a complicated experience with missed flight connections and our baggage not arriving with us to Marrakech. We were tired and stressed out and being so far from home without our possessions did not help. Nonetheless Antonio and the staff did everything to assure us and comfort us during our unease. The staff took care of locating our bags and communicating with us any updates. Antonio even personally drove us to the airport to pick up our bags. These are the details that make this Riad and its employees so special. This level of attention is given to every detail including welcoming you with tea and snacks offering complementary fresh juices and fruits throughout your stay and even providing one with a lunch pack meal for the departure. The comforts and services of this amazing riad are 5 star. The meal options were some of the best we had throughout our trip in Africa and Europe. The rooftop and all its comforts were an excellent place to start and end our adventures throughout the city. The staff was very attentive and always concerned about comfort and needs. The riad itself is an oasis in the middle of the chaos of the medina. We can honestly say that without our stay at Dar Anika this trip would not have been the same. Believe the reviews and don't hesitate to book.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kayvon G wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Title: The most hospitality I've ever received anywhere!
Review_Text: I went on a mini tour of Morocco with my father and brother for a week. We stayed at various Riad's (old family homes that have been renovated and converted into essentially bed and breakfast hotels) along the way in Rabat Fes and finally in Marrakesh. We were frankly blown out of the water with how excellent the service was. We felt as though we were treated with the same hospitality we would receive if we were family.    We were immediately greeted upon arrival with tea snacks and water. We told them last minute that we were hungry and they were able to whip up an amazing lamb shoulder meal at the drop of a hat. Antonio met with us and was thorough with respect to what we should do with our time there and gave us several pointers about the city. All members of the staff were exceptionally warm and friendly at all times. One in particular Larsen was very gregarious and amicable. When we were ready to leave they helped arrange transportation to the train station and even offered to purchase tickets on our behalf. We were given goodie-bags with some snacks for our travels and they even went so far as to fill out as much of the airport forms for departure as they could. They are extremely deliberate about paying attention to detail about even the smallest of things - we were all extremely impressed. I've never had such excellent customer service anywhere that I've traveled.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My husband and I have often talked about visiting Morocco and after doing some homework we decided that we must stay in the Medina. Further research lead us to Riad Dar Anika and I am so pleased that we stayed here. The service is OUTSTANDING! the hote/riad is very beautiful inside very clean and fresh. The atmosphere is relaxing and pleasant. We selected a room on the ground floor and found it to be very private good shower firm mattress fridge nice linens bathrobes slippers room safe hair dyer and daily treats - cookies fruit etc delivered to our room.  each morning we enjoyed breakfast on the rooftop terrace and in the evenings a glass of wine and snacks downstairs. We were celebrating our anniversary and they surprised us with a song and large bouquet of roses at breakfast. The food was very good and they have a generous menu. If you are visiting Morocco you must stay here have a meal here enjoy some time out upstairs in the afternoon and you MUST sign up for Hammam - wow that was the bath of a lifetime. Seriously I was so pleased and exfoliated! LOL. Ladies bring your bikini bottoms - that is all you need to wear (you can wear your bathrobe to the bath). My husband and I took swim suits and I ditched the top when I realized it was truly a bath and not just random soaking in a tub and sitting in a sauna. You will not regret the bath.  We also signed up for the walking tour - I strongly recommend this. Navigating the Souks alone can be daunting. The salespeople are quite aggressive. the guide took us through the souks and we also visited the secret garden and palace and several other areas - well worth it. on day two we went to the new town area. we felt very safe and found a nice place to eat lunch. I have to say much of our success was due to the great advice and map that Antonio the proprietor at Riad Dar Anika provided. I cannot tell you how happy we were to spend our time off here. it was wonderful. then as we were leaving they sent us off to the airport with a gift of sandwiches and fruit for lunch. I love this place and I LOVE the management and staff!!  and you will too
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Marrakech I was not too fond of however I would go back just to experience the level of service I experienced at this Riad. The place is beautiful the rooms are very comfortable the staff was an absolute pleasure. From the outside you may be underwhelmed at first but will be absolutely impressed after going in and it all adds to the experience of visiting Marrakech.  Antonio and Fadwa would do anything to make your stay comfortable but what impressed me most is that this attitude was passed along to everyone of the staff working at this Riad! This is something that is very hard to accomplish in customer service.  We really liked sitting up top and having breakfast also just having a glass of wine in the lounge downstairs next to the fireplace. They had no problems with our flights arriving early and had our room ready.  Also had the couples Hamman experience and would do that again.  I have stayed at many hotels around the world and very few could come close to the experience we had here. We will be back just to spend time at this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you love perfectly attentive service then the Riad dar Anika is for you. It’s situated in the heart of the medina and its insignificant front door hides the luxury that lies beyond. Antonio the general manager personally greets his guests and gives a comprehensive orietation of how to get the best out of your visit. He highlights the must-sees on the map and gives you an insight into local culture including those often senstive topics of tipping and taxis. From there on his super-friendly staff continue the theme. Nothing is too much trouble even down to details such as confirming your return flights and printing your boarding passes (a thoughtful touch was being provided with a fully-completed embarkation card to save time at the airport). Throughout our stay the attentive service never felt over-the-top and nor did we ever feel we were being pushed into ordering drinks etc. One word of warning. The breakfasts served where possible on the open air terrace are comprehensive; it would be easy to go home with a few extra pounds around your waist. The Riad dar Anika will certainly be our choice on any future visit and we are grateful to our personal travel consultant for recommending it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Riad Dar Anika should be the paradigm for service. The friendliness efficiency and attention to detail of the staff is so amazing that I am still in awe weeks later. First and foremost they ensured that my friends and I knew where we were going whenever we left the Riad. They provided us with a map instructions and guidance for every aspect of the stay. When we were unwinding in the lounge they would bring us tea and would strike up a friendly and relaxed conversation. They told us how to navigate the marketplace and how much you should pay taxi drivers. Before I left for my flight they packed me a meal. It was truly a worthwhile and unforgettable experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed for 2 nights at this wonderful Riad. We had such a warm welcome from all the fantastic staff and the manager Antonio.    They couldn't do enough for us. It was a little oasis amongst the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Vasiha Begum wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: I remember the most unusual experiences of my stay at dar Anika. It was like visiting a traditional Moroccan mansion. The room was very romantic with roses on bed and in the bathroom. The breakfast was very traditional Moroccon and delicious. The manager and staff were very warm helpful and caring. The character of the hotel is very cosy and homely. Highly recommended for newly weds and for holiday makers. The location is excellent. Taxi is available little outside the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Noor A wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: The staff at Dar Anika was incredibly helpful. They offered advice and made reservations for dinners arranged transfers for tours and to/from hotel. Perfectly arranged. For two young women traveling in Marrakech felt very safe here. There is a hammam at Dar Anika and easy to book a service here nice to have at our hotel rather than find one in the town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This is a fantastic place. The manager and the staff provided exceptional and very personal service. Many complimentary extras were provided. They also made excellent restaurant and private tour service recommendations that made our whole vacation experience outstanding. We will literally miss these fantastic people! Thank you Antonio Fadwa Hind Mohammad. Thank you to the entire staff. Laurence I miss your breakfast everyday! Thank you for an outstanding experience!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Alishia S wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: What a wonderful experience we had at Riad Dar Anika!!! From the moment we arrived Antonio and his staff treated us like royalty. We were greeted with a very friendly staff when we arrived. From the fabulous breakfasts served by Lawrence and his outstanding staff to all the transfers offered to take us wherever we needed to go we were never in need of anything. Antonio made sure we were taken care of no matter what was needed. He set up all transfers arranged reservations for dinners and arranged for us to have a fantastic guide (Saad) through the Souks. Our trip was fantastic and I know it was because of Riad Dar Anika!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I visited Marrakech Morocco for the first time last week (Nov. 19-25 2016) and we spent the trip at Dar Anika. This riad is the epitome of excellence. I think I sent a dozen emails in the weeks leading up to the trip asking questions and arranging things and each email was responded to quickly. Upon arriving at the airport the driver greeted us at the door and drove a very nice crossover vehicle to the riad where we were met by the staff who took our bags and guided us inside. The riad is located on a busy traffic square so a lot is going on and it is very intriguing. We were given dates and milk and mint tea within minutes of arriving and then we met with Antonio the riad manager who went over details about the city including safety and made sure we were planning to make the most of our trip including suggesting excursions and riad services but with NO PRESSURE; he simply told us what was available and left it at that. We stayed in room 6. It was beautiful and clean and very quiet. It is an oasis from the busy city outside. Breakfast lunch and dinner are absolutely wonderful. All of the staff are very friendly and eager to make your stay perfect. We booked a hammam and massage on one of the days it rained and it was a great experience. You can't go to Morocco and not try a hammam! We felt very comfortable and it was relaxing which was important after a long trip and busy days exploring the city. We celebrated my husband's birthday while in Marrakech. I went down the morning of his birthday to request something be left in the room for him and the hostess smiled and told me it was already taken care of! I was blown away. They took it upon themselves to look at the booking information take note that is was his birthday and arrange a celebration for him....on their own! They had set up a separate location for us to enjoy break fast. Afterwards the table was cleared and the host place red rose petals one at a time on our table following this the entire riad staff came out with a small birthday cake and the most beautiful flower bouquet I have ever seen and sang Happy Birthday in 3 languages! It was such a special experience and so very thoughtful of the manager and staff! I wish I could highlight one thing to help but honestly everything was perfect. The rooftop at breakfast the courtyard at all hours the rooms the lounging areas the food the service the wine selection......everything was perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is an absolute gem in Marrakech. We checked in seated in the warm and cozy living room area while being served mint tea and treats. The manager Antonio sat with us and to give us information about the city and walk us through the map. He took note of any reservations we had during the stay so that we could be accommodated accordingly with drivers food to go or anything else we might have needed.    The location is perfect inside the Medina and a short walk to Jamaa El Fna. You can easily find taxis in the area if you are venturing out of the area.    Although we didn't have a full meal the small snacks we did have in the restaurant were delicious we enjoyed wine by the fire in the evenings and were treated with the very best service. The staff here is so kind and welcoming it was sad to say goodbye!    I would absolutely recommend this riad to anyone visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Exp T wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Title: Sublime Service and surroundings in Marrakech
Review_Text: This lovely riad is most like a boutique hotel. It's difficult to know where to begin singing its praises. I stayed for a business (great internet) but bit by bit the surroundings and wonderful manager and staff began wearing off the layers of tension and I found myself looking forward to seeing them in the evenings almost as if I was returning home. Was it the dates and fresh milk every night daily laundry and the hammam? Or was it the authentic Moroccan breakfast on the rooftop terrace or the lovely room with ornate plaster carvings and inlaid furnishings? It's hard to know except that at each step of my stay Antonio the owner and staff ensured that I knew everything I needed to feel at home and was able to enjoy the city and my business trip to the fullest. I hosted a dinner at the riad in the courtyard by candlelight by the small pool under the eaves and there too the hotel and staff created an amazing atmosphere and memories. This stay alone committed me to return to Morocco and learn more about this fabulous country and citizens and Riad Dar Anika is where I will stay as a tourist. It is the perfect location from which to explore the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Dar Anika is hard to summarize except to say it was the best vacation hotel experience we have ever had in a long life of travel. Located on the edge of the Medina you are well situated for shopping and site seeing. The staff is superb and provide a level of personalized service (including goat's milk and dates every evening in your room) that is fantastic. Made us feel at home. They easily dealt with any questions or issues we had. Breakfast on the rooftop patio is a great way to start the day. when we were too tired to go out at night (after a long day of touring) the food from the Dar Anika kitchen was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We just stayed at Riad Dar Anika for two days as we were traveling through Marrakech. It is perfectly located at the entrance to the Medina and only a short walk to Jamaa El Fna (the center market). The manager Antonio and the entire staff were incredibly accommodating. You are welcomed to the Riad with Moroccan mint tea and pastries upon your arrival and from that point on it is impeccable service and amazing food for your entire stay. If you need to book any activities or reservations the staff can do that for you when you get there as well. The interior is an authentically Moroccan cozy and comfortable oasis in the heart of the busiest part of the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I visited Dar Anika the last week of October 2016.    I believe the true test of a hotel's quality comes not when things go perfectly right but when something goes wrong or not quite what you'd expect. This hotel is an absolute GEM for countless reasons but primarily because of the utmost professionalism shown after I reported a small issue. The owner and his brother as well as the other staff were determined to go above and beyond to correct the matter and provide me with an experience I would never forget.    First the location is PERFECT as it is immediately accessible from one the main thoroughfares in the Mellah (Jewish quarter) section of the media. If you know anything about the dizzying maze-like streets in Moroccan medinas you will be grateful for it. Dar Anika is in close proximity to nearly all of the main sights (less than 10 minutes walk) making it the most convenient hotel I stayed in during my entire trip.    The rooms are colorful and decorated elegantly. I really loved the plaster work (one of the key elements you will see throughout Morocco) and attention to detail.    The owner and his brother both named Abu were very helpful with recommending worthwhile sights as well as places to purchase excellent gifts to take back to colleagues and family. The owner was gracious enough to show me the riad they're working to open next and it is GORGEOUS! I'm already trying to figure out how to get back!    As a woman traveling alone they made me feel safe and welcome (VERY important). I was a bit sad I wasn't there with a significant other as the hotel is quite romantic especially at night in the lobby as well as the rooftop!    The food was good but there are so many delicious places to eat in Marrakech so you may not want to eat there every night.    All in all I lucked out with Dar Anika. Stay here and you won't be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Thanks to Abu Antonio & Larsson. Dar Anika really took care of us and our friends from airport pickups to a trip into the Atlas Mts Hammam and restaurant bookings. The Riad itself was clean comfortable and a great place to relax on the roof or in the garden. Breakfast with Larsson was not to be missed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sverrir H wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: We spent a week at Dar Anika and I must say that this is a truly amazing place. Abu his brother and the whole staff really pampered with us. the service was really great all the way - they helped us plan everything from dinner to carpet dealing. The Hammam was brilliant as well. One of the highlights was a trip the planned for us to the Atlas mountains where Hassan our guide showed us the beautiful nature of the High Atlas mountains and the we ended having lunch at his mothers. We would recommend Dar Anika to anyone who wants to have a nice time and experience the best that Marrakesh has to offer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen W wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Dar Anika for a long weekend and had the most amazing time. Antonio and his staff are the best! Nothing was too much trouble and their hospitality was heart-warming. The location of the Riad is perfect if you want to experience the real Morocco. I would highly recommend a stay here if you want to be well looked after.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Nice restaurant in the centre of the city very good service and excelent Kitchen. The food was very tasty and the waiter lovely. We order marrocain salad lamb and chiken pastilla and We reale enjoy. The decoracion of the Riad is beatiful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Great for Moroccan charm, cuisine and convenience
Review_Text: If you like your hotels to be Hiltons or Holiday Inns this is not your place. Like many places on old Marrakech (the Medina) you walk to it a few meters down a pedestrian walkway from the main road. You open the door wondering if you are in the right place. And from that moment you are welcomed as family with fresh milk and dates tea and pastries as they register you and give you the lay of the land.    This is a totally charming 3-story 10-room guest house in an old Moroccan building that features old country architecture and features. The rooms are very comfortable and luxurious and decorated in old Moroccan style.    It also has a fantastic restaurant that is frequented by guests and outsiders. You have the option of eating downstairs next to a fountain the the fire place. Or (my favorite) eat on the roof top and enjoy the cool fresh air and view.    I cannot overstate how great their hospitality is. They helped me with directions car arrangements business needs and what I should see while there -- always with great courtesy and a smile.    I definitely plan to return
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Our first time in Marrakech and this was a perfect spot. Great location wonderful staff comfortable room. Couldn't ask for anything else.    In particular they were extra helpful in helping us arrange excursions which removed all stree from our vacation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I would totally recommend this Riad. Situated in a fantastic location in the centre of Marrakech.  We were made to feel extremely welcome from when we arrived to the day we left. The staff were all very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The food was of a very high standard and we had a 5 course breakfast each morning in the rooftop terrace.  I would definitely return again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Staying at Dar Anika was the best experience of our trip to Marakech. It is just at the entrance of the Medina. Dar Anika is full of Luxury details. The owner Antonio is always worry of how to help. And probably the best restaurant of Marrakech is located at the Roof Top of Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Reem A wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: I was very nervous about being a solo female traveler to Marrakech for the first time. But soon this worry vanished as I entered Dar Anika . I have stayed in the best hotels around the world but this one was really special and cozy . Both the owner Abu Molook and the Manager Antonio made me feel really at home. They gave me an amazing insight about the city and the culture. I even fell sick and they looked after me as their own family member. The rooms are beautiful the Riad is just located in few minutes walk to the souk.  And What ever you want just ask Antonio and he'll get it done.  I highly recommend this place and for sure it will be my second home in Marrakech for all my next trips there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Christophe B wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: This was our first trip to Marrakech. The service at the riad was fantatstic. From the very first meeting to the minute of departure everybody went out or their way to be helpful and make our stay memorable. We were explained how to work the city how to get out take taxis work the souks haggle...etc. Everybody in the team takes their responsibiliies at heart and very personally. Needless to say that all rooms are impeccably cleaned every day. The setting and attention to detail in the tasteful decoration the lighting the pool area the terrace all contributed to an amazing restful and cultural experience.    I wish I had not booked my transfer to and from the airoport with the trip organiser but instead let the riad organise it. The riad will send you an email and contact numbers as soon as the reservation is made. They offer to pick you up and drive you back organise dinner or a snack the evening you arrive. They also will orgainse a whole suite of activities to perform in the area of Marakesh so wait to see what they offer before booking anything else.    The riad will organise anything you would wish to do from 1/2 days guided visits to day trecking in the Atlas to 2-3 excursions in the desert.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We have travelled extensively and have never been treated better than at Dar Anika from the time we arrived to the sandwichs they packed for us when we departed. The decor is not five stars but our room was super clean with lovely linens interesting Moroccan furnishings and a first-rate bathroom. The roof top garden with its fabulous breakfast and staff was a treat every morning. This was a birthday trip and on the day at breakfast they sprinkled the table with rose petals brought a beautiful cake roses and the staff sang Happy Birthday in 5 languages!!They even brought us mint/lime iced drinks when we came back to the riad hot after sightseeing every day.  We loved Dar Anika and Marrakech. What a wonderful week!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A Five PLUS Star Customer Service Experience in a beautiful Riad!
Review_Text: I have traveled all over the world and this is one of the BEST hotels (known as a Riad) I have ever experienced. From the moment we entered my husband and I were treated like royalty. From the exquisite rooftop meals/drinks to the staff greeting us when we returned with a refreshing lime/mint drink every aspect of this Riad is first class. Try the day trips you can book through the dar Anika...wonderful chance to explore out of the city. They will also arrange a fabulous guide for you to explore the Medina. We are so looking forward to booking this Riad again when we return to Marrakech. The staff and Antonio the manager feel like family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: THE BEST HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED IN
Review_Text: I have stayed in 5 star hotels all over the world and all of them lacked something. Dar Anika offered a tranquil sanctuary in the heart of the chaos that is the Medina. NOTHING was too much trouble all the staff smiled and couldn't do enough for us.    The Riad has been done up in a shabby chic Moroccan style but had all the mod cons and was really clean. The beds were really comfortable with PROPER linen on them and fresh fruit and bottled water were put in the rooms daily.
