I am not your 'normal' guest and was distressed at all the poor donkeys and cats and although they must have thought me mad gave me buckets of water to give to the donkeys daily!    The breakfasts are HUGE and utterly delicious especially their homemade yoghourt which was out of this world. Their Hammam scrub and massage was beyond wonderful too - a great start to the holiday!    We had to leave at 7am for our flight home and Antonio the marvellous manager came in on his day off to say goodbye to us. He then gave us the most delicious picnic to eat at the airport. Extraordinary!    They are opening another Riad very soon and if it's HALF as good as Dar Anika it will be a great success! Enjoy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Bill B wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: A beautiful riad situated within 5 minutes of Jemaa el Fna. The staff were welcoming and exceptionally attentive especially Antonio the manager and Lassan one of the waiters. All our needs were attended to with charm and grace. The riad is very comfortable. The rooftop terrace was great for both breakfast and dinner. Great food and attentive service. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I stayed at Dar Anika for over a week last June. The experience was lovely. From the milk and date reception to the sending off with sandwiches (on gluten free bread) for my flight there was not a detail that wasn't tended to with the greatest of care and pride. A small Riad there is an intimate and special feeling staying here. The staff will cater to your every need. They accommodated my gluten-free restriction and served a beautiful breakfasts on the terrace where they also serve dinner. There is a lovely room on the ground level where you can smoke and watch movies or simply work.  Their open ground terrace is adjacent to their pool which is not used by guests as often as it should be The room was comfortable and immaculate and the daily laundry service was an added bonus. An ideal place to work or simply relaxed while having the full staff of the hotel at your disposal for anything you may need. Ideally situated one could walk to the Medina (5 minutes) and any other of the attractions in the Medina.  I loved staying here and will do so whenever I am back in Marrakesh.  Thank you Antonio for being such a gracious host and for all the wonderful staff members that make staying with you so special and unforgettable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Tranquil home from home in the busy Medina
Review_Text: We spent two nights at Dar Anika with our four adult/teenage children. It was an ideal base from which to explore the souks and Medina. We are frequent travellers and I have to say that the staff were some of the most welcoming and friendly we have come across. The charming General Manager Antonio personally talked us through the dos and donts of exploring the souks - useful advice for travelling generally; as well as helping with restaurant reservations and any other questions we had. He even gave each of us a business card with his personal mobile number in case we ran into difficulties in the souk.    Antonio's team of staff are well trained and very welcoming. Lesson looked after us most attentively at breakfast at the pretty roof top restaurant. This huge and delicious feast kept us going all day.    Dar Anika is small and we have stayed in other Marrakech riads where the building has more of a 'wow factor' but the welcome and little extras at this one are hard to beat. Indeed when we left Dar Anika we went on to stay at a spectacular five star resort hotel outside the city and although the facilities were excellent we missed the Dar Anika personal welcome and kindness.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A Beautiful Small Hotel in Center of marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed 3 nights at Riad Dar Anika and we enjoyed our time there. The rooms in this 12 room hotel are decorated in traditional moroccan style. We had booked 2 rooms but one was too small and the hotel owner Abu immediately changed it for us.  The service and hospitality is amazing at Riad Dar Anika. The staff makes sure every guest feels right at home. We had breakfast at the roof top restaurant every day. A lady baked fresh moroccan bread right in front of our eyes. The freshly squeezed and all you can drink orange juice was certainly a treat. On the day of our departure Abu the owner handed us 4 canvas bags to take with us. He had packed us sandwiches that were still warm fruit water and other goodies. He told us the sandwiches are what his mom used to make when he was growing up. He really touched us by his grace. He was always available in the lobby and we spent a lot of time talking to him about everything and anything. He certainly left a good impression on us.  The Wifi is very good at the hotel but there was no TV in the room. That was the only drawback.  The hotel is right in the center so we could walk to many places.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Boo Y wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: Best hotel I have ever stayed in.
Review_Text: I went to Marrakech for my honeymoon and stayed at the Dar Anika which was just amazing. I cannot pay enough compliments.  At the time I was doing my research Dar Anika had approximately 95% of its reviews as 5* and the rest were 4* - which was astonishing considering there was almost 600 reviews. I was very intrigued how they had such consistently good reviews. Well I know now. The way we looked after was something I haven't even experienced when staying with family.    1. We were greeted at the door and not just checked-in at reception but taken to the poolside and brought milk dates Moroccan sweets. Such a nice way of being welcomed in.    2. The manager (Antonio) then sat with us for half an hour and gave us a map and loads of amazing inside information about Marrakech which you can only get from a local. We really appreciated how thoughtful and useful this was and really set the tone for our whole stay.    3. Our room (the Suite) was very comfortable and tastefully decorated. I loved the bathroom products which were made with natural argan oil    4. The breakfast served was amazing. And after the first couple of days the waiters remembered exactly was we liked (e.g coffee tea orange juice). On the second day we woke up late and were leaving the Riad around midday. We bumped into the owner who asked us if we had had breakfast. When we replied we had woken up too late and therefore missed breakfast he said nobody should leave without eating and sent us to the roof terrace and specially ordered breakfast be sent before we left to wander the city!    5. The staff were very attentive incredibly polite and went the extra mile whenever possible. We noted during our stay that whenever we returned to the hotel in the afternoon to avoid the heat we would always have complimentary drinks sent to our room within 5-10 minutes - and they were these divine iced mint / lemon drinks which were incredibly refreshing. The reception team helped book all our taxis and made all restaurant reservations for us.    6. The owner also gave us a special gift which I won't say here as everyone will be requesting it! - but it was incredibly generous of him    7. On the day we were leaving we had arranged to go for a trek in the Atlas mountains and the staff had prepared a bag for us with sandwiches fruits and drinks to take.    8. The Wifi was easily the best out of the 3 hotels we stayed at    9. Location - perfect. 10 minutes walk to most of the main attractions in the heart of the medina.    Just overall 10/10. There probably are other hotels with more amenities (full-sized pool gym sauna etc etc) but if you want to stay in a Riad in the Medina this is THE best. The staff made my honeymoon unforgettable and I will be eternally thankful for what they did.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great place! The staff and management team make you feel at home. Everyone works hard to make your stay wonderful. Great food Great Atmosphere Great Location. Highly recomend Dar Anika. Exceptional Value and Service!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ian M wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: From the moment we got to Dar Anika we were welcomed with refreshments and warm smiles. Antonia and the entire staff went out of their way to make sure that we were comfortable and had everything we needed- not just in the Riad but out in the medina too (finding and walking us to taxis helping us find vendors taking us to a nearby seamstress to fix some broken luggage getting train tickets for us putting us in contact with a wonderful tour guide "Hassan" in Imill...to mention a few).    Their wonderful terrace allowed us to enjoy the bustling Medina below and the food was delicious- try the "Pastilla"! The rooms were super clean and beautifully decorated as was the entire Riad.    All in all a fantastic experience!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We arrived home yesterday after spending 3 nights at this wonderful Riad. It is filled with the most helpful friendliest warm hearted people you will ever meet. The Riad is perfectly located just outside the hustle and bustle of the main square but within walking distance to pretty much everything.    Antonio and his employees cannot do enough to ensure you have the perfect stay. The rooms are individually beautifully decorated and so clean and tidy as is the whole Riad. On our arrival we were greeted with some dates water and mint tea - which after a 4am start was most welcome and to our delight we were also offered breakfast on the terrace which no other hotel ever has offered on morning travels. Antonio then went through a map of the Medina highlighting places of interest entrances from different directions should we go outside of the walls and his mobile number should we got lost. He also advised things to be watchful of and could he help with anything to let him know.    We had already pre-arranged with the Riad for a 3 hour medina tour but Antonia also then arranged a trip to the Atlas Mountains - which was totally amazing. After a 2hr 30 min hike we had lunch with a traditional Berber family which was not a tourist gimmick offered by some tours we have previously been on elsewhere. This village was in the middle of the mountains not accessible by cars but tracks through the mountains which was not for the faint hearted - so we knew it was traditional! The food was amazing the best lamb we have ever had.    This small but beautiful formed Riad has no boundaries in providing the best it can possibly offer. It's the small touches that make your stay so unforgettable and provide lovely memories. They literally cannot do enough for you from offering the greatest breakfast however I suggest you embrace that you will put on a few pounds as the food is never ending Larson who served us breakfast each daywe nicknamed Larson 5 and half kilos as he just kept bringing food but it was good food!    It was my husbands birthday the day we left and after an early breakfast he was presented with a delicious birthday cake and congratulations from the team and a lovely handwritten message. After saying our goodbyes with mouthfuls of cake we were given a little bag with sandwiches apples and grapefruit for our flight also our departure forms already completed. So whilst everyone was hectic trying to complete these in the immigration queue we breezed past and on the Ryanair flight when people were eating overpriced somewhat god awful food - we were eating our delicious snacks result!    Please do not look any further if you are planning a trip to Marrakech if you want to have a taste of proper Morocco and not just be a number of a hotel room but be known who you are with the warmest genuine service then you have just found your hotel. Enjoy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Before booking the Dar Anika I read all the glowing reviews but in the back of mind I was convinced that they couldn't all be true. Well after a few days at the Riad I'm a believer. Every positive review on this site is well deserved and I'm happy to add my own 5-star review.    I've stayed at luxury resorts all over the world and I've never had better service anywhere. And as a solo traveler the hotel was very conscientious about safety and offering as much information as possible.    Upon arrival the owner sat with me and outlined all the things to do in the city how to get there and what the taxi fares should cost. He even offered tips on how to negotiate at the souks. But by far the most impressive amenity was the cell phone they gave me in case I needed to reach the hotel during my stay. That was above and beyond any service I've ever received!    In addition there was an amazing breakfast spread everyday a wonderful hammam a beautiful pool a lovely well-kept room evening desserts daily fruit the packed lunch upon check out... and the list goes on.    I will absolutely be back and recommend this Riad to others.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We found Dar Anika after seeing reviews online and we are so glad we did. We arrived to Dar Anika after a short tour in the desert and it was a wonderful reprieve after some hot long days. Immediately the staff was accommodating and providing us with drinks and teas. The hotel in itself was beautiful with a dining space downstairs a spa in the back and beautiful rooms. Our room was gorgeous clean and included great amenities. We were served an enormous breakfast on the beautiful rooftop terrace which included fruit soup crepes cakes yogurt coffee and tea. Again the staff was kind and accommodating continuing to offer us anything we could have wanted. The hotel was perfectly located and was a short walk to all of the major sites within the Medina. Because we were leaving Marrakech that evening we asked the hotel if we could store our luggage while we explored during the day. Not only did they allow us to keep our luggage in the room but they also gave us access to use our room to shower before we left for the airport since the room was not being used that night. The hotel organized a car to take us to the airport and provided us a bag with sandwiches and fruit to take with us to the airport. I would easily return to this hotel when I return to Marrakech and recommend anyone else to do the same.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Dee L wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: From location to staff to the restaurant. All incredible. Highly recommend. Will definitely stay there again. A mom with 2 teen daughters. Always felt safe. Not one complaint. Absolutely love everything about our experience at Riad Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Amazing hotel with excellent service felt like royalty
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here for two nights in August and it was a great choice. Neither of us had been in Morocco before but I read a number of blogs. I knew that safety and comfort were my highest priorities. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was beyond hospitable. They even made sandwiches for us at check out for our plane ride back to Spain. The pool in the middle of the hotel felt wonderful after a hot walk in the Medina. I would highly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had such a lovely time staying at Dar Anika - the staff are all so kind and helpful and the service is amazing. The breakfast was huge and delicious and the fruit kebabs and icy mint drinks in the afternoon were the perfect way to cool down and refresh after a day exploring the city.  The staff even completed our embarkment cards for us for when we got to the airport to fly home in case the airport had run out. The service was exceptional for the price we paid - definitely recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: There’s absolutely no need to look elsewhere if you plan on staying in Marrakesh. My wife and I checked in and right away we were made to feel at home. Abu sat us down our first morning and gave us an extremely helpful crash course on the city (it was our first time visiting) and arranged an amazing trip into the Atlas mountains. If you want to venture up into the mountains yourself make sure to ask for Hassan he’s a great guide and makes the trip super fun. The complimentary breakfast would put American hotel offerings to shame and the entire staff was professional and extremely kind.    Hands down this is the best hotel in the city. We visited some of the more expensive hotels in the area and the atmosphere wasn’t nearly as nice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: From the hotel to the food to  the rooms to the staff all the way up to Antonio the manager the visit and stay was memorable and exquisite. The only problem was we didn't stay long enough as we had to move on. I would and will highly recommend Dar Anika to all. We will likewise plan to stay there again when we next visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just wow! Dar Anika was highly recommended by a good friend of mine and yet we were still amazed by our stay. Beautiful rooms delectable food a relaxing terrace.. the list would go on.    However what earns Dar Anika the highest rating is the service. The staff treated us with incredible warmth and kindness assisting us with every need or want. The hotel manager Antonio met with us at the very start to brief us on our stay and provided us with invaluable tips on making the most of our stay in Marrakech. He constantly checked up on us throughout our stay always going beyond the call of duty.    Simply put Dar Anika is the ONLY place you need to stay at if you ever visit Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul B wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: An obscure entrance and door opens up to a beautiful step back in time hotel. The vegetation furnishings and overall ambiance are superb. The most impressive feature is the service the likes of which would be hard to duplicate anywhere. Antonio the manager is just so impressive with his local knowledge and advice. His recommendations for dining were so good. All staff were engaging and so attentive.  A really special experience not just a place to stay. Total recommendation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: More than excellent way beyond 5 star
Review_Text: From the start to the way to soon end of our stay everything perfect never in staying in hotels for over 40 years round the world had the quality of this hotel.  The staff from Antonio down just so helpful and attentive perfect rooms cleaned not once but twice a day to authentic local cuisine served on a roof top dining room to die for watch storks fight for resting points and the local noises of the markets.  Final touch a freshly made lunch bag a bottle of cold water for the trip to our next hotel just amazing nothing else has ever come close to this stay at this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hotel service was most noteworthy point. I came down ill and the manager Antonio went out and got me antibiotics from a pharmacy first thing in the morning. The staff also made me some simple food to try and keep down along with ginger tea and other various remedies. Additionally it was my girlfriend's birthday while we were there and they surprised her with a song and cake and flowers which was a very nice touch.    The rooftop terrace is very nice and the location of the hotel is excellent for access to the Medina. The rooms were nice I happened to stay at another slightly nicer hotel which is why I give this 4 and not 5.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Extraordinary service with a royal treatment we were consistently made to feel that we were the most important guests the Dar had ever had. Right in the middle of the Souk but far enough from the chaotic side. You just can't go wrong with choosing Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Carlo S wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: We spent 5 days at the Riad and everything was absolutely perfect. The staff was amazing and always ready for any necessity. The Riad is also in a great position and Marrakech main attractions at a walking distance. I simply loved the city and the Riad. It's a must!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Made Marrakech a trip of a lifetime
Review_Text: It is such a beautiful riad with amazing food in a perfect location central to everything. But one of the things that makes this so special is the people who work there. They helped plan our days in Marrakech from guided tours in the soulks sights to see. to incredible restaurants. This meant that we saw and experienced the jewels that Marrakech has to offer and made memories that will last a lifetime.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: most amazing Riad I have ever experienced in Marrakesh
Review_Text: I have been traveling to Marrakesh for the last 10 years with friends families my partner on several occasions and of all Riads and hotels I have ever tried The team of Riad Dar Anika were the most hospitable and gave us ( my friends and I ) an amazing feeling of coming home. Everything that we wanted they bend backwards to make it possible. I would recommend it to everyone that want to have an amazing experience. Location wise hospitality wise rooms rooftop swimmingpool dinner on location everything was impeccable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: wilfredo r wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Wilfredo Tony & Johanna from Los Angeles California would like to thanks the wonderful staffs at Riad Dark Anika. Especially to Aziza for his professionalism genuinely and respectfully way to threat others. Thank you from all us. We also would like to thank Abu Antonio & Alpha for their excellent customer services. Absolutely nothing to say about the wonderful staffs at Riad Dar Anika the rooms are amazing the cleanness of the entire place impeccable OMG the food was absolutely delicious thank you to chef Abdellatif Amrani we tried all the dishes they were obsoletely delightful the environment of this place is fascinating: since upon arrival until we checked out we were mesmerizing. Unfortunately we came in only for 4 days however the wonderful staff made feel like it was an entire month. We were treated like their own family everyone was so courteous and treat us with respect professionalism and the most important part they made us feel safe. We would like to thank you for the wonderful costumer services hope to see you again.  Wilfredo  Tony  Johanna.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Irina C wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Look don't waste your time trying to figure out how to do Marrakesh. Just come to Dar Anika and put your trust in Abu. He will take care of you and you will have an amazing time. That's it. Oh and definitely do their hamam at least once.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Staff facility and location were perfect - you couldn't ask for anything more! The hotel director Antonio was very involved and made us feel so safe and welcome his staff was extremely friendly and always had what we needed or wanted before we could even ask for it. We booked several excursions by email a few days before we arrived. All the excursions were excellent and the people they connected us with did not disappoint. We went hiking in the Atlas mountains rode camels did a walking city tour and a hamam spa. Everyone we did these activities with were knowledgeable fun professional and we made instant friends with them. It was a beautiful hotel and a central and convenient location. We would definitely visit again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The rooms were comfortable and beautiful the food was delicious and the service was beyond compare. Every detail was attended to and absolutely everyone there was so kind. I would definitely stay here again without question!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Having travelled extensively i chose this hotel for the location and great reviews and i was not disappointed.  From the moment we arrived we were personally looked after by the manager Antonio - who went out of his way to assist us  nothing was to much trouble and he helped up with the better quality restaurants and any queries we had.  The Riad is very high end and the staff are so accommodating.  If you are looking for quality stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The location is fantastic. Only a short walk to Djemaa El-Fna the Medina the Souks the Kasbah and all sightseeing attractions. The rooftop bar/ restaurant is a dreamlike place to take breakfast and watch the City awake. Fantastic architecture right outside. The rooms are gorgeous and the staff friendly knowledgeable and intelligent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Victoria R wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: This place was the brightest of havens during our stay in Marrakech. They really excel when it comes to service and attention to guests. Every time we walked back into our hotel the staff arrived and offered us a drink and snacks. Every. Time. The room itself was perfect for our needs and they even had this amazing selection of body wash for our showers. Anthony the manager was amazingly helpful in how to navigate the city and what to see during our short stay. They were also great when there was a mistake on our bill and ended up compensating part of the bill when it was charged incorrectly.    The breakfast was also an amazing experience. They piled on every selection of food you could think of and providing everything you could ever want. The yogurt here was amazing. Also had the pleasure of having dinner here as well. Food and service were excellent. Definitely try the camel tajine.    Only one interesting thing to add here. During our travels we had the pleasure of meeting a former staff member. He mentioned to us the staff are not allowed to talk to guests which we definitely did notice during our stay. Take of that what you will.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Superb! Excellence in service - Great location!
Review_Text: Dar Anika is my favourite riad in Marrakech centrally located and excellent service it feels very much like staying in a palace rather than a hotel. The service is very personal and each guest is catered to their own needs.    A second return to Marrakech and without a doubt I knew to stay here again. Dar Anika did all it could to ensure my stay was comfortable excellent service great food – this is the kind of place where one feels like a prince or princess or even a king or queen a palace rather than a hotel.    The location is ideal centrally located and just minutes away from the lively Jemaa el-Fnaa square and the giant souks of Marrakech.    Working with you to ensure you get the most out of your stay from visiting the sites of Marrakech to venturing far along the Road to the Desert to spend a night under the stars in the Sahara - Dar Anika helped with any requests I had.    The word riad comes from the Arabian term for garden “ryad” often interpreted to mean “paradise”. Riad Dar Anika certainly feels like a piece of paradise within the Marrakech medina and can't help but praise it for the efforts to ensure my stay went as expected.    The courtyard at the heart of the building has a heated pool on one side and a cosy enclosed lounge with fireplace on the other side. Calm relaxed and informal Dar Anika staff show a real interest in guests comfort and holiday enjoyment.    This won't be the last time I return - I often recommend Marrakech as I believe it is the best exotic destination nearest to Europe and staying in a place like Riad Dar Anika certainly makes the experience that much special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Sinead M wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: We stumbled across this riad whilst looking for somewhere to have a drink.  The riad is breath taking inside with luxurious decor and breath taking views from the roof top.  In all the countries I've visited I've never known such fantastic service the staff are just amazing.  It was a stifling hot day and they made sure we had cold water and a fan they brought us gorgeous complimentary snacks.  We were so impressed we returned for dinner the next day and we were so glad we did.  The food was incredible the best food we ate in Marrakech. Once again the service was amazing and attentive.  We saw the bedrooms and they made jealous as we were not staying there.  You can't visit Marrakech without visiting riad dar anika
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My boyfriend and I stayed here August 3-7 to celebrate my 40th birthday. I did a lot of research online and kept coming back to Dar Anika. The pictures don't do it justice. Location was perfect. The terrace is beautiful and a great place to watch the sunset while enjoying a glass of wine. We stayed in room #2 which was lovely. Ever since we've been back to New York we say to each other "customer service is nothing like Anika". Top notch people there.. They truly make you feel special. As we arrived the staff greeted us with drinks and snacks then Antonio the manager gave us a talk about the area and answered any questions we had. Breakfast was so delicious! Keeps you full all day. For the ladies I brought my own hairdryer because usually when I travel they always have week ones but in Dar Anika they have a powerful salon grade one so no need to bring your own. Again everyone at Dar Anika was so kind. I called Alpha everyday with questions and he had so much patience with me. Alpha if you're reading this Thank You! We truly can't wait to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just off a dusty street we accidentally found this amazing place. We didn't stay the night as we already had our riad booked. What we were in search of was an ice cold beer. Difficult in a country that does not sell alcohol unless it's a licensed hotel. The service we received and the beauty of the riad made us come for dinner the following evening.  The decor was spectacular the ambience was soothing. The staff could not have been more helpful bringing us ice cold water and an electric fan.  The complimentary snacks were an unexpected treat.  The food was delicious.  This place is a must... It has the wow factor and you won't regret your visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Excellent service but a bit overpriced
Review_Text: A great place to stay with attentive and helpful staff.    Our room was a little too small to command the price it did and the air conditioning was not very effective. We complained and the manager immediately moved us to a bigger room and really went out of his way make sure we were looked after with champagne and flowers.    Previous reports of management issuing letters about giving good reviews on Trip Advisor are accurate but this was a letter put into our free lunch pack to take to the airport with us so plus and minuses there I suppose.    An all round a good experience and a nice hotel but I would negotiate a better room rate.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: HaydenNita H wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: Not surprising that this Riad is proudly displaying a TA 2016 Certificate of Excellence.  Located in the Medina the Riad is an oasis I from which to escape the frenetic pace of the Medina and the main square even though these are a short walk away. Many of the major sites of the Medina are also close by. A feature of the Risd is the staff. Although this is the low of the low season Zac and his team maintain a very high standard of customer service of which they should be proud Rachid Abdul Isaac are great examples of what a sound tourism business needs to succeed and are well supported by kitchen and domestic in providing a warm welcoming and safe haven.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika was the best hotel in Morocco I have passed on my way of 2000km crossing the country fréom Casa ta Rabat with Sahara and the best hotel ever I have stayed in. Firstly it will attack all your senses by its design in typical oriental style but there is something more real sense for details and creation atmosphere. You feel you are at right place just now and nothing else matters. Secondly the hospitality starting with the manager of the hotel finishing by full service of the staff. Giving you a cap of milk to the room and plate o dates before going to sleep as a service. This is beyond the expectation you can even imagine before entering the magic hidden hotel from the street on the corner of old Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Karen A wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: Just home from our holiday in Marrakesh staying at Dar Anika and can honestly say it was the best hotel I have ever stayed in . The riad is beautifully designed but it's the staff and management that make it so special they literally can't do enough for you. From the moment you arrive to the time you leave absolutely everything is done and taken care of for you . They all do genuinely care that you have the best holiday ever . I spent a long time looking through places to stay don't bother just book here you won't get any better they are simply the best 10/10 for everything.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mi G wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Title: One of the most luxurious vacations we have ever experienced-
Review_Text: I felt like a princess in a palace surrounded by the loveliest staff. If I could rate in stars 5 wouldn’t be enough.  Riad Dar Anika is an absolute gem and I can’t believe I haven’t written a review earlier.    Antonio the manager of the Riad was so kind and informing. He even took the time to take my daughters iPhone to a shop in the middle of the city to get her screen fixed at a cheaper rate. In the meantime he equipped us with a mobile phone with a Morrocan number in case we wanted to reach him or had questions about where to go and what to do.    Everybody who worked at Riad Dar Anika were angels and I will definitely return.    I recommend anybody to come here I’ve been to Marrakesh before but at Riad Dar Anika.  It has been a whole different experience for me. If you want to feel like royalty for a few days I promise you this is the place to stay.    - the breakfast on the rooftop is just divine - prepared next to you by a wonderful cook while you enjoy the beautiful view.  I was shocked at how nice people can be when we were about to leave to catch a cab to the airport they had prepared lunch bags with fruit and Morrocan sandwiches for us. I literally melted.    Thank you for one of my best holidays.  Lots of Love  Angela
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Great location. Amazing accommodations. Beautiful roof and riad. Helpful staff.    I traveled to Marrakesh with a few friends. As Americans Morocco was a completely foreign country and culture. Abu the owner was great. He made us feel at home and gave us tips for exploring the city.    The next time I'm in Marrakesh I will definitely stay at the Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: From the moment my friends and I checked in to the Riad to the morning we left Abu and team definitely made sure we were well taken care of. We were greeted by a driver at the airport we were welcomed with food and drinks they took care of our taxi fare negotiations and even watched over our luggage as we spent a couple of days on an excursion. The Riad is walking distance 2 min from the main market. I would highly recommend and will definitely stay here next time in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I cannot recommend Riad Dar Anika enough. The service was impeccable and the building itself is beautiful. I was traveling alone for my first time in Morocco and the staff made me feel right at home! They had great suggestions for guides and tours and they helped me figure out many details of my trip. I had originally been thinking of staying at a bigger hotel but I'm so glad I stayed at Dar Anika. I'll certainly be staying there the next time I'm in Marrakesh!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Karen V wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Title: Paradise in Marrakech.... A hidden Jem
Review_Text: I love this place you hear about other places treating you like royalty though Riad Dar Anika truly delivers. I have felt this week like what I am sure a real princess feels like. The staff here are truly amazing I have never experienced customer service like this before - words cannot describe how utterly impressed I am. They have thought of everything from first initial meeting being greeted with pastries and mint tea to greeting us daily with there awesome fresh mint and lemon smoothies which I am truly going to miss. Fresh fruit everywhere for you to help yourself to. Everyone from the cleaning staff to waiters to front desk and Management were / are incredible.. Not only are they all amazing the place itself is truly breathtaking... I hope I am fortunate enough to return to this amazing city and if I do it will most definitely be to stay here thanks Ito the Dar Anika I am leaving in the morning with some wonderful memories that I will forever treasure. They deserve more than 5 Starr........ Karen Van Dueck (Walton)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The best, of the best, anywhere in the world.
Review_Text: These days altogether too many Companies speak of "customer service" bit fail miserably in delivering it.    Rhiad Dar Anika personifies it.    Even though there were multiple other guests we were treated as the ONLY ones in this fabulous property. The service was beyond extraordinary. I now believe I know what it feels like to be Royalty.    Ever single detail is attendedicated to and nothing is left wanting. For the discriminating traveller there is none better.    The rooms are exquisite luxurious and impeccably kept. The staff are attentive (32 staff for 20 to 24 guests) and seem to be able to anticipate your every need. ANYTHING you desire . . . They will provide.    Having stayed at hundreds of Hotels all around the world in 50 years of travel; I can honestly say that I've never been treated so royally.    To anyone considering Marrakech it makes no sense whato ever to look anywhere else.    This is a Diamond in the Desert and one that we'll return to time and time again.    RW
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Vickie P wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Dar Anika last weekend and had a fantastic stay. The Riad had arranged an airport transfer for us - we were picked up in an air conditioned car with bottles of water which was very welcome after the airport queue's.  The Riad is in a great location right on the edge of the Medina so the car can drop you off right outside. We got a lovely welcome and the manager went showed us where we should go on a map and recommended places of interest and good restaurants and bars.  Nothing was too much effort for the staff and they would get us cold drinks before we set out for the day and told us if there was any fruit / food we would like to try just take a photo of it and they would get it and prepare it for us.  The breakfasts were huge with many courses so allow at least an hour. Served on the beautiful rooftop terrace where you could also have dinner or drinks.  The food and drink in the Riad was reasonably priced compared to many of the other places we went and they were also more than happy to supply wine glasses for wine we had bought at the airport.  There is a small pool in the Riad which is perfect for cooling down after being out on the 45 degree temperatures but don't splash about as the water does go everywhere all over the marble floors!  There were a couple of small incidents where the waiter split coffee / watermelon / beer over us but it didn't detract from the overall great service of the Riad.  The bedrooms were beautifully decorated and even though our room was opposite the mosque I didn't get woken up by the call to prayer as they have this big cushion / window plug thing that kept all the noise out. They gave you a new bottle of water in the room every night as well as milk and dates at bed time.  I would recommend this Riad to anyone who is looking for an oasis of peace and tranquility in the middle of chaos of the Medina. The service was outstanding and we couldn't of asked for any more. Would definitely go back - but maybe not in July or August (too hot!)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: wow, Wow, WOW couldn't be better
Review_Text: Come to Marrakech to be charmed by this surprisingly phenomenal place. The Raid dar Anika is superlative in every sense of the word. Perfectly perched at the entrance to world famous souks spice markets and the Media you are immersed in the into luxury and an overwhelmingly comfortable and tranquil home away from home. The food is the very best in the city the ambiance is relaxed elegance the service is beyond compare and the cleanliness is impeccable. The staff is genuinely hospitable and warm offering delights at every turn.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Lisa W wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Title: A holiday we will never forget!
Review_Text: The Hotel was really nice clean and relaxing. The waiter cleaning women and the manager were all super friendly and we really felt comfortable. The staff at all are super kind - always smiling and helpful. The city is really loud and busy and hustle  but as soon as you enter the hotel you feel you are in another world and you can relax whenever you want. You swim in the pool and get a fresh juice without asking. We travel a lot but this hotel was definitely one of the best. I appreciate it also that the hotel manager welcomed us and gave us information and tips introduced himself which makes everything very personalised but it was not too much. There is only one thing i did not like was in the end when we had to leave the hotel manager gave us a sheet which says that they would get penalties if we do not leave a excellent review - which i leave anyway as this stay was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After several hours of walking around the sites of Marrakesh in 40°c heat we we were drawn to this Riad. What a welcome - we were only there for a sit down and some refreshing mint tea - but the staff were wonderful. So gracious and kind. My daughter checked her phone for the Wimbledon final scores - Murray was half way through his second set. They noticed and before we could say anything they had set up the large screen in an air-conditioned room - what a way to watch the match. My daughter has already posted how fantastic this was - but I wanted to add my note of thanks and gratitude for the wonderful service we received at this Riad - they are truly generous and kind people - I would totally recommend staying here. Marrakesh is a wonderful city - we have now been twice and would certainly return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: linda f wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: Riad dar Anika provides calm away from the heat and hustle of the city. Every time we stepped back inside during our two-night stay we felt instantly relaxed. Friendly and professional staff throughout but fun as well giving a real character to the place.    It was our friend's birthday and he was sung to in at least three languages by the team as well as receiving a beautiful cake and flowers.    The breakfasts from the roof terrace were the best we've had with fresh fruit and freshly baked pitta breads and Moroccan pancakes. Dinner was delicious too.    Lovely cool and contemporary rooms with water and fresh fruit and other little treats - just a really lovely experience from start to finish.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: If you're looking for a genuine marokansk experience you will need this riad. Great customer service & delightful meal from breakfast till diner. Walking distance from almost everything you need to see in the medina. They took care of our transport to the airport and gave oss a picnic bag for lunch. Lovely o unexpectedly plaisant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Myself and my family walked in to have some tea on their roof terrace. We were greeted with the kindest of staff and brilliant service!  They noticed we were looking at the Wimbledon final score on our phones so invited us downstairs to the court yard to watch it live along with complimentary drinks and pastries - we couldn't have asked for more!  The best find in Marrakech!  Thank you to all the staff at Riad Dar Anika!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Vicki B wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: I can not say enough about the service in this lovely place. From the moment we entered to seeing us to our transport the staff and management were beyond exceptional. We've had the opprtunity to travel a fair bit and I have to henstly say I've never had service like this.    The accomidation was charming and just within the Medina and located a short distance from the Market. After wondering around we were greated back in our room with cold drinks as the staff knocked on our door with this suprize. as we had just retruned from a week traveling arounhd Morocco it was a great gift to find out that laundry service was provided and all my dirty gear was returned within a few hours clean and ready to go again.    Antonio the manager was a delight to talk to and gave us the low down on what to see and what to be weary of. He also helped me at the pharmacy when my partner was a little under the weather. They bent over backwards to make sure my partner didnt miss a minute of the Euro 2016 by running out and making sure they had the right chip to recieve the channels for the broadcast.    Additonally when they learnerd it was my parners birthday we were suprized with a great cake and flowers at dinner and a room upgrade. Completly unexpected and a wonderful treat. The service was so personal it was like a little peice of heaven in a hectic but vibrant city! I shouldn't fail to mention that on our departure they even gave us a packaed lunch for our flight!    Highly recommended and I hope I get to go back. Cant say enough about our experience here! 5*+++
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Albert S wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: If you get the chance to stay here do it. One word for the experience: wow. From the moment I stepped inside and was greeted by Fatima it was clear that Dar Anika was a special place. The staff was exceptional and attentive to every need whether expressed verbally or not.    Breakfast was a feast every morning. Camel meat omelette breads fresh juices fresh fruit and on and on... No matter how many times I left the room everytime I returned it was not only cleaned but personally manicured and restocked with fresh fruit and drinks.    The owners helped round out my activity itinerary with great recommendations and helpful advice on the plans I had previously made. Let's be clear Dar Anika is on the high end of the price scale for Morocco but it is worth every penny. I would especially recommend staying there upon your initial arrival because they'll be incredibly helpful as you learn the Medina local customs and expectations and plan your adventure.    They've earned every one of the five stars I'm giving them in this review but it's always helpful to offer a suggestion or two. My one suggestion is to be a bit more explicit about the costs of add on serveices that are offered. To their great credit so many things are complimentary (like the incredible breakfasts snacks and refreshments every time I came to the lobby multiple room cleanings and on and on) that I was surprised when I got the $30 USD (round trip) bill for the chauffeur to the New City for dinner. The convenience was definitely worth it but we would've liked to know about the fees in advance. (I would've made the same decision to be clear because although a local taxi would've been about $3 USD it would've come with the hassle of hailing and haggling with the driver.)    In event I'm a tough customer but Dar Anika won me over with extraordinarily service superb accommodations and a remarkable attention to detail. This is THE PLACE to stay in Marrakesh!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Isabella B wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: Absolutely amazing they helped us come up with a great itinerary and planned a day trip for us. Food was great room was beautiful and even had soundproofing shutters. Couldn't recommend the place more!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Such a wonderful and authentic place!!
Review_Text: By far the best place to stay when visiting Marrakech. Perfect location right in the heart of the Medina; impeccable service with so much attention to details; pleasant and efficient staff making the stay a memorable experience. Antonio the General Manager and his entire team are all there to make you feel at home - nothing is too much trouble! This is definitely a place I can recommend to anyone visiting this exciting city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The manager Antonio and the other staffs are always ready to help with us. The hotel locates very close to the souks and you can walk to the square in 10 mins. The food fruit facilities room service and everything are perfect. The fresh rose pedals made me pleasant all day long. And when we were having breakfast on the terrace there were some pedals felling on our table. It was so wonderful. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Gordon W wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: Stayed four nights in this lovely Riad. Could not fault this beautiful place for its location facilities extremely friendly and attentive staff and the amount of food served for breakfast! The manager Antonio was very helpful and ensured we had the perfect stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David H wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: Fantastic place and location.  Staff nothing too much trouble from breakfast (which is absolutely fab) to late night drinks and nibbles on the roof top terrace.  Introduction welcome by Antonio was knowledgeable informative and extremely helpful to get the most out of a beautiful and fascinating Marrakech.  Sites and medina all within 30 minutes through the meandering joys of the Medina and Souks.  Great and food and superb value.  Food markets are fascinating and the people great fun and welcoming.  Really special trip thanks to all the wonderful and thoughtful team at Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter M wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: This was a wonderful hotel any by far the favourite of the three we stayed in while in Morocco. The room was very nice but the best bits were the roof the food and the lovely staff. We really enjoyed out time there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Distinctive oasis in a city of disordered bueaty
Review_Text: We greatly enjoyed all the details offered by the hotel: from the nicely decorated room to the well crafted garden atrium and rooftop terrace. And various tiny refreshments/decorations easily to neglect are among the most touching ones. Anyway you can easily feel the hotel is working hardly to bring guests comfort in an unfamiliar environment after a full day adventure. In addition the staff are quite friendly and helpful. The manager is even thoughtful to provide with the filled paperwork for passing the custom. Normally you have to fill out by yourself at the custom when leaving the nation. Would highly recommend the place without any hesitation. Best memory!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Distinctive oasis in a city of disordered bueaty
Review_Text: We enjoyed every details offered by the places: the well-crafted garden atrium and rooftop terrace the scented and nicely decorated room in a high taste of art the tiny fruits/snacks/decoration/services easily to be neglected. We can feel the hotel is working hard to provide guests with comfort by various touching details. Additionally the staff are very friendly resourceful and helpful. In our last day the manager is quite thoughtful even preparing the paperwork for passing the custom. Normally you have to fill it out yourself at the custom when leaving the nation. Would give them a top rate without any hesitation! Highly recommended of this match to a fascinating city of Fes with so many exotic uncertainties.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael S wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: My wife and I have done a fair amount of traveling together especially in this last year and we have never had such a wonderful hotel visit. We arranged a car to pick us up from the airport (our flight changed 3 times and we received email confirmation quickly every time). The car was prompt and easy to find. It was a short ride to the hotel where we were promptly offered (an amazing) breakfast even though we were just checking in. The manager Antonio greeted us at our table to discuss our plans for our short stay in Marrakech. He offered us valuable tips and recommendations. After a full and busy day our room (decorated with fresh flowers and petals) was a welcome sanctuary from the noise and busy nature of the city. We departed with complimentary sandwiches and laying memories. Could not recommend more highly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is a beautiful and peaceful oasis in the middle of a very high-energy city. The room was spacious clean quiet and cool and it was decorated with lovely touches. My wife and I were traveling with our college-age daughter and we couldn't have been happier with our stay. We took advantage of the airport transportation a private tour of the city arranged by the Riad and a spectacular evening meal on the roof-top terrace. We have stayed at thousands of hotels all over the world and the attentive service provided by the Dar Anika staff was unquestionably the best we have ever experienced. Our expectations were exceeded in every category. As a final point we were very surprised that all of the staff we interacted with spoke very good English which made everything even easier. A truly wonderful place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Mei S wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: Antonio is the best manager! He took us to a car shop to get our car fixed and provided tons of valuable information about Merrakesh. The room is tastefully decorated and the service is awesome. Free laundry fruits water juice etc and the breakfast is delicious!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Charles B wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: Amazing Affordable Luxury in true authentic style and service
Review_Text: We planned a visit to Marrakesh to celebrate a friends birthday we were given 3 Riads to choose from based on a recommendation. Riad Dar Anika went well beyond what was expected and coming from the luxury hotel background myself I was astonished and pleasantly surprised by the attention to detail of the friendly and happy employees not to mention the wonderful and charming GM. I felt totally at home straight away within the hustle and bustle of this magical city. The rooms and suites are very comfortable and decorated in true Moroccan style which takes you back in time. The personally hand picked soft chilled music on the terrace enables you to put your feet up and relax with a drink or having a nice meal cooked by their excellent chef which when if you live in London like me then a few days away is another of life's pleasures that need not be interrupted. I have just returned to re-book for after the summer! Need I say anymore. Thank you Riad Dar Anika. Ps. no rooftop pool but a lovely cold pool in the courtyard on the ground floor!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Anita H wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: AMAZING RIAD IN THE HEART OF MARRAKESHES WALLED CITY
Review_Text: We stayed at the Riad Anika from the 18th June for 3 nights (a long weekend). We travelled via a no frills airline and by the time we landed in Morocco and had been processed by immigration we were starting to feel the strains of the journey. Leaving the airport we negotiated a fare of 200 Dirhams for the journey to the Riad Anika we managed to halve this on our return. We left the taxi and were very quickly surrounded by people offering to help us with our luggage or offering to direct us to the Riad at a cost. The situation was a bit of a culture shock but we found the Riad. Once inside it was a true sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the streets outside and we were given the warmest welcome I have ever experienced. We were ushered to a lounge area were we washed our hands in rose water and then were served soup followed by milk and dates along with mint tea and biscuits it was un-believable. Once we had finished our arrival feast we were sat down by Antonio who sprawled a map over a round table and began to help us plan our attack on the city. We were given excellent advice and recommendations and the map and the briefing were a constant help throughout our stay. Once we caught our bags up in the room we were faced with an exceptionally clean space adorned with rose petals. The room itself is not huge as it’s a traditional Riad although the bathroom is a good size and complete with hand made soap bathrobes and other delightful personal touches. The bathroom had a coloured stained glass window which was a pleasure to wake up to. The breakfast is served on the roof terrace and was un-missable. We sat under the canopy of a Bedouin tent type structure on cushions and were served fresh orange juice and offered a variety of different teas or coffees along with soup breads preserves fresh fruit salad a choice of eggs and even fresh made to order crepes. We sat on the roof terrace on each evening to enjoy its panoramic advantage. The Riad is in a great location and was just a short walk from many of the places we wished to visit including ‘Kosy Bar’ the ‘Souks’ The ‘Jamaa el Fna’ and ‘Pepe Nero’. There is a taxi rank less than a minute away for those further afield excursions. Antonio recommended ‘Beldi Country Club Marrakech’ which is a must for a day of relaxation just a small drive outside Maraakesh itself . The room was cleaned more than once a day!!! and on our return from a day of exploring we were greeted by ether milk and dates or melon kebabs or even both. During our stay we spent the day at the La Mamounia a - so called 5 star hotel. The staff at the La Mamounia could learn a great deal about service and hospitality from the staff at Riad Anika. Iv travelled extensively but never experienced such hospitality. I write this review as a thank you for having us so to say and just wish I could do more to show our appreciation for making our stay so special. ………Oh and a special thank you for the knapsack that was gifted to us as we departed the Riad which was filled with fresh fruit and lunch a great touch which was greatly appreciated.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very good experience in marrakech Anika staff always ready to help in everithing.  Good rooms always clean. Regarding to the food excellent breakfast on the top of the building!  The maganer and consierge always ready to help whith tours.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Magical little Oasis in the middle of Marraketch
Review_Text: Incredible service and a beautiful little Riad in the middle of the Medina made our trip magical . From the moment we arrived with dates and honey served to us in the little lounge  to the excellent massage and scrubbing treatments we got in their inhouse "sauna" .. Riad Dar Anika was amazing . The position is great just next to the markets and big square  and being in the Riad is very relaxing and enchanting. Breakfast up on the roof is awesome !!! ... We loved it and thanks so much to the great team running the Riad .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A warm welcome from a helpful and attentive team
Review_Text: My wife and I spent a very enjoyable 5 day stay at Riad Dar Anika in May. The Riad is very well located in the Medina and the staff were most helpful and made sure we have an enjoyable and comfortable stay. Our room was beautiful and we very much appreciated the advice we received to help us explore and enjoy our stay in Marrakech. Thank you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika far exceeded my already high expectations in service quality history and overall experience. The Riad is beautiful and the Riad representatives are equally if not more beautiful. i highly recommend the Anika to anyone visiting Marrakesh. You will not be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had 5 nights in Marrakesh and decided to spend one in a riad for a bit of variety as opposed to just staying in a hotel. It is a very nice riad good views fantastic breakfast and in a part of town which is walking distance to many attractions.    But what really set our visit apart was the warmth generosity and hospitality of the management and staff which we will remember for a long time and which surpassed anything we have ever encountered in our extensive travels.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Superb stay at the Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: Wow Marrakech what a buzz. Riad Dar Anika were welcoming and generous the staff and manager were extremely kind and nothing was a problem. The Riad was beautiful our room was quiet and had everything we needed the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast was spectacular which we ate on the with rooftop terrace a perfect place for lounging or watching the moroccon life unfold in front of you. The Riad is close to the Medina and souks and we never felt our safety was in question when out at night. From the time we walked into the Riad and was served tea and morrocon treats till the time we walked out carrying a packed lunch we felt extremely relaxed and well looked after. I would have no hesitation in coming back to Riad Dar Anika. And yes we were asked to rate Dar Anika well on TA but I have no problem with that... they were 5/5.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: overpriced compared to options in the area
Review_Text: the waitstaff were really lovely. the room was completely overpriced and noisy from the adjacent street. the manager appeared at the end and we were handed a paper informing us they would be "penalized" if they did not get high reviews on trip advisor. beware of their inflated ratings. you can get much more for that price anywhere else in the medina!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sue B wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: I loved everything about this Riad I wish we had longer there. The service was first class. I travelled with my daughter who is pregnant. They looked after us really well. When we returned from a day of sight seeing a refreshing drink arrived at our room within minutes. They organised a booking and driver to a really good restaurant we were escorted to the driver by a member of staff. In fact each time we wanted a cab the staff walked us to the vehicle. The airport pick up and return was seamless. We had an early flight home and they had breakfast ready for us at six and we were pleasantly surprised to be given one of their linen bags with a packed lunch. I can't give this place enough praise one of the best places I have stayed in and will look forward to returning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Brandon C wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: This was one of the best places my wife and I have stayed at. The Riad is beautiful and the staff was excellent. Upon arrival the owner gave us tips on where to go and what to do in the city and arranged airport transportation for us. Every time we returned to the Riad we were immediately brought fresh juice or tea without requesting it. I would highly recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We spent 2 days at Riad Dar Anika which was lovely clean and spacious. We were greeted with tea and snacks on our arrival and the owner was very helpful in suggesting places to visit and tours to look for. Their food was great and since we were leaving early for a tour they prepared an early breakfast for us and even packed us a bag with sandwiches and fruit to take with us! We'd definitely come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I cannot emphasize enough how everyone did their best to make our stay an enjoyable one:- the staff and Antonio the manager where much much better than many 5 star rated hotels one stays. Some should take notice (and learn) how this small place is being run. Where else do you get a sandwich and fruit to take on your flight?! It may be a small gesture but it makes a lot of difference- it shows that they care for you. The chamber maids kept the room very clean as they did the hotel. Breakfast was excellent and so was dinner. Easy access to everywhere. Unfortunately the hammam is not all day operational so you do have to book a time and that is inconvenient. In a country that sells oils soaps and creams everywhere I would like to have had moisturizer in the bathroom. All in all very good experience
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad is absolutely amazing! Centrally located near the medina souks and Jemaa El Fna it is very convenient to get around. Five star service endless breakfast dinner and complimentary drinks snacks and even a lunch to take on our departing journey. We love the staff. One of the best hotels we've been to (and we've been to some good hotels!). Don't hesitate to book this place if you love luxury and you're thinking of heading to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Everything you expect from a 5* hotel but in an intimate and beautiful setting.    Free water and pastries each day. Even dates and milk before bed time. The breakfast and dinner courses are ENDLESS and exceptionally delicious.They bring a cold drink when you stumble back in from the Medina - VERY welcome. A lady making breads for breakfast.    Easy to navigate to and from as its on a main road/square where cars can access. Great if you want to get Taxis. You will have less chance getting lost even when walking as its not down ten small alleyways (that all look the same in the dark).  An orientation as you arrive with no hard sell to do tours just good sensible advice for a full on city. The staff walked us out to the drivers/ taxi's organised for us. Slightly intimidating outside the front door but its real Marrakesh so thats to be expected.    Very quiet Riad I was only woken by the call to prayer (unavoidable) and I am a light sleeper and fully anticipated to have broken sleep.    Staff where all friendly and spoke good English wake up call was reliable. They did us breakfast for our early departure PLUS a picnic for the flight. They even got us olive oil for our Henna tattoos. Exquisite restaurant recommendation.    Only considerations are:  The pool was very cold - perhaps a good thing for refreshing tired feet.  i would have liked moisturiser in the bathroom not just shower gel.  The bathrooms are western style which is slightly disappointing.    Stop searching for Riads they don't really get any better than this one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We have just returned from a 3-night stay at this Riad and we can't speak highly enough of the service and atmosphere to be found here. Sam is truly delightful as is Mohamed and all the staff. we were greeted to a stunning secluded Riad at the end of a street. The location is perfect - right in the centre but somehow remaining incredibly peaceful despite the hustle and bustle of the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Roshan P wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad with excellent service and staff!! Book Now!!
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed in Riad Dar Anika for two nights before travelling to the coast (Essaouira) for another two nights. By the time our check-out date arrived we didn't want to leave!! From the moment we arrived Antonio and Dalila and the rest of the staff catered to our every need and thoroughly looked after us!! Antonio gave his suggestions on the places we should visit and he also gave us a few very handy tips on how best to explore and enjoy the souks. Our room was extremely clean and well furnished and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was roomy and stocked with a number of natural grooming products which we both enjoyed using. Riad Dar Anika has four levels and all are beautifully furnished. The top two levels are mainly used for al fresco breakfasts and dining and there is also a sun bathing area (with sunbeds) in the far corner. We simple cannot express how much we enjoyed our stay at the Riad Dar Anika!! We will definitely stay here on our next visit to Morocco!! Thank you very much Antonio and all of your staff for your hospitality during our stay in your exceptional Riad!! Roshan & Dela....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is a gem in hectic Marrakech. A perfect paradise with great location (short walk to the main square) delicious food (my girlfriend and I are still talking about the delicious and plentiful breakfasts each morning and outstanding service. Not to mention the riad itself is simply stunning. Special thanks to all the staff who made us feel at home. Special thanks to Antonio - a true gentleman and made our stay a memorable one. And thanks to Hanane who was extremely welcoming and always available to answer any questions (not to mention the many times she accommodated our requests for mint tea!). So many positive things to say about Riad Dar Anika - I would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter B wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: A little gem on a perfect location
Review_Text: We thoroughly enjoyed 5 days (and nights) at Dar Anika. Staff is wonderful they seem to be everywhere to help out.    Sit down on a chair and they will pop up with fresh mint tea and crispy little fruit tarts all complimentary. Five start service in a homely setting.    We loved the breakfast where freshly baked pancakes joined bread rolls and homemade jams with any style of egg to complement a very good start for long walks in the Souks. These walks are made very easy as the location is just great. You literally walk out into the action and it is a pleasure to get lost in it all as you will be more than able to find the way back to this little sanctuary. Their restaurant can also be considered as one of the best we have tried in Marrakech.  The interior of our room resembled Aladins' cave. A tad dark but then again in the heat of summer big windows would most probably not help to keep the temperatures down when you want some rest.    If you are looking for both rest sheer spoils and a place to call your own have no doubts about the Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Vinay S wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: We (me and my wife and three other couples and a single) stayed one night on arrival in Marrakech preparatory to moving to Royal Mansour to attend a wedding. Was a wonderful experience. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable we had dinner and breakfast as a group on their beautiful terrace some had a hammam but most memorable was the delightful service. If they had not already provided for something they were always ready to respond to our requests. All agreed that this was a great stay with the only minor blemish being lack of exciting vegetarian choices for dinner. Pre-arrival communication with the riad was also very efficient. There were no bad surprises. A great start to our Morocco trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Dean R wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: I have been to a lot of hotels claiming to be 4/5* but which don't quite hit the mark. Riad Dar Anika absolutely smashes this. From the 5*++ personal welcome you receive to being constantly pleasantly surprised this is a hotel which goes above and beyond your expectation. The staff remember everything and make sure you are totally comfortable (without going over the top).    The next thing to mention is that a lot of hotels require you to get a taxi into the most interesting part of Marrakech the heart of the Medina. Riad Dar Anika is practically on the doorstep to everything and save from airport transfers we were able to walk everywhere. We were also able to return very easily if it got too hot to a nice air conditioned accommodation.    I didn't realise this until the last few days but a very nice bonus to this hotel is the roof top terrace. Not just the beautiful sun-trap on which you can enjoy an excellent breakfast but a further set of steps which give you views of everthing including but not limited to the Katoubia Mosque and the distant snow capped mountains! Plenty of cafes/restaurants offer you a terrace view but here it is right at your accommodation.    I can not wait to return. I loved this Riad and of course Marrakech it is an absolute battering of the senses; Endless souks and picturesque alleys snake charmers story tellers music and pulsing life. You do have to be on your toes but there are people who will go out of their way to help you if you need it- the city can seem a little overwhelming at first but you will fall in love with it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Marion K wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: Not a Rose Petal Out of Place
Review_Text: What can we say? Dar Anika is exquisite in every detail and it has spoiled us for everyday life. If you don’t know what sights to visit the owner personally works out your itinerary. If you return from a long day of sightseeing looking hot and dusty moments later a waiter appears at the door of your room with glasses of chilled juice. While you are out for dinner unseen hands tidy the room and leave a bedtime snack of dates and milk. You begin your day with a luxurious breakfast on the breezy rooftop terrace and end it there with dinner or a drink under the stars. Your bathroom is stocked with fragrant argan-oil toiletries and if you book a hammam your skin is scrubbed silky smooth. All of the sights of the Medina are within easy walking distance. In short you are relieved of all of life’s difficulties until you regretfully leave for home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A home away from home in the heart of the medina...
Review_Text: o be honest when I first came to the Riad I had my hesitations considering the Bed and Breakfast style of the property. I was quick to change my opinion as the intimate setting of the hotel and the attentiveness of the staff made Riad Dar Anika a home away from home. The staff were eager to cater to our every need from advice on the best places to eat at Jmaa el Fnaa to the point where when I inquired about where I could get my hands on the Argan shampoo (provided in the bathrooms at the Riad) i was provided with two bottles of it upon departure. This Riad actually changed my opinion about small boutique hotels teaching me an important life lesson ... sometimes less is more!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful rooms excellent service everyone is super friendly lots of extras delicious food. We felt like king and queen. The owner gave us tips and advice and really took his time to talk to us. Fantastic experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrew M wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: Best Hotel in Marrakesh this is the place.
Review_Text: Upon arriving from taking a night train from Tangier we were greeted by the hotels owner Abu. He was quick to show us exactly what to do for the 1 day we were there and how to get the most out of it. Then he took us to eat an amazing breakfast on the roof. Everything he told us to go see was amazing. He recommended an amazing spa experience dinner and nightlife. The hotel was impeccable  beautiful and the staff were amazingly helpful and friendly. The next day as we set off for the airport he gave us to go bags with food. I can't imagine a better experience! Highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Having stayed at Dar Anika in 2014 we decided to return and celebrate my 40th birthday for three nights on 25th May. It's always a concern when you go back to somewhere you have stayed before in case it's not as nice but we were certainly not disappointed !  We were collected from the airport and our luggage whisked to our room which was upgraded to a suite(room 2) It is a beautiful room with a domed ceiling lounge area with 2 chaise longues and a fire for the winter months. The bathroom only had a shower and no bath but this wasn't a problem. It is stocked with shampooshower gelsoapcotton wool pads and cotton buds.  In the wardrobe are reading lights for you to use a hairdryer safe extra pillows and blankets. You are also provided with bottled water every day and fruit/dates.  We had dinner here on our first night on the rooftop restaurant and it was the best meal of our entire stay (we also ate at Maison Arabe and Azar). I was also surprised with a delicious birthday cake and was sung to !  Breakfast is also served on the rooftop and consists of freshly squeezed orange juice coffee yoghurt fruit salad local cake Moroccan crepes and bread with butter honey and jam.
