We were so full we missed lunch everyday !!!  There are also sun-beds on the rooftop which have towels straw hats and fans for you to use.  We both had a hamman and massage which was wonderful. As the public ones are single sex it was nice to be able to do this together. There is a pool on the ground floor which is surrounded by candles - if you want to use it they pull curtains around it for your privacy as it faces inwards onto the courtyard.  The riad is very conveniently located for the souk - a 5 minute walk to the main square and a 15 minute drive to the airport.  You will see rave reviews on trip advisor about Maison Arabe but i feels like a Disney take on a riad and really a hotel rather than a riad as such. We also preferred the location of Dar Anika as well.  The service is faultless and staff so friendly and attentive. They really cannot do enough for you. Thank-you for making my birthday so special !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John D wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: Five stars doesn's give Dar Anika justice
Review_Text: Staying at the Dar Anika was an absolute pleasure and I was disappointed to leave. It is a fantastic place to stay for multiple reasons. First and foremost is the staff. They were amazing and their service was impeccable at all times. My wife and I were there on our honeymoon and the first morning they brought out champagne cake and sang for us. In addition to the amazing staff the food was very good. Breakfast on the roof every morning was lovely. We also ate dinner there one night in the courtyard which was very good. The property itself it also beautiful. All of these factors made for a perfect stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a great stay due to the attentive and caring staff. The Riad has a cosy atmosphere and is tranquil which is a nice change from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.  It has a marvellous terrace to enjoy food and drinks on spa indoor swimming pool and great catering.  The owner manager and staff will take care of your every need and always polite humble and efficient.  Highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent attention to detail, very accommodating and great food and service.
Review_Text: Centrally located. Abu gives a personal and appropriate service. Guests are treated impeccably. No request is too great and everything was done with excellent attention to detail. An oasis of calm in a bustling vibrant city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marijn R wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: Best hospitality i have ever experienced
Review_Text: The room was great and a very welcome interlude for al the hectic of the city. The hospitality of the hotel and its employees blew our minds. Best example would be the morning when we checked out early they already had filled in our custom forms for us! And to top that of they even prepared a small snack for us to take on the plane with us. Insane. By far one of the best hotels i have ever had the pleasure of staying.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect Stay at the Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: My husband and I just returned from a short stay at the Riad Dar Anika. From the moment we walked in the beauty and peacefulness took our breath away. The service was nothing short of extraordinary and no detail was overlooked during our time there. We thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast each morning on the  rooftop terrace (which was enough to carry us through lunch) and then returning to the terrace for a drink each evening before dinner. For first timers to Marrakech the location was perfect with the main square just a few minutes walk away. All in all we could not find a single fault in our stay and would highly recommend this Riad. We hope to return one day soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was an oasis of calm amid the busy streets of the Medina of Marrakech. The staff were wonderful and nothing was too much trouble. The food was fantastic and we enjoyed wonderful breakfasts and dinners. The manager was particularly helpful and sat down with a map and advised us on places to see and some do' s and dont's. Very useful indeed when we had limited time there. Location is perfect as you are only a few minutes from the main square.  We used the airport transfer which worked perfectly. Would definitely return. Thank you for a great stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Riad, Great staff, Great Great Great
Review_Text: Amongst the chaos of a really busy street inside the Medina you will find an unbelievable refuge called the Riad Dar Anika. The place is beautiful and modern with a Moroccan flair. Staff will be so kind and welcoming. All the rooms are different overlooking the court yard and pool. Cant wait to stay here again. LOVED IT!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Dar Anika was for 3 days the house of warm hospitality as it has been described so many times in the past. Discuss your plans with Abu the Owner. You will benefit from that and he is always interested to update his knowledge about his city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent four nights here and left very pleased with the our stay.    First of all the service and attention is exceptional from the time of reservation until check-out. For example I requested flowers and fruit basket placed in the room for my wife with a romantic note which they did as a complimentary gift. Upon check-out at 6 am the manager Antonio and staff were up and ready with a packed breakfast.    The location is convenient within the medina though there was construction all around at the time we went. The room we reserved was a deluxe room which was way too small for our liking and without windows it felt claustrophobic. Thankfully we were upgraded to a superior room at the generosity of Antonio.    Breakfast in the terrace was great!!    What sets Dar Anika apart is indeed the service charm and location. I would only suggest a couple of minor improvements:    - keep a well stocked mini-bar / snacks  - have an in-room dining menu
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you`re looking for a big resort with swimingpool and tenis courts where you can sunbath all day by the pool this is not the place for you. BUT if you want to experience the real Marrakesh the Medina the souks busy streets exotic smells and wonderfull people this is where you stay! Just a five minutes walk from the main square this diamond of a hotel is located just of a busy walking street. An old restaurated riad is turned into a five star hotel in the middle of the old city with the best personalized service i have ever experienced. With only ten rooms you get pampered from the moment you enter and i had one of the best hotel experiences in my life at Dar Anika. Nothing and i mean nothing beats a visit to the Hamam in Dar Anika followed by a massage in your room after a long day walking in the Medina of Marrakesh! Absolutelt loved everything with this hotel from the rooms breakfast the service and the location!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We just got back from a long weekend from Marrakech. There is only one word to describe Riad Dar Anika. Amazing! An over the top staff makes your visit a truly unforgettable experience. The breakfast the Hammam the massage the mani the pedi the rooftop dinner restaurant recommendations reservations shopping tips... You name it they make it happen - at the highest standards possible. Dar Anika is beyond recommendation - if you are able to make it have the experience of your life.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Fantastic for families. So much to do. Luxury stay at Riad Dar Anika!  The variety of food is amazing. So much to do and everyone is helpful and friendly. The place is immaculate. We had a family room which was perfect. Looking to go again next year. Don't bother with any other hotels you won't be disappointed at the voyage. Any questions just ask!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An Oasis in Marrakech - A pure delight from the first hello to the last goodbye!
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is an oasis in middle of the Medina of Marrakech. From the moment you walk through their doors you are made to feel welcome and the Riad is beautiful and relaxing! Welcome beverage and snack are served during your leisurely check-in and then you meet with the manager Antonio who helps you plan your stay. Every member of staff is superb and every request is met with a smile and a warm response. Breakfast is delicious and plentiful and with the beauty of the rooftop added in every morning is a delight. We also took advantage of the rooftop in the evening for a cocktail and dinner. The food as in the morning was excellent the service was efficient and the atmosphere superb including a gentleman playing soft Moroccan music.    We booked a walking tour of the city through the Riad for our first full day which I would recommend as it helps to orient you to the very complex street system in Marrakech. Saad was our tour guide - he was fantastic! We always hope to have tour guides that are local and who can tailor their tour to our interests and Saad hit the mark! We also did the tour to the Atlas Mountains with a Berber guide. Hassan was also wonderful - we hiked through a few High Atlas Berber villages and had lunch at his mother's home where my husband learned how to make famous Moroccan mint tea!    We also took advantage of the private hammam and massage at the Riad and our attendants were all very good. If you have not visited a hammam before I would recommend it as a unique experience beyond the normal spa experience.    The location of the Riad is quite good as well if you are planning to spend time in the Medina as it is walking distance to most things. If you need a taxi or a driver the Riad will either arrange a private driver for you or will escort you to the street and get you a taxi (including negotiating the rate).    We visited several other Riads for dinner while we were there and I commented to my husband more than once that our Riad was far nicer and the service better. I would not hesitate to go back to Riad Dar Anika or to recommend it to family and friends. It is a slice of heaven and I am thrilled that it was a part of our trip to Marrakech.    I would recommend arranging the transfers through the Riad as it is a bit chaotic coming out of the airport and knowing that you have someone there to pick you up makes it less hectic. Also the Riad is very good at communicating with you prior to visit. I would not recommend spending a lot of time setting things up before you arrive as Antonio will go through everything again when you get there and depending on the weather you may need to change things. And on that topic should you need to cancel and event or change a dinner reservation the Riad staff is very accommodating and will arrange everything for you.    And finally if you have an early morning departure they do serve you full breakfast even if it is before hours and then they send you on your way with a bag full of sandwiches and fruit and a warm smile and thank you!

Review_Date: Mark W wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: Excellent accomodation with great staff and great location
Review_Text: Stayed at the Riad this weekend & i cant say enough good things about this place!    Location was perfect 5 mins walk to the main sq & other local sites to see.  The manager was a really nice guy and sat down with us with a map and explained the do's & dont's of Marrakesh  places to see & places to avoid and recommendations of restaurants. The staff in general are brilliant and go above and beyond in everything from booking restaurants to serving breakfast!    Our flight home was early so too early for breakfast but when we left we were provided a bag with sandwiches & fruit to keep us going for our flight...very nice touch & thoughtful & never had that before in anywhere else i have stayed around the world.    If you are going to Marrakesh & you want to stay in a Riad then this is the place to stay!! :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Highlight of the trip to Marrakech
Review_Text: This was our first trip to Marrakech. First we communicated with Riad Dar Anika several times via Skype and emails; their replies were very quick and to the point. We were flying into Casablanca and riad has arranged to pick us up from/to the airport. We had two more chances to use their drivers - trips to the mountains and to Essaouira. Their drivers are best.  Also you have to experience Dar Anika's hammam - it is out of this world.  When booking the room I mentioned our upcoming wedding anniversary and then I forgot about it. To our total surprise we were greeted with beautiful flower arrangement and delicious cake.  Riad is located near Jewish quarter (Mellah) about 15-20 minutes walk to central square. Car can drop you off at about 40 yards from entrance.

It is not often that you get an experience of staying at accommodation like Dar Anika. All the previous reviews are accurate and I will not repeat them. Our five days were relaxing and we enjoyed the short holiday and the facilities this lovely Riad offered. Many thanks to the unfailing generous and courteous staff.    Marrakech is a truly exciting city to visit. The traffic is a cross between Mad Max and the Ben Hur Chariot races and the people in the Old City kind poor but welcoming. We both felt very safe when walking about in our tourist gear and never once were hassled beyond an initial approach.    In temperatures of 95% when we returned to the coolness of Dar Anika there was always a greeting and a cold drink served.    Well done Abou and staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeremy J wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: Amazing Traditional Riad in Medina with Superior Service
Review_Text: This riad was beautiful provided an "oasis in the desert feel" and had some of the most accommodating staff I have ever encountered in my life. The hotel's cleanliness was also superb. The next time I am in Marrakech I will definitely be staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: maariyah i wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: Me and my husband stayed here for our 1year w/a  The riad was so lovely and the room was decorated for us. The main guy abu who dealt with us was so amazing he really did look after us and planned our whole holiday with us.  The staff treated us like family giving us milk and dates before bed everynight cooking us fresh brekky in the morning.it was a lovely atmosphere.  They even gave us a complimentary pack lunch for our way home when we left which i thought was so nice of them to do.  They reception staff were always talking to us and making us laugh.  They really made us feel special  I would defo reccomend to everyone
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An excellent accommodation with highest level of customer service and satisfaction
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is well located in the heart of the city. The team cannot stop doing more for you. The word NO does not exist in their vocabulary or dictionary. The traditional welcome is really warm and makes you feel at home. The food is excellent and all the rooms are decorated to the highest traditional standards. The roof top is an excellent location to enjoy your morning breakfast or you evening dinner amidst setting sun light breeze live music and candle lit area. I made an unusual request for food well out of their menu and I was surprised to see the result. All you have to say what you want and they will organise it for you. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to experience differently from a usual commercial hotel.

In the middle of Marrakech (the Medina's) this hotel is a true oasis. Upon arriving we were welcomed with traditional treats and a quiet space to relax. The staff went out of their way to ensure we were very well taken care of even going so far as to resolve an issue we had with a tour guide something they had no responsibility for. We felt very safe knowing we had immediate access to the staff even when out of the hotel. My only complaint was that we didn't stay there longer to enjoy this wonderful experience for a longer period.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: From the moment we arrived at the airport the service was first class. The car was there to meet us staff from the Riad met our car and carried our luggage to the Riad. We were shown to a beautiful furnished room and offered water & towels to freshen up. This was followed by several plates of "snacks" including soup. All that was needed after a flight. As our room was not quite ready we were given a bedroom in which to freshen up and change out of travel clothes. Before we left the Riad to explore we were sat down and shown on a map where we were staying places of interest marked out for us. Also although not needed on our trip advice of not what to do to be taken advantage of. On return our beautiful rose scattered rooms were ready. After such an early start we eat in and the food  wine and service were first class. They could not do enough for us without being intrusive. Even as we left we were given a hessian bag containingfruit and sandwiches so we didn't have to worry at the airport or on flight. I would highly recommend this Riad not just for wonderful service but for cleanliness and central position to everything we wanted ro see.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Andrew S wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: We recently returned to the Dar Anika for another fantastic holiday.From the moment you enter the beautiful Riad its feels you are at home being pampered by the most amazing staff led so ably by Antonio the manager. The owners Abu&Abu are always striving to improve the Dar Anika's experience for guests and while we were there a new A la Carte menu was introduced. The dishes we tried were mouth wateringly good and it was nice to be able to try other Morrocan recipes other than the famous tachines which you get everywhere.On this trip we took a friend with us and she was just made so welcome she said it was one of the best holidays she had ever had! After such a perfect visit to Dar Anika we can't wait to return and usually as a couple we never do return visits but we are hooked !! One extra piece of information the square outside the Riad was in the process of being upgraded ready for an international conference at the Bahdi Palace so entrance to the Dar Anika and the medina will be even easier and more attractive.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: James E wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: Incredible and fantastic riad in Marrakech
Review_Text: Best place in the world I have stayed. We went to Morocco as a family on a gadventures tour which ended in Marrakech. We looked online for a place to stay in advance without knowing Marrakech. What a pleasant surprise when we arrived (after a rather entertaining walk by local wagon/porters. They wanted to charge 20euro for a 50dirham job that was pre agreed) !  The riad staff is wonderful and Antonio provided a very nice layout of Marrakech and a great map with all the details. He was a fantastic resource. The staff is excellent and predicts your needs with simple things like strawberry juice when relaxing on the upper deck. The food was great and the riad pool was nice and refreshing at the end of the day. I can't think of a better place to depart-the-chaos of the place el fnaa and the souks! Wonderful trip and will definitely return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sarah W wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: Just back from a long weekend in Marrakesh at Riad Dar Anika.  EVERYTHING WAS PERFECT ABOUT THE RIAD.  I have travelled a lot and stayed in a lot of places. This Riad takes a lot of beating.    It is a haven of tranquility from the hustle and bustle of outside. The interior is exquisite and full of beautiful flowers trees and the occasional friendly little bird. The rooms and Riad as a whole was spotless. The food amazing. The constant complementary snacks and refreshing drinks were fabulous. And the staff were so warm and friendly. I would advise anyone travelling to Marrakesh to stay here. And in case you were wondering about street noise there was no problem at all we took ear plugs but didn't need them. Our room 6 was street side they had a specially made and upholstered foam insert in our window which they put in at night time when they delivered our complementary night time milk and dates to our room. It acted as a sound barrier and apart from a muted call to prayer at 5 (which you hear everywhere in Morroco) there was no noise at all.  Perfect location perfect hosts. Loved it. Want to be back there on the roof terrace now. Don't look at any other reviews just book Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Amazing Visit At Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: My wife who generally plans our big trips out did herself this time. We were visiting our daughter who was spending a semester abroad in Barcelona. We met her there and moved on to Marakech.    Our plane was delayed and we did not get to the hotel until around 9:30pm. They immediately greeted us and ushered us into a lavishly furnished lounge area. They started by serving us mint tea and pastries. Very relaxing. They were chagrined to inform us that the kitchen was closed. However they kept bringing more small plates: dates with fresh milk a lentil (I think) soup and a few other things. Who needs the kitchen to be open with that kind of service!    Once we were fully checked in they showed us to our rooms. The four poster bed was strewn with rose petals. Very romantic. The room was big elegant and comfortable. The girl's room was not quite s big but was equally well appointed. We asked if we could have a bottle of wine sent to the room. The response: "with pleasure". This was basically the response to any request. One could get used to that.    The next day the manager spoke to us about the town what we wanted to do/see. Very informative and helpful. We pre-ordered dinner. I think you need to order by 3:00 if you plan on eating there. With only 9-rooms they can't be expected to keep a staff on hand if you decide to eat last minute. However given their willingness to please I'm sure they would pull something together. Dinner was great. Traditional tagine of various kinds appetizers and desert. Excellent.    One night before we went out we had a drink. We generally try to go with the flow and be "local". I was though in the mood for a "dirty martini" (vodka up with olives and a little olive brine). The waiter didn't know what that was. I would not have expected him to so no big deal. I explained. He basically brought an "up" martini with a couple of olives. Hey I gave it a shot. Not his fault it wasn't right. My wife and I enjoyed it. As we were leaving though he pulled me aside and asked him if there was anything wrong. I assured him that there was no problem and that I had been the one who ordered an idiotic drink. He then asked how he could improve it. We had a discussion about how to make a dirty martini. That is great service.    My wife had scheduled us for a Hammam (I am sure I have spelled this wrong). It is basically a steam bath with an attendant who exfoliates and washes you with various salts and mud concoctions. I will give this a 7 but with my wife giving it a 13 it balances to a 10. My only issue was that it was too hot. That though is a personal taste issue not a criticism of the process. My wife loved it. After we had a 1-hour massage which was also great.    Everything about this place is great. Very relaxing place to get away.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: From the first moments of welcome from Antonio we kept on thinking it could not get any better....but it did keep getting better. The staff are all wonderful. Nothing is too much trouble. We used the hotel excursions. Mohammed took us on an excellent walking tour of the Medina and the stargazing in the desert was fantastic. Thanks again to the hotel for organising it and providing a fabulous picnic. Everything about our stay was perfect. Especial mention for Hana who looked after all the arrangements with great skill and a lovely smile.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Sofia R wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: We had a great stay at dar Anika. Great service and wonderful food. They were also very helpful with booking excursions and providing information which made our trip special. I really recommend their trip to the Atlas Mountains!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Modal T wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: A homely hotel in the heart of the hustle
Review_Text: Stayed February 2016    A small hotel 10 or so rooms which I think used to be the house of a prince. Free WiFi which was decent/stable.    The location is fantastic for walking to the square and some of the nice restaurants like Pepe Nero Nomad was nearby too infact the square is just a 5 minute walk where there is lots going on with several snack/coffee stops. Otherwise a taxi can be stopped just outside.    A great welcome from the hustle outside the owner sat with us and talked us through the various activities we could fit in during our 5 day stay he ordered a pizza in from outside for our fussy son- which was much appreciated. We were able to get an idea of what we could fit in to our 5 day stay by talking to the staff they were able to advise and book trips/restaurants for us. Everyone was knowledgeable and super kind and all very friendly to our son (7 years old).    The rooms are perfect and again have a homely feel as you’d expect from a Riad compared to a 5 star chain perfectly clean and comfortable and ample room to relax.The pool is small and more so for dipping than actual swimming – although fine for children to play/swim its located within the main internal dining area.    Breakfast every morning in the dining area was like home dining with a variety of things to try different each day followed by pancakes which our son really enjoyed.    We didn’t do any shopping.    A very enjoyable stay throughout made special by the staff who treated us like family a pleasant surprise on departure – very thoughtful.    Highly recommend no reservation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: From the minute your walk thru the door the staff and service is impeccable. Antonio was quick to show as around and Hanane was a sweetheart. She upgraded our room on our second stay without us even asking. We can't wait to come back and visit again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Wonderful friendly staff with personal touch
Review_Text: Beautiful and tranquil in a perfect position to access all the top sights in Marrakesh.  The staff were charming and nothing was too much trouble from the inital welcome drink and advice to the farewell where they made you feel like an honoured guest.  Of particular note were the trips organised by the riad - especially the walking day in the high atlas mountains with a local guide culminating in lunch at his own house.  The rooftop terrace was lovely for breakfast and in the evening and the food exceptional.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Our 2nd stay here - we can't recommend more highly
Review_Text: This was our 2nd time at Dar Anika. The staff and management were incredibly welcoming and helpful the Riad is lovely and conveniently located. It's exactly the kind of service I love - you always know that someone will be there and be able to help but you never feel like you're being smothered.    Breakfast was freshly made and delicious (eat on the balcony if the weather's nice!) and they thoughtfully packed us sandwiches and fruit (without us asking) when we departed on our last day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The quality of Riad dar anika surpassed any hotel I have stayed in. The constant care and thought of the staff was most impressive. The cleanliness and care of the room could not be faulted. My companion's birthday was made special by a gift of roses a gorgeous cake and seven staff singing "Happy Birthday." I cannot recommend this centrally-situated hotel highly enough. Excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Relaxing stay in a very nice hotel with a beautiful patio! The hotel is very central located and therefore most attracions were at walking distance. Antonio was the perfect host and the rest of the staff really friendly
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed just one night but could appreciate the kindness and efficiency of all the staff. We have been welcomed and guided by the director who advised us how to optimised our stay. When we checked out the staff prepared us a picnic bag as we were going for an excursion...really nice gesture!  The hotel is really charming with the amazing roof terrace and rooms were clean and comfy.  I will come back and recommend.  Thanks  Renaud Boisson
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Wendy O wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: Very special place with a magical staff!
Review_Text: We loved our time at the Riad; it was really the staff that made it magical. Everyone there made you feel like royalty. They took such great care us from the moment they opened the beautiful front door to welcome us. Honna was so sweet to my 4-year-old that when we were checking out he told me that he was going to miss her. Their customer service is a top down effect as the owner is so concerned about his guests and it shows. One evening we were going to an outdoor show and it was very cold. As we were leaving the front desk staff provided us all with hoodies to ensure we would be comfortable. Everyone should be lucky enough to stay in the place that really values their guests like Dar Anika does.    The Riad itself is beautiful and very quite. We all slept great. The food was spectacular especially our welcome Harira and treats. The breakfast was out of this world with course after course and everything was not only beautiful but tasted wonderful as well. It took me a while to write this review because I wanted it to be as amazing as our stay however I realized that wouldn't be possible as our stay was perfect!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My mother & I stayed at the Riad in mid-March and had a great stay. The location was great. We felt safe and it was about a 5 minute walk to the square. The hotel employees were very friendly and accommodating. The common areas and our room was very clean. They assisted us in making reservations for tours. We ate breakfast and dinner and both were delicious. I would recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Perfect in every way. I would definitely recommend the Riad I have never felt so pampered and spoilt by everyone! From the moment we walked through the door until the moment we left with a packed lunch for our journey the staff thought of everything to make our visit enjoyable in every way.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: George S wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika for 2 nights to celebrate my wife's birthday. They went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and entertaining. From the manager(Antonio ) to all the staff they were the best host. The food was delicious and well prepared. Everything about this place was breathtaking and it was a memorable experience that we will never forget. Thank you everybody at Dar Anika for making our stay very comfortable and enjoyable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is an A1 Riad. Largely due to the care effort and generosity of all the staff. The welcome and kind gestures expressed and supported are exceptional and were well received. There is nothing that is too much trouble.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great hotel second time I have stayed 5 star for me. the staff are fanatic i would recommend the Hamman and Massage well worth the money.  I could find anything negative to say about our stay well done to all the staff at Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Toby M wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: Yes a delightful experience. Dar Anika was like staying with friends but politer more willing to do anything to make our stay great and super comfortable. Our chat with Antonio (the manager) on what to do in Marrakesh and how to handle the souks was fun and excellent. All the recommendations of what to do see and eat turned out well. We had hammam in the Riad's own little hammam room which was unique and great. And we did the Riad's tour to the mountains at Imlil. Fantastic. Hassan the guide had to be recorded on my son's iPhone. 'welcome to the HighAtlasMountains' Location was good too altogether a very happy experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Liz Y wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: This place is wonderful I can literally say nothing negative about it.    The location of this Riad is right in the heart of the medina just a few minutes walk to Jemaa el Fna and the palace so is very easy to explore the city.    The staff at the Riad were superb very welcoming and always happy to help. They organised a trip to the Atlas Mountains for us which included our on personal Berber guide and even a mule for our 4 year to ride if he got tired.    Our room was beautiful comfortable and always very clean. Breakfast on the roof terrace was always a treat lots of tasty food surrounded by beautiful plants and flowers views of the Atlas Mountains and much to the delight of our little boy a few resident tortoises!    I loved this place and would recommend it to anyone wanting to explore this exciting city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Our stay in this beautiful riad was absolutely amazing! The location is right at the front of the medina and very secluded. The decor of the riad itself is gorgeous and very welcoming. The service is great with helpful people at every corner and a car service in case one might need it. We felt very peaceful and welcomed throughout our stay. A big thank you to the manager Antonio for making our stay very relaxing. The food is also excellent! Breakfast on the rooftop was a favorite for our family. Our overall stay was absolutely amazing and we could spend weeks in this beautiful riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Patty P wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika during the half term Holidays in February. We were met with a really warm welcome when we arrived and then presented with a delicious array of Moroccan treats and mint tea .....a lovely surprise after our long journey. Dar Anika is a beautiful riad well located to many of the main tourist sights and all in walkable distance.The souks are also on your doorstep . The interior of Dar Anika is traditional Moroccan style with a lovely sun terrance and rooftop views over the city. There is also a pool for dipping in.. We really enjoyed eating our breakfast in the sitting room which was made even more cosy by a real fire which was lit every morning . The breakfast was plentiful and very well presented.infact it was delicious. The staff were all very helpful and pleasant paying particular attentiveness to our young son which we really appreciated. The owners and manager gave us lots of useful tips and advice to get the most out of our trip to Marrakech . We made a number of restaurant reservations on their recommendations. All in all I would really recommendate staying in Dar Anika..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Wenjie Z wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Dar Anika for two nights and the staff there never failed to amaze us with their five star service. Day 1 at 11pm we are looking for some specific type of body wash which they didn't have in the Riad but when we called the reception they immediately sent someone to buy body wash for us. And after 5 minutes a person was in front of my room giving me even shampoo and two bottles of body wash he bought. It was so amazing! The next day we need to catch a 5pm train to Casablanca and before I went to the train station they surprised us again by giving me a bag of fruits and sandwiches to eat on the train. I like this place so much and I love the people there. Will definitely come back again if I have a chance.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We chose this Riad through Trip Advisor and we definitely made the right choice. From the minute we arrived to the minute we left myself and my five friends were treated like princesses.  Breakfast was amazing which was omelette fresh fruit salad with yoghurt and various other mini plates.  We had an evening a meal which was a traditional Moroccan Tagine it was beautiful the service was impeccable.  The owner/manager sat us all down after breakfast on the first day with a map and advised us where to go and where not to go he gave us some great tips and he even gave us a mobile phone in case we needed him !!  There was a roof top terrace we settled in with a couple of bottles of wine one lazy afternoon and tray after tray of complimentary nibbles and snacks were served. I would highly recommend this gorgeous place to stay Antonio and his amazing team made our mini break one to remember.  Thank you to you all.

Review_Date: Delnor N wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: Our stay at Riad Dar Anika was supreme! The service and attention to detail was par excellence! Upon arrival we were invited to sit in the lounge/lobby and enjoy milk and dates soup mint tea and sweets. The manager took time to give us tips to make our stay in Marrakesh more enjoyable. Our room was covered in rose petals. Bottled water sweets milk fruit and laundry services were complimentary. The breakfasts were amazing with the best home made yogurt ever. All of the food (dinner and breakfast) was fresh and made in house. Upon our return from the day's activities we received fresh strawberry drinks. We left an electronic reader out to charge during the day and when we returned the staff had placed the charging reader on a small table. Each day on our return we had fresh water and other treats in our room. Rather than just giving directions one of the attendants walked us to a local restaurant. On our departure we were provided a small lunch in a satchel. The front desk provided great recommendations for activities and restaurants and made arrangements when needed. Once again the service was amazing.    The Riad has a great location with many of the attractions of the Medina in walking distance. The roof top terrace provided a quiet and relaxing setting while allowing you to observe the hustle and bustle of the street below. Restaurants shops bank machines etc. can all be found within walking distance.    Riad Dar Anika is a MUST STAY! Pay in cash for a discount.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A little piece of heaven with the best staff ever.
Review_Text: I am so very happy I picked this place. From the time we walked in to the time we left we felt very welcome and well taken care of. We had a wonderful reception they offered us food drinks roses you name it Hanane made sure our check in was as easy as possible. Even before we saw the rooms we were happy. The rooms were lovely rose pedals everywhere very very clean very comfy beds and beautiful decore. The breakfasts were amazing dont think I have ever had scrambled eggs as good as that in my life. And there was always plenty of food to take us all the way to dinner. And the dinners were amazing too definatly the best meals of our trip. But by far the best thing about our stay were the people that worked there. Every single one of them was very kind to us and did everything possible for us. We had a huge issue when one of us was flying into Brussels and the plane was cancelled they went to a lot of effort and sorting it out for us. The two brothers who run this riad have done an excellent job in chosing good people and they themselves are around all the time to take care of their guests. But a very special mention goes to Hanane at the front desk she went way further then she needed to help us out even walked us to places because we did not know where we were going. She is a great person and I would be very happy to call her a friend. Thank you for everything Hanane.And thank you everyone else as well they even gave us a lunch bag on the way out taking care of the customers to the end. They even do the laundry for free.I wish I could live there felt very much at home..  Location is great a five minute walk to the square a nice spa is close by I promise you you will have a wonderful time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My daughter and I stayed at Riad Dar Anika this month for five days. The owners and staff were incredible they couldn't do enough for us. Antonio provided us with a wealth of information on what to see and do. At the end of a busy day it was so nice to sit up on the roof terrace and enjoy a glass of wine. I would definitely recommend staying at this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Thomas M wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: My stay was absolutely amazing. The Riad is perfect in every way. The staff were beyond accommodating; they focus on impeccable customer service at all times. The meals were fantastic. Overall I couldn't have been more pleased with the stay. Try the Hamman and Massage; it's a delightful experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Lovely relaxing stay with great service
Review_Text: Had a fantastic stay here for 3 nights in March celebrating my birthday with my parents. The hotel was beautiful and welcoming a warm inviting lounge with open fireplace perfect place for the extensive welcome drinks and snacks. The rooms were cosy and the rooftop was wonderful for breakfasts in the sun as well as lounging and relaxing during the day. The location was ideal for exploring Marrakech. The staff were fantastically helpful and helped us book some tours tailored to our requirements they were also so kind to organise some surprises for my birthday. Thank you everyone at Dar Anika!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jane S wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: This Riad really is a hidden gem. I recently stayed here with 5 friends to celebrate my 50th birthday and what a celebration it was! I can't thank Antonio and everyone of his staff enough. The service they provide really is exceptional. Nothing is too much trouble and they are all attentive  polite and very professional. Antonio was very informative and gave us great advice on all aspects of Marrakech The food provided by Hanan and her restaurant staff was delicious and plentiful! Especially the birthday cake they provided as a surprise (along with the flowers!) We will definitely return to Marrakech and we will definately stay in the Riad Dar Anika again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Fabulous stay the staff are amazing can't do enough for you. When you arrive it is breathtaking such a little oasis. Food was excellent both evening meals and breakfast . Antonio was excellent going through the map with us and recommending places of interest and where best to eat oh and where you could get a wine. I would definitely recommend this Riad as we are all going back next year thank you all for a fantastic weekend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Words cannot describe the magestic beauty of this riad/hotel. The entrance reception area is simply understated. But when you turn the corner and walk down a short hallway you enter what appears to be a large open courtyard with inlaid marble floors and columns and a square blue swimmiing pool surrounded by lounges and chairs. Gorgeous! A delicious breakfast is served in a lovely room off to the side. There's a bar! The staff are very friendly gracious and accommodating. All the rooms are located up the stairs on four sides looking down over this courtyard as in many other riads. The rooms are quite large and elegant including large bathrooms with tubs and showers. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We decided that this hotel with it's very kind personnel beautiful roof terrace wonderful cuisine and lovely furnishings was the best hotel we have ever stayed in. The hammam and massage were tops and the breakfast on the roof terrace was perfectly served and very inventive. Upon arrival we were invited to have a chat with the manager who told us what to expect in Marrakech where to find the best restaurants and exactly where the sights were. We went on a wonderful excursion to the Atlas mountains which was organized by the hotel and even had lunch with a real Berber family. This hotel leaves very little to be desired.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Neil P wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Title: 5 star service, genuine Moroccan hospitality, superb location. Our Marrakech oasis.
Review_Text: We were overwhelmed by the hospitality shown to us by the staff in the riad. Their attention to detail is something else. Do not be put off by the un-assuming entrance - this is a traditional riad building set in the old town. It's location couldn't have been better. Yes there are other riads further in towards the main square but you don't want to be trudging through the souk with your luggage !. Dar Anika is about as close as you can get by car/taxi and is just a few steps away from where the taxi will drop you. However don't be worried about getting the into the magical frenzy of Marrakech. It's just a 10 minute walk to the main square and the labyrinth of the souks through the adjacent alleyway (which is a mini souk in it's own right). The Petit taxi rank is just opposite and so is ideal.    The hotel itself is a traditional Riad and so be prepared for the layout. It has a central courtyard and all the rooms are arranged around it. All have windows facing into the courtyard (I think a few might have had small windows facing out into the town as well can't be sure). This can make the rooms seem a bit dark to begin with but we opened the windows into the courtyard and this gave a sense of light and space into the room. This is just how Riads are made - have a look at the old palaces in the city and you'll find exactly the same layout. We found the rooms and hotel to be delightful - a real oasis from the hustle and bustle of the old town. This was enhanced by being served ice-cold strawberry drinks as soon as we arrived back in the afternoon.    In short if you're after a superb location and a real Moroccan experience with first class 5-star service then Dar Anika is the place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I recently stayed at Riad Dar Anika with my husband and this is by far the best riad in Marrakech (we've been to Marrakech several times over the past 10 years and have made a point of staying in different riads). We have now found our home away from home. Excellent location with the utmost attention to detail in every room. We felt like guests in a palace with personal attention from the staff members. A special thanks to Hanane who is without a doubt the shining star of Riad Dar Anika! Thank you for always greeting us with a smile and making our stay more pleasant than we could ever have imagined. Hanane helped us with dinner suggestions airport transfers shopping recommendations (I wanted to buy some Moroccan gold jewelry) - not to mention the delicious treats she served us at the riad (by the way - breakfast is amazing and will fill you up for hours - we savored every bite!). Hanane and the rest of the staff went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable one. We can't wait to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Everything I could have wished for
Review_Text: I stayed here in August 2015 with my best friend to celebrate my 40th birthday. We arrived very early in the morning to be seated on the roof and served the most spectacular breakfast. I suspect it may well have become the highlight of our day. The setting is amazing we loved watching the hustle and bustle below us the smells on the stalls selling the spices ad candles the call to prayer. Just everything. Breakfast ended up taking between two to three hours!!    Location wise you are right on the edge of the souk and can get a taxi straight to the front door!! You couldn't be better placed.    I loved the souk and the noise and people were amazing. We were too white British girls travelling alone and felt safe and happy at all times. It is only polite to be respectful of the cultures wherever you go.    We struggled to spend money when we were there the food and drink is amazing and cheap. We went to French country clubs to eat and ate in the souk all was equally fabulous.    The staff were amazing the riad was beautiful the décor stunning and certainly quality. it was always spotlessly cleaned.    Delighted that this is where I choose to celebrate my birthday. We are going back again this year. I think this says it all.    Highly recommend. Enjoy your stay!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed for 8 days and they made us feel like a family. Antonio was very helpful in giving advice and all the staff were very attentive. The service was flawless such as free daily laundry fruit drinks and even sandwich bag for us to leave for the airport with. They also cleaned our rooms often multiple times. The place itself is also tastefully decorated with a lot of charm. You can also exchange money there with a better rate than what you can get out there. We highly recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic and Wonderful Hotel, full of character and Arabic charm!
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel full of Arabic charm and character and in a perfect location. We were a party of 6 women celebrating a 50th Birthday. Antonio and his team were impossible to fault. A great deal of thought has been put into the service of this Riad and the staff were amazing. Nothing was too much trouble. Antonio was a fabulous host and was always on hand for a friendly chat and to help organise restaurants and places for us to visit. Breakfast on the roof top terrace was fab! with the sun shining and impeccable food well done to Hanan and her team. Hanan with her beautiful charm and smile was always on hand to serve us delicious pastries and olives with some well deserved dacquiries! after hours of wondering around the souks. Mohammed was our personal driver and always greeted us with a smile and friendly humour. Overall we could not fault this hotel. We give it 10/10 and would not hesitate to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Julie B wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: This hotel was in a great location . On arrival we were offered a evening meal which may I say was amazing the rooms are excellent comfortable beds clean and tidy. On arrival we were greeted by Antonnio who is one of the best hosts I have ever met explained dos and donts of Marrakech told us of some fab resturants and organised a taxi service for us being  being a party of 6 girls this was truly a must . There is not much more I can say about this little gem except the staff and service we received was one of the best and I have visited a lot of hotels .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We recently stayed for five nights and we would recommend Riad Dar Anika highly. Perfectly located so we could walk everywhere. Owners and staff were very friendly and welcoming all times of the day. Gave good advise where to go eat and where not to. Little added extras a bonus. Five star stay in a family feel small hotel. Make sure you ask for Riad Dar Anika on transfer from airport as there is a Riad Anika as well!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: So Glad We Found This Gem
Review_Text: Whenever we travel to a new city we always hope we will find a little gem that will be our hotel of choice whenever we revisit and at the Dar Anika we did. Everything was perfect - the staff were incredibly attentive and professional there is loads of character and arabic charm the breakfast and dinner we had one evening was delicious and the location is fantastic just a short walk from the main square. If you are wondering where to stay and looking a various options then my advice would be to look no further and stay here. We stayed in Marrakesh a few years ago in a hotel out of the centre that had a lovely pool but no character no charm and you could have been anywhere in the world. In the Dar Anika you feel safe and secure and in a perfect oasis that you can venture out from to explore.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Lovely luxurious spot with the greatest staff and a perfect location! Easy walking distance to everything. Beautiful interior and perfect rooftop terrace. Lovely breakfast. Sweetest most attentive staff and every guest is briefed by the manager about dos and don'ts and where to go - very helpfull if your first time in the souks. Will visit again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David G wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: We stayed at the Riad Dar Anika for three nights and have to say that it is probably the nicest small hotel we've ever stayed in. From the minute we arrived the service was nothing short of superb. We were met by Antonio the hotel manager and given soup and drinks and then shown to our room which was clean and well appointed. The hotel is in a great location a few minutes south of the main square and very close to other sights such as the El Badi Palace the Saadian Tombs and the Kasbah. It has a really calm atmosphere and the public areas are great to sit in.We really enjoyed the breakfasts each morning and being able to take it on the rooftop terrace was great. We ate in the hotel one night which was very nice and very reasonable. Overall we would recommend this hotel without reservation and would definitely stay here again if we came back to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fraser H wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: Our stay was very pleasant and enjoyable and relaxing. The standard of service was very high and all the staff were very polite and welcoming and helpful. The hotel was also very conveniently located.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Tucker K wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: The service was excellent (if they ever saw you sitting they brought you tea pastries olives or daiquiri) the food was good (although the menu was not extremely diverse) and the location is perfect (walking distance from the main square yet quiet). Antonio organized a 4 day 3 night trip to the desert for us including all of the best sights and hired a fantastic driver. Overall a highly pleasant experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Ben T wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: Spent 4 nights here last week. The hotel is easily the best part of our trip to Marrakech.  This hotel is very small only 12 bedrooms in a former tradesman's house. The service is amazing and the care and attention make every guest feel very special.  A superb location on the thoroughfare into the souk. lovely little roof top garden perfect for cocktails and breakfast.  If they put this hotel in any other city I would be sure to return.    Cannot recommend this place enough and loved every minute spent in here with Antonio and his team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: david n wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: This is the forth time we have stayed in the this great Riad.  From the very moment when you are collected from the airport to the journey backthe care is amazing both from the owners and all the staff. Nothing is to much trouble and their attention to detail is second to none.  the trip which they arranged for us to a country club was very successfullusing their own driver and we felt really save.  The food and wine was well served and excellent value and we intend returning later this yearwhen the weather in the u.k. turns poor.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing few days spent in this perfect oasis
Review_Text: We have just had a break exploring Marrakech. The highlight of this mini break was the stay at Dar Anika. It was superb from beginning ( such a warm welcome) to the end when we received a packed lunch for our trip home.  Our washing was whisked away and returned all neatly put away. Fabulous strawberry smoothies appeared when we returned home from our ventures out. Breakfast and dinner were delicious. But best of all were the staff who were brilliant.  Many thanks to each and every one of you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here for 4 nights back in Oct last year . Lovely riad with lots of nice touches. Staff are great and nothing is too much trouble. Owner sits you down and gives you lots of advice on how to get the most out of Marrakesh and stay safe. Riad is a 10 minute walk from the main square so very convenient. Breakfast is taken on a rooftop terrace which is lovely also very nice for pre dinner drinks. Had dinner here on one night and it wad delicious! Would not hesitate to recommend or stay here again. Well worth the money! And good value. Dar Anika is a peaceful and tranquil oasis in the madness and frenetic atmosphere of Marrakesh. Go you will enjoy it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ian M wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: The quality and friendliness of the initial welcome and the service throughout our stay was outstanding. After we arrived Abu gave us a good introduction to the places to see and eat in Marrakech and offered to arrange any trips we wanted. When he realised we had left home very early that day he arranged for a complimentary breakfast on the roof terrace even though if was early afternoon. Throughout our stay the three owner managers and staff all seemed to have a very genuine concern for our enjoyment of the stay with them true hospitality and why the 5 stars was truly deserved. An example of this is the free drinks the staff bring you if you sit at a table on the roof or in the main areas downstairs. A mention too for Hannah who got us a table at Maison Arabe at short notice.    The room itself was a touch small and dark but I think that is often the case with the smaller riads. The shower was challenging the shower head was below my chin but there was always plenty of hot water - the managers are proud of the large hot and cold water storage on site to ensure continuity of supply.    We had an evening meal here one of the days during our stay and also enjoyed that very much.    Highly recommended place to stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It was a lovely stay. Dar Anika is beautiful pristine elegant comvenient to places of interest spacious and quiet. The manager and staff were very helpful friendly attentive and prompt and the food is wonderful. There were many nice gestures such as the serving of tea and pastry fresh fruit or dates. The manager took the time to give us good advice on how to negotiate Marrakech. We enjoyed everything about Dar Anika and hope to return soon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at Dar Anika for three nights 23rd - 26th February. Dar Anika exceeded our expectations. The Manager Antonio is charming and very knowledgeable. He sat with us for probably an hour when we first arrived to explain the map of the city tips where to go the souks where to eat safety etc etc. Very thorough and very informative and essential to us as it was our first time in Marrakech. All the staff are lovely and very efficient. The Riad is very clean and the food exceptional. The added bonus was being able to sit on the roof terrace and have breakfast. If it is too cold the staff bring woollen capes. On our second day in the afternoon we went to the Kozy Spa (recommended by Antonio) for a Hammam which was two hours steam scrub and massage. It was fantastIc and we thought great value. Don't be put off by the entrance as it says Kosy Bar. The Spa is at the top and is beautiful. The bar at the top is lovely and they play good music so we went back the next evening for a drink. It was my husband's birthday on the 25th and the Riad made him a cake and presented it at breakfast and the staff sang happy birthday - a lovely touch. The highlight of the trip for us was visiting the Atlas Mountains. Dar Anika organised that for us and a driver Jowad picked us up at 9. We drove to Imlil and met our guide Hassam. We walked for about 2 and a half hours (don't worry if you can't do that as Hassam will walk far enough to suit you). Hassam is a fantastic guide as he lives in the area and knows everything about it. We visited a waterfall and had lunch at Hassam's house where his mother cooked for us a delicious and huge lunch on the roof top overlooking the mountains. She also made a birthday cake for my husband. (Two cakes in one day)! The Berbers are lovely  kind generous people and we are so glad we did the trip. After lunch we walked for about 10 mins back to the car and Jowad drove us home. Jowad and Hassam spoke perfect English and are both absolutely charming and fun. On our last morning when we left Dar Anika to drive to Essaoiura we were presented with a packed lunch to eat on our journey. They think of everything! After only three days we felt like family. Another thing we liked about Dar Anika is the location. It's slightly on the edge of the town and away from the souks so it is a bit quieter. A wonderful stay and I would thoroughly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Elaine C wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Title: Excellent homely stay in a friendly riad
Review_Text: From the moment we walked through the door we were greeted with the best Moroccan hospitality - rosewater to wash our hands some green or mint tea and some moroccan pastries. Antonio the hotel manager then took time to give us a map and explain where things were and to answer any questions we had. The Riad has a modern yet authentic feel. The room we had (number 8) was slightly on the small side but was perfectly nice. The attention to detail here is superb and the food excellent. We decided to eat in the riad on our first night - the chicken pastila is amazing and the wine list offers a good local choice. Also recommended is the roof terrace which is a perfect spot to watch sunset. 10/10.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kevin C wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: Even up to the day of departure my partner and I did not want to go to Marrakecha trip that was a birthday present.On the day we were leaving the hotel we did not want to leave.The city itself was such a fantastic experiencewith the main square and the souks (incredible)But I cannot find enough words to explain our absolutely wonderful time at this hotel.The manager "Antonio" and "Everyone"of his brilliant staff were really fantastic.NOTHING was too much trouble to them.As I have already said I cannot find enough words to explain the awesome time that we spent thereAnd the "Creme Caramel" Heaven.!!I could actually spend hours telling you moreWhy not just go there and Im sure that you will soon understand what I mean..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ivana C wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: First call !!! We were very well received the manager gave us all information on Marrakech and the day to go accompanied us to the exit to the road. All impeccable breakfast and wonderful dinner. Close to everything and very safe. I recommend it to everyone
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ally W wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika made my time in Marrakech amazing. The staff was incredible; hospitable helpful and knowledgeable. I was greeted warmly and the pictures of my room the courtyard and the breakfast terrace have inspired envy in the hearts of my friends and family on facebook. You will not be disappointed with this fantastic place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Mark F wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: We stayed here for my girlfriend's birthday and it was fantastic! All the staff were 1st class from start to finish and could not do enough to help us. They even laid on a surprise cake and flowers on the day plus all the staff sang Happy Birthday. It was amazing! If you arrive in Marrakech for the 1st time you may be fooled by the exterior of the hotel but this is a typical riad. Once inside it's amazing décor pool and furnishings look fantastic. Breakfast was served on the roof top terrace with freshly cooked pancakes omelettes and bread. Plus the terrace was also nice for a G&T after walking around the city! Thank you again to Antonio and all the team. Look no further for somewhere to stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It was a very Nice stay everything was perfect and the Personal was so good. The breakfast was overwhelming and tasted so good. Can recommend it for everyone who wanna go to marokko. Fantastic city and fantastic life.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay at Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: This riad is wonderful. The lobby area and the rooftop terrace are beautiful. The location is perfect. The rooms were very nice. But what makes this place truly stand out is the staff. Everyone on the Riad Dar Anika team did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Antonio made excellent suggestions for excursions and truly does a great job of managing the property. I wholeheartedly recommend this accommodation to anyone who is visting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika was a great place to stay. The staff were all so hospitable. They answered all the questions that we had about the city and gave us some great recommendations as to where to eat in Marrakech. When we arrived we were greeted with tea and snacks. The rooms were clean and spacious. The location was also very convenient- close to the palace as well as the central souk. They served us so much food for breakfast and it was all great. On our last day we were leaving to do a hiking trip around the Atlas Mountains. The staff packed us lunch for our trip. The service was superb.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: After reading all the great reviews of Dar Anika we were excited to be staying at one of the best riads in the city and right on one of the streets leading to Djenna El-Fna. It’s a boutique experience with many different zones for you to relax in – we loved the berber tent on the rooftop garden for its comfort and shade and also the traditional tea ‘lounge’ just at the top of the stairs and the room with a roaring wood fire (yes a fire! you may think this mad in a hot climate but it’s welcome on a winter night after a few gins on the roof terrace!). There’s also a plunge pool and a large choice of areas to relax in including sun loungers and various seated zones around the area. Plus the attention to detail in the decor is wonderful – from the carved wood ceilings on the ground floor to the red and floral stencilling on the mezzanine really living up to its 'boutique' title. It is a special place!    Upon arrival we met Antonio the manager who we read about on TripAdvisor - he really is a great person full of interesting information and recommendations to help you make the most of your stay. He gave us a pep talk of tips (you can find some of his Marrakech survival tips at our rocknrolltourist blog along with a few of our own) and recommendations of must see and dos. He was also full of surprises and up-graded us to a beautiful bedroom because it was my birthday! I also got a beautiful bouquet of flowers and a delicious cake (I just wish I'd left enough room after the meal to eat it) accompanied by the staff singing happy birthday! A really thoughtful touch!    The staff made us feel more than welcome with a table loaded with milk dates cakes pastries sweets biscuits mint tea fresh orange and moroccan soup and rose water to freshen our hands after the flight.    The riad has a fully stocked bar so relaxing on the roof terrace is a must with a couple of bottles of Casablanca watching the sun go down across the cinnamon rooftops accompanied by a selection of olives and nuts. And you really must try the food here! Tray after tray of the most delicious fare is brought out – a starter of warm flat breads and aubergine salad and then some delicious pastries filled with cheese spinach and meats before cous cous and steaming tagines are delivered. Then if you have enough room is the desert course. All served up by candlelight to the backdrop of distant drums and singing from the square – and if you get the timing right the evening prayers from the mosque right next to you – which is a magical experience. We ate here twice in our three nights in the city as it was that good!    Breakfasts are made for kings – again more courses than you will probably eat in a week; fruit salads yoghurt warm bread and moroccan crepes and you can have eggs any way you like too – we loved the cheese omelettes. They really know how to set you up for a day of exploring!    And about that exploring... Do get out and about! Antonio can book excursions for you through the many contacts he has - we went on the most amazing adventure to the picturesque Imlil in the Atlas Mountains with Hassan culminating with food in his house - a delicious tagine cous cous and salads made by his mother and we also experienced the tea ceremony (which I had the honor of performing under the instruction of Hassan!). They were so welcoming and I don't think they wanted us to leave! Antonio can also book trips for you to the sahara (star-gazing there will be amazing - we're saving that for the next time we go!) and make reservations for you in other recommended restaurants book cars etc.    We loved:  *The whole riad - so beautiful we wanted to stay forever! and you will too!  *The staff – so attentive and the service was outstanding – much better than at an exclusive resort.  * Milk and dates every night as a night cap and fresh water daily  *The free laundry service! Leave whatever needs washing in a basket in your room (aside from underwear) and it appears as if by magic fully laundered on your bed some hours later!  *The tortoise on the roof – he likes to roam about in the day!  *The view – from seeing the sun rise to seeing it set – from the roof terrace  *The packed lunch to go home – as we were flying with Easy Jet they even made us lunch to take on the plane too!  Why on earth would you want to stay in an all-inclusive hotel with its beige and branded decor when you can stay at Dar Anika and have a brilliant totally authentic experience here with staff who care so much about your hard-earned holiday? All in all a highly recommended riad – we can’t wait to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed a night in this beautiful Riad. They arranged a ride from the airport which I definitely recommend however the Riad is conveniently located and not difficult to find. The welcome was so friendly with many delicious snacks soup tea and juice while we filled out paperwork. Then we had time to relax in our beautiful room decorated with rose petals and stocked with more snacks.    We were then given a great detailed description of the city with a map and suggestions. You turn right out of the Riad and down the small road you walk into the main square. It is the perfect location still quiet and easy to find but also very close to the action.    We ate dinner at the Riad and it was delicious. I really cannot say enough nice things about this place. They even packed us a lunch to-go when our guide picked us up for the desert tour!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Dar Anika is a beautiful riad in an excellent location at the southern edge of the Medina – a ten-minute stroll from the inspired madness of Jemaa El Fnaa (the main square at the heart of the many winding lanes of the souks).    Upon arrival we were collected from the airport for a short drive to our accommodation. We were then ushered off the hectic streets through an imposing doorway into the peace tranquility and cool of Dar Anika. Having welcomed us with warm smiles and perfect English they sat us down and gave us some complimentary cold drinks snacks and a spiced soup my partner declared to be the best she’d ever eaten.    The friendly and knowledgeable manager Antonio then gave us a handy overview of Marrakech – the main sights how to get around how to deal with ‘false guides’ and such – and helped us quickly create a basic itinerary for our three-night stay.    (This included a day trip to the nearby Atlas mountains for a couple of hours hiking with a Berber guide then a trip to his house to enjoy a traditional meal made by his mother. Hassan and his family were brilliant and if you get the chance go for it – moderate fitness is all you need. Oh and a massive appetite. So. Much. Food.)    Back at the riad our basic room was small-ish but perfectly formed and was cleaned and tidied regularly. If you need clothes cleaned and pressed just pop them in the basket in the wardrobe and it all gets taken care of.    As we visited during a quiet time we were lucky enough to get an upgrade on the second day to a larger room on the first floor. However this room was actually a bit noisier with outside traffic and furniture being moved around upstairs – just to sound super ungrateful.    There’s a rooftop bar and restaurant that we only ate in on our final day (which may have been a mistake as it was excellent) plus a small spa where you can enjoy a hammam and a range of massages (which we absolutely did).    Okay it’s not the cheapest choice for a break in Marrakech. But it is a lovely convenient home from home staffed by warm friendly people who clearly take pride in looking after their guests. And I suspect if we were to visit again in the heat of the spring or summer we’d be even more grateful for this – to coin a cliché – blissful oasis in the heart of hustle and bustle of this ancient city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: michael c wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Title: Dar Anika defines hospitality and graciousness.
Review_Text: The universally excellent reviews in Trip Advisor seem almost understated after my superb experience. Beyond perfection on every level: location (proximate to the center of the old city); hospitality (from the moment you enter you are a valued addition to this unique community of warmth and congeniality); service beyond excellent (an example: immediately before pouring tea my cup was replaced with a warm cup). The food was uniformly superb the facilities were clean and modern the staff always available and uncompromisingly helpful. In sum it was a totally pleasurable stay. I cannot recommend Dar Anika highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Ehsan M wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: Great place to relax in and get away from the clouds and the rain in Europe very friendly staff definitely worth to visit again. Just few minutes walk away from the historical centre.  Thank you very much
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Karl T wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: I will not be able to express in words how high the level of hospitality was. The two brothers who own/manage the Riad are very friendly and make you feel like family. There staff are the friendliest I have ever experienced and the service that was offered to us was impeccable. The Riad itself is comparable to staying in a Morrocan palace. The room and amenities were top of the line. The cleaning never disturbed you the turn down service was over the top. There food is very good with little bites offered at anytime of day and the dinner specials changing daily. The meals on the roof top were a great way to start and end your day. The breakfast can claim top five of my life. Lot's of ingredients home made lot's of courses with out you asking and great coffee and eggs . They offered a very relaxed atmosphere and made it feel like we were the only two people their. I cannot say enough nice things about this Riad the grounds staff owners and service it was all very top notch. Thank you for making my stay in Marrakech one to remember.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nadine D wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Text: I have never posted a review on Tripadvisor before but the care that was taken of us during our stay in this wonderful place means I must. From the moment you walk into this beautiful place you are looked after. An oasis of calm in a wonderful location it truly is. Every member of staff treated us amazingly. Dinner on the rooftop terrace with a view of the rooftops of Marrakech was an unforgettable experience. We also received a talk from Abu that provided local information in a way no guidebook could. The knowledge that was shared really made our trip. Thank you again to the wonderful people that make Dar Anika the special place that it is.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Understated Luxury and Emphasis On Service.
Review_Text: This Riad has a lovely intimate feel. The quality of the rooms and the food was tremendous but the highlight was the standard of service from all the staff they were polite attentive and caring.  Taking care and looking after guests was the main priority of Dar Anika management team.  Will come back and bring my family and friend.

Review_Title: Outstanding Hospitality. A real hidden gem.
