Review_Text: This place is amazing! The comfortable beds beautiful rooms but what makes it really outstanding is the genuine welcome and continued hospitality of all the staff. Hidden away in The Medina this is a fantastic find. You can walk to all the sites when we wanted to get a taxi a member of staff came with us to negotiate the price. Breakfasts were lovely on the roof terrace the evening meal we had in the riad was the best meal we had all holiday. After the madness of the souk and markets it was just bliss to knock on that door and enter an oasis of smiles and welcomes. Nothing was too much trouble. They even made us a lunch pack for the wait at the airport.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lars Jørgen M wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: Want to get away for a few days in a small and intimate five star hotel? This is this place. Hammam massage top kitchen indiviuell arrangements for everything from mountain tours to restaurant visits. An exceptionally service-minded staff arranges this easily. We will certainly return.

Review_Date: Philip C wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika for four nights over New Year and from the first moment we arrived the staff at Dar Anika made us feel so welcome. Being ushered into an amazing open space inside the riad we were settled down with dates orange juice and little cakes while we got given a great guide as to what to do and see in Marrakech (including what to be wary of very useful for novice travellers!). The room was incredible very individual and oozing with Moroccan charm and again the staff were so kind and helpful - nothing was too much trouble!    Location-wise the riad is ideally located in the old town five minutes stroll to the main square and the souks and surrounded by great places to eat (the best of which are always tucked away but well known to the staff who were great in suggesting restaurants and booking tables). Breakfast in the riad was always outstanding - we'd definitely recommend having it up on the beautiful roof terrace (watch out for the tortoises!). On one of the days we went on a brilliant excursion organised by the riad staff to a Berber village up in the High Atlas via an elaborately served mint tea at Richard Branson's hotel.    Our entire experience at Dar Anika was fantastic and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend this gem of a riad to anyone wanting a taste of true Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for only one night (tear!) - my husband and sister so we had two rooms on the second level. The reviews set expectations for amazing service but actually experiencing it was another thing. Antonio and the team made an unbelievable visit for us. from the welcome to a packed lunch to take with us at check out the phrase "this is your home" couldn't be more true (although I have to make my own sandwiches at home). The riad itself is gorgeous- the traditional breakfast on the roof deck was an experience in itself- (with marrakech no short of them!) anything you need they can help with and expect to be well taken care of. Our gratitude to the team for the memories and helping make our trip one of he best!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Made the best out of what could have been awful
Review_Text: Within hours of arriving at Riad Dar Anika my wife fell on the stairs and broke her foot. While not ideal I am glad this happened at the Riad Dar Anika. The staff were helpful caring and kind. We were on the second floor and the bell staff helped carry my wife up & down the stairs. When a room became available on the first floor they moved us there.    Luckily the food here was very good since we ate almost of all our meals at the hotel.    We ended up returning back to the US after the third night. The manager of the Dar Anika called the other hotels where we had reservations to explain our situation to them and help us get our deposits back. Someone from the hotel dropped my wife's prescription off at the pharmacy and walked me there later to pick it up.    While we did not get to see much of Marrakech the staff here went above & beyond to make sure that my wife & I had what we needed and they were helpful at every turn.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Abdulaziz A wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: I've been traveling for 20 days with a friend (both males) and we book at Dar Anika 3 nights.    We enjoyed our stay every second we both Arabs and the Riad had a outstanding Oud player who was playing classic Arabic music for three hours everyday from 5pm till 8pm during that the staff were extremely available and they were making sure that we have what we want which they always do.    Marrakech was our third stop and we had some dirty cloths and the riad had a complimentary laundry services which help us a lot.    We haven't tried thier restaurant but the breakfast was great and variant the Moroccan bread is so teasty and flavourful.    Many thanks to this Riad which made our stay in Marrakech unforgettable and to the manager Antonio how greeted us and gave us an advise upon our arrival and to all the welcoming staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Raksha M wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Dar Anika in December 2015 - I am a well-traveled person and usually we stay at resorts so I was a little apprehensive when I booked our stay at this small boutique hotel. As we walked in through the doors we were greeted by the most friendly staff members. Our adult son was with us and they had probably made arrangements for a young child. Quickly they changed the arrangements for him. The service was impeccable. This Riad is located in the heart of the Medina about 10 minute walk from the square. This Riad is absolutely stunning. You can see they have put real effort in decorating this place. There are comfortable sitting areas for the guests. The manager Antonio and the owner Abu went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. Any time we were relaxing we would be treated to fresh juices nuts dates milk etc.... Breakfast was the best we had during our trip - it was served on their beautiful rooftop. Everything was made fresh - The lady sat on the terrace and made different things (some morrocan) on the pan. She was very passionate about how she made it and served it. My husband and I are both vegetarian so Abu and Antonio both took extra special care to find good restaurants for us that had good selection of vegetarian food. The square is about a 10 minute walk from Dar Anika and we felt safe walking from the square even after midnight... Be sure to have their Hamam bath - it is quite an experience - I asked them to book me a hair dresser to style my hair after the bath. Not only did they arrange for somebody but it was complimentary. Nothing was too much to ask for. They packed us some great fresh fruits and baked wares for our flight. Abu remembered I liked Pomegranate so they had packed couple of boxes of pomegranate seeds!!! Wow what personal touch!!! I am sure we will go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Masood A wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: We went for a three day stay just after Christmas. Everything was as good as it could be! From the moment we arrived to even after we left every single staff member went out of their way to make us feel welcome and cater to our every need. Our room was spacious (some of the others are cosy). The public areas are charming. The food is better than in most of the restaurants in the city so do plan to eat there during your visit. We'll definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I stayed in this oasis for one night and I could not speak highly enough of the experience. From the moment I walked in I was treated like royalty. The attention to detail and to the individual are outstanding. I highly recommend experiencing the Hamman and dinner there. Both were delicious. This is the kind of place where they think of everything and want you to get the most out of your stay. You want for nothing- I was even told that if there was fruit that I wanted from outside of the riad they would source it and clean it for me (complementary)- not that I could have fit anything else in after the plentiful meals. I even got a packed lunch for my long flight home. The only downside was that I was only there for one night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Mai L wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: It is not cheapbut is absolutely lovely:difficult to describe in a few words.Itis located in the old Medinabut is very easy to find because is near the souk and the main square:The decoration is stunningthe service outstandingand the breakfast(included) wonderfully varied so you can "refuel" for a hectic day:And what a relief to know after busy day of shopping or sight seeing you shall return to an oasis of luxury and peace.A must in Marrakesh

Review_Title: Dar Anika in unique, not like anything you have ever seen before
Review_Text: Dar Anika has elevated service and caring about their costumers to a whole new level. A degree of service you have never seen even if you are well-travelled and have stayed at a lot of luxury hotels! Located in the heart of the Medina one minute walk from your car drop-off there is the highlight of your trip to Morocco! You open the door at the end of this small dead-end ally and enter a new world! The building is simply gorgeous and to me the architecture was different that other riads with beautiful ceiling paintings etc. The covered courtyard area/ lobby is candle lit and has a special feel with a small pool and lots of seating for guests to relax and enjoy a drink or chill. You get a warm welcome from the assistant manager and the manager Antonio and a very helpful “Marrakech 101” lecture! Rooms are cozy and comfy. I asked for a room change and even-though I was there for the New Years Eve and the hotel was full they made it happen. Their staff moved everything for me and I didn’t even have to lift a finger ☺ Breakfast was the best I had during my trip and it is served on their beautiful rooftop. Everything was fresh and pancakes were made right there on the rooftop. Dar Anika is simply excellent and makes your stay special. I miss them already and I am sure I will go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The many previous positive reviews reflect our experience when we were lucky enough to spend our honeymoon at Riad Dar Anika in the summer. This really is a superb place to stay with a perfect balance of professional attentiveness by the staff when anything is needed and privacy when not.    The location is excellent the roof top terrace and atrium are wonderful spaces especially for breakfast (which certainly sets you up for the day!) and to unwind in the evening. We can also recommend the Hammam and using the pool.    From the initial welcome to the organisation of our departure (complete with a packed lunch for our journey back) and everything in between made our experience in Marrakech a pleasure.    We would really like to Thank Abu and the other staff members there who helped make it a fantastic few days it was all the little extras that made it special and sets this hotel apart from many others large and small that we have stayed in. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel and hope ourselves to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely setting, wonderful staff, in a great location
Review_Text: This beautiful Riad has everything from a soaring elegant courtyard with small swimming pool to a glorious rooftop terrace with multiple seating areas arranged for guest comfort. The rooms can be a bit dark (as is the case in this kind of structure) but are well appointed and decorated with comfortable bathrooms and seating areas.  The staff are extremely accommodating about everything including helping you find your way around the medina (and you're right in it).  The food was rather mediocre but lots of good meals are available in the medina so it shouldn't be a problem.  Access to WiFi though free was very spotty.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Adrian T wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: New Year in Marrakesh - Wonderfully Different
Review_Text: Having been in Marrakesh in July when it was over 40 degrees we decided to come back and enjoy a cooler Marrakesh at New Year. The party on New Year's Eve was great fun - belly dancer traditional Berber ladies with an amazing sound a very good "Morracan Ed Sheeran" and a woman who danced with a tray full of lit candles on her head ! Food wine and a great fun had by all. Next day it was a mixture of Hammam massage and manicure with some time around the Souks the. An evening of star gazing in the desert .... Amazing .. Really amazing. Best day it was into th Atlas Mountains for a days trek and lunch in the local Berber village - once again amazing and the people are genuinely pleased you are there and so very friendly.    The Riad staff get 11/10 all day long as do anyone they bring in to take you in the excursions or just the airport. Special thanks to the lady who makes the wonderful bread on the roof terrace every morning :) the Riad itself does need a refresh in places like the bathrooms but that's picky . You want for nothing except more time there.

Review_Title: Great hotel and very well located
Review_Text: My girlfriend and I have just spend a week at this Riad. Everything was perfect. The welcome when we arrived when the Director Antonio informed us about Marrakech and recommended us excursions restaurants etc. The service was wonderful during all our stay. The breakfast great and always with flexibility regarding the time we would like to take it. When we came back from our day out we where always received with a smile. We received a very personalized service and attentions and we even receive some sandwiches and fruits when we left our hotel so we could eat them in our flight back to Spain.  It is as well very good located in medina near the big square. With the advantage that taxis can drive you to the door (which it does not happen with most of the riads in Medina).  Highly recommendable riad and I without doubt will stay there in my next visit to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice stay in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: This is a typical Marrakech riad located in the medina very close to the suk and to all other activities of the center of the old town. The rooms are small but comfortable very quiet and clean and all the staff with no exception of the director of the hotel Antonio are very kind and supportive. The excellent breakfast with typical local food is an additional reason for choosing this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: mark d wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: Dar Anika is an oasis of calm in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: We travelled as a family of 4 over New Year 2016. There's a lot that's been covered in prior reviews; from the fast free wifi through the ultra-cleanliness and to the outstanding breakfasts. However it's the staff and management that really make this somewhere special to stay. Here's ONE example - we had a reservation at a restaurant that was in the middle of the souks - not easy to get to. When we asked for directions at the Riad Antonio instead spent 20 minutes walking us to it and making sure we learnt the way to get back as we went. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Fantastic riad in the heart of Marrakesh
Review_Text: We stayed at this wonderful riad for six nights over Christmas. The service was fantastic – the staff were very friendly and attentive and nothing was ever too much trouble; you feel very well looked after. The riad itself is well situated to explore the best of Marrakesh and is a lovely little oasis of calm and tranquility to return to after a frenetic day spent in the markets and noisy streets of the city. We enjoyed tea on the roof terrace every afternoon. The rooms are exceptionally clean and the décor stylish. We had dinner here on our first night and it was one of the best meals we had on this holiday. I would not hesitate to recommend Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chas B wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Title: Stunningly good hotel a short walk from Jemaa El Fna
Review_Text: This place is properly special. We arrived from the airport into another world. They sat us in the lounge poured us tea fed us biscuits and pampered us. Everywhere you look is marble and wood carved and inlaid with intricate and beautiful patterns. There are fresh flowers foliage cascading from above a lovely pool and songbirds. The beds had rose petals on them and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. We arranged massages and a camel ride all effortless. We were brought to and from the hotel by excellent drivers and the morning breakfasts were huge and delicious. Come with a big appetite - every meal here is a feast and the dinner is to die for - absolutely incredible. Please please if you want a bit of luxury near the old town this place scores ten out of ten.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: At the end of a small road 5 minutes walk from the main square - far enough to be away from the noise but near enough to wander into the souks. We were welcomed with a single rose goats milk & dates mint tea & biscuits and soup..what at welcome! Antonio kindly showed us a map of the town and where to go (and avoid!) - without any pressure to sell or gain anything for the hotel. The room was simply lovely - we booked the superior suite - and it certainly was. A huge dome over the 4-poster bed open log fire facing seating. The shower room was spacious with local bath product (note only shower gel soap and shampoo) - which smelt of chocolate!  Breakfast served 8-10am anywhere you wanted - we chose the roof terrace - set with table and chairs covered with white linen. Breakfast was fresh bread and crepes made in front of you honey jam yoghurt with fresh fruit (pomegranate / apple) freshly squeezed orange hot coffee cake...it goes on! We ate at the Riad on one night and were given a table in the courtyard and served amazing turkey tagine (well it was Christmas Day!). The dinner price was really reasonable and wine normal UK restaurant prices.  Jamil our server was simply wonderful. He could not do enough for us and was completely welcoming and always with a smile. He recommended places for us to visit and showed us on the map - understanding that not all tourists want to see the souks.  The morning we left - the Riad organised a taxi for us (22euros) - which was a private car not a taxi as we were expecting. Jamil had set up breakfast for us even though it was 6.30am! - and lit the fire in the courtyard as it was cold in the morning. All the staff came to say goodbye to us (and this was nothing to do with wanting a tip - it really was just to say goodbye). We were however a little confused when we were ready to left but were asked to stay...after 5 minutes we were handed fresh bread sandwiches and fruit..."for your journey home"...which was a beautiful parting thought.  Most afternoons we took advantage of the upper roof terrace (seating for 4) and had drinks - served with olives and nuts to looked out over to the main square and city walls.  Free wifi throughout the hotel - which always worked!  Totally charming and would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jaime M wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: Amidst all the hustle and bustle sight seeing haggling and the like this is the perfect serene Riad to retire to. Antonio Abu&Abu and countless others make the stay seem like you never left home!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Marianne J wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: My friends and I scheduled a trip to Morocco many months ago and then after the multiple incidents of terrorism around the globe had some hesitation about our trip to Marakech which was then days away. We needn't have worried. Our hotel took extra care in making us feel welcome and safe. The rooms and interior of the hotel were lovely and we had a marvellous tangine dinner upon arrival after the hotel's driver fetched us from the airport on the first night. The subsequent days we had a tour of the city and a road trip to see a local waterfall both which were arranged by the hotel. This was excessively helpful as it took the worry and effort away from us. In fact the hotel staff was great about helping us with anything we wanted- whether it be a camel ride dinner at a specific restaurant or suggestions for what to do next. Also the guides they arranged for us were very good. Our city guide showed us around and treated us like his own daughters he even helped us negotiate in the souk rather than just take a commission off our purchases. Our mountain guide was also very good and practically carried one of my less adventurous friends over the rocky terrain. We also had massages organised for us at the hotel which were also very good and the owner was so kind as to pack us a to go dinner for our flight since he knew we were on easy jet and therefore not likely to get anything onboard. All in all a great stay and would highly recommend this hotel. Some housekeeping items: it's about a 10 minute walk to the souk from the hotel well located and easy to find easy access by car (although no parking) which is useful for taxi drop off and the call for prayer in the morning is extremely loud so would suggest ear plugs if this will bother you - for us it was just part of the experience of being in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Excellent service and the food was amazing. I would recommend this hotel as it adds a lot of small friendly touches which will make you feel special. Very relaxing and enjoyable and all amenities are close by.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alison H wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika was the perfect place to stay. It offers the much needed serenity one needs after a day in Marrakesh. It is in a great location- it is close to the hustle and bustle of the city and yet when in the riad you feel like you are away from all of the noise and can really relax. The Staff could not be nicer. They truly made use feel at home. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left Riad Dar Anika we were treated like royalty. The friendly and polite staff could not help us enough; always smiling and always happy to assist. On our arrival we were taken to a comfortable reception room (with a log fire) given tea biscuits and even soup - that's what I call a good check-in! The room was lovely clean and well equipped and had nice touches like rose petals tastefully scattered on the bed and table tops. The bed itself was very comfortable and we slept well. Other nice touches were daily fresh fruit and bottled water (the cold tap water was treated and drinkable).  Overall the riad was wonderful; spotlessly clean and very relaxing. The rooftop terrace was very pleasant with its potted plants sun beds Berber tent tortoises strolling around and had a nice view of the Marrakech skyline.  We ate a tasty Morrocan breakfast on the terrace with bread baked by a lady on a hotplate (the bread not the lady). The afternoon tea and cakes were lovely as was the fresh fruit juice brought to our room daily. After checking out the other local restaurants we decided to have dinner at the riad and were so pleased we did and ate the next night too. Lamb wasn't on the menu and we asked if they had some available could we have it instead; and the manager said if they didn't then they would go out and get some - great service.  The manager Antonio was always available and he gave some great advice on Marrakech.    Thanks to all the staff for a lovely stay at the Riad Dar Anika!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A week's stay at Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: Good location very central to loads of venues and the hustle & bustle of the market. Window in the room has been insulated to isolate noise from outside. Enjoyed the Camel meat prepared in the Kitchen & the cosy lounge winding down after dinner. The staff were very helpful & friendly and happy to help at all times. The rooms were cleaned 2 or 3 times a day and kept warm and cosy. Complimentary pastries along with milk & dates were provided every night. We were even given a pack of sandwiches and fruit for the journey home!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Do not stay anywhere else until you have experienced this Riad
Review_Text: Wow! Wow! Wow!  I booked a trip to Marrakech as a surprise for my husband's 60th. Informed the Riad by e-mail prior to travel to keep it a surprise. Well - that was it! The staff and Anotonio the manager could not do enough for us. Our two daughters arrived a day later as a surprise and the plan was executed to the tee by the management - and what a surprise it was!    I was worried that my 2 young daughters in their early 20s may find the Riad a bit small and without excitment. How wrong was I. One of them stated that she did not want to come back home!    Antonio's detailed guidance on etiquette and things to do in Marrakech and the advice on the trips not only helped us save some money but also added to the whole amazing experience. Thank you!!    The staff were equally fantastic and nothing was too much trouble. We truly felt like Royalty!!    We ate at the Riad on one of our nights and it was truly special. The setting service ambience the shesha etcetc- we could not have asked for more. Even if you do not stay here please make sure you spend an evening at the Riad - it truly is an experience!    We visited the Atlas mountains and trekked up to see the waterfall. Hassan our guide was brilliant. The best part of that day was the meal that Hassan's mum and family had prepared and laid out for us in their house. We were truly humbled by the hospitality and warmth of the family. What made it even more special was that the kids from the family and practically the whole neighbourhood descended on us and we enjoyed true local Berber culture and food. Anotonio as usual had not missed any detail and had duly informed Hassan that it was my husband's birthday on that day. Well! A cake arrived after our 'lavish' lunch - baked in true Morrocan style oven. There was even a candle on it and the cake was decorated with twigs. They had even managed to put my husband's name on it!!! All in a completely rural setting! Thank you Hassan and family. My husband stated that that was the best birhday present he could ask for    The restaurants recommended by Antonio were brilliant.    Can't stop bragging about this Riad. Even if you cannot afford it please save up and go here!!    Thank You Dar Anika - the staff management and everyone else.    Superb!!. Our best holiday ever!!! All 4 of us are already missing you !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Zach W wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: The rest of the reviews pretty much sum it up - a fantastic place to stay within Marrakech.  Great location - a 5 minute walk to the main square in the old medina as well as the endless souks.  Huge platter was awaiting us when we arrived: milk dates soup cookies tea etc. Great hospitality.  Also - fastest WiFi of any of the places we stayed during the 13 nights in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Noma S wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika was our very favorite Riad during our 10 day trip to Morocco in July. We travelled with 3 kids; 2 teenagers and a 9 year old. From the moment we stepped into the Riad we were pampered and cared for. Our three children stayed in a very comfortable room with 3 beds and we stayed in an adjacent room. The kids enjoyed the hotel and pool so much that they didn't want to leave! My youngest daughter had melon one night and loved it. The waiter would go out each evening to bring fresh melon just for her! When my kids got tired of eating couscous and tanginess the staff prepared a special meal for them. On our first night the staff provided us with a detailed map and guide of the city with restaurant recommendations and shopping advice. Location was ideal in the heart of the city and very close to both the Medinah as well as the modern city! Absolutely breathtaking riad in a magical city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Clayton P wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: Brilliant Riad with lovely hosts. Highly recommended. Great rooms great attention to detail and brilliant food. The service and guidance made it a wonderful and safe 5 days. All day trips and guides were also excellent. Thank you to the owner and Antonio who made our stay exceptional.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I don't normally write reviews but this time it's truly worth doing so. My girlfriend and I staid at Dar Anika for 3 nights and everything was simply perfect. Location rooms and food were fantastic but what it is worth rewarding is the outstanding service given. The care and attention to details was simply overwhelming. Everybody really went the extra mile to ensure you get treated like a king. At this Riad nothing is left to the case everything it's perfectly organised and well taken care of before you wanted to ask for something you soon realise that they've already done it for you! If you are planning to stay in the beautiful Medina then this is the place to be. Hanmam and massage are also worth the shot. I will highly recommend Riad Dar Anika  they really deserve 10/10. Bravi!

Review_Date: Richard G wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We dropped by for lunch - a fantastic tajjn with prunes - moved tables and accidentally failed to pay for the pre-lunch drinks. We offered to pay by phone with a credit card but the proprietor refused and instead offered us a free drinks next time we were in Marrakesh! Leaves a very warm feeling

What a beautiful Riad! I would strongly suggest you stay here for an authentic Moroccan experience; much more wonderful than the sterile and Americanized Four Seasons which we also visited. Everyone at this Riad was so welcoming and so very helpful. The bedrooms were cozy and soundproof. The bathrooms very clean. The included breakfasts were delicious. We had dinner at Dar Anika one night and the food was excellent. All the recommendations of our hosts were excellent; the dinners what we must not miss in Marakeesh and a great lunch cafe. They booked us an authentic and wonderful hammam massage. The ONLY negative of our entire visit was that the tour guide that they helped us hire spoke English with such a thick accent he was hard to understand. Other than that ONE thing I'd say our experience with Dar Anika could not have been better. Oh! One I couldn't get my phone to find the Riad wifi and the front desk fixed my iphone for me...wow! GREAT PLACE.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I stayed with 4 girlfriends and we had a fantastic time in dar Anika. The staff goes out of their way to make you feel comfortable and provide with the most delicious food. We had dinner in the terrace one night which was fantastic because of the ambiance and the food.  The staff was so on top of the details that the morning we were leaving for a hiking trek they packed up lunch for us and gave it to our group as a present. Totally recommend staying in dar Anika!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: A completely wonderful stay from the moment we arrived until our departure. The accommodations were beautiful and peaceful everyone at the Riad could not have been nicer or more helpful. Breakfast on the terrace and our Hammam was a special treat. The tour suggestions and drivers were all fantastic. We couldn't imagine a better place to stay to really enjoy all Marracech has to offer. Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Lisbeth H wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: Very nice and cosy place to stay if you want to stay in the middle of the city. Inside the riad it is quiet clean and tidy. The whole staff was very nice helpful and did everything to make it a pleasant stay from the beginning to the last day.  Good food lovely cakes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Cara M wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: This riad was truly fantastic. The staff went above and beyond to ensure that our time in Marrakech was amazing. We were greeted with dates and tea when we arrived and they sent us off with homemade sandwiches when we left. Latif sat me down with a map when we first arrived and explained how to find everything we wanted to see plus some helpful tips on restaurants and other things to say. We had some absolutely incredible meals on the rooftop terrace and their beautiful courtyard and everyone was incredibly polite and friendly. Could not recommend enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Dar Anika during four warm & sunny days in November 2015. It is located at the south end of the Medina perfect for exploring old town by foot but a taxi stand is also close by. We loved our stay form the moment we stepped through the front door.We were welcomed with tea a local soup and tasty snacks. A map and helpful tips on how to get around were provided. Support with finding places or booking restaurants was available throughout. The beautiful roof terrace is an additional highlight. One can have breakfast or dinner on the roof but there is also space for lounging and relaxing any time of the day up there. The food is wonderful we can recommend to have at least one dinner at the Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mandy W wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: The staff are very helpful and accommodating. I would recommend this hotel to travelers going to Marrackech. We hope to return to Marrackech in the future and will definitely be staying at this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anthony C wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Do not miss out on staying here!!
Review_Text: My daughter and I booked this hotel last minute and hoped it would be ok. Well a more perfect place to stay in Marrakech you would be hard pushed to find. Everything from the initial emails back and forth to the greeting we received from the Owner General Manager and the staff made us feel like kings. Nothing was too much trouble. Our every wish/need/want was catered for and the staff here are a credit to the obvious philosophy the owner.  We look forward to our next visit very much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The Dar Anika is just perfect. It's a beautiful Riad in a great location. Once you're through the door it's so quiet and peaceful. The service is fantastic and the breakfast is lovely. We loved the rooftop terrace with tables and tents. We would definitely come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Deshan S wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: You receive a generous welcome and the staff go above and beyond to make you feel at home. The building is beautiful and the amenities are great. A five minute walk from the main Souk and close to the other palaces. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Dar Anika gave real feel of marrakesh all the staff were attentive and Mr Abu went out of his way to make sure we were well looked after the complimentary 3 course dinner which was served to as on rooftop was amazing I could not have asked for more
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Positive: very nice place ambiance attentive staff great breakfast organized extras in a quick manner clean good location    Negative: sometimes a bit over the top regarding suggestions to visit sights somewhat noisy during the first night due to guests in the patio
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Dar Anika is an outstanding oasis in bustling Marrakesh. From the moment you arrive you are treated as someone very special: seated in a lovely lounge with fresh dates and milk then mint tea and biscuits then a lovely homemade Moroccan soup then rosewater on your hands and a cool towel for your neck. Wow. What attention to detail and beauty. Our room was decorated artfully with rose petals- tasteful Moroccan style furnishings. Book the hammam experience. A delightful bathing ritual where my husband and I in bathing suits were scrubbed and bufffed. Breakfast on the rooftop is another delight. We had the pleasure of meeting both Antonio(the manager) and Abu ( the proprietor) who were the most charming hospitality professionals we have ever encountered. We travel all over the world and this was our favourite boutique hotel ever.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Darren M wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: The food decor and service was excellent. The owner Mr Abbu helped us plan our days. Everything was within walking distance of the Riad. The breakfast was a feast and we also had dinner (huge) there also. Airport pick-up and drop-off was excellent. Will return again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mette H wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: My mom and I got picked up in the airport and were transported to this centralplaced riad in Marrakech.  We arrived early in the day and were welcomed by the manager who was always present and helpful and the extremely friendly staff who served us a great breakfast without us asking for it!  After that the manager gave us a little talk about what to see what to do and how to behave in the city.  Our room was cosy clean and always made tidy after a long day in the medina.  The rooftopbar made a nice getaway from the noisy streets and there were plenty of opportunities for ending a good spot for relaxing etc. The food was perfect as well the breakfast overwhelming and authentic and the evening dinners delicious (they even made us a special dish as we asked for!) Altogether a fantastic stay in Marrakech especially because of the lovely staff at Riad dar Anika thanks again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Neil H wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: This riad is perfectly placed to explore the old city just south of the main square. It is the archetypal riad an unprepossessing exterior hiding a beautifully tranquil interior with a lovely terrace above the hustle & bustle of the streets below.    However what really sets this riad apart is the fantastic service given by the owners and staff. They really couldn't do enough to help us enjoy our stay in Marrakech - restaurant recommendations were always spot-on invaluable advice on how to avoid the tourist pitfalls (especially on what to pay and where to go) and a willingness to source whatever we needed from fruit to day trips just to make our stay more pleasant. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Outstanding stay - would come back again without a second thought. A true diamond of a hotel
Review_Text: Ok so what really sets this riad apart from others is the faultless service. The kindess of the owners and the nothing is too much trouble attitude. I always say a few things are important when in Africa:    Room and hotel Hygiene - exceptional I think my room was cleaned at least three times daily. The hotel and rooms themselves are large well equipped and comfortable.    Hotel services and facilities are excellent. As I say nothing is to much trouble and the owners and staff make sure you enjoy your stay. I had the hammam there and it was excellent.    Food quality - Abu (the owner said set aside an hour or more for breakfast) he wasn't kidding the food was gorgeous and abundant. My only regret about this trip was not having dinner at the hotel every evening it smelt and looked amazing and if breakfast was anything to go by it would have been stunning    Hotel location: 5 minutes from all the sights and the main square plus in a very safe area and no alleyways to wander down. In fact it was impossible to get lost and easy to find. One thing we have discovered is spending a busy day in the medina requires a quiet retreat that you can pop back to when you need a moment.    Knowledge: Local knowledge and advice was spot on and as a result Abu ensured we had as much fun as we expected.    My husband is used to staying at the Jumeriah hotels and this was more than equal to that standard if not better. He is a picky traveller and I was worried he wouldn't have a great time Abu and Abu (the owners) made sure he did. Our daily chats with them made our stay all the more special. Just as a final note when I say nothing is too much trouble it really isn't They sourced cactus fruit for me because I wanted to try it My Mum had asked for nuts from morocco she loves them they got that too and also gave me enough argan oil to last me till my next trip. I cannot find anything to fault them on it truly was an outstanding experience.    Marrakech is a fabulous city and a stay at Dar Anika just adds to that making for a truly relaxing and perfect stay.    We loved it so much we will be back again next year. Thanks to the team at Dar Anika for making our trip unforgettable
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our stay was fabulous. it's hard to find words for the more than pleasant stay my wife and I had with the people of this nice Riad.  The location was perfect and the beds and pillows of high quality.  Value for money!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff at the Riad went out of their way to make the stay of my husband and I and my mother perfect in every way. The two brothers both called Abu who own the Riad were excellent. My husband lost a screw out of his glasses and Abu senior sourced him a pair of cheap reading glasses . We were given advice on the best restaurants to visit and a lovely day out with driver was organised for us. We ate in a couple of nights- the food was good and Abu even gave us a picnic to take to the airport for the journey home    My mother is elderly and generally manages stairs well. However the Riad had very steep winding stairs ( the sort that are wide on outside and narrow on inside) which were dimly lit with no handrail. Really they were totally unsuitable for an elderly person. It isn't the fault of the Riad - but if it had been made clearer I would not have taken my mother there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: What a gem! This was my third time to Marrakesh (second with my husband) and Abu & Abu offered a unique perspective at a point when I thought I'd already seen the best it had to offer. They sat with us the morning we arrived and helped to plan an itinerary pointing out the best shops cafes and restaurants that we hadn't sniffed out ourselves. The staff were unbelievably attentive and anticipated what we might want before we even knew ourselves (often an addictive mint lime granita style iced drink!). The breakfasts up on the sunny roof terrace were epic to say the least with the local breads cooked up on a stove in front of us every morning. The Riad location was perfect just inside the old city 10 mins walk to the main square but also a matter of meters to a spot where a car could easily access and whisk you off to a day trip to the mountains - convenience not to be underestimated. We also enjoyed a lovely hamman the day we left with a wonderful therapist one of the most smily and warm I've encountered. All in all cannot recommend enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Erica S wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: I do not normally write reviews of hotels but I have to make an exception for Riad Dar Anika because it was truly exceptional. My husband and I spent 3 nights there and we could not possibly have been happier. The room was lovely (the rose petals strewn on the bed when we arrived very late at night and the cookies waiting for us were charming touches). The restaurant on the rooftop terrace was wonderful. All that and the Riad is in the heart of the city close to every place we wanted to visit -- easy walking distance to all the sites within the Medina.    And the service was outstanding. We had complicated travel arrangements because our flights were rescheduled several times and finally arrived very late -- well past midnight. But through it all with each change of arrival time Abu the owner of the Riad assured us that we would be met at the airport (and we were) and assuaged any worries we had. Despite our very late arrival at the Riad (after 3 in the morning) there was staff on hand to show us to our room.    During our entire visit Abu went out of his way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible helping us to plan our touring recommending restaurants advising us on how to haggle with the vendors in the souks and even providing us with a bag lunch on the day we left to take the train to Casablanca). We really felt that Abu (and all the staff) cared about us as guests.    The only downside to this visit is that we are now totally spoiled. I can't imagine any hotel being better than Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Amazing stay amazing staff amazingly looked after amazing everything. So impressed never been treated like such royalty! From the airport pick up to the welcome at the hotel to the pampering like the spa treatments and the hammam (oh definitely recommend trying the hammam its definitely an experience!) and the excursions organised by the hotel to the valley and the atlas mountains we definitely got a stay to remember. Will 100% be coming back next time I'm in Marrakesh :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Dar Anika is a tranquil oasis in the madness of the Median in Marrakech. Abu and Abu are the brothers who between them - and their staff - make you feel completely at home from the minute you enter through the door. We were lucky enough to spend a whole week here 10-17th October and I can honestly say it was like staying in someone's home along with members of the family who simply couldn't do enough for you! Restaurants were booked for us minutes before a taxi was arranged to whisk us off and pick us up at any pre-arranged time. The Restaurant was specifically recommended by Abu (senior) as he made it his priority to make sure no-one had their holiday spoilt by an upset tummy. Each day after wandering through the warren of souks and back streets we were welcomed back with a large jug of cold water mint and lime ice drinks and a delicious cake of our choice (all complimentary). I could go on and on but most of what I'd put has been said umpteen times over and every word is true. They have wonderful staff even the cleaners are dressed immaculately and give you a huge beaming smile each time you cross paths. I think Abu and Abu have the most incredible sense of what people from all backgrounds expect when they arrive in Marrakech and do everything in their power to make sure you leave with every intention of returning someday......
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Vincent S wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: Amazing personal , hospitality and service. Rooms are very nice and clean. Food is excellent
Review_Text: I feel obligated to review this hotel as it was the best service I have ever experienced in my extensive international travels. The staff treats you like a friend and VIP at the same time. As a pilot I had stayed at anywhere from tent camps in Botswana to 5 star hotels In Paris. Staying at the Riad Adar Ankir made the trip a relaxing enjoyable experience for my flight crew. All of the details made tthis a valuable hotel; great food filtered water fruit and most important the owners/brothers and all of the staff are great trustworthy and respectable people. if you want to visit a Marakesh this is th place to staytour eat shop and experience the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Just what the doctor ordered. First class hospitality
Review_Text: My wife and I spent 3 nights there earlier this week. From the moment we arrived we knew we were in a place where they really cared about you as a guest. The hospitality was phenommenal. Comparable to the 6 star service you can receive in the great Asian hotels of the world. Always the answer was Yes. More than this they gave you the space we needed to relax and then helped us plan the right adventures. Helping us relax next to the rose gardens of Beldi Country Club followed by Sunday lunch was genius.

Review_Date: Steve B wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: This riad is simply outstanding. 5 star service was truly amazing. Abu the owner can provide anything you require! The service in this riad is also brilliant. The staff are so attentive it's literally unbelievable. We loved eating on the roof terrace and the food was also awesome. I can't fault this place. Don't look elsewhere! Serious!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David W wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: I was at a golf tournament in Marrakesh with my wife.Everything was just perfect.Of course is not the cheaper option to stay in Marrakesh but you get what you pay for and more.  I would mention above anything else the charming attitude of the staff.  The place is decorated with taste with all the modcons the location is also very convenient since is very peaceful and yet you are in the heart of the city.  Absolutely worth a second visit.We have already booked for next year!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I cannot recommend this Riad highly enough! My boyfriend and I travel a lot and staying here has been a real highlight for us. The Riad itself is beautiful very well kept clean and feels like a serene oasis to escape to if you need a bit of a break from Marrakech. The rooms are a good size quiet and very comfortable.    Abu and the whole team could not be more welcoming and will go out of their way to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. Breakfast on the beautiful roof terrace is the perfect way to start your day and you are in the perfect location to explore the medina and all the main sights.    We will definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David H wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: If you want 5 star service in a amazing hotel you need look no further. Ask Abu and he can get you whatever you need :). The restaurant upstairs is also very nice and very authentic Moroccan. I would highly recommend to anyone visiting to stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dave M wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: Room was small but had everything I needed. To a Western it could odd (no TV no mini-bar etc.) and the frontage does not even look like a hotel. However do not be put off this is a typical high-class Moroccan hotel. Have breakfast or dinner on the sun terrace or like me just sit around the open-air atrium. The staff cannot do enough for you and are extremely friendly. The hotel is in Madina (the old town) so outside is busy and full of people cars animals shops etc. but that just added to its charm
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Best Riad we stayed at in Morocco!
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I were greeted with a rose and sat down for some milk and dates. Latika (not sure if I spelt that right) was absolutely wonderful. He was incredibly attentive and genuinely cared about our stay. He went through a map of Marrakech and gave us great recommendations on restaurants and sights to see. He had a form with the dates we were staying ready to plan our whole Marrakech trip. Make sure you give your self plenty of time for breakfast. Its in the rooftop with a chef cooking pancakes right infront of you! Our stay was absolutely wonderful and could not have asked for anything more!! I regret not having dinner and the hammam there too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joanna B wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: Almost afraid to share this gem....
Review_Text: My friend and I had an absolutely amazing time at Dar Anika. I would highly recommend it. Abu gave flawless restaurant recommendations and great general advice so that we were able to get the most out of our stay. The staff was incredibly friendly and the service is impeccable. I still think about the complimentary amazing breakfasts every morning on the roof more than six months later! Room was comfortable and the homemade soaps and shampoo were awesome. Fast and constant internet connection. Beds are firm. I typically do not like to revisit destinations but cannot wait to go back to Morocco and will be sure to stay at Dar Anika when I do.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Filipe S wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: The "worst" thing I can say about the experience we had in Dar Anika is that you simply feel at home... Away from home.  The level of the services provided is absolutly amazing truly five stars quality service and most of all the kindness of the staff and the owners Mr. Abu & Abu that made everything to make our stay unforgetable. Always with great sugestions and all the support you need when you arrive in a totally diferent country beeing available for you 24/24h a day.  The Riad and the rooms are excelent and very confortable breakfast is fantastic as well as all the food. We had lunch and dinner there and it was great served in magical atmosphere on the rooftop. The location of the Riad couldn't be better five minutes away from Jemaa El Fna square and of most interesting sites of Marrakech.  If you want to have a real experience of Marrakech and the Medina served in pure luxury and well beeing Dar Anika is the place to stay!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from four blissful nights at Riad Dar Anika and have been raving about the property ever since. We could not have felt more welcome and the attention to detail along with service levels were supremely special. Abu & Abu and their team were all so very friendly and attentive the food delicious and the Hammam and massage extraordinary. Thank you for a fantastic stay!

Great location - straight road to Jemma Al Fnaa - you cannot get lost!!!  Great filling breakfast and dinner with treats served regularly - great wine too served on the peaceful rooftop terrace. Very elegantly decorated.  Lovely attentive staff - as a sole traveller didn't feel alone once great ability to anticipate one's needs i.e. a nice cold beer with crudites nuts and olives after a morning trip. Really appreciated the packed lunch presented by Abu on my departure. Although I booked the smallest room and it was a bit 'cosy' the rose petalled welcome more than made up for the lack of space and I wasn't visiting to spend time in my room. All in all a lovely 3-day experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Julia B wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: incredible attention to detail, comfort, service
Review_Text: I can't say enough about Dar Anika. There's no need you could have that they can't solve. The food the pool the rose petals the advice... all with an authentic local feel. It would be a waste to stay in a big luxury hotel if you could possibly stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: At first I thought they had mistaken me for some celebrity until I realised that they treated all the guests with such respect and generosity. Genuinely this place made our stay in Marrakech as wonderful as it could possible be. From the moment we were chauffeured from the airport (by the same friendly chap that took us back) to the 4:45am cooked breakfast we were given before catching our early flight it was magical. The riad is traditional and full of Morrocan flavour and our room was gorgeous. There seems to be only a fair mark up on the excellent services like the hammam spa experience and I'd definitely recommend a guide to take you through the city's monuments.  All of the staff are so friendly and nothing is too much trouble. We were even given a complimentary little packed lunch to eat on the plane!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Diana B wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: An exceptional place to experience Marrakech both for location, attention to detail and friendliness of welcome
Review_Text: The staff and management are so friendly. They gave us a really carefree holiday. We had a extremely warm welcome. Our room was lovely strewn with rose petals!. Tours were discussed and arranged. We had friendly and informative guides. When we ventured out alone we were given a mobile so we could call in if we were lost or in trouble so they could send immediate help. Don't bother to take too many clothes there is a free laundry service. The superb staff are always on hand with help and advice and jugs of iced water and there are cakes and fruit for you to help yourselves. You can lounge around or take meals on the rooftop garden terrace or get good recommendations of places to go if you feel more adventurous. You are made to feel totally at home here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rose F wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: The best place to stay in central Marrakech. Located right in the medina 10-15 minutes walk to the Jamaa el Fna and just across the road from El Badi Palace. The staff were wonderful they treated us like royalty. We were given a full 3 course lunch before we'd even checked in!  There were lots of restaurants nearby but the food in the hotel was incredible as well we sat alone in the lounge area eating by candle light it was so romantic.  We also spent a long time relaxing on the roof-top terrace watching the world go by and being waited on hand and foot!  The hotel also offered an indoor pool and massage facilities but we didn't have time to try them out. Maybe next time!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Phil W wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: From the moment we entered the Riad to the moment we left the care attention service and advice from all of the staff was incredible.    Abu the owner met us as soon as we arrived and offered a comprehensive overview of 'must dos' relevant to us.    The room was beautifully decorated and presented and there were rose petals scattered throughout a lovely touch.    The breakfast deserves a special mention its size and quality will keep you full to dinner time!    Great value and highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard N wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: Best Marrakech Hotel for Local Flavor
Review_Text: This hotel has excellent service a superb staff and good food. The hotel is located right at the entrance to the market area and gives one a sense of the real Marrakech. Food service is available at ALL hours; transportation can be arranged and is very efficient; and the concierge services are quite competent. There is a lovely five star luxury hotel in Marrakech but if one wishes to see the real city and the real people this hotel is an overall better experience. My wife and I recommend it highly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ivor f wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here with other family members the weekend 11-13 Sept..2015  Located in the old bustling part of Marakesh the Dar Anika is an amazing boutique hotel a peaceful oasis with real Morrocan charm and character.  From the moment we arrived the service was first class and nothing was too much for the excellent staff. We have stayed in many 5 star hotels world wide and the Dar Anika matched or surpassed all of them for personal service.  The air conditioned rooms are tastefully decorated the beds comfortable and bathrooms had plenty of hot water.  All the food served on the terrace was also first class.  All in all a thoroughly delightful experience.  Ivor FarrantCleethorpes England
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jordan A wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: Your first time into a country can often unfairly dictate whether or not you ever decide to return again. In that sense Dar Anika can safely say it's left me with a glowing impression of a city and a country that I will be sure to visit again.    Situated in a prime location in the old town of Marrakech you find yourself in the epicenter of the busting city streets and yet the Riad is an oasis of tranquility and luxury. Welcomed with refreshments upon our arrival the manager - Abu - duly took the time to introduce us to Marrakech taking a full 20 minutes to brief us on what to do and where to go on our stay. The map he gave us was invaluable we used it the entire trip. You can expect this throughout your stay: the staff are always friendly welcoming and accommodating food is aplenty and the room is cleaned multiple times a day helping you relax in between the aforementioned hectic strolls through the souks and in the heat.    I cannot recommend this Riad enough thank you to all the staff for a wonderful trip and I look forward to returning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ross H wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: My wife and I absolutely fell in love with this place after a 5 night stay. The staff there could not have done more to make our trip to Marrakech perfect. The concierge had contacted us via e-mail to make sure everything was arranged before we arrived; airport transfer hammam dinner guide - check.  The rooms are simple decorated tastefully and give an authentic feel. However the whole ethos of the place is to get you out of the rooms and exploring the city or enjoying mint tea on the balcony or a bottle of wine on the terrace. On our first morning (after a superb hammam) the owner sat down with us to walk us through our itinerary he gave us some wonderful recommendations but most importantly made us street wise with some tips and tricks. He was genuinely concerned that we made the most of our time and the rest of the staff there really follow his lead.  The breakfast each morning is nothing short of a feast with any left overs going to the very tame resident birds and tortoises. I'm pretty sure they will serve you breakfast whenever you wake up be it morning or afternoon. After that you are set to explore the city all of which is right on the doorstep a turn left and you are in the souks or a 5 min walk to the right to visit the palaces.  I cannot stress enough how well we were looked after by all during our stay it really does set the bar for service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: julie d wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: We have stayed in some beautiful hotels but none to match the hospitality of this tranquil oasis in the bedlam of marakesh . From arival you feel safe and relaxed. Absolutely nothing is too much trouble food is authentic and great but they will cook any thing if ordered. Cooking class for husband and massage for wife was our thing and it was lovely ...served the food on the evening ....camel mmm that's different .. The breakfast is an array of breads and cakes cooked in front of you we filled up for the day then returned for afternoon tea at 4 all complimentary  if you want tranquil setting but in the midst of it all...this is it....clean authenticprofessional. I would recommend as small friendly safe ....but that's only half of it... and every single member of staff was lovely they set a new bar for standards
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We have just returned from a 4 night stay and in all travels have never experienced such thoughtful and helpful service. We could not praise the whole experience highly enough. The walking tour recommended by the Riad was excellent as well as the trip to the Atlas Mountains. The rooftop breakfast was a highlight as well as indulging us with our request to visit the kitchen where we were taught how to make bread Marrakech style as well as making our own camel dinner!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The spacious courtyard with inviting pool is the heart of this place. Staff are very welcoming and helpful. Rooms are spacious and well equipped. There was a little bit of road noise - but mainly horse traffic that was not too intrusive. We dined in the riad on a number of nights as the food was good and service excellent. WiFi was variable but there is an alternative network in the reception area that seemed reliable. The main square was some distance away but walkable or a taxi can be arranged. A very pleasant oasis in a busy city.

Review_Date: Charles A wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Title: Best Riad we have found so far
Review_Text: This is our fourth visit to Morroco in the last year and my wife and I enjoy staying in Riads rather than hotels as they have a more authentic feel and tend to give better and friendlier service.    Riad Dar Anika is without doubt the best of the eight or so we have tried so far.    The service is simply superb from the first moment with a host of courtesy details too numerous to detail. Milk and dates (a Berber welcoming custom) and Morrocan mint tea served while your bags are taken to your room is just the first example.    It is a short and fascinating walk (600m) to the famous square yet only a few yards from the road crossing the Medina so a taxi can drop you at the door where a bellboy will take charge of your bags. A public car park is only 100m away if you have your own transport.    We were in a Deluxe Riad Double Room on the first floor overlooking the street and it was perfect. We had a refreshing swim in the pool followed by a warm shower to recover from our long and hot journey.    We had breakfast upstairs in the lovely rooftop garden and that was delicious and very complete. We spent just the one night there but we would have loved to stay longer    If you are planning to visit Marrakech try to spend at least one night at Riad Dar Anika. You won't regret it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing Service delivered with warmth from all
Review_Text: A beautiful Riad right in the heart of Marrakech. The service was fantastic always wanting to please and make sure our stay was fabulous which it was. All the staff were always attentive and helpful. The food was lovely and the Riad very clean. Thank you you all made our stay special

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad, Great Location and Excellent Service
Review_Text: When our flight was delayed by several hours due to a storm which meant we didn't arrive in Marrakech until past midnight we were amazed that not only was our transport from the airport to the Riad still waiting for us with a smile on his face but the staff had stayed up until the early hours to ensure we could enjoy the dinner we had also already booked.    This really set a high bar for the kind of service we would receive for the rest of our stay and they never once let us down.    Mr. Abu is amazing. Visiting the main square and the souks can be a taunting task but Mr. Abu was able to provide us with a guide for the day but he had also circled on a map of the local area the places to go and the places to avoid.    We only had three days in Marrakech so our first morning at the Riad Mr. Abu talked to us about what we were hoping to accomplish from our stay and he put together a comprehensive itinerary which allowed us to enjoy the local attractions and activities we had been hoping to do and we were given a driver for two days to help us get around.    The staff were also very attentive and go above and beyond in making sure you are comfortable and are enjoying your stay. One evening after I had gotten ill from eating within the square - something Mr. Abu had warned me not to do - the staff put together a wonderful light dinner for me to enjoy and were all very helpful and I felt they were genuinely concerned about my well-being shown by the fact they provided me a complimentary dinner and a packed lunch to help me get better.    As for the Riad itself it was a wonderful escape from the busy and hectic streets just outside. This Riad is in the thick of it and you may think before entering that the area maybe too noisy to be able to relax however this just wasn't the case. The moment you walk through the doors you enter a calm and palatial area that is the perfect place to unwind after a busy day of shopping and the rooms are quiet and allow you to get a great nights sleep so you are ready to face another day of activities.    So to sum up loved staying here the staff were just amazing the location is perfect for those who want to be in the thick of it and the Riad is a wonderful place to stay.    Thank you to Mr. Abu and the Team for all your efforts and I couldn't have asked for more.    P.S. The breakfast is fantastic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Luiz N wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: The best service level I have ever experienced in any hotel.  The rooms are very comfortable and the cleaning service outstanding.  Special remark to the breakfast at the solarium an excellent way to begin your day.  The kindly manners of all the Dar Anika team and the "Oasis Atmosphere" inside the hotel are unforgettable
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An absolutely first-rate experience. Staff, amenities and accommodation are beyond exceptional.
Review_Text: We chose to come to Marrakech for my girlfriend's 30th birthday and wanted a place that would give us an authentic experience without compromising the comforts of a good hotel. Not only did Riad Dar Anika deliver they completely blew away our expectations. We spent four nights here during our adventure and are literally broken up over having to leave. In such a short amount of time Mr. Abu's staff make you feel like family a sense that is accentuated by the immaculate and intimate setting and supremely generous amenities (including complimentary drinks laundry and breakfast).    Upon our arrival we were met by Zineb and Fatimah who showed us to the solar where we were served a delicious spread of local fare. Mr. Abu (the riad's proprietor along with his brother also named Abu) then spent an hour (AN HOUR!) with us pouring over a map of the city outlining the neighborhoods highlighting must-see historical sites good shopping in the medina and the best restaurants and lounges in the new city. Most importantly he gave us a thorough run-down of do's and don'ts and helped us save time and dirham (Moroccan dollars) during our excursions. I've not experienced this level of personal attention and service in all of my travels.    Our rooms were immaculate traditionally decorated and immensely comfortable. Though not overly large they have all of the conventional modern necessities. On our second day Mr. Abu upgraded us at no cost simply because he had what he considered to be a better room available. While we were happy with both we were shocked and pleased at such unbridled generosity.    There is so much to see and do in Marrakech but at the end of each day we were always happy to come back to Dar Anika to get a respite from the bustle of the streets. We would always find fresh milk and dates laid out in our room with the bed and linens freshly changed and turned down. We relaxed in the central courtyard complete with a plunge pool and reading room ideal for escaping the Marrakchi heat or unwinding before bed. The rooftop restaurant and garden serves exceptional Moroccan dinners (try the tanjia or any of the tagines - they are perfect) and breakfast with a French twist. They have beautiful flora and climbing roses adorning this outdoor space where you can watch the city on all sides or rest in the shade of a Berber tent. Perhaps best of all a family of desert tortoises live on the roof and ramble about charmingly munching on foliage while you drink your coffee and watch them.    At all times and for no charge you can have freshly-baked cakes and pastries (made in-house by the kitchen staff daily) Moroccan tea or coffee a glass of excellent Moroccan wine - seriously good stuff try anything from Volubilia vineyards from near Meknes - or a tray of local olives and peanuts prior to dinner. The staff will handle anything you need and contracts with excellent local livery to provide transportation. They professionally handled managing excursions exchanging our US dollars (at a decent rate no less) and coordinating reservations. They are always present but never overbearing and seem to have a great emotional intelligence about them. Nearly all are fluent or competent in English French and Arabic making us feel right at home even 3600 miles from Manhattan. Finally the location of the Dar Anika only a half-kilometer from the legendary Jemma al-Fna square and even closer to Bahia Palace and the Saadien Tombs is perfect for really getting to know Marrakech. We were never more than 15 minutes walk from the major attractions within the walls of the medina and only a short taxi-ride from the party in the New City.    I cannot come up with a single negative thing to say about this place. We have been to La Mamounia and explored a few other properties in the city and it is BY FAR the most successful at marrying authenticity and modern luxury in the heart of the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It's not often that you stay in an oasis of calm and beauty like Dar Anika. I could go on and on about the incredibly high level of service but I will just share one example which demonstrates Abu and team's level of commitment to guest service. Our 7 year old son came down with a very bad stomach bug after 9 pm one night. When we told Abu and asked for the nearest pharmacy he didn't just give us directions but instead drove my husband via his motorbike to the one pharmacy open some ways from the center of town. He even offered to lend Joe local currency in the event Joe didn't have it on him. I've stayed in many many hotels around the world and have never experienced the level of care for our family. That experience plus the very detailed review of our needs and itinerary along with very helpful tips for navigating the city a beautiful facility etc etc are the reasons why I can wholeheartedly recommend Dar Anika to all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Christie F wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: Our flight was delayed by 5 hours so we arrived late to the riad. This did not seem a problem at all to the riad and we were warmly welcomed by one of the owners Abu. The riad is an absolute sanctuary and we loved our stay. The staff were so polite and kind and even surprised us with a packed lunch to take on our journey the next morning to essaouira. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough and only wish we had been able to enjoy our stay there for longer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We said goodbye to Riad Dar Anika last Saturday after spending a week there. We were very sorry to leave. It felt like we were saying farewell to family. Riad Dar Anika has left a very special impression of Marrakesh within us and one we will not be forgetting anytime soon.  From getting picked up from the airport by the Riads's driver Abdelatif we had other than 5* first class service and from then on it only got better As we stepped through the doors from the chaotic buzz of the streets of the Medina into a magical little palace where we were treated like the King and Queen of Riad Dar Anika.  On our first morning we had a warm welcoming meeting where we put together our holiday itinerary of what we wanted from our stay. We dined at some of the best restaurants chilled at trendy local bars and other days escaped to the country. A real mix of Marrakech thanks to Riad Dar Anika. Our best times were spent in the Riad. We swam soaked up the sun and had a hammam and massage. The food in the Riad was exploding with flavour - Recommend the Lamb Tagine and agree with the other reviewers - it really was the best Tagine in Marrakech!!  You will want for nothing at this magnificent Riad iced water as you step through the door light refreshments shortly followed with some fruit. You will not go hungry here that’s for sure  and if you don’t like what is being served they will simply change it to your own personal liking. Forgot something? Just ask – they will go that second and bring back that hairbrush you stuipidly left back home  Also the Riad is fully equipped – travel plug adaptors/ book lights toiletries – they have it all.  To the marvelous maids who tidied our room twice a day!!! The kind and friendly young men who served us day to day where nothing seemed like too much trouble. To Latif and Fadwa for always welcoming us home with a gorgeous smile and to Mr Abu for ensuring our weeks stay was one not to forget in a hurry for your time and concern we thank each and every one of you for giving us the best holiday experience we have ever had. We look forward to visiting again sometime soon we hope 

We are going to agree with all previous reviews!    The hospitality at this riad is unsurpassed. The owners managers and staff cannot do enough for you to make you comfortable.    Our visit began with welcome treats as described by others (absolutely delicious) and then an introduction to Marrakesh provided by Abu and Abu. They were so kind to provide information recommendations and advice. It was extremely professional and helpful without being intrusive. They made recommendations for attractions and restaurants to visit. They were all great and worthwhile.    The hotel was extremely comfortable - especially the pool on days when the mercury hit 52. When we returned to the riad there were always refreshing beverages brought to us poolside.    We ate dinner at Dar Anika on our first night. It was absolutely delicious. The breakfasts each day were fabulous. Moroccans do bread very well! Yum!!    On the morning we departed (very early) staff came in to prepare breakfast and they then sent us off with a packed lunch. Unbelievable service.    If you are going to Marrakesh just stay here. The Medina is crazy and you could choose to stay in a more western hotel in the new city but why bother? This is the experience and Dar Anika provides a luxurious oasis.
