Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Magical Marrakech made even more special
Review_Text: As soon as we stepped through the door we had the most wonderful greeting with many refreshments. Then the staff took us through the best places to visit in Marrakech to help us get the best out of our visit. The rooms were absolutely lovely and it's great to cool down in the pool after a day in the medina. Also the breakfast is so big that it will keep you going with all the walking you are doing. Many thanks to all the staff and manager Richard and Benedetta
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the second we walked in every single detail was perfect. We came to this hotel at the end our time in Morocco and had stayed in a few small riads and village hotels up to that point. The reviews were pretty spot on in retrospect but really nothing prepared me for the amazing experience in this hotel. The staff greeted us at the door on arrival and brought us a rose then took us into an air conditioned lounge for tea and snacks. The hotel is beautifully decorated in all the common areas and in the room. But the real gem is the staff and service. They are so attentive! I mean they literally made ANY request come true. I had even asked about a specific Moroccan dessert I wanted to try but had not found anywhere and they made it for me that evening with dinner! We also used their hammam services dipped in the pool and layed out on the terrace rooftop. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a beautiful tranquil 5 star service hotel experience in Marrakech (which is anything but tranquil outside those walls). Dar Anika will take care of you and give you the experience of a lifetime. Stay here I guarantee you will be so grateful you did. I can't wait to come back someday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I cannot say enough nice things about this hotel and the staff. We wanted for nothing during our stay and they exceeded our expectations at every point.    We arranged a driver from the airport that was prompt and friendly.    Upon arrival as others have mentioned we met with Abu and Abu. They gave us a detailed breakdown of places to eat/drink and things to see. As this conversation was happening we were served a tremendous amount of food and drink- from tea milk dates soup mint iced drink and much more. The service was outstanding.    We had booked a double bed regular room which was beautifully appointed but small. A room for those looking to see the city. We were upgraded to a larger room with a larger bed and bathroom. One thing to note: the shampoo they give you is amazing. I took some home because it was outstanding.    We ate dinner at the riad for three nights of our stay outstanding. I reviewed their kitchen separately.    Rooms have excellent AC for relief from the hot sun.    Location is excellent- in the medina near the palaces a five minute walk to the Jemaa and a hidden oasis amongst the hustle and bustle.    Free wifi that was excellent in terms of reliability. The riad had three floors. The main floor: with reception posh sitting area pool rooms and hammam. I would highly recommend their hammam services at the beginning of your stay. The pool was great after a day of sightseeing. The second floor: rooms balcony sitting areas. We enjoyed time up here drinking and eating some amazing things. The kitchen here is insane. The third floor/roof: sitting area Berber tent lounge/sun chairs and a taller sitting area. There are also the resident turtles who visited us during breakfast. We spent time on the roof to enjoy the sunset and storms off on the horizon.    A word on breakfast: it is free. It is amazing. It is fresh. Leave an hour. At least. It was a nice way to ease into the day.    We were here celebrating our anniversary and they surprised us with a song cake and flowers.    Overall magic. I cannot remember looking at a staff member and not seeing a smile for the entire week we were here.    Note: they book excursions and car services. I would highly recommend discussing options with them on arrival.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ChrisandDrew A wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: We ended our 11 nights trip to Morocco with 3 nights at Dar Anika. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left we were overwhelmed by the pampering and unbelievable attention paid to us. My family of 10 were the only guests until the final night when another couple arrived. The staff of 26 under the direct supervision of the owners Abu and his brother were incredible. Ridiculously attentive gracious and trained. The food for every meal was of the highest quality. We only ordered the light dinner as it was more than enough food. ( we would have wasted so much of the other menu). Wine and spirits and cigars are available. Follow Abu's advice about do's and don'ts. Trust me! When we left they sent us off with food bags We were so touched and appreciative. This is truly a gem located in the heart of the Medina. Worth every penny.

Looking for somewhere for a nice dinner on our last night in Marrakesh we searched TripAdvisor and found this place near the Riad where we were staying. We knocked on the door- and we're transported from the hot and dusty medina to a place of coolness and tranquility. We were offered drinks on the rooftop terrace- or an air conditioned room overlooking the pool-and chose the latter. We stayed there for dinner too as it was so nice. The service was impeccable- and the food simply delicious. From the olives crudités and aubergine pate (with freshly baked moroccan bread) we had with our G+Ts to the moroccan soup and the camel shepherd's pie and chicken pastile it was simply a wonderful meal and the best we had in Morocco. The trifle-type thing we had for dessert was lovely too - but we couldn't do it justice as we were too full by then. The wine list of mainly Moroccan wines (but for the French champagne) was not extensive by European standards but we had sufficient choice to find nice wines to accompany the meal. Dar anika us well worth a visit when in Marrakech - just knock on the door and be enchanted.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jim L wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Title: Riad Dar Anika - amazing people and beautiful accomodations
Review_Text: My stay at the riad Dar Anika was superb and I recommend this wonderful place 110%. Starting from the airport pick up through to the return drop off it was a magical and relaxing stay. When you first enter Dar Anika you instantly know you are somewhere special your bags are taken to your room while you are received in the most luxurious of ways: rose water sprinkled on your hands and a cool cloth to wash away the cares of traveling. You are then brought milk dates cookies to mint tea pastries olives and a refreshingly delicious lime/basil iced beverage.  Dar Anika is owned by two brothers - Abu and Abu and each introduced themselves to me and let me know that when I was settled they would be kind enough to create an itinerary which included recommendations for restaurants and shopping. The location of the raid is perfect....only a 10 minute walk to the Souk El Jadid.  My room was outstanding comfortable bed A/C Argon oil shampoo and body wash and get this...rose petals!! Yup..5 Star living.  The Food!!! Dinner at the Riad which was a delicious choice of Moroccan specialties...try their tangine....you will thank me.  The staff are amazing they are available and kind and at any time there is someone available to help you with anything you might need.  I can not imagine staying in Marrakech and not staying at Dar Anika.    Until we meet again    Jim Lyons
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: A true jewel in the Medina
Review_Text: There are not enough words to describe Dar Anika but one that comes to mind most frequently is perfection. I have stayed in several five star luxury hotels and nothing comes close to the perfection that is Dar Anika and their costumer service. First walking into Dar Anika is like walking into a beautiful oasis among the maze-like alley ways and souks of the Medina. You are led into a lobby off the courtyard wherein you are given a five course welcome reception. Everything from milk dates cookies to mint tea pastries olives and a refreshingly delicious lime/basil iced beverage. Then to top it all off one of the owners (Dar Anika is owned by two brothers - Abu and Abu...so for this review I'll say Abu I and Abu II) Abu I sat down and went over a day by day itinerary with us which included recommendations for restaurants shopping and plotting a tour for us in the Medina. He gave us several cards so we always had the Riad's address and tips on how to handle aggressive street vendors what to pay for photos with snake charmers etc. He took so much time with us and made sure all questions were answered then showed us to our rooms. The rooms were very charming and had beautiful furnishings A/C argan oil shampoo and body wash and the perfect hair dryer! We ate dinner at the Riad which was a delicious array of Moroccan specialities...truly the best meal I had during my stay in Marrakech. Breakfast was equally impressive...an array of Moroccan breads crepes yogurt fruit and eggs made to order along with the freshest orange juice I've ever tasted. At any time there is someone asking if you need anything. They were especially attentive to our nine year old daughter. We meet another family from the states and all nine of us sat in the courtyard and chatted. Next thing we knew we had pitchers of cucumber water and glasses mint tea. I cannot say enough about the service at Dar Anika. Abu I and Abu II have truly perfected what costumer service is all about and I would 100% recommend Dar Anika to anyone staying in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: sadhna a wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: We stayed at the Dar Anika for 3 nights where we were treated like queens from the moment we were met at the airport by Idriss.  When we got to the Riad we were warmly welcomed by all of the staff with welcome food and drink and a lovely red rose I loved all of the touches around the Riad. Their vegetarian tagine was the best in Morocco.  On our first morning we had a briefing with the owner and discussed what to do whilst in Marrakech and given loads of tips.  The staff organised our Hammam treatment and a massage for us which were lovely experiences.  I would highly recommend staying at the Riad and if I ever returned to Marrakech I would definitely stay there.  Thank you to the owners Abou and Abou and ALL of their lovely staff for an amazing stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Michelle D wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: We cannot recommend this Riad and it's staff highly enough. We stayed for a few nights in June and nothing was less than excellent. The staff service and food from the moment we arrived until we left just perfect. They team at Dar Anika cannot do enough to ensure your time with them and in the city is everything it should be on holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jo M wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: We stayed in Dar Anika for three nights. Upon arrival were greeted like royalty with mint tea water a cocktail and nibbles in an air conditioned luxurious room which was very welcome treat after such a long journey!    Our room was comfortable a deluxe twin it was street side which was a bit of a worry as I am a light sleeper but it wasn't noisy in the end. Comfortable bed and wifi throughout the building.    In the morning Abou and Abou (the owners) talked to us about Marrakech with hints and tips no selling of trips etc as we'd already planned what to do. Very helpful. They even gave us a mobile during our stay for emergency use we presumed as we were two female travellers but it was a nice touch.    We would breakfast on the roof terrace - a mixture of offerings bread fruit pancakes eggs etc very relaxed. We'd always be offered water and a cocktail upon our arrival back from a hot day out. Milk and dates were in the room when we would return after dinner.    All the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful we were waited on and wanted for nothing. We had a hammam and a massage in the Riad during our stay.    This Riad is a very peaceful and calming place to be (we did stay in one more which did not compare) a sanctuary from the hustle of bustle outside. A great place to stay and in particular thanks to Abou and Abou Idriss (our driver) Zineb Latif and Jowet for making it special but quite honestly everyone in the Riad was wonderful! Would totally recommend this to anyone it is a slice of paradise in a very hectic medina!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We picked this hotel based on the reviews and it still managed to exceed our expectations! From the moment we were picked up by Idriss we were fantastically looked after by everyone in the riad. The 7 course (!!) breakfasts were delicious and the staff were always accommodating and provided anything we needed and more! There was also options to eat lunch and dinner in the riad and snacks were often provided during the day to accompany drinks. It was our first trip to Morocco and Abu(the owner) sat and took time with us drawing us a custom map and highlighting the best points of interest and when to see them. We were guided toward recommended restaurants and cafés so we were really able to make the most of our stay. We highly recommend the riad The location was fantastic as it was only a short walk to the main square so we really felt in the middle of it all nestled in the Medina near the palace. It was lovely to come back to the calm riad after the madness of the city. The rooms were beautifully furnished with fantastic bathroom. Everything was clean with complimentary toiletries and fresh towels and bedding daily. Refreshing cold water was always brought to us several times a day.  The Riad Dar Anika is a tranquil oasis within the bustling medina. Peaceful at night with stunning decor and a roof top garden to fall in love with. Views across the city at sunset are spectacular. All of the staff were polite courteous and very friendly.  Thanks to all of the staff for such a memorable holiday and for always being so polite and welcoming We will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 4 nights at the this quaint and boutique hotel. We have never experienced service like it at a hotel.    From the first time arriving to the last minute we left we were treated extremely well and professional by Abu and his staff. On arrival Abu took the time to listen and advise where we should visit & eat.    It's an experience staying here and we loved it.    It's not for everyone staying in the Medinah area but its the true Marrakesh experience.    Will have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone. We also tried the hamman & was excellent!    Thanks again Abu & your team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Came here last night and tonight and shall continue for the rest of my stay. Amazing place for a drink and a view. The service is superb. Staff are very friendly and the extra nibbles with a drink are a wonderful gesture.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We would definitely recommend Dar Anika to anyone and are already planning a second trip! It is the best and most personal service we've ever received and we've stayed in numerous five star hotels all over the world. The owners and staff are very friendly and genuine and made us feel completely at home every tiny detail had been looked after. The food was amazing and our vegetarian and vegan diets were catered for. The Riad itself is gorgeous with an amazing roof terrace and a swimming pool. Would also definitely recommend a Hammam treatment in the hotel. Absolutely nothing can be faulted thank you all so much!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ramy G wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: After a few days in a hotel in Casablanca it was my retreat to escape to Marrakech for one night of relaxation. I was overwhelmed with the hospitality from the very start as I was welcomed with a platter of food and drinks prior to being shown to my room. This place is a jewel and has the mystical feel of Marrakech. A vast contrast from staying in a hotel beautiful decor excellent staff and very welcoming owners. I could not fault this place and will certainly plan to be back with my wife. Cannot recommend it enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: I can not say enough nice things about the Dar Anika and its staff. The surroundings are beautiful and provide a welcoming and peaceful place to relax and be pampered. The food was plentiful and delicious. You can't sit anywhere for more than a few minutes without refreshments being given and snacks to pick at. If you require anything at all the staff will accommodate you. They are always cheerful and happy to help with advice and directions and the enevitable questions about Moroccan culture. After a day in the souks it was so wonderful to step in to the Dar Anika - 'a comfort blanket' sort of feeling. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else if I return to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Best service I have ever been privy to
Review_Text: When you are "wow'd" by a hotel it's hard to articulate. Let me put some bullet points in:    The service in this hotel is outstanding: a 5-course set of welcome drinks and snacks hourly smoothies and drinks delivered to your room / where you are sitting without asking plated cakes and snacks in the afternoon if you happen to be around bagged lunches if you ask for them very personal attentiveness from the owners Abu and Abu. We were also given a suite to shower in before our flights.    The hotel is outstanding: Located a 5-minute walk from the central square but peaceful quiet and recently updated with contemporary furniture.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ove S wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: Superb excellent wonderful splendid magnificent etc etc. Definitely the most unbelievable place we ever have stayed at. I can only agree with the other writers that this place is extraordinaire.  12 rooms with 26 staff members pampering you from arrival to departure. Found the place by co-incidence as my wife's name is Annika and we were celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary. A fact that did not go unnoticed as the staff did whatever the could to celebrate with us. Unfortunately we "only" stayed for 3 nights and if we ever go back to Marrakesh the main reason would be Riad Dar Anika!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This riad was beautiful. The inner courtyard was so peacefulsuch a contrast from the noise and energy just outside the front door. We didn't Sat dinner here but the breakfast was delicious. Word of warning the walk from the riad into the centre of the city was a bit challenging at times.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: S Saxena wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Title: The very best hospitality I've experienced on a holiday
Review_Text: While we did enjoy our trip to Marrakech and what it offered as a city the highlight still remains our experience at Dar Anika. Staying at a riad vs a hotel was the best decision we made and at Dar Anika we experienced possibly the most personable service we've come across on any holiday.    The riad is situated in the south of the Medina (old city) where you will be face to face with the hustle and bustle of city life. Dar Anika is tucked away in the corner of one of the streets and really is like an oasis of peace amongst the chaotic world outside its doors. Its only a 10 minute walk to the main square and is walking distance to several other attractions and restaurants.    When we first entered Dar Anika (they arranged for a taxi transfer from the airport for us on request) we were immediately given fresh milk and dates (a Moroccan tradition) and the owner Abu sat us down and talked through our itinerary with us and what we wanted to get out of our holiday. This was our first taste of the highly approachable and personal nature of service at Dar Anika.    Our room was on the ground floor and a great amount of attention to detail was given to its daily servicing which constantly amazed us. We had daily breakfasts on the terrace and these were of very high quality - the chefs will try to accommodate any dietary requests you may have.    The riad offers excellent excursion packages and Abu is able to talk through these with you and incorporate them into your schedule. We had a personal guide for a half day city tour (Hamid - he was excellent and even helped us with negotiating prices at the markets!) a full day visit to the Atlas Mountains (expensive but worth it) and an excellent Hammam (Turkish bath) at Dar Anika itself.    To conclude Dar Anika has the appearance of a beautiful little paradise and that's exactly how we would describe the experience. To put things into perspective: on my request they arranged for the pool to be surrounded with extra candles and covered in rose petals as a surprise for my partner and followed it up with complimentary sparkling white wine. They also gave us packed lunches for our flight back home....Enough said. Experience it for yourself.    Abu Abdul Latif Hamid Zenib and co. - thanks again for all you've done!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful, brilliant and first class service
Review_Text: My sister in law and I spent 5 nights at Riad Dar Anika last week and we did not want to leave. We were picked up from the airport which is only 10/15 minutes away by a very nice driver. As 2 women traveling on our own we were made to feel safe and relaxed. When we arrived we were greeted like royalty by the stuff who welcomed us with red roses and cold drinks and milk and dates. The Riad is utterly charmingfilled with flower pots singing birds and beautiful furniture. While we relaxed on comfortable sofas sipping delicious mint tea we learned about Marrakesh and places to visit and dine. We loved our rooms which were furnished beautifully. I must also mention the delicious breakfast which was served on the gorgeous roof garden. Another fantastic feature of Dar Anika is its proximity to jemaa el fna and the souks and places of interests. But the most important thing that made our stay so special were the staff and Abu and Abu. They were all welcoming warm friendly yet professional. We had the time of our life and will go back again to lovely Marrakesh and of course to see everyone at Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My friend and I are nearing the end of our 6 night stay here at Dar Anika and I cannot praise this place highly enough. It is an oasis of stunning Moroccan beauty calm and tranquillity in the middle of the dump that is The Medina. All the staff are absolutely wonderful; attentive welcoming they honestly can't do enough for you! Breakfast is 5 courses and sets you up for day they bring you jugs of cucumber infused water immediately you arrive 'home' their cucumber/mint juice is to die for glasses of milk and dates are left in your room every evening as are fresh towels and robes. Abu and Abu will help you plan your itinerary and recommend restaurants and as a foodie they haven't been wrong yet. 10/10 You MUST stay here!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lizzy C wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Title: There's nowhere I'd rather stay in Marrakech. Just awesome.
Review_Text: We spent a few days in Marrakech at the beginning of June and had the most amazing time. I honestly don't think I could praise Dar Anika enough.  Everything we could possibly want and more was provided almost instantly.  Upon reaching the riad (we arranged our own transport but Dar Anika can do this for you too) we were met and taken into a beautiful little room. Here we were given water tea and food. One of the owners then came in and spent almost an hour talking to us. He listened to what we wanted to do and then helped us plan an itinerary for our entire stay with helpful tips given along the way.  He helped us make the most of our short trip and his recommendations for where to eat proved absolutely spot on.  The staff at the hotel are just brilliant too- anything you ask for they'll provide it within seconds. They almost seem to intuitively know what you want and have it ready for you!  The breakfast too. Oh. My. God. You are fed like a king/queen. There is course after course and you can watch it be freshly prepared. It is so tasty. We spent about 1.5hours each morning enjoying the sun and the food- it really set us up for the days. Even on the morning we were leaving (too early for breakfast) they provided us with a packed breakfast so we didn't go hungry.  My favourite thing about Dar Anika is that they genuinely go out of their way to get to know you. I'd spoken to them extensively in planning our trip about wanting it to be special and asking for assistance with picking a suitable room (a present from myself to my little sister for her 21st birthday). I hadn't thought anything else of it when we checked in but on our second breakfast all the staff came up to our table and provided my sister with a HUGE bunch of flowers and a birthday cake. They sang Happy Birthday too. It was such a lovely unexpected touch. Needless to say she was the happiest girl around that day!    We visited one of the main hotels whilst we were there for a spa treatment. I could honestly say that it wasn't anywhere close to the standard that Dar Anika provides and I wouldn't hesitate to go back there over and over again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Throughout our Morrocco roadtrip we stayed in a number of hotels in different places but Dar Anika remains the benchmark for service. Abu and Abu were extremely helpful and provided any assistance and guidance you could possibly think of. They even sat down with us for half an our to dicuss in detail the possible itinerary of the roadtrip. You will not regret staying at this place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Luxury and warmth at the same time
Review_Text: My wife and me spent 4 days at Riad Dar Anika last week and it was one of our best hotel experiences ever.  Rooms and common areas are exquisitely decorated. Traditional Morocan food is delicious and breakfasts are amazing.  But above all Abu and his team know how to take care of every detail and how to make every need possible. Dar Anika makes you feel at home and at a real five star hotel at the same time
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here for 4 nights on a last minute trip and so glad we did. From the moment we arrived we received first-class service from the owners and their staff - rarely do you get such attentive service of such high quality.    When we arrived Abu (one of the owners) sat down with us and helped plan what to see and where to eat and then made the arrangements. Lovely room tranquil setting great food - the whole experience was faultless.    The riad is in a safe location just 5/10 minute walk from Jemaa el Fna so you get the benefit of a central location yet the tranquility of being away from the main centre (make sure you go there on Saturday or Sunday night).    When we left we were given a bag with rolls and fruit for our journey. I was initially pleasantly surprised but then thought...yes that's typically Anika!    Many thanks Abu & Abu.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cristina C wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Dark Anika provided the most exceptional travel experience I have ever had. Every detail was attended to and executed with elegance care and the highest standard of excellence. Dar Anika it's owners and it's staff exuded a serene and relaxing atmosphere where every effort was made to ensure my utmost comfort happiness and ability to enjoy my time exploring Marrakesh. Upon arrival we were greeted by the entire staff and one of the brothers who own the Riad (a wonderful and elegant man) created a personalized itinerary for our entire stay in Marrakesh based on our interests. He also arranged for any transportation and reservations that were necessary. In effect he acted as a personal concierge for our entire stay. His guidance was invaluable and allowed us to experience Marrakech's culture history and beauty. The two brothers who own Dar Anika are genuine and generous men whose kindness is evident from the staff's dedication to the guests as well as their employers. I have never seen staff so pleasant and genuinely interested in the happiness of their guests. The beauty of this Riad and the incredible service are accompanied by delicious fresh meals. The food at Dar Anika was impeccable and is personally overseen by the brothers with it's ingredients coming from the Riad's own farm located in the countryside. I could go on but essentially Dar Anika's excellence is evident from it's high ratings across every travel site that I researched prior to going. Dar Anika is truly a wonderful place with beautiful people.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: stephen c wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: The riad is well situated and the palaces and main square are within easy reach.  .Our room was lovely and there is a pretty courtyard with pool and rooftop terrace where excellent food was served.  The staff arrange taxis trips and there is an in-house hammam.  Abu and his staff are charming and all give exceptional service and are very helpful and they ensured that we had a very happy week.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a wonderful place to stay in Marrakech. The owners staff service and outsourced daytrips were all excellent! My husband celebrated his birthday and they even baked him a cake! I highly recommend this establishment to all travellers!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rebecca F wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: Excellent service, an oasis in the medina
Review_Text: Abu and his family of staff lived up to all the trip advisor expectations. The location is excellent and the staff made every effort to make our stay feel like home. A great oasis just outside the bustling medina. Well worth staying here if you want to visit Marrakech but still have some home comforts! Superb clean rooms and we even had time to fit in a hamman and massage. Fabulous-thank you Abu &Abu! The Fowlers
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amy W wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: Easy walk to the main square and wonderful service
Review_Text: This hotel is an easy walk to the main square (about 15 mins) and you won't get lost. There's a few sights along the way and of course many shops. The staff at this riad were exceptional. Very helpful and just playing with their service. They will bend over backwards to help you. The room itself was lovely and large even rose petals were placed on the bed for our arrival. Strongly recommend and would easily stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We visited Riad Dar Anika while in Marrakesh and were so impressed with the service and the facilities. The owners had a point of difference and were well travelled and knew the hotel business this was evident with how things were managed it was the small differences that counted.    They treated their staff professionally and they took pride in their Riad. There was a huge difference compared to other Riad's we visited in all aspects. The food was fresh and they were honest and patient with giving tourism advice without any hidden agendas.    We came for our honeymoon and would return to visit Riad Dar Anika and highly recommend this Riad to any Australian or tourist wanting to experience a true Moroccan Riad in the heart of the medina of Marrakesh!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Shelley J wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: My Mum and I have just returned from a perfect long weekend at Dar Anika. From the minute we arrived we were made to feel so welcome and this level of hospitability continued throughout our entire stay. The owners Abu and Abu and all the staff couldn't have done more for us. The service really is outstanding. The breakfast here is pretty special with delicious homemade fruit salads cake bread pancakes and soup. The riad itself is a beautiful and relaxing oasis from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. I enjoyed my first hammam experience and the massage I had afterwards was the most relaxing massage I have ever had.    Marrakech is a magical and enchanting place and I will definitely return. I would without question stay at Dar Anika again. Thank you so much to everyone for making our stay so perfect and special x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: From the moment I booked our reservation the staff of Dar Anika was nothing less than amazing. A driver picked us up from the train station and escorted us directly to the door of the riad at the edge of the souk. As soon as we arrived we were given tea dates soup roses and cookies while we waited for the owner (Abu) to check in with us. Abu was wonderful. Even though we were only able to stay for one night he made sure to give us realistic and helpful suggestions on what to see how to get there where to eat (and where not to!) and how to bargain. When he found out that it was one of my friend's birthdays not only did he arrange reservations at a fantastic restaurant but he also had his staff bake a delicious cake to surprise us at breakfast the next day. Incredibly thoughtful!    Breakfast in the morning on the rooftop was excellent - a few served courses which included soup fruit yoghurt eggs crepes... It was all delicious. Highly recommend spending time on the rooftop for drinks snacks etc. Great views and great service.    During our whole stay we felt looked after and so comfortable. This was our first time in Marrakech and I would seriously come back just to stay here again though it would be for more like 5 days instead of 1.    Thank you for everything Abu and your staff. You made our trip special easy and comfortable. We will be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Janet F wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Beautiful Riad in a great location. The owner and staff truly could not do enough for us. The rooms were perfect and the food fantastic. Can definitely recommend the Hammam and Massage! Would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: marissa a wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: First Class Treatment, Better Than The Ritz
Review_Text: I travel frequently for work which puts me up in 5 star hotels including Ritz Carlton and Trump properties and Riad Dar Anika 'trumps' them all. We only spent one night at Dar Anika and I was cursing our flight back to NYC when we checked out! Abu was absolutely wonderful he should honestly teach courses in hospitality everyone has something to learn from him! Every member of staff made us feel at home. We were served tea cookies and cakes upon arrival our bed was covered in rose petals and everything was perfect down to the last detail. We booked a very last minute hammam treatment (one hour before the hammam closed) and Hamisa the woman who did our treatment was so much fun. She was so warm and happy (despite our lack of French and Arabic skills) scrubbed off all of our dead skin treated us like family and when I shaved my legs the next day it was the softest I've ever been! The staff made an excellent dinner recommendation and were swift to make reservations for dinner and taxis. Breakfast in the morning was out of this world. Fresh squeezed juice fresh and local jams breads soup fruit it was a real treat! When we checked out Abu handed us a canvas satchel with fruit bottled water and delicious vegetarian sandwiches (he remembered my diet!) because he knew we had a tight connection in Casablanca to fly home to JFK and he thinks (quite rightly so) that the cafeteria in the Marrakech airport is poor. I have NEVER received better treatment in a hotel in my life I would recommend Riad Dar Anika to every person I know including the most executive clients I work with.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jason T wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: I recently spent 3 nights at Dar Anika and the review are all bang on  this place is brilliant  In fact i would say the service received here is better than some 5 * hotels i've stayed at.  From the moment you arrive Abu ( the owner ) asks you what you want to do while you are there and proceeds to tell you all the must see places in Marakesh  this is not a chance for him to sell you trips he is so proud of Marakesh he wants to ensure you don't miss anything during your stay.  Out comes the local map and he advises where to go and how to get there ( you can walk most places if you're feeling fit)  best restaurants to eat in and places to drink . Take his advise and enjoy getting lost as that's part of the fun!    Personal service is an understatement . nothing is a problem and there is always enough willing staff to deal with anything you might want or need.    I recommend the Hammam and the lady who does it is lovely and your skin will feel amazing afterwards.    You can get them to collect and deliver you back to the airport if you ask ( charged at about £10.00 each way ) but it saves the hassle and the driver is also very nice.    Would certainly stay here again as they are like a family and they treat you like a family member during your stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rupert P wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: We had such a wonderful stay at Dar Anika. We felt it was almost like the staff could read our minds- as soon as we thought of something we would like it arrived. They even upgraded our room without us asking. The riad is in a perfect location for the souks and the palace which was something we were unsure about when booking. The waitering staff were so friendly they even joined my wife in trying to teach me to write my name in Arabic! (روبرت).    Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What can I say that hasn't already been said by so many others. I'm lucky enough to be a gold member of the Ritz hotel group but have never experienced such a high level of service and attention to detail as Dar Anika.    The Abu brothers who own the Riad have combined the uniqueness of a boutique hotel with the high end end service of a 5 star hotel.    Everything you could ever ask for and more comes as standard and almost anything else you could wish for is happily arranged.    My son and I wanted a very tailored one day trip of culture and high adrenaline fun and Abu delivered beyond our expectations.    As an example of the level of service We took a dip in their beautiful courtyard pool. I put my phone on the side and within seconds a stool arrived and my phone was placed safely on the stool. A few seconds later and a glass of champagne and a virgin mojito arrived. These guys are almost telepathic.    Don't waste your time looking any further. There is no other place to stay in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Jonathan M wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: My husband and I arrived at this beautiful Riad and was met by the owner Abu. He welcomed us in and for the next half hour we were lavished with delicious pastries tea soup and mint drink. Breakfasts were to die for and every morning Abu met with us to plan our itinerary for the day.  We stayed four days and on the last day he treated us to lunch. On our departure he had a picnic made up for us. All his staff were incredible! We were blown away with the kindness and generosity at this fab Riad . We hope one day to go back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A Gem in the Centre of Marrakech
Review_Text: Perfect location situated between all of Marrakech's tourist hotspots. Despite this it is secluded and self-contained with a very relaxing vibe despite the surroundings. Incredibly attentive staff; this is the best service I have experienced at a hotel by all staff members I interacted with. Every traveller's preferences are different however the staff are genuinely passionate about making your stay as enjoyable as possible and will do whatever they can to accommodate your requests. We came here without knowing anything about Marrakech but we were given in depth friendly advice by hotel staff which really helps in Marrakech as it is easy to get lost in the hustle and bustle. The food was fantastic; beautiful breakfast lovely tagines and fantastic desserts available whenever. You will never go hungry here. The hotel is beautiful the rooms all individual with a distinct Moroccan charm. Charming roof terrace where you can eat meals overlooking the city and also sunbathe if you so wish.  Perfect for couples and small groups.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: the hotel is very clean with a small indoor swimming pool it has very clean and comfortable rooms a roof terrace for breakfast and evening meals or drinks. the staff are extremely helpful and they go out of there to please you.  The location is very convenient but a little noisy if you have a front room.  All in all is a very nice hotel for a city break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Like being a guest in a local home, only better
Review_Text: Great food excellent location and highly attentive service from the greeting to itinerary assistance.    We came to Marrakesh on a whim as it was raining in Paris and the experience could not have been better. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Tucked away at the edge of the Medina Dar anika riad is a wonderful gem owned by two brothers Abu and Abu. When we arrived at 8pm we were taken into the lounge area brought dates milk cakes and mint tea – and that was before we were served dinner by candle-light on the roof terrace! If there is one thing Dar anika knows how to do well it’s serve amazing Moroccan delights in those wonderful tagine dishes! And so many of them!  We were two women on our own and Abu was marvellous booking us guides and showing us where and where not to go on the map. The riad is beautiful and the service faultless. The waiters and management just couldn’t do enough for us. We were brought drinks whenever we were out on the roof terrace including a fabulous banana and lemon smoothie and cakes in the afternoon.  We were in room 4 on the first floor overlooking the court yard. The Moroccan beds are quite firm but Abu put memory foam and extra padding on mine for my arthritic bones. We had a lovely bathroom with local toiletries fresh towels bathrobe and slippers. We also tried the hamman and had a massage – both of which I would recommend. There is a mosque close by but we closed our window and put on the air conditioning and couldn’t hear a thing.  Breakfast again such a wealth of food for those who want it can be served up on the roof terrace or inside. We liked the highest point that looked out over the busy square. We also loved the tortoises that roamed freely every so often nibbling our toes! Delightful.  The riad is not large and has a cosy feel to it. The roof terrace is where most people eat and socialise. You can sunbathe at the back of the terrace on sun beds without feeling self-conscious and there’s a small indoor pool on the ground floor which we didn’t use although I could imagine that once the temperature rose you might well be tempted. I would say this is a place for couples – although it might be ok if you only had one child. It really was a perfect little paradise in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Colin M wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: The managers here lead by example. The staff are attentive well trained and friendly. Everyone goes out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The managers explain all the places of interest and encourage you to get out and visit them. They even give you their mobile number and will come out on a scooter and rescue you if you get lost in the souk! The roof top breakfast is a delight and will last you all day. Altogether an excellent experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The many reviews of the Riad Dar Anika are absolutely correct. This is a marvelous Riad - from the super attentive staff the beautiful common areas the perfect rooms to the location. Based upon previous reviews I had high expectations. The Riad Dar Anika did not disappoint. I am fussy about where I stay - I look forward to returning to this wonderful Riad someday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Dar Anika    I don't know where to begin but I'll start with this riad exceeded any expectations my friend and I had and it all started with the moment we booked. We requested to have the airport shuttle and our driver Idriss was there waiting for us even though we arrived an hour early. Idris was AMAZING and gave us an explanation of the places we passed and always had a smile on his face. When we arrived we felt like we were right in the middle of the medina. Unlike big hotels the dar Anika was right in the middle of all the action and what I think every person wants when the visit morocco. When you arrive theres a black door that's hidden away. It was like walking into a secret place Inside. Zineb our main receptionist was a gem! She walked us into the sitting room and my friend and I IMMEDIATELY started taking a hundred pictures because we couldn't believe how beautiful this place is. Then came the food. Omg the food!!!! First they bring out the dates and milk then the pasties then this amazing brightly colored Orange soup then the pastries then the fruit. (I know that's a lot but it's true) we honestly couldn't believe it... And everything was amazing. Abu who was so kind and funny took us to the rooftop terrace with great views of the medina and showed us a map on how to get around. He was patient even though we asked him 10 times over how to get to certain places. He knew ahead of time how long our stay was so he gave us a suggested outline on how to tackle as much as possible in our regrettably short stay. He gave us all the tips on how to navigate the souks and how to get to the restaurants but It gets better... When we couldn't find the first place he actually walked us over to the place. Our first night we requested to have the meet and greet dinner and I can't begin to tell you how amazing this was. First let me say that as soon as we booked this riad they sent us a menu if we requested this dinner. We had the lamb tanjine which was presented in a clay pot and literally fell off the bone... I had no room for it and still finished it! The lamb amongst the other 8 courses they presented were phenomenal. We were actually tired of eating but had to try because it was too delicious not to. The next day we had breakfast there as well and again... More selection fresh perfect and really felt like we had the Moroccan experience. The presentation and service were impeccable! If you are considering the in house hammam which is an authentic Moroccan style bath and scrub... Do it! I could honestly write a book on how amazing this riad is and it still wouldn't do this place any justice. We were treated like royal family. We felt safe welcome and just at home here or should I say paradise. 10 stars across the board and there's no question I'm DEFINITELY staying here on my next stay to Marrakech!!!! Upon departure another Abu sent us off with a small lunch for the drive back to the airport and let's just say I had to almost fight off tears because I didn't want to leave. They truly exceeded my expectations and has set a whole new bar for any future travels! Thank you Dar Anika for making this one of thee most memorable experiences I've ever had!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Paul E wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Stayed for a week with friends. Nothing was too much trouble. Spend 15 minutes with the owner who will organise an itinerary specifically tailored to your requirements as well as advise you on local protocol and excellent places to stop off for refreshments. Right up there with the best hotels I've ever stayed at. Would definitely recommend and will certainly stay here again should I return to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Wonderful Stay - planning the return trip
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed here in Feb this year and we had the most wonderful time. Nothing is too much effort for the staff here and Abu was very kind and generous he oriented us before we headed out provided maps and local knowledge and if we needed anything he would organise it for us. We got the hotel to pick us up fromt he airport this is a good idea as the hotel would be hard to find on your own! The food here is amazing and it is very well located for exploring the city and souks. The hotel also organises excursions out of the city although we didnt take advantage of these this time fellow tourists raved about them. We will definteley do this when we return!    Id recommend having mint tea and cake on the sun terrace in the late afternoon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Archie H wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: This is an absolutely amazing hotel. I'm not normally one to leave reviews but this time I had to. The staff are amazing catering to our every need even before we knew we needed it! The rooms were beautiful and the food never ending and delicious. Thank you so much Dar Anika for making our stay so special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nicola J wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: My partner and I (both 26 years old) have just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Riad Dar Anika. We are both VEGAN and Abu made sure he did everything possible to provide for us; even requesting a vegan cake recipe so his kitchen could rustle us up some cakes and sure enough a few hours later- we ate cake!  The location is perfect you get to experience the hustle and bustle of the markets and daily life of the locals yet the hotel itself provides you with a tranquil paradise to rest and recuperate. The cleanliness of the Dar Anika was amazing it was immaculate but without that horrible chemical/bleach concoction you often get with hotels. It was luxurious spa-like and a real pleasure to experience. The intimacy of this 'boutique' style hotel gives you a great relationship with the staff who are always there smiling and offering to help. Food 10/10 service 10/10. staff 10/10 rooms 10/10 harman spa 10/10 location 10/10... you get the idea! Thank- you to Abu & Abu and the rest of the staff. I have already recommended it to all my family and friends :-)  P.S The roof terrace is the perfect place for breakfast and to watch the sunset in the evenings!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is an amazing place....I wont repeat all the good points from the other 5 star reviews...its a kind of refuge from the splendid chaos of Marrakech you just step in out of the chaos though a massive door and step into another world of peace and tranquility. The service is amazing.....have you ever experienced living with 5 butlers and countless maids....now is your chance. I would recomend 4-5 nights here but please take an excursion organized by the hotel is well worth the experience and you get out of the town for a while and see some of Morocco. We went on an excursion up the Ourika Valley where you can get into the heart of the amazing high Atlas mountains....a day trip with no problems. They have other excursions you might want to try or I am sure they would lay on anything you want.(ask about a desert trip). Its good to get out of town every now and then as Marrakech is too high pressure for me all the time.    Again what service......!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Most amazing day & night of my life
Review_Text: We are a couple (26 years old) and we stay only one night at the Dar Anika but it was like a dream for us.    We arrive very early in the morning (11am) in order to drop our lugage and to come back later to take our room but Abu welcome us with a glass of milk with dates. He was available and give some very good advice for our trip in Marrakech (and you need some very good tricks!).    The place is amazing the roof top is perfect you can see the atlas mountain every morning eating your breakfeast with all the best speciality of Marrakech concentrate in your table. The night there is a lot of candle everywhere and the place became magical.    All the employee are so nice and helpful. They give us black soap spices argan oil food day and night everytime everywhere! There is especially one very helpful who help us finding a strange fruit pick up by the kids in Marrakech looks like a raspberry but white and in the tree and was very funny and help us to pay only 80 DAM to go to the airport.    We take the hammam it was so nice with very good product. There is a side effect the activity protect you with a bubble all around you for the next hour. You can go in the medina and be like on a cloud or on a magic carpet.    I don't want to spoil everything but every little details make for us the trip Unforgettable and the only problem now is to know that we can't find any better hotel in the future. We have to came back again?    Thank you again (to Abu & Abu!)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrew S wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We can only echo the glowing comments of other guests we stayed 9 nights due to the air traffic controllers strike but hey they did us a huge favour! From the traditional Arab welcome complete with red rose on arrival to the very thoughtful picnic for the journey home Abu & Abu and their excellent staff deliver a 5star + service all the time.Our suite decorated with rose petals was stunning and the family atmosphere of the Riad Dar Anika was just so special.  Abu in his thoughtful way arranged some fantastic excursions for us as a couple but one was so memorable it deserves special mention.We were very fortunate to be the first guests to experience their Stargazers picnic. It starts with an evening drive into the lower Atlas mountains( the last 5km up a Berber trail) and as the sun sets you arrive at a small Berber tent set up on a hillside and meet the owner Abdul dressed in traditional robes.He welcomes you with tea he has just made as your driver /guide sets up the picnic complete with wine. We then spent a magical two hours enjoying our picnic and gazing at the myriads of stars in the Moroccan Sky with just the croaking of frogs in the nearby wadi as an accompaniment. It was such a moving personal experience that my wife and I will never forget it.We have in the past enjoyed the world famous Sounds Of Silence dinner at Uluru in Australia but this was so much more personal Well done Abu and Jaoud our driver for making this night such a highlight of our memorable stay at the Dar Anika . Another couple went after us and were equally spell bound so if you can don't miss this unique trip.  Naturally we can't wait to return to Morocco and the Riad Dar Anika in particular and we rarely visit the same place twice!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alex A wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: A World-Class Stay with wonderful people
Review_Text: My wife and I returned a couple of days ago from what we both agreed was one of the best trips we've ever had anywhere in the world. The service was as good as anywhere we've stayed. Abu - who makes you feel comfortable and looked after from the start and was extremely helpful in helping us on a very specific carpet hunt - has created and maintained a fabulous team of people which we understand is no mean feat! Food and drinks were all of a high standard and the terrace was the perfect place to enjoy all of this whilst watching the locals' day unfold (and pack u) on the street below. We also enjoyed the hotel's hammam and massages which were a great end to our stay. We will be back and will recommend to our friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful hotel really peaceful and calming. Staff are amazing really care about your stay and very helpful in recommending restaurants and things to do. Breakfast pancakes on the sunny roof-deck is great! Would definitely recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: brian k wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is a beautiful Riad in a great location in Marrakech. Abu and his staff made us feel right at home and went above and beyond the normal course of duty to take care of us. They even went to the train station and bought our tickets for us since we were short of time and wanted to see more of Marrakech. When we return to Marrakech we will stay at Riad Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed in Riad Dar Anika for our tenth wedding anniversary break. We had a wonderful time and Dar Anika was absolutely fantastic! The attention to detail amazing food friendly and attentive staff and perfect location made Dar Anika unique and we were able to relax and rewind in the middle of the buzzing Marrakech. We will definitely go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: If you are looking for customer service at it's finest with all the personal touches - this is it!
Review_Text: I took my husband here for a birthday surprise and he was bowled over ( and he is not easy to please). The hospitality exceeded our expectations with nothing being too much trouble! Abu Zineb and the entire team look after us like family. The stress was taken out of our holiday by arranging all our excursions and reservations at the very best places. I was first hesitant whether to let them do this - but they were spot on with their suggestions that they tailored to our likes and dislikes. They arranged everything to suit our timings gave us a mobile to keep in contact with our driver although we were supposed to check out by midday they were kind to allow us have our room until the evening. The chef even baked my husband a surprise birthday cake.  We couldn't of wished for anything more! You would never get the personal service we had at the normal 5 star hotel.  Ps This is the first time I've been compelled to write a review.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alicia M wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: An oasis in the middle of the busy Medina
Review_Text: The staff of the Riad made our family holiday a unique experience. I can highly recommend this beautiful hotel. It' the perfect starting point for exploring Marrakesh since it's really close to the main square of the old town and right across of some major sightseeing points. Nevertheless once you enter the Riad you leave all the craziness that is going on outside behind and find a beautiful quiet hidden gem. The staff is amazing and takes care of you the minute you enter the Riad whether they're providing you with delicious moroccan mint tea and pastries or running errands for you. The owner took good care of us with planning our whole stay giving us excellent dinner recommendations and making sure we got everything we need from medication to post stamps. Make sure you have dinner at least once in the Riad! Chef Morgan is an excellent cook and you'll really be missing out. Thanks again to the whole staff for making this holiday unforgettable for each one of us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Bart V wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: Believe me whatever good comments you have read so far on TripAdvisor is 110% true.  We stayed at this place for 4 nights and enjoyed every single second of our trip.  From the moment we were picked up by hotel driver till we left the city we were pampered by all the hotel staff.    This hotel is within the old city center and close to all the bustle and hustle of Marrakesh. A great quiet place to escape after a day in hectic old city center.  Rooms are pretty spacious and shower/bathroom was more than acceptable.    Breakfast is just great but just like with anything in this town: do not rush but take your time and enjoy the roof terrace.  Although not cheap I really would recommend to have diner one evening in the hotel. We suggested we would like to try the camel and strawberries for dessert but for the rest left it up to chef's imagination. It was a great meal which we enjoyed under the stars of a warm evening.    Second recommendation would be to try the ham-man. It is a great way to relax after a full day of walking the Soux.    It was an impressive stay and recommend anybody visiting Marrakesh to consider Dar Anika both for service rooms and location. We could not have picked a better place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Myself and my mother stayed at this Riad for 3 nights over Easter and I can't recommend it highly enough. The Riad is gorgeous and all of the staff are lovely. Abu and Abu are wonderful hosts and could not have done more for us. As two woman in the city for the first time this was a great choice they really go out of their way to look after you getting taxis providing a local mobile phone and recommending restaurants and things to do each day. We will definately be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kanchan T wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Unique personalised service in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: This is a gorgeous gem - small boutique hotel. Serene and friendly with amazing informative staff. Delicious food. Abu the owner made sure that we knew what to expect whilst shopping in the souks and went out of his way to keep us safe. I ran out of dental floss and a staff member face their own supply as the shops were shut. Also the most beautiful cake and basket of flowers were given to me for my birthday - literally unforgettable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Chris S wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Exceptional service and another memorable visit
Review_Text: We visited Dar Anika as non-residents for a special evening meal to celebrate my daughter's 11th birthday. Having stayed 2 years earlier again for my daughter's birthday we were overwhelmed by the warm hospitality and so booked a return visit. Yet again the kindness of all the staff and warmth of welcome complemented the superb and plentiful food. We sat on the roof-top terrace and despite the rain's attempts to dampen the celebrations were entertained by a local group of musicians and dancers. Having got us all up to join in with the dancing the food kept on coming. A fantastic dessert birthday cake and round of ’happy birthday' from all the staff including the kitchen staff and chef was finished off with my daughter receiving a beautiful basket of flowers to take home. Overall we had another wonderful evening at Riad Dar Anika and cannot praise the establishment strongly enough. Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: holley s wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Best hotel I've ever stayed in
Review_Text: I've travelled quite a bit and stayed in hotels of varying quality but can now say this is hands down the best hotel I've ever stayed in. I got a taste of what it feels like to be royalty the way the staff treat you. I went here for a big birthday trip not knowing what to expect. From the minute we walked in we were sat down and given treats (within ten minutes we had been presented with flowers local delicacies drinks tea and a lovely welcome in the stunning lounge area). The hotel is located among the madness of Marrakech and inside the decor is quiet peaceful and stunning. It has a pool downstairs a hammam room gorgeous bedrooms (decorated painstakingly with rose petals) a stunning roof terrace tea areas living room with roaring fire....the list goes on. The owner talked us through the highlights of the city and gave us great advice. Afternoon tea and cakes is on the house but the highlight for me was the breakfast. It was literally about 6 courses of the most delicious food I've had in a long time and they will even make you anything you want on top of that. There's no start or finish time so no clock watching and perfect for brunch. There are beautiful plants tortoises wandering round and an area with sunbeds and hats. The bedrooms are comfortable and whilst here we had a hammam by a lovely lady. If you are thinking of staying here don't hesitate - it's simply stunning and I'm already looking forward to going back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patrick R wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Stayed here for a night for business. Great location just minutes' walk from the Djama al Fna and with a taxi rank outside but feels very much a calm place withdrawn from the city's bustle. Very welcoming staff and an excellent boutique hammam at a reasonable price. Rooms are simple but elegant - mine was strewn with rose petals on arrival.  Well apointed bathroom and nice antique style fittings in the bedroom. No TV which is nice from a decor perspective but I guess some might miss it. Recommended. I'll be back next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Without exaggeration if I could give The Dar Anika 10 stars I would. From the minute the large wooden door with a matching brass knocker is opened for you and immediately you are greeted by the smiling courteous and friendly staff immaculately dressed you know this is going to be something special. My wife was handed a single rose the fragrant smell of a mixture of familiar spicy and floral scents hits you. We were shown into the lounge area with an eclectic mix of seatingtables lamps all in the classical Moroccan theme not to mention a log fire burning in the library area. Soon two of the staff arrived and proceeded to bring a plethora of tasty treats. To mention a few- milk and dates soup pastries and a tasty cocktail. All this is unexpected. This was to be a common theme for our stay. The charming girl from reception asked if it was ok for the owner- Abu- to come and introduce himself. Abu then proceeded to spend about 45 minutes with us whereupon he suggested a "highlights" tour of Marrakech in the 4 days we where there. Abu was incredibly engaging with perfect English. It felt like he hadn't had this chat with any other tourist before. Abu took us to our room and again without any rush showed us the layout and features of the room. The room is compact (14m2) but well apportioned with plenty of wardrobe space. The 4 poster beautifully hand carved Cedar bed was stunning and Abu seemed very proud of it and asked us to smell it! The whole room and bathroom was beautifully decorated in fresh rose petals all laid out in patterns. The bed was very comfortable. The air conditioning was necessary. The safe was good. Next morning we had breakfast on the roof terrace. Again this stunning area is swamped in flowers and plants. The white linen tables and chairs reflect the incredible service from all staff. Now Abu did say "take an hour or so over breakfast"  and he was right. A real highlight of the trip. Again the food just kept coming- homemade yoghurt with fruit salad soup (yes soup) pancakes with 5 preserves homemade bread and cake and eggs of your choosing. Unusual by British standards but really delicious nonetheless ( when in Morocco!). Looking down from the terrace the streets are filled with thousands of people and vehicles and carts and horses and motorcycles. It's hard to take in the sheer madness of the non policedanything goes streets. It's really very disconcerting at first but like the souks and the consistent pestering from street vendors you sort of get used to it. It's just part of the experience. I'm not going to ramble on about what to do in Marrakech. It's more fun to find out yourself (helped by Abu)  This review is for Dar Anika . Two more things I would like to single out. After breakfast on our first morning the entire staff came up to the Terrace to sing happy birthday to my wife (in 3 languages) and present her with a stunning birthday cake and a beautiful basket of flowers. I did not ask for this. It was a truly lovely generous gesture and very touching.  Secondly just as we where about to leave for the airport. Abu came over and presented us with a handmade shoulder bag ( made by the on street upholsterers next to the front door). It was filled with sandwiches fruit and bottles of water for our journey home. Again totally unexpected. I have stayed in a few 5 star hotels but never 10 star. It really is that good. Thank you Abu and staff for making my wife's 40th birthday treat unforgettable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We rarely write reviews but Dar Anika was so fantastic we had to make an exception. From the moment we arrived to be greated to a wonderful light meal with a roarring fire ( a rainy day) to when we left after sunning ourselves under a Berber tent on the roof patio with its wonderful views  the hotel and its staff had been exceptional. Its position close to palais le bahia and palais el badil with an indiot-proof straIght 10 minute walk to Jermaa El Fina is ideal. Abu spends so much time to work out with you an ideal itinerary for your stay and the staff could not be more attentive if you were royalty. The breakfasts and evening meals should not be missed and there is freshly pressed orange juice mint tea coffee and excellent cakes always available.  The rooms and the facilities - hamman indoor pool roof garden and patio  etc - are fine but it is the service of the staff which makes this place so extraordinary. I did not believe the other reviews about Dar Anika until we got there but it is as good as they all say.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: New Forest National Park Hampshire, United Kingdom

Review_Title: A cocoon of tranquilty inside the medina.
Review_Text: A lovely relaxing holiday in many ways and most has already been said in other reviews but for us the staff were the highlight an excellent team led by Abu nothing was ever a problem congratulations to all.  For meat eaters we recommend he camel tajine wonderful.  Moandjohn
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Priya R wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Came to Marrakech to celebrate my sister's birthday and we were treated like royalty. Abu was extremely kind and helpful and highlighted the best the city had to offer. The hammam and massage we had were superb - just the ticket after a busy time in the souks!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My husband booked this for my birthday weekend in February and it was such a fantastic treat.From the moment we stepped through the doors we were made to feel so welcome and at home. An oasis of calm in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the medina.The owner Abu and his team have thought of everything from beautiful breakfasts on the rooftop terrace to delicious dinners in front of an open fire an in house hamman and massage service. They also provided us with a welcome service to assist planning your stay in Marrakechactivitiesrestaurant bookings etc.The rooms are beautifully decoratedthe food is amazing and the staff cannot do enough for you.If you want to feel like royalty for a weekend and leave feeling completely relaxedbook this placewe could not fault it and will 100% return here on our next trip to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Just as amazing the second time around
Review_Text: I've just returned from my second stay at Riad Dar Anika and it was just as amazing if not better than the first time around. The staff and management team are attentive the location is amazing the food is amazing & never ending the roof terrace is beautiful the rooms are lovely you can't ask for more. I plan to return again as there is no better place to go when you want to step away from city life and experience something different.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I came to Morrocco with a group of friends and we had the most amazing experience here even from the moment we stepped off the plane. We were greeted with rose petals on our beds and a beautiful set menu that was worth every penny. I even tried camel which is a must whilst here. The staff were very attentive and the owner was very helpful and even giving us a briefing so we knew all the local knowledge. Breakfast was amazing and came in lots of different courses which suited our lazy morning breakfasts. Staff were always on hand when we needed them and provided us with regular cups of mint tea and nibbles. The location was amzaing and we were always only 2 minutes from local tourist attractions and shops to buy goodies from. As a group of girls we felt super safe here. I would highly reccomend this riad over any other.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Amber H wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Mind blown - Oasis in the Red City
Review_Text: Our trip to Marrakech was the best I've ever been on made all the more special by the staff and owners of the Riad dar Anika. Mr Abu gave us (a group of 9 women) great suggestions on places to eat sites to see and safety tips. The food at the Riad was fantastic (I went particularly crazy over the delicious yoghurt and the pancake thingy served at breakfast) and really enjoyed the special dinner we had on the first night (I lost count of how many courses there were).    A well run family business with lots of little luxuries and surprises (ask to meet the pet tortoises). The staff were so attentive and kind and I hope they retain this perfect balance.    I can't wait to go back again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Carol B wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: My husband and I have just returned from a 12 night stay at this lovely boutique hotel. I agree with every positive comment made in other reviews here. Dar Anika really is an outstanding place to stay. After a flight delay we were met at the airport by the hotel's very pleasant driver who took us on the short drive through the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. On arrival in the square outside Dar Anika at about 9pm we were met and escorted into the fragrant candle-lit hotel with soothing music playing in the background. We were greeted by several members of staff and shown to the lovely glass-walled library where rose-water was poured into our hands and warm towels given to dry them. We were then offered a reviving glass of milk with a dish of dates. Our table was already prepared for dinner next to the softly illuminated pool for when we felt ready to eat. The meal consisted of a delicious array of flavours and textures as did all our meals at Dar Anika during our stay and I was in heaven! As another reviewer on here we always stay in 5 star establishments and I have never been made to feel so comfortable and relaxed as I was during our stay at Dar Anika. Every member of staff worked to the highest standards of professionalism whilst also maintaining a warm and welcoming demeanour. The next morning we were met by Abu the owner who spent about an hour finding out about the sort of places that we wanted to visit and giving advice about local customs and places of interest. I was particularly touched that in response to an email that I had sent to the hotel regarding my chemical sensitivities Abu had gone above and beyond anything that I could have hoped for to make sure that my stay at Dar Anika was completely comfortable. Our room suite no. 1 was lovely and nothing was too much trouble during our stay. As Abu said to me "anything is possible". Restaurants were booked for us drivers arranged (who escorted us down the sometimes quite long alleyways right into the restaurants and met us in the restaurant when we were ready to leave) excursions were arranged and advice offered. Our enjoyment and safety in an unfamiliar area was given the highest priority by all the staff at Dar Anika during our stay. If anyone would like to read my other Tripadvisor reviews you will see that I 'tell it like it is' and I would not give such a glowing account unless the standards were especially high as they are here. Thank you to all the staff at Dar Anika for a wonderful holiday. We can't wait to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I stayed one night at this wonderful boutique hotel - service atmosphere room and food was fantastic. I have stayed at 250 + different hotels around the world and non better than this one
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Leanne H wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Just back from a wonderful week in Marrakech 4-11 March. Stayed in a superb boutique hotel Riad Dar Anika. Owners and staff were wonderful and looked after us so well. very relaxing and terrific food. we will definitely be back. Highly recommended 10/10
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Not sure it gets any better than this...
Review_Text: Wonderful modernised Riad (or Dar) just 10 minutes gentle flat walk to the main square and the souks beyond. Taxi can approach to within 10 metres of the door which is also a plus. Room was superb bathroom fine though a little tight but well lit and a good shower breakfast very good. This has been distinctly modernised as opposed to restored but has lost none of its charm for that. Perfectly quiet hard to imagine when you see the enormous bustle going on just metres from the front door and we slept incredibly well (unusual for us!).    The team were in our view the role model for hotel management from the waiters (Khaled you were magnificent) to the front desk and management. When my phone packed up the manager lent me his laptop to keep in the room for a few days then offered to let us take it to our next hotel (3 hours away) for the rest of the trip - 'just get your driver to bring it back sometime'. Whatever we needed they were there for us - we weren't just told where a pharmacy was we were escorted there and back.
