Do let this team pamper you the way we were - we cannot thank them enough for making Marrakech so special.    Also if you have the chance stay in one night for dinner. Traditional fare with a twist but it was quite superb - taste presentation variety service and in enormous quantities too. Do not miss it and their superb team if you have the chance.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter E wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: From the moment of our arrival we were transported into an oasis of peace and hospitality. Our welcome was amazing management and staff could not do enough for us we were thoroughly pampered for the duration of our stay. We were also given a mine of information about where to go and what to see in and around Marrakech and a car was laid on and tables booked for dinner when requested. Our room was a delight covered in rose petals dates and milk set out for us on our return in the evening oranges on the table. The food was delightful portions very generous. the staff make their own bread jam and even delicious yoghurt. We are planning our return visit to Dar Anika already for next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: from the moment we arrived to be welcomed with drinks rose  and rose petalswe were surrounded with care and attention from the hospitable manager Abu to the attentive waiters wanting to provide the best of attention to our needs. As grandparents we were delighted to see how much they enjoyed having a nearly two year old baby making his not always gentle demands on them met.  The Riad itself could not have been bettered for its comfort and cosseting ambience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: raid dar anika! What can I say! This has gotta be by far the best hotel experience ive had from the various holidays ive been on!  From the manager to the staff everyone is so welcoming an treats you like VIP and cater to your needs  I can't praise this hotel and staff enough to my friends and family  And really do recommend to  anyone checking out dar anika on trip advisor! Thank you Abu an a big thank to your lovely staff for making us feel so welcome and safe! I definitely will be back to morocco and definitely staying at raid dar anika again!!! :)

My partner and I have only just got back from a five night stay. I rarely write reviews but this hotel was especially worthy of comment. We were treated like royalty. The service and hospitality were fantastic.  We were greeted by the owner Abo at breakfast who helped construct a program for our stay in Marrakesh. All the recommendations he gave were excellent especially the Azzar restaurant and Richard Branson's hotel for a hamman and spa.  We were given a mobile phone to contact the hotel for any queries or for assistance. This was reassuring and useful. If you feel at all nervous about travelling to Morrocco then this is a good place to stay. Consideration is their forte.  The drivers working for the hotel spoke good English were knowledgable about the area and know the quality of the surrounding restaurants.  The hotel itself is beautiful and spotlessly clean. The bedrooms are gorgeous and comfortable. The hotel has a great roof terrace with views over the surrounding rooftops. a Bedouin tent area sun loungers flower pots and two rampant tortoises ha ha A lovely place to retreat to read or enjoy a meal.  The staff could not be faulted. All were polite friendly courteous and keen to please. The head waiter was fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble. He went the extra mile..  My fiftieth birthday was marked by an unexpected bouquet of flowers birthday cake the staff singing 'Happy Birthday' a fantastic set of suggestions for the day and rose petals in the room. What can I say it was 'WOW!'  The food was excellent. I could not fit it all in. The cakes were great.  We were sad to leave. What more can be said. Thank you Abo and staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We arrived in Marrakech in the early evening with the square outside the hotel still bustling with activity and shown to a very inauspicious looking door. My immediate thought was "This can't be it!" However what a wonderful surprise awaited us when we walked inside - an oasis of peace and calm and understated elegance. From the moment we arrived we received a truly exceptional level of care and attention. My daughter has a number of food intolerances and the staff had researched various ingredients and amended their soup recipe to ensure that she enjoyed her food to the full. Khalid who has been referred to in previous reviews deserves a special mention; he remembers all your likes and dislikes and brought my daughter various alternatives for breakfast each morning so that she had plenty to eat. When I asked him which was his day off he said that it was the following day but that he felt he should really be at the hotel to welcome the new guests. A real gentleman from start to finish. I can't speak highly enough of the owner and the whole staff. They made dinner reservations called taxis gave advice about where to go and what to do; nothing was too much trouble. Any queries or problems were sorted out to my complete satisfaction. Apart from the wonderful breakfasts and evening meal which was one of the best we had during our stay the location is perfect. It's walking distance to most things and you can get a taxi almost outside the door. I'm hoping I can persuade my husband to make a return journey one day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: colin g wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: My wife and I have just returned from a long weekend stay in Marrakech where we stayed at Riad Dar Anika. This place is just amazing. From the moment we arrived we were treated magnificently and I have never stayed in a place with such kind and helpful staff.  The owner is clearly passionate about his business country and food. He's built a great team around him who share his commitment to service. I can and will recommend this Riad to my friends and family. I also plan on returning next year.  I can recommend the car service they provide for the airport pickup it costs a bit more than the local taxi's but you get a better car and won't have a taxi driver tying to rip you off at the destination.  I can also recommend the hotels dinner which we had on the Friday night we arrived it was one of the best meals we had in Marrakech.  Finally my wife and I tried the Riad's Hamman which is smaller than those you get in Turkey but the lady who did it was lovely and used local spices which she mixed up in front of us. We both loved the experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A hidden gem inside the bustling Marrakesh Medina
Review_Text: This was one of the most AMAZING places I have ever stayed at -- truly paradise. A friend and I decided to travel to Morocco and we were so happy that this Riad had availability. They offer the highest level of service I have ever seen -- this was more personal than the service I have received at both the Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons. They truly make you feel like family during your stay and don't just tell you that they care about how much you enjoy Morocco; they actually show you. We were two girls traveling together and different staff took the time to sit with us and make sure we knew how to stay safe walking around in the Medina. One day we were going out to the Ourika Valley and the doorman (even though he didn't know how to tell us in English) stopped us and found someone else to remind us to wear warm clothing so we wouldn't get sick! They gave us amazing advice for bargaining and shopping in the souks. Aside from this the food was impeccable. I highly suggest you enjoy dinner at the Riad. The included breakfast soup and cakes (wonderful afternoon snacks) were divine. The riad itself was beautiful but the people were even more genuine and caring. We will definitely be back soon and highly recommend this riad to all of our friends and family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: AMAZING experience at Riad Dar Anika
Review_Text: From the moment the door of Riad Dar Anika opened we were transformed and embraced into the Marrakech hospitality. The entire staff are so genuine and welcoming it's hard to describe without sounding like a 'paid reviewer'. We are a family of extensive world travellers and have enjoyed many many 5 star hotels. You get 5 star service at those hotels but let me tell you: you have never experienced the graciousness & service of Dar Anika. Authentic. Outstanding. Nothing asked was too much. Abu & his staff organized everything for us. Personal guided tour of the Medina and Souk. Camel rides. Guided driven tour. Dinners at Dar Anika were beyond outstanding. Abu even organized dancers and musicians from the Atlas mountains to entertain all the guests one night. My 11 year old stated "Mom I can't go back". The food was THAT good. If you can impress us with our travel experience a vegetarian and two children - aged 11 & 13 - all of whom had such an amazing experience - we felt we were treated as family (and felt special!). I spoke with the other guests and we all felt the same. I made my decision to book here largely on other fellow TripAdvisor reviewers and I actually thought 'it can't be THAT great'....but it was! (read the other reviews - they were right..) I can tell you this: if you want one of the best experiences you can imagine - book Dar Anika and let Abu and his staff coordinate it all for you. Hammam dinner breakfast tours they did it all and it was an absolute authentic experience and very affordable. Oh did I mention you step outside the Riad and you are right in the centre of the action - within minutes to all the places you want to see. I called my 75 year mother in Canada and told her that her next trip will be to Dar Anika. We will be back. Do yourself a great favor and go here. There are only 12 rooms which makes it feel like you really are 'at home'. We will definitely definitely go back and recommend Dar Anika to everyone without hesitation. Thank you Abu and Khalid (the most kind gracious genuine!) Samir....all of you for making this experience a memory we will cherish forever.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Koen D wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Dar Anika made our trip to Marrakech more than memorable. From the moment of arrival till our departure we were hosted like kings and queens. Things I will remember: a very individual service aimed at who we are and what we wanted to do in Marrakech excellent food (be sure to dine at the Riad it is not the cheapest meal but it is certainly worth it) and the divine beauty and atmosphere of the place. On the flight back we were already contemplating on our next visit back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Gillian W wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: We so enjoyed our four nights at Riad Dar Anika that we dropped by briefly to say farewell on our way from Essaouira to the airport three days later. The whole staff led by Samir are very friendly and welcoming. This was a quiet understated civility and they couldn't have been more thoughtful or helpful. Samir's suggestions on what to see in Marrakesh were very useful and his map was invaluable. His recommendations for where to eat proved wholly reliable and the establishments clean and pleasant. Our bedroom (number 3) had all we could want right down to cotton buds and it was mercifully quiet. We were delighted with the scores of crimson rose petals scattered all over the bed and even the bath when we first saw the room. That said it all - a charming introduction to the colourful city. The roof garden was worth seeing despite February weather. A very kind touch was the provision of a picnic lunch when we were leaving; we were relieved not to have to test the cooking at the highway busstop. Best of all the attentiveness and care of the waiters especially the head waiter Khalid was highly professional and perfectly executed and made us feel very pampered! The location of this Riad is just right in the Medina at the mouth of a minor souk with all the local activity at the doorstep. However it is very near a big road accessible by taxi and only a few hundred metres from the Jemaa el Fna. Most of the places we wanted to see were within walking distance. We were recommending this Riad to strangers before we had even left the country; we are convinced it couldn't be bettered.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Looking forward to visiting this place again
Review_Text: Two friends and I arranged a girls weekend in Marrakech at Dar Anika for mid January. Everything about the weekend was just what I needed to forget my post Christmas holiday blues. From the minute we stepped out of the baggage area at the airport our driver was waiting for us to take us directly to the Riad.  The Riad has an excellent location - situated close to the medina with the square only a 10 minute walk away however secluded and private enough so you felt as if you were in your own secret garden. Once you walk into the Riad you will understand exactly what I mean as it feel likes you've left the city behind and entered a relaxing indoor oasis complete with an indoor swimming pool. But the real treat for me was the comfortable lounge area and fireplace - it quickly became my favourite place to hangout.  The owner Abu greeted us upon arrival and arranged a lovely welcome lunch on the roof top. After relaxing for a bit we each had spa treatments. I recommend getting the hammam followed by a full body massage a perfect combination. Total treatment lasts about 3 hours and is worth it.  We finished our first day with dinner in the Riad - fish for me as I don't eat red meat while my friends sampled the lamb and camel tangines. Dinner was delicious and bountiful so prepare for healthy portions of delicious side dishes.  Breakfast the next day was amazing - pancakes fresh bread eggs made to order freshly squeezed orange juice fruit yogurt and more. A great start to the day.  Abu helped us to plan our weekend which was a mixture of shopping at the souks dinner at recommended restaurants nightlife at popular clubs in the area and a private outdoor cooking class near Atlas mountain where we prepared our own tangines. He even arranged our transportation during the day and evening as needed so we had a driver we could contact when we needed to get back to the Riad.  We ended our long weekend with a second spa treatment before heading to the airport.  Thank you Abu and the wonderful friendly and attentive staff at Dar Anika for providing us with such a fabulous girls weekend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Claire B wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: My husband and I have just come back from a 4 night 5 day stay in Marrakech at the Riad Dar Anika and I cannot recommend this highly enough. The staff were outstanding and couldn't do enough to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable.    The Riad was beautiful and well placed for exploring the city. The food was outstanding and to say there was plenty of it is an understatement! Expect a 5 or 6 course breakfast plus complimentary cakes with your drinks throughout the day!    The manager and owner both took time out to check we were enjoying our stay and point us in the right direction for good food as well as arrange a driver for us. More than anyone else though Khaled the head waiter was amazing! Can also recommend the Hamman and massage and the Atlas Mountains trip! Thank you all for a wonderful trip!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patrick H wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: We experienced a VIP treatment and the staff really helped us with everything from places to visit reservations their driver that picked us up wherever we where repairing our travel bag putting on our own fire place in the room snacks with every drink and don't forget the wonderful diner we had at the Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a very pleasant experience with Riad Dar Anika. The staff was very good in helping us with transportation arrangements. The riad itself was really nice and the location was great. Unfortunately we had a very short stay but we definitely would like to go there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This was my first visit to Marrakech and the second for my travelling companions. We had chosen the Riad Dar Anika as my friends had met the owner on their last visit and he invited them back to say at his hotel on their next visit as their last hotel experience had not lived up to their expectations.  Upon arrival we were greeted by the hotel concierge and escorted to the roof top for a welcome meal. The view at the top of the hotel was beautiful. I could see the Souk and the hustle of the busy road under. Each of us was presented with a red rose during our welcome meal and the owner came up later to welcome us to his hotel. After we were taken to our rooms were the theme of red roses carried on. Petals were carefully placed on our beds and in the bathroom. I couldn't help but think this would be perfect for a romantic getaway.  We stayed at the Riad Dar Anika for 3 nights.  If staying you must experience the full body scrub and massage. Two and a half hours of sheer pleasure and relaxation. Bring your swimming costume or go in naked as I did.  This was my first time eating authentic Moroccan food and I was not disappointed. Make sure you are starving hungry because there are many many delectable dishes to try. I had the Camel...the meat just fell off the bone. My friend is vegetarian and she found lots on the menu to satisfy her appetite.  The staff are friendly and cannot do enough for you. I felt like a princess.  If you are lost as to where to visit the hotel staff will help you. There is a huge arrange of places to visit and some amazing night clubs and restaurants. The hotel will arrange taxis to take you to each place if you wish.  Riad Dar Anika is beautiful. My favourite place to sit and relax was the living room with fireplace. Relaxing chairs and a variety of games to play if you don't feel like going anywhere.  When I come back to Marrakech with that someone special I will definitely stay at the Riad Dar Anika. The hotel is great for friends and families but I can imagine it would be magical for couples.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Tom V wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Dar Anika is a gem and place of solace among the craziness that is Marakesh. From the minute you walk in the wonderful staff is welcoming and attentive. The structure has amazing attention to detail with an intentional architecture that pays tribute to the nearby 19th century Bahia Palace. Its like a Moroccan Architectural Digest showpiece. The glass-enclosed library is museum-like and features a lovely marble fireplace (we were there in winter) and interesting antiques. There is a lovely rooftop terrace to view the bustle and have a drink. Speaking of which Dar Anika stocks some fantastic Moroccan wines. We know wine and several of the Moroccan wines are absolutely quality. Dar Anika is owned by two lovely brothers (which we found personally important to stay in locally owned Riads) whom are very interesting and aspiring sommeliers. Lastly the location of Dar Anika is perfect in that its not in the heart of the crazy medina but rather centrally located on the south side so there is much to see within a 20 minute walk in all directions. From the food to the hammam Dar Anika is a great place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed in October 2014 for 4 nights & this review is long overdue! Where can I start.. amazing in every way. I booked this as a birthday surprise for my husband and it was just perfect. A beautifully clean oasis just minutes from the souks. Marrakech is magical and so was Dar Anika. The room downstairs wasn't to our liking on the first night and they changed our room immediately the next day. We were made to feel like royalty. The amazing ice cream cake staff singing happy birthday and champagne bottle provided by Dar Anika was beyond my expectations my husband and I were blown away by the hospitality we received. In addition the daily mint tea water and cakes were a real treat and much needed after long days in the Marrakech heat.  I'd like to thank Samir and all the staff for a very memorable and special stay and for making my husband's birthday just perfect. We'd also like to wish Samir all the luck for his forthcoming wedding. We hope to see some photos! :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a great family holiday over New Year with the Dar Anika. The staff were excellent and really feels like a family - they were leading the charge on the New Years Eve celebrations. The website does not do the hotel justice - it is really a fantastic place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I stayed 2nights in this hotel. Everything worked out perfectly.  All of their staff were very helpful and nice/friendly.  We were very happy with their service.    Room was nice and clean. Every time we were out and in. Room was always cleaned and organized. They also left some snack for us in the room.    Up on arrival they offered nice moroccan tea and snacks. As we arrived mid day before check in time they let us stay in the lounge area with their nice refreshment service. Also gave us very informative briefing about the city and where to visit.    We also reserved hammam and massage service. I only got hammam experience which was very relaxing. I liked their natural product they used on my body. It was absolutely relaxing and soothing for my skin. My friends got massage service. They also seem to very happy about the massage service. We were very satisfied.    We had ordered dinner one night which was also very great. They offered the belly dancing show prior to dinner which it was very entertaining. Dinner quality was absolutely perfect. Food was very authentic moroccan.    I cannot say anything more than just "perfect". I felt like i was treated as the princess! :)    Will definitely come back to this hotel if i come to Marrakech again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Stephen R wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: The staff were brilliant and could not do enough for you.The manager gave us great advise and used his knowledge of the area.The facilities were second to none and the food was exceptional.We will definately be giving the Dar Anika another visit or two.Definately one of the best stay's I have ever had.The local people were very friendly and the owner came to say goodbye which was lovely and he gave us a packed lunch to take to the airport.  Steve & Deb from Sunderland
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Top Class Hospitality.. It just get's better, better & better with each stay
Review_Text: Just got back from a stay at Dar Anika.. Fabulous. Our 2nd visit & just loved it we were treated like princesses. I love this place as its so versatile long weekend away with the girls or romantic get away with partner it hits the bill. The service is brilliant & reinforced with the no tipping staff culture of the Riad all guests have the same superior service as standard. Fresh roses in the rooms no end to refreshments home made cakes & fruit. We were well fed. On this visit we contemplated booking in with a well known spa in the top 3 for marrakech however we tried the hammam & massage package at Dar Anika & it was brilliant. We loved the fact after the hammam we chilled out near the fire was prepared a organic healthy lunch on the spur played solitaire before our massage. This was priceless time was not an issue & booked in again on the day of our departure. On our last visit Abu had put togeather an excellent itinery so we had exhausted most of the best places to see eat club & drink in Marrakech. However he pulled it out again on this visit from organising dinner at Palais Namasker to private cooking lessons with a prestigious chef on his farm. Abu will suggest activities to your taste activity level & budget. Nothing was any trouble you just have to ask & it's done with a smile. The staff are so lovely attentive & patient. Dar Anika have thier own drivers you book out & most reccommended for evenings out rather then taxis. We had the same driver each night & on one of the nights we clubbed & bar hopped our driver was excellent & patient & all this for surprisingly great value for money. On our arrival night we had dinner at the Riad fabulous again we each had a main of the menu inc the Camel & were not dissappointed 5* organic food from their farm with excellent service. Overall for the high level of service quality of food drinks & beautiful surroundings its sure  value for money & worth it. This is probably the only place we will book on any return visits as with all the extras you get when  you stay here they are priceless & would now be dissapointed with anything less.

Review_Date: Neil B wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: We stayed for three nights. The Hotel was lovely and all the staff were charming and friendly and put themselves out to look after us and make our stay special. We felt like members of a large and very happy family. We could not believe how the room was decorated with Rose petals and Roses; such a lovely touch. The hotel was light quiet and everything you could hope for. There was always a log fire burning so it was never cold and in the evening candles and soft lighting created a sense of well being. Despite our poor French the staff and management spoke good English and put us at our ease.The food was excellent plentiful beautifully cooked and presented exquisetly. The manager helped us to plan our stay which made a massive difference to us for which we are very grateful. The Hammam and massage were wonderful experiences and not to be missed.  We were very touched by the surprise birthday cake beautiful bouquet of Roses and the lovely celebration songs which we thoroughly enjoyed.  As a final impression the Iniana Jones bag of food for the plane was a very thoughtful touch.  We would recommend this hotel without hesitation and we would like to extend our thanks to everyone in Dar Anika who made our stay so very special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Araceli Parres S wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: The best óption yo visit marrakech
Review_Text: In the middle of the Medina you will found the perfect place for everything you want to: family with your cuople business... The team si gonna try to do their best in order to make you feel great even better you could wish. The marrakech experience is enriched by the team And spirit of riad dar anika.

Review_Title: Great location, beautiful place, perfect staff service
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika for a week end. I've never been in a hotel with such helpful and caring staff. The rooms were nice and clean and the place is beautifully decorated and full of light. The roof top is a plus. It's also perfectly located - it's close to the entrance of the medina so you can reach it by car and it's 5 minutes walk from the Jema El'f'na square.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: First i need to clarify that we did not stay overnight at the hotel but only spend the New Year dinner and celebrations and with this occasion we saw the hotel rooms service.  Location- excellent. On the "quieter" side in between the souks and the up and coming jewish quarter close to batha palace on a very nice street  Service- excellent beginning to end. The New Year party was small and intimate 10 guests at best but the staff made such an effort to create a party atmosphere with music dance and a little show (loved the "candle woman"). We felt like we were in someone's home it was very genuine. Even the cooks and cleaning staff joined at midnight! Very special.  Dinner- food was good but plain- would have preferred something more festive than tangine for 150 eur/person; i guess we had too much tangine over the 7 days in morocco for 30- 40 dirham not to feel a little cheated. I would encourage some creativity for special occasions.  Hotel: lobby library lounge rooftop terrace- all outstandingly decorated a blend of traditional and stylish moroccan with some amazing antique pieces.  Room- we needed to use the restroom during dinner and oddly enough we used a guest room (guests were away). To start with I wouldn't have liked for anyone to enter my room and use my toilet while i was not there; ok. I understand they must have had some malfunctioning and the staff were trying to be accomodating...still it was a used guest room. That aside it was a small guest room rather plain vanilla; the room at our own Riad (Itrane) which was about 30% cheaper (Anika was full at the time of the reservation) was about twice as big and definitely more luxurious (e.g we had private rooftop access larger bath little livingroom) so we felt that "accidentally " we scored a much better deal.  Regardless of the few hiccups- Dar Anika is a very special place especially because of the people- truly great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Dream Come True in this 6 Star Riad
Review_Text: I don't normally write reviews although I have probably stayed in several dozen hotels reviewed by others on this site.    So why was I tempted to write this?    So that you know that Dar Anika is a pearl of absolute beauty and hospitality in the heart of Marrakesh.    The Riad is beautiful. It's authentic. The meal we ate there during the very first evening (highly recommended) was a multi course feast for the senses and the best food we had during our stay in Morocco. The in hotel massage is professional and relaxing to the point you may fall asleep during it (which I did).    All that is great and in itself would justify a five star review but the real distinctness of this hotel lies something else - in it's staff and for that I would award a sixth star if it was only possible.    Samir Fatwa and the Team are there to cater to your every wish spoken or otherwise. Celebrating our anniversary I enquired about the cost of one of their magnificent suites which was vacant at that time. The second day Samir offered a free upgrade free of charge for three nights just because he knew we were celebrating a special occasion we liked it and he wanted to treat us - show me another hotel were this happens.    But that's just one example. On a regular basis the staff go out of their way to make you feel blissful. Whether it's small complimentary evening treats mint tee and cake throughout the day reservations at restaurants guided tours or booking transfer they aim to please and do it well.    During our second night the Staff surprised us with a special anniversary cake and a bottle of champagne!    On the last day Samir even equipped us with lunch for our trip back and gave us small gifts.    We already miss this wonderful hotel and the people who work there and hope as many people will be able to have this fantastic experience.    Trust this review and have a wonderful stay at Dar Anika.    Alex & Alex
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Let me start with the negatives.........  Now that done let me enlighten you on what I consider to be one of the nicest places I've ever stayed at.  We arranged for their driver to collect us and although we could have took a taxi at a much cheaper rate the luxury of having someone greet us and take the care to look after our needs was well worth it. He drove through what I can only describe as the equivalent of Piccadilly circus with the lights out. Drivers going in all directions kamikaze motorcyclists popping up from nowhere pedestrians crossing all over the place but he got us there in one piece.  We arrived in the hustle and bustle of the square with its noise dust beggars and all when the driver knocked at the door of the Riad. When the door opened we were presented with a tranquil peaceful oasis. Very well appointed and welcoming. A small pool a loung with roaring fire relaxing seating areas. We were welcomed by very friendly staff who served us with tea dates and other delicacies. We were then shown to our room which had all the necessary amenities. But it was decked in rose petals and the effect was just amazing.  We ate our first meal at the Riad and what a treat that was. The food never stopped coming and by the time the main course came along i just couldn't eat it. Delicious.  The breakfasts were truly amazing and served with such grace and politeness.  Samir the manager sat down with us on the first morning and gave us a run down on the dos and don'ts of the city. Very valuable advice. He pointed out where to go and what to avoid. Never did he try and sell us anything.  I had a massage at the hotel and thoroughly recommend this.  There is free wifi in the Riad  There is a rooftop terrace where there are sun loungers and dining tables and relaxing chairs. A real oasis.  The hotel is situated in a perfect location with all the tourist attractions within a 5/10 min walk.  We were there in winter time and the hotel provided without request hot water bottles and electric radiator which came in very handy.  On leaving we were offered free use of their driver to go to the airport and a packed lunch free of charge. Such a nice touch.  I highly recommend this hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Accommodation and service excellence is business as usual in this comfortable well staffed Riad.  The added value gained through professional advice from Samir and his team in both recommending and organising day and evening trips enhanced our four day vacation in Marrakech.  Cleanliness comfort security and an excellent location allowed us to maximise our activities from this location in Madina.  All requests for information or assistance to Hallid and the staff were efficiently met promptly.  Breakfast quality quantity and speciality deserves specific mention together with the opportunity to be served indoors or on a split level terrace area to enjoy the morning sun.A full range Moroccan dinner menu is available which will satisfy all visitors.  The owners of the Dar Anika are often involved gaining feedback from customers and also welcoming guests into a great holiday environment. The staff go the extra mile to afford satisfaction  some examples- hot water bottles mini snacks not to forget the very enjoyable unsolicited packed lunch provided foc as we were checking out of the Riad Dar Anika.  Great value for money.  Charles.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Dar Anika is a beautiful Riad which is perfectly situated within the Medina for access to many places of interest being only a few minutes walk from the main square and the souks. The food is amazing breakfasts are a feast brought to your table with an array of freshly baked breads fresh orange juice and jams. There are many other items also just too many to mention. We had booked dinner here on our first evening. It was authentic Moroccan cuisine fresh vegetables succulent meat and many courses having the delicate taste of the beautiful spices. There is the option to have meals on the leafy rooftop terrace and enjoy the sunshine.    On arrival we were shown to the library which is a lovely room with a wall of glass overlooking a dining area and the indoor pool. Here we were served small glasses of chilled milk dates small pastries and delicious hot mint tea. I'm not normally a fan of a herb type tea but this Moroccan speciality is delicious. This was a complimentary welcome and an introduction to a wonderful stay in Dar Anika.    Our bedroom was beautiful spotlessly clean white bedlinen covered in rose petals a tray of fresh fruit and authentically Moroccan in character with its beautiful lamps and lighting.    Now for the reason for my heading. My husband and I are fairly extensively travelled world-wide and never have we been looked after with such genuine care and attention. Every member of staff gives personal prompt attention to requirements. Nothing is too much trouble and we were constantly reminded to ask for anything which would make our holiday more pleasurable. The reason for this is because the owners and senior management take a personal interest of care in their guests. I've got to mention Khalid the head waiter and a very gracious man whose main interest was to please and assist in any way possible.    Samir the manager spent private time with us arranging the itinerary for our whole stay. He gave us a map and suggested places we should visit and this he did. Some places were within walking distance and these were marked on our map. Other trips were suggested and he arranged for us to have our own dedicated driver who took us to places of interest during the day and various restaurants in the evening Lebanese Moroccan and French etc. All expenses while we were out meals and entrance fees we paid while we were there and the charges for the driver were added to our bill at the Riad. We had a lovely driver who was happy to wait or return after our expeditions and the cost was not overly expensive and well worth the comfort of knowing we would have a safe and prompt return to Dar Anika.    It was a lovely gesture on our last day to be given a lovely Moroccan bag containing a picnic with sandwiches and fresh fruit for our journey home.    Our stay at Dar Anika was faultless and services were above and beyond anything we have experienced at any other place we have visited. I would highly recommend staying at Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tanya K wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: Great location and great ambience and charm  The staff where amazing kind friendly and helpful nothing was a problem what ever we needed they did for you.  Everything that was recomendid by the manager was 1st class    It was like home away from home    Big thank you to everyone at Riad Dar Anika
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Fantastic location and great ambience and character. Staff was superior with their services and highly recommend this place. I would highly recommend this place to either families or individuals wanting quick access to the Medina and local restaurants.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: the people who works there was so kind at our arrive they gave us many attentions they offered us typical snacks  and any informations about Marrakech. Service was always perfect also the manager was very friendly !! The riad is near the main place of marrakech Jamma El Fna only 5 minuts by foot and also the taxi parking was in front of the riad.  In the riad there was a peaceful atmosphere the fire in the common big room in front of the pool very nice many candles and typical maroccan lights. Beautiful was also the roof top where is possible eat something under the hot sun or sunbathing on the beds. The rooms are warm and clean with flowers and little colored windows very nice!!! Dar Anika is a special beautiful oasis of peace between the sounds perfumes and colors in the heart of the medina!!

Review_Date: Steve W wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: Great location fantastic food great recommendations for places to visit. Really enjoyed the Hammam experience and customer service was outstanding. The room had beautiful Moroccan decor and bed was extremely comfortable. Will return with family soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kai F wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: This was a surprise honeymoon for my wife and I booked this Riad based on reviews of others.    We have been positively surprised by all service provided the room the food and the staff. I booked dinner some time before arrival and I must say it was the best dinner we had sitting on the roof top and hearing the slight buzz from the city. One night we had a local musician playing for the guests dining on top a great experience as well.    We can recommend everything from the massages dinner private on-site Hamam the small pool etc. The best for me were the breakfasts in the warm sun on the roof-top however those I won't forget in a long time.    The location is somewhat better better than other Riads since its not in the middle of the old town but rather just on the side. Benefits are that you can reach it by taxi its less crowded and gives you easier access to journeys outside the souks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic stay (but beware of pricey car service)
Review_Text: We had a wonderful 4-night stay at the Riad Dar Anika in early December. All of the staff are very warm and welcoming from the moment you step inside. We arrived from the airport with the taxi arranged through the hotel and were ushered into this sanctuary from the busy street outside. Before taking us to our rooms we were served cookies and tea in front of a toasty fire just off the main foyer. The room itself was very clean with fresh rose petals everywhere. We were welcomed this way every day when coming back to the riad. When we left they surprised us with packed sandwiches and water for our trip... such a lovely way to end our vacation!    Pros: amazing staff FANTASTIC breakfast with more food/drink than you could possibly eat delicious dinner (much better than the other riads that the hotel offered for us to try! They actually shop for the food only after you've booked that evening's meal so everything is super fresh... and we could never finish all the food!) beautiful rooftop terrace for breakfast/lounging convenient location (5-8 minute walk) to the Jemaa el Fnaa the Koutoubia and the souks    Cons: super expensive car rides... if you're worried about safety the riad's private car service is a great option but it'll cost you >10x the price of a normal taxi. They charge 300 dirhams ($30) for a 10 minute ride to a riad for dinner which would otherwise cost max 20 dirhams ($2). They don't tell you this when they offer to book it for you so it was a bit of a shock to us when we received it on the hotel bill...    All in all a great stay -- would've loved a heads up about the expensive car rides though
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christopher C wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: We were in Marrakech on a cold and wet Saturday at the end of November having come from Casablanca. The wet weather was good for Marrakech which needed rain but not for us and we could have had a miserable visit. But the Riad was very warm and welcoming. The staff were most agreeable and our room was excellent. We were at the lowest part of the season but that made no difference. We had an excellent hamam and massage for the two of us in the hotel (well worth it). We were directed to another riad for dinner (because we wanted to go out) which was first class We thoroughly recommend it. Good value too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The best was the service they do whatever they can to make you feel very comfortable. Beatiful riad it is like a small palace in the middle of the old town. Great location 5min from Le Grand Place. I really recommend this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Dinah D wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: We stayed at the Riad Dar Anika it being the first time we had been away for Christmas.Having been collected from the airport by taxi arranged by the hotel we arrived in a very busy street but were taken to the door of the hotel our luggage having been carried by a member of the hotel staff. The door opened and it was like walking through into an oasis of calm. The inside of the Riad is just stunning with hanging plants and a peaceful inner courtyard. When we arrived we were greeted by Samir the manager and his staff with rose water to wash our face and hands and given mint tea milk and dates. We were then shown our room where rose petals had been arranged on our bed and in the bathroom. Very beautiful. From that moment on the service and attention to our every comfort was first class. We had dinner there the first night as we arrived in the evening. The food was absolutely delicious and very plentiful. We had dinner in the sitting room where our table had been laid. There was an open fire and the whole setting was so beautiful. The following morning after breakfast which consisted of many courses again including cake fruit yogurt eggs pancakes honey jams and freshly squeezed orange juice which we took on the rooftop overlooking the medina Samir met with us and told us the best places to see and eat and also advised on best way to walk through the souk and marking everything on a map for us. We also had a taxi driver to take us one day to see the sights and one evening to take us to dinner in the Nouveau Ville which is the modern part of Marrakech. Would also recommend the massage at the hotel. Very relaxing and wonderful for the skin.We had our Christmas Day dinner in the hotel and again the meal was fantastic with the waiting staff being very attentive and so welcoming. When we left on Boxing Day morning Samir gave us each a bag with a packed lunch for our journey home.We would certainly recommend the Riad Dar Anika and are looking forward to returning there sometime. Many thanks to Samir and all of his staff for making our stay such a memorable one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a wonderful relaxing week in Riad Dar Anika. Our host Samir and his thoughtful & considerate staff made our stay a pleasure.  Samir was very helpful in offering advice of what to see and recommending places to eat for lunch and evening meal. We particularly enjoyed Café Arab Cozi Bar Café des Epices and Terrace des Epices. He also organised trips for us to the Atlas mountains Essaouira and to a half day cooking course. We used the services of the Riad's driver to get us to and from the evening restaurants saving us the hassle of using local taxis.  The Riad is close to the bustling Medina but very quiet and peaceful once you get behind it's enormous front door and into the very welcoming inner courtyard. Most rooms are on the balcony level and a sneak peak in a few of them revealed them all to equally well appointed.  The excellent breakfast was served on the sunny rooftop terrace.  The Riad has it's own hammam. Definitely an experience one should try at least once. We didn't use the swimming pool but could see how inviting it would look on hot summer days.  As one other reviewer said "they will spoil you rotten". They certainly did!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A calm oasis filled with generous people
Review_Text: From the moment we stepped through the carved doors of Dar Anika to the regretful time they last closed on our reluctant backs our stay was wonderful. Our room (a long sought twin) was spacious and very clean with a beautiful bathroom filled with argon oil soap and chocolate scented shampoo. The beds were scattered with rose petals and fruit water and biscuits were laid out lest we ever got hungry. The rest of the riad was very beautiful from the ceder ceilinged sitting room where we sat by the fire to the sun and plant filled terrace where we ate breakfast in the morning. In true Morroccan style it was the food and the people that stood out for us. From Leila's greeting with roses milk dates cake tea and biscuits to Samir's comprehensive guide to attractions and eating from the fresh cake that Halima made each day and that was served to us by silent smiling young men to the packed lunch that she provided us with on our way to the airport from the money changing they helped us with to the argon oil and spices that they gifted us with on our departure. There was nothing more we could have asked for to make our stay more enjoyable and having been to Marrakech several times before I can recommend Dar Anika completely whole heartedly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I visited this Riad with my sisters as part of a 40th birthday treat. What can I say other than from start to finish we were made to feel so welcome and special! The hospitality was exceptional. When we arrived we were greeted with roses rose scented hot towels and of course Morroccan tea milk dates and lots of lovely sweets. When we were taken to our rooms we were amazed at how beautifully authentic they were. I loved the organic products in the bathroom my hair was so silky with the shampoo. In terms of location I would say we were very well placed. Just 10 minutes to the left took us to the Jemaa al Fanaa - the main market square to the right we were able to walk to The Koutoubia mosque and the Palace gardens. If we wanted a taxi the taxi rank was also just a few minutes to the right of the hotel. A tip - just agree the price with the taxi driver beforehand.  The hotel were helpful in suggesting where best to eat so do make sure you take on board what they recommend. They were also able to provide a driver to take us to and from the restaurants (there was a charge for this service however).  I guess the best part was being surprised by a birthday cake and a lovely bouquet of flowers by the hotel staff. I was in tears I just didn't expect it!  There is also a pool at the Riad which my sisters and I used one evening. As it was cold they heated it for us. Do be sure to let the hotel know when you want to use it if going in winter because they will get it to the right temperature for you.  When we left the hotel we were each given a bag with a packed lunch and a free bottle of Argan oil. I think you will agree that it does not get much better than this!    Another quick tip..if you want to go for a hammam the one on site is good but the best one is the Heritage spa. You will need to book this in advance so ask the reception staff to do this for you. In fact if you want to book anything the reception will do this for you.  Also if you take the three village tour wear comfortable climbing shoes - it can get steep and slippery as you get higher up the mountains. The view is definitely worth a trip so don't miss out.  A special mention to Samir and Leila who made each day of our stay informative and wonderfuel. Also to the breakfast staff who made our 7 course breakfasts on the terrace a royal experience.    This riad is a gem. Don't miss out especially if you are celebrating a birthday or anniversary. They will spoil you rotten!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Just entering to the hotelwe were welcomed very nicely and we fell like at home during our stay.  The hotel has a great location at the beginning of medinaand can walk to Jamaa el Fanaa within 5-10 mins. Samir and every staff person was welcomingattentive and friendly .Breakfasts and the meal we had at the Dar Anika were so special. Thanks so much to Dar Anika team for making our stay superb!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sonia O wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: The staff at this hotel really know how to pamper their guests. From the moment you are greeted at the airport by their courteous driver to the moment you leave you are treated like royalty at this charming and well-located hotel. The rooms have amazing decoration comfortable beds and free wifi. I don't know many hotels where they prepare you a packed lunch for your excursions and give you a mobile phone to carry with you in case of an emergency even without asking. Simply awesome!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: George M wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: The most amazing service you could ever receive. Great central location beautiful and charming hotel and the best personal service you could ask for. The hotel arranged several trips for me and my wife to wonderful places which meant we did not have to worry about any of the logistics. Would highly recommend sticking to the hotel itinerary rather than venturing on your own. Thanks to Samir the hotel manager and all the staff for making our stay simply magnificent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great Location right at the beginning of the Medina; just after entering we were welcomed very nicely and during the whole stay we always felt treated individually and specially. Thanks for the great time we could spend at Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The most amazing place to stay with amazing hospitality
Review_Text: Me and my sisters have just returned from a long weekend at Dar Anika and being a frequent traveler I can easily say this was one of the most hospitable homely and luxurious stays ever. We were celebrating one of my sister's 40th birthday and they had all left their children at home to relax and unwind from life.    The moment we arrived Leila (staff) gave us fresh (literally fresh) goats milk and dates. We were then given rose oil to freshen our faces and a wet towel followed my Moroccan tea and biscuits. THEN we were led to our beautiful rooms which were flourishing with rose petals everywhere. The room decor was beautiful and authentic for a true Moroccan experience.    Our breakfast was one of the biggest highlights and it felt like a 10 course meal oozing with freshness and quality.    Before we got there I informed them that it was my sister's 40th birthday and so they even surprised her (and me) with a cake and bunch of flowers making the trip even more special for her.    Whenever we wanted something a recommendation help snacks etc they would be readily available and never seemed short fused if we ever went overboard. One could easily just relax in this Riad and not feel the need to do anything else but maybe stroll through the market alley to end up into Jamaa el Fanaa within 5-10 mins.    The cutest part was; they prepared lunch bags for us with sandwiches and fruit (and now I'll be recycling the bag as an everyday lunch bag!) on our departure back to London.    It was truly a beautiful experience and I'll definitely be returning here :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: As soon as we came out of arrivals the driver of the riad was waiting for us even though we were stuck at immigration for forty minutes. On our arrival to the riad we were welcomed by the elegant and charming staff. The rooms were cleaned three times a day the choice of breakfast is fantastic served on the roof terrace. We had dinner twice on our four day trip the food was the best we had in Marrakech. They were very helpful in organising excursions. Next time we come to Marrakech we will definitely be back to Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Julie S wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Title: Wonderful people, beautiful Riad, and a great location
Review_Text: We were invited to stay with our family at Riad Dar Anika for a week. Dar Anika is beautiful the decor is lovely and having it to ourselves was just wonderful. Each guest room is unique. Samir and every staff person was welcoming attentive friendly and always made us feel at home. Every morning they served us a wonderful breakfast and were waiting at the door to send us off with a bottle of water as we left with our guide to visit various sites museums and souks. We were served several great dinners in their elegant courtyard. The location is great as the markets begin right out the door Jemaa el Fna is about an 8-10 minute walk and the airport is a 20 minute ride away. I am not exaggerating when I say all of us truly enjoyed this Riad and the people we met there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Kevin F wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Title: Great location and even better service
Review_Text: Went to Marrakech on a business trip and stayed at Dar Anika for three nights. The location was very close to the markets and Jemaa el Fna but was tucked away and quiet once inside. The service was excellent and attentive; cold lemon water and mint tea after returning from my conference each day fantastic breakfast and smiling faces. It even rained one morning and as I was walking out the door they offered me an umbrella to use that day; it is the little things that matter the most.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: George W wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Our family took the Dar Anika for an entire week just us. The facility is beautiful intimate and located well in the Medina - a short walk to the square and the souk. But people have more to do with an experience and the staff of the Dar Anika were just outstanding. They said: while you are here this is your home so relax and enjoy. The food in Morocco is really good and the meals we had at the Dar Anika were special. Just really good food and service. So if you could give a score here of six or more we would do it. The staff just worked their tails off to make our visit a pleasure and they succeeded. GSW
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: The nicest staff in Marrakech! A lovely, comfy Riad.
Review_Text: We rented this entire Riad for a family vacation and it could not have been a better experience from the warm service to the comfy rooms and lovely common areas. There was nothing they wouldn't have done to make us feel at home the service from Samir's staff was exemplary and we appreciated there hard work to handle all out needs. We can't wait to go back and visit this amazing place and city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Hayley B wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Title: Amazing! Best place we've ever stayed!
Review_Text: Our stay at Riad Dar Anika was perfect from the moment we stepped into the hotel! The owner and his staff are so welcoming and attentive! First evening we had an amazing massage and dinner on the roof terrace which was unforgettable. Can't wait to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gregory N wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Just amazing. From the moment we arrived it was just fantastic. The room was perfect. The staff were friendly and very attentive. No request was too big. Was perfect for a couple. Great location.  The Riad has it's own hammam spa which was spectacular. The owner organised a packed lunch for our journey to the airport.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Timothée M wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Everything is perfect especially the hotel staff!  They are extremely kind and at your listening.  The hotel is very beautiful well located in the center of Marrakech (Medina) and clean.  We spent just 3 days at Marrakech but this journey has been unbelievable!

Review_Title: Beautiful riad, easy access to main medina areas, fabulous staff
Review_Text: Website photos are a good reflection of the beauty and intimacy of this small road (12 rooms) plus lovely roof terrace. The staff are amazing and really provide superior service. Easy to get to by taxi from the airport so no dragging of suitcases through narrow medina streets. Within 5 mins walk of the palace and 10mins straight walk (important!) up to the main square and the souks. Plenty of restaurants nearby though I'd recommend one night at least eating at the riad as the set menu was truly fantastic and the best meal we had. I would definitely stay here again they made you feel like family and were extremely attentive to any needs you might have. Stunning thank you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Wow. We were getting married and they met us at the door with a rose rose petals sprinkled on the bed and later upgraded our room. Didnt seem phased by the fact we arrived very stressed after driving in Moroccan traffic. They had prepared a special cake for us and a bouquet of roses and lilies on the breakfast table. We were looking for supplies for a trip across the Sahara and Ab the kind proprietor pointed us to everything we needed. The only things we couldn't find were towels and he sold us some of his at a mere $0.10 each; and a coffee plunger so they gave us one of theirs as a present. They even packed us a picnic lunch when we left which many hours later with no restaurants in sight was a godsend. Only recommendation I'd have is if you are driving figure out a way to have someone meet you in Marrakech to show you the way as it was hard to find and difficult to drive right up to. We had to park a short way away. Thanks Dar Anika team for making our stay superb!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard K wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: We stopped here for a couple of nights on our way from Ireland to Mauritania for our desert wedding. It was to be our last chance for a luxurious stop and it did not disappoint! It was difficult to find driving a RHD Landcruiser fully for desert travel in the crowded evening but once we arrived it was like a taste of heaven. Beautiful building with amazing common area we were greeted with roses milk tea and sweets. Ab (spelling?) the manager was so amazing and helpful as were all the staff. We were on a bit of a treasure hunt to collect some necessities before hitting the desert including yoga mats a shovel teapot coffee pot and wedding rings. Ab helped us find everything. We came up short on the coffee pot so he ended up giving us one from the hotel!  We had a full dinner the first night and it was amazing- course after course of delicious food. We were full and exhausted before dessert and asked to retire to our room. This caused some consternation with the staff. It turned out they had prepared a special frozen chocolate mousse cake with wedding congratulations written on it candle and all. Served along with poached pears with cream and chocolate sauce. Truly delicious and unexpected! We also took advantage of a private hammam and massage- our first hammam. It was a wonderful experience having our skin washed scrubbed then covered with a mixture of mysterious substances then washed again.  Having travelled much and staying in many luxury hotels I can honestly say this was probably my best experience ever. Thanks so much to Ab and the staff!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: True Moroccan hospitality in a magical setting.
Review_Text: Samir and the staff at Riad Dar Anika are shining examples of the famous Moroccan hospitality we had heard about before our trip. Everything we needed was provided promptly and graciously - we were made feel like honored guests in their home.    The Riad itself is beautifully luxurious with a fantastic pool and roof garden. It's location is hard to beat - a stone's throw from many of Marrakech's main sights.    We hope to return some day and have no hesitation in enthusiastically recommending Riad Dar Anika to fellow travellers visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Adam G wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Title: Great location, great room, great service
Review_Text: The staff are amazingly attentive and the Riad is decorated to a fantastic standard throughout. You're well located next to cash points and a short walk from the town centre / souks but not so in the thick of it you can't find a quieter stroll when you need a break!    Nothing is too much trouble. The breakfast is absolutely fantastic and just keeps coming... although nothing can compare to the 5 course traditional Moroccan mezze dinner they we had. It was lovely and a real bit of culture.    Roof terrace is fantastic although be aware there is no pool on the roof - it's inside. Hammam and massage was also lovely.    Would recommend this riad for anyone but particularly short city breaks where you want a bit of culture and some romantic luxury.    If you like a drink or two head for the Cozy bar - look for the big tree (really big and covered head to toe in foliage looks like the tree of life) about 60 metres to the south of the riad - across the square - it's the best place we found... aside from the Riad itself of course which was a lovely spot for a G & T.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Leon S wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: The Riad Dar Anika met all my expectations for a true Moroccan experience.  Located centrally in the heart of the city this hotel was beautifully presented with central courtyard splashing natural light throughout the hotel. The Moroccan decor was simply divine.  My room was unlike anything I have ever experienced. In the centre of the room was a dome with light holes. At night it looked like I was peering into the heavens. It was very special.  The bed and bathroom were comfortable and functional.  Breakfast was a delicious assortment of Moroccan / French ranging from crepes to omelettes. The setting was delightful on top of the roof terrace overlooking the city.  The ambiance for the entire hotel was relaxing and laid back.  The Staff were friendly and professional. They were obviously well managed with an attention to detail.  This hotel is highly recommended for those seeking a genuine Moroccan experience.

Brilliant short stay at Dar Anika. Samir and the team couldn't have been more helpful from the moment we arrived: from a great Moroccan welcome on arrival to giving us advice on how to make the most of our stay and even providing a packed lunch when we left. Thank you!

Review_Date: Jessica L wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Perfect location - very easy to navigate around the city by foot. Samir and his staff took excellent care of us. The food was wonderful. Tour and dining recommendations were perfect. The riad is absolutely beautiful. We would definitely recommend Dar Anika and would stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: celia z wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Our short break at Riad Dar Anika was a wonderful experience. The management and staff were so helpful and attentive we felt like royalty right from our arrival when we were greeted with a red rose warm towels and typical morrocan refreshments. Our room was covered in rose petals and our hotel dinner was a sumptious feast fit for a king. Once you step inside the Riad it is like a beautiful palace - such a contract to the outside! Breakfast on the roof terrace is a delight and the local advice we were given was very good and helped us to avoid any tourist traps. We can really recommend the individual trips organised by the hotel especially the trip to the Atlas Mountains where you really see how the Berbers live it is like stepping back in time. An amazing experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is only a five minute walk from the souks. It is an oasis of calm in the middle of the madness that is Marrakesh!    The staff who work at the riad take huge pride in doing absolutely everything to make you feel special and provide a level of service I have never experienced before. Samir the manager talked us through the best and worst areas and arranged a driver and restaurant bookings. We were escorted to and from our destinations and always felt safe in what can be quite an intimidating city.  Dinner and breakfast were plentiful and delicious and the rooms were super.    We had an amazing weekend in an amazing city made even more special by the staff at the riad. Could not recommend it more highly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed with our 18 year old high school senior son in March. Samir and his staff are top notch. The riad is well appointed comfortable safe and in the real city - you will get the real experience of life. Samir knows who to call upon if you want to travel outside the city for guided tour to the mountains ocean and desert as well and planned a variety of eating places for us to experience. He also arranged for the traditional hammam or bathing ritual at the riad. The drivers he arranged were excellent and varied. Everything was timely fascinating and I would highly rate this riad as he and his staff can make the experience what you are interested in having. Without a doubt he and the rest of his team are able to please a range of interests.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Paul and Kim A wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Title: Wonderful care in a beautiful setting!
Review_Text: My wife and I spent two days in Marrakech and stayed here. We couldn't have asked for a better place. The briefing from Samir was the most helpful and useful we got at any of the Riads at which we had stayed. He listened carefully to our interests and really helped us plan OUR stay not some generic stay.    The whole staff was just as helpful whether bringing us water and OJ without being asked after we came back from hours of walking or finding my wife's lost wedding ring or helping us move to the room upgrade we were given for the second night. They were a charming balance between "professional 5 star service" and "local charm" always eager to please on the smallest ways but just a little shy in doing it too.    The Riad itself was beautiful (though if an upgrade isn't available and you like extra space in your room paying for the bigger room or small suite is money well spent). The rooftop terrace where a varied and delicious breakfast of local fare is served was utterly delightful and all the public areas were gorgeous and comfortable at the same time.    All of that said it was the staff every single one of them that made this place as special as it is. I would recommend the pampering of this place to anyone. We loved our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jacqueline K wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Title: The only place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: My husband and I were completely bowled over by the hospitality and service at this beautiful Riad. It was my birthday whilst on the trip and they organised a cake and flowers and treated me like a Princess for the whole stay.The Manager Samir takes you under his wing from the moment you step through the door - his staff provide welcoming refreshments and he goes through a map of Marrakech offering advice on sight seeing restaurants and things to steer clear of. We took advantage of their car service (fee paying) to ferry us at night and on our trip to the mountains and their driver was likewise amazingly friendly and polite. The accommodation was beautiful - offering both traditional Moroccan decor with modern amenities (except TV - but why would you need that??). Touches like rose petals scattered in your room and Argan oils products in terracotta pots in your bathroom just add to the luxury. We were more than pleased with the breakfast where we expected a typical bland continental fare - we were given a banquet of yogurt fruit warm pancakes and muffins jam and honey and drinks galore. Taking up the manager's recommendations we ate somewhere different every night and on the last night had dinner at the Riad - at the end of which we wished we had ate there more; dinner was served under a Bedouin type tent on the roof terrace and every course was sumptuous - even the Camel tagine ordered by my husband! We were even given a packed lunch for the airport! We organised a Hamman and massage at the Riad and although the Hamman is on the small side the accompanying body scrub was invigorating and again administered by a very enthusiastic therapist. On the last day we followed a tip in our guide to try and spend the day by the pool in the nearest 5 start hotel - only to be told they were full by abrupt snooty staff which was such a stark contract to the staff at Anika. We will definitely be returning and next time with the kids.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful Riad in a perfect location with amazing staff
Review_Text: This was my first trip to Morocco and my first experience staying in a Riad. If you are hoping for a "western hotel" experience complete with HD flat screen tvs in your room this is not the place for you. But if it is service ( unbelievable!) a welcoming staff very clean rooms help arranging travel and excellent food this is a much better option. You will be in the medina close to the square and the maze of souks. You will feel like you have actually experienced Marrakech. (I had friend staying in a 5 star "western" hotel and they did not have the same experience and in fact changed hotels hoping to find a better experience). Samir and his staff go out of their way everyday to be sure you have whatever you need- a quick taxi ride a day trip food water tea cookies whatever. I highly recommend staying in this Riad. If I return to Marrakech I will certainly return to Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Margaret G wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: We stayed here for two nights. I have never stayed anywhere where we were treated better. We were warmly welcomed and given refreshments. We were told places to visit provided with a map of how to get there given restaurant recommendations cautioned against going to the leather works and other helpful information. Our room had rose petals on the bed treats and fresh fruit every day. Breakfast on the garden-like rooftop was included and was plentiful and very delicious.  Anything we needed the staff was willing to provide. They picked up bus tickets when they learned we were going to Agadir next arranged a tour the last day on the way to the station. The staff was always warm and helpful. Our room was very comfortable. We were made to feel like honored guests during our stay there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: this is one of the best hotels anywere
Review_Text: I am strongly promoting this hotel not because other hotel locally are not as good it is because the employees at this hotel went the extra mile  from my check in which was quick and very efficient to being escorted to my room 202 which was beautifully decorated in a traditional Moroccan style with touches and modern were you would want it to be crisp linen soft towels nice bath soaps shower gels etc  great selection of food on offer wish i could have spent more time there  even the check out was a pleasure
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: If like me you have spent hours or days researching which Riad to stay in during your trip to Marrakech I promise you that you will not be disappointed with this one!  From my first enquiry to when we left the hotel with a lovely packed lunch they had made for us the service here could not have been more friendly and helpful. They really do make you feel special and nothing is too much trouble.  The Riad is just on the entrance to the Souks so you don't have to meander through them with all your luggage - personally I think it is on the perfect spot. It is a few minutes walk to the main square but far enough away to be peaceful.  The Riad itself is beautiful. It smells lovely is clean tidy homely and is the most relaxing and tranquil place I have ever stayed. It is true that what another reviewer said...the photos do not do it justice.  Our room was on the ground floor and was beautifully laid out when we arrived with rose petals on the beds and in the bathroom. It was clean and there was plenty of room. We also found it to be quiet and got some lovely nights sleep. No call to prayer heard at all (as I have seen mentioned in some of the other Riad reviews).  We ate at the hotel the first night and the food was fabulous....there is so much of it though...make sure you don't eat much beforehand! The service was charming and it was such a lovely experience eating the wonderful food on the roof terrace.  Breakfast is also eaten on the terrace and again is plentiful. They bring out lots of dishes which are all lovely - especially the yoghurt and cake!  The owners make themselves available should you need any help at all and will gladly sit down with a map and give you hints and tips on where to go and any things to avoid. We followed most of their advice and enjoyed a lovely couple of days.  The roof terrace has 4 sun loungers if like me you want to catch a few rays in between all the sights. Again it is most relaxing and peaceful there. Also you won't be sitting down for long before a complimentary mint tea or any other drink you fancy is brought along to you.  Honestly the staff just want to make your stay as nice as they can do.  I really did spend days looking on Trip Advisor for the right place to stay (and there are lots of Riads with good ratings in Marrakech) but I am so pleased I chose this one. I wouldn't even look next time I would definitely come back here.  One piece of advice for those of you who haven't been to Marrakech before.....expect delays getting through passport control!! There were lots of booths open when we arrived but the queuing system was shambolic! Once you are through though it is all worth it and the lovely man from the Dar Anika will be there to escort you to the peace and relaxation of the Riad which is only about a 15 minute drive away.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tim B wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: I have stayed in numerous hotels in numerous countries of different star ratings from 0 to 5 and some suggesting that they were 6 stars! all hotels have their own personality but I have never stayed in a hotel with such personal friendly service where they can advise and organise your whole stay if you require -simply superb. Without doubt will stay there again in a heart beat. My only tip would be to make sure that you have at least one evening meal there as it is by far the best food we had on our trip in fact it was they best food of its type I have ever had. Forget the others just book the Riad Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: He where in the hotel for five nights.Very good stay. Very helpfull staf... Loved it. Very good breakfast on the top floor overlooking the medina. The only but for us was that there were no tv in the rooms
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Adam G wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: I've travelled extensively in Morocco and this is by far the best Riad experience I've every had. By "experience" I mean that this is much MORE than just a remarkable place. It is extremely clean it's beauty is indescribably (the pictures on line do not do it justice) and the location is perfect (just short stroll from the square at the edge of the medina and yet easy to taxi to...so no need to drag your luggage down bustling streets). But the owner and staff are also very special. Upon our arrival we were greeted with a celebration of wonderful Moroccan snacks and of course mint tea.
