We had a fantastic diner on the roof top terrace and they even packed a lunch for us as we headed off to the train station. Couldn't ask for a better place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Dar Anika was a great place to stay in Marrakesh. The location is within walking distance of all the major sights of the city. The riad itself is nicely appointed and very tranquil after a day on the streets. Our room was spacious cool and very quiet. The food is excellent and the service is fantastic. Any time we would return to the riad we were greeted with mint tea ice water and snacks. The manager took the time to sit down with us to point out things we should not miss in the city and the things to avoid. Loved the outside terrace on the top of the riad that provided a great view of the busy streets below.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Dar Anika is an amazingly beautiful experience. Upon arrival we were treated like family members coming home - the hospitality facilities and cuisine have no rivals - truly a wonderful Riad. We have traveled the world and our stay at the Dar Anika ranks #1!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Miles T wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: An oasis in the madness that is Marrakech
Review_Text: With over 1500 (apparently) Riads in Marrakech it would be hard to choose - luckily I stumbled upon Dar Anika and what a find. From the moment we arrived from our airport transfer we were greeted by manager Samir and his team with chilled water mint tea and a rose ( I admit I told my wife i'd organised that one!). The team could not have done more for us throughout our stay and the hotel is simply top class. The rooms clean the beds comfortable and the terrace a haven looking down onto the street below. Dinner in house was a treat and just kept coming!! Also the in house Hammam with massage after was a fabulous way to unwind on one of our days. To end it all we were presented with a picnic for our journey home and the owner came to say goodbye too.  If you need a place to stay in Marrakech then look no further than Dar Anika. It's perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: First class/5 Star. I experienced the best service I have ever had.
Review_Text: The place is gorgeous location is perfect but the team are outstanding. Samir and his team literally thought of and catered for our every need. Their quiet understated approach is special and means that the little touches made a huge contribution to our enjoyment of our trip. The briefing and insight into Marrakesh set us up perfectly the incredible lack of hard sell of their own services/offerings was very comfortable the delivery of ice cold water and fresh mint tea after a day out and about much appreciated the bottles of water casually handed-over when leaving for a day out were thoughtful the picnic beautifully presented in a little silk bag prepared (without request) for our home-bound journey was the icing on the cake....I name only a few of the little things Samir & his team have very cleverly thought through and deliver as part of the price. Would return to Marrakesh but only to Dar Anika and so highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris F wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: We arrived in Marrakech after a much-delayed flight and long wait in Morocco immigration. Dar Anika arranged our pickup at the airport and the driver was present and waiting even though we were several hours behind schedule. We received a traditional warm welcome at Dar Anika with mint tea and were presented with a wonderful meal that was beyond our capacity to finish.    Throughout our week at Riad Dar Anika we found Samir's hard-working staff to be consistently professional friendly and very helpful. This included organizing trips taxis providing advice meals drinks a wonderful breakfast each morning and more. Our room and in-fact the whole Riad Dar Anika was very clean. We felt welcome and treated like royalty.    Marrakech being a very busy and somewhat noisy city once entering the Dar Anika it was an oasis of tranquillity! We enjoyed our visit to Marrakech and would highly recommend the Riad Dar Anika. We would certainly stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fabulous Riad Dont Book Anywhere Else !
Review_Text: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at Riad Dar Anika and I can assure you that you should believe everything written in these 5* reviews. The riad is situated just a few minutes walk from Djemaa el Fnaa square and the souks. The riad arranged a car to pick us up from the airport which I would recommend as you dont have to get involved with the taxi drivers trying to scam you ! After a 10 minute taxi ride we were greeted with rosewater and flannels for our hands mint tea and traditional Moroccan pastries. Samir then chatted to us giving us terrific advice about things to do places to eat and areas to avoid.  Our room was beautiful-traditional tiles and stain glass windows. It was immaculate as was the rest of the riad. We had booked dinner that night and this is a must-it was our best meal BY FAR !!!  Breakfast was served on the leafy roof terrace where the resident turtles wandered around. Thoughtful touches such as bottled water given to you to take out everyday sunhats and fans laid on the sun loungers delicious mint tea and pastries served on your return from the souks and dates fresh milk and water placed in your room every afternoon. We felt completely at home in this tranquil haven.  As we were celebrating our wedding anniversary we were presented with a gorgeous cake and a bottle of champagne-such a thoughtful touch. Please do not consider staying anywhere else-we will definitely be returning !!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely weekend in Marrakech made special by staying at Dar Anika. Much has been said about both the peace quiet and luxury of the Riad and the service provided by Samir and the team. Food was also excellent although I personally couldn't get the hang of the soup with breakfast. Thanks for a lovely few days.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: One of the best vacation experiences ever
Review_Text: This is one of the finest Riads In Marrakech or anywhere in the world for that matter. Samir is the best host I've ever encountered. His hospitality was world class. From giving us instructions and guidance to visit Marrakech to helping us make dinner reservations at one of the best restaurants in Marrakech for authentic Moroccan food to providing us with a driver and making travel arrangements for us to head to Casablanca for our flight Samir and his team are the best. The Riad feels like a 5 star hotel from the room set-up to cleanliness to outstanding service. If I am ever in Marrakech again Riad Dar Anika is the only place I'll stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Corinne S wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: As a frequent business traveller I thought I had experienced some of the best customer service in the world – from the immaculate new 6 star hotels in India to the historic grandeur of The Ritz. I have been fortunate enough to have stayed in a number of wonderful hotels that take excellent care of the requirements of their guests but never before have I stayed in a hotel that anticipated all of our needs! Not once did we ever have to ask for assistance. Samir and his team have perfected the art of caring for their clientelle in this boutique hotel so your enjoyment of the Marrakesh experience could not be better.    Dar Anika provides a wonderful cool sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the city. The hospitality that greets you on arrival continues throughout your stay. There is always a combination of fresh pastries fruit smoothies goats’ milk dates and chilled water to greet your return to this amazing cool oasis.    Our air-conditioned room was not over-sized but we had selected according to our budget for this trip. There was much more spacious accommodation available however our room was more than adequate for our needs - beautifully cool extremely clean and had a lovely bathroom with a highly effective shower. And for the occasional call of work the wi-fi was both fast and reliable.    The roof terrace provides a lovely garden setting for breakfast which was absolutely delicious and extremely generous. Indeed after the first morning we started to share some of the courses to minimize waste. In addition to the fresh fruit and yoghurt cake pancakes bread and soup we had also been offered eggs which we would never have managed to eat.    The honesty of the hotel directory and Samir’s introductory talk is both refreshing and invaluable. We might certainly have been tempted to buy “fresh” orange juice from the vendors in the Souk had Samir not warned us of the potential hazards of added water.    Samir also provides some excellent restaurant recommendations but the dinner we had at Dar Anika was unparalleled despite all that Marrakesh has to offer. The slow-cooked lamb pot-roasted in coals of the Hammam was the highlight of our trip. The proprietor explained that the hotel also makes an effort to serve Western Europeans with vegetables that retain a little bite in preference to the local tradition for softer vegetables for ease of eating with bread.    Samir and team arrange excursions with Khalid who also speaks excellent English and drives probably the cleanest car in Marrakesh! And at the end of the journey there is the Dar Anika plunge pool awaiting on your return. Having the hotel arrange for Khalid to collect you from the airport is a decision you will not regret and will ensure that your trip gets off to the best possible start – arguably the most important €22 that you will spend in Marrakesh.    We stayed for four days and ventured out to the coast for a day trip in the middle. For us this was the perfect duration. This was our first trip to Marrakesh and we had expected it to be a “once in a lifetime” experience but the excellent service we received at Dar Anika has determined that we shall return. Next time we will take things more slowly bring a book and spend some time on the loungers on the roof as a contrast to the intensity of the city. We will also undertake some research in advance on the price of leather Gladstone bags (which looked much better quality than those we saw in Florence last year) hurricane lamps lights and the other treasures that await in the Souks.    It’s definitely not for the faint hearted – Marrakesh has sights sounds tastes and smells that are very alien to those of us from the West which can be both wonderful and shocking. But it is the enthusiasm of the vendors the vibrancy of the colours the fragrance of the spices and the cool professional calm of the Dar Anika which will linger in the memory.    If only all hotels could be this good…. thank you team Dar Anika for the perfect stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Thanks to Samir and his team for a fantastic weekend from meeting us from the airport to brining us fresh water and juice when returning to the Riad from the hot sun . Samir recommended some restaurants which were fantastic and also organised a car for the day to visit the mountains nothing was too much trouble . The Riad also gave us a pack lunch to go home with which was a lovely touch . Thank you for a fantastic weekend .

Review_Text: As a frequent business traveller I thought I had experienced some of the best customer service in the world – from the immaculate new 6 star hotels in India to the historic grandeur of The Ritz. I have been fortunate enough to have stayed in a number of wonderful hotels that take excellent care of the requirements of their guests but never before have I stayed in a hotel that anticipated all of our needs! Not once did we ever have to ask for assistance. Samir and his team have perfected the art of caring for their clientelle in this boutique hotel so your enjoyment of the Marrakesh experience could not be better.    Dar Anika provides a wonderful cool sanctuary from the hustle and bustle of the city. The hospitality that greets you on arrival continues throughout your stay. There is always a combination of fresh pastries fruit smoothies goats’ milk dates and chilled water to greet your return to this amazing cool oasis.    Our air-conditioned room was not over-sized but we had selected according to our budget for this trip. There was much more spacious accommodation available however our room was more than adequate for our needs - beautifully cool extremely clean and had a lovely bathroom with a highly effective shower. And for the occasional call of work the wi-fi was both fast and reliable.    The roof terrace provides a lovely garden setting for breakfast which was absolutely delicious and extremely generous. Indeed after the first morning we started to share some of the courses to minimize waste. In addition to the fresh fruit and yoghurt cake pancakes bread and soup we had also been offered eggs which we would never have managed to eat.    The honesty of the hotel directory and Samir’s introductory talk is both refreshing and invaluable. We might certainly have been tempted to buy “fresh” orange juice from the vendors in the Souk had Samir not warned us of the potential hazards of added water.    Samir also provides some excellent restaurant recommendations but the dinner we had at Dar Anika was unparalleled despite all that Marrakesh has to offer. The slow-cooked lamb pot-roasted in coals of the Hammam was the highlight of our trip. The proprietor explained that the hotel also makes an effort to serve Western Europeans with vegetables that retain a little bite in preference to the local tradition for softer vegetables for ease of eating with bread.    Samir and team arrange excursions with Khalid who also speaks excellent English and drives probably the cleanest car in Marrakesh! And at the end of the journey there is the Dar Anika plunge pool awaiting on your return. Having the hotel arrange for Khalid to collect you from the airport is a decision you will not regret and will ensure that your trip gets off to the best possible start – arguably the most important €22 that you will spend in Marrakesh.    We stayed for four days and ventured out to the coast for a day trip in the middle. For us this was the perfect duration. This was our first trip to Marrakesh and we had expected it to be a “once in a lifetime” experience but the excellent service we received at Dar Anika has determined that we shall return. Next time we will take things more slowly bring a book and spend some time on the loungers on the roof as a contrast to the intensity of the city. We will also undertake some research in advance on the price of leather Gladstone bags (which looked much better quality than those we saw in Florence last year) hurricane lamps lights and the other treasures that await in the Souks.    It’s definitely not for the faint hearted – Marrakesh has sights sounds tastes and smells that are very alien to those of us from the West which can be both wonderful and shocking. But it is the enthusiasm of the vendors the vibrancy of the colours the fragrance of the spices and the cool professional calm of the Dar Anika which will linger in the memory.    If only all hotels could be this good…. thank you team Dar Anika for the perfect stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Thanks to Samir and his team for a fantastic weekend from meeting us from the airport to brining us fresh water and juice when returning to the Riad from the hot sun . Samir recommended some restaurants which were fantastic and also organised a car for the day to visit the mountains nothing was too much trouble . The Riad also gave us a pack lunch to go home with which was a lovely touch . Thank you for a fantastic weekend .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Dar Anika was a great place to stay in Marrakesh. The location is within walking distance of all the major sights of the city. The riad itself is nicely appointed and very tranquil after a day on the streets. Our room was spacious cool and very quiet. The food is excellent and the service is fantastic. Any time we would return to the riad we were greeted with mint tea ice water and snacks. The manager took the time to sit down with us to point out things we should not miss in the city and the things to avoid. Loved the outside terrace on the top of the riad that provided a great view of the busy streets below.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Dar Anika is an amazingly beautiful experience. Upon arrival we were treated like family members coming home - the hospitality facilities and cuisine have no rivals - truly a wonderful Riad. We have traveled the world and our stay at the Dar Anika ranks #1!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Miles T wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: An oasis in the madness that is Marrakech
Review_Text: With over 1500 (apparently) Riads in Marrakech it would be hard to choose - luckily I stumbled upon Dar Anika and what a find. From the moment we arrived from our airport transfer we were greeted by manager Samir and his team with chilled water mint tea and a rose ( I admit I told my wife i'd organised that one!). The team could not have done more for us throughout our stay and the hotel is simply top class. The rooms clean the beds comfortable and the terrace a haven looking down onto the street below. Dinner in house was a treat and just kept coming!! Also the in house Hammam with massage after was a fabulous way to unwind on one of our days. To end it all we were presented with a picnic for our journey home and the owner came to say goodbye too.  If you need a place to stay in Marrakech then look no further than Dar Anika. It's perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: First class/5 Star. I experienced the best service I have ever had.
Review_Text: The place is gorgeous location is perfect but the team are outstanding. Samir and his team literally thought of and catered for our every need. Their quiet understated approach is special and means that the little touches made a huge contribution to our enjoyment of our trip. The briefing and insight into Marrakesh set us up perfectly the incredible lack of hard sell of their own services/offerings was very comfortable the delivery of ice cold water and fresh mint tea after a day out and about much appreciated the bottles of water casually handed-over when leaving for a day out were thoughtful the picnic beautifully presented in a little silk bag prepared (without request) for our home-bound journey was the icing on the cake....I name only a few of the little things Samir & his team have very cleverly thought through and deliver as part of the price. Would return to Marrakesh but only to Dar Anika and so highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris F wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: We arrived in Marrakech after a much-delayed flight and long wait in Morocco immigration. Dar Anika arranged our pickup at the airport and the driver was present and waiting even though we were several hours behind schedule. We received a traditional warm welcome at Dar Anika with mint tea and were presented with a wonderful meal that was beyond our capacity to finish.    Throughout our week at Riad Dar Anika we found Samir's hard-working staff to be consistently professional friendly and very helpful. This included organizing trips taxis providing advice meals drinks a wonderful breakfast each morning and more. Our room and in-fact the whole Riad Dar Anika was very clean. We felt welcome and treated like royalty.    Marrakech being a very busy and somewhat noisy city once entering the Dar Anika it was an oasis of tranquillity! We enjoyed our visit to Marrakech and would highly recommend the Riad Dar Anika. We would certainly stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fabulous Riad Dont Book Anywhere Else !
Review_Text: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at Riad Dar Anika and I can assure you that you should believe everything written in these 5* reviews. The riad is situated just a few minutes walk from Djemaa el Fnaa square and the souks. The riad arranged a car to pick us up from the airport which I would recommend as you dont have to get involved with the taxi drivers trying to scam you ! After a 10 minute taxi ride we were greeted with rosewater and flannels for our hands mint tea and traditional Moroccan pastries. Samir then chatted to us giving us terrific advice about things to do places to eat and areas to avoid.  Our room was beautiful-traditional tiles and stain glass windows. It was immaculate as was the rest of the riad. We had booked dinner that night and this is a must-it was our best meal BY FAR !!!  Breakfast was served on the leafy roof terrace where the resident turtles wandered around. Thoughtful touches such as bottled water given to you to take out everyday sunhats and fans laid on the sun loungers delicious mint tea and pastries served on your return from the souks and dates fresh milk and water placed in your room every afternoon. We felt completely at home in this tranquil haven.  As we were celebrating our wedding anniversary we were presented with a gorgeous cake and a bottle of champagne-such a thoughtful touch. Please do not consider staying anywhere else-we will definitely be returning !!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jo P wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: We have stayed in many hotels. But this has to be the best Hotel/Raid we have stayed in. From our arrive in Marrakech we made to feel like very special guest. Abu (the owner) had arranged for us to be picked up from the airport by one of his drivers. Who spoke very good english. Upon arriving at Dar Anika we were greeted with a very traditional Mint Tea and Moroccan nibbles. Our room was stunning. We had rose petals arranged beautifully around the room. The next morning we had a wonderful breakfast on the roof terrance. The staff were very attentive . We had different courses of food.We then had a meeting with Abu (owner) who wanted to know if we wanted an any recommendations of what to do for our stay in Marrakech. We are so pleased we took up this offer. Abu arranged a artillery for us. We also told Abu what kind of restaurant / entertainment we wanted for the evenings. This was also arranged for us. First day we got the feel of Marrakech by walking around the Souks (markets). That evening was the eve of my birthday. Abu had arranged a surprise birthday cake for me at the restaurant we were eating at ! On my birthday after breakfast all the staff from Dar Anika brought out a cake and sang Happy Birthday to me in Arabic and Berber. It was truly amazing. Our driver Ali then took as on our excursions. Visited Moroccan Villages via Altas Mountains. Learnt so much about the Berber way of life. Very humbling. Once back a Dar Anika we had a Hummam (Moroccan bath) . On our last day we went on a cooking course this was the high light. Abu became our friend. We are going back next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We recently spend two nights (June 11th - June 13th 2014) at Dar Anika. We booked two rooms. Arrangements were made for the hotel's driver to pick us up at the Airport when we arrived. Highly recommend this service and reasonable enough. Also arranged with hotel for a driver to the airport when we departed. We left for the airport at 5:30A and the driver was waiting for us. The hotel arranged to have breakfast ready for us at 5:00A and even packed a small snack for us to take on our flight. Drivers escorted us from hotel door to vehicle each time. Lovely breakfast included each day with the room rate. Breakfast served in the rooftop terrace. Our rooms were on the second floor. No elevator available. A lovely welcome greeting with different Moroccan foods to taste and drinks. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Rose pedals on the beds and throughout the bathrooms. Good location in the old town area. Have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel and the location. Try their dinner one night. It is wonderful. Need to let them know the day before for dinner. They have snacks and drinks available throughout the day for an extra charge.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Rory B wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: Our time in Dar Anika was amazing. It is most definitely the best hotel/Riad we have stayed in. We went for a superior room and it was absolutely stunning. We were both blown away by the level of service and hospitality; from Abu's city advice the arrival refreshment to the many little touches such as fresh smoothies brought to us after a hot day in the city to the food package made for us for the journey to our next accommodation outside the city. A fantastic riad I hope to return to!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stuart S wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: The service and overall experience at Dar Anika was just perfect. Starting with the pickup at the airport to the welcome snack to the beautiful room to the relaxed and elegant breakfast and the staff's support in recommending restaurants and activities in Marrakech everything was just perfect. When we returned to the hotel every afternoon we were greeted with fresh-made juice pastries and mint tea. The staff was friendly and always available they treated us like we were their most important guests; a real home-away-from-home feeling.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: True meaning of gastronomy and Spa heaven!
Review_Text: This was the perfect location for a romantic getaway.  In the middle of the busy streets at the centre of Marrakech Riad dar Anika was a haven of tranquility.  We were treated as royalty from the moment we arrived. The very friendly staff were looking after us making sure we had everything we needed.  From the breakfast afternoon tea until dinner at the roof terrace we were spoiled with the most amazing food.  The location is absolutely perfect. Only a few minutes away from the big square and shopping streets.  After a day out it was a joy to step back in to our hotel and relax by the pool or at the roof terrace.  Not to mention the heavenly hamam treatment and the Spa.  We recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to enjoy the wonderful Marrakech in true Moroccon style.  With special thanks to the lovely Mr Abu who helped us to see the most beautiful places in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rosemary G wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: Finding the Dar Anika was luck backed up by the excellent reviews which helped us decide - and we were absolutely delighted with everything about it. Abu Samir and the whole team were faultless in the care and service they provided. We took advantage of them arranging our trips (city walking tour and Atlas mountain trips with Mustafa and Mohammed) which were first class and we would recommend them to everyone. The Riad itself is a lovely calm oasis and we ate most of our excellent meals on the stunning roof terrace overlooking the Atlas Mountains. The other treats we experienced were the Hammam followed by an excellent massage and also the swimming pool which was lovely brilliant after a very hot day of outings. We hope to return to Marrakech and would stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Linda L wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: I cannot rave enough about my experience at Dar Anika. The owner Abu as well as his staff are very attentive to every aspect of their clients' stay. The traditional Moroccan welcome far exceeded any normal welcome -- they served us not only dates milk juice and mint tea but also delicious cakes. They brought the left overs to our room which was adorned with rose petals and was simply beautiful. Abu reviewed with us all information we needed to know to make our stay successful and even packed a delicious box lunch for us to take on the plane the day we left when he realized that we didn't have time for breakfast that morning because of a busy sightseeing schedule. Breakfast on the upstairs patio was not only delicious and varied but the service incomparable. We felt connected to everyone who worked there and recommend this Riad to anyone traveling to Marrakech.    Linda GL
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Super hotel that serves you with their heart!
Review_Text: We stayed there for 3 nights and the owner was like family showing us where to go to the smallest detail. The hotel itself is small yet beautiful and every staff was so friendly and wonderful! It's the best hotel that I have ever stayed in! Excellent!

Review_Date: Christine C wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived we felt as though we had stepped into a magical wonderland of service and comfort. We were greeted with roses cookies and mint tea as well as a personal welcome from the riad owner. At Dar Anika we felt as though we were family members. We were truly treated like we were at home and we knew that the staff really cared about our well-being.    We highly recommend eating at Dar Anika. The dinners were exceptional! We booked the camel tangia for the first night of arrival and it was surely one of the most memorable and tastiest meals we ate in Morocco. Each morning we were excited to enjoy the enormous breakfasts on the beautiful rooftop terrace with our friend Couscous the turtle!    Our room was simple but beautiful with every amenity we could anticipate needing (including cookies in the fridge!). After exploring the city every day it was a delight to come back to a sparkling clean exceptionally comfortable bedroom every night.    A large part of Dar Anika's charm is how much care is taken with guests. When we arrived Mr. Abu took the time to point out places he thought we would enjoy and mapped everything in the medina out for us. We know we had memorable experiences at shops restaurants and in markets because of his advice!    The location of this riad is absolutely perfect. It's a simple 5 minute walk North to the "big square" Jemma El Fna. We have stayed in other riads and Dar Anika was most perfectly situated by far.    The entire staff was wonderful helping us with our needs before we even knew we needed assistance! No task was too complicated or too small for the Dar Anika team to handle.    One of the reasons we are planning a trip back to Marrakech in 2015 is to stay at this riad! We can't wait to book another stay with our "Moroccan family". It was a comforting feeling to know the answer to our questions was always "Of course yes." Thank you Dar Anika!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lorna O wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: Samir and his team certainly know how to look after their guests. You walk into this oasis off the hustle and bustle of the Moroccan streets and you are greeted with top quality service. From the traditional Moroccan welcome of rose water cold face towels dates and fresh milk to the traditional hot sweet mint tea and pastries. Our time was very limited and Samir recommend where to visit and eat in the short time (less than 24 hours). The Riad is approx. 7 mins walk from the main square and very well located although you don’t hear any noise from the surrounding streets. Our breakfast was amazing fresh fruit salad and yoghurt followed by traditional Moroccan breakfast soup to eggs mini pita breads and jam. There is afternoon tea and cakes provided in the court yard and dinner is served on the roof terrace although we didn’t try dinner. The rooms are very comfortable with air con a safe bath robes etc provided. We were provided with some food for our return flight fruit and small stuffed pitas and a people carrier to take us to the airport. We wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this place and we will certainly be back. Well done Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Suzanne M wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: A little gem in the heart of the old Medina
Review_Text: From the moment of arrival we were treated as VIP's  The staff were so friendly and helpful we never had to ask for anything twice.  The room was extremely clean and so was the rest of the hotel.  It was very comfortable to relax in the lobby or on the roof terrace after a day out in Marrakech.  Whenever we had dinner at the hotel roof terrace we were looked after by the staff.  Amazing food and plenty of it!!    Thanks Riad Dar Anika we had an amazing time and will deffinitely come back!  We recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a relaxing holiday in beautiful Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Staying at Riad Dar Anika is something we will never forget. It is a wonderful tranquil place and the hospitality is second to none! Breakfast everyday on the terrace was outstanding. I highly recommend staying at least once for dinner as well - it was the best dinner we had in Marrakech hands down. Everyone there was very friendly and helpful and wanted to do everything to make our stay there and in Marrakech as enjoyable as possible. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Clifford S wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: Driving closer to the Medina the streets got narrower busier and cluttered with alley-side vendors. As we left the main street after finding the tiny street were looking for we began to have doubts about our hotel choice. Then sandwiched between street vendors was a beautiful doorway cut into an otherwise nondescript wall. A very quiet knock was immediately answered by two uniformed bellboys who escorted us out of the 100 degree afternoon into an A/C relaxation room. Treated to tea sweet cakes and a welcome by the manager we filled out our registration paper work on the comfort of couches and easy chairs not by standing at a counter in the lobby.. An added treat was the rose water a young girl poured over our hands and very welcome was the cold wash cloths we were given to freshen up. Brought then to our room we were very pleasantly surprised by it. The hotel is lovely the staff just waiting to serve whatever needs we had. The room was spacious clean and very comfortable and inviting. Beds were firm. Third bed for grandson was a real bed not a roll-a-way. Breakfast on the roof garden was fresh varied and plentiful. The pool in the lobby was inviting though we did not use it. As indicated location was excellent and we walked to the central square where all the action is in about 5 minutes down an interesting shopping street. We would definitely recommend to anyone and cannot think of any negatives we experienced here. A true Oasis.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jeff D wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: We recently traveled to Marrakech for my wife's 30th birthday. There are tons of Riads to choose from and we ended up staying at the Dar Anika after reading reviews from multiple sites.    We were not disappointed! Everything was spectacular from the décor to the service to the location. We loved the staff and had the time of our lives. You will not be disappointed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff and management at the Hotel Dar Anika cannot be touched. A friendly oasis in the "Real Marrakech" (i.e. not the Four Seasons part of town). My wife and I were treated like royalty from the moment we arrived. The room was exceptionally clean and the hotel was tranquil. Oh yes and they ordered us a cake in celebration of our anniversary. Great roof deck bar as well. We loved it and would recommend it in a heartbeat. Book it and don't think twice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment you land in Marrakech Dar Anika begins to care for you! A driver is patiently awaiting to take you to Dar Anika. No stress! Upon your arrival you are greeted by warm hosts who seem to exist only to please you and help you to have a memorable visit. Refreshments as you check in your luggage effortlessly delivered to your lovely room Hammam and massage awaiting and you may dine in or choose to go to any of myriad restaurants. No worries about a taxi! Just let the attendant know your wish and a reservation and driver will await you. Excellent tips on places to visit and great rate of currency exchange with no fee! We have never felt so pampered !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Dee F wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: The Riad is located in a fantastic location and the Riad is beautiful. I absolutely LOVED it! They give you a warm welcome and the staff is amazing.    !The staff will go out of their ways to help you and service you. !    I think our choice of staying at this Riad made our trip way more magical and amazing rather than staying at a regular hotel. Their breakfast... omg...I miss it right now. It was amazing. All the food was amazing. Every recommendation they made to us in terms of restaurants spas and places to visit turned out absolutely amazing.  To be honest I have been to many hotels around the world...but this Riad is by far the best I have been to as they make you feel at home and their service alone deserves 5 stars!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Recently returned following a short stay in Marrakech. Was slightly anxious when the taxi pulled up outside an alleyway and announced we'd arrived however we were warmly welcomed into the riad by the manager Samir and shown into a beautiful riad away from the hustle and bustle outside. We were given dates tea and biscuits and then sat down with Samir to discuss the do's and dont's of Marrakech advised on places we might like to visit and on some good places to eat. This allowed us to make the most of our time there.    The staff were very polite and friendly throughout our stay. They went above and beyond the call of duty in facilitating us. On our final day we had a late flight so they provided us with a packed lunch as we were leaving which was very thoughtful. The hotel was clean and lovely and peaceful away from the busy streets of Marrakech. If we needed anything (e.g. An iron) it was provided promptly. The breakfast was also great.    The location was ideal. We were within walking distance of most tourist attractions.    We wanted to visit the Atlas Mountains and that was sorted immediately. We had a very good and friendly driver Ali who was very accommodating and polite throughout.    Overall a great stay in a beautiful riad with lovely staff. The only regret was not having enough time in Marrakech to spend more time enjoying the riad. Would definitely recommend to others and go again in future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Brigit V wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: Was here just for the night in a double room! I love traditional style riads as they are always so beautiful and much more homely than 4 star hotels filled with tourists!! Staff was quiet and shy but very polite and welcoming! Bed was comfy and the bath was huge!! Had breakfast on the courtyard downstairs which was delicious and very filling! the small pool is not heated but was still fine to dunk feet in and cool off! Views are not amazing on rooftop but its a nice place just to relax and have a drink and BBQ! I Very close to djemma el fnaa but once inside the riad you are not disturbed by the hustle and bustle and noise!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: lisa b wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: Fantastic location excellent and attentive staff who are happy to accommodate any requests. The hotel is clean and beautifully presented. On arrival Abu the manager helps you to make the most of your stay with helpful and knowledgeable advice to suit your interests. Dinner was fantastic. Would definitely recommend and hope to return in the near future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Vanessa P wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Truly an oasis in Marrakesh! My friend and I arrived having a incident with a taxi driver in Marrakesh and the staff at Riad Anika were amazing reassuring and wonderful. From the moment you enter you are looked after given tips on where to go and what to do local restaurants and many other tips. I usually stay in 5 star hotels so I have very high standards in terms of service and you totally get that here. It almost felt like there was a surprise around every corner - rose on arrival packed lunch etc. We didn't actually have time to eat at the riad but we walked past another table and the food looked amazing. I would definitely go back to this riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Beatriz Z wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Great location very nice staff the dinner in the terrace was excellent. When we arrived at the hotel they gave us milk tea and moroccan sweets. Lovely!    If we come back to Marrakech we`ll go to Dar Anika again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Dar Anika is a wonderful place. Brilliantly located calm wonderful roof terrace helpful and nice staff. We will definitely stay there again next time we go to Marrakech.    Fun Fact: There are pet turtles roaming on the roof terrace called Couscous and George
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a little treasure. We were extremely pleased with our recent 3 night stay at the Riad. The staff were extremely helpful nothing was too much trouble. We had booked dinner for our first night but our arrival was delayed by 3 hours so by the time we arrived we couldn't face it. This was the right decision as we had the meal the following night and we couldn't have done it justice at 11 pm at night.    We booked the walking tour around Marrakech. This was an excellent choice as it made us feel at home in the city showed us some of the sites and then made us feel confident about walking around on our own.    The staff were extremely helpful in suggesting things for us to do places to visit and places to eat. We did eat at the La Mamournia hotel which is where Churchill used to stay. Very nice French meal but we really could have been in any 5 star hotel anywhere in the world.    In contrast the Moroccan meal at Dar Anika was excellent. The atmosphere is fantastic - all meals are eaten on the roof terrace and this is surrounded by the sights and sounds of Marrakech. We ate by candle light the most fantastic meal. We certainly couldn't have faced it at 11 pm the night before but we tried our best on the Friday night. We also had lunch on our last day before heading to the airport. Again another fantastic 'light meal' (3 courses) fish this time.    I would recommend that if you stay at this hotel you eat at least either one dinner or lunch here. You won't be disappointed.    In in all an excellent stay in an excellent Riad where the staff and management couldn't have done more to make your stay the best it could be. By the way after having worked in the travel industry (albeit 30 years ago) and travelled extensively this is the first hotel where I hadn't need to use my travel make up mirror as one was provided for you plus a reading light and hair dryer!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: K R wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: My husband and I only spent one night at dar anika and even as I write this review in another city..I wish that we could go back forever!! The other reviews are spot on you will not be disappointed. We were greeted with roses rose water dates and milk..their breakfast is beautiful fruits with Angel cake yogurt eggs and soups. It was the most incredible experience for our honeymoon. We chose to have dinner at the riad and it was absolutely delicious. You guys I do not like lamb but something compelled me to order it ahead..so I couldn't change my mind when I realized what I had done and boy am I glad I didn't. It was the most exquisite lamb I've ever tasted the whole meal was beautifully timed and presented by the staff. The riad is just beautiful. Five star class we can't wait to be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After a recent short stay in this beautiful Riad I can only confirm that all the good reviews are true.  This was our first time in Marrakech and we weren't sure what to expect; our stay at Dar Anika made our visit very special. The location rooms and food are all perfect and all the staff are fantastic & cannot do enough for you. I would also recommend the Hamman it is a great experience! I don't often say this but it is one of the nicest places I have ever stayed at and we cannot wait to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As the last visit it was superb. We came with a different couple that last time and hoped that our enthusiasm was not misplaced they loved it!  The meal at the Riad was fabulous again.  We used the hotel recommended tour guide for a trip to the Atlas Mountains by car it was very good value for money.  Hoping to return for Christmas OK it will be lamb but the tree will be up!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Andy P wrote a review May 2014
Review_Title: Is this Riad as good as the reviews make it out to be?
Review_Text: We booked this Riad on the back of the outstanding reviews given by other guests that stayed at the Dar Anika. So lets cut to the chase – Is this Riad as good as the reviews make it out to be?    In short yes. Dar Anika gets a 10/10 from us and deservedly so. This establishment is run along the same ethos as Richard Branson runs Virgin Atlantic Airlines. It’s all about customer service and attention to detail so what follows is a more detailed insight into our stay.    On arrival at Marrakesh we were greeted by Anil who held up a board with ‘Dar Anika”. Anil was our VIP driver who took our bags from us and drove us to the Dar Anika Riad for our 4-night stay. The transport was clean comfortable (spacious leather seating) with cool air con for the 15-minute journey.    On arrival at the Dar Anika we were warmly greeted at the door by the manger (Samir) and as we walked through into the courtyard Samir introduced us to Fadwal who was standing tall and proud carrying a big smile as she greeted us and held out a long freshly cut stemmed red rose for my wife to receive. Wow what a stunning reception!    Samir and Fadwal then introduced us to the staff - they took our bags to our room (Suite – Room 2) whilst we were asked to take breakfast on the roof top gardens to unwind after our 3 hour 15 minute flight from the UK.    After breakfast we sat with Samir who explained the Do’s and Don’ts of Marrakesh when visiting the Medina. Samir also mapped out some quality restaurants for us to eat in (new and old town) and a whole lot more……..    We stayed in a Suite (Room 2). It was a stunning room; rose petals decorated the fresh white bed linen in the shape of a heart with a fresh bouquet of flowers placed on the centre of the bed. Above the bed was a stunning sky light dome feature (see photo) which became an even better feature of an evening.    We decided to have our first nights dinner at the Dar Anika and wow we did not go disappointed. The food was plentiful to say the least but more importantly it was excellent in quality and professionally presented. To top it all the chef and the kitchen staff came out after to dinner to sing me a happy birthday and greet me with a birthday cake.    The quality of service and attention to detail did not drop in standards after our 1st day. It remained constant throughout the 4 nights and nothing was too much trouble for Samir Fadwal and their team. Oh we also took in a Hammon and a massage which we would well recommend you do whilst staying at this Riad.    On departure from the Riad a packed lunch was handed to us for our flight back to the UK (Lemon chicken bread rolls fruit– stunning and a huge thank you) and our baggage was taken to our VIP driver for the 15-minute journey to Marrakesh Airport.    We wanted for nothing during our stay at this Riad and we felt so relaxed in this friendly but professionally well run Riad which felt like home – a far cry from these modern hotels that simply treat you as number once they have secured your money for your stay!    Top Tips:    (1) Get Samir or Fadwal to arrange for a professional tour guide to take you around the local points of attractions.    (2) Ask Samir or Fadwel to book you into the La Maison MK Restaurant – its stunning but get Samir to take you otherwise you will not find it on your own!    (3) Take a trip to the Atlas Mountains and Ourika Valley but make sure Samir and Fadel at the Riad arrange it for you. We spoke with others outside of this Riad who made their own arrangements – guess what they were hugely disappointed.    (4) Trust know one during your stay in Marrekesh and we mean know one other than the management and staff in the establishment that you are staying in.    A huge thank you once again for making our stay one to remember and your 10/10 rating is thoroughly deserved.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dirk H wrote a review May 2014
Review_Title: A true gem in a vibrant city
Review_Text: We spent a wonderful week in Dar Anika. Great experience from the first knock on the big wooden portal. Suddenly all the noise and gear from the busy street stops and you enter an oasis of peace charm and friendliness. The staff is ever so attentive. Rooms are very well designed and perfectly clean. The breakfast can't be topped. The small yet perfectly temperature pool is a phantastic relief after a full day out in the city. Highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mili R wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: I traveled with my kids my brother and his wife their kid and our parents.The hotel is perfectly located right in the Medina but not in a noisy area. It is beautiful. It is what I was hoping it would be: a boutique hotel with high standards in every way (I am a New Yorker and picky) yet still authentic to the place. I didn't want to feel I am at some corporate hotel when I am in Marrakech. The breakfast area is on the roof a gorgeous outdoor dining area with food as fresh and delicious as could be and cute turtles. There is a pool in the main floor though water was too cold to use (but we were there during spring maybe that's why we didn't want the cold water just yet). But what made the trip so special was the service. While super professional it was also personal. We felt like we came home every time we entered. Upon arrival we received traditional tea and moroccan sweets as well as roses. SAMIR the hotel manager was exceptionally excellent. He was caring detailed and very patient with jet lagged big family guests that we were. He sat down with us right away to plan our stay as to not spare a moment. His recommendations were sensational and made our trip unforgettable. He was right on target with what we hoped to experience and we did. The driver he arranged for us was super professional lovely and spoke English very well. During our stay every whim at every moment ANYTHING we needed was answered with a delightful attitude and competence by the whole staff. They made us feel at home.Thank you Samir and everyone at Dar Anika for making our trip so special. We can't wait to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Tim L wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: We recently stayed at Dar Anika and found the staff extremely friendly and accommodating to all requests. It is more intimate than larger riads and hotels but that just adds to the extra level of service you get from the staff.    Morning breakfasts on the roof terrace are very filling and give you a good start for the day.  A recommendation is to book and eat dinner at the riad one night but make sure you are hungry as it is a big feast and we couldn't finish.  The riad itself offers a little oasis in the busy streets of Marrakech and an escape during the hot summer days and is within a 10min walk in all directions of nearly all of the medinas main sites.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad is an oasis among the chaos and heat.  We (two female friends) stayed in early April and the reviews on this site are completely accurate. We had a fantastic experience from the moment we were picked up at the airport until we were dropped back to the airport. There was nothing they would not help us with. Samir met with us right away to find out what our needs were what we wanted to do and offered us guidance on how to make our visit most enjoyable.    We had dinner the first night on the roof top terrace and the food and local wine were wonderful.  Breakfast is a feast - by the second day we had to ask that they just bring us fruit and yoghurt (which was amazing on its own).  We did opt in for the Hammam and massage and it was worth it. The only thing is I would suggest is going separate. My friend and I went at the same time and space was a bit cramped for the two of us plus the lady providing the treatment.  Being two women travelling alone we did also request a private driver for dinners out.  The restaurant recommendations did not disappoint. Again wonderful. The hotel also found a driver to take us on an excursions. We are so happy we did.    I would highly recommend staying here. You will not be disappointed.  Thanks to all the great people who took such amazing care of us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Leah H wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Feeling amazing the most incredible weekend in Marrakech! It's a dream away from our busy city life. Arrived early morning. Greeted at the airport and within minutes where sitting on the roof terrace of this Splendid Raid eating the most delicious breakfast. The room was beautiful but couldn't wait to step out into the medina with great advise and guidance from the super friendly staff we did just that.    Ideally situated for site-seeing everything within a short walk. The location also contributing towards the remarkable contrast between what is on the door step and how it feels inside. The excitement noise and bustle of the bazaar yet the minute you step into the Riad and door is shut behind you all falls silent and calm completely uninterrupted apart from the call for prayers which is the only noise that seems to penetrate the walls.    It's just lovely just to lounge around in the raid. My favourite place is roof terrace enjoying the breeze with views to Atlas Mountains.    My best bits about the hotel  Strong hair dryer  Can leave your phone in charge. No annoying card/electric stop.  Fast wireless internet everywhere could even watch you tube
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sue N wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Dar Anika is an absolute gem. The location is excellent and the rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast is served on the terrace rooftop and is delicious. However what really makes this place are the staff. They cannot do enough for you. Samir the manager sat down with us when we arrived and we talked about what we wanted to do and see. He then suggested some tours for us restaurants to eat in and organised our transportation. It made it so easy and his recommendations were excellent. It was my birthday while we were there and the staff presented me with flowers and cake and even sang happy birthday! For anyone going to Morocco who wants to stay in a traditional riad and soak up the atmosphere of Marrakech this is the place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Janice M wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived we were well taken care of. Our excursions and golf were all taken care of by the hotel. It was lovely to sit back and just relax. Well done to all the lovely staff and management.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Dar Anika the place where to go
Review_Text: Excellent location superb staff. They take care of you in any detail. Very helpfull in a city where occidental can be little bit lost. Let the staff drive you on the choice of restaurant for dinner they know what to do and they suggest you very nice places. I really reccomend to anyone going to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rachel H wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Such a special place with lovely warm hospitality from the staff Samir Fadwa Tariq and many others. Beautiful room and surroundings made the stay special as did the great hammam and massage. Special thanks for the treat given to my husband for his birthday - flowers cake champagne and not least all the staff including the Chef coming to the roof terrace to sing happy birthday in 3 languages - memorable! Recommend the meal on the roof terrace just pace yourself as it is immense but lovely. Recommend also the walking tour with Mustafa when you arrive as it helps you to acclimatise to the medina. Kosybar just over the road is great for drinks too. Superb service and place
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ken S wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: It's difficult to know where to start in reviewing this oasis in the hustle and bustle that is Marrakech. I guess the overwhelming impression is the wonderful service and attention that all of the staff gave us during our visit. From the moment we were collected from the airport nothing was too much trouble and the level of service was impeccable far exceeding any expectations that we might have had. Samir and his team really are faultless.    The riad itself is perfectly located - right on the edge of the old souk close to three of the major attractions but only 10 mins walk from the main square so everything is in easy walking distance.    Inside the riad has been elegantly converted with the rooms around the traditional courtyard into which they have been able to fit a welcoming pool. Every room is different so each have their own charm and quirkiness but all are cleaned and decorated to a high standard.    The flexibility of the spaces in the riad were excellent - you could have breakfast in the courtyard on the balcony level or on the rooftop terrace. Despite visiting in February we were able on a couple of days to eat on the terrace which has great views across the rooftops. On a couple of evenings we ate in the lounge area which has a glass wall overlooking the courtyard and for the cold evenings a roaring log fire too.    The food was exceptional - both of the evening meals were excellent and the breakfasts almost overwhelming in the quality and quantity of the food.    There were a number of occasions where the staff really went out of their way to help us and to provide a level of service that we don't think we have encountered anywhere else.    We cannot think of a reason why anyone visiting Marrakech should want to stay anywhere else other than Dar Anika. When we return we will certainly be back here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: If you go to Marrakech stay here
Review_Text: This place is amazing and good value for money. This was the 2nd time I have stayed in Marrakech and Dar Anika was perfect even better than my previous stay which I thought was amazing. The communication before we went was spot on. We got picked up at the airport which was really easy. The transfer is only 15 mins to Riad. Best of both worlds as it is in the Medina very close to Main Square and the Markets but nice and peaceful when in the Riad. Everything else of interest is walking distance or taxi if you want to be lazy. All the staff are fantastic and if you needed anything you just had to ask. They all smiled and greeted you - even cleaners who did not speak any english were so friendly. All recommendations for restaurants and stuff were good. Samir is the manager and he was around a lot to make sure we were happy with the stay. Our taxi driver (Zacharay) who we asked for as we liked him the first time was a good laugh and his English was good. We ate at the Riad one night and it was really good (I had Camel). I eat like a horse normally but there was too much food (in a good way!!). If you stay here you will not be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Familie A wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: For our first visit to Marrakech we chose Rida Dar Anika.  It was a very good choice. The room was a bit small for the four of us but still nice quiet and clean/nice. The service is better than in some of the 5 star hotels we stayed in.  The dinner the first night was very nice but some more choice for other evenings would be a good idea (but then you have all the medina and can go to all the other places). The Breakfasts were wonderful on the roof and very tasty - a good place to stay and the lunch packet was a wonderful treat thank you again :) Best wishes from Norway  Mirjam and Family
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A fantastic stay for a short break. What attention to detail...before we left home Leila was in touch with helpful hints and suggestions. The obligatory tourist form completion meant that the observant Leila was alerted to my wife's birthday.....evening drinks were interrupted by the entire staff singing Happy Birthday in English Berber and Arabic - and the delivery of a beautiful bouquet of roses and a birthday cake.    Nothing was a problem in this haven if peace in a bustling city even leaving was a special occasion - a little food pack fresh from the kitchen to ensure we enjoyed the journey home.    Wonderful and HIGHLY recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: probably the friendliest hotel I've ever stayed in
Review_Text: The staff were extremely helpful and friendly - nothing was too much trouble. Useful local information for tourist visits - enjoyed the hammam and massage very much. After the excitement and buzz of the local streets and squares the Dar Anika was an oasis of calm.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Perfect location for the must-see Marrakech sites but "off the grid" so it feels local and less touristique. Very nice roof terrace with servings (breakfast dinner or just drinks). Super friendly service-minded and personal staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic--The best service I have experienced
Review_Text: From the moment you arrive in Marrakech whether by train or air the staff at Dar Anika are preparing for your visit. We were picked up by their driver at the train station and taken directly to the Riad. At the door we were greeted by the full staff who had a rose for my wife and a porter for our bags. We were led into a waiting area where we were served fresh milk and dates followed by pastries and mint tea. The proprietor arrived and detailed the surrounding area using a map highlighting the placed we should go and when we should go there. Our room was upgraded and upon entry we found it covered in flower petals. The hot water was hot the linens crisp and fresh and our hosts were most hospitable. I've stayed at Ritz-Carltons 7 Diamond Vegas hotels and lavish all inclusive Mexican resorts and I've never felt so welcome and well served as I did at Dar Anika. Upon our departure the staff went so far as to provide us a sack lunch for the car ride. Do not hesitate to book your stay at Dar Anika by far the best lodging we had in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lenard L wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: Great location with owners who are local and are hand on managers who care about their guests. They arranged a 3 day 2 night desert experience that used the hotel as home base to store unneeded luggage while we went thru the Atlas Mountains thru the Darr Valley. They arranged car service in the evenings to take us to and from local restaurants as well as airport pickup. The facility was great and the food better than several restaurants that we visited for dinner. The beef tijan is a most. Breakfast was terrific .. We will return soon to explore other southern cities but Dar Anika as home
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Julian M wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: Stayed at Dar Anika with our family. Fabulous stay - great riad with excellent plunge pool and roof terrace. Staff were exceptionally helpful and attentive. Roof terrace is a wonderful haven - particularly at night for sipping mint tea in peace and quite after the hustle of the square.    Rooms were quiet and peaceful (we had 3) and we all benefitted from an excellent night's sleep - even the call from the mosques was muted - we know from previous stays in other riads that it can be quite noisy!    Location is perfect - close enough to souks and close to the main palaces.    Thank you Abu you have created a great haven in the wonderful chaos of Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Beautiful place and honest and helpful staff that did everything to make it a perfect holiday. The dinner one the night of arrival (with camel meat as a bonus) was one of the most romantic nights you could imagine. Simply an amazing setting! Also fabulous breakfasts overlooking the whole of Marrakech every morning. Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David A wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: We can’t think of anywhere better to stay in Marrakech.    It’s been beautifully restored and so is a pleasing space to return to after the hustle and bustle of the city. The service is excellent. We were greeted with milk and dates followed by mint tea and pastries. All our needs were impeccably looked after – arranging a guide taxis Hammam massage. The food was excellent and plentiful. Having breakfast on the roof is a great way to start the day – with yoghurt fruit orange juice eggs cooked as you want them unusual breads. The pool offered a refreshing way to cool after a day sight seeing. Add to all that the location – just minutes from the Bahia and Badii palaces the Sadiaan tombs and five minutes walk to the souks. But really it is the staff who make the place feel so relaxing. All of them were attentive and very good at what they did. Would highly recommend and would stay there again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah M wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: The rooms and the service were excellent and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The Riad has a lot of charme and feels very authentic.  Apparently it is one of the very very few Riads that is actually Moroccan managed. Most other Riads are owned by foreigners.  The guided city tour by a certified guide that is included in the rate is the perfect way to start off the visit to Marrakesh and the equally included massage is a good way to relax after a day of visiting the city.  If you have a light sleep the one thing you should not forget are earplugs. While you do not have any noise from the outside the wooden doors of the rooms open onto the inner court of the Riad and you can hear everything that is going on within the Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The perfect trip away from a busy life
Review_Text: I stayed here with two friends in late Feb and had an amazing time. We were collected from the airport and received a lovely welcome by the staff at the Riad which set the scene for the perfect stay in Marrakesh. The food was amazing whether it was the amazing luxury dinner on the first night the delicious endless breakfast or the never ending tea and cake oh and even a packed lunch on our way to the airport.  The room was warm and inviting and it felt like a safe haven from the world outside.  The staff were the really amazing part though they thought of everything apart from the obvious delicious delights above they also arranged a great trip at one of the local hammam gave us pointers on how to get around things to watch out for and always had a welcoming smile we came back from our walks to the Madina. Since coming home I’ve missed it every day and am planning my next trip back. I’ve recommended this beautiful Riad to friends since coming home and wouldn’t hesitate to return myself in a heartbeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: What a fantastic wee break at Dar Anika.....    Whilst the previous reviewers have covered most of the major points I have to say my own thank you and add my recommendation to this site.    From the moment we were collected at the airport we were treated with such hospitality and respect. We arrived late but were welcomed with refreshments and moist towels plus a rose for the lady. After the initial bedlam of the airport and journey into town Dar Anika was almost totally silent and very tranquil.    After time to freshen up we enjoyed a banquet in the raid's covered courtyard. The food was utterly fantastic and so much of it....... Given another opportunity I would have this another night. We were not able to do credit to the meal - simply too knackered after the 2 flight journey from Scotland.    On our first morning after an amazing breakfast our genial and welcoming host Abu enquired after what we wanted to see and do in Marrakech. He gave us a map and illustrated what he thought we would like to see an interesting route to follow with timely rest stop plus gentle indications of "Do's & Don'ts".    Anytime we returned to Dar Anika it was so relaxing to step from the friendly madness of the streets into the cool and friendly welcome of the raid.    I cannot ever recall having previously enjoyed a breakfast that included fresh fruit salad cake freshly squeezed orange juice fresh Moroccan bread and pancakes eggs scones with preserves fresh coffee.... and SOUP!. It was all delicious heartening and just what we needed to set us up for a day in the Medina. Breakfast is served on the roof terrace with great views of the nesting storks and in the company of the three resident tortoises.    I will recommend Dar Anika to anybody and everybody friends and strangers. I am sure Abu Samir and all the attentive respectful and well mannered staff will look after you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: James F wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Title: A fantastic riad with wonderful staff
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here for our Anniversary in Febuary  The Riad itself is beautiful quaint relaxing and well run with impeccable service. All the staff are warm welcoming and do their up most to make your stay the best it can be 'For us it certainly was'. We just couldn't fault it.we have travelled extensively and rarely have experienced such a high standard of attentive yet unobtrusive service -just fabulous !!  Thanks again to all the wonderful staff at Riad Dar Anika kindest Regards Mr & Mrs Franses
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Matina S wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: We recently came back from Marrakech. Riad Dar Anika made a difference to our trip. Not only it provided a hidden magical oasis in the middle of Medina but also because the decor the food and the above all the hospitality was excellent. We were greeted by lovely staff who offered us mint tea and local desserts before we were escorted to our room full of fresh aroma of rose petals that were scattered everywhere. Once we settled the manager spent an hour with us gave us a map and explained in detail best sites to see as well as practical information about what to avoid transport and safety. During our stay we booked a Hammam in the Riad which was fantastic followed by a private dining experience in the Riad's courtyard. They cooked camel meat for us which you don't find in restaurant menus. Really yummy. Before we left I was given a small gift and they had prepared for both myself and my husband packed lunch for the plane. What else can someone ask from their hotel really?

Review_Date: Lee R wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: First time of writing on trip advisor but had to having had the most amazing stay at Riad Dar Anika.    Treated like royalty from the moment the driver met us at the airport. Abu and his staff have thought of everything to make your stay the most amazing experience. Attentive staff  eye for details and thoughtful on every level from arrival at the Riad where we were given traditional mint tea and dates to the pack lunch for your departure.    After a quick chat about what we wanted to do in Marrakech ideas were shared on where to visit and to where to dine. We were shown to our room which was dressed with petals and flowers then a quick show round to the rooftop terrace. The Riad could not be better located for the hustle and bustle which makes Marrakech a great place to visit and immerse yourself then re enter the Riad Dar Anika and all that disappears with the tranquility of its surroundings.      Thank you to all at Riad dar Anika    A downside .....yes I had to leave .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beyond 5 star service, in your own little palace
Review_Text: Our flight was several hours late we were exhausted - until we arrived to a warm welcome and the most beautiful little riad with a glowing turquoise courtyard pool candles sweet scents a log fire in the salon the table laid for our dinner and not the slightest hint of irritation at the hour. We were fussy and fractious - and in ten minutes were soothed and happy and felt very well taken care of. Nothing was too much trouble and to my amazement it really felt genuine. The place is immaculate elegant and Abu the owner has exquisite taste. He came to meet us at breakfast the next day and made sure we had everything we needed to venture out into the city - and once again there was no sense of rush or being processed through the experience. The food there is great the hammam was a treat and I was completely taken aback when the staff gathered to present me with a (delicious) chocolate cake and sing happy birthday in English then Arabic complete with the chef's ululations. This is a long review because there are so many wonderful things about this riad. There are grander places there are more economical places but if you want a superb introduction to Marrakech to find a place you can feel both cosseted and at home and for service that money simply cannot buy Dar Anika is it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A really nice welcoming and friendly riad from which to base your stay in Marrakech. The two owners and the manager along with all the staff had one aim to make your stay relaxing and enjoyable. Service was always attentive without being obtrusive the perfect balance.Recommendations are freely offered on what to see how to best navigate the local sellers and which restaurants to visit. Nice sized roof terrace for dinnerbreakfastchilling & sunbathing.Lovely food and very good local wines. The riad has its own small hammam with quality massage on offer carried out in a spare room if available or your own room. A really good VIP taxi service to transfer from/to the airportrestaurants for short tripshalf or whole day and at reasonable prices. We were given a packed lunch for the plane which was a really nice touch and thus avoided the plane food!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stephen S wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Title: Truly an oasis of peace in a city of bustle
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here at the end of February 2014 for a (very) long weekend and were spoilt by the staff throughout our stay.    Marrakech is a great city to visit but you certainly need a haven to return to when you get tired of the souks and Riad Dar Anika fully fits the bill. We had one of the suites which was full of character and really comfortable. But the real benefit of the Riad is the staff who simply can't do enough for you. This carries right up to the two brothers who own the Riad and who are keen to make sure that your stay is perfect. It is well worth listening to their recommendations for restaurants and making use of the Riad's car for airport transfers and to take you both to restaurants in the evening and pick you up when you are finished your meal.    If you have time a day trip to the Atlas mountains is a great day out but don't bother with the tanneries which are simply not pleasant and not interesting enough to compensate for the smell. We spent our first afternoon on a walking tour with a guide organised by the Riad and that was both interesting and helpful as it helped us get our bearings.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marie H wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: I stayed at this Riad Feb 21st - 23rd with 2 of my friends for a long weekend break we were welcomed by lovely staff who gave us the first of many cups of mint tea milk dates and pastries. Our room was covered in rose petals to welcome us which was a nice thought. The set dinner that evening was generous delicious and beautifully presented and the accompanying entertainment was quite an experience! The roof top is a lovely place to relax and have breakfast. Breakfast each morning is done beautifully with variety on each morning of fresh breads crepes fruit coffee cake (yes for breakfast) - the yogurt is the best part. The room/ensuite/beds were very clean and comfortable. The staff really make this stay though nothing is a problem they are very attentive at all times and they were very helpful to recommend and arrange a suitable hammam experience within a set budget (Thank you Samir!). Don't say no to the pastries they are delicious and worth the indulgence. We found the location very convenient a short easy walk from the main square. When we checked out everything was in order the staff provided us immigration forms so we avoided delays at the airport and were thoughtful enough to pack a small lunch for us all as our flight time meant that we wouldn't have time to eat before we left. I would highly recommend this Riad for travellers wanting a unique experience that feels personal with a very high level of customer service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lorraine B wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: Five of us stayed here as part of a 50th birthday celebration and the staff could not have been more helpful.  Our transport was waiting when we arrived and we were swiftly transferred to the Riad. As with most Riads behind the door there is a sense of peace and tranquility.
