We were given cleansing towels milk and dates and refreshing mint tea and biscuits while the sights and places to visit were explained to us along with suggestions of where to eat and where not too!  All our rooms were lovely decorated with rose petals and supplied with bottled water fruit bowl and more Moroccan biscuits. Room 2 is really special with an open fireplace and beautiful cupola above the bed with small round skylights to let the moonlight in. Definitely the room to have.  There is a lovely plunge pool on the ground floor with the small lounge area. A roof terrace for drinks meals and sunbathing.  Breakfast was typically Moroccan with so much food. Fruit salad and yogurt fresh juice cake pastries crepes soup and eggs of your choice. Tea and coffee. Tea and coffee are available all day free of charge and pastries are available in the afternoon.  We had a celebratory dinner in the Riad served downstairs by the pool and I can only describe it as a banquet. Everything was traditional Moroccan including a selection of tagines salads vegetables and breads. This was followed by a surprise birthday cake. An absolutely wonderful meal and great atmosphere.  All the staff were very nice and nothing was too much trouble. They arranged taxis to other restaurants an excellent Hamman at the nearby Golf Hotel and advised us to fill in immigration cards before leaving for the airport to save the hassle once there.  All in all an excellent experience and would recommend it as a great place to stay in Marrakech where it is located very close to the main square and souks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: One of the nicest small Riad's in Marrakech
Review_Text: What a great small Riad The patron's Nigel & Diana were great host's the food was fantastic the position in Marrakech was great and easy walking from the main square.  The roof terrace was great to sit in and have a end of day sundowner!  Just a great week with Great people and good food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: L H wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Title: This place is awesome, just stay here!
Review_Text: We looked at so many options when trying to find our accommodation- as a small group of girls travelling as friends our priorities were somewhere that felt safe clean and comfortable.    We just arrived home from a few days at Dar Anika and want to go back now!    Samir and his staff team work hard to ensure guests feel welcome happy and relaxed.    From the moment we arrived they made sure we felt right at home and had everything we needed. One of our group had forgotten a toothbrush and asked about the nearest shop to go & buy a new one. Samir told us just to relax and before we had even unpacked Samir had gone & got a new brush and toothpaste!    We were particularly happy with the location. The medina is crazy intense & at times overwhelming so being able to come into the calmness of the riad and relax with tea & cake straight away was a welcome retreat. The cakes were different & tasty each day so even without the excuse of being frazzled & harassed tea and cake became our happy afternoon ritual.    Being able to walk safely on a well lit & populated street also helped us feel confident & independent with getting to & from the night markets. We noticed other accommodation options nearby were often down dark slightly dodgy looking alley ways. So I feel like we made the best choice for us. If ever we felt unsure about venturing out somewhere new a staff member would offer to show us the way or book a trusted taxi driver. This was really appreciated.    The staff arranged a hammam for us booking a driver to take us to & from at a very reasonable price. I recommend this experience after a busy day of walking.    The food at the riad is delicious as ardent foodies we are pretty fussy and I can safely say the breakfasts were a highlight of our day. SO MUCH FOOD! Freshly baked Moroccan style breads traditional soups. Fresh fruit & juices. All tasty. We also had the set menu and tried camel for the first time I recommend trying this it was actually quite good.    I will definitely chose this riad again & recommend it to anyone I know going to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We have just returned from an incredible stay at Riad Dar Anika. If you want a real Marrakech experience with fantastic service then you should definitely stay here too.    Prior to arrival we arranged our airport transfers via email with Riad Dar Anika (complimentary if you book a suite) which I would highly recommend as you are dropped off at the nearest point a car can go (no cars on most streets in the Medina) and met by a member of staff to take you a few metres to the riad.    When we arrived were given cool towels rose water for our hands and a rose. Then we were served glasses of milk with dates followed by traditional mint tea with pastries while our bags were taken to our room. We were given a map and talked about what we would like to see in Marrakech with the owner. Anything was possible to arrange through the riad.    We stayed in room 1 which is one of the 2 suites in the riad and it was a gorgeous room. The staff had scattered rose petals everywhere and there were lots of thoughtful touches like fresh fruit pastries bottled water and fresh flowers. The bathroom was complete with little jars of toiletries towel dressing gowns and more flowers. It is a really beautiful room with stained glass windows and 4 poster bed all designed in traditional style. This room is away from the street and even though we didn’t use the specially designed sound proofing cushions for the windows (we chose to leave these in the cupboards) we slept really well and weren’t disturbed at all.    The highlight of our stay was the dinner we had on our first night. A table had been set for us downstairs by the pool but we really wanted to eat upstairs on the outside terrace. So we were given complimentary drinks as the staff quickly set a table for us in a traditional tent on the terrace. It really was the most romantic setting. The riad had emailed the menu for a 3 course set meal and we had chosen starters and main courses but didn’t expect the feast that we were served. I don’t want to spoil the surprise for anyone but this would be my biggest and number 1 recommendation in Marrakech because the food setting and service was simply stunning. We highly recommend the Special dish of Dar Anika which was a delicious camel and prune tagine. This incredible meal only cost £35 each excluding drinks and it was a true taste of Marrakech with real home cooked food.    We also booked a private hammam which I would highly recommend (about £30 each) which was well worth it. The whole experience lasted just over an hour and our skin felt amazing after all the scrubs oils and natural local products. Afterwards we sat in the lounge in front of a real fire and were served a fresh beetroot juice then a mint tea. It was my partners birthday and the staff chose this opportunity to bring him a homemade birthday cake flowers and sing happy birthday (in 4 different languages!!) which was really thoughtful and totally unexpected.    Complimentary tea and cake is served every afternoon but we preferred to sit on the top terrace with a few beers nuts and olives watching the streets below as the sun set with CousCous the resident tortoise.    Breakfast was a real treat and it was served whenever and wherever you wanted it. It was so fresh and the warm breads pancakes fruits and yoghurt and strong coffee set us up for the day we didn’t eat lunch as breakfast was so filling.    The riad is really beautiful. It is well maintained and a real Morrocan experience but it’s the staff and the service which make it stand above and beyond the rest. Every member of staff we met was warm genuine and friendly we felt like we were treated like royalty. The riad is a total oasis of calm in such a chaotic city. Marrakech is a must see city and a stay at Dar Anika will ensure you make the most of it.    I feel like this review is a little long but I really want to express what an amazing place this is and how wonderful the staff are. I don’t normally go back to the same city twice as I think there are so many places to visit but we both agreed that we would go back to Riad Dar Anika again and we would definitely book for longer than 2 nights as they made it such a special trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Relaxed atmosphere with first class service - lovely!
Review_Text: Our stay in this Riad during February Half Term has prompted me to post my first ever review on a hotel as we had the most wonderful time here. From the moment that we walked through the doors from the mayhem of the street into this peaceful haven we were made to feel so welcome; this Riad is a delight. The service from every member of staff was outstanding - absolutely faultless. There were so many lovely touches that made the service personal including cake flowers and all the staff gathering to sing happy birthday in 3 different languages on my husband's birthday! Their aim is to help you get the most from your holiday and have a trouble free Marrakesh experience whilst delivering outstanding service. They really do think of everything and we loved it. I would not hesitate to recommend to family and friends and is definitely to be revisited by us!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Wonderful Stay! Can't wait to come back
Review_Text: I have stayed and visited some of the top luxury Riads / Hotels in Marrackech though I choose Riad dar Anika for my last trip and i"m so pleased I did. The staff were simply fantastic and I felt 100% looked after from the moment I checked in until I left. Samir and his staff are ready to cater to your every need and plan a complete experience including spa and excursions.    I contacted the Riad prior to booking to discuss my plans and was put completely at ease that they could provide everything I was looking for. It lived up to my every expectation. I highly recommend reaching out prior to booking if you are considering where to stay.    The Riad and the rooms are extremely comfortable and charming a beautiful respite from the busy streets of Marrakech. Bathrooms and products are great - only wish I had brought some of the shampoo home with me. The food was amazing and after dinner at some finer establishments in the city I can say I was happy to have dinner at the Riad several times on this trip.    Thank you to the amazing staff for an exceptional stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Charlotte V wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Title: Dar Anika could not do enough for us
Review_Text: Before we even arrived Dar Anika had regular email contact giving us advice on services they provided and things we could do once in Marrakech. We booked transport from the airport hamman massage a guided tour of the city and a traditional Moroccan dinner for the night of our arrival even before getting there.    The pick up from the airport was seamless and we were glad that we had a driver that knew where to take us as the door to Dar Anika could be missed if you did not know where it was! Once you enter you are greeted by a beautiful tranquil oasis which is in stark contrast to the crazy hustle bustle of the Marrakech streets!    On our arrival we were taken to sit in a lovely lounge with a live fire and given fresh mint tea milk pastries and dates to refresh ourselves. Once we were settled the manager Samir came to sit with us and he gave us a map of the city and marked different places we should see such as the palaces souks and gardens and he also showed us where to go for lunch and dinners. He even offered us a free room upgrade but because our room had been so beautifully decorated with rose petals I didn’t want to move!    The dinner at Dar Anika is delicious but you need to make sure you have not eaten too much at lunch time as you receive a feast! The complimentary breakfast is also fantastic as you receive loads of dishes such as yoghurt fresh fruit salad pancakes cake warm bread SOUP!! and any type of eggs you care to name!    The guided tour of the city is a must as it helps you to get your bearings and allows you to see parts of the city you may miss if you were just to walk around on your own.    In the evenings Dar Anika were so fantastic and allowed us to use the lounge as our own personal place and we watched films on the TV by the fire with a bottle of wine on a couple of occasions. One night we went to Comptoire (a restaurant with belly dancing) that Samir has recommended and that was really fantastic. Another MUST SEE is the Circus. You are able to hold baby lions and the circus acts are astounding! It is great great value for money!    We were unfortunate with the weather as it was quite cold and rainy on a couple of days but on those days Dar Anika arranged for a lady to come to the Riad to provide Hamman for us both then separate ladies to come in and do traditional Moroccan massages and Samir even organised free of charge for a lady to come in a do henna for me.    The Wi-Fi has a good connection and my partner was able to deal with work emails quickly and efficiently.    The staff at Dar Anika cannot do enough for you. We had great banter with our waiters and on the day it was sunny we were able to eat breakfast on the roof under a beautiful tent.  Overall I would thoroughly recommend Dar Anika for couples looking for a romantic getaway. Due to the fact that there are only 12 rooms the service is so personal and Dar Anika will bend over backwards to make your stay a special one. On our last day we were even given complimentary glasses of wine whilst we waited for our taxi to take us to the airport and then we were given a delicious packed lunch to take to the airport!!! I would most definitely go back and would recommend Dar Anika to my friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Luxury and attention to detail - feel like royalty here!
Review_Text: Look no further than Riad Dar Anika calm relaxed and informal. I felt like a king as every whim was catered from transportation and transfers to the medina tour with private guide. Dar Anika staff show a real interest in guests comfort and holiday enjoyment and go out of their way to ensure you are comfortable.    The courtyard at the heart of the building has a heated pool on one side and a cosy enclosed lounge with fireplace on the other side. A private on-site hammam can be arranged followed up by a private massage. Mineral water flowers and Moroccan pastries are found in the room on arrival. All rooms are modern with telephone Wi-fi safe and air-conditioned and equipped with private bathroom. Enjoy the roof terrace with a view of the snow-covered Atlas Mountains in the distance.    The location is close to the Badii Palace the Saadian tombs and the bizarrely interesting Djemaa El Fna square with all the hustle and bustle of the souk outside the door.    Possibly the best breakfast ever!    Dar Anika went above and beyond my expectations a real pleasurable stay that could be hard to beat with its very personal attention to service ensuring every individual need is met.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: This small Riad is practically perfect in every way. The location is ideal as it is within walking distance of all the main sights and a short drive from the airport and the mountains. With a small number of rooms the staff are able to offer an unsurpassable level of service and adapt to individual needs. Collection from the airport taxis guides day trips Hammam everything organised seamlessly and with style. Beautifully converted building with pool and glorious roof terrace. All the rooms are a generous size (but spring for a suite if you can)  traditional decor coupled with all mod cons. The food was exceptional I can't remember the name of the "squashed croissant" bread we had for breakfast but it lives on in my memory!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Alison B wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: it shows the power of trip advisor as we wouldn't have known about this hotel without trip advisor but It really is as good as everyone says it is. The hotel was an oasis of peace with service that royalty maybe used to but I have certainly never experienced anything like it. From the minute you step out of the bustle of the streets through their large Arabic door they greeted us with drinks and asked us what we would like to do over the weekend. They sorted trips and meals and gave us a surprise picnic but were also gentle and quiet and "not in your face ". They were spot on with advice on how to deal with frequent "offers of help" on the street. We had a fabulous 4 days and have recommended to friends and family. Small hotel but big on service!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard M wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: I highly recommend this Riad as probably the best place to stay in Marrakech. The location is very convenient and it is definitely more fun to stay inside the Medina than to stay in one of the soulless hotels outside the ancient city. It is a stone's throw from the marketplace. The Riad has been beautifully converted and the rooms although not luxurious are spacious very clean and beautifully decorated. The staff are very attentive and knowledgeable and everyone is very cheerful which really makes a place for me. Dinner was exceptional and the staff's attentiveness only added to the pleasure of dining in house. Breakfast was good quality and everything was freshly made from the bread to the orange juice. The little touches are there in abundance from the gracious way requests are dealt with to a surprise pack lunch just before our departure really made Dar Anika a gem. The guide and driver recommended to us were also excellent and we felt very comfortable with them. All in all a great experience. Many thanks Sameer and staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Staff are amazing very welcoming extremely helpful from arranging the pick up from the airport to pin pointing attractions on the map. The food is magnificent both breakfast and evening meals (highly recommend the camel and prunes tagine). Perfect location to get to all tourist attractions and the Souks. I can't thank Fadwa Alana the guys and the management enough for all their help in making my husband's birthday truly wonderful. Would not hesitate to recommend this Riad and we will be returning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Exceptionally helpful and friendly staff who couldn't have done more for us during our stay. The delicious breakfast was served at a time of our choosing by the gorgeous court yard pool. The rooms were exquisite. We never had to worry about getting a cab as the staff always ensured transport was organised. The staff even organised to look after our luggage for a few days when we went to the coast. Really nothing was too much. Was simply amazing. My only regret was not eating in the restaurant ...perhaps an excuse to make a return visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were here from 28 December leaving on 1 January    Pick up from airport efficient with a lovely welcome on our arrival at Anika which is very much hidden from the street the large wooden doors being set in a little alley off the beginning of the Medina.    Our deluxe room was on the ground floor directly opposite the courtyard/public area (think room10). Lovely room with four poster vanity unit and spacey showerroom. Only window was a pretty stained glass one overlooking the public area. We were shown a window cushion to lessen any noise from outside. This did work but there was a feeling of lack of privacy with this room and more than once other guests congregated outside the door not helped by seating!    After 2 nights we enquired whether another room was available and were delighted to be shown upstairs to room 3 which was an upgrade.    All was well until we discovered the air conditioning was not working just as we were going out. They attended to it immediately and we were told it was fixed . However on our return much later in the evening we discovered it was only blowing hot air. I should point out I am of a certain age and get very hot so need a really cool room. By 11.30pm it had not been resolved so they had to put us in another room so after moving all our belongings we did not get a good nights sleep.    The following day the owner took up the issue and kindly bought me a fan so we could return to room 3 for our final night. I think everybody looked at the a/c unit but finally concluded it was broken!    Now you might think this is a complaint about Anika! but far from it. We asked to be moved from an acceptable room and things break down but the owner and staff at Anika bent over backwards to help us in addition to their genuine care about their guests stay and enjoyment of Marrakech.    They also made our last night (NYE) very special by Laying a table on the roof terrace under the Bedouin tent for our dinner which was probably an inconvenience as they had a special night for hotel guests with entertainment which was on the ground floor!    Would be go back to Anika? If we return to Marrakech yes most certainly but upstairs!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Out of this world! Highly recommended!
Review_Text: We arrived on 5th of January for three nights. The hotel it self is absolutely stunning clean and the best setting for those who want exceptional service in a boutique hotel. We were overwhelmed by the hospitality as the staff were very friendly helpful and responded very well to whatever we requested. As a couple we are well travelled and regularly stay in. 5 star properties over the world. But this hotel was exceptional on terms of service! On our last evening we dined at the hotel and food was the best meal of our entire stay! Would love to come back soon !

I recently stayed at this hotel. My experience was amazing. The hotel staff couldn't do enough better then some of 5 star hotels I've stayed in.  My husband & I had dinner in the hotel on our last evening and it was the best meal of our trip.  I would recommend this hotel.

This is a lovely Riad and the rooms are very nice. The sitting room downstairs with the sofas and fire is great. Service was very good the staff friendly and food is nice. The terrace upstairs is lovely and we enjoyed sitting out there in January in the sun (28 degrees at one time). My only critique was the level of noise at times from other guests who would sit outside my room (once at 4.30am in the morning) talking - this woke me up a few times and I had to mention it to them. The Riad is very central - a 5 minute walk to the main square. It is easy to find and the taxi takes you almost to the front door. So a lovely Riad overall.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Paul H wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Title: WOW WOW - you must stay here
Review_Text: I wanted to say amassive thank you to Samir and the team at the Riad Dar Anika. We've just returned from a 3 night stay and I can say I we were sad to leave. Samir organised:    - Local guide for shopping in the Souks and Medina  - Restuarant with Belly dancing  - Private car hire  - Golf at the Royal course in Marrakech  - Hammam and Massage    The service was attentive but respectful. If you want a real Marrakech experience stay here. It really gets no better for small and personalised hotels
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Only one bing wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: My wife and I have stayed in many 5* accommodations around the world but the staff at Dar Anika are like no other we have ever experienced. from the moment you arrive you are made to feel part of the family.    The Riad itself is in an amazing location as you are right in the heart of the action not to mention the beautiful traditional Moroccan décor which is complimented by the staff's attention to detail and cleanliness.    Now for the exceptional part..    My wife is 20 weeks pregnant and at 23.30 on new years eve she began to lose amniotic fluid and had asked me to get her to the hospital. Within 10 minutes we was on our way to the hospital where the languages spoken are French and Arabic however the taxi driver (Mohammed) was asked by the Samir (manager at Dar Anika) to stay with us and to make sure we was ok this is exactly what he did. He translated and made sure that we was getting the care we needed staying with us until 1.30 in the morning when I finally managed to get him to go home. This was not before he had gone back to the riad to get us both clothes from our room along with drink and snacks.    The next day I called the riad to organise a taxi for me to come back to get some more clothes etc of which within 10 minutes we had a visit from Abu the owner of Dar Anika who had come on his bike to visit us to see how my wife was. He asked if we needed anything that we had just to ask. On my return to the hospital the staff at Dar Anika had prepared some food to take back along with more drink and fruit.    Thankfully that evening my wife was discharged and we was greeted by Mohammed who again translated the results and scans and then helped to get the medicines from the pharmacy and then taking us back to the riad. upon our arrival the staff where all present to see how my wife was. We was asked if we would like dinner in our room due to my wife being told strict bed rest from which we just assumed we would be eating on a tray etc but we was greeted by two waiters who bought in a table and dressed it like the restaurant even going as far as to bring the wine glasses and stabilizing the leg to stop the table wobbling!!!    This continued to the next day where we was still on strict bed rest but was put up in the guest lounge and served breakfast then lunch. We was then greeted with a basket of flowers from Abu who again had come in to see how my wife was again saying anything that we need please just ask. again that night we had dinner served in our room.    The final day we had to go and collect our notes from the hospital from which Abu himself took me in a taxi to the hospital where they had unfortunately misplaced the notes but after an hour of Abu speaking to several nurses and doctors they located them and prepared our copy along with the certificate to fly home. upon leaving the riad we was greeted by staff wishing us all the best and was yet again given more food for the journey home.    Words cannot describe the emotions we went through but the staff as Dar Anika where simply second to none. Without them we would have endured a nightmare trip to Marrakech.    Thank you Abu Samir and team we shall return with the baby.    Simply amazing.....................
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: WE are so glad that we choose Dar Anika for our stay in Marrakech. We were treated like royalty at Dar Anika from the moment we walked in the door. We had told them that we were visiting for our honeymoon and our suite was covered in rose petals. The entire staff was committed to making sure that our experience was nothing short of FANTASTIC. The highlight of our trip was the New Years Eve celebration at the riad. Not only had the staff lined up an array of great bands belly dancers and singers but the entire staff seemed to genuinely enjoy celebrating and dancing the night away with us. Aside from being a great host and helping us plan out our days with attention to all the details Abu was an awesome Dj and Samir not only made sure we were taken care of during the stay and provided five star service but he also made sure the dance party kept going. :) We had such a fantastic time and really appreciated how the staff all went above and beyond.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent riad and very helpful staff. The location is excellent and very close to the famous square. The riad is a nice refuge in the middle of the busy medina.  Loved the breakfast on the rooftop and the afternoon tea. We have experienced real Moroccan hospitality that has been among the highlights of our trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I cannot possibly say enough great things about this place. It is absolutely gorgeous and situated in a fantastic location. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are lovely and well appointed. The view from the rooftop terrace allows you to take in the sights of the Medina as you are only minutes away from the main square. Abu the owner is an absolute gentleman who treated 3 girls from the UK that had a rather difficult first day in Marrekech to a sumptuous afternoon tea in sitting area by the fireplace. If you are looking for paradise in Marrakech - look no further. This is the perfect place to stay.

This riad is excellent to stay in from the moment we enter to the time we leave the service provided is great and the staff are always on their feet to help you and cater for your needs. If your coming Marrakech then this is definitely the place to stay everything about this riad is perfect you can chill at the rooftop or get cozy in the lounge. In this riad you get full time service where there will be someone to provide you with delicious cuisines chauffeur you around the city and even look out for you when you are out. Many thanks to Abu for welcoming us soo well and being extremely friendly and helpful.

Review_Title: Excellent an oasis in the medina
Review_Text: Highly recommended beautiful luxurious Riad & the personal service second to none. The roof top was amazing. Abu thank you very much for all your hospitality and making our stay fantastic & 6* we were so glad to meet you.

Review_Date: Roozbeh S wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Title: A good reason to write my first review ever
Review_Text: A wonderful get away from freezing New York  A cozy environment  polite staff spacious and clean rooms and delicious foods  I have visited many countries and I have never been motivated enough to write a feedback about a hotel so far.  But this was not just a hotel or Riad for me.  As an immigrant living in US away from family. DarAnika reminded me the warmth of my family back home (Mostly those warm home made BARBARI breads.)  The manager "Mr Abu" was a real "Gentleman"  genuinely seeking our comfort and pleasure rather than his personal benefit.  (What I saw unfortunately few days later in another Riad in Fez).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had an amazing 2 nights at Riad Dar Anika last weekend. We travelled to celebrate my own and my husband's 40th birthdays and the trip couldn't have been more special. We were so well looked after from start to finish. The service and food was excellent and plentiful the staff were friendly and helpful our suite was beautiful. Highlights were an open fire bing lit in our room breakfast on the roof terrace "Happy Birthday" being sung in English French and Arabic to accompany our birthday cake (not ordered or expected!) a couples hammam and massage. The staff recommended La Maison Arabe for dinner on my husband's birthday and arranged a reservation and another surprise birthday cake.    The location of the Riad is excellent being an easy walk to the main square but also close to a road for ease of use of taxis.    We cannot recommend Dar Anika highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anthony E wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Text: Morroco has been on our travel radar for sometime and we finally went two weeks ago for 5 nights which as we quickly learned was 2-3 nights too many.  While we stayed in a very authentic Riad (Riad Dar Anika) on the edge of the Medina where the staff were excellent and attentive and clearly anxious to ensure we were well looked after our room was tiny and cramped mostly occupied by a traditional poster double bed and one upright chair and one reading light and certainly did not meet the description on the website of being "a double room and seating area."  The local souks and large market square were bustling and interesting but being perstered on all sides by sellers and beggars did not help. A day trip to the nearby Atlas Mountains was very interesting but the tombs are vastly over rated.  Should have booked for 2-3 days not 5.  At least we have crossed Morroco and Marakesh off the list.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Janis A wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Title: Best relaxing and pampered weekend ever
Review_Text: We have had the most excellent 3 day weekend.  Traditional welcome followed by an excellent 'briefing' to ensure we made the most of what was available and stayed safe.  Our room was great and the staff were all so caring and attentive.  We had one dinner in the hotel which was a real Moroccan experience.  Just a superb place to stay in a complex and exciting city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lorelle F wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: We have stayed at many places around the world but Dar Anika has been the best by far. We were welcomed like family and treated like royalty. Every little touch made our experience wonderful. The manager Samir and his loyal staff made us very comfortable. The riad is in a great location at the entrance of the medina. Breakfasts on the sunny rooftop were a delight and the dinner was an absolute feast. Magic!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andy C wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: Simply superb.The owner and staff looked after us like kings.Fantastic location.  The owner gives you a map and shows you should you wish places to go and see.    Couple of points Taxis from the airport are going to cost you 100-150dhr they will try to charge 250dhr.  The walk from the taxi too the raid is 30seconds and the barrow boys will try to charge you 50dhr...ho ho.  Count your money when using a bureau de change they will try to short change you.  Go to the Kosy bar for a mojito.  Shoe shine boys will try to stiff you for 200dhr we paid 20dhr and they give you he whole hurt act....then walk away smiling.Dont get up set when bartering keep it friendly.  There is a cafe de epice which was just ok...a much nicer experience was terrace de epice in the souk... good luck trying to find it.    Too finish the Dar Anika Riad was excellent the staff the breakfast the location the managers all 5 star.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amit P wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: We had our honeymoon in Marrakech and luckily for us we stayed at Dar Anika. As soon as we walked inside the Riad we were amazed with the authentic look and warm surroundings. On arrival to our room there were flowers and rose petals laid out on the bed which definitely gave me some brownie points with my new wife. We had booked a meal that night in the Riad in which we were given our own private area for dining and the staff pulled out all the stops to make a very romantic setting. After our first nights stay we were greeted in the morning by Abu the hotel manager who provided us a map and advised us of activities and where to eat as well as giving excellent advice on do's and dont's which proved invaluable. My wife found the bed slightly hard and they sorted this problem immediately (I on the other hand like the matress). An absolute must is to take advantage of the massage and hammam services the Riad offers in which we went twice. There is a heated indoor swimming pool which unfortunately we only used once and directly opposite there is a living space with TV which we unfortunately did not have time to make use of but really is a truly amazing space to read or watch TV. The Riads location is prime everything is walking distance and as soon as you walk out onto the street you can embrace the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. On our last day our flight was not until 6:20pm and they kindly allowed us to stay in our room until we needed to leave for the airport. Lastly to our delight when we left they provided a free taxi to the airport and a packed lunch. If you are looking for an authentic morrocon Riad central location with a great personal friendly service Dar Anika is a great place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was a very special place. We couldn’t recommend it highly enough. We travelled as a family with children aged 7/10/13. The location within the Medina is perfect for all the key places to visit. Most are a 10 minute walk. Inside the atmostphere is serene the rooms are very well appointed and the peace away from the hubub is not to be underrated! But the greatest plaudits belong to Abu and his staff. As first time travellers to Marrakesh this made the experience a greatly enjoyable one for all of us. Nothing was too much trouble. He confidently helped us how to plan each day. How long visits would take when to take breaks suggestions to eat/shop and most importantly how to haggle! (Divide by 6 and end up about 50% higher than that). They arranged a Hamman at the hotel warmed up the pool for our three children organised a private dinnner on the roof. The roof terrace was a great place for our children. There is a small turrent in one turret in one corner and they loved watching the husstle and bustle of the street life below them away from the noise dirt and heat which one can have enough of. The roof terrace is also where one has the most beautiful breakfasts in the morning sun. And whilst Dar Anika is not a large place its is nevertheless higher than most building around affording beautiful views especially in the evening sunset.  Any downsides? The Riad is close to a Mosque so the call to morning prayer can be rather early and may disturb lighte sleepers. Rooms 1 and 2 are furthest away. DO NOT let it prevent you staying here would be my advice.  For what its worth we travelled on to the palatial and vastly more expensive Kasbaah Tamadot which was another experience. But on balance we decided that we all preferred Dar Anika. We were charmed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This was a fabulous gem of a riad - beautiful roof for breakfast and sunbathing and a quiet oasis and retreat just off one of the streets leading to the main square - perfect central location for all the sites. Very friendly and welcoming staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: An Oasis of Calm Amongst The Chaos
Review_Text: Words are not enough to describe the transition of feelings as you enter the Riad from the street. When the taxi dropped us off we thought he had us in the wrong place. Trepidation was the overwhelming feeling as we navigated our way past the donkey pulling carts and ladies sitting outside selling gold bracelets. The door swings open and you are greeted with warm smiles and a wondrous smell. The atmosphere inside is the reverse of outside and that makes it an ideal place to rest after a day spent haggling with a market trader over the cost of a chopping board or spending 3 hours being marched round the medina by Ali who decides that we need his personal attention ( costing 100 DH obviously ).The food that was served on my birthday evening was possibly the best I have ever eaten and the way the staff looked after us and our baby Sophia was impeccable. Nothing was too much trouble. They even produced a birthday cake and sang happy birthday to Jow on the roof terrace . You would not get that at a Best Western. The Riads own pet Tortoise summed up the place. Measured graceful calm.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Will C wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: I'd booked the Riad to celebrate a special birthday based upon Trip Advisor scoring and was not disappointed in the least. We were the only guests with a child (well behaved 7-year old) and were overwhelmed by the charming service and dedication to our happiness. They even heated the pool for our daily 6-minute plunge.  The location is perfect to explore the old city and the rooftop terrace is an ideal place to chill after the bustle of the souks. Samir arranged a day excursion into the Atlas mountains and although this wasn't especially cheap it provided a great contrast to the heat of the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: 5 star service - we were treated like Sultans
Review_Text: We had an excellent five day stay at the Riad Dar Anika. The location and service are the two best features of this hotel. The manager gave us a detailed 'briefing' on where to visit and where to avoid. The hotel is spotless and the dinner we had at the hotel was the best meal of the trip (try the beef and prune tajine). The hotel's location is excellent...out the door turn left and it's five minutes walk to the central square!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Stayed at Riad Dar Anika on our first visit to Marrakech. Wasn't sure what to expect and am pleased to say that the place did not disappoint. Very smart and clean this beautifully restored Riad is a real gem. Excellent staff service food and accommodation. Also benefits from an ideal location on the Medina a small indoor swimming pool & lovely roof terrace. Am unable to find fault and can heartily recommend. Will return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 nights on a long weekend break with our teenage daughter. A real oasis in a busy bustling environment. The riad is perfectly located for nearly all the popular tourist sights all within 10-15 mins walk away. We were greeted with mint tea fresh pastries and fruit on arrival and then were given an introduction by Abu about the various sights etc. as well as valuable tips on getting around what to be careful of and a map. The rooms were well furnished and equipped absolutely pristinely clean as was the rest of the riad. Breakfast was served on the balcony fresh fruit homemade delicious yoghurt cakes breads and pastries. All cooked fresh and served warm. We ate dinner in the riad on one evening and I can only describe it as a banquet! Fresh local food home made and lots of it!!! In fact it was the best food we had in marrakesh. The service throughout our stay was excellent very personal without being intrusive. Tea coffee and cakes served on return at the end of a day sightseeing was a real treat. Whilst outside the riad all around was very noisy it was very quiet and calming as soon as you entered. We had a wonderful stay and would not hesitate to recommend a stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sam T wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: Dar Anika is a gem. My husband and I spent five of seven nights of our honeymoon here and were treated with the utmost care and kindness. As a case in point our first breakfast – already amazing given the wonderful selection of food (oh the yoghurt!) and the charm of the roof terrace – was further enhanced as the Dar Anika staff presented us with a delicious personalised ‘honeymoon’ cake.    The hotel from top to bottom – including each individual hotel room – is gorgeous and designed with care and the staff reflect this precision; they are kind diligent and proactive and they aim to please. The managers are accessible and approachable and make time to ensure you are equipped with the best tips (i.e. where to eat staying safe) before you head out into the hubbub of the Marrakech souks and streets.    Its location is also brilliant. A five minute walk can land you at the main square (Fna) to the north or the Badi Palace to the south. A 10-15 minute taxi ride can get you into the ‘new town’ as well if you’re seeking a different kind of meal or nightlife or if you need to get to the bus or train station.    If you’re looking for an extra special stay in Morocco than Dar Anika will not let you down.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ian C wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: Chose this hotel for a 3 night stay based on Trip Advisor reviews. As the trip was a bit of a celebration (birthday & wedding anniversary) we chose a suite rather than a regular room which turned out to be a great choice. Very well appointed room beautifully lit with traditional brass lamps and a unique cupola above the rose-petal-festooned bed. Very attentive service from Samir and his team making great restaurant recommendations laying on guided tours etc. Lovely breakfasts on the roof terrace and a nice dinner one night there too. Thoroughly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was our first trip to Morocco and we chose Marrakech for a 5 night break. We knew we wanted to stay in an authentic heritage stay rather than a large impersonal hotel. I cannot rate Riad dar Anika highly enough. By staying here you make the choice of staying with long lost friends who love having you over and cannot seriously cannot do enough for their guests. The rooms are immaculate tastefully decorated with stained glass windows streaming delicate colours into the room internally and externally. Each day water fresh fruit and small cookies and pastries are left for you in your room  mint tea and cakes anytime and a delicious breakfast served on the terrace yogurtfruitcakeseggsmsimminmuffinspikelets jams freshly squeezed juice coffee served by the staff of this small boutique style hotel. The staff throughout cannot be praised enough the service the cleaning the reservations taxi bookings restaurant suggestions taxis transfers and the genuine interest in you and your trip. Samir the manager and Abu and his family the owners feel privileged to have you stay truly the privilege is ours. A strange new place where you are scooped up by all of them to stay in this beautiful well priced oasis and looked after so well you will not want to leave. There is only one choice for Marrakech in our view Riad Dar Anika every now and then you find a little gem this is. Its simply lovely and the experience cannot be bettered.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nick S wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: I thought long and hard about the rating could I really consider it as being excellent? The answer had to be a resounding yes with the caveat - for the price. If you can afford the £470 per night La Mamounia then you might not consider Dar Anika as excellent. However for us it was great. The location right on the edge of the Madina is good close enough to experience the bussle far enough away to feel comfortable. We enjoyed the Hammam the breakfast and the decor. The staff were really helpful and the size of the room great with ample storage and a great bathroom. The whole environment was cool and calm - a complete contrast to the world outside!  We found the bed to be a little harder than we're used to - I acknowledge that comfort is such a subjective thing! However this issue was quickly remedied by the staff through the addition of an additional layer of bedding.  If you’re flying in to Marrakech make use of Dar Anika's airport pick up and drop off service - it was really good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff were fantastic very helpful and polite the food was delicious the hammam and massage very relaxing. Samir the manager recommended excellent restaurants and arranged transfers and excursions all very high standard. The Riad is beautiful in a great location only a short walk from every must see in Medina and the new town. An oasis of calm in a busy city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 4 nights in Marrakesh and my wife's choice was this beautifull place. Since our arrival at this riad everything was perfect Samir is excellent with his enthusiastic way of treat people like others reviews we had a welcome tea cakes a lot of information about the city and what to do. Everyday we enjoy staying in this place if you need a massage city tour walking tour guides driver special dinner advices etc...even one night Samir came with us to make sure we will be at one place my wife select for dinner (was at Medina little street and late hours). Roof terrace for breakfast with one of the best orange juice I ever had (we used to live in Brazil and Miami) and we know about oranges. I used to travel for work and staying at many hotels and places and countries I can say this was one of the nicest place and service I can remember. Enjoy your stay...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We only spent 48hrs in Marrakesh so wanted to be in the action and Dar Anika was ideal. It is in an easy to find location on a main street with beautiful rooms staff and facilities. Many of the riads we had researched were in hard to find small side streets so we were very happy to find a Riad that was so easy to locate. The staff were eager to please and offered good advice on holidaying in Marrakesh.  The airport transfers and rooftop terrace were a great addition.  We also loved the resident Turtle that lives on the roof.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of luxury and charm
Review_Text: We booked a superior/de luxe room here for a three day break for two. What a find this is! We are not prone to effusive or overenthusiastic reviews but here is one to redress the balance. It would be hard to criticise this riad in the old city. The organisation the welcome the service throughout our stay were fantastic. We were pampered beyond our expectations - we would definitely recommend the hammam followed by a massage as a way of relaxing after a day of travelling. That put us in the mood for a delicious traditional Moroccan dinner which was certainly one of the best meals we had during our stay. Breakfasts were also excellent and food plentiful.  The riad itself is small with only 12 rooms only half of which were occupied. It is a very comfortable and intimate place to spend a few days. The welcome included tea cakes rose petals spread everywhere fruit & complimentary drinks in the room a chat with the owner (including helpful tourist tips restaurant reservations etc). Biscuits and nibbles were put in the room daily. Service from the entire staff was always courteous unintrusive and delivered with grace and a smile.  Standards of cleanliness were incredibly high - it was spotless - and it is in excellent decorative order.  For a romantic weekend this absolutely ticks all the boxes. Worth every penny. We would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My boyfriend and I have just spent 3 nights at Dar Anika. Having travelled in Morocco before and having sampled some great Riads in Marrakech this is definitely the best yet! The service and hospitality was great. They were welcoming without being pushy or over the top. It's a beautiful Riad on the outskirts of the Medina so easily accessable by taxi. There is a great bar just across the road and the Jemaa el Fna is about 5 minutes walk away. Breakfast on the terrace was peaceful and absolutely delicious! They even sent us off with a packed lunch for our journey to Essaouira. I would definitely recommend this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Liz L wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: We have just returned from Marrakech where we climbed Mount Toubkal. We started our trip with 2 nights at Riad Dar Anika - what a wonderful introduction to Marrakech! Samir was the perfect host telling us where to go - where to eat advice for handling the Souk!! All the staff were so helpful breakfast was wonderful on the roof - the small pool was a godsend once the heat became unbearable! I would highly recommend this Riad - perfect location on the edge of the Medina. Samir arranged transport from the airport for us. We will go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed one night with 2 and 4 years old. The staff made sure we had a wonderful time. The Riad location is very good. It is easy to find a parking and loading. The food is good. The rooms are big. Above all the staff and owner are great. We loved it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Michelle C wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: Marrakech was the first city we visited in our honeymoon and we stayed in Riad Dar Anika for 4 days... It was indeed the best way to start our trip with this riad full of nice decoration details and our room was amazing with a small patio just for the two of us. The service is simply incredible all the people at the riad make you feel welcome and they are very helpful for every little thing that you need from restaurant recommendations and bookings to having your laundry done. Breakfast was served at the terrace and it was great. Every day they had different pastries and a choice of tasty dishes our favorite was the Moroccan omelette and of course the mint tea that they serve you all day long. I would definitely recommend this place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Erin L wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Title: Amazing Property with even better Customer Service
Review_Text: From the pick up at the airport to the warm welcome when we arrived we couldn't have asked for a nicer sweeter professional staff. They treated us like gold! Made reservations for dinner cooked an incredible dinner another night on the rooftop for us and scheduled a tour through the old city which was beyond fantastic! The room was beautiful immaculately cleaned bottle of water left everyday along with fruit and snacks. The Moroccan tea and fresh orange juice is to die for and don't miss their breakfast.  Samir the manager goes above and beyond to ensure you have the absolute best experience not only at the Riad but in Marrakech. Can't wait to go back and visit them!  Erin W
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Teifi G wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Title: An oasis of calm; excellent location and value, attentive and friendly staff
Review_Text: My sister and I stayed here for 10 days in August. We were warmly welcomed with refreshments and a very helpful briefing by the manager Samia with particular reference to our safety (we were two women travelling alone). He even gave us his personal mobile number. The room was cool comfortable and spacious and was kept very clean and tidy. Breakfast was extensive served on the roof terrace with the riad's two resident tortoises. The waiter remembered our orders and preferences throughout the stay and all of the staff from the manager to the cleaners were smiley and helpful. This was particularly appreciated when my sister fell ill in the middle of our trip. The staff helped me to cancel/ reschedule reservations for spas and excursions we had made taking pains to retain the deposits I had paid wherever possible. They also brought us lunch in our room despite usually only serving lunch and dinner with 24 hours notice and then didn't charge us for any of it at the end of our stay. We were very sad to leave!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Mj S wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: Everything in this place was just perfect. Since the way the staff makes you feel at home every time you get in bringing you hommade cookies and an addictive mint tea to the decoration details in every corner of the Riad. There was magic everywhere It really was hard to leave that place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Florence C wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Title: You never know what's behind closed doors!
Review_Text: Wow! What a beautiful place. The drive to Anika didn't suggest we'd be met with such opulence when we arrived. We had the traditional mint tea by the lovely pool before being shown our gorgeous rooms. We were upgraded to a lovely four poster - very spacious cool and clean : we found the air con v effective! A huge comfy bed was most welcome after a tiring day negotiating the souks. Breakfast was fine. We had lunch a couple of times - it was okay but 1) nothing special and 2) expensive. It's quicker to walk to the square rather than taking a cab but it's not a scenic route (!) and a little unnerving so ask the hotel for a guide..at least for part of the way. The square is amazing at night and a real experience. Try the food stalls - we survived! Number 75 was excellent. The riad was a welcome oasis in the madness! If I returned to Marrakech I'd definitely go back to Anika.

Review_Date: Conor F wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Title: Honeymoon - 1st time in Marrakesh from Ireland
Review_Text: We stayed with Abou in Riad dar Anika in January of this year for a week on our honeymoon.  It was our first time in Morocco travelling from Ireland.  On first arrival in Marrakesh it looks like a daunting city but the warm welcome from Abou and his staff (and tortoise called couscous) made us feel right at home :)  We were brought into the beautiful Riad from a busy street and greeted with pastries mint tea and milk.  Once we had relaxed after our travelling we were invited onto the lovely roof terrace that has full views of the old town were Abou spent an hour with us giving us our bearings around the city with a map and drawing points of interest and telling us the do's and don’ts.  On arriving in the city we were sure we would hire a guide to show us around but after the hour with Abou he had put our minds at rest and we felt happy to venture out by ourselves.  Abou pretty much organised our entire week for us booking restaurants and show’s -without him we would not have seen a quarter of the things we did and would have fallen into the usual tourist routines and traps.  The Riad is a beautifully decorated in a traditional manner and is a calming spot in the middle of a bustling city the staff could not do more to make you feel welcome.  Fresh flowers in the room and rose petals on our bed!!  The food is unreal - just be aware that there is so much of you will probably put on a few pounds!!  Traditional Moroccan breakfast is served on the beautiful roof terrace - this is a real treat.  The Raid is a real gem in the heart of the old town in Marrakesh and Abou and his staff honestly could not do more to welcome you to the beautiful Riad and their city.  My wife and I both travel regularly on business and we have never experienced service like it.  Top marks and highly recommended :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My daughter and I spent 3 nights at Dar Anika and were blown away by its beauty tranquillity and tasteful interior. The level of service of its staff was without compare. We were welcomed with piping hot mint tea and wonderful pastries and cakes. Our room was decorated with rose petals and the plunge pool gave welcome relief after the heat of the day. The top terrace where we enjoyed a scrumptious breakfast had wonderful views over the medina. Situated close to most of the main tourist points of interest this riad is a must to stay at.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Dar Anika is simply perfect! Service is excellent everyone is always polite and they make you feel very welcome. In terms of locations is also very good about 10 to 15 minutes to Jemaa El Fnaa and 5 minutes to the Bahia Palace and mostly close to the main tourist points. The rooms are spacious bed is comfortable and there is a terrace where you can have breakfast while appreciating the view! Oh breakfast is amazing!! Their cook is the best! Ask for the scrambled eggs with onions tomato and cheese sooo yummy!    Also if you want to relax they have a pool. If it’s hot you can refresh yourself and if it’s chilly they warm it for you :).    Dar Anika was our last hotel in Morocco and it couldn’t have been better! Thank you very much for the hole staff and special thanks to Tarik who was always so kind!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had an absolutely wonderful experience! Service was impeccable staff was wonderful and made you feel at home the second you walked in. The riad only has about 10 rooms so you really feel very special when staying there. Rooms were beautifully designed. We really loved *everything* about Dar Anika and would definitely stay there again if we were in Marrakesh again! Absolutely wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: cornelius b wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: A oasis of peace and honest kindness. Authentic marocan atmosphere in an old riad. Outstanding staff. Beautiful decor in general and in all details. Inviting cold pool inside. Terrasse with wide view over medina are obligatoire. Wonderful strong waterpressure in the shower is to mention. The arrivel in the rooms has hewaien taste. Leaves all over. amazing place we loved it very much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful home from home and great base for exploring
Review_Text: Abu and his team of friendly staff are intelligent attentive and full of good advice about how to enjoy your stay. Food in the hotel was fabulous restaurant suggestions were spot on. Location is perfect for exploring the Medina and finding your way home after a late night out - no trouble to find it taxis can drop you at the door - but only 5 mins walk from the main square. Roof terrace is great for sunbathing too and the pool is refreshingly clean and cool. With only 12 bedrooms it feels like home. Highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Manning W wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: During our family's four-day stay in Marrakech the boutique hotelDar Anika was our oasis in the medina. The hotel's driver picked us up promptly on our arrival. Our suite there was large and comfortable with A/C WiFi and fresh roses. Fresh fruit water and mint tea was continually replenished. Our breakfast each morning on the rooftop terrace was simply wonderful with freshly-squeezed orange juice omelettes English muffins French crepes and a continually changing array of fresh pastries. The owner-manager Abu personally designed our tours providing guides and drivers for our time in the souks for camel rides in the Palmerie for our carriage ride (calech) around the old city walls and our visit to Essaouria and its Atlantic beach. The riad's highly trained staff especially Fadwa Laila and Rachid could not have been more thoughtful gracious and attentive. On our departure the staff even prepared sandwiches and fruit for our return flight to Barcelona thoughtfully aware that we would be arriving too late for dinner there. We will definitely return for another stay at Dar Anika and may accept Abu's offer to make arrangements for a three-day excursion to the deserts of Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: elizabeth w wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Title: Oasis in the Medina in Marrakech
Review_Text: Stayed 2 days here after a hectic 13 day tour of Morocco. We wanted some peace and quiet and TLC and this is what we got. We could not fault any aspect of the riad from the time of arrival to the time we left. The location is excellent as you are within a few hundred metres of the souks and the square if you wish to experience the hustle and bustle of the nightime market. However behind the doors of the riad you are unaware of the activity. Treat yourself you will not be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis within the hustle and the bustle of a great city
Review_Text: Just stayed 4 days in the incredible city of Marrakesh. To walk around the souks and the main square is a fantastic experience. Be prepared to be constantly approached for buying any kind of stuff but its not too bad ... The Riad Dar Anika was a lovely stay with an exceptional friendly service from all staff members without any exceptions. The last night we had a typical local dinner on the roof terrace which was absolutely amazing. Also try the local wine which was better than expected.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Samir and his staff go out of their way to make sure that your experience in Marrakech is an enjoyable one. The Riad is gorgeous well appointed and is ideally located for exploring the Medina.    I suggest having at least one dinner on the terrace. The food and the view are phenomenal. Their only rival is the service- which was perfect without exception.    I would have no hesitations recommending Dar Anika to anyone looking for a first-class stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very comfortable stay. The staff are helpful the rooms are nice the location is good. Very difficult to find anything negative to say. I would recommend the hotel. In essence the hotel is small comfortable and nicely located. A little pricey perhaps. We did not eat at the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The old walled city of Marrakech is amazing. It's busy 18 hours a day/night with people donkeys pulling carts and mopeds coming at you from all angles but a place to visit on your must visit list. We stayed at the Dar Anika which is ideally situated for visiting all sites of interest. It is a 5 minute walk to the Medina and Souks. The staff at Dar Anika are so nice and can't do enough for you. On our arrival we were met by the owner who spent an hour with us drinking mint tea with various pastries and advising us with a map where to go and what to avoid. We were then shown to our room with a large 4 poster decorated with red rose petals. The bathroom also with rose petals was really nice no bath but a really good shower. Meals taken up on the roof were superb and the views excellent. You can walk the whole city but be prepared to get lost because you will even with a map. Just go into a shop and the guy behind the counter will put you right. Don't ask anyone else They will offer to help you and you end up at a 'friends' and get the big sell. We were there for 3 full exciting days. If we had booked 4 we could have done the mountains so we'll go back to Anika in a couple of years and do just that. Anika is so quiet after the noise of the city one of the best hotels (for it's size) we have stayed in. Go there and enjoy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: neena s s wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: If you're looking for a touch of culture heritage balanced equally by both an excellent and personable service; this is definately the place to stay in Marrakech! We really feel that our wonderful holiday was the result of our stay at Riad Dar Anika. Samir - the manager made it such a hospitable experience and recommended the best of Marrakech. The staff were truely attentive and went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and truely a memorable experience. If we are lucky to revisit the city we will most definately be staying here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Whilst not wishing to repeat other reviews as the title says 'it couldn't have been better'. A 4 night stay where nothing was too much trouble for Samir and his team. Everyone was courteous and helpful. What you mustn't miss is the welcome chat Samir has with you as it sets out the do's and don'ts of Marrakesh and he also tailors the chat to your requirements.  The Riad itself is perfectly located not too far from and not too close to the hustle and bustle of the market and souks coupled with a roof terrace to come back and relax in what becomes your 'home from home'. Again it couldn't have been better thank you Samir and the team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Karan D wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: Just got back from a four night stay at the Dar Anika. First time in Marrakech and we certainly made the right choice of hotel. Location was great but what really stood out was the standard of service from Samir and his team - friendly and professional in the extreme. As a previous reviewer has said they really did create a real home from home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at other riads - but Riad Dar Anika is truly worth the time to write about. This riad is in the perfect location. Our room was spacious and clean. The common areas were well appointed and there was always someone around to attend to our needs. The walk to the souks is easy and yet it is on the edge of all the chaos - which makes for the perfect place to retreat after a long day sight-seeing and bargaining. We've stayed at 5 star hotels around the globe and have to say that the staff here is on the same par. We wanted for nothing. Abu and Samir were extremely accommodating and gave us one-on-one attention in order to see what ways they could help make our vacation memorable. Upon our departure we were each given wonderful brown bags filled with sandwiches and fruits to carry us through our next destination. I even received a beautiful bouquet of roses - such a nice touch and yet so unexpected. A big thank you to the staff - they made our stay most pleasurable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My husband stayed 3 nts and had a wonderful experience. We were treated like honored guests in a friend's house. All the staff were very professional warm and friendly. They made sure our stay was as comfortable and pleasant as they could make it. Reservations were easy to make and we were met at the airport so we did not have to worry about finding the Riad. The location is perfect just off the main road and close to the market square and some of the key tourist sites. Once inside the riad you really don't hear noises from the outside. The indoor atrium living room balcony areas and the rooftop terrace were all nicely set up with comfortable areas to sit lounge read etc.  We chose room #2 which we believe is their largest room. It had a king size bed and a dome with little glass covered holes so at night you can look up from the bed and it looks like you are looking at stars; during the day it lets additional light into the room. When we first got to the room they had rose petals strewn about which we thought was very romantic. There is no bath tub so we had to get used to the open shower which is very common in Europe just have to accept that water will splash around not really an issue.  Had dinner at the riad our 1st nt. We ate at two other places the other nights and we have to say that the food at Dar Anika was equally good and the service the best! There was a really cool nomad tent up on the rooftop terrace and that's where they had set up our dinner. The food kept coming and it was delicious! The presentation of the different dishes was very well done like being in a Michelin starred restaurant. And service during dinner was impeccable.  Breakfasts were feasts! They have the best ever homemade yogurt which my husband loved. When you come back from sightseeing or shopping someone is always ready to get you some tea and cakes. We also got a nice picnic lunch on our departure day. On top of it all the staff brought flowers and a birthday cake for my husband while we were having breakfast one day since we were there for his birthday. They sang happy birthday twice including one in the traditional Moroccan way! We were very touched.  Our stay really was one of the most enjoyable we've had in our travels. If we are ever back in Marrakech will definitely stay at Riad Dar Anika again! Thank you so much for all you did to make our stay memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: great service, great location and very charming Riad
Review_Text: Service was fantastic. When we arrived the room was decorated with rose petals as if we had hired a romantic package. The staff took care of us not only when we were at the hotel but also being very helpful in dinner reservations booking taxis and even gave us a small basquet with sandwiches and fruits when we left for the airport by lunchtime.    Location is great walking distance from main atraction in the Medina. From outside Dar Anika looks like any other house in the Medina. But inside you find a charming and confortable place to stay. It is worth visiting!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: You have to experience this - at least once!
Review_Text: Just spent 4 glorious days at this wonderful place. To Mr. Sanir to the rest of the staff - thank you for treating us like royalty - nothing was ever too much to ask! The friendly greetings the friendly smiles and the effort all went to was just incredible. We were treated with total respect kindness and total professionalism from the minute we arrived. The rooms were comfortable clean and all attention to detail were taking into account. Mr. Sanir and the staff of this lovely and great place - will be one of the good reasons we will return to Morocco. Thank you from us all!!!! SP and friends from Johannesburg SA.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Serena S wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: I wasn't sure what to expect when visiting Marrakech as I hadn't really heard of anyones experiences before hand. Upon arriving to Dar Anika the hustle bustle that surrounded the Riad was close to my expectation however after entering the Riad it was as if I was transported to a fairytale land somewhat resembling Aladdin. The welcome that I recieved from the staff added to my fairytale making me feel like Princess Jasmine.    The Riad itself was beautiful and the attention to detail in the décor was truly magical. The rooms were comfortable and no televisions truly enhanced the feel of a traditional Riad. The terrace where breakfast was served was an experience in its own. It was wonderful to sit and watch over the Medina and all that was happening outside whilst being in an environment so serene.    Breakfast was lovely with an orange juice coffee fruit salad yoghurt and cake every morning as well as almost anything you request. The staff were kind and attentive constantly ensuring that my stay was comfortable and whatever I needed was available to me right away.    All in all I would rate Dar Anika 10 out of 10. For anyone looking for a relaxing holiday or one with a true feel of Marrakech Dar Anika would be the ideal place to stay as alll your needs will be met and all your expectations will be exceeded.    This place was truly mystical magical and memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Great team, and great place to stay
Review_Text: We stayed here after being on the coast for a week. We were greeted with kindness professionalism and style. In what has been one of our nicest stays on our travels in Morocco.    The hotel is well located a short 5 min walk from main square giving you some peace and tranquility but with all the convenience that you need in the city.    Recommendations were excellent pool was cooling and breakfast roof terraced delight. We were also surprised and touched at the snack provided for us for our flight home.    A thoughtful and lovely place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Heather J wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: We have just spent three fabulous nights in Marakech at Riad Dar Anika.The rooms were greatthe staff treated us like starsnothing was too much trouble and every task was done with a smile.The staff also gave us good info on where to eat and which places to visit .We would like to say thankyou and hope to see you all soon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Incredible service and comfort in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: I have travelled a fair amount for both business and pleasure. Dar Anika was our final stay in Morocco. I can honestly say that the service at this riad was the best I've ever experienced in over 30 years of travelling beating out even 5star hotel chains. From the riad's owner to the manager to the service staff all were willing to do anything it took to make our stay comfortable. This included providing us espressos in the morning from a coffee shop across the street to buying is kilos of spices from their own supplier for fear that we'd be taken by unscrupulous vendors in the souks. We had an incredible multi-course meal at the riad that trumped any other Moroccan fair during our 10 days in country. The rooms were small but comfortable. The riad was an oasis.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Elizabeth Williams wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: We only decided to go to Marrakech two days prior to our departure it was a very last minute decision. We chose Dar Anika on the reviews we read on Trip Advisor as they were excellent. This is a 12 bedroomed traditional style Moroccan mansion. The rooms are arranged around a court yard and the accommodation is traditional comfortable but not luxurious. We were highly delighted by the hotel. The staff are very attentive but not overbearing. The first morning there we were greeted by the manager Samir who greeted us with great pleasure. He marked up a map of the city showing places of interest good places to eat and lively night spots! Such detail to attention was exemplary. We could not fault the service it was just wonderful.  Later we met the owner Abu who was equally attentive and gave great insight in to where to go and what to avoid. The breakfast was very good and held on the roof terrace look out for the storks! Remember to have lunch or dinner the food is first class cooked to perfection. Thank you for the birthday cake and flowers that were given to my husband for his birthday and all the staff signing happy birthday. A very memorable holiday staying at Dar Anika thank you everyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Every positive review you have had is an understatement.It is difficult to imagine the quality of service and the charm of this Riad from the outside.All the staff could not do enough for us without intruding. Advice and information was so good as to make a guide unnecessary.LOVE LOVE LOVE itwill be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: The Absolutely Perfect Place to Stay in Marrakech!
Review_Text: The Riad Dar Anika is one of the best places we have ever stayed at in all of our travels.  The Riad is absolutely beautiful. It has a gorgeous entry with a swimming pool in the middle of the courtyard. The place is exceptionally clean to the highest of standards. We stayed in Room #1 (it is spectacular and spacious highly recommend it) and our kids stayed in Room #2 (Very large room with plenty of sleeping capacity)  The people who work there are very friendly and attentive without being overbearing and hovering.
