The are ready to provide you with advice on the logistics of getting around and things to do.  The restaurant is fabulous. One must have dinner there at least once during the stay. My wife and sister-in-law took a cooking class with the head chef. They learned how to make tangia and tangine. I am still reaping the benefits to that cooking class!!  The breakfast in the morning is wonderful. They would ask us around what time we would like to eat and a table would be ready for our entire group already set up with fresh squeezed orange juice fruit salad pastries and other freshly made items. It was really great because we could quickly eat and get out about our day.  The hotel is in a short walk to the main market in Marrakech. We walked with our 4 kids to the main historic sites in Marrakech using the Riad Anika as our home base.  When we go back to Marrakech we will definitely be staying at the Hotel Anika again. Everyone in our family had a great time in Morocco and the experience as a whole was enhanced by the wonderful places we stayed at such as the Riad Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: for the price i would say it is worth the stay but only for 3 nights not the full 7. it is a lovely place to stay do'nt get me wrong but i feel the price is the same for one of the other hotels just out of town and the facilities are much superior and you can relax by the pools in much more safety than in this small riad. there was a very good welcome at this riad and the breakfasts were very good. stay and enjoy the facilities but if you want to relax by a large pool this is not the place to be for too long.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dominique S wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: Just returned from 5 days in Marrakech at the sumptuous and delightful Dar Anika. I read the reviews before I booked was impressed and then doubly so when I stayed. An oasis in the midst of chaos. You have to decide if you want to be in town or just out of town in 'hotel land'. If you choose the former for a more authentic Marrakech feel then you will find unparalleled service and attention to detail at this Riad. I can not fathom how any Riad could better them. The location to is so central you can walk on foot everywhere. The rooms are spotless and the staff - well they are the little gem that make it uber special.    Hats off! This place is worth the money and worth your visiting. Just don't step on that little turtle down by the pool or pop her in your suitcase to come home. Everyone else describes this place in more detail than me and I concur with their accounts. I'm fussy and I loved it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The best service we have ever had - amazing!
Review_Text: Just back from a fabulous stay at the Dar Anika - it and Marrakech exceded our expectations in every way.  They pre arranged a car to meet us at the airport and effortlessly whisk us to the hotel. The door is a simple door - but then inside - an incredible moorish decor just oozing care and quality.    We were shown to our room of good size with a large bathroom decorated in the same vein with rose petals strewn thoughout. All spotlessly clean.    And then up onto the roof for an amazing Morroccan dinner - and Morrocan wine - they have a very good Morrocan wine list.    So all very good so far - then you get up the next morning and after a sumptous breakfast again on the roof. They hit you with their secret weapon - service.    We were given a map and they sat down with us and explained where to go what to see how to get there what a caleche/ taxi would cost for this route etc. (it kills the haggling when you go -"hotel says it's this much" - price comes straight down.  As for restaurants they just booked them arranged a driver and that was all there was to it. By the way you give the restaurant the driver's card when you are finished and he comes and takes you back.    All of this service is very discrete and in in no way pushy - they are are just there to help you have a great time. We had a truly effortless break - The team just organised everything quietly and efficiently for us.    The location is very good - it is just a straight line walk (say 5mins) to Jamaa Al Fna Square - you can't get lost and it felt safe walking back at 11.30 pm plus.    On top of this we had the Hamman and Massage in the hotel's facilities - very good and relaxing I was falling asleep over dinner that night. Finally they arranged a car to take us back to the airport.    This was probably the most relaxing holiday we have ever had - all down to the efforts of the Dar Anika team - thank you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Hospitality doesn't get better than this: our family trip to Morocco part 2
Review_Text: Tucked away round a corner so very easy to miss when the large wooden doors swung open it was like entering the Tardis. Stunning interiors a delightful welcome beautiful and decorous fabulous rose-petalled bedrooms breakfasts on the terrace the small but welcome pool and of course the three tortoises (large medium and cute). But what sets this Riad apart is the service - attentive friendly perfect.    We spent 2 nights here with our two 11 year olds following 5 nights at Kasbah Angour near the Atlas Mountains (see part 1 review). Abu was our main host here and his tips on what to do and when and where to eat were great. When we ate at Pepe Nero on the first night it was a beautiful setting complimented by very good cuisine (they have Moroccan and Italian menus). (btw walking to the restaurant some cheeky gent told us it was closed - no doubt trying to win custom for another place - luckily we had reservations so didn't fall for it).    However Abu's second recommendation on our last night was sublime - Dar Rizlane was beyond exquisite: the gardens the food the service were amongst the best I have experienced anywhere. It cost a lot - around £150? - but as near to perfect as a meal in Marrakech can be.    Marrakech was very hot this week 38 degrees and the assault on all the senses with the souks and the Medina square as mad and as noisy and as busy as ever may not suit everyone but it is a magical place with great exotic sights and smells at every turn. The ever present and buzzing mopeds and scooters are not welcome partners in the alleyways.    On our first afternoon there Abu recommended we ask our guide to take us direct to the souks and visit the Bahi and Saadian tombs the next day ourselves as they were very closeby. Unfortunately the guide wouldn't listen to us and it took an hour and half in very hot conditions before we finally arrived in the markets. We weren't happy with him as the souks are only about a 10 or 15 minute walk from Dar Anika but he did show us some great stalls. You have to be prepared for the way of the guides - they take you to a shop - usually a pharmacy/herbalist a carpet shop a carpenter etc where there's a medium to hard sell but on about the fourth or fifth 'no thank you' the message is received. But there is so much I'd like to buy! If you do want to buy something always offer less than half their asking price and work up a little from there. Never pay more than half their original asking price. Walk away then you will get a good price! At one stage we got drawn (via our guide) into a carpet shop tired and hot and we politely withdrew quickly before our guide had re-appeared. I suggested (only half jokingly) we make a run for it.    A guide is useful the first time there but no its not impossible to find your way round the Medina with a decent map.    Dar Anika provided a wonderful peaceful respite from the hustle and bustle and noise of Marrakech; on our last day they provided very tasty lunch bags to take to the airport with us.    It's a fabulous place and just doesn't get better than this.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Don't be put off by the approach to the entrance this must be one of the nicest Riads in Marrakech. Welcomed with mint tea milk and dates after a while Samir greeted us and gave us a full introduction to Marrakesh including map advice and recommendation where to eat. Lovely covered courtyard with rooms off on first floor very comfortable little warm at night but we did not think it justified asking for the air con to be turned on. Great evening meal lots of elements whole tableful of dishes. Breakfast with eggs served on roof. Attentive service we could have benefited from better French as some things weren't clear to us when Samir was not there but the staff could not be more helpful including sending us off with lunch on last day. This is great location we walked everywhere in the old city from it without the hassle of crossing the new roads. Very highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anne M wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel - fantastic food and great staff!
Review_Text: We spent 5 days at the Riad dar Anika. What a beautiful hotel! And the staff was simply fantastic!  Arrival:  We got picked up in a lovely car from the airport and driven straight to the hotel. There we were welcomed and sent up to the roof terrace straight away for a complimentary breakfast as we arrived in Marrakech at 9am.  Food:  The food was great - delicious yoghurt fruit salad fresh orange juice coffee tea break a different cake every day and an omelette. We had dinner at the dar Anika as well one night. The setting was fantastic on the rooftop the food was truly outstanding but maybe just as good as the food was the service – we loved witnessing how proud the staff was to introduce us to the delights of the Moroccan cuisine which was lovely.  Staff:  Every staff member was extremely helpful and courteous always there to help you in any way by making recommendations upon request. Tea and Moroccan soups were offered to us throughout our stay. Fantastic staff management and owner – I’d definitely come back to stay at the dar Anika!  Rooms:  Beautiful rooms! Decorated in deep colours and quality accessories – from handstitched bedspreads to gorgeous pillows and quality shampoo.  Pool:  I was looking for a hotel with a pool but booked the dar Anika despite its moderate 4-meter pool. When I arrived I learned that due to architectural reasons there are actually very few pools in the city. The small pool at dar Anika is perfectly fine to get refreshed and you can go on a trip to one of the beautiful spas for a swim or a Hammam if you like. I recommend the massage at the Golf Atlas hotel outside of the city walls.    If you book the dar Anika I am sure you will have a beautiful stay – suitable for children and couples alike. A great small hotel!    My thanks go to Samir and all the staff  Anne
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It started with a short drive from Marrakech airport to the old city Medina at the beginning of a busy street Zaitoun El Kadiem (Old Olive Street) at the entrance of the old Souk (market) leading to Djemma el Fna.  Not knowing what to expect except some photos we saw of the Riad (Boutique Hotel) in the Internet we were directed to an old beautifully carved door the moment it was opened we were greeted by Abu Omar and Khalid part of the hotel management we knew that we were into an experience.  At the entrance there was a small reception area handled by two pleasant ladies directly to an amazing courtyard with a massive skylight extending to the upper parameters of the yard during the winter times it is covered with a transparent membrane during the summer the membrane is removed totally at all times light always comes through. The main structure of the building overlooks into the yard to the right there is a swimming pool directly straight the hammam to the left a sitting room some guest rooms on the ground floor and the rest on the first floor in total 12 guest rooms all with views on the yard on the second floor there is the roof terrace beautifully landscaped focus point Arabian tent potted plants trees and flowers with views over the old city and Atlas mountain. All floors are furnished in a traditional period style with the influence of mature plantations. In addition to the hotel staff furniture fixtures and fittings there are two tortoises a chameleon and a stuffed toy monkey on a palm all permanent occupants.  Once inside the Riad strangely the noises of the busy streets disappeared our luggage were taken immediately to our room politely we were asked to leave our passports for registration and then taken through the main courtyard of the hotel to a beautifully decorated sitting room with the traditional old style of the Riad  we were offered wet towels to freshen up followed by some traditional soup dates Moroccan tea and local sweets all prepared on the premises followed by a brief introduction to the hotel and the city. Going up to our room we were faced with an amazing internally decorated and finished room red rose petals were used to enhance the decoration there were complimentary fruits water and nuts. Although the Riad is of old construction it has been modernized to a very good standard which is very evident in the rooms and the bathroom facilities.  Our complimentary breakfast we used to have it daily on the roof terrace with some guests already finished soaking in the sun with a book some coming to have breakfast. Afternoon tea is offered daily with dinner normally served with local dishes in the courtyard some nights there will be local musician playing traditional music to accompany the food and wine. We must say dining in the Riad is an experience and is a must so is the hammam translated bathroom but it is a way of bathing in the old traditional way.  Leaving the Riad to visit the Souk local attractions and excursions it was always nice to come back to the Riad as a retreat looking forward to a clean room shower a glass of wine to relax and to embark into the evening. It is almost like an oasis in the middle of the desert.    In total we stayed eight nights we were sad to leave the service we received the attention to our needs and to small details the readiness of the staff to help and please all was beyond our expectations Dar Anika is a boutique hotel with a massive big heart for sure we will visit again.  Thank you to the management and all the staff to have made our stay memorable one.  Rima & Ata
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amanda C wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE Riad Dar Anika!!!
Review_Text: My second stay at this fabulous boutique hotel which can't be beaten for comfort location service and the best food we had whilst in Marrakech. Even tho the weather wasnt that great it was so nice to relax in the salon with all the comforts of home. The staff are so amazing and the food unforgettable please don't miss the opportunity of discovering this hidden gem I guarantee you will be back for more.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hugo R wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: Execellent and warm and carring service.    You must ordre dinner once at Dar Anika at Your stay as it is execellent.    We got all the help and advice for visits tours resturants etc. as we needed.    If You want to visit Marakech Dar Anika will be a good part to make the stay in Marralech a succes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A special and memorable birthday stay.
Review_Text: We spent a night at Riad Dar Anika in April having arrived in Marrakech earlier on in the day. We were efficiently collected from the airport and brought to the door of the Riad. From that moment we received the most outstanding service imaginable: we were greeted in person and offered refreshments to relax. We were allowed to drop our bags early in the room where we discovered the most beautifully adorned room decorated with rose petals and with a stunning basket of roses to celebrate our daughter's birthday that day. We went off on a guided tour of the Medina arranged previously through the Riad and returned for evening dinner. The dinner was a wonderful experience tasting so many different specialities; so much was provided that we didn't come close to eating everything on our table. To cap off a perfect evening a cake had been arranged by the Riad for our daughter. The following morning a generous breakfast was the icing on the cake. Seriously excellent service outstanding attentive staff wonderful surroundings and a beautiful and comfortable room: Book a visit you will not be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Fantastic place a real gem in Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights at beginning of March with our mums as a surprise treat for them. Can't thank the staff enough for their warm hospitality & care. The little touches were lovely all the staff are happy & helpful. Wish we could have stayed longer. Loved the breakfast mint teas & the great haria soup with homemade bread & cakes. Location is perfect & we did so much in a few days. Thanks from Debs Ann & Margaret & me. Keep up the good work Dar Anika :-)

Review_Date: David Baker wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Title: Luxury in Marrakesh with Care for your Comfort
Review_Text: We arrived in Marrakesh airport to be met by a driver from the Dar Anika who helped with bags and took us through the chaotic traffic of Marrakesh to the calm and beauty of this exotic Riad. After a welcoming mint tea we were shown to rose petal covered rooms by smiling staff. The hassle of the journey evapourated in the scents of shower.  An extensive dinner followed with several gently spiced courses appearing under the tagines. We had arrived in some sort of exotic heaven ! Candles floated on the surface of the swimming pool a muiscian played in the corner but suddenly tranquillity was interrupted by drumming and singing as three ladies appeared to demonstrate their quivering hips ! Soon peace returned and we retired to the comfortable bedrooms their Moorish designs.  Breakfast was on the roof surrounded by flowers in "ali baba" pots. Delicious pancakes and local bread accompanied eggs of your choice a subtle yoghourt fruit juice - in fact almost anything one could wish for.  The next three days were spent on a desert Safari organised by Abu the owner of Dar Anika. All went like clockwork thanks to excellent planning by Abu and his team. Back again in the comfort of the hotel we found out about the delights of Marrakesh Medina; everything is close by: the Bahia Palace the Jemaa El-Fna carriages to take you round the city restaurants recommended by Abu and the fascinating bustle of the passages filled with merchants selling all kinds of produce.  The staff are helpullness itself they produce tea whenever you return tired from your shopping. The hotel exchange rate is competitive everything is spotless the pool is cool after a hot day and we enjoyed being pampered immensely . Can I think of any negatives ? The Muezzin's call to prayer can disturb one's sleep but that is what he intends to do !  I cannot recommend this small hotel highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Flossie C wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika for 6 days and it was really a very enjoyable experience! Located right in the Medina itself it was an easy walk to the souk and Jemaa El-Fna where you can take in the sights and sounds of the old city. In fact the Bahia Palace and the El Badi Palace were just a stone’s throw away from the riad! The riad itself was clean and had a quiet and soothing ambience which was much needed after being out in the busy medina. The manager Samir was extremely comprehensive with information about must-see sights and good restaurants. We had excellent service all the time and every single person working in the riad was friendly and helpful. We also had dinner in the riad on the first night we were there and it was simply sumptuous! In fact it was one of the best meals we had in Marrakesh which was saying a lot since we did eat at many highly rated restaurants like Dar Rizlane (which was disappointing and overpriced!). We were in Room 2 which was nice and large but not well lit. Three other things made the room less than perfect for us: (1) the shower area was not enclosed which meant that the bathroom floor was always wet after we showered no matter how careful we were; (2) the two windows in the room opened out to some random space where people could walk about and that meant that we had to leave the windows closed all the time or we could have strangers looking right into our room; and (3) little skylights in a dome-shaped ceiling just above the bed was gorgeous until we realized that it meant we could not sleep in since the skylights allowed light into the room. The skylights were painted white but still let in quite a bit of light. So if you are the kind to sleep in Room 2 is not for you! But the drawbacks of the room did not detract from the loveliness of the staff and the wonderful service they provided at all times. Furthermore the owner of the riad Abu is wonderfully knowledgeable and enthusiastic about ensuring the best experience for his guests and now organizes trips into the desert where you could sleep under the stars! We met some guests whose itinerary was planned by Abu – three days in the desert before coming to Dar Anika for another few days – and they told us it was an amazing experience because everything from food to facilities to vehicles to guides was just exceptional. So we definitely recommend Dar Anika if you are planning to have an authentic Moroccan experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing all around, especially the service
Review_Text: From the moment we were picked up at the airport Samuel and his team did an amazing job of making us feel right at home in their beautiful Riad in the Medina with perfect access to the Souks and Square as well as the street for car service or taxi to anywhere you wish to go. Don't worry if you are not sure where to go because Samuel and the team will make great recommendations. We played 4 days of golf and loved it and the team planned our delivery to and from the golf courses every day and dinner each night was based upon their recommendations including a great Moroccaine meal in Dar Anika the first night. Everything was delicious and my wife and I were full for two days after that meal. The restaurants were all great recommendations and variety each night. We spent several days strolling the souks right from the Riad and contributed well to the local economy and bought some great treasures to remember our second trip to Marrakech. About half way through the week we had the pleasure to meet Abu the owner and it is clear that the warm hospitality and great service at Dar Anika comes from the top. He recommended an amazing restaurant for our last evening and sent his team to get us some of the best Moroccaine Pastries to bring home to a dear friend and some for ourselve too. The breakfasts the teas the terrace the service the family atmosphere I could go on and on just go and I assure you you will be glad you did! It was so great my wife will go again with her sister real soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed at Riad Dar Anika from 1st to 4th March 2013 with my Daughter and two friends . We were treated with care and respect and were totally spoiled with attentive service ( not obtrusive and very professional). The staff were friendly and always willing to help and the managers were most helpful with local tips etc. and would take the time to chat to us.  The rooms we had were excellent although I would recommend room number 2 as it seemed lighter than mine (which was number 7). Both rooms were very comfortable and decorated on arrival with rose petals which was a lovely touch.  The breakfasts were fantastic with fruityoghurt pancakes. bread eggs etc. and even English tea! (Yes we also had Mint tea). We often had tea on the roof terrace after a day of sightseeing which was most welcome and a restful spot.  We were also given a packed lunch with a small gift on departure which was also unexpected and gave a caring impression of the Riad.  The Riad itself was a tranquil place where we could totally relax and feel very comfortable in.  I would totally recommend this Riad to any travellers to Marrakech it was close to a lot of the tourist places which we wanted to visit and we could walk there easily ( 2 of us were seniors).  My thanks to the managers and staff at the Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: As all the reviews on Trip Advisor were SO good I was a bit worried the riad was almost destined to fall short. On arrival you are welcomed warmly and plenty of time is spent with you explaining where to go and answering any questions on the area. This Riad only has 12 rooms and over the days we stayed it began to feel like home! The layout is great as there are plenty of places to have a relaxing mint tea whether it be on the terrace in the lounge or on one of the other floors. The team there are brilliant; genuinely friendly and surpass themselves to go that extra mile for you. Small touches like fetching blankets so you can sit outside to watch sunsets at night when it's cooler packed lunches remembering how you like your eggs/tea in the morning are a welcoming change from chain hotels.    We also had the set dinner - wow. All i can say is I have never seen so much (yummy!) food in my life. It was great! The Moroccan salads were the best we had all holiday and the lamb was delicious. Breakfast was also plentiful and set you up for the day ahead- great home-made yoghurt and bread daily.    The location is also perfect. An easy stroll to the main square and really close to 3 of the main attractions. Bedrooms were spotless and lovely comfy pillows. Also liked the dressing gowns.    On the plane home we overheard some other people discussing their stay in a 5 star hotel and they said the service they received was half hearted at best. Choose this riad and I can guarantee you will have the opposite experience- this riad and it's fabulous team made our holiday so special as they really did deliver wonderful service. I hope to go again soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: From the melee of the street markets in Marrakech you go through the black door into the tranquility of Riad Dar Anika. Without doubt this must be one of the best small hotels in the world. Never have we experienced service like this. From the rose petals around your room when you arrive to the friendly helpful staff the service was exceptional.    The dinner is a MUST. You will be amazed by the quality and the quantity (the only complaint is that the tables were too small to hold it all).    Abu insisted that we did not tip anyone individually (and the staff did not expect it) but we just had to give a tip at the end.    All this does not come cheap but when it came to paying the bill most of the small services like tea and cakes were free of charge. How many other hotels would do that for you?    We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Marrakech is quite unlike anywhere in Europe. It is more than you can imagine.An assault on the senses in every way. Dar Anika is an oasis of calm in the Medina.  From our arrival at the airport to our departure everything is taken care of. On the first night we had dinner in the riad and this is something I would recommend. For authentic Moroccan food I dont think you will do better.  The staff our great and Samir is a font of knowledge and is happy to recommend trips what to do and what not to do.  Some really nice touches such as the welcome mint tea and cakes right through to our packed lunch for the plane journey home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: So fabulous we are already planning to organize a far-flung-family reunion here
Review_Text: Thank you Trip Advisor friends. Your stellar reviews led us to a truly wonderful 5 day stay at Riad Dar Anika. Particularly appreciated: the welcoming ceremony; the spotless and upgraded room; the hour-long "introduction to Marrakesh" the first morning with Abu owner and host extraordinaire who gave us excellent information and confidence to make the most of our stay; a most comfortable location at the end of the souk which I found I much preferred to other riad locations around the area; and the staff who actually went out to try to buy a converter at 9 pm when ours broke who remembered our names and who seem to be really enjoying their jobs. Unexpected bonuses: lovely rooftop terrace for the hearty breakfast; complimentary yummy traditional soup served each evening; help changing US dollars without having to go outside; help arranging a tour and airport transfers; and a colorful community of people just outside the door who have been living there for over 30 years. So unexpectedly relaxing to be so well taken care of in this very unfamiliar city. I could just simply move into Riad Dar Anika; we will certainly be bringing our far-flung family to enjoy the hospitality. Could not be any better. Cannot think of one suggestion for improvement which my friends will assure you is highly unusual for me. Don't hesitate. BTW: Marrakesh is wonderful too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Carole C wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Annika for 4 nights having chosen it because of other Trip Advisor reviews. We had a fantastic time and were treated beautifully from the second we arrived until we left. The staff were pleasant attentive (to the right degree) and provided everything we could want. We had a very pretty room (number 6) which looked out onto a street leading up to the main square (5 minute walk) Our initial thoughts that this could be a noisy room were totally unfounded.On our last night we had a meal at the riad which was superb...by far the best meal we had and a highlight of our stay. Samir and all the other staff did an excellent job!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was my first visit to Marrakech and I am so pleased that we chose Riad Dar Anika with the help of the Trip Advisor reviews. Our stay was amazing The owners  manager and every member of the staff were incredibly helpful. They explained the good interesting and less safe areas of the city giving us maps and explaining how to get to the best areas and sites. They advised on where to eat safely and recommended itineries for our length of stay that allowed us to see as much as possible whilst we were there.  Breakfasts were amazing and we also ate there two evening meals which were traditional Morroccan cuisine delicious and in great quantity !  The bed was incredibly comfortable and room was immaculate.  Taxis arrranged whenever we needed them at very reasonable costs the mint tea was delicious and plentiful...........I really cant say enough about the standards of this Riad we enjoyed every aspect of our stay there and would highly recommend it to anyone that is thinking of going to Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I have only got raves for this place. The service and hospitality are exceptional from the welcoming "ceremony" to the Moroccon soup each evening. Nothing is a trouble the staff remember your name and it is sincere.probably the best service I have had anywhere in the world.  The decor and finishes are classy as well as homely. It is an oasis from the noise and mayhem just outside the door. There is wifi throughout the establishment and even a small swimming pool in the lobby. There is a rooftop terrace overlooking the hussle and bussle below.  The breakfasts are delicious especially the yoghurt and the eggs are to die for!!  The rooms are a good size but if you can get an upgrade it gets even better.  I could have spent a week in just in the Riad without going out into the old city of Marrakech. But the excitement of Marrakech is just in walking distance from the front door. All the main sites are close by.  I would strongly recommend this Riad and hope that I have another opportunity to stay here. I just loved it. So that is my rave!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Jonathan B wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: Excellent service. Very tasteful Riad with comfy bed and delicious breakfast. Staff can't do enough to help. Lovely roof terrace too. A few minutes from the main square. Taxis can take you to the door which is very handy.

Review_Date: Federico G wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Title: Probably the best place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: As I work for an airline I have the privilege to travel a lot. I've visited many hotels riads and resorts mainly around Europe and as far as I'm concerned I can say that it's very difficult to find something even close to this Riad. The structure have been completely rebuilt using high european standards while preserving the genuine Moroccan style. Everything have been studied to make it comfortable. On top of it the service to the customer it's something incredible! You'll have one (or even two) people looking after you! This place it's fantastic and it's already the second time we are going there (next year we are going there aswell).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A wonderful experience - exquisite service & food. The staff are all well-trained and provide very professional quality of service. The location is just right - close to the centre without being in the hustle and bustle of Djemma el Fna. Perhaps too much food? But who's complaining? We can't recommend the Dar Anika highly enough and we will be returning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was a haven for us away from all the wonderful madness outside....the staff are outstanding and could not do enough for us...Abu and Samir (think we have the names right!!) were beyond excellent. From the moment we arrived we were greeted beautifully with milk cookies treats etc The breakfasts on the roof terrace are something we will never forget. The mint tea and freshly baked goodies were to die for. Please go for the cheese omelettes baked in tagine dishes - delicious!. Also lovely coming in from a night out and have a last drink of the evening in front of the real fire which you will have to share with their pet tortoise who also loves the warmth of the fire! We stayed for 5 nights and it was for my husband's 50th birthday...we asked for a room swap and they did with no problem. They even provided my husband with a gorgeous birthday cake on the morning of his birthday; which was totally unexpected and greatly appreciated. Rooms are gorgeous with bath robes and rose petals scattered over the rooms are a lovely touch. The hosts were fantastic with giving us excellent advice about where to go and even booked us taxis and restaurants. Just excellent personal service without a doubt! Please stay here...you will not be disappointed...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great location in the heart of the Medina made it easy to explore the city. A unique Morrocan experience decore food and service. As a first timer to Marrakesh the city can be a little daunting the hotel Manager Samir showed us what was important to see gave us maps and the confidence to make the most of the trip. Lots of little extras purchased our ongoing bus tickets and even packed a lunch for us on the day we departed. Our thanks to the team for making our stay very memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Go. Now. Wonderful Riad with friendly, attentive service
Review_Text: First time / first night in Morocco. Arrived around 6 p.m. to a somewhat chaotic street scene on the edge of the Medina. Then into paradise (in every way). Warm greeting from Tarek and Joab (so sorry as I know I've butchered the names of these fabulous fellows) followed by milk and dates then mint tea and cookies. Romantic interior including rose petals on the way to the room then in the room (all over including the bath). Romance plus! Invited to relax and clean up before our dinner. Do not miss out on the dinner (which I sort of reluctantly signed up for figuring we'd be a bit road weary our first night). So glad we ate at the Riad . . . the food was great and just kept coming and coming. Amazingly warm attentive service at dinner and during our entire stay. Breakfast on the terrace which was much more than merely a continental-style breakfast i.e. eggs any style. 5 minute walk to the main square. Wonderful people watching from the terrace in the early a.m (with great sunrise) and end of the day. Stayed two nights perfect stay. Highly recommend this Riad. Note that I booked this Riad through Priceline so not only was it perfect in every way the price was less than $100/night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Travel Foodie wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: Firstly I want to say a Big "Thank you" to Samir Abou and Halima for the overwhelming hospitality they showed us. Being Irish our national motto to visitors in Gaelic is "Cead Mile Failte" which means 'a hundred thousand welcomes'; well this is exactly what we received in Riad Dar Anika!  When we arrived we were greeted by the warm and friendly Samir who ushered us into a beautiful Morrocan style lounge were our hands were cleansed with rose water and we were first given ornate chalices of t mint tea which was traditionally poured from a height. Followed by glasses of almond milk dates and some Morrocan pastries. We were then left there to relax and soak up the mystique of our surroundings while we unwound from our journey.  The Riad itself is located right in the heart of Marrakech amidst all the hustle and bustle of the souks and the mystical palaces and mosques. It is only a few minutes walk from the famous Djemaa el fna the massive square where you will see snake charmers and monkeys and souks selling everything you can imagine. Yet once inside the doors of the Riad you will find yourself in a peaceful tranquil oasis.  You must have dinner in this Riad at least once as it was the best traditional Morrocan food we tasted. On our first night the chef Halima made us a feast of several different tagines. It was Superb! She also took me down and showed me the kitchen one evening as I showed an interest in how the food was prepared! I was delighted!  Abou the owner was so helpful and told us all the sites to see and where was good to eat etc. a lovely man!  Every evening we were offered a bowl of Harira soup to comfort us.  Samir would organise our taxis to take us to and from restaurants and he even organised and paid for our bus journey to Agadir when we were leaving. On top of that we were given a packed lunch for the journey!  An absolutely amazing memorable stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was our first visit to Morocco and "WOW!!" what a Christmas break we had. On leaving a wet and cold England on the 22nd December we were a little apprehensive as we relied heavily on the reviews on Trip Advisor's website in making our decision to stay at Dar Anika. Not only did Dar Anika meet our expectations they exceeded them!! Having organised our airport transfers with the most helpful and friendliest of drivers we were subject to the most incredible welcome we have ever experienced! We were greeted in the traditional Moroccan way by the most wonderful staff who provided us with milk and dates followed by mint tea and pastries.  The riad is just wonderful; it's so quiet and peaceful inside even though it is well positioned close to the El Badi and Bahia Palaces and a short walk to the Jemaa-el-Fna Square. The decor is lovely with plenty of comfortable seating areas inside and on the terrace. There is a pool and a hamman. Our rooms (1 double & 1 twin) were spotlessly clean and decorated with rose petals. Bottled mineral water pastries fruit bathrobes and toiletries were provided. We have travelled extensively in Europe and we have never experienced such hospitality in our lives before. We were made to feel extremely welcome and special; in fact truly spoilt! The hospitality was what you would expect of a 5* hotel but without the high price tag.  All the staff at the Riad are helpful kind polite and friendly. The food is exceptional and plenty of it too. Breakfasts were served on the terrace and consisted of fruit yoghurt fresh orange juice warm bread rolls pancakes condiments cake a variety of egg dishes and good coffee even English tea! The 3 course meals offered in the evenings were freshly prepared daily and of the highest quality. The wine which was recommended by the waiters was extremely good too. The waiters are well trained knowledgeable and couldn't do enough for us.  Samir manages this impeccable riad. He is very friendly approachable and helpful. He makes time to hold a meeting with you at the beginning of your stay to give advice and make suggestions on where to go what to see where to eat arrange excursions inform you to how much to pay for taxis or horse and carriage rides etc. and provide you with a packed lunch on the day of your return. We were really impressed that he provided us with his mobile telephone number in case we felt that we needed help or got lost - this was very reassuring. He organised a wonderful Christmas gala meal on Christmas Eve which included aperitifs wine water wonderful food and traditional Moroccan & Berber entertainment as well as an Xmas tree! We also discovered some wonderful roses in our rooms with a note from the staff of the riad wishing us 'a merry Christmas'. His attention to detail and thoughtfulness was again a lovely touch. Samir also arranged a day trip to the Ourika valley to visit 3 Berber villages for us with the driver who collected us from the airport. The driver deserves a mention too as he made this trip a 'must do'. We felt in safe hands throughout. As well as being a good driver with a large comfortable air-con car he was friendly helpful and provided us with much information on the area and the villagers. He even surprised our sons by giving them the opportunity to get dressed up and have a camel ride (they thought they were only stopping for a photo shoot!).  We also met Abdul the owner of Dar Anika. A lovely man who should be very proud of Samir and all the staff. He has created a place to stay within the Medina which is truly magnificent.  This was our first visit to Marrakesh and it has been such a fantastic experience and one we will remember always. We would love to return sometime in the future and will recommend Dar Anika to anyone wanting to visit Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Andy M wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: Travelling to Morocco for our honeymoon naturally we were in high spirits and expecting a wonderful week together but I must make it clear from the start of this review that Riad Dar Anika not only exceeded our expectations but went out of their way at practically every opportunity to make us feel welcomed special and appreciated. We both agreed that we will NEVER experience better hospitality again in our lives especially at such a reasonable price.    The staff at the Riad are helpful kind and friendly. Nothing is too much trouble and from the moment we arrived they were making helpful suggestions on where to go what to see and what to eat and where to eat it. We asked for a week of genuine Moroccan experiences and every option was made available to us and all taken care of so that we didn't have to worry about making excursion bookings restaurant bookings or finding directions. Some excellent advice was to enjoy getting lost in the souks how much we should be looking to pay for items (they drive a hard bargain in Marrakech!) and where and who we should avoid when out and about. We felt that the staff were approachable on any topic whether it related to our stay in their accommodation or just general advice on our plans for the day. They even prepared sandwiches for us to eat on the plane on the way home (much more tasty and cheaper than anything you can get on Easyjet! :) )    The staff are headed by the polite hard working and friendly Samir. We loved meeting him and enjoyed sharing a joke with him when he had time to chat. He was there to serve us breakfast in the morning and to serve us a drink late in the evening. A real gentleman and a very kind man he really seemed to take pride in his work. The food served at the Riad is plentiful clean and tasty. It was the best food we ate in the whole week and we tried many of the recommended local restaurants by way of comparison. We were truly spoiled!    Many thanks to Riad Dar Anika - you have given us an experience we will remember for the rest of our lives.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Dar anika is home away from home
Review_Text: We stayed for 4 days at Riad Dar Anika and had a wonderful time. We were welcomed with mint tea and moroccan cookies and our rooms were beautifully decorated with flower petals. It was very well located and easy access to the square souks and the new medina. The breakfast at the rooftop was lovely and the kids loved the house tortoise and the pool. The fireplace was nice on cold winter nights. The staff were all very well trained and friendly and recommended us a good place to shop and eat. They also provided us with some packed sandwiches before we left for the airport which was a nice touch. We would definitely come again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Natalie H wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: I have travelled around the world and this is the only hotel I would actively go out of my way to return too. Facilities excellent staff amazing and helpful. No pressurising courteous and very friendly. Food brilliant had the most tasty meal here on our final night which I could only describe as a banquet!    Felt like home away from home.... beautiful tranquil oasis perched on the edge of the medina! Lovely roof terrace very romantic place
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Staff were very friendly and helpful were given pastries and tea on arrival and made to feel very welcome. The location was very good with easy access to Medina and Souks. The rooms were clean and comfortable and an excellent lunch was provided for us ar very short notice this was served on the roof terrace as was breakfast.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Rosslyn H wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: We had a great time here a quiet beautiful place to stay on the edge of the Medina. Staff were helpful home baking great roof terrace lovely and the rooms were tasteful clean and very comfortable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: 5 of us up for adventure in Marrakech couldn't have picked a better place to stay. On the edge off the old city with only a 10 min walk to The Square via the local trade stalls. Hotel staff could not have done more to make us welcome and at home they supplied the same taxi driver every evening to take us safely to restaurants which was reassuring to us. After 3 days of mad shopping eating and drinking we had a very quite flight home a delightful place to go and enjoy.

I have stayed in hotels and guest houses in many parts of the world. I do believe this is the best experience yet! Picked up at the airport smooth transport and the most hospitable welcome I have had in any hotel ever was just the beginning. The staff always present always friendly started off by serving us tea and local cookies and then took us to our rooms which were clean nice and decorated with flower leafs.    Normally I do not like to eat at the hotel I am staying at but we did on the night of our arrival. We took up more then half of the place being a group of 8 people (5 different rooms). We asked for a three course meny with a mix of different dishes. It was fantastic!    If you do not stay at the hotel eat here;-) For a group of 6 to perhaps 16 persons you are in for a treat both for the hotel the dinner the breakfast and the service. Enjoy:-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika offered really everything that we had hoped and searched for when we booked our trip to Marrakech. The Riad has a beautiful and comfortable Morrocan style interior and is ideally located in the Medina. The taxi that had been arranged to pick us up from the airport drops you of in front of the main door of the Riad and it's only 7 minutes walk via one main path/road to the Djemaa el Fna square. So no worries to get lost in the Medina at all.    The staff is super friendly and does really everything possible to make you feel comfortable and all in a very personal way. From the moment we arrived we were spoild with drinks snaks and little attentions in our room the lounge or on the toof terrace and that continued untill the early morning that we left when we were offered a pakced lunch for our journey home.  Having a delicious breakfast with all kinds of home made bread cakes and flesh fruit salade in the early morning sunshine on the roof terrace is a very relaxing start of the day. On the night of my 50th birthday they prepared a special Morrocan diner for us with all the best dishes from the menu. We enjoyed that very much.    A big thanks for the friendly owner perfect management of Samir and his very mindful team! It must be clear by now that we can highly recommend Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic service, wonderfully calm and hospitable
Review_Text: From the second we stepped into the Riad we were treated fantastically well. The little extras were very special the room was very special the breakfast and dinner were beautiful. I would definitely recommend eating dinner at the Riad it was fantastic service was very attentive without being in your face.    Anything you need just ask. We had a body scrub in their Hamman again I would definitely recommend this service left us feeling so relaxed. Go on treat yourself!!!

Review_Date: Yvonne R wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: Even Marrakech is an interesting city to visit...if you have a really really good accomodation - it doesn't matter where you are in the world!    Thank you for all: hospitable owner perfect management and very friendly mindful staff!    Yvonne from Germany
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Wow this Riad really is the most fabulous accomadtion I have ever stayed in and I have stayed in five star hotels all over the world. My husband and I spent our honeymoon here and we were treated like a king and queen for the duration of our stay. We were picked up from the airport four hours before we should have checked in and taken back to the Riad to be welcomed with milk pastries and mint tea. We were then shown to our spotless beautiful room- wonderfully spread petels fresh flowers pastries and a large bottle of water helped us to settle in. We freshened up and we were then given a very detailed explanation of things to do in the area with a map. We had brought a guide from the UK but we really didn't need it! After a wonder around the souks we enjoyed a refreshing dip in the pool. We ate in the Riad the first night I would highly recommend this the food was divine. We asked to eat on the roof terrace you can see many of the famous buildings of Marrakesh from the roof. The wonderful waiters set up our table in minutes. It was perfection and so romantic. The location of Dar Anika is fantastic right in the middle of everything but once you shut the doors it is so peaceful. If I could describe the service I would say it was six star. The owner arranged a trip to the coast for us the night before we went they arranged a cooking class for us and when my husband asked where to buy cigerates the owner insisted on going out and buying them for him with no charge for the cigerates. We were offered fresh juice every day and the owner give us a free bottle of argan oil before we went for a hammam one day. Breakfast was delicious home made and enough to fill you until dinner. On our last day we didn't leave until 5pm we took our bags out at 12pm to check out and were asked what we were doing and that we could have the room until we leave and when we did leave we were given a packed lunch for the journey. We want to go back already we really were made to feel as if we were at home. Thank you to all of the team at Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Les G wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: Riad Dar Anika is an exceptional hotel. Our room was wonderfully comfortable and beautifully furnished. Lots of thought had been given to detail around the hotel which had been decorated and furnished to a very high standard with all areas offering a comfortable relaxing environment. The staff were very welcoming attentive and helpful throughout our stay and the owner took a particular direct interest in his guests and did everything to make our stay enjoyable. The food was delicious and home-made by their in-house staff. The location was great - within the medina and only five minutes walk away from the main square but away from the hustle and bustle of the crowds and it had vehicular access. Having stayed in six good hotels on our trip Dar Anika was the best - the exceptional service making it stand out.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Vickey P wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful visit to Morocco. The Dar Anika was such a fabulous find in Marrakech - the staff was so warm welcoming and they are what made the trip so special for us.  In addition to the wonderful staff we enjoyed breakfast on the roof-top each morning (a wonderful start to each day) and the Riad is in a convenient location - so convenient as you can walk to the square for meals shopping. At the end of your day return to the Riad and leave the hustle of the city at the doorstep and know that you are back in tranquility.  We look forward to returning! The Pettypool's from Arizona
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Dar Anika provided a wonderful and civilised refuge from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Perfectly located at the south end of in the Medina the rooms are comfortable and stylish and the courtyard and terraces are cool quiet and welcoming. The staff can't do enough for you especially Abdul and Samir. You don't need a guidebook or a map just let them advise you. They certainly know all the best places to eat in Marrakech!    We would recommend the Dar Anika to anyone
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: They couldn't have done more for us
Review_Text: I can't imagine a more friendly accommodating and inviting Riad anywhere. The room we were given was beautifully decorated with local furnishings and textiles and provided us with our own little oasis at the end of each busy day. The staff were polite and warm and instantly made us feel very safe and welcomed. They really couldn't do enough for us from the tea and homemade biscuits on arrival to the delicious sandwiches we were given at the end of our stay to take to the airport. Mr Abu is extremely informative and ensured that our taxi drivers knew where we were going and how much we intended to pay - a very useful service to avoid being overcharged.  We can't recommend this Riad highly enough it made our stay in Marrakech all the more memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Do not look further than Dar Anika when booking your accomodation in Marrakech. A group of 4 of us have just returned from a fabulous 3 nights here. The riad is traditional well cared for and in a superb location to discover the delights of Marrakech. From the moment we arrived until leaving I was impressed with the hospitality. We received a lovely welcome had an excellent meal with live music (suggest you have a meal here) very comfortable beds and bathrooms very clean lovely relaxing roof terrace excellent breakfast drinks/food served all day/night transfer to airport we were even provided with a delicious sandwich for the airport! Abu and his staff couldn't do enough. This is a great place and good value for money. Hope to be back soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Fantastic stay perfect location for walking to main square good access to outside attractions by petite taxi and short walk to palaces.  Very peaceful fantastic service. Would recommend to anyone! Staff could not do enough for us from recommending great places to eat to negotiating a taxi for the day. Food was of an excellent standard!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Magnificent an experience never to be forgotten.. Highly Reccamended ..
Review_Text: Mr Abu and the entire staff at dar Anika are the most wonderful people I have stayed with.with the options of any 5 hotels we chose this one. Hidden in the old part of this pink city Marrakech the door opens and I am left completely awestruck .. The welcome drink mint tea dates and milk is served to us while we wait to check in.. Mr Abu upgrades us and a beautiful suite I come across a note wishing me a happy birthday with flowers is left for me to smile about... Had it not been for mr Abu and the entire we would have been clueless in this city .. All tours were organized goods bought for us so we would not get ripped off.. Fantastic massages and romantic roof top .. dinners... It was a home away from home.. I was completely spoilt and loved.. And it's coming from some one me who travels the world and has stayed at most luxury hotels ... When leaving my heart sank..as every one at dar Anika felt like family .. I will definitely go back.. Marrakech I fell in love with u because dar anika made every experience a magical one..

We visited marrakech in june 2012 and we are sorry for not putting up a review until now. It is hard to do full justice to this wonderful place to stay. We had an incredible time. The riad is beautiful and the rooms clean and comfortable but what really put the Dar Anika above anywhere else we have stayed was the amazing friendly and personal service from everyone including the owner and all of the other staff. Whatever we wanted Samir and his team were immediately on hand to help out.  We were a little worried before our trip that staying in such an intimate place to stay might be a bit invasive and that the riad would not provide the creature comforts of a top class hotel. Those fears were completely misplaced. Nothing was too much trouble and we had the most relaxing and stress free first trip to Marrakech. To give just a few examples there was some issue with our apple laptop accessing the free wifi. The owner simply gave us one of his laptops to use as our own for the duration of our trip. One evening we wanted to have dinner on the roof terrace - they set up a table just for us and cooked what we wanted. There was no menu they just asked - tell us what you would like! On an impulse we hired a scooter to get around. The staff parked this for us and then brought it back first thing in the morning without any prior warning. In short they made us feel at home. Infact more than a review this is a huge thank you to the people working there who made us feel really special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: You must stay at this place. It is run by an absolutely lovely team whose main concern is to make sure you're comfortable and have the best stay possible. The rooms are very clean and there is a small sun terrace on the roof where you can eat breakfast or dinner (which was lovely). It's location is excellent and is right by the medina but an oasis of calm. It has a small pool where you can rest your weary feet after a day exploring. The owner sits down with you on arrival and goes through a map of Marrakech with you and gives you hints and tips for restaurants. The best boutique hotel ever. Our flight difnt depart until early evening and they let us hsve the room til 5pm for free and even gave us a lunchbox for the airport! Absolutely no criticism at all!

We stayed here with a group of friends and had the whole Riad for ourselves.    Every room is exquisite and very clean. It can be a bit noisy at times as these are old buildings with no concept of Sound insulation. However the Management has installed creative solutions to make our stay better.    Very friendly and helpful staff and Management.    It is a place from 1001 Arabian Nights. Marvellously and very tastefully decorated interiors and each room has a theme of its own.    Breakfast on the Terrace is a delight and really good.    The indoor thermal swimming pool and Hamam is a treat.    I would recomend anyone and everyone this experience of staying at Dar Anika!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: We will definitely stay there next time
Review_Text: Excellent location very nice and relaxing atmosphere and beautiful rooms. The suite we had in particular was really amazing.  The food was also very good from typical dishes to anything we requested.  Abu the owner his brother Samir and the rest of the team made our stay unforgetable.  Thank you Abu.    the Songel-Clark family
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Beautifull Riad with amazing staff and owner!
Review_Text: Indeed it's 5+!!! First off all it's 5 minutes to El Fna square; then rooms has royal quality with welcome-pack water full-equiped bathroom and so on; service are even too perfect - that I felt as a princeess ;-); and finally the owner (I supposed it was the owner rather then manager) who straighten our problems with booking.com after they canceled our reservation when we arrived one day later. The owner gave us even the promotion price from our reservation we haven't any more and we didn't have to pay normal price of the room which was little to high for us - we are really grateful for taking care of us and all cases - thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Well what can we say?  Undoubtedly a 5/5; a remarkable riad; an oasis of calm in the chaos that is Marrakech. An example of the welcome we received is illustrated by the management accommodating our request to eat dinner in front of the TV so that we could watch the Olympic closing ceremony.  When we thanked the assistant manager she replied simply "This is your home." Rooms pool sun terrace all immaculately clean with staff diligent and dedicated.  There were many charming areas to sit in the riad plus an air conditioned lounge with a guest computer and library books.  Internet access was available throughout the hotel and free.  Our waiter was simply delightful and the food superb.  The cliche that nothing was too much trouble for the staff is absolutely true in the case of the dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Marie N wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: We had an amazing stay at Dar Anika - the staff were simply excellent and the owners felt like friends right from the moment we arrived. The Riad is beautifully decorated with gorgeous scents and sounds and really gives your a true feel for the wonders of Morocco.    The rooms are in immaculate condition and traditionally decorated. The location is fabulous. Our whole trip went seamlessly from the airport pick-up to Mint tea with homemade biscuits we were greeted with on arrival to the (incredible!) meals and taxis we arranged throughout the stay.    I highly recommend this Riad to both new visitors to Marrakech and returning travelers like myself. Simply perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Francis E wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: My sister and I stayed at this incredible riad for three nights. Upon arrival the manager made the mistake of thinking we were a couple so he put us in an upgraded suite with a king bed. I asked for a cot saying that we weren't dating. Instead he gave me another room completely for free for all three nights! It was incredible. We had two amazing suites for the price of ONE regular room.    Samir is the manager and he only continued to amaze throughout our stay. He is genuinely one of the most generous and eager people I have EVER met. Whenever we needed anything or even mentioned something he would go so far above and beyond our expectations. He arranged for us to have a cooking class with the fantastic chefs at the Riad taught us all about the city and was always on hand for for anything and everything. On our last night we decided we wanted to take home some cooking pots. He realized we wouldn't get a good price if we went to find them so he went out HIMSELF to bargain for one. Aside from that he was always opening up a cold beer for me pouring us wine tea and whatever else we could have dreamed of. He was a fantastic guy to talk to. Everyone who works at this Riad is in fact incredibly nice. It was easily the highlight of our entire trip through Morocco. Do yourself a favor and stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Amazing Riad, amazing food! Best place I have ever stayed!
Review_Text: 5*++++ I would highly reccomend this riad this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in!!    We really enjoyed our stay at Dar Anika from the moment we arrived we were made to feel really welcome we were served Mint tea with homemade biscuits milk and dates which were amazing and just what you need after a day of travelling! We were given all the relevant info and lots of useful tips for our stay in Marrakech.    Our room was Upgraded to a suite the room was spotlessly clean and very stylish and comfortable we could not fault it!    The staff are very polite and helpfully and the riad is spotless.    We ordered dinner in the riad on our first night it was amazing and I would definitely reccomend it. Breakfast is also amazing homemade breads jams and cakes / pancakes with freshly squeezed orange juice and eggs we didn't need to eat  For the rest of the day!    I would really reccomend staying here it is so calming after a busy day in Marrakech would return in a flash!!

Just had the most unbelievable stay at Dar Anika. My brother and I were here for three days and were completely stunned by the hospitality and beauty of this riad. The rooms are beautiful comfortable and clean. The pool is small but a perfect way to decompress and cool down after a long day in the hectic streets of Marrakech. The roof terrace offers spectacular views of the city and the breakfasts there are delicious. But the highlight of the Riad is the staff. Samir makes sure that you have everything you could possibly need including drinks toothbrushes directions unbiased recommendations or just general information on Morocco Islam the region etc. The three men helping Samir are wonderful quiet presences that attend to your every need. They are so sweet and are genuinely happy to help you with anything. The cook Hadima is fantastic and I would suggest taking a cooking class with her a great experience especially for one looking to learn about Morocco's special Tagine dish. I have never been to a place that delivers such unobtrusive and wonderful service.    This is a great place to stay is close to the medina and to the main square of Marrakech. Definitely stay here!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Feel at home. These were the first words that we receive by e-mail before arrive at Riad Dar Anika and certainly was what we felt during our stay at this Riad.  A very careful attentive personalized treatment with each guest up to cause some of our wishes come true! :)    The location is excellent close to the big square Jamaa el Fna and other sightseeing such as the Palais Bahia the Jewish quarter and the Royal Palace.  All the accommodations from Dar Anika are exceptional! Excellent decoration and lot of comfort - the Moroccan hospitality is present at all times!    The breakfast is mouth-watering! Natural yogurt fruits fresh breads jellies mint tea..oh the mint tea!!  And as advice if you have the opportunity you should have at least one dinner at Dar Anika. The food is delicious and you will experience a feast of the gods!  One thousand and one flavors and sensations!    I can only thank the entire staff for making the first trip of my mother and her friend to Marrakech unforgettable!    Special thanks to the owners of Riad: Abou Hafsa and Abou Milouk for the hospitality and kindness. Thanks to Mohamed Abdou and Tarik for their kindness and joy that they served us and amused by our adventures in the medina. The magnificent cooker Soulina Halima and her assistant Zibeb special thanks for our Moroccan cooking lesson (learning how to make the pear desert “apple’ sister” and the lamb was an incredible realization) and our amazing dinner! And the last but not the least thanks to Samir for his attention patience to try to understand my mom’s and her friend’s with their badly english and arabic (hehe). A friendly person and responsible for all the pampering and wishes fulfilled!    We just have to thank and highly recommend this Riad.  Chúcran!    Luciana Batista
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My stay at dar anika was perfect the staff were amazing and nothing was too much we were made so welcome and all the staff provided advice on the good attractions and places to eat.    The riad was impeccable and authentic with a modern feel. Stepping into the riad from the chaos of the medina was a surreal experience and I would recommend anyone stay at dar anika for a relaxing stay embedded in the heart of Marrakech.    I wish I could have stayed longer and will definitely be going back!
We really enjoyed our stay here.    Very romantic Riad - Fantastic hospitality - Perfect location for exploring the Medina - Good food.    Couldn't fault it!    I will go back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Leighton C wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: Fantastic stay - the service and friendliness of the staff was some of the best I have ever experienced. The hotel itself is gorgeous and the dinner on the first night was the nicest meal we had in Morocco. Dar Anika is the perfect place to retreat from the madness of the streets and I couldn't recommend this more for anyone that wants an oasis of luxury to make their stay in Marrakech thoroughly relaxing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We chose the Dar Anika for a 5-night stay in Marrakech based largely on its positive reviews on Tripadvisor. Having experienced the wonderful hospitality of Abu and his staff for ourselves we can only agree with other contributors that it is an excellent choice. It was unseasonally hot when we visited - 40+ degrees in mid-May - and it was always a joy to come back to the relative cool and calm of the Riad after the heat and bustle of the souks and tourist sights. We found the location ideal being not only on the edge of the old city a short walk from the main sights but also directly accessible by taxi for arrival/departure and excursions. The Riad itself is as beautiful as it looks in the photos on their website and our room was spacious comfortable and very well equipped. The leisurely breakfasts were first class with a wide choice of fruit yoghurt pastries eggs etc. We also ate dinner in the Riad a couple of times and it was the best quality and best value Moroccan food and wine we experienced. But what really made our stay special was the incredibly friendly and helpful service we received and all the little extra touches which truly made us feel that nothing was too much trouble.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: fred b wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: It struck me as so cliche: a huge dark door with a brass knocker at the entrance to an alley... what on Earth had we got ourselves into? Then stepping through the entrance into a modern version of a palace from the Arabian Nights. An almost unbelievable contrast of beauty serenity and tranquility to the bustling streets outside. There were no disappointments. Abu the proprietor briefed us on what to expect of the city. He arranged a trip to the Atlas Mountains. Hammam and massage were available in house. We had dinner and entertainment in one night which was excellent. His mantra "anything you need just ask" was believable in no small measure due to the friendly attentive staff. In trying to come up with a criticism all I can say is: try Dar Anika for yourself see if you can come up with one and let me know!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Everything we hoped for and more
Review_Text: We have traveled the world but rarely have we stayed in a place that ticks every box. Right from the start we were welcomed by Abu who spent time with us making us feel welcome and being a great travel guide. The Riad was out of this world. Tastefully decorated and traditional but above all it felt so welcoming and homely. All the staff were fantastic especially Samir and Haidar and I'm not sure who cooked the meals but you MUST spend at least 1 night eating at the Riad but make sure it's towards the end of the trip as you will not find any better food service or entertainment. The location is great even though you are in the heart of the action it's so peaceful. Thanks for making our honeymoon so special and the little acts of kindness along the way.  Missing being there already and we only landed a few hours ago  Lindsy & Owen
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amanda C wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Title: If you're looking for an authentic Moroccan experience don't stay anywhere else!
Review_Text: Riad dar anika proved to be the jewel in marrakech's crown. The accommodation was luxurious the staff were friendly and attentive and the food was par excellence! We ate out quite a bit but have to say the food in the riad was far superior. The location of the riad made it a short walk to all the major points of interest. Bring an extra case as the goods on offer in the souk are not to be missed. As regards value for money it was by far the best holiday we have had thank you so much to Haidar Samir and the team for an unforgettable stay.

Review_Date: Shareen S wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: We loved every minute of our five night stay at this quaint clean gorgeous and quiet Riad tucked away in Marrakech’s bustling medina. It is in walking distance to the main souks the main square – Djemaa el Fna and the Bahia Palace. Every dinner we had was excellent - the best tagines we've eaten in Morocco. Each dinner is meticularly prepared on request. The staff were really warm and efficient and the owner Abu and his right hand man Samir went out of their way to make us feel at home and really special. Both spoke English fluently and were very helpful in organizing our entire trip.  They were also very accommodating of the special needs of our 7yr old daughter and her 73 yr old granny. And whenever there was a problem like one of us leaving a bag in the taxi that transported us from the airport Abu was quick to get hold of the taxi and retrieve the bag. When granny had a problem with a ring she bought at the museum shop again Abu went beyond the call of duty and accompanied her to the shop to make sure she either got a refund or another ring. This kind of service is rare in today’s tourism industry and I can honestly say that the Riad Dar Anika has impressed us in every way. What’s more it is reasonably priced.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Just one word''Fabulous'' this riad was something extra special a very special hotel in a special city.  We stayed at the Dome Suite what a room! Decoration was unique the riad staff were just fantastic and the breakfast tasty and fabulous.  Located less than five minutes away from the centre square.  Marrakech is a magical city to visit and this riad made our stay enjoyable relaxing and special.  Bottom line: A grade home in Marrakech  Would be delighted to go back anytime and would be our first choice.  Tip 1: Don't miss out on the inhouse 'Hammam & Massage'  Tip 2: One of the finest cuisine in Marrakech

Review_Date: Mary E H wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: Staying at the Dar Anika Riad was the highlight of our trip to Marrakech. The place was charming very atmospheric and in a good location to walk to the market! The rooms were clean and had nice amenities. We were greeted by a very attentive staff with tea and cookies as we checked in. A very nice start. We asked for the dinner service that was offered and enjoyed a delicious homecooked meal for two on the candle lit rooftop. It was delightful. We found out too late that they would have provided cooking lessons which we would have done had we known. This is a hidden gem.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Birgitte R wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Title: Peaceful stay in the restless medina
Review_Text: A peaceful place right in the middle of the hectic medina. Lovely breakfast served by helpful staff in the sun on the roof top overlooking the city and nearby stork nests. Try a classic private hammam to get clean after a day around the busy souks. And treat yourself with a candlelight dinner made by the riads own chef afterwards. It is all tasty and made from ingredients bought the same day at the local market across the street. When we arrived we were greeted with mint tea dates and morrocain cookies and an inspirational introduction to the city including how to survive traffic handle souk sellers and get the most out of our intended routes and sightseeings. And that simply set the standard for the entire experience. We stayed for a week and loved every day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful Riad in the centre of town
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived (late at night) to a welcome of mint tea and biscuits to when we left 4 days later we were thoroughly spoilt at the the Riad Dar Anika. The hotel is centrally located near all the major sites. The manager and staff are fantastic catering to all our needs. They produced an amazing breakfast on the roof terrace each day as well as a fabulous meal in our own private dining room one evening when we didn't feel like venturing out (at £16 per head for a delicious 3 course meal we thought this was really good value).  The rooms are comfortable and well equipped with modern bathrooms (including a lovely bath).  The Riad has only 10 rooms so we hardly saw other guests and seemed to have the beautiful roof terrace to ourselves whenever we went up there for tea or to relax after a day out.
