A private guided tour and a restaurant booking were organised for us by the manager.  All in all I would highly recommend this Riad to anyone looking for a base to explore the old city of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Comfortable luxury room tasty food beautiful architecture service second to none and in the middle of it all. The best weekend I have ever had.  Thanks to Samir who looked after us like we were the sultans. Will back for x-mas.

Review_Title: Amazing hospitality, serene atmosphere and great location
Review_Text: I stayed at the Ryad for 4 days and as a first time visitor to Marrakech I was anxious about finding the right accommodation at a reasonable price. The right accommodation to me meant great facilities excellent customer service good food good location (distance for all Marrakech has to offer) and nice cozy reasonably sized rooms. I read people's reviews on this Ryad and then called them directly to get a sense of what they were really like and it was the best decision i made because they sounded like they would tip all my boxes but i was still sceptical because sometimes what you expect isn't what you get when you actually get there. Upon arrival they welcomed me with mint tea and biscuits Abu the owner opened a map and told me what was what in Marrakech and generally guided me through what to do whilst I was there. He then took me on a tour of the Ryad from the hammam room by the courtyard to the roof top terrace where i could have breakfast. Samir the manager ensured I was well looked after on my trip made sure I didn't lack for anything went above and beyond the call of duty to make me extremely comfortable and told me what to look out for when I was out and about (he behaved like a caring big brother). The rest of the staff generally did everything to please me and make me forget I was in a hotel. Honestly I felt like I was at home even down to the TV and fire place in the living room area (and the blankets dotted around which I could wrap around myself if I felt a little chilly). Imagine being in your own home and not having to be in your bedroom to watch TV but either swimming in the pool in the courtyard or hanging out with friends in the very cozy well equipped living room? Imagine paradise in the midst of the beautifully exhilarating chaos of the old Medina in Marrakech Morocco. That's Riad Dar Anika for you. It allows you to step in and out into 2 different worlds. "The best of both worlds" this to me is what defines an amazing holiday. I got to see most of what Marrakech had to offer but still come back to the tranquility of an amazingly serene hotel. If you're planning a trip to Marrakech staying at Ryad Dar Anika is probably the best decision you'll make once you've booked your ticket because trust me Abu Samir and the rest of their team certainly know what to do and how to make you feel like a part of their family was coming home to visit. It's not really about hospitality it's about understanding what it really means to make a member of your family feel loved and welcome. Thank you Ryad Dar Anika for giving me one of the most memorable holiday experiences to date. I've fallen in-love with you guys and I can't wait for everyone else to fall in love with you too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: "Paradise and one of the must do things before you die"
Review_Text: On arrival to Marrakech we were met by our 'as promised' luxury transfer to the Riad in a lovely Mercedes. A short journey we were in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the old town surrounded by a 20 kilometre wall. I must admit that at first when the driver stopped I did start to wonder if we had come to the right place and that if we had made the right decision after all we had come away to get a peaceful break to recharge the batteries!. However after entering the Riad through the large wooden doors it was like walking into a different world altogether. This place is so peaceful and tranquil. We were led to our suite no2 which has a beautiful ornate ceiling dome and its own fireplace with plenty of room for ourselves and our young child to sleep. Power showers hot water not an issue!. Breakfast includes pancakes fresh breads sweet youghart Fresh fruits plenty of hot coffee and tea or you can go for the traditional mint tea. Breakfast served when you decide so if you decide to have a lie in there's no problem with missing breakfast like in most hotels.    There is no time zone difference from the UK and a short plane journey so an excellent place to spend a long weekend. Weather was great around 22c-23c in the day but does drop off to around 15c in the evening so take a coat with you if your planning to stay out all day.    The owner and his staff treated us more like family than guests. Everything was catered for. My son wanted to do an activity so they organised quad biking and the transport there and back. When it came to dinner the owner took us to the market which was literally over the road where we selected Monkfish tails chicken an array of fresh vegetables which were later cooked for us and the fish and chicken were presented in a tageine and cooked with 27 different spices fresh and delicious. The Riad is situated only a couple of minutes walk from the world famous Jemaa El Fna square which is really buzzing and all of the alleyways are crammed full of spice shops and other handmade items. A word of advice please haggle as the locals expect it and you will get some great deals!. Abu the owner of the Riad gave us a mobile phone with the Riads number pre-programmed he also gave us a map and marked out some of the must see places to visit. Again the level of service was second to none. As I mentioned earlier we came out to get some rest and recuperation so on the second day we had a Hammam similar to a Turkish bath and is located within the Riad. Straight after the refreshing and cleansing Hammam we were taken to our suite by some lovely ladies for an amazing and relaxing hour long massage. After this we needed a short sleep (so good was the experience).  There are two parts to Marrakech the old city and the new city. We travelled to the new city that evening again transport was organised for us (and very reasonably priced) there and back. There is a shopping plaza with all the shops you would expect in any vibrant city and surrounded by a beautiful waterfall. We ate at the Cafe de la post which has a french inspired menu and although a little pricey it was an amazing experience and well worth it. This break was fantastic and only made better by the excellent service and generousity of everyone at the Riad Dar Anika. On our departure they even made a packed lunch for us! words cannot express the gratitude and respect we hold for these people. We will (god willing) be back as there is much left to explore like the snow capped Atlas mountains which is your back drop whilst eating breakfast on the massive terrace in the morning!!. There are to many superlatives to describe this Riad and Marrakech. You must see for yourself!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I arrived in Marrakech on 2nd Feb with my expectant Daughter-in-law both of us in great need of rest tender loving care and a break from home. After a 15 mins bus ride from the airport we reached Jemaa El Fna and asked for directions to the Riad. I wish now that we had contacted the Riad beforehand as they would have sent a taxi to meet us at the airport. Hindsight is truly a wonderful thing! Once in front of the beautiful dark doors we knocked and were amazed at the treasure we had found. Firstly the staff greeted us with a smile and asked to take our cases and led us straight to the lounge and within minutes there was a tray with Morrocan tea and pastries. I was worried that we had arrived a couple of hours before the check-in time. But this was not even mentioned. The owner came and introduced himself and offered us a mobile phone which we could use throughout our stay either to contact the Riad if we hit any problems whilst we were out or to contact our family back home. (we added credits as and when we needed to)  The twin room (No4) was spacious with a double wardrobe a fridge safe a hairdryer and heater (as the evenings were quite cold at this time of the year). The bathroom was clean and included bathrobes which were a blessing. We loved relaxing in them during the early evenings that we stayed in and when had late starts to our day. We even lounged on the roof terrace in them! I loved it.  Each day we were offered help in deciding on where to explore next on the local customs how to haggle the best method of transport etc. Basically they was not anything that they couldn't provide. On day 3 we realised that we had forgotten our iphone charger. The owner provided us with one as well as an ipod docking station that we could use in our room in the lounge or on the roof terrace! From the terrace you can see the magnificent Atlas mountains. We took the opportunity of mid-morning naps on the roof loungers. Great way to soak in the sunshine!  The staff were so respectful and caring. They were so keen to ensure that we enjoyed our stay. It was their warmth and genuine interest in us as guests that would make me visit again.  It was worth dining in for lunch or dinner as the meals were excellent and very generous portions. The owner has done a marvelous job in combining luxury with comfort and great hospitality. We have returned home well rested nourished and recharged.  I would recommend Dar Anika to anyone single couples and families. It has been a haven for us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Caroline B wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Title: An Experience I will remember for ever!!
Review_Text: I have never stayed anywhere quite like Riad Dar Anika. To be fair I didn't even know what a Riad was! The welcome we received was warm and sincere. The hussle and bussle of the Medina outside was exciting and a bit crazy then once behind the huge beautiful doors of Riad Dar Anika was tranquility calm and smells that were a feast for the sences. Our room was large and beautifully done traditional yet contemporary comforatable and So peaceful. We relaxed on the roof terrace on comfy sun loungers. In the evenings we chilled by the log fire and we ate the most amazing food! Lamb Tagine washed down was lashings of fantastic Moroccian wine which was suprisingly very nice indead. We explored Marrakech the YSL gardens and the markets. The highlight was the Riad. I went with my cousin who had made all the arrangements. We have both travelled fairly extensively but have NEVER known hospitality like that of Riad Dar Anika. The staff could not do enough for us to make us comfortable and welcome talk about go the extra mile!!! I can't wait to go back and wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else! As for value for money its fantastic value. I can't wait to recommend to family and friends they will love it. I can't think of a single negative. A fancy hotel is a fancy hotel. You could be anywhere in the world they are all much of a muchness. A Riad has a completely differant ambiance. Its So relaxed friendly and the sense of calm is to be relished and soaked up. The manager and his team of wonderful staff have something special going on at their beautiful Riad Dar Anika. It was magical and guess what......... I Highly recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: fiona w wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Title: Wall to wall luxury, exceptional accommodation, food and service
Review_Text: This boutique hotel is simply superb! I have visited a number of 5* hotels over the years but none top this one as hospitality is second to none and the service is out of this world. After learning that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary we got upgraded to a suite and a large bouquet of roses was delivered to us!  The room was very clean well appointed with everything you would need. It was also recently refurbished with great attention to detail. Everything was hand crafted locally apart from the laptop with the free internet access.    The food was fantastic. We expected to pay much more than we did for food and beverage but were pleasantly surprised by how reasonably priced everything was.    The two hour massage hammam and scrub is a truly soothing experience. Well worth it.    We have told all our friends and family about Dar Anika and thinking of coming back and booking the entire Riad for all of us to enjoy!    See you soon Dar Anika!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Diana W wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: My adult daughter and I spent a lovely week here and loved it. The superb breakfasts on the roof and one night we enjoyed a delicious evening meal in the Berber tent on the roof; all very luxurious. Our room normally a double was easily split into two singles and we had a very comfortable stay always given the lovely mint tea stuffed with mint leaves in a glass whenever we wanted it. It is a great place to relax in the heat of the day and so near all the places of interest you would want to visit including a great restaurant called Tagine.    Samir arranged for us a driver to take us to the coast for the day and a guide to the souks for another half day. When we travelled to the Atlas mountains for a day he even checked up part way through the day with our driver to ensure we were OK and enjoying it! Couldn't have asked for more. Highly recommend staying in this lovely small riad whilst in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Hjalmar O wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: My wife and I spent a weekend at the Dar Anika regarding a birthday arranged by the travel agency " Travel and Learn". The hotel the manger the staff and the food was top of the range. You could fell a precence of warm hospitality all the time. Some hotels can feel like a well designed concept. Riad Dar Anika was all genuine and as a guest we felt like a part of warm famlily.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Great place to stay. Very cosy and comfortable with interesting Moroccan decor .. Stylish rooms. We had a big bathroom as well. Breakfast was great- loved the Moroccan bread with fresh orange juice! Owner and the pple who run the place are very nice and genuine always helpful. Very close to the medina- a 5-7 minute walk away. Will definitely stay there again if I ever go back to morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Would give it Six stars if I could!
Review_Text: My wife (who is 6 months pregnant) and I stayed at Riad Dar Anika for 4 nights. Our stay was excellent and the owner Samir and his brother own a top notch operation.    The Riad is superbly located--only a few minutes walk to Jemma El Fna and just a few minutes the other direction to many of the sights (Bahia palace Saadian tombs Dar Si Said). So it was nice to see one thing come back to the riad to rest and then head out again.    The Riad itself is beautifully done--very elegant and holding true to the definition of a Riad--it has water (a plunge pool) greenery and an open roof which lets in lots of sun. Even though the riad is right in the heart of the medina it is very quiet and once entering in through the door it is tranquil and relaxing. My wife and I slept very well and we're pretty light sleepers.    The room is tastefully decorated and beds were comfortable. The common areas (lounge sitting room terrace) are nicely done as well and allows one to relax but not feel confined to being in your room.    Wifi worked well and was nice to be able to stay connected. No TV was a good idea as it kept noise level down.    The thing that impressed us the most was the staff. They were all extremely polite and attentive always asking if we needed anything. The staff all spoke English very well and communication (for non Arabic speakers) was easy.    My wife was ill with a stomach bug (which ironically she contracted in Spain before we even arrived in Morocco) the first day. Samir and his assistants made sure she was taken care of and provided some nice soup that she was able to eat when she was too fatigued to go out to get something to eat. It was a really nice touch and genuine not something they did expecting to get money or tips.    Overall I couldn't find any faults with Riad Dar Anika. I've travelled to nearly 70 countries and stayed in all types of lodgings from 5* hotels to pensions and hostels. This place is well worth the price you pay and I highly recommend it.    By the way I don't typically write reviews on places unless I had a bad experience but in this case I felt it was worth my time to share my experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely Riad. Would 100% recommend to anyone!
Review_Text: I stayed at this Riad with my wife in December 2011 and was very impressed at all levels. The room was lovely the communal areas very well done with a lovely log fire to warm the evening. The food was great not too expensive and most impressive of all was the staff. Very helpful indeed. The location is ideal for the Medina and local shops. I will definitely visit again.    Matthew Tingle.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sherina H wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Title: Top choice - a home from home :)
Review_Text: Having just returned from Marrakech and this Riad I completely agree with all previous positive comments. The manager Samir and full time host Abdul made us feel at home straight away. They ensured we knew were to go daily and at night for dinner making reservations and inquiries at the slightest mention. The owner too was extremely welcoming and although we saw the 4/5 * hotels we would usually have chosen we were all so glad we did not! No hotel could make you feel as comfortable safe or get the personal touch as we did at the Riad. Dar Anika is well hidden so you slip behind the bustling market stalls into this chic sanctuary and it's so quiet !!! Although we opened the stained glass windows to let in the Marrakech sounds - delightful!  The staff even changed all our money back before we left and gave us special soaps and the tastiest sandwiches for the trip home.  You'd do yourself a big favor to choose Dar Anika if planning a trip to Morocco.  Beautiful people beautiful place very happy holiday .....enjoy !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Elizabeth B wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: As soon as we stepped out of our taxi outside Dar Anika just a few steps away from Jemma El-Fenna we were greeted by the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. Leaving the lively sounds of the outside world behind us and entering the Riad we knew we had made the perfect choice! It was as if we stepped into another tranquil mystical world that left us in awe of what was yet to come.    The place is beyond charming with a warm and inviting setting. Open courtyard with a very inviting heated pool surrounded by burning flames all around it. Whilst on the opposite side  we were welcomed into a cozy room with an open fire where we were welcomed with soothing morrocan tea and delicious pastries whilst gentle music was floating in the background.    Moments later we were shown to our very spacious room which was decorated in the same tastful manner as the rest of the Riad. Warm colours inviting bed great bathroom with colourful mosaic sofa for the both of us to snuggle opposite the open fireplace....Honestly the room didn't lack a thing! We were reluctant to leave but the sights sounds and smells of Jemaa el-Fenna were calling out for us....    Before we set out into the labyrinth of alleyways which would lead us to the main square the staff were helful and gave us a thorough step by step guide on where to go or not to go what to watch out for and some excellent places to go eat;since picking a place to eat on your first visit could be rather daunting.    I don't think anything could have prepared us for what was to come.... Strolling along you want to take everything in from the snake charmers to the colourful food stalls the spices and the rugs the silver and the gold. The atmosphere is festive and it seems it always has that uplifting air carrying you along with it....    A couple of hours later we emergerd exhilarated and triumphant making our way back to the Riad. Before going back up to the room we went up take a look at the roof top terrace where we decided to kick back and have a drink before having our massage in Dar Anikas hamam which was divine.    The massage was exactly what we needed after our visit to the souks and before retiring into our room before embarking on our next adventure the following day....    The next few days brought with it the same promises as the first day. I really can't seem to fault Marrakesh nor the exotically serene Dar Anika. Perfection at its best is just one of the simplest ways to describe our stay and experience. Cannot wait to return!    Liz-London
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ribal A wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed at Dar Anika for four days and had the best time. The staff were amazing you can be served a meal anywhere in the riad and at any time at great value. The breakfast was included and up on the top terrace was a great start to the day with the birds singing all around you. the riad is perfectly situated - we only had a four minute walk to the souk/Jama el fena square. The hotel also organised for a guide to show us some of the historic points in the area worthwhile as he had such a wealth of knowledge which really added to the experience.  If you want a relaxing (sooo relaxing) break in beautiful surroundings with friendly staff (including one of the best hammam and massage I've ever had) then try Dar Anika. We couldn't recommend it enough. Definitely we are going back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: jolanta j wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: We have to agree with other reviewers that this hotel was one of the best parts of our trip to Morocco. The location couldn't have been better- it was a short walk to the Fena main square Bahia Palace and the Badi Palace. The staff was extremely helpful providing us with maps and directions. We were treated to an upgraded room and tea dates and milk upon arrival. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wishing a luxury stay in Marrakech and would certainly stay here if we ever return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a wonderful time and loved dar anika! i have already recommended it to few people !  it was also great to meet samir assistant manager ; the staff were absolutly amazing .it was like being in our own private hotel!!  icould have done without the wake up call and lack of water ;but hey it all added to the experience !!!!!!!!!!!!  thank you all very very very much!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had the privilege of taking two rooms for three nights on a family vacation. The entire staff particularly Abderrazak bent over backwards to be sure our every desire was met. Incredibly gracious and helpful. The perfect hosts.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Beautiful riad, great location, wonderful staff who couldn't do more to help
Review_Text: Just back from a long weekend in 'Mad Marrakech' where we stayed at the Riad Dar Anika. We had no idea what to expect but were thrilled from the moment we walked in off the bustling noisy streets into the oasis of cool calm loveliness that is Dar Anika. Location is brilliant - a 5 minute walk and you're at the main square. Lovely rooms a plunge pool (absolutely essential with temperatures of 42 degrees) and great advice from Samir about where to go and what to do with only a short space of time happily making reservations for us at some of the most gorgeous restaurants. At no extra cost a member of staff even escorted me to the local market so I could buy some fish to feed to Molly (the cat that appears frequently on the roof - I think she's a permenant feature) - they must have thought I was absolutely bonkers but didn't say a word (and the man at the market was so lovely that he gave me the fish for free)! Definitely recommend this Riad - and don't forget the treats for Molly!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joss O wrote a review Aug 2011
Review_Text: Looked at a number of options for a quick first-time business trip.  I was met at the airport had every facility I needed including PC connection good food did the bizz and back to the airport.  Just wished I could've stayed longer!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Great location, beautiful Riad and helpful staff in the heart of Marrakesh
Review_Text: the hotel has the perfect location near the heart of town. the roof terrace is perfect for dining and the staff are most helpful - highly recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad, great location and fantastic staff
Review_Text: My sister and I spent 4 nights at the Dar Anika in Jan 2011.    The Riad is situated on a small road leading directly to the Djemaa el-Fna (a 10 minute stroll). Despite its very central location the Riad is very tranquil.    The Riad is beautifully decorated and has some gorgeous pieces of Moroccan furniture. Beds are comfortable and the whole place is immaculate.    During our stay the friendly staff Majdouline and Samir recommended some great places for us to visit including Theatro (club) Palais Jad Mahal (restaurant with entertainment) and Comptoir (restaurant with great bar). They also arranged guided tours of the local area and an excursion to the Atlas Mountains which I would recommend although if you plan on doing the trek to the waterfalls good walking boots and a head for heights are essential.    On our first night we had a wonderful dinner in the lounge in front of an open fire which was delicious. We had our breakfasts on the roof terrace which consisted of fresh breads/preserves yoghurt fruit salad fresh cakes/pancakes (differed each day) and fresh OJ / tea/coffee which really set us up for the day. There is no set time for breakfast - you can go whenever you like which was a lovely touch.    I would recommend the Riad and cant wait to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: This is what hospitality is all about!
Review_Text: We stayed stayed here a couple of days after my wife met Majoline (one of the owners) at a yoga class.  Dar Anika is a beautiful riad situated a few hundred metres from Jemaa el Fna. Near the hotel are some great international restaurants a market (lamps) and an ATM.  We felt right at home here. They were very helpful by letting us use their phone to book an excursion and some other things. We could have breakfast at a time that suited us. And we left we even received a free taxi drive back to the airport!  Our room was spacious beautifully decorated modern with a lot of local influences.  Thanks again for your hospitality!  We plan to return in April and we will definitely contact you again.

Review_Title: Friends and good team at Anika
Review_Text: We liked to take holidays to Morocco some times two times a year but this time we have find special discount for flying from our home in Barcelona. We look internet for good deal and find luxury-riads.com and they pick up from Marrakech airport and let stay for four night for pay 3. Altogether this hotel I think is one of best in area all facility and near tourism but very peace. My wife take photo to show friend I think sure we will come again and i think use same booking company they morocco i think so they know best place to stay. Manager and staff also very helpful and polite we not need to ask for anything everything very good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After a bumpy start due to our travel agent (STA) we were delighted to arrive at Riad Dar Anika! The grand traditional wooden doors hide a beautiful sanctuary from the hectic city. My wife and I were well looked after by the friendly staff (in particular Samir and Abdu). Abdu served us our roof terrace breakfast and greeted us when we came home from exploring each day with a familiar smile and joke. While the room we were initially provided was lovely we were delighted when Samir upgraded us to a larger room. The rooms and Riad are all beautifully decorated (like a scene from Arabian Nights) and we were made to feel 'well at home' whether in the glass fronted sitting room or cosy roof top tent. The Riad is only a few minutes from the main square and there are 2 fantastic restaurants (Tanjia & Dar Essalam) nearby. We also frequented a nearby bar (Kosybar) where you can watch the storks (!) and enjoy reasonably priced wine (starting at £15 per bottle). We recommend arranging dinner in the Riad as part of your stay. Our Wedding Anniversary was made truly memorable by the intimate surroundings beautifully decorated table (thank you Abdu!) and delicious locally sourced food. Can't wait to come back! Steve & Katie
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: we really enjoyed our stay in marrakech and dar anika proved to be a fantastic choice service(abdou).....staff(halima and atika....).manager.(samir wonderfull level of hospitality).........make this riad wonderfull .......  so many thank all the staff ;they were very courteous and attentive
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent Riad in good location to explore Marrakech
Review_Text: Clean comfortable and very attractive Riad with a roof terrace to relax after a hard day's walking around the Medina and souks. The service was faultless. The staff were all very friendly and you are welcomed on arrival with mint tea and pastries. Recomendations for restaurants were good along with helpful tips for sightseeing. Would return without hesitation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: On our arrival we were greeted with mint tea and pastries and even though it was only 9 am we were able to go straight to our rooms. The riad itself is lovely but it’s the staff that make this place so special. Nothing was too much trouble and everything was done with a smile. On my boyfriend's birthday the manager even ordered a cake as a surpise without asking and arranged for it to be brought out with candles. I can't recommend Dar Anika highly enough - I have very seldom stayed in places with as much warmth hospitality and attention to detail.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A LITTLE GEM......LIKE AN INDIANA JONES MOVIE
Review_Text: Just returned form 3 nights.....what a fantastic experience.....The Riad is less than 10 minutes transfer from the airport and your met by a driver in a clean air conditioned mercedes and located right in the centre of things...on arrival we were greeted by Samir the manager with piping hot mint tea and local pastries. He can organise anything you need....we had a private guide for 4 hours called Cam who was brilliant and showed us around (£35)  a hammam scrub (£10) massage (£35) a day at Nikki Beach club(arranged free entry which is normally £25 each for a sunbed but be aware food and drinks there are expensive and there are alternative places to go and spend a day by a pool). The rooms were spotless the plunge pool and roof terrace relaxing and the breakfast included in the price was fresh...continental style...can recommend dinner at Dar Essalam 5 minute walk typical Morrocan food with music and belly dancing. Would also recomend taking a tour on a horse and carriage in the Medina for about 1 1/2 hours(£25....you haggle with the guy). Leather goods and costume jewellery are the best buys.......Have fun!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I would like to add my positive review to the ones already on the site. I stayed 3 nights at the Dar Anika and the experience could not have been better. The service was great the rooftop terrace was a wonderful place to have breakfast in the morning and drinks in the evening and the staff were all friendly and helpful. As a solo traveller I appreciated the warm welcome and friendly service. Sallah Samir and Rashid in particular went out of their way to make sure I had everything I needed. I will stay there again the next time I am fortunate enough to be in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: we stayed in Dar Anika for 5 nights and had a top class personalised experience from the moment we arrived. There were beautiful personal touches from the letter in our room welcoming us to being given an option each morning of where and when to have our breakfast. Each time we arrived back at Dar Anika it was like coming home. the location is wonderful for reaching all the main attractions of the medina on foot so when the pace became too fast (it was out first time in morrocco) it was easy to come back to a warm welcome and a cup of mint tea that was brought at any time of day (or night!). The breakfasts were delicious and the freshly baked goods each morning a real treat. The staff especially Salah and Samir are keen to assist whilst also leaving breathing space to use the roof garden and terrace as you would your own home and for them nothing is too much trouble. We had a wonderful stay in a beautiful room and met lovely people.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An a peaceful haven in fantastic, frantic Marakkesh
Review_Text: This riad delivered everything it promised and more. The rooms were beautifully presented being clean and comfortable and each one different (I think we saw them all).    As our daughter announced she would be home from university and able to join us we asked for an extra bed in our suite although security was such that she could have had her own room.    I had a huge itinerary of things we were going to do we did some the Atlas mountain trip arranged by the hotel the tour of the souk again arranged by the hotel lots of wandering around but the riad was just so nice we didn't want to leave it. Also we could have massages plus other treatments in the riad.    The teenager lay on a range of different sunbeds on the roof for approximately 4 days for as long as the sun shone. When we were out for the day she was served lunch seated at a table covered with a linen table cloth and laid with crystal and china and protected by a huge parasol. Just like a Disney princess.    The breakfast the staff the decor it's all been said before but it was faultless....... We particularly enjoyed the Thai food prepared to our order Moroccan food is good but the lovely Philipino cook prepared some great veggie dishes. The hotel recommended some excellent local restaurants so we did try out the local food too!    We loved the cinema room and the fact there was no TV in the bedroom. The pool was freezing but if you ask them the staff will heat it for the time you plan to use it.    Downside is Marrakesh airport but I guess the riad can't do anything about that but it was fantastic to be met and to have a meal (Thai) waiting when we arrived.    We are definitley coming back maybe in term time though much cheaper without children.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Remo A wrote a review Apr 2010
Review_Text: This Riad is very clean very stylish good located has great rooms and beds. But what is even better is the service. I have never ever anywhere found a place with such nice helpful qualified service. With service I not only mean the day and night managers and staff but also the owners. Thanks again for making this stay an unforgettable one!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Not a good hotel on rainy days
Review_Text: Marrakesh is supposed to be hot and dry all year long (that's what we thought in the first place) but unfortunately during our 3 day stay in Feb. it rained almost everyday (and from what we were told it had been raining for days before our arrival...). As the hotel is small and all built around an open air central courtyard the rain was flooding everywhere in the house most of the walls were damp - even in our room and en-suite bathroom - sewer smells were rising up from the drains.. Very far from the little oasis we had in mind !  I have no doubt this little place might be nice on summer time – the owners and staff are genuinely friendly – but better check the weather forecasts before you go..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I have stayed in many hotels motels riads inns outs dives and bungalows across the world. This was the best.    Never I have encountered such personalized service as I received from Samir the manager of the establishment and his colleague Yousef. Samir's unrelenting attention to detail is spectacular and his suggestions made for a great visit to Marrakech.    The riad itself is also spectacular. It is a relatively new construction and as a result has up to date heating and hot water (items I have been told can be rarities in other riads). The refined courtyard of the riad is wonderful for afternoon tea or a late night drink and really remains one of the enduring and fondest images of my trip to Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: A fantastic place to stay amid the frantic streets of Marrakech
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at Dar Anika for a long weekend having selected it from the many positive entries on TA - to sum up our own experience is easy ... all of the existing comments are 100% correct!  From the minute we arrived until we had to leave Diane Nigel and all the staff were excellent nothing was too much trouble or effort to make sure we had an enjoyable weekend.    A couple of tips for you other TA's who will hopefully go and enjoy Dar Anika ...  1. Nigel’s restaurant recommendations are great - give them a try  2. Do have a personal guide and Mohamed is first class - his insight and friendly approach  really gave us the Marrakech experience  3. Diane & Nigel are also involved with a new venture at KSAR ANIKA - we were pleased  to be shown around have lunch and a massage ... its truly fantastic!    Our thanks to everyone at Dar Anika who made our weekend just what it should be ... great!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Dar Anika is a calm tranquil escape from the husstle and busstle of the outside world. My sister and I stayed there from 26th December to the 2nd of January and were very pleased with the hospitality of the local Manager Norradine who looked after us during our stay. All the staff were pleasant and its as pretty as a picture. If I had one complaint it was that our room although decorated well had no windows and was very darkly decorated like most of Morrocco and after 7 nights this was over welming to say the least with no natural light or air. However Riads can be like this due to the heavy walls that incase the properties from the outside world. Marrakech itself is an eye opener and has to be experienced for oneself. From the eclectic and exotice hustle and bustle of the main square and the soukes to the great food and things to see its worth a visit.

Review_Title: Perfect location to see the medina and souks
Review_Text: I spent 3 nights at Dar Anika in Marrakech and I could not have had a more comfortable stay. The rooms were very clean and well presented and the staff were attentive and helpful. Breakfasts were generous and delicious and served on the roof terrace - a peaceful haven to get away from the rush of the street below.    I highly recommend this hotel and Diane Nigel and their staff were fantastic.    If you want somewhere in comfortable walking distance of the medina and souks with a really traditional feel and a very friendly and welcoming atmosphere - Dar Anika is it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Serenity in a Sea of Souks!
Review_Text: My wife and I spent a few days in Dar Anika in October. It was the first time I had been to Marrakesh - it will not be the last. From the moment we stepped inside Dar Anika to the moment we left there was nothing but helpful advice great service and of course a fantastic ambience! Dianne Nigel and Nourredine could not have been friendlier! I especially would recommend the cooking lesson with Habiba - select your menu go to the local market with Habiba and Nigel buy your food - then go and watch/help Habiba at work. later on have it served to you on the rooftop terrace - fantastic! Our room was nice - with a little private 'garden area' off it. As soon as you stepped inside the hustle and bustle of the souks streets and vendors fell away. perfectly placed - only about 5-10 minutes to the main square accessed though a lovely little street. Found a great local spice market - where I bought loads of spices for very little! all in all a superb place to stay - and a very nice email from Dianne and Nigel to check we had arrived home safely - a nice touch!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The very best place to stay to explore the Medina
Review_Text: This little gem sits on a street not far from the Medina and its many attractions.the Riad is beautifully appointed with sumptious luxury. The food was the best we ate during our stay. The breakfasts on the roof were like eating in an oasis whlist Marrakech bustled and haggled all around. Excellent so far but the most enjoyable experience was the friendly and helpful team led by Diane and Nigel who were not just hosts but more like "old friends" welcoming us into their beautiful home.We cannot recomend this Riad too much. Go there and enjoy the experience its worth is more than these few words.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An Oasis In A Sea Of Frenzied Vendors
Review_Text: I cannot express how lovely Dar Anika is the usual expressions would be a waste Ladies travelling I could not fault the establishment Di & Nigel fantastic hosts who even put up with a group of Aussie ladies who where a bit jadded by the time we reached Marrakesh and just made us feel so welcome. A big surprise rooms large clean and everything worked and no funny noises from the electric applicances( I got familiar with the buzzing of light switches on the trip aircons that didnt work etc) The staff excellant could not fault them pleasant and could understand. Meals fabulous too much for 'this little black duck'. The privacy that alone time we all need on a trip especially the VEG DAY where all you want to do is have a swim curl up in the tent on the roof and read. Lovely place. Dont be scared 'Have a Go'

Spent one week on a desert trip with my 14-year old daughter. Started out and finished in Dar Anika and was very glad every time we came "home" to this peaceful and beautifully decorated place. The pool and the lounge offered an opportunity for rest and some quiet reading after shopping and sight-seeing. An absolute relief after some other hotel-experiences of mediocre quality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: If you are going to Marrakech don't stay any where else!!
Review_Text: Service with a smile and sinerity. Nothing was a trouble actually management and staff went out of there way to ensure our stay was relaxing and enjoyable.  Our room was fantastic. Clean comfortable beautifully decorated. The swiming pool was truly refreshing after a day of exploring the maze of laneways near by. The Raid was close to lots of resturants and mrakets within a safe walk.  It didnt take long to feel like home!

Review_Title: A lovely place to stay with fantastic service from people there to make your trip perfect
Review_Text: Some friends and I are are just back from having a fantastic break at Dar Anika and we can't recommend it enough. The riad is a lovely oasis of calm and beauty just off the bustling streets. All the staff at the hotel did everything they could to make our trip fantastic from recommending great local restaurants to organising a trip to the atlas mountains and you got the feeling that there was no problem that they wouldnt help you solve if you asked. It wasn't intrusive though - just there to help if you wanted it.. I have never had such great service anywhere in a hotel.    Our room was lovely the hammam/massage were great experiences and not to be forgotton and the copious supply of mint team and indoor pool all came together to add up to a great break.    I can't recommend it enough - worth every penny!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: As mother and 17 year old daughter travelling to Marrakech alone for the first time we were a little nervous but all our fears were allayed at the Riad Dar Anika.    The Riad is excellently run by a lovely English couple who clearly know how to make guests feel safe comfortable and at home. The rooms were spotlessly clean and comfortable. Inside the riad it is very quiet. None of the noise from outside was audible except for the regular calls to prayer which are amplified throughout the city. The air conditioning is also extremely quiet. The information pack helpfully provided a map and list of monetary exchange values The freshest bread and fruit were delicious for breakfast. Breakfast was served throughout the morning so we were under no pressure to get up earlier than we wanted to. Every single member of staff was polite helpful and friendly. The Riad is beautifully decorated in a Moroccan style which we would have liked to bring home. It is a five minute walk down one straight road to the Jmaa el Fna square and also very close to the Badii and Bahia Palaces. There are good restaurants and two ATMs very close by.    There is a very pleasant sun terrace and small enclosed swimming pool. Sunbathing and swimming were therefore clearly an option but the pool is small and the Riad is so close to the activity and life of Marrakech that we were not tempted to do so.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The location of the Dar Anika are superb because you are in the midst of it all. Diane and all her staff members are very friendly and very helpful. The food superb and the setting is sooooo Morrocan it made us feel fab.  Thanks to all of you  Laurie and Ineke Keyser  Winchester  UK
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I heared a lot about the magic of Marrakech and i truly beleive it now the whole expeirence was fantastic and place we stayed in was remarkable the people were nice and the place was clean thanks to our freinds who recommended the place for us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Serindipity! We will remember trip this with great fondness forever.
Review_Text: We are so glad we took this side trip from Paris in order to meet Di and Nigel whom we had inadvertently connected with through an incorrect e-mail address! We spent an excellent 3 days here. Diane and Nigel and the staff did everything to make our stay enjoyable. The Riad was spotless very well laid out food was very good close to everything.    We had no idea of what to expect in Morocco but found Marrakech a delight. A trip y car into the Atlas Mountains was arranged our visit to a private Berber home (and the attached shop!) very pleasant and interesting even though we had to return because of heavy rain and risk of a road wash out! The driver said this was extremely rare in June.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was my second stay here and once again it was superb. Marrakech is a vibrant exiting and sometimes overwhelming city which needs a soothing antidote - and this is where the Dar Anika comes into it's own. Although I've been fortunate enough to stay in some very good hotels over the years I have no hesitation in saying that this riad is one of the loveliest places I have ever visited. It is calm peaceful and beautiful as well as being very clean and beautifully furnished. Thanks to Di Nigel 'Nu Nu' and the rest of the staff. See you in a few months....!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A peaceful oasis at the heart of the Marrakech Medina.
Review_Text: Marrakech can be quite a culture shock even to those who know Morocco. We were on a short weekend working trip from our base at the Atlas Film Studios in Ouarzazate. But the minute the beautiful doors opened from the hectic street the cool calm of Dar Anika cast a slow-down spell. The owners Diane and Nigel could not have been more helpful and we should also mention their gracious manager Nourredine. All the special touches : the wonderful home-made yoghourtthe peace the rose petals in the bathroom the wondrous lack of TVthe peace the storks nesting on the nearby mosque the pool the perfect location so near to the main square oh yes and the perfect peace!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Our stay at Dar Anika was a highlight of our honeymoon. The hotel epitomises small but perfectly formed. It is impeccably clean beautifully decorated and ideally located. Outside the cool calm riad it’s a short stroll through bustling and intoxicating streets to any of the main attractions including Djemma El Fna. The riad has all the luxuries you could want from a Moroccan boutique hotel; pool hamam wine list and menu air conditioning and no T.V. (a wonderful idea). Mouth watering breakfasts are served on the roof terrace as the medina comes to life below. But it’s the people that make this place. The staff are all consummate professionals friendly and always willing to help and advise. And the welcome and hospitality from genial hosts Di and Nigel made us feel like old friends returning. Having travelled around Morocco for 2 weeks we were "welcomed home" to Dar Anika for 2 nights. It was a pleasure to return to a hotel so clearly loved by owners and guests alike. It was our favourite accommodation in Morocco and I'm fairly sure the sun shines brighter on Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: We had an amazing cooking lesson!
Review_Text: I marked the rooms high because we were shown around and everything was beautiful but we actually went for a cooking lesson while staying somewhere else in Marrakesh. It was a brilliant day from going to the market and picking our chicken (vegetarian options were available!) then to the fruit market and a glass of wine while we were talked through what we were about to learn. I took notes and had four pages of carefully written advice on how to make the beautiful salads chicken and fresh strawberry dessert. I was given a cook book to take away and after a thorough and fun lesson we had a break before sitting on the roof terrace to enjoy the results. We sat on a really beautiful terrace with a Stork on the minaret a short distance away – plenty of photo opportunities. The dinner was lovely and knowing how it was all prepared made it even better. I’d thoroughly recommend a cooking lesson at Riad Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The place to send family and friends if they want to really experience the real Marrakech
Review_Text: we stayed for 4 nights in a lovely riad with only 7 rooms just 400 metres from the major souk in the city where it all happens for the locals: the open air restaurants water sellers snake chamersfortune tellers toothpullers(dentists) story tellers male dancers over loaded donkeys  manic scooter traffic  orange stalls toy trains with george bush chasing osama bin laden...THE pluses of Dar Anika is (1)its location: (2)airport transfers included in the room rate(3) the management: Denise & Nigel and welcoming local staff. The attention from the start: all e-mails acknowledged within the hour  the changing of currency because the banks were closed the arranging of a day tour in the atlas mountains in a 4x4 with an english guide: not only did this mean no language problems but also a total absence of " bumping into cousins " who happened to sell the cheapest/ best price / carpets potterygems goats etc...... the rooms were very "local" in design/layout with no tv and first class plumbing! breakfasts were taken on the roof terrace surrounded by storks on neigbhouring chimmney tops.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Exquisite hospitality in a beautiful setting
Review_Text: My husband and I are just back from a perfect vacation in Morocco and our stay at Dar Anika was a big part of the perfection. It's location is great - a 5 minute walk from Jemaa el Fna. The rooms are lovely and the food is terrific but the big draw for us was the hospitality. Nigel and Di whom we read about on this site were very welcoming but our main man while we were there (6 nights altogether) was Noureddine. He was extraordinarily gracious and helpful to us even to helping arrange a 5-day trip to the south and Erg Chebbi. The company he set us up with Morocco Tailormade turned out to be excellent. We had a fascinating trip south and still were very glad to return "home" to Dar Anika for our last night in Morocco. Nouraddine had arranged a special dinner for us which was the most romantic dinner for two imaginable and the food was remarkable. We would highly recommend this charming riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of calm and tranquility amidst the colourful madness of Marrakech
Review_Text: A charming Riad hosted to perfection by the warm and generous Nigel and Diane.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Great position very near all Marrakech's attractions, very good service
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Anika for 3 nights in April 09. The English managers Nigel and Diane were very welcoming and extremely helpful. The rest of the staff are also charming efficent and helpful. We had a large room with a very nice bathroom and all usual accoutrements. They serve lunches and dinners by request the lunch we had was good. We used the small pool in the courtyard twice for a very refreshing dip after a hot day's travelling then went up to the roof terrace for sunbathing. The roof terrace is also where they serve a very good breakfast.  One of the best features though is that Dar Anika is only about 10 minutes walk from Marrakech's iconic main square Djemaa el Fna and the souks so it was easy to get around in the evenings without using taxis or a car. The restaurants recommended by the staff at Dar Anika were excellent.  All in all a very good place to stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Comfortable, welcoming, excellent service from a relaxed and friendly team
Review_Text: We have travelled widely and stayed in a wide range of places. We thought Dar Anika was just right. It is a smallish place with a range of rooms and a pleasant central courtyard. There is a roof terrace and a tent on the roof if it is too hot in the sun. It is an unpretentious refuge from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech but is a great location - accessible by car but within an easy and very attractive walk from the central square.    The thing we really liked was that it is a great atmosphere and all the people there were really friendly and a good team who looked after us well. They helped plan our trip (we spent a few nights in the mountains as well)  they were able to give good advice when we were there about a wide range of things and of course were on hand when the end of a noisy hot time in the city demanded a beer or glass of rose.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jeff Paffett wrote a review Apr 2009
Review_Text: We stayed in the Riad Dar Anika after spending a few days walking in the Atlas mountains. We got a wonderful welcome from Nigel and Diane who immediately made us feel at home.    We had a suite on the upper floor which was very spacious with a good sized bathroom.    The breakfasts were good with fresh juice and great French style bread (which was a treat surprisingly after a few days of arab bread). The weather was perfect to have breakfast on the roof terrace. We had a lunch a couple of times which was also very good.    You can dine at the hotel although you have to make your choice of dishes at lunch time. This tends to mean that the dining room is not very heavily used and so there's not much atmosphere although the food is very good. Also certainly while we were there the wine supply was a bit haphazard with none of the wines on the wine list available.    The position of the riad is great and you walk straight out of the door into a busy but not too touristy shopping street. It's an easy walk to all the main tourist sites.    Nigel and Diane are always ready to help with restaurant recommendations and booking and will tell you all the best places to shop.    All in all a great place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My fabulous friends surprised with a long weekend in Marrakesh for my hen party and i was really impressed with their choice of Riad. Diane Nigel and their colleagues at Dar Anika made sure our group of 10 relaxed from the moment we arrived - mint tea and fresh orange juice on arrival saving us from the self-appointed porters(!) arranging cabs and a tour guide and of course the breakfasts on the sunny roof terrace. The personal touches they added really made the weekend. I would unreservedly recommend this Riad to everyone - groups and couples alike. I'm already thinking of going back with my new husband!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A luxury retreat amidst the hubub that is Marrakech
Review_Text: Marrakech is hectic noisy colourful loud and teeming with people donkey carts hand carts and mopeds.  What more could you want then than to step through a carved door (smiling at the mint seller permanently pitched outside) into an oasis where your every need is met immediately but discreetly. Where breakfast is served on the roof terrace while you watch the storks re -building their nest each day on the top of the mosque tower while listening to the muezzin calling the faithful to prayer. Where after breakfast you can go for a dip in the pool situated in the internal courtyard and gaze up at the ornate ceilings and North African patterns. Where you can both retire to the private Hamman and enjoy its indulgent pleasures. Where as night falls the riad turns into a candlelit wonderland when staff appear as if by magic should you need anything and bring you drinks once more on the roof terrace but this time you are lounging on immense sofas under a tented roof.  What more could you want? Oh yes an English couple who felt like your best friends by the end of the holiday. Nothing was too much trouble for Di and Nigel: computers medicines and advice were proffered immediately along with companionable chats.  We wanted a week’s break that gave us some winter sun plenty of rest but some local colour as well. This fitted the bill perfectly and our enormous thanks to every single member of staff who took so much trouble over us: to Salah who rustled up a meal for us when we arrived late(and served it with linen napkins and all the other silver service niceties); to the manager Nourdine who got us a guide helped us with our room safe and immediately fixed a light for me to the cleaners who were discreet and never tried to come in our room unless they were certain we would not be using it to Mohammed who served our breakfast and practised his English on us to the cook who made such beautiful meals (we had rose petals scattered over the table for our last dinner) and of course to Di and Nigel who made it all possible.  We are already recommending Dar Anika to anyone who will listen.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just come back from 5 days in Marrakech and Dar Anika was everything we wish for in a hotel. Nigel and Diane as well as Noureddin and all the staff couldn’t have been more pleasant helpful reliable and easy to get on with. The hotel is beautiful and its location is excellent just off a small busy square and on a street that leads straight to the main square.    Marrakech itself is a must-visit. It has several beautiful 12th to late 19th century buildings that show off splendidly the development of the sometimes dazzlingly rich style of Muslim decoration in stucco marble carved wood and ceramics. We also greatly enjoyed the extensive and fascinating markets the streets of the large old town (medina) and the stunning activity on Djema-el-Fna pulling you into another world. The people are genuinely friendly. We never felt unsafe anywhere (and we got around).    It was also great to be able to rely on a genuinely friendly welcome and willingness to attend to anything we might need literally every time we went through the door at Dar Anika at whatever hour. The complimentary private transfers from and to the airport were very much appreciated. Dar Anika also arranged for us a wonderful day trip to the mountains (Siti Fatma) with an excellent Berber driver/guide in a luxury car at reasonable cost. My wife particularly enjoyed the hammam experience offered in Dar Anika. All in all highly recommendable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A group of 10 of us went for 3 days to Marrakech and this was a fanatastic place to stay.    -They arranged a transfer to collect and drop us at the airport  -There was a warm welcome on arrival - and fresh orange juice too  -The Riad is very close to the main square  -Once inside the Riad you are in an oasis of calm  - The rooms are beautifully and individually decorated  - the roof has an amazing terrace to have breakfast on or go up to after dark and have a drink on  - The staff were ever friendly and helpful - from helping us change money into smaller notes to arranging a tour guide to show us round.  - The Hamam was charming and you can either do it yourself or have someone pamper you.    It was perfect for us and I'd definitely return on my next trip!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: If you bring a little book light and if the Riad can install some electric towel warmers you will feel you have landed in Paradise. Although the hotel is elegant quiet comfortable and peaceful it is really Diane Nigel and their staff who tip this place over the top. And although they are somehow completely unobtrusive about it your wish is their command! These are folks who will give you the change from their pockets to buy postcards who will give you STACKS of their own personal music collection to enjoy and I do believe that Nigel would give you the shirt off his back if you requested it. We were five friends and colleagues traveling together for a short break before buckling down to work in Casablanca. This was the perfect choice because our hosts made it possible to do so much in two short days. Four of these folks have been virtually everywhere stayed in some of the world's best hotels... but it was unanimous: in Marrakech you must stay with Nigel and Diane at Riad Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: Very relaxing - great place to recharge the batteries
Review_Text: A short but great trip despite having the worst weather in several decades!! This did not detract from the whole experience - plenty to do and lots of cosy places to eat and drink.  The welcome and service offered by the Riad were great - Di and Nigel and their team have got it just right incredibly helpful and friendly but not in your face. We were slightly limited with what we could do due to the impending birth on child No.2 but I know that Di and Nigel were full of recommendations about places to go outside of the City and spectacular walks to take in (maybe next time!). Nothing was too much trouble - recommending and booking restaurants helpful tips about where to go in the Souks and generally offering any assistance they could.  The Riad is in a fantastic location - at the end of a fascinating road which leads directly to the main square and also with some great restaurants and bars right ont he doorstep - higly recommend La Tanjia and the Kosy Bar - great food and lovely open fire to relax in front of (given our weather conditions this was most welcome!).  If we were to go back to Marrakech I would not think twice about staying at Dar Anika again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John B wrote a review Feb 2009
Review_Text: not enough space to begin to tell of our experiance. Di and Nigel made our stay in every way. . . their time attentiveness and knoledgeable! Nothing was too much trouble. . .can't wait to revisit. . .and will in September. . . .Hopefully try out there new adittion . . . Thanks Di and Nigel for all your help then . . . and ongoing. . . Great couple . . .great Riad!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a Riad! It was a wonderful experience spending our time at Dar Anika. Diane and Nigel the managers were especially helpful and lots of fun. They helped us with information such as restaurants sightseeing taxis drivers etc. The rooms are very clean and have the morrocan motif. There is a roof top terrace where we had drinks late at night overlooking the town. There's a dining room inside pool and having breakfast in the open air courtyard was a real treat. By far the customer service is top rated at this Riad. Do not spend your money staying at the large hotels. You will miss the ambience and truly the reason why you traveled all the way to Marrakech. The Riad is within close walking distance from the main square and equal walking distance to sights in the old city. All in all it was an excellent place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The Dar Anika is a gem. The hosts are generous with their local knowledge and Nordeen their manager...well he has the most amazing "fixer" skills of anyone I've ever met in the hospitality profession! You name it Nordeen will get it done and make it seem effortless. The location is excellent: easily accessible from the taxi drop-off point good situation for some superb restaurants and tourist highlights. Our room was exceptionally quiet and the interior courtyard (used for dining in winter) was a very pleasant spot. The homemade yogurt/fresh fruit/bread selection was a treat for breakfast. Very very pleasant experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My partner and I wanted an interesting city break and picked Marrakech. As there are over 600 Riads in the city we wanted to pick one that had the right mix of peacefullness good location and comfortable facilities. Riad Dar Anika certainly delivered this and much more. The location could not be better as it's only 5 minutes from the main square however once inside the doors it is so tranquil and a wonderful haven from the noise and bustle of the city. The Riad has been done up in very good style - not too Moroccan and with taste! Wonderful hand painted ceilings throughout which are a feat of artistry There is a pool and hamman and a lovely roof terrace with great views. We ate in the Riad on our last night and had lovely food. However the thing that just makes Dar Anika so special is the staff. Di and Nigel are just the perfect hosts - so warm professional and helpful - and great fun too! They have boundless knowledge of the city and surrounds and will really make your stay special. Nigel is a real foodie and is very knowledgable about all the restaurants which is useful! Their son also runs trips into the Atlas mountains which is a great contrast to the city. Nourredine the Manager and the rest of the staff are just lovely too - gracious and warm and eager to please! We had a wonderful time there and would thoroughly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of calm in Marrakech
Review_Text: We have just returned from a short break in Marrakech staying at the Riad Dar Anika. We were given a warm welcome by the friendly staff and hosts Nigel and Diana and quickly settled into our room the guest suite.  The suite was spacious and luxurious with hand painted ceiling and a large dome above the bed. The lighting although very atmospheric was a little dim and it would have been nice to be have a bit more light. The room very tastefully decorated however the expanses of stone meant that it got quite cool in the early morning (not a problem when the weather warms up though!).  The rest of the Riad is beautifully laid out with a small pool hammam and plenty of room on the roof top terrace for sun bathing even in January. The breakfasts are fairly simple but satisfying and the fresh orange juice is a treat. We dined in once and the food traditional Moroccan fare was very good indeed.  The riad is ideally located just 5 mins from the main Jemaa El Fna square and lots of really good restaurants.  Overall Riad Dar Anika is a wonderful place to stay and enjoy all that fabulous Marrakech has to offer. And when you have had your fill of the souks and hustle and bustle you can close the door and step into an oasis of calm and tranquility that is Riad Dar Anika.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Loved our stay at the Riad.    The two main attractions were the brilliant staff and the food!    Nothing was too much trouble for the staff including a middle of the night wake up for the Doctor and fetching the necessary medicine!! (Bug taken out with us by the way nothing to do with the food!)    The food was out of this world and if you are offered the last night special meal book it! Excellent value for money and the best food we had all holiday.    Unfortunately we weren't able to make much use of the terrace as the weather was against us but the fire in the dining room made up for it...    I wouldn't hesitate to return here or recommend it to others.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This was the most beautiful and welcoming hotel we have ever stayed at - it was like going from home to home. I loved the fact that we had an English couple running the hotel who could advise us of where to go and the best places to eat and the best sight seeing spots etc...  Nigel and Di were extremely friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them or their staff. The views from the terrace were breath taking and the hotel was immaculate.  The meals we also ate at the hotel were beautiful and set us up for the night life of the square in the evenings which you just have to see to believe.  This is the best holiday we have had in years and I cannot wait to book up for next year - I would never stay at a different hotel than this as you cannot beat perfection.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Loved the peace and tranquility in the madness of marakech
Review_Text: We have just spent a long romantic weekend in Dar Anika Riad. The hospitalty was second to none. Nigel and Di the hosts of this traditional Riad made us feel like we were long lost friends and in a strange way a created a feeling of home from home in this strange noicy bustling environment of the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis in the madness of Marrakesh
Review_Text: Dar Anika was picked for us by the travel agent because it has a restaurant on the roof. Its a lovely place very clean and well laid out with a lovely roof terrace for breakfast. If I had some criticisms it would be breakfast needs some variety and a simple cooked option (eggs/toast) would be nice and we never ate there in the evening because you had to give notice during the by midday to order a meal for the evening.    Having said that it wasn't a problem we ate at plenty of lovely if slightly expensive restaurants that were near by or a short taxi ride.    The hosts were very welcoming I'd recommend the Riad if staying in Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Last weekend we slept in this Riad.  It was our first time in Marraekch.  Great hotel very clean very goog placed just 7 minutes from the main square at a walking distance.  Good breakfast.  Everything correct!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A place of tranquility and peace
Review_Text: Dar Anika is an oasis of calm and tranquility within the Medina of Marrakech. Its 10 rooms are individually decorated with unqiue features and artefacts of the area. Although you are within the medina and a couple of minutes walk from the souks and the main square Dar Anika is completely silent ! No need for earplugs!    Your host: Nigel Turner-Hopkins and his charming wife Diane will make your stay at Dar Anika a special one with taylor made shopping and sightseeing trips available as well as help with restaurant choices. Nothing is too much trouble !    I took my teenage daughters who thoroughly enjoyed their first taste of Africa and the colour and atmosphere of Marrakesh.    If you are going to Marrakech you must stay in the Medina and more importantly you must visit DAR ANIKA.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The minute I stepped through those heavy wooden doors I felt the stressness of the city melt away. This riad is really worth every penny from the amazing hospitality (thank you Diane Nigel Nordeen (I'm sorry I'm probably spelling your name wrong but you were awesome)) to the unpretentious luxuriousness the lovely breakfasts and the relaxed ambiance. I honestly have no complaints about this place. The team who work here were incredibly helpful and friendly but I was truly impressed by the smaller touches - the warm conversations over breakfast and the lovely mint tea and yummy pastries served anytime we wanted (someone actually was sweet enough to run to the market and buy fresh mint to prepare tea for us even though we were the only guests that night). Real class and service. I was blown away. And thanks Diane and Nigel for driving me to the train station! -Khay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: You Must Come To This One!
Review_Text: First trip to Morocco and very keen to be right royally treated! I was not disappointed! Very personable couple "in charge" and made a very welcoming pair - no problems there then! Accommodation 1st class & extremely comfortable. Food was excellent in all respects. Riad well positioned for all sorts of entertainment be it sightseeing shopping or chilling. I would have no hesitation in making a 100% recommendation to anybody not just my friends to stay with this couple. Come here and be treated as SPECIAL - you will not be disappointed.

What a little gem! So close to the Medina and all the action and yet stepping inside you could have been a milllion miles from it all. Friendly and efficient staff created a relaxing atmostphere in a beautiful setting. Thank you Diane and Nigel- you'll be seeing me again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I just got back from a very enjoyable stay at Dar Anika. Nigel and Di are excellent hosts always ready with advice and ever helpful. They sorted out a morning's horse riding and a fantastic day trip to the Atlas for me even taking me to the airport in the hotel van at the end of the stay. That's great hospitality!    The Riad is an almost new building so everything works fine has excellent staff and is well positioned. It's a real oasis of calm but also very handy for many of the medina sights. There is a taxi stand 50m away for those longer trips out.    The rooms are nicely decorated and well maintained with comfortable beds. It's traditional in style and very calm and relaxing. The terrace has a big tent for shade and plenty of sunbeds. I spent a day chilling out up there and the staff were excellent leaving me in peace but always available.    My case got broken just as i arrived at the door and the first thing Nigel said was that I could get it fixed up the road. At the time I thought 'yeah' but the next day I took a look in Riad Zitoun Kedim (the street the Da Anika is located in) and found a shop 200m away who charged me 50 Diram and fixed it in 24 hours! That's Marrakech. Anything's possible:) :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: What can i say......  Great location 2 mins walk from Jeema beautiful accomodation wonderful service with exceptional managers!    If you are thinking of going to Marrakech Dar Anika is possibly one of the best Riads available. Di and Nigel do everything to make your stay as comfortable as posible. Always on hand to give advice on where to visiteat and shop and a few great stories to tell!  Nothing is a problem all staff go out of there way to help you at anytime.  Had a wonderful dinner in the riad on our last eveningfood and company were superb. Cant wait to return.  Apparently new riad will be just as good cant imagine how they can beat Dar Anika!    Hope you are all well Carla and Craig x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The riad was recommended to us by a friend and first impressions were good when we were upgraded to the suite when we informed them that we were on our honeymoon. We were collected from the airport and upon our arrival we were welcomed by Di and Nigel the English couple that run the riad with mint tea and pastries.    Throughout Di & Nigel were very helpful giving us advice and suggestions to anything we asked them - they even offered to buy some lamps on our behalf and get them shipped to us in the UK.    Our room was beautifully prepared and furnished. Despite its central location we found the riad pretty quiet. We had a plentiful breakfast on the terrace every day (up to midday if we wanted) and this along with the pool make the riad a very comfortable place to stay.    Di and Nigel go out of their way to ensure their guests' comfort and we would highly recommend this riad to all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My best friend and I were looking for a week away from the pollution traffic and stress of London and found Marrakech to be the perfect destination and the Riad Dar Anika the perfect location to explore its beauty.    We were looking for a holiday that was not a million miles flight away but offered us more than just a sun-lounger by a pool. Thankfully we found the Riad Dar Anika...    Amongst the hustle and bustle of the vibrant Marrakech sits the gem that is the Riad Dar Anika. There are many pleasant Riads in Marrakech but this Riad truly takes your breath away. You enter into a cool tranquillity with friendly and very helpful staff and hosts Diane and Nigel that leave you feeling like a member of the family!!    Diane and Nigel are never too busy to take time out to point you in the direction of the best Tagine around organise a hire car and discuss bargaining etiquette in the souks...
